example.ex: I knew that if I didn't make a note I would lose the thought so I asked to borrow a pen or pencil...
example.tran: 我知道如果我不把这个想法记下来就会忘记，所以我找人借了支笔。

example.ex: Take notes during the consultation as the final written report is very concise.
example.tran: 磋商的时候要作记录，因为最终的书面报告非常简洁。

collins.def: In a book or article, a note is a short piece of additional information.

example.ex: See Note 16 on p. 223.
example.tran: 参见第223页的注释16。

example.ex: ...'Exiles' by James Joyce, edited with an Introduction and notes by J C C Mays.
example.tran: 詹姆斯·乔伊斯的《流亡者》，由J.C.C. 梅斯作序并注释

collins.def: A note is a short document that has to be signed by someone and that gives official information about something.

example.ex: Since Mr Bennett was going to need some time off work, he asked for a sick note...
example.tran: 因为贝内特先生要请假一段时间，他请医生开了病假条。

example.ex: I've got half a ton of gravel in the lorry but he won't sign my delivery note.
example.tran: 我的卡车里装着半吨沙砾，但他不给我签收送货单。

collins.def: You can refer to a banknote as a note .

example.ex: They exchange traveller's cheques at a different rate from notes.
example.tran: 他们兑换旅行支票时依据的汇率跟兑换现钞时不同。

example.ex: ...a five pound note.
example.tran: 5英镑的纸币

collins.def: In music, a note is the sound of a particular pitch, or a written symbol representing this sound.

example.ex: She has a deep voice and doesn't  even try for the high notes...
example.tran: 她嗓音低沉，从没试过高音。

example.ex: If the note of D is sounded on a harp, all the corresponding D strings of other octaves will likewise resonate.
example.tran: 如果用竖琴演奏D音符，其他八度音阶所有相应的D弦都将发出共鸣。

collins.def: You can use note to refer to a particular quality in someone's voice that shows how they are feeling.

example.ex: There is an unmistakable note of nostalgia in his voice when he looks back on the early years of the family business...
example.tran: 他回忆早些年的家族生意时，无疑是带着一种怀旧的语气的。

example.ex: It was not difficult for him to catch the note of bitterness in my voice.
example.tran: 他不难听出我话语中的愤愤不平。

collins.def: You can use note to refer to a particular feeling, impression, or atmosphere.

example.ex: Yesterday's testimony began on a note of passionate but civilized disagreement...
example.tran: 昨天的作供是在激烈但文明地表达分歧的氛围中开始的。

example.ex: Somehow he tells these stories without a note of horror...
example.tran: 不知为什么他讲这些故事时一点都不害怕。

collins.def: If you note a fact, you become aware of it.

example.ex: The White House has noted his promise to support any attack that was designed to enforce the UN resolutions...
example.tran: 白宫已经注意到他承诺支持所有旨在贯彻联合国决议的打击。

example.ex: Suddenly, I noted that the rain had stopped...
example.tran: 突然，我意识到雨已经停了。

collins.def: If you tell someone to note something, you are drawing their attention to it.

example.ex: Note the statue to Sallustio Bandini, a prominent Sienese...
example.tran: 请看这座萨卢斯蒂奥·班迪尼的雕像，他是一位杰出的锡耶纳人。

example.ex: Please note that there are a limited number of tickets.
example.tran: 请注意，票的数量有限。

collins.def: If you note something, you mention it in order to draw people's attention to it.

example.ex: The report notes that export and import volumes picked up in leading economies...
example.tran: 报告特别指出经济大国的进出口量攀升。

example.ex: The yearbook also noted a sharp drop in reported cases of sexually transmitted disease.
example.tran: 年鉴同时指出，性传播疾病报告病例数显著下降。

collins.def: When you note something, you write it down as a record of what has happened.

example.ex: 'He has had his tonsils out and has been ill, too,' she noted in her diary...
example.tran: “他切除了扁桃体，一直病着，”她在日记里写道。

example.ex: One policeman was clearly visible noting the number plates of passing cars...
example.tran: 能清楚地看到一名警察记下了经过车辆的车牌号。

collins.def: If you compare notes with someone on a particular subject, you talk to them and find out whether their opinion, information, or experience is the same as yours.

example.ex: The women were busily comparing notes on the queen's outfit...
example.tran: 女人们忙着交换对女王衣着的看法。

example.ex: They exchanged greetings, compared notes on their wives and families, and finally got down to business.
example.tran: 他们互致问候，聊了聊家常，然后才言归正传。

collins.def: Someone or something that is of note is important, worth mentioning, or well-known.

example.ex: ...politicians of note...
example.tran: 政要

example.ex: He has published nothing of note in the last ten years.
example.tran: 他在过去的10年里没有发表任何有影响的作品。

collins.tran: 表达…的情感;带有…的印象;营造…的氛围
collins.def: If someone or something strikes a particular note or sounds a particular note, they create a particular feeling, impression, or atmosphere.

example.ex: Before his first round of discussions, Mr Baker sounded an optimistic note...
example.tran: 第一轮讨论前，贝克先生听上去还比较乐观。

example.ex: Plants growing out of cracks in paving strike the right note up a cottage-garden path.
example.tran: 从铺路石缝隙间长出的植物恰好营造出乡间农舍花园小径的感觉。

collins.def: If you take note of something, you pay attention to it because you think that it is important or significant.

example.ex: Take note of the weather conditions...
example.tran: 留心一下天气状况。

example.ex: They took note that she showed no surprise at the news of the murder.
example.tran: 他们注意到她对谋杀的消息一点都不感到惊讶。

collins.def: A horse is a large animal which people can ride. Some horses are used for pulling ploughs and carts.

example.ex: A small man on a grey horse had appeared.
example.tran: 一个骑着灰马的小个子男人出现了。

collins.def: When you talk about the horses, you mean horse races in which people bet money on the horse which they think will win.

example.ex: He still likes to bet on the horses.
example.tran: 他仍然喜欢赌马。

collins.def: A vaulting horse is a tall piece of gymnastics equipment for jumping over.

collins.tran: 从知情人那里直接（获悉）
collins.def: If you hear something from the horse's mouth, you hear it from someone who knows that it is definitely true.

example.ex: He has got to hear it from the horse's mouth. Then he can make a judgment as to whether his policy is correct or not.
example.tran: 他必须得到千真万确的信息才行。这样他才能判断自己的政策是否正确。

collins.tran: 自始至终;从头到尾;贯穿
collins.def: If you say that something happens throughout a particular period of time, you mean that it happens during the whole of that period.

example.ex: The national tragedy of rival groups killing each other continued throughout 1990...
example.tran: 敌对派别相互残杀的国家悲剧 1990 年全年都在上演。

example.ex: Movie music can be made memorable because its themes are repeated throughout the film.
example.tran: 电影音乐要想让人记住不难，因为它的主旋律贯穿影片始终。

collins.def: If you say that something happens or exists throughout a place, you mean that it happens or exists in all parts of that place.

example.ex: 'Sight Savers', founded in 1950, now runs projects throughout Africa, the Caribbean and South East Asia...
example.tran: 创始于 1950 年的国际防盲及救盲组织如今在非洲、加勒比海地区和东南亚各地都开展项目。

example.ex: As we have tried to show throughout this book, companies that provide outstanding service don't do it by luck.
example.tran: 正如我们一直想在本书中努力表明的那样，提供优质服务的公司靠的不是运气。

means: 总统[总裁，议长，董事长，校长等]（职务）的
统辖的，支配的，监督的，指挥的

collins.def: Presidential activities or things relate or belong to a president.

example.ex: ...Peru's presidential election...
example.tran: 秘鲁总统选举

example.ex: There are several presidential candidates.
example.tran: 有数位总统候选人。

collins.def: A magazine is a publication with a paper cover which is issued regularly, usually every week or every month, and which contains articles, stories, photographs, and advertisements.

example.ex: Her face is on the cover of a dozen or more magazines.
example.tran: 她的面孔出现在十几种杂志的封面上。

collins.tran: (广播、电视上融合多种话题的)杂志型节目，板块节目
collins.def: On radio or television, a magazine or a magazine programme is a programme consisting of several items about different topics, people, and events.

example.ex: ...a live arts magazine.
example.tran: 直播的艺术板块节目

example.ex: ...'Science In Action', a weekly science magazine programme.
example.tran: 《当下科学》——一个每周一期的科学新闻杂志型节目

collins.def: In an automatic gun, the magazine is the part that contains the bullets.
A magazine is a building in which things such as guns, bullets, and explosives are kept.

means: 成为王后或其他大于卒的子

collins.def: If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread.

example.ex: You don't have to sacrifice environmental protection to promote economic growth...
example.tran: 不必为了促进经济增长而牺牲环境保护。

example.ex: In many ways, our society actively promotes alcoholism.
example.tran: 我们的社会从多个方面助长了酗酒的风气。

collins.def: If a firm promotes a product, it tries to increase the sales or popularity of that product.

example.ex: Paul Weller has announced a full British tour to promote his second solo album.
example.tran: 保罗·韦勒已经宣布到英国巡演，以推广他的第二张专辑。

example.ex: ...a special St Lucia week where the island could be promoted as a tourist destination.
example.tran: 在特殊的圣卢西亚活动周期间这个岛屿可以作为旅游胜地进行宣传推广

collins.def: If someone is promoted, they are given a more important job or rank in the organization that they work for.

example.ex: I was promoted to editor and then editorial director...
example.tran: 我先是被提升为编辑，然后又晋升为编务总监。

example.ex: In fact, those people have been promoted.
example.tran: 事实上，那些人已经升职了。

collins.def: If a team that competes in a league is promoted, it starts competing in a higher division in the next season because it was one of the most successful teams in the lower division.

example.ex: Woodford Green won the Second Division title and are promoted to the First Division.
example.tran: 伍德福德格林队赢得了乙级联赛的冠军，成功升甲。

collins.def: The benefit of something is the help that you get from it or the advantage that results from  it.

example.ex: Each family farms individually and reaps the benefit of its labor...
example.tran: 各家经营各自的农场，收获各自的劳动成果。

example.ex: I'm  a great believer in the benefits of this form of therapy...
example.tran: 我坚信这种治疗形式非常有益。

collins.def: If something is to your benefit or is of benefit to you, it helps you or improves your life.

example.ex: This could now work to Albania's  benefit...
example.tran: 这种情况目前对阿尔巴尼亚有利。

example.ex: I hope what I have written will be of benefit to someone else who may feel the same way.
example.tran: 我希望我所写的内容能对其他和我有同感的人有所裨益。

collins.def: If you benefit from something or if it benefits you, it helps you or improves your life.

example.ex: Both sides have benefited from the talks.
example.tran: 双方都从谈判中获益。

example.ex: ...a variety of government programs benefiting children.
example.tran: 有益于儿童的各种政府项目

collins.def: If you have the benefit of some information, knowledge, or equipment, you are able to use it so that you can achieve something.

example.ex: Steve didn't have the benefit of a formal college education...
example.tran: 史蒂夫没能接受正规的大学教育。

example.ex: With the benefit of hindsight, it is clear we ought to have done more...
example.tran: 事后看来，我们显然本该做得更多。

collins.tran: （政府提供给穷人、病人和失业人员的）救济金，补助金
collins.def: Benefit is money that is given by the government to people who are poor, ill, or unemployed.

example.ex: ...the removal of benefit from school-leavers...
example.tran: 取消辍学者的补助金

example.ex: I was told that in order to get benefit payments I would have to answer some questions.
example.tran: 我得知要领补助，就得回答一些问题。

collins.def: A benefit, or a benefit concert or dinner, is an event that is held in order to raise money for a particular charity or person.

example.ex: I am organising a benefit gig in Bristol to raise these funds.
example.tran: 我要在布里斯托尔组织一场义演来募集这些资金。

collins.def: If you give someone the benefit of the doubt, you treat them as if they are telling the truth or as if they have behaved properly, even though you are not sure that this is the case.

example.ex: At first I gave him the benefit of the doubt...
example.tran: 起初，我姑且相信了他。

example.ex: Shalford is entitled to the benefit of the doubt.
example.tran: 沙尔福德暂且获得了信任。

collins.def: If you say that someone is doing something for the benefit of a particular person, you mean that they are doing it for that person.

example.ex: You need people working for the benefit of the community...
example.tran: 你们需要为社区谋利益的人。

example.ex: He doesn't have to go through this elaborate display for my benefit!
example.tran: 他不必为了我作这么详细的展示！

collins.def: Formal speech or behaviour is very correct and serious rather than relaxed and friendly, and is used especially in official situations.

example.ex: He wrote a very formal letter of apology to Douglas...
example.tran: 他给道格拉斯写了一封非常正式的道歉信。

example.ex: Business relationships are necessarily a bit more formal.
example.tran: 商业关系有必要更正式一些。

collins.tran: (行为、声明或要求)官方的，正式的
collins.def: A formal action, statement, or request is an official one.

example.ex: UN officials said a formal request was passed to American authorities...
example.tran: 联合国官员称正式请求已向美国当局转达。

example.ex: No formal announcement had been made.
example.tran: 尚无任何官方声明。

collins.def: Formal occasions are special occasions at which people wear smart clothes and behave according to a set of accepted rules.

example.ex: One evening the film company arranged a formal dinner after the play.
example.tran: 一天晚上，电影公司在演出结束后安排了一个正式的晚宴。

collins.tran: (服饰)正规的，正式的，适合正式场合的
collins.def: Formal clothes are very smart clothes that are suitable for formal occasions.

example.ex: They wore ordinary ties instead of the more formal high collar and cravat.
example.tran: 他们打着普通的领带，而不是更为正式的高领领结。

collins.tran: 整齐的;规矩的;井然有序的
collins.def: Something that is done, written, or studied in a formal way has a very ordered, organized method or style.

example.ex: This does not encourage the child to analyse the environment in a formal way...
example.tran: 这并不能鼓励孩子有条理地分析周围的环境。

example.ex: Classic Greek drama was written in verse, usually in an elevated and formal style.
example.tran: 古典希腊戏剧以韵文写成，通常用词讲究、结构整齐。

collins.def: Formal education or training is given officially, usually in a school, college, or university.

example.ex: Although his formal education stopped after primary school, he was an avid reader...
example.tran: 尽管小学毕业后就再没有受过正规的教育，他却十分爱读书。

example.ex: Leroy didn't have any formal dance training.
example.tran: 勒罗伊没受过任何正规的舞蹈训练。

collins.tran: (尤指按照某种设计规则)布局匀称的，布置整齐的
collins.def: A formal garden or room is arranged in a very regular and controlled way, especially according to certain rules of design.

example.ex: ...a formal herb garden...
example.tran: 布局匀称的草药园

example.ex: The Coronata wallpaper lends a formal air to the dining room.
example.tran: 科罗娜塔墙纸给餐厅增添了一种整齐有致的气氛。

collins.def: You use overall to indicate that you are talking about a situation in general or about the whole of something.

example.ex: ...the overall rise in unemployment...
example.tran: 失业率总体的上升

example.ex: Cut down your overall amount of physical activity...
example.tran: 减少体力活动的总量。

collins.def: Overalls consist of a single piece of clothing that combines trousers and a jacket. You wear overalls over your clothes in order to protect them while you are working.

example.ex: ...workers in blue overalls.
example.tran: 穿着蓝色连身工作服的工人

collins.def: Overalls are trousers that are attached to a piece of cloth which covers your chest and which has straps going over your shoulders.

example.ex: An elderly man dressed in faded overalls took the witness stand.
example.tran: 一位穿着褪色吊带工装裤的老人上了证人席。

collins.def: An overall is a piece of clothing shaped like a coat that you wear over your clothes in order to protect them while you are working.
A spokesman is a male spokesperson.

example.ex: A UN spokesman said that the mission will carry 20 tons of relief supplies.
example.tran: 联合国的一名男发言人说，该代表团将携带 20 吨救济物资。

collins.def: A bag is a container made of thin paper or plastic, for example one that is used in shops to put things in that a customer has bought.
A bag is a strong container with one or two handles, used to carry things in.

example.ex: She left the hotel carrying a shopping bag.
example.tran: 她提着一个购物袋离开了酒店。

collins.def: A bag is the same as a handbag .
If you have bags under your eyes, you have folds of skin there, usually because you have not had enough sleep.
If you say there is bags of something, you mean that there is a large amount of it. If you say that there are bags of things, you mean that there are a large number of them.

example.ex: ...a hotel with bags of character.
example.tran: 很有特色的酒店

collins.def: If someone calls a woman an old bag or a stupid bag, they are insulting her.
If you bag something that a lot of people want, you get it for yourself before anyone else can get it.

example.ex: The smart ones will have already bagged their seats by placing cards on them.
example.tran: 聪明人早已在座位上放一张卡片占住了位子。

collins.tran: 囊中之物；稳操胜券；十拿九稳
collins.def: If you say that something is in the bag, you mean that you are certain that you will get it or achieve it.

example.ex: 'I'll get the Republican nomination,' he assured me. 'It's  in the bag.'
example.tran: “我会得到共和党提名的，”他向我保证，“这是十拿九稳的事。”

collins.tran: 背别人甩掉的包袱；背黑锅
collins.def: If you are left holding the bag, you are put in a situation where you are responsible for something, often in an unfair way because other people fail or refuse to take responsibility for it.

example.ex: I don't want to be left holding the bag if something goes wrong.
example.tran: 如果出了什么问题，我可不想替人背黑锅。

collins.def: If you pack your bags, you leave a place where you have been staying or living.

example.ex: Police arrived at his hotel and ordered him to pack his bags.
example.tran: 警察来到他的酒店，命令他收拾行李走人。

collins.def: If you treat someone or something in a particular way, you behave towards them or deal with them in that way.

example.ex: Artie treated most women with indifference...
example.tran: 阿蒂对大多数女人都漠不关心。

example.ex: Police say they're treating it as a case of attempted murder...
example.tran: 警方称他们正把它当作一起谋杀未遂案件来处理。

collins.def: When a doctor or nurse treats a patient or an illness, he or she tries to make the patient well again.

example.ex: Doctors treated her with aspirin...
example.tran: 医生用阿司匹林为她治疗。

example.ex: The boy was treated for a minor head wound...
example.tran: 那个男孩因头部轻伤接受了治疗。

collins.def: If something is treated with a particular substance, the substance is put onto or into it in order to clean it, to protect it, or to give it special properties.

example.ex: About 70% of the cocoa acreage is treated with insecticide...
example.tran: 大约 70% 的可可树林地喷过杀虫剂。

example.ex: It was many years before the city began to treat its sewage.
example.tran: 很多年以后这个城市才开始处理污水。

collins.def: If you treat someone to something special which they will enjoy, you buy it or arrange it for them.

example.ex: She was always treating him to ice cream...
example.tran: 她总是请他吃冰激凌。

example.ex: Tomorrow I'll treat myself to a day's gardening...
example.tran: 明天我将犒劳一下自己——享受一天的园艺乐趣。

collins.def: If you give someone a treat, you buy or arrange something special for them which they will enjoy.

example.ex: Lettie had never yet failed to return from town without some special treat for him.
example.tran: 莱蒂每次从城里回来都必定会给他带点特别的礼物。

collins.def: If you say that something is your treat, you mean that you are paying for it as a treat for someone else.
If you say, for example, that something looks or works a treat, you mean that it looks very good or works very well.

example.ex: The first part of the plan works a treat...
example.tran: 计划的第一部分天衣无缝。

example.ex: The apricots would go down a treat.
example.tran: 杏会非常好吃。

collins.def: Your diet is the type and range of food that you regularly eat.

example.ex: It's never too late to improve your diet.
example.tran: 什么时候改善饮食都为时不晚。

example.ex: ...a healthy diet rich in fruit and vegetables...
example.tran: 富含水果和蔬菜的健康饮食

collins.tran: (医生指定的)特别饮食，规定饮食
collins.def: If a doctor puts someone on a diet, he or she makes them eat a special type or range of foods in order to improve their health.

example.ex: He was put on a diet of milky food.
example.tran: 他按照医嘱要食用乳制品。

example.ex: ...a special diet for children with high cholesterol.
example.tran: 专为胆固醇高的孩子准备的特别饮食

collins.tran: （为减轻体重的）限制饮食，节食
collins.def: If you are on a diet, you eat special kinds of food or you eat less food than usual because you are trying to lose weight.

example.ex: Have you been on a diet? You've lost a lot of weight...
example.tran: 你最近在节食吗？你瘦了好多。

example.ex: Diet and exercise will alter your shape...
example.tran: 节食和锻炼会改变你的体形。

collins.tran: (为减轻体重而)限制饮食，节食
collins.def: If you are dieting, you eat special kinds of food or you eat less food than usual because you are trying to lose weight.

example.ex: I've been dieting ever since the birth of my fourth child...
example.tran: 我生完第四个孩子后就一直在节食。

example.ex: Most of us have dieted at some time in our lives.
example.tran: 我们大多数人都曾在人生的某个时期为减肥而节食过。

collins.tran: (饮料或食物)有助于减肥的，低热量的，低卡路里的
collins.def: Diet drinks or foods have been specially produced so that they do not contain many calories.

example.ex: ...sugar-free diet drinks.
example.tran: 无糖低热量饮料

example.ex: ...diet margarine.
example.tran: 低卡路里的人造黄油

collins.tran: (尤指令人不快或劣质的东西的)大量
collins.def: If you are fed on a diet of something, especially something unpleasant or of poor quality, you receive or experience a very large amount of it.

example.ex: The radio had fed him a diet of pop songs...
example.tran: 他从广播里听到的都是千篇一律的流行歌曲。

example.ex: People are rejecting this constant diet of despair.
example.tran: 人们开始拒绝这种没完没了的绝望情绪。

collins.def: Facilities are buildings, pieces of equipment, or services that are provided for a particular purpose.

example.ex: What recreational facilities are now available?...
example.tran: 现在有些什么娱乐设施？

example.ex: The problem lies in getting patients to a medical facility as soon as possible.
example.tran: 问题在于要把病人尽快送至医院。

collins.tran: （组织提供的）附加服务，特色服务;(机器的)功能
collins.def: A facility is something such as an additional service provided by an organization or an extra feature on a machine which is useful but not essential.

example.ex: It is very useful to have an overdraft facility...
example.tran: 有透支功能用处很大。

example.ex: One of the new models has the facility to reproduce speech as well as text.
example.tran: 新型号中有一款具备复读和文本复制的功能。

collins.def: If you have a facility for something, for example learning a language, you find it easy to do.

example.ex: He and Marcia shared a facility for languages...
example.tran: 他和马西娅都有语言天赋。

example.ex: Smell is a very basic sense but humans have lost much of the facility to use it properly.
example.tran: 嗅觉是一种非常基本的官能，但人类已经丧失了恰当使用这种官能的大部分能力。

collins.def: If a level or amount drops or if someone or something drops it, it quickly becomes less.

example.ex: Temperatures can drop to freezing at night...
example.tran: 夜间温度可能会降到零度以下。

example.ex: Once the rate rises it never drops back to its previous level...
example.tran: 一旦价格上去了就再也不会降到以前的水平了。

collins.def: If you drop something, you accidentally let it fall.

example.ex: I dropped my glasses and broke them.
example.tran: 我不小心把眼镜掉下来摔碎了。

collins.def: If something drops onto something else, it falls onto that thing. If something drops from somewhere, it falls from that place.

example.ex: He felt hot tears dropping onto his fingers...
example.tran: 他感觉到热泪掉到他的手指上。

example.ex: Burning embers started dropping from the ceiling...
example.tran: 余火未尽的木块开始从天花板上往下掉。

collins.def: If you drop something somewhere or if it drops there, you deliberately let it fall there.

example.ex: Drop the noodles into the water...
example.tran: 将面条下到水里。

example.ex: He dropped his plate into the sink.
example.tran: 他把盘子丢到水槽里。

collins.def: If a person or a part of their body drops to a lower position, or if they drop a part of their body to a lower position, they move to that position, often in a tired and lifeless way.

example.ex: Nancy dropped into a nearby chair...
example.tran: 南希疲惫地瘫坐到近处的椅子上。

example.ex: She let her head drop...
example.tran: 她低垂着头。

collins.def: To drop is used in expressions such as to be about to drop and to dance until you drop to emphasize that you are exhausted and can no longer continue doing something.

example.ex: She looked about to drop...
example.tran: 她看上去快要累垮了。

example.ex: You have to run until you drop.
example.tran: 一直跑到你跑不动为止。

collins.def: If a man drops his trousers, he pulls them down, usually as a joke or to be rude.

example.ex: A couple of boozy revellers dropped their trousers.
example.tran: 两名醉酒的狂欢者脱掉了他们的裤子。

collins.def: If your voice drops or if you drop your voice, you speak more quietly.

example.ex: Her voice will drop to a dismissive whisper...
example.tran: 她会把声音压低，轻蔑地低语。

example.ex: He dropped his voice and glanced round at the door.
example.tran: 他放低了声音，在门口环视了一下。

collins.tran: 中途放下（某人）;中途卸下（某物）
collins.def: If you drop someone or something somewhere, you take them somewhere and leave them there, usually in a car or other vehicle.

example.ex: He dropped me outside the hotel...
example.tran: 他把我送到了酒店。

example.ex: Many children had been dropped at the stadium by their parents...
example.tran: 很多孩子被家长送到了体育馆。

collins.def: If you drop an idea, course of action, or habit, you do not continue with it.

example.ex: He was told to drop the idea...
example.tran: 他被告知要打消那个主意。

example.ex: The prosecution was forced to drop the case...
example.tran: 控方被迫撤诉。

collins.def: If someone is dropped by a sports team or organization, they are no longer included in that team or employed by that organization.

example.ex: The country's captain was dropped from the tour party to England.
example.tran: 该国的国家队队长无缘英格兰之行。

collins.def: If you drop a game or part of a game in a sports competition, you lose it.

example.ex: Oremans has yet to drop a set.
example.tran: 奥尔曼斯还一局未输。

collins.def: If you drop to a lower position in a sports competition, you move to that position.

example.ex: Britain has dropped from second to third place in the league.
example.tran: 英国在联赛中的排名从第二位降到了第三位。

collins.def: A drop of a liquid is a very small amount of it shaped like a little ball. In informal English, you can also use drop when you are referring to a very small amount of something such as a drink.

example.ex: ...a drop of blue ink...
example.tran: 一滴蓝墨水

example.ex: Add the cream a few drops at a time...
example.tran: 每次加几滴奶油。

collins.def: Drops are a kind of medicine which you put drop by drop into your ears, eyes, or nose.

example.ex: ...eye drops.
example.tran: 眼药水

collins.tran: (水果味或巧克力味的)糖豆，糖果粒
collins.def: Fruit or chocolate drops are small round sweets with a fruit or chocolate flavour.

collins.tran: 落差;垂直距离;下降距离
collins.def: You use drop to talk about vertical distances. For example, a thirty-foot drop is a distance of thirty feet between the top of a cliff or wall and the bottom of it.

example.ex: There was a sheer drop just outside my window...
example.tran: 我的窗外就是垂直深渊。

example.ex: It's only a four-foot drop.
example.tran: 仅有 4 英尺的落差。

collins.def: If you drop a hint, you give a hint or say something in a casual way.

example.ex: If I drop a few hints he might give me a cutting.
example.tran: 如果我给点暗示，他没准会送我一段插枝。

collins.tran: (常指因不喜欢而让别人)终止谈论，不要谈论，谈到此为止
collins.def: If you want someone to drop the subject ,drop it, or let it drop, you want them to stop talking about something, often because you are annoyed that they keep talking about it.

example.ex: Mary Ann wished he would just drop it...
example.tran: 玛丽·安希望他就不要谈论它了。

example.ex: Does that mean you're going to drop the subject?
example.tran: 那是不是意味着你将不再谈论那个话题了？

collins.tran: 东边的;东部的;来自东边的;来自东部的
collins.def: Eastern means in or from the east of a region, state, or country.

example.ex: ...Eastern Europe.
example.tran: 东欧

example.ex: ...Pakistan's eastern city of Lahore.
example.tran: 巴基斯坦东部城市拉合尔

collins.tran: 来自东方国家的;东方国家的
collins.def: Eastern means coming from or associated with the people or countries of the East, such as India, China, or Japan.

example.ex: In many Eastern countries massage was and is a part of everyday life.
example.tran: 在很多东方国家，按摩从古至今都是日常生活的一部分。

collins.def: A profit is an amount of money that you gain when you are paid more for something than it cost you to make, get, or do it.

example.ex: The bank made pre-tax profits of £3.5 million...
example.tran: 这家银行的税前利润为350万英镑。

example.ex: You can improve your chances of profit by sensible planning...
example.tran: 你可以通过合理计划来提高盈利的机会。

collins.def: If you profit from something, you earn a profit from it.

example.ex: Footballers are accustomed to profiting handsomely from bonuses...
example.tran: 足球运动员对获取丰厚的奖金已习以为常。

example.ex: He has profited by selling his holdings to other investors...
example.tran: 他将自己的股票卖给其他投资者，从中获利。

collins.tran: 得益（于）；对…有益；对…有好处
collins.def: If you profit from something, or it profits you, you gain some advantage or benefit from it.

example.ex: Jennifer wasn't yet totally convinced that she'd profit from a more relaxed lifestyle...
example.tran: 珍尼弗还不完全相信更轻松的生活方式会对她有好处。

example.ex: So far the French alliance had profited the rebels little...
example.tran: 到目前为止叛军都没有从法国同盟那里获得什么好处。

collins.def: A television or television set is a piece of electrical equipment consisting of a box with a glass screen on it on which you can watch programmes with pictures and sounds.

example.ex: She turned the television on and flicked around between news programmes.
example.tran: 她打开电视，来回换台看不同的新闻节目。

collins.def: Television is the system of sending pictures and sounds by electrical signals over a distance so that people can receive them on a television in their home.

example.ex: Toy manufacturers began promoting some of their products on television...
example.tran: 玩具制造商开始在电视上推销他们的一些产品。

example.ex: Television is increasingly being transmitted by satellites.
example.tran: 越来越多的电视节目通过卫星进行转播。

collins.def: Television refers to all the programmes that you can watch.

example.ex: I don't have much time to watch very much television.
example.tran: 我没有太多时间可泡在电视上。

collins.def: Television is the business or industry concerned with making programmes and broadcasting them on television.

example.ex: British commercial television has been steadily losing its lead as the most advanced sector of the industry in Europe.
example.tran: 英国商业电视在逐步失去其作为欧洲电视广播业最先进部分的领先地位。

means: 按比例（或平均）分配（利润等）
平均：作为或达到一个中间值

collins.def: An average is the result that you get when you add two or more numbers together and divide the total by the number of numbers you added together.

example.ex: Take the average of those ratios and multiply by a hundred.
example.tran: 算出那些比率的平均值再乘以100。

collins.def: You use average to refer to a number or size that varies but is always approximately the same.

example.ex: It takes an average of ten weeks for a house sale to be completed.
example.tran: 售出一幢房子平均需要10周的时间。

collins.def: An average person or thing is typical or normal.

example.ex: The average adult man burns 1,500 to 2,000 calories per day...
example.tran: 普通成年男子每天消耗的热量为1,500到2,000卡路里。

example.ex: Packaging is about a third of what is found in an average British dustbin.
example.tran: 英国垃圾桶里平均约有1/3是产品包装。

collins.def: An amount or quality that is the average is the normal amount or quality for a particular group of things or people.

example.ex: Most areas suffered more rain than usual, with Northern Ireland getting double the average for the month.
example.tran: 大部分地区降雨超过通常水平，北爱尔兰地区本月的降水量则为平均值的两倍。

collins.def: Something that is average is neither very good nor very bad, usually when you had hoped it would be better.

example.ex: I was only average academically.
example.tran: 我的学习成绩一般。

collins.def: To average a particular amount means to do, get, or produce that amount as an average over a period of time.

example.ex: We averaged 42 miles per hour.
example.tran: 我们的平均时速是每小时42英里。

example.ex: ...pay increases averaging 9.75%.
example.tran: 9.75％的工资平均增长幅度

collins.def: You say on average or on an average to indicate that a number is the average of several numbers.

example.ex: American shares rose, on average, by 38%...
example.tran: 美国股票价格平均上涨了38％。

example.ex: On an average we would be spending £300 per day.
example.tran: 平均下来，我们每天要花费300英镑。

collins.def: If you say that something is true on average, you mean that it is generally true.

example.ex: On average, American firms remain the most productive in the world.
example.tran: 总体来讲，美国公司在全球范围内还是产值最高。

collins.def: Competition is a situation in which two or more people or groups are trying to get something which not everyone can have.

example.ex: There's been some fierce competition for the title...
example.tran: 夺冠之争一直都相当激烈。

example.ex: It was in these studios that young painters found the support and stimulating competition of peers.
example.tran: 就是在这些画室里，年轻的画家们得到了同龄人的支持，也感受到了激励大家向前的竞争。

collins.def: The competition is the person or people you are competing with.

example.ex: I have to change my approach, the competition is too good now.
example.tran: 我得改变方法，现在的竞争对手太强。

collins.def: Competition is an activity involving two or more firms, in which each firm tries to get people to buy its own goods in preference to the other firms' goods.

example.ex: The deal would have reduced competition in the commuter-aircraft market...
example.tran: 这项协议原本会减少通勤航班市场的竞争。

example.ex: The farmers have been seeking higher prices as better protection from foreign competition...
example.tran: 农场主们一直在寻找更高的价格，以更好地保护自己不受国外竞争对手的影响。

collins.def: The competition is the goods that a rival organization is selling.

example.ex: The American aerospace industry has been challenged by some stiff competition.
example.tran: 美国航空和航天工业已经受到某种强劲的竞争产品的挑战。

collins.def: A competition is an event in which many people take part in order to find out who is best at a particular activity.

example.ex: ...a surfing competition...
example.tran: 冲浪比赛

example.ex: The council has organised a series of events and competitions for school children in the area...
example.tran: 委员会为本地区的中小学生组织了一系列的活动和比赛。

collins.def: You use reality to refer to real things or the real nature of things rather than imagined, invented, or theoretical ideas.

example.ex: Fiction and reality were increasingly blurred...
example.tran: 虚构和现实越来越难以区分了。

example.ex: Psychiatrists become too caught up in their theories to deal adequately with reality.
example.tran: 精神病专家太纠结于理论，无法很好地处理现实问题。

collins.tran: （尤指不愉快的或困难的）真实情况，实际情形
collins.def: The reality of a situation is the truth about it, especially when it is unpleasant or difficult to deal with.

example.ex: ...the harsh reality of top international competition...
example.tran: 高层次的国际竞争的严酷现实

example.ex: Other psychoanalysts do accept the reality of child sexual abuse.
example.tran: 其他心理分析师确实接受了儿童性侵犯的现实。

collins.tran: 现实存在;真实发生的事
collins.def: You say that something has become a reality when it actually exists or is actually happening.

example.ex: ...the whole procedure that made this book become a reality...
example.tran: 本书成书的整个过程

example.ex: The reality is that they are poor.
example.tran: 现状是他们很贫穷。

collins.def: You can use in reality to introduce a statement about the real nature of something, when it contrasts with something incorrect that has just been described.

example.ex: He came across as streetwise, but in reality he was not.
example.tran: 他给人的印象是很适应都市生活，但实际上并非如此。

collins.def: If you warn someone about something such as a possible danger or problem, you tell them about it so that they are aware of it.

example.ex: When I had my first baby friends warned me that children were expensive...
example.tran: 当我有了第一个孩子时，朋友们提醒我说养孩子是很花钱的。

example.ex: They warned him of the dangers of sailing alone...
example.tran: 他们警告他说独自航行危险重重。

collins.def: If you warn someone not to do something, you advise them not to do it so that they can avoid possible danger or punishment.

example.ex: Mrs. Blount warned me not to interfere...
example.tran: 布朗特夫人警告我不要插手。

example.ex: Children must be warned to stay away from main roads...
example.tran: 必须警告孩子们远离交通要道。

collins.def: If someone says to you 'be warned', they are advising you to be cautious, because there are risks that you may not have thought about.

example.ex: But be warned: this is not a cheap option.
example.tran: 但要慎重：这个选择代价不菲。

means: 特定区域的，特定地区的

collins.def: Regional is used to describe things which relate to a particular area of a country or of the world.

example.ex: ...the autonomous regional government of Andalucia.
example.tran: 安达卢西亚自治区政府

example.ex: ...concern about regional security...
example.tran: 对地区安全的担忧

collins.def: To ensure something, or to ensure that something happens, means to make certain that it happens.

example.ex: Britain's negotiators had ensured that the treaty which resulted was a significant change in direction...
example.tran: 英国谈判代表已经担保由此而签订的条约将是方向上的重大改变。

example.ex: Ensure that it is written into your contract.
example.tran: 确保把这一点写入合同中。

means: 串行线路接口协议(Serial Line Interface Protocol)

collins.def: If you slip, you accidentally slide and lose your balance.

example.ex: He had slipped on an icy pavement...
example.tran: 他在一条结了冰的人行道上滑了一跤。

example.ex: Be careful not to slip.
example.tran: 小心，别滑倒了。

collins.def: If something slips, it slides out of place or out of your hand.

example.ex: His glasses had slipped...
example.tran: 他的眼镜滑掉了。

example.ex: The hammer slipped out of her grasp.
example.tran: 锤子从她的手中滑落。

collins.tran: 迅速而悄无声息地走(到某处);溜(到某处)
collins.def: If you slip somewhere, you go there quickly and quietly.

example.ex: Amy slipped downstairs and out of the house...
example.tran: 埃米偷偷下楼溜出了房子。

example.ex: She slipped into the driving seat and closed the door.
example.tran: 她溜进了驾驶座，关上了门。

collins.tran: 迅速而不被注意地放置;偷偷塞进
collins.def: If you slip something somewhere, you put it there quickly in a way that does not attract attention.

example.ex: I slipped a note under Louise's door...
example.tran: 我偷偷在路易斯的房门下面塞了一张便条。

example.ex: He found a coin in his pocket and slipped it into her collecting tin...
example.tran: 他摸到口袋里有一枚硬币，便匆匆丢进她的讨钱罐。

collins.def: If you slip something to someone, you give it to them secretly.

example.ex: Robert had slipped her a note in school...
example.tran: 罗伯特在学校里偷偷地塞给她一张纸条。

example.ex: She looked round before pulling out a package and slipping it to the man.
example.tran: 她四下里看了看，然后拿出一个包裹，偷偷地塞给了这个男人。

collins.tran: 不知不觉地转入(某种状态);逐渐陷入(某种情况)
collins.def: To slip into a particular state or situation means to pass gradually into it, in a way that is hardly noticed.

example.ex: It amazed him how easily one could slip into a routine...
example.tran: 他惊异地发现人很容易在不知不觉中因循守旧起来。

example.ex: There was a 50-50 chance that the economy could slip back into recession.
example.tran: 经济再次陷入衰退的可能性是 50%。

collins.def: If something slips to a lower level or standard, it falls to that level or standard.

example.ex: Shares slipped to 117p...
example.tran: 股价跌至 117 便士。

example.ex: The club had slipped to the bottom of Division Four...
example.tran: 该俱乐部已经跌为丁级组的最后一名。

collins.def: If you slip into or out of clothes or shoes, you put them on or take them off quickly and easily.

example.ex: She slipped out of the jacket and tossed it on the couch...
example.tran: 她麻利地脱下夹克，扔在了沙发上。

example.ex: I slipped off my woollen gloves.
example.tran: 我迅速地脱下了毛绒手套。

collins.def: A slip is a small or unimportant mistake.

example.ex: We must be well prepared, there must be no slips.
example.tran: 我们必须好好准备，不能出任何差错。

collins.def: A slip of paper is a small piece of paper.

example.ex: ...little slips of paper he had torn from a notebook...
example.tran: 他从笔记本上撕下来的一张张小纸片

example.ex: I put her name on the slip.
example.tran: 我在纸条上记下了她的名字。

collins.def: A slip is a thin piece of clothing that a woman wears under her dress or skirt.
If you refer to someone as a slip of a girl or a slip of a boy, you mean they are small, thin, and young.

example.ex: He's a mere slip of a lad compared to his brother...
example.tran: 跟他哥哥一比，他不过是个小毛孩。

example.ex: She was just a slip of a thing.
example.tran: 她才是个小丫头。

collins.def: If you give someone the slip, you escape from them when they are following you or watching you.

example.ex: He gave reporters the slip by leaving at midnight.
example.tran: 他在午夜时分离开，避开了记者的追踪。

collins.def: If you let slip information, you accidentally tell it to someone, when you wanted to keep it secret.

example.ex: I bet he let slip that I'd gone to America.
example.tran: 我可以打赌，是他走漏了我去了美国的消息。

collins.def: If something slips your mind, you forget about it.

example.ex: The reason for my visit had obviously slipped his mind.
example.tran: 他显然已经忘掉了我的来意。

collins.def: If you shake something, you hold it and move it quickly backwards and forwards or up and down. You can also shake a person, for example, because you are angry with them or because you want them to wake up.

example.ex: The nurse shook the thermometer and put it under my armpit...
example.tran: 护士把体温计甩了甩，然后放到了我的腋下。

example.ex: Shake the rugs well and hang them for a few hours before replacing on the floor...
example.tran: 把地毯好好抖抖，挂起来晾上几小时再铺到地板上。

collins.tran: 摇动，抖动(身体或身体部位)
collins.def: If you shake yourself or your body, you make a lot of quick, small, repeated movements without moving from the place where you are.

example.ex: As soon as he got inside, the dog shook himself...
example.tran: 他一进来，狗就开始摇头摆尾。

example.ex: He shook his hands to warm them up.
example.tran: 他摇动双手让它们暖和起来。

collins.tran: 摇头(表示拒绝、怀疑或难过)
collins.def: If you shake your head, you turn it from side to side in order to say 'no' or to show disbelief or sadness.

example.ex: 'Anything else?' Colum asked. Kathryn shook her head wearily...
example.tran: “还有别的吗?”科拉姆问。凯瑟琳疲惫地摇了摇头。

example.ex: We were amazed, shocked, dumbfounded, shaking our heads in disbelief.
example.tran: 我们震惊、愕然、目瞪口呆，难以置信地摇着头。

collins.tran: (因为寒冷或害怕而)发抖，颤抖，战栗，哆嗦
collins.def: If you are shaking, or a part of your body is shaking, you are making quick, small movements that you cannot control, for example because you are cold or afraid.

example.ex: He roared with laughter, shaking in his chair...
example.tran: 他放声大笑，笑得身子在椅子上直颤。

example.ex: My hand shook so much that I could hardly hold the microphone...
example.tran: 我的手抖得如此厉害，几乎都拿不住麦克风了。

collins.tran: (因害怕、生病或喝醉酒而产生的)颤抖，战栗，哆嗦
collins.def: If you have the shakes, your body is shaking a lot because you are afraid or ill, or because you have drunk too much alcohol.

example.ex: Another man constantly chain-smoked and seemed to have the shakes.
example.tran: 另一名男子一直一支接一支地抽烟，似乎身体有些发抖。

collins.tran: (因愤怒而)挥动,舞动(拳头、棍子等)
collins.def: If you shake your fist or an object such as a stick at someone, you wave it in the air in front of them because you are angry with them.

example.ex: The colonel rushed up to Earle, shaking his gun at him...
example.tran: 上校冲向厄尔，朝他挥着枪。

example.ex: The protesters burst through police lines into the cathedral square, shaking clenched fists.
example.tran: 抗议者冲破警方封锁线来到教堂广场上，挥舞着愤怒的拳头。

collins.def: If a force shakes something, or if something shakes, it moves from side to side or up and down with quick, small, but sometimes violent movements.

example.ex: ...an explosion that shook buildings several kilometers away...
example.tran: 使几公里以外的建筑物都感觉到震动的爆炸

example.ex: The hiccups may shake your baby's body from head to foot...
example.tran: 打嗝可能会让宝宝从头到脚地颤。

collins.def: To shake something into a certain place or state means to bring it into that place or state by moving it quickly up and down or from side to side.

example.ex: Small insects can be collected by shaking them into a jar...
example.tran: 收集小昆虫时可以把它们装进广口瓶里。

example.ex: She frees her mass of hair from a rubber band and shakes it off her shoulders...
example.tran: 她解开橡皮筋，将浓密的头发披散在肩头。

collins.def: If your voice is shaking, you cannot control it properly and it sounds very unsteady, for example because you are nervous or angry.

example.ex: His voice shaking with rage, he asked how the committee could keep such a report from the public.
example.tran: 他气得声音发抖，质问委员会这样一份报告怎么能向公众隐瞒。

collins.def: If an event or a piece of news shakes you, or shakes your confidence, it makes you feel upset and unable to think calmly.

example.ex: The news of Tandy's escape had shaken them all...
example.tran: 坦迪逃跑的消息让他们所有人都无比震惊。

example.ex: She was close to both of her parents and was undeniably shaken by their divorce...
example.tran: 她和父母的关系都很亲近，因此毫无疑问，他们的离婚对她打击很大。

collins.def: If an event shakes a group of people or their beliefs, it causes great uncertainty and makes them question their beliefs.

example.ex: It won't shake the football world if we beat Torquay...
example.tran: 即便我们击败了托基队也不能撼动足球界。

example.ex: When events happen that shake these beliefs, our fear takes control...
example.tran: 当一些事情的发生动摇这些信念时，恐惧就会占据我们的心灵。

collins.tran: 使摒弃，使改变(态度、信念)
collins.def: If you shake someone out of an attitude or belief that you disapprove of, you cause them to change their attitude or belief to one that is more responsible or sensible.

example.ex: No amount of reasoning could shake him out of his conviction...
example.tran: 再怎样跟他讲道理都不能让他放弃自己认准的事。

example.ex: Many businessmen still find it hard to shake themselves out of the old state-dependent habit.
example.tran: 很多商人发现自己仍然很难摆脱依赖政府的老习惯。

collins.def: A shake is the same as a milkshake .

example.ex: He sent his driver to fetch him a strawberry shake.
example.tran: 他让司机去给他买一杯草莓奶昔。

collins.def: If you do not get a fair shake, you are not given a reasonable opportunity to succeed or to achieve something.

example.ex: A lot of people think that they're not going to get a fair shake from the courts.
example.tran: 很多人认为他们在法庭上不会受到公平的审判。

collins.tran: 技术不高的;不出色的;无效的
collins.def: If you say that someone or something is no great shakes, you mean that they are not very skilful or effective.

example.ex: I'm no great shakes as a detective...
example.tran: 作为一名侦探我并不出色。

example.ex: The protests have failed partly because the opposition politicians are  no great shakes.
example.tran: 抗议失败了，部分原因是因为反对派政治家们并未发挥积极作用。

collins.def: If you shake someone's hand or shake someone by the hand, you shake hands with them.

example.ex: I said congratulations and walked over to him and shook his hand...
example.tran: 我向他表示祝贺，并走过去和他握手。

example.ex: The Secretary emerged, a big fat man who quickly shook us all by the hand.
example.tran: 这位大臣现身了，是一个大块头，他迅速和我们所有人都握了手。

collins.tran: (打招呼、道别、道贺或表示赞同时)与…握手
collins.def: If you shake hands with someone, you take their right hand in your own for a few moments, often moving it up and down slightly, when you are saying hello or goodbye to them, congratulating them, or agreeing on something. You can also say that two people shake hands .

example.ex: He nodded greetings to Mary Ann and Michael and shook hands with Burke...
example.tran: 他向玛丽·安及迈克尔点头致意，并和伯克握了手。

example.ex: We shook hands and parted on good terms.
example.tran: 我们握了握手，然后祝福道别。

collins.def: Your partner is the person you are married to or are having a romantic or sexual relationship with.

example.ex: Wanting other friends doesn't mean you don't love your partner.
example.tran: 想交其他朋友并不意味着你不爱你的伴侣。

example.ex: ...his choice of marriage partner.
example.tran: 他对婚姻伴侣的选择

collins.def: Your partner is the person you are doing something with, for example dancing with or playing with in a game against two other people.

example.ex: ...to dance with a partner...
example.tran: 和舞伴跳舞

example.ex: My partner for the event was the marvellous American player.
example.tran: 那场比赛我的搭档是那位了不起的美国选手。

collins.def: The partners in a firm or business are the people who share the ownership of it.

example.ex: He's a partner in a Chicago law firm.
example.tran: 他是芝加哥一家律师事务所的合伙人。

example.ex: ...her business partner Max Hampshire.
example.tran: 她生意上的合伙人马克斯·汉普希尔

collins.def: The partner of a country or organization is another country or organization with which they work or do business.

example.ex: Spain has been one of Cuba's major trading partners.
example.tran: 西班牙一直是古巴的主要贸易伙伴之一。

example.ex: ...the main coalition partner in the Slovak government.
example.tran: 斯洛伐克联合政府中的主要盟友

collins.tran: （比赛或舞蹈中）做…的伙伴（或搭档），与…配对
collins.def: If you partner someone, you are their partner in a game or in a dance.

example.ex: He had partnered the famous Russian ballerina...
example.tran: 他已经和那位著名的俄罗斯芭蕾舞女演员做了搭档。

example.ex: He will be partnered by Ian Baker, the defending champion...
example.tran: 他将和卫冕冠军伊恩·贝克搭档。

means: 进行易货贸易，作物物交换

collins.def: If two or more people exchange things of a particular kind, they give them to each other at the same time.

example.ex: We exchanged addresses and Christmas cards...
example.tran: 我们交换了地址和圣诞贺卡。

example.ex: The two men exchanged glances...
example.tran: 那两个男人互相扫了一眼。

collins.tran: 调换，交换，更换（尤指更好或更令人满意的东西）
collins.def: If you exchange something, you replace it with a different thing, especially something that is better or more satisfactory.

example.ex: ...the chance to sell back or exchange goods...
example.tran: 回销或调换商品的机会

example.ex: If the car you have leased is clearly unsatisfactory, you can always exchange it for another.
example.tran: 如果你对租借的车明显不满意，可随时另换一辆。

collins.tran: 短暂的交谈;（常指）口角，争吵
collins.def: An exchange is a brief conversation, usually an angry one.

example.ex: There've been some bitter exchanges between the two groups.
example.tran: 两组之间发生过一些激烈的争吵。

collins.def: An exchange of fire, for example, is an incident in which people use guns or missiles against each other.

example.ex: There was an exchange of fire during which the gunman was wounded...
example.tran: 有过交火，其间那名持枪歹徒受伤了。

example.ex: This could intensify the risk of a nuclear exchange.
example.tran: 这可能会加剧爆发核战争的危险。

collins.tran: （不同国家人们之间的）交流，互访
collins.def: An exchange is an arrangement in which people from two different countries visit each other's country, to strengthen links between them.

example.ex: ...a series of sporting and cultural exchanges with Seoul...
example.tran: 和首尔之间的一系列体育和文化交流

example.ex: ...educational exchanges for young people...
example.tran: 面向年轻人的教育交流

collins.def: Exchange is used in the names of some places where people used to trade and do business with each other.

example.ex: ...the Royal Exchange.
example.tran: 皇家交易所

collins.def: The exchange is the same as the telephone exchange .
If you do or give something in exchange for something else, you do it or give it in order to get that thing.

example.ex: It is illegal for public officials to solicit gifts or money in exchange for favors...
example.tran: 公务员通过索要礼物或钱财作为为他人提供便利的交换是违法的。

example.ex: He paid her a huge salary. In exchange, he was assured of her vote.
example.tran: 他给她支付了很高的薪水，作为交换，他确定能够得到她的选票。

collins.def: Criticism is the action of expressing disapproval of something or someone. A criticism is a statement that expresses disapproval.

example.ex: This policy had repeatedly come under strong criticism on Capitol Hill...
example.tran: 该政策在美国国会屡遭强烈批评。

example.ex: The criticism that the English do not truly care about their children was often voiced.
example.tran: 常有人指责英国人并不真正关心自己的子女。

collins.def: Criticism is a serious examination and judgment of something such as a book or play.

example.ex: She has published more than 20 books including novels, poetry and literary criticism.
example.tran: 她已出版了包括小说、诗歌和文学评论在内的20多部著作。

collins.def: If something is reserved for a particular person or purpose, it is kept specially for that person or purpose.

example.ex: A double room with a balcony overlooking the sea had been reserved for him...
example.tran: 特地为他预留了一间带阳台的海景双人房。

example.ex: In the United States lanes are reserved for cars with more than one occupant.
example.tran: 在美国，多人乘坐的汽车有专行道。

collins.def: If you reserve something such as a table, ticket, or magazine, you arrange for it to be kept specially for you, rather than sold or given to someone else.

example.ex: I'll reserve a table for five...
example.tran: 我要预订一张5人的桌子。

example.ex: Demand will be huge, so ask your newsagent to reserve your copy today.
example.tran: 需求量会很大，所以今天得请卖报摊主为你预留出你那份。

collins.def: A reserve is a supply of something that is available for use when it is needed.

example.ex: The Gulf has 65 per cent of the world's oil reserves...
example.tran: 海湾地区拥有全世界65％的石油储藏。

example.ex: A friend can be a reserve of help in times of trouble.
example.tran: 朋友可以在困难的时候提供帮助。

collins.def: In sports, a reserve is someone who is available to play as part of a team if one of the members is ill or cannot play.

example.ex: He ended up as a reserve, but still qualified for a team gold medal.
example.tran: 他最后成了替补队员，但仍有资格获得团体金牌。

collins.def: A nature reserve is an area of land where the animals, birds, and plants are officially protected.

example.ex: Marine biologists are calling for Cardigan Bay to be created a marine nature reserve to protect the dolphins.
example.tran: 海洋生物学家号召将卡迪根湾建成一个海洋自然保护区，以保护那里的海豚。

collins.def: If someone shows reserve, they keep their feelings hidden.

example.ex: The subject is one which must be discussed with reserve...
example.tran: 对这个话题必须进行慎重的讨论。

example.ex: His natural reserve made him appear self-conscious.
example.tran: 他天生的内敛性格让他显得有些拘谨。

collins.def: If you have something in reserve, you have it available for use when it is needed.

example.ex: ...the bottle of whisky that he kept in reserve...
example.tran: 他特地留的那瓶威士忌

example.ex: There were patrol cars on the streets and riot police standing by in reserve.
example.tran: 巡逻车在街上守候，防暴警察也在一旁待命。

collins.def: A military reserve is a group of soldiers who are ready to join a military operation if they are needed.
A proposal is a plan or an idea, often a formal or written one, which is suggested for people to think about and decide upon.

example.ex: The President is to put forward new proposals for resolving the country's constitutional crisis...
example.tran: 总统将提出解决国家宪法危机的新议案。

example.ex: ...the government's proposals to abolish free health care...
example.tran: 政府关于废除免费医疗保健的提案

collins.def: A proposal is the act of asking someone to marry you.

example.ex: After a three-weekend courtship, Pamela accepted Randolph's proposal of marriage.
example.tran: 经过3个周末的追求之后，帕梅拉接受了伦道夫的求婚。

collins.def: If a building or other structure collapses, it falls down very suddenly.

example.ex: A section of the Bay Bridge had collapsed...
example.tran: 海湾大桥有一段垮塌了。

example.ex: The roof collapsed in a roar of rock and rubble...
example.tran: 屋顶轰隆一声塌了下来，碎石瓦砾落了一地。

collins.tran: (体系或机构)崩溃，瓦解，突然失败
collins.def: If something, for example a system or institution, collapses, it fails or comes to an end completely and suddenly.

example.ex: His business empire collapsed under a massive burden of debt...
example.tran: 他的商业帝国无力承担沉重的债务负担而垮掉了。

example.ex: This system has collapsed in most countries where it ruled...
example.tran: 这一体系在其占统治地位的大多数国家都失败了。

collins.tran: (因生病或虚弱)突然倒下，昏倒
collins.def: If you collapse, you suddenly faint or fall down because you are very ill or weak.

example.ex: He collapsed following a vigorous exercise session at his home...
example.tran: 在家剧烈运动了一阵后他突然昏倒了。

example.ex: It's commonplace to see people collapsing from hunger in the streets.
example.tran: 在街上看见有人饿晕是很平常的事。

collins.tran: (因精疲力竭而)突然坐下(或倒下)
collins.def: If you collapse onto something, you sit or lie down suddenly because you are very tired.

example.ex: She arrived home exhausted and barely capable of showering before collapsing on her bed.
example.tran: 她精疲力竭地回到家，勉强冲了个澡就倒在了床上。

collins.def: If something with air inside collapses, it falls inwards and becomes smaller or flatter.

example.ex: He plunged 300ft to the ground when his parachute collapsed...
example.tran: 降落伞突然瘪了，他从300英尺的高空跌落到地面。

example.ex: He was rushed to hospital last week after suffering a collapsed lung.
example.tran: 上星期，他因出现肺萎陷而被火速送进医院。

means: 拍摄(shoot的过去式和过去分词)

collins.def: Shot is the past tense and past participle of shoot .
A shot is an act of firing a gun.

example.ex: He had murdered Perceval at point blank range with a single shot...
example.tran: 他在近距离一枪射杀了珀西瓦尔。

example.ex: A man fired a volley of shots at them.
example.tran: 一名男子向他们射出了一排子弹。

collins.def: Someone who is a good shot can shoot well. Someone who is a bad shot cannot shoot well.

example.ex: He was not a particularly good shot because of his eyesight.
example.tran: 他视力不好，算不上是一个出色的射手。

collins.def: In sports such as football, golf, or tennis, a shot is an act of kicking, hitting, or throwing the ball, especially in an attempt to score a point.

example.ex: He had only one shot at goal.
example.tran: 他只有一次射门得分。

collins.tran: 一张照片;(电影的)一组镜头
collins.def: A shot is a photograph or a particular sequence of pictures in a film.

example.ex: ...a shot of a fox peering from the bushes...
example.tran: 一只狐狸从灌木丛中窥视的照片

example.ex: He received praise for the atmospheric monochrome shots in David Lynch's The Elephant Man.
example.tran: 他在大卫·林奇的电影《象人》中所拍摄的那些渲染气氛的黑白镜头受到了好评。

collins.def: If you have a shot at something, you attempt to do it.

example.ex: The heavyweight champion will be given a shot at Holyfield's world title.
example.tran: 这名重量级拳击冠军将尝试挑战霍利菲尔德的世界冠军头衔。

collins.def: A shot of a drug is an injection of it.

example.ex: He administered a shot of Nembutal.
example.tran: 他注射了一针宁比泰。

collins.def: A shot of a strong alcoholic drink is a small glass of it.

example.ex: ...a shot of vodka.
example.tran: 一小杯伏特加

example.ex: ...spirits and liqueurs, served in a shot glass.
example.tran: 小杯的烈性酒和利口酒

collins.def: If you give something your best shot, you do it as well as you possibly can.

example.ex: I don't expect to win. But I am going to give it my best shot.
example.tran: 我没指望赢。但我会尽全力的。

collins.def: If you describe someone's actions as a shot across the bows of another person, you mean that it is a warning to that person to stop or change what they are doing.

example.ex: As a warning shot across the bows of rivals, it is already setting aggressive prices.
example.tran: 作为对竞争对手的一个警告，其已报出了很有杀伤力的价格。

collins.def: The person who calls the shots is in a position to tell others what to do.

example.ex: The directors call the shots and nothing happens without their say-so.
example.tran: 董事们掌握大权，没有他们的允许什么都不能做。

collins.tran: 立刻;飞快地;毫不迟疑地
collins.def: If you do something like a shot, you do it without any delay or hesitation.

example.ex: I heard the key turn in the front door and I was out of bed like a shot...
example.tran: 听到钥匙在开前门的声音，我立即从床上起来了。

example.ex: If he thought it his duty to arrest me, he'd do it like a shot.
example.tran: 如果他认为逮捕我是他的职责，他会毫不迟疑地去做。

collins.tran: 没把握的尝试;不大可能成功的尝试
collins.def: If you describe something as a long shot, you mean that it is unlikely to succeed, but is worth trying.

example.ex: The deal was a long shot, but Bagley had little to lose...
example.tran: 这桩交易有些冒险，不过巴格利也没什么可损失的。

example.ex: I thought about meeting a handsome stranger but it seemed a bit of a long shot.
example.tran: 我想象着能遇到一个英俊的陌生人，不过这似乎希望不大。

collins.def: People sometimes use the expression by a long shot to emphasize the opinion they are giving.

example.ex: The missile-reduction treaty makes sweeping cuts, but the arms race isn't over by a long shot.
example.tran: 导弹削减条约大幅度减少了导弹数量，然而军备竞赛还远没有停止。

collins.tran: 布满，充满，富有(某种因素或特征)
collins.def: If something is shot through with an element or feature, it contains a lot of that element or feature.

example.ex: His work was deeply refreshing, and all of it shot through with humour...
example.tran: 他的作品令人耳目一新，充满幽默元素。

example.ex: This is an argument shot through with inconsistency.
example.tran: 这个论点前后矛盾，漏洞百出。

collins.def: If you have confidence in someone, you feel that you can trust them.

example.ex: I have every confidence in you...
example.tran: 我完全相信你。

example.ex: This has contributed to the lack of confidence in the police...
example.tran: 这导致了大家对警方缺乏信任。

collins.def: If you have confidence, you feel sure about your abilities, qualities, or ideas.

example.ex: The band is on excellent form and brimming with confidence...
example.tran: 这支乐队状态极佳，自信满满。

example.ex: I always thought the worst of myself and had no confidence whatsoever.
example.tran: 我老是妄自菲薄，没有一点儿信心。

collins.def: If you can say something with confidence, you feel certain it is correct.

example.ex: I can say with confidence that such rumors were totally groundless.
example.tran: 我可以肯定地说这样的谣言完全没有根据。

collins.def: If you tell someone something in confidence, you tell them a secret.

example.ex: We told you all these things in confidence...
example.tran: 我们告诉你的这些事都需要保密。

example.ex: Even telling Lois seemed a betrayal of confidence.
example.tran: 即使是告诉洛伊丝都好像是在泄密。

collins.def: A confidence is a secret that you tell someone.

example.ex: Gregory shared confidences with Carmen.
example.tran: 格雷戈里和卡门说了知心话。

collins.def: If you give someone or something your attention, you look at it, listen to it, or think about it carefully.

example.ex: You have my undivided attention...
example.tran: 我专心听你所讲。

example.ex: Later he turned his attention to the desperate state of housing in the province.
example.tran: 其后，他将注意力转向了该省形势严峻的住房问题。

collins.def: Attention is great interest that is shown in someone or something, particularly by the general public.

example.ex: Volume Two, subtitled 'The Lawyers', will also attract considerable attention...
example.tran: 副标题为“律师”的第二册也将获得广泛关注。

example.ex: The conference may help to focus attention on the economy.
example.tran: 此次会议可能有助于将关注焦点放在经济上。

collins.def: If someone or something is getting attention, they are being dealt with or cared for.

example.ex: Each year more than two million household injuries need medical attention.
example.tran: 每年有超过200万起家中受伤事件需要医疗处理。

example.ex: ...a demanding baby who seems to want attention 24 hours a day.
example.tran: 好像一天24小时都要人照看的难缠的宝宝

collins.def: You can refer to someone's efforts to help you, or the interest they show in you, as their attentions, especially if you dislike or disapprove of them.

example.ex: The only way to escape the unwanted attentions of the local men was not to go out...
example.tran: 避免被当地人指指点点的唯一办法就是闭门不出。

example.ex: The meeting was held away from the attentions of the media...
example.tran: 会议的举行避开了媒体的关注。

collins.def: If you bring something to someone's attention or draw their attention to it, you tell them about it or make them notice it.

example.ex: If we don't keep bringing this to the attention of the people, nothing will be done...
example.tran: 如果我们无法让群众一直关注此事，那将一事无成。

example.ex: We conclude by drawing attention to the issues around which the debate should focus.
example.tran: 我们作总结时着重提到了辩论应该关注的一些问题。

collins.def: If someone or something attracts your attention or catches your attention, you suddenly notice them.

example.ex: A faint aroma of coffee attracted his attention...
example.tran: 淡淡的咖啡香味一下子吸引了他。

example.ex: He sat at one of the round tables and tried to attract her attention.
example.tran: 他坐在其中一张圆桌旁边，想引起她的注意。

collins.tran: 关心/不关心；注意/不注意
collins.def: If you pay attention to someone, you watch them, listen to them, or take notice of them. If you pay no attention to someone, you behave as if you are not aware of them or as if they are not important.

example.ex: More than ever before, the food industry is paying attention to young consumers...
example.tran: 食品工业比以往任何时候都更加关注年轻消费者。

example.ex: Other people walk along the beach at night, so I didn't pay any attention at first...
example.tran: 入夜后还有人在沙滩上散步，起先我并没注意到。

collins.def: When people stand to attention or stand at attention, they stand straight with their feet together and their arms at their sides.

example.ex: Soldiers in full combat gear stood at attention...
example.tran: 全副武装的士兵们立正站着。

example.ex: The waiters stood to attention with napkins folded over their arms.
example.tran: 服务员笔直站立着，餐巾折叠着放在他们的手臂上。

collins.def: If you consider something as a unit, you consider it as a single, complete thing.

example.ex: Agriculture was based in the past on the family as a unit.
example.tran: 过去的农业是以家庭为单位的。

collins.def: A unit is a group of people who work together at a specific job, often in a particular place.

example.ex: ...the health services research unit...
example.tran: 医疗卫生服务研究部门

example.ex: The results from this unit are staggering.
example.tran: 这个团队得出的结果令人吃惊。

collins.tran: （武装部队或警察机关的）小队，分队
collins.def: A unit is a group within an armed force or police force, whose members fight or work together or carry out a particular task.

example.ex: One secret military unit tried to contaminate the drinking water of the refugees...
example.tran: 一个秘密军事分队企图污染难民的饮用水。

example.ex: Two small Marine units have been trapped inside the city for the last 36 hours.
example.tran: 两支海军小分队在过去的36个小时被困在城内。

collins.tran: （常为更大机器一部分的）装置，设备，部件
collins.def: A unit is a small machine which has a particular function, often part of a larger machine.

example.ex: The unit plugs into any TV set.
example.tran: 这个部件能插进任何电视机。

collins.def: A unit of measurement is a fixed standard quantity, length, or weight that is used for measuring things. The litre, the centimetre, and the ounce are all units.
A unit is one of the parts that a textbook is divided into.
If you teach someone something, you give them instructions so that they know about it or how to do it.

example.ex: The trainers have a programme to teach them vocational skills...
example.tran: 培训师计划教他们一些职业技能。

example.ex: George had taught him how to ride a horse...
example.tran: 乔治已经教会了他骑马。

collins.def: To teach someone something means to make them think, feel, or act in a new or different way.

example.ex: Their daughter's death had taught him humility...
example.tran: 他们女儿的死使他学会了谦逊。

example.ex: He taught his followers that they could all be members of the kingdom of God...
example.tran: 他教导信徒们说，他们都可以升入天国。

collins.def: If you teach or teach a subject, you help students to learn about it by explaining it or showing them how to do it, usually as a job at a school, college, or university.

example.ex: Ingrid is currently teaching Mathematics at Shimla Public School...
example.tran: 英格丽德目前在希姆拉公立学校教数学。

example.ex: The topic is not taught in degree courses...
example.tran: 学位课程不讲授这个课题。

collins.def: If the police arrest you, they take charge of you and take you to a police station, because they believe you may have committed a crime.

example.ex: Police arrested five young men in connection with one of the attacks...
example.tran: 警方逮捕了与其中一次袭击有关的5名青年男子。

example.ex: The police say seven people were arrested for minor offences.
example.tran: 警方称有7人因轻罪被捕。

collins.def: If something or someone arrests a process, they stop it continuing.

example.ex: The sufferer may have to make major changes in his or her life to arrest the disease...
example.tran: 患者可能必须对生活习惯作出重大调整以控制病情。

example.ex: The law could arrest the development of good research if applied prematurely.
example.tran: 如果草率施行，该法律将会阻滞高质量研究的进展。

collins.def: If something interesting or surprising arrests your attention, you suddenly notice it and then continue to look at it or consider it carefully.

example.ex: The work of an architect of genius always arrests the attention no matter how little remains...
example.tran: 天才建筑师的作品无论残留多少都能最大限度地吸引眼球。

example.ex: As he reached the hall after her, he saw what had arrested her.
example.tran: 他跟随她到了大厅，看见了吸引她注意的东西。

collins.tran: 遭受，经受(疼痛);感到(痛苦)
collins.def: If you suffer pain, you feel it in your body or in your mind.

example.ex: Within a few days she had become seriously ill, suffering great pain and discomfort...
example.tran: 几天的时间，她就病得很严重了，疼痛难忍，周身不舒服。

example.ex: Can you assure me that my father is not suffering?
example.tran: 你能保证我父亲不会受罪吗？

collins.tran: (因疾病或处于其他不利境地而)受苦，受难，受折磨
collins.def: If you suffer from an illness or from some other bad condition, you are badly affected by it.

example.ex: He was eventually diagnosed as suffering from terminal cancer...
example.tran: 他最终被诊断出患了晚期癌症。

example.ex: I realized he was suffering from shock.
example.tran: 我意识到他休克了。

collins.tran: 遭遇，遭受，蒙受(不好的事)
collins.def: If you suffer something bad, you are in a situation in which something painful, harmful, or very unpleasant happens to you.

example.ex: The peace process has suffered a serious blow now...
example.tran: 现在和平进程遭到重创。

example.ex: Romania suffered another setback in its efforts to obtain financial support for its reforms.
example.tran: 罗马尼亚在为其改革努力寻求经济援助时再次受挫。

collins.def: If you suffer, you are badly affected by an event or situation.

example.ex: There are few who have not suffered...
example.tran: 谁都会经受挫折。

example.ex: It is obvious that Syria will suffer most from this change of heart.
example.tran: 很明显，这一态度的转变对叙利亚的影响最大。

collins.tran: (因不够关注或处于不利境况而)失利，失败，不成功
collins.def: If something suffers, it does not succeed because it has not been given enough attention or is in a bad situation.

example.ex: I'm not surprised that your studies are suffering...
example.tran: 你的功课变得越来越差，我并不感到奇怪。

example.ex: Without a major boost in tourism, the economy will suffer even further.
example.tran: 旅游业如果没有大的起色，经济状况会每况愈下。

collins.def: If you do not suffer fools gladly, you are not patient with people who you think are stupid.

example.ex: She doesn't suffer fools gladly and, in her view, most people are fools.
example.tran: 她不愿与笨人为伍，而在她看来，大多数人都是笨人。

collins.def: Someone's youth is the period of their life during which they are a child, before they are a fully mature adult.

example.ex: In my youth my ambition had been to be an inventor.
example.tran: 我年轻时的抱负是成为一个发明家。

example.ex: ...the comic books of my youth.
example.tran: 我少年时代看的漫画书

collins.def: Youth is the quality or state of being young.

example.ex: Gregory was still enchanted with Shannon's youth and joy and beauty...
example.tran: 格雷戈里仍为香农的朝气、快乐和美丽着迷。

example.ex: The team is now a good mixture of experience and youth.
example.tran: 这个队如今既经验丰富又充满朝气。

collins.tran: （新闻用语，尤指惹麻烦的）青年，小伙子
collins.def: Journalists often refer to young men as youths, especially when they are reporting that the young men have caused trouble.

example.ex: ...gangs of youths who broke windows and looted shops...
example.tran: 打碎玻璃橱窗抢劫商店的成群的年轻人

example.ex: A 17-year-old youth was remanded in custody yesterday.
example.tran: 一名17岁的年轻人昨天被还押候审。

collins.def: The youth are young people considered as a group.

example.ex: He represents the opinions of the youth of today...
example.tran: 他代表着当今年轻人的看法。

example.ex: She's not a very good influence on the youth of this country.
example.tran: 她对这个国家的青年一代没什么好影响。

collins.def: The millionth item in a series is the one you count as number one million.

example.ex: Last year the millionth truck rolled off the assembly line.
example.tran: 去年，第100万台卡车驶下流水线。

collins.def: A millionth of something is one of a million equal parts of it.

example.ex: The bomb must explode within less than a millionth of a second.
example.tran: 炸弹必须在不到百万分之一秒的时间内爆炸。

collins.def: The fourteenth item in a series is the one that you count as number fourteen.

example.ex: The Festival, now in its fourteenth year, has become a major international jazz event.
example.tran: 这个艺术节现在进行到第14届，已经成为国际爵士乐的一大盛会。

collins.def: When something occurs, it happens.

example.ex: If headaches only occur at night, lack of fresh air and oxygen is often the cause...
example.tran: 如果只是在晚上头疼，那常常是由于缺乏新鲜空气和氧气的缘故。

example.ex: The crash occurred when the crew shut down the wrong engine...
example.tran: 机务人员关错了引擎，随即飞机坠毁。

collins.def: When something occurs in a particular place, it exists or is present there.

example.ex: The cattle disease occurs more or less anywhere in Africa where the fly occurs...
example.tran: 在非洲凡是有这种蝇虫的地方，几乎都会出现这一牛病。

example.ex: These snails do not occur on low-lying coral islands or atolls.
example.tran: 在地势低平的珊瑚岛或环礁上没有这种螺。

collins.tran: （想法或主意）被想到，被想起，浮现于脑海中
collins.def: If a thought or idea occurs to you, you suddenly think of it or realize it.

example.ex: It did not occur to me to check my insurance policy...
example.tran: 我没有想到要核实我的保险单条款。

example.ex: It occurred to me that I could have the book sent to me...
example.tran: 我想到可以让人把书寄给我。

collins.def: A writer is a person who writes books, stories, or articles as a job.

example.ex: Turner is a writer and critic.
example.tran: 特纳是作家兼批评家。

example.ex: ...detective stories by American writers.
example.tran: 美国作家创作的侦探小说

collins.tran: （特定文章、报告、信件或故事的）作者，撰写者
collins.def: The writer of a particular article, report, letter, or story is the person who wrote it.

example.ex: No-one is to see the document without the permission of the writer of the report...
example.tran: 此报告未经作者允许，任何人不得翻阅。

example.ex: I can't agree with the letter writer who claims bringing back the death penalty would be an abuse of human rights.
example.tran: 我不能赞同写信人所称恢复死刑就是侵犯人权的说法。

collins.def: In some systems of government, a governor is a person who is in charge of the political administration of a region or state.

example.ex: He was governor of the province in the late 1970s...
example.tran: 他在20世纪70年代末担任该省的省长。

example.ex: Governor William Livingston addressed the New Jersey Assembly.
example.tran: 威廉·利文斯顿州长在新泽西州议会上发表了演说。

collins.def: A governor is a member of a committee which controls an organization such as a school or a hospital.

example.ex: Governors are using the increased powers given to them to act against incompetent headteachers.
example.tran: 董事们运用赋予他们的更大权力罢免不称职的校长。

example.ex: ...the chairman of the BBC board of governors.
example.tran: 英国广播公司董事会主席

collins.def: In some British institutions, the governor is the most senior official, who is in charge of the institution.

example.ex: The incident was reported to the prison governor.
example.tran: 这一事件已汇报给监狱长。

collins.def: When you heat something, you raise its temperature, for example by using a flame or a special piece of equipment.

example.ex: Meanwhile, heat the tomatoes and oil in a pan.
example.tran: 同时，在平底锅里将西红柿和油加热。

example.ex: ...a gas that absorbs the sun's energy and heats the air above it.
example.tran: 吸收太阳能、使上方空气变热的气体

collins.def: Heat is warmth or the quality of being hot.

example.ex: The seas store heat and release it gradually during cold periods...
example.tran: 海洋储存热量，并在寒冷季节里慢慢地把它释放出来。

example.ex: Its leaves drooped a little in the fierce heat of the sun.
example.tran: 它的叶子在灼热的阳光下微微耷拉着。

collins.def: The heat is very hot weather.

example.ex: As an asthmatic, he cannot cope with the heat and humidity...
example.tran: 他患有哮喘病，经不起高温和潮湿。

example.ex: This heat is killing me.
example.tran: 这么热的天气真让我难受。

collins.def: The heat of something is the temperature of something that is warm or that is being heated.

example.ex: Warm the milk to blood heat...
example.tran: 将牛奶热至人体温度。

example.ex: Adjust the heat of the barbecue by opening and closing the air vents.
example.tran: 通过开关气阀来调节烧烤架的温度。

collins.def: You use heat to refer to a source of heat, for example a cooking ring or the heating system of a house.

example.ex: Immediately remove the pan from the heat...
example.tran: 马上把平底锅从灶上端下来。

example.ex: Some apartment buildings don't have their heat turned on till the end of this week.
example.tran: 有些公寓楼直到本周末才会开暖气。

collins.tran: 强烈的感情;（尤指）愤怒，激动
collins.def: You use heat to refer to a state of strong emotion, especially of anger or excitement.

example.ex: It was all done in the heat of the moment and I have certainly learned by my mistake...
example.tran: 所有的一切都是在一怒之下干的，我无疑已经从自己的错误中吸取了教训。

example.ex: 'Look here,' I said, without heat, 'all I did was to walk down a street and sit down.'
example.tran: “你瞧，”我平静地说，“我只不过就是沿街走我的路，然后坐了下来。”

collins.def: The heat of a particular activity is the point when there is the greatest activity or excitement.

example.ex: Last week, in the heat of the election campaign, the Prime Minister left for America.
example.tran: 上周，当竞选活动进行到白热化时，首相启程去了美国。

collins.def: A heat is one of a series of races or competitions. The winners of a heat take part in another race or competition, against the winners of other heats.

example.ex: ...the heats of the men's 100m breaststroke.
example.tran: 男子100米蛙泳预赛

collins.tran: （雌性动物）正在发情（美国英语中作 in heat）
collins.def: When a female animal is on heat in British English, or in heat in American English, she is in a state where she is ready to mate with a male animal, as this will probably result in her becoming pregnant.

means: 表明（某人参与了罪行等）(involve的过去式和过去分词)

collins.tran: 卷入的;参与的;与…有密切关联的
collins.def: If you are involved in a situation or activity, you are taking part in it or have a strong connection with it.

example.ex: If she were involved in business, she would make a strong chief executive...
example.tran: 如果她投身商业的话,她会是一个很有能力的总裁。

example.ex: She became involved with political causes after the Chernobyl nuclear disaster...
example.tran: 在切尔诺贝利核泄漏灾难发生以后,她开始投身政界。

collins.def: If you are involved in something, you give a lot of time, effort, or attention to it.

example.ex: The family were deeply involved in Jewish culture.
example.tran: 这家人非常注重学习犹太文化。

example.ex: ...women who are so involved in their careers that they have no time for friendship.
example.tran: 忙于事业以至于无暇顾及友谊的女性

collins.def: The things involved in something such as a job or system are the necessary parts or consequences of it.

example.ex: We believe the time and hard work involved in completing such an assignment are worthwhile...
example.tran: 我们认为完成这项任务所必须付出的时间与辛苦都是值得的。

example.ex: He cannot reveal how much money is involved in the scheme...
example.tran: 他不能透露该计划投入了多少钱。

collins.tran: 复杂难懂的;棘手的;难处理的
collins.def: If a situation or activity is involved, it has a lot of different parts or aspects, often making it difficult to understand, explain, or do.

example.ex: The operations can be quite involved, requiring many procedures.
example.tran: 手术可能非常复杂,需要对多处进行手术。

collins.tran: 关系暧昧的;有情爱关系的
collins.def: If one person is involved with another, especially someone they are not married to, they are having a sexual or romantic relationship.

example.ex: He became romantically involved with a married woman.
example.tran: 他与一位已婚妇女产生了恋情。

collins.def: When you are alone, you are not with any other people.

example.ex: There is nothing so fearful as to be alone in a combat situation...
example.tran: 没有比孤身奋战更可怕的了。

example.ex: He was all alone in the middle of the hall.
example.tran: 他独自一人在大厅中间。

collins.tran: 单独的（无其他人在场的）
collins.def: If one person is alone with another person, or if two or more people are alone, they are together, without anyone else present.

example.ex: I couldn't imagine why he would want to be alone with me...
example.tran: 我想象不出为什么他会想和我独处。

example.ex: My brother and I were alone with Vincent.
example.tran: 我和弟弟与文森特单独呆着。

collins.tran: 孤苦伶仃的;无依无靠的；孤单的
collins.def: If you say that you are alone or feel alone, you mean that nobody who is with you, or nobody at all, cares about you.

example.ex: Never in her life had she felt so alone, so abandoned...
example.tran: 她一生中从来没有感到如此孤单，如此无助。

example.ex: He found himself alone in a hostile world.
example.tran: 他感到自己处在一个充满敌意的环境中，孤立无援。

collins.def: You say that one person or thing alone does something when you are emphasizing that only one person or thing is involved.

example.ex: You alone should determine what is right for you...
example.tran: 只有你自己才能决定什么适合你。

example.ex: They were convicted on forensic evidence alone.
example.tran: 仅凭着法医证据，他们就被判有罪。

collins.tran: 单单（强调部分或整体的数量）
collins.def: If you say that one person or thing alone is responsible for part of an amount, you are emphasizing the size of that part and the size of the total amount.

example.ex: The BBC alone is sending 300 technicians, directors and commentators...
example.tran: 单单英国广播公司就派出技术人员、导演、解说员等一行300人。

example.ex: Megastars like Jack Nicholson, who made $500 million from Batman alone, are unlikely to be affected.
example.tran: 像杰克·尼科尔森这样的巨星，单从《蝙蝠侠》一部片子中就赚了5亿美元，是不太可能受影响的。

collins.def: If someone is alone in doing something, they are the only person doing it, and so are different from other people.

example.ex: Newcastle is far from alone. Colleges around the country have developed programmes of student support...
example.tran: 远不止是纽卡斯尔，全国的许多大学都推出了助学项目。

example.ex: Am I alone in thinking that this scandal should finish his career?
example.tran: 只有我认为这件丑闻会断送他的事业吗？

collins.def: When someone does something alone, they do it without help from other people.

example.ex: Bringing up a child alone should give you a sense of achievement...
example.tran: 自己一个人带大孩子会给你一种成就感。
