example.ex: He was working alone and did not have an accomplice.
example.tran: 他在单干，没有同伙。

collins.def: If you go it alone, you do something without any help from other people.

example.ex: I missed the stimulation of working with others when I tried to go it alone.
example.tran: 当我试图单干时，我很怀念与他人一起工作的那股兴奋劲。

collins.def: If you transfer something or someone from one place to another, or they transfer from one place to another, they go from the first place to the second.

example.ex: Remove the wafers with a spoon and transfer them to a plate...
example.tran: 用勺子抄起薄饼，把它们转盛到盘子里。

example.ex: He was transferred from Weston Hospital to Frenchay…
example.tran: 他从韦斯顿医院转院到了法兰查。

collins.def: If something is transferred, or transfers ,from one person or group of people to another, the second person or group gets it instead of the first.

example.ex: I realized she'd transferred all her love from me to you...
example.tran: 我意识到她已把所有的爱从我身上转移到了你身上。

example.ex: The chances of the disease being transferred to humans is extremely remote…
example.tran: 该疾病传播到人类身上的几率微乎其微。

collins.def: Technology transfer is the process or act by which a country or organization which has developed new technology enables another country or organization to use the technology.

example.ex: The Philippines needs capital and technology transfer...
example.tran: 菲律宾需要资本与技术转让。

example.ex: There will be a transfer of technology from this country to Mongolia.
example.tran: 这个国家将会向蒙古国进行技术转让。

collins.def: In professional sports, if a player transfers or is transferred from one club to another, they leave one club and begin playing for another.

example.ex: ...Nick Barmby who transferred from Spurs to Middlesbrough...
example.tran: 从热刺队转会到米德尔斯伯勒队的尼克·巴尔姆比

example.ex: He was transferred from Crystal Palace to Arsenal for £2.5 million.
example.tran: 他以 250 万英镑的身价从水晶宫队转入阿森纳队。

collins.def: If you are transferred, or if you transfer ,to a different job or place, you move to a different job or start working in a different place.

example.ex: I was transferred to the book department...
example.tran: 我被调到图书部。

example.ex: I suspect that she is going to be transferred...
example.tran: 我猜想她要被调走了。

collins.def: When information is transferred onto a different medium, it is copied from one medium to another.

example.ex: Such information is easily transferred onto microfilm.
example.tran: 这种信息很容易转存到缩微胶卷上。

example.ex: ...systems to create film-quality computer effects and then transfer them to film.
example.tran: 创造胶片级电脑画质并将之转录到胶片的系统

collins.def: When property or land is transferred, it stops being owned by one person or institution and becomes owned by another.

example.ex: He has already transferred ownership of most of the works to a British foundation...
example.tran: 他已把大部分作品的所有权转让给一家英国基金会。

example.ex: Certain kinds of property are transferred automatically at death.
example.tran: 死亡时某些财产会自动转让。

collins.def: If you transfer or are transferred when you are on a journey, you change from one vehicle to another.

example.ex: He likes to transfer from the bus to the Blue Line at 103rd Street in Watts...
example.tran: 他喜欢在华兹区第 103 大街下公交车转乘地铁蓝线。

example.ex: 1,654 passengers were transferred at sea to a Norwegian cruise ship.
example.tran: 1,654 名乘客在海上转搭了一艘挪威游轮。

collins.tran: 转印纸(纸上面印有图案，可通过加热或压力转印至其他材料上)
collins.def: Transfers are pieces of paper with a design on one side. The design can be transferred by heat or pressure onto material, paper, or china for decoration.

example.ex: ...gold letter transfers.
example.tran: 金字转印纸

collins.def: A transfer is a ticket that you get when you leave a bus or train that allows you to go on a different bus or train without paying again.
An airport is a place where aircraft land and take off, which has buildings and facilities for passengers.

example.ex: ...Heathrow Airport, the busiest international airport in the world.
example.tran: 希思罗机场，世界上最繁忙的国际机场

collins.def: Commitment is a strong belief in an idea or system.

example.ex: ...commitment to the ideals of Bolshevism.
example.tran: 对布尔什维克主义理想的信奉

collins.def: A commitment is something which regularly takes up some of your time because of an agreement you have made or because of responsibilities that you have.

example.ex: I've got a lot of commitments...
example.tran: 我承担了很多责任。

example.ex: Work commitments forced her to uproot herself and her son from Reykjavik.
example.tran: 她的工作迫使她和儿子从雷克雅未克搬走。

collins.def: If you make a commitment to do something, you promise that you will do it.

example.ex: We made a commitment to keep working together...
example.tran: 我们承诺继续合作。

example.ex: They made a commitment to peace.
example.tran: 他们承诺要维护和平。

collins.def: Commitment is the process of officially sending someone to a prison or to hospital.

collins.tran: 大小;(尤指庞大的)规模,范围,程度
collins.def: If you refer to the scale of something, you are referring to its size or extent, especially when it is very big.

example.ex: However, he underestimates the scale of the problem...
example.tran: 然而，他低估了问题的严重性。

example.ex: You may feel dwarfed by the sheer scale of the place...
example.tran: 看到此处气势如此恢宏，你可能会觉得自己很渺小。

collins.def: A scale is a set of levels or numbers which are used in a particular system of measuring things or are used when comparing things.

example.ex: ...an earthquake measuring five-point-five on the Richter scale...
example.tran: 里氏 5.5 级地震

example.ex: The patient rates the therapies on a scale of zero to ten...
example.tran: 患者按十分制给这些治疗方法打分。

collins.tran: (根据年龄、工种等核定的工资或费用)级别,标准
collins.def: A pay scale or scale of fees is a list that shows how much someone should be paid, depending, for example, on their age or what work they do.

example.ex: ...those on the high end of the pay scale...
example.tran: 工资级别最高的人

example.ex: A Registered Osteopath will be pleased to tell you his scale of fees before you decide on a consultation.
example.tran: 在病人决定是否就诊之前，注册整骨医师会很乐意告知其收费标准。

collins.tran: (地图、图纸、模型的)比例，比例尺
collins.def: The scale of a map, plan, or model is the relationship between the size of something in the map, plan, or model and its size in the real world.

example.ex: The map, on a scale of 1:10,000, shows over 5,000 individual paths.
example.tran: 该地图以 1:10,000 的比例尺显示了 5,000 多条不同道路。

collins.tran: (模型或复制品)按比例缩小的
collins.def: A scale model or scale replica of a building or object is a model of it which is smaller than the real thing but has all the same parts and features.

example.ex: Franklin made his mother an intricately detailed scale model of the house.
example.tran: 富兰克林为他的母亲制作了一个复杂精细的房屋模型。

collins.def: In music, a scale is a fixed sequence of musical notes, each one higher than the next, which begins at a particular note.

example.ex: ...the scale of C major.
example.tran: C 大调音阶

collins.def: The scales of a fish or reptile are the small, flat pieces of hard skin that cover its body.
Scales are a piece of equipment used for weighing things, for example for weighing amounts of food that you need in order to make a particular meal.

example.ex: ...a pair of kitchen scales.
example.tran: 一台厨房秤

example.ex: ...bathroom scales...
example.tran: 浴室体重秤

collins.def: If you scale something such as a mountain or a wall, you climb up it or over it.

example.ex: In 1981, five members of a climbing party died while scaling Mount Hood.
example.tran: 1981 年，一支登山队的5名队员在攀登胡德峰时遇难。

example.ex: The men scaled a wall and climbed down scaffolding on the other side.
example.tran: 那些男人攀上一堵墙然后顺着另一侧的脚手架爬了下去。

collins.def: If something is out of scale with the things near it, it is too big or too small in relation to them.

example.ex: The tower was surmounted by an enormous statue, utterly out of scale with the building.
example.tran: 那座塔的顶部矗立着一尊巨型雕像，与整个建筑完全不成比例。

collins.def: If the different parts of a map, drawing, or model are to scale, they are the right size in relation to each other.

example.ex: ...a miniature garden, with little pagodas and bridges all to scale.
example.tran: 内有全部按比例建造的小塔和小桥的微缩花园

collins.def: Abuse of someone is cruel and violent treatment of them.

example.ex: ...investigation of alleged child abuse.
example.tran: 对涉嫌虐童案的调查

example.ex: ...victims of sexual and physical abuse.
example.tran: 遭受性虐待及肉体摧残的受害者

collins.def: Abuse is extremely rude and insulting things that people say when they are angry.

example.ex: I was left shouting abuse as the car sped off...
example.tran: 汽车飞驰而去，留下我在那里大声咒骂。

example.ex: Raft repeatedly hurled verbal abuse at his co-star.
example.tran: 拉夫特不断地破口大骂和他联合主演的演员。

collins.def: Abuse of something is the use of it in a wrong way or for a bad purpose.

example.ex: What went on here was an abuse of power.
example.tran: 这里所发生的事是一种滥用职权的行为。

example.ex: ...drug and alcohol abuse.
example.tran: 嗜毒和酗酒

collins.def: If someone is abused, they are treated cruelly and violently.

example.ex: Janet had been abused by her father since she was eleven.
example.tran: 珍妮特从11岁起就遭受父亲虐待。

example.ex: ...parents who feel they cannot cope or might abuse their children.
example.tran: 认为自己应付不来或可能会虐待孩子的父母

collins.def: You can say that someone is abused if extremely rude and insulting things are said to them.

example.ex: He alleged that he was verbally abused by other soldiers.
example.tran: 他宣称自己遭到其他士兵的辱骂。

collins.def: If you abuse something, you use it in a wrong way or for a bad purpose.

example.ex: He showed how the rich and powerful can abuse their position.
example.tran: 他让我们看到有钱有势的人是如何滥用其地位的。

collins.def: If someone is willing to do something, they are fairly happy about doing it and will do it if they are asked or required to do it.

example.ex: The military now say they're willing to hold talks with the political parties...
example.tran: 军方现在说，他们愿意与政党进行谈判。

example.ex: There are, of course, questions which she will not be willing to answer.
example.tran: 当然，有些问题是她不愿回答的。

collins.tran: 自愿的;愿意的;积极肯干的
collins.def: Willing is used to describe someone who does something fairly enthusiastically and because they want to do it rather than because they are forced to do it.

example.ex: Have the party on a Saturday, when you can get your partner and other willing adults to help...
example.tran: 把聚会安排在周六，这样你就可以找自己的搭档和其他愿意帮把手的成年人来帮忙了。

example.ex: Although he had had no formal engineering training he was a natural and willing pupil.
example.tran: 虽然他没有接受过正规工科训练，但却是个天生好学的学生。

collins.tran: 国王的;女王的;王室的;皇室的
collins.def: Royal is used to indicate that something is connected with a king, queen, or emperor, or their family. A royal person is a king, queen, or emperor, or a member of their family.

example.ex: ...an invitation to a royal garden party.
example.tran: 参加皇家游园会的邀请

example.ex: ...the Japanese royal couple, Emperor Akihito and Empress Michiko.
example.tran: 明仁天皇和美智子皇后这对日本皇室夫妇

collins.tran: （用于机构或组织名称）皇家的
collins.def: Royal is used in the names of institutions or organizations that are officially appointed or supported by a member of a royal family.

example.ex: ...the Royal Academy of Music.
example.tran: 皇家音乐学院

example.ex: ...several pilots of the Royal Navy's 846 Squadron.
example.tran: 皇家海军846中队的几个领航员

collins.def: Members of the royal family are sometimes referred to as royals .

example.ex: The royals have always been patrons of charities pulling in large donations.
example.tran: 王室成员一向热心慈善事业，捐资数目巨大。

collins.def: A channel is a television station.

example.ex: ...the only serious current affairs programme on either channel.
example.tran: 两个频道唯一的严肃时事节目

example.ex: ...the proliferating number of television channels in America.
example.tran: 美国激增的电视频道

collins.def: A channel is a band of radio waves on which radio messages can be sent and received.
If you do something through a particular channel, or particular channels, that is the system or organization that you use to achieve your aims or to communicate.

example.ex: The government will surely use the diplomatic channels available...
example.tran: 政府肯定会利用各种现有的外交渠道。

example.ex: The Americans recognise that the UN can be the channel for greater diplomatic activity...
example.tran: 美国人认识到可以通过联合国这个渠道开展更多的外交活动。

collins.tran: 将(资金或资源)专门用于
collins.def: If you channel money or resources into something, you arrange for them to be used for that thing, rather than for a wider  range of things.

example.ex: Jacques Delors wants a system set up to channel funds to the poor countries...
example.tran: 雅克·德洛尔希望建立一套体系，将资金专门用于援助贫穷的国家。

example.ex: Revenues from 'green taxes' could then be channelled back into energy efficiency.
example.tran: 从“绿色税收”得来的收入便可回过头来用于提高能效。

collins.tran: 将(精力或情感)专注于;集中
collins.def: If you channel your energies or emotions into something, you concentrate on or do that one thing, rather than a range of things.

example.ex: Stephen is channelling his energies into a novel called Blue.
example.tran: 斯蒂芬正集中精力写一部名为《蓝色》的小说。

collins.def: A channel is a passage along which water flows.

example.ex: Keep the drainage channel clear.
example.tran: 保持下水道畅通。

collins.def: A channel is a route used by boats.
The Channel or the English Channel is the narrow area of water between England and France.
When you cry, tears come from your eyes, usually because you are unhappy or hurt.

example.ex: I hung up the phone and started to cry...
example.tran: 我挂断电话，开始哭了起来。

example.ex: Please don't cry...
example.tran: 拜托不要哭。

collins.def: If you cry something, you shout it or say it loudly.

example.ex: 'Nancy Drew,' she cried, 'you're under arrest!'...
example.tran: “南茜·朱尔，”她喊道，“你被捕了！”

example.ex: I cried: 'It's wonderful news!'
example.tran: 我叫道：“真是个好消息！”

collins.def: A cry is a loud, high sound that you make when you feel a strong emotion such as fear, pain, or pleasure.

example.ex: A cry of horror broke from me...
example.tran: 我吓得大叫了一声。

example.ex: Her brother gave a cry of recognition...
example.tran: 她哥哥认了出来，惊呼了一声。

collins.def: A cry is a shouted word or phrase, usually one that is intended to attract someone's attention.

example.ex: Thousands of Ukrainians burst into cries of 'bravo' on the steps of the parliament...
example.tran: 成千上万的乌克兰人聚集在议会门前高喊“好啊”。

example.ex: Passers-by heard his cries for help.
example.tran: 路过的人听到了他求救的呼喊。

collins.def: You can refer to a public protest about something or an appeal for something as a cry of some kind.

example.ex: There have been cries of outrage about this expenditure...
example.tran: 这项开支遭到了一些人愤怒的指责。

example.ex: Many other countries have turned a deaf ear to their cries for help.
example.tran: 很多其他国家对他们的求助置若罔闻。

collins.tran: (鸟的)鸣叫，啼叫;(动物的)嗥叫，吠
collins.def: A bird's or animal's cry is the loud, high sound that it makes.

example.ex: ...the cry of a seagull.
example.tran: 海鸥的鸣叫

collins.def: Something that is a far cry from something else is very different from it.

example.ex: Their lives are a far cry from his own poor childhood.
example.tran: 他们的生活与他那贫苦的童年生活相比大相径庭。

collins.def: When someone is in full cry, they are expressing their views very strongly or are very active.

example.ex: The main opposition party is already in full cry over this mishandling of security.
example.tran: 主要反对党已经对这起安全事故的错误处理进行了猛烈抨击。

collins.tran: 天啊，哎呀，岂有此理(用来表示恼怒或不耐烦，或加强提问或请求的语气)
collins.def: You use the expression for crying out loud in order to show that you are annoyed or impatient, or to add force to a question or request.

example.ex: I mean, what's he ever done in his life, for crying out loud?
example.tran: 我的意思是，天啊，他一生中到底做过什么呀？

means: 为祭祀杀死的动物（或人）

collins.def: A victim is someone who has been hurt or killed.

example.ex: Not all the victims survived...
example.tran: 并非所有受害者都得以幸存。

example.ex: Statistically our chances of being the victims of violent crime are remote.
example.tran: 从统计数据来看，我们成为暴力犯罪受害者的可能性微乎其微。

collins.tran: （他人行为、信仰或恶劣环境的）牺牲品，受害者
collins.def: A victim is someone who has suffered as a result of someone else's  actions or beliefs, or as a result of unpleasant circumstances.

example.ex: He was a victim of racial prejudice...
example.tran: 他是种族歧视的受害者。

example.ex: He described himself and Altman as victims rather than participants in the scandal...
example.tran: 他把他自己和奥尔特曼描绘成这一丑闻的受害者而不是参与者。

collins.tran: 成为…的牺牲品（或受害者)
collins.def: If you fall victim to something or someone, you suffer as a result of them, or you are killed by them.

example.ex: In the early 1960s, Blyton fell victim to Alzheimer's disease...
example.tran: 在19世纪60年代早期，布莱顿患上了老年痴呆症。

example.ex: At Brussels airport he fell victim to pickpockets who pinched his wallet.
example.tran: 在布鲁塞尔机场，他被扒手盯上，钱包被偷走了。

collins.def: You use otherwise after stating a situation or fact, in order to say what the result or consequence would be if this situation or fact was not the case.

example.ex: Make a note of the questions you want to ask. You will invariably forget some of them otherwise...
example.tran: 把想提的问题记下来，否则总是会漏掉其中的一些。

example.ex: I'm lucky that I'm interested in school work, otherwise I'd go mad.
example.tran: 我很庆幸自己对学习怀有兴趣，不然我会疯掉的。

collins.def: You use otherwise before stating the general condition or quality of something, when you are also mentioning an exception to this general condition or quality.

example.ex: The decorations for the games have lent a splash of colour to an otherwise drab city.
example.tran: 为运动会所作的装扮给原本毫无生气的城市增添了一抹亮色。

example.ex: ...a blue and gold caravan, slightly travel-stained but otherwise in good condition.
example.tran: 除了在旅途中弄得有点脏以外，性能良好的蓝金色旅行拖车

collins.def: You use otherwise to refer in a general way to actions or situations that are very different from, or the opposite to, your main statement.

example.ex: Take approximately 60mg up to four times a day, unless advised otherwise by a doctor...
example.tran: 每次服用大约60毫克，每天最多4次，或遵医嘱。

example.ex: There is no way anything would ever happen between us, and believe me I've tried to convince myself otherwise...
example.tran: 相信我，我已经努力试图说服自己我们之间存有希望，但我们真的是绝对不可能的。

collins.tran: 以其他方式；用别的方法
collins.def: You use otherwise to indicate that other ways of doing something are possible in addition to the way already mentioned.

example.ex: The studio could punish its players by keeping them out of work, and otherwise controlling their lives.
example.tran: 电影公司能通过让艺人坐冷板凳来惩罚他们，并采用其他方式控制他们的生活。

collins.tran: 及其他；或相反；或其反面
collins.def: You use or otherwise or and otherwise to mention something that is not the thing just referred to or is the opposite of that thing.

example.ex: It was for the police to assess the validity or otherwise of the evidence...
example.tran: 应该由警方来判定证据有效与否。

example.ex: He didn't want company, talkative or otherwise...
example.tran: 他不想跟人搭伴，不管这个伴儿是否健谈。

collins.def: If you have an image of something or someone, you have a picture or idea of them in your mind.

example.ex: The image of art theft as a gentleman's crime is outdated...
example.tran: 把盗窃艺术品看作是一种绅士犯罪的观念已经过时了。

example.ex: The words 'Cote d'Azur' conjure up images of sunny days in Mediterranean cafes.
example.tran: Cote d'Azur (蓝色海岸)这个词让人联想到地中海咖啡馆阳光明媚的日子。

collins.tran: (个人、团队或组织的)形象,声誉
collins.def: The image of a person, group, or organization is the way that they appear to other people.

example.ex: The Prime Minister knows that his personal image is his greatest political asset...
example.tran: 总理知道他的个人形象是他最重要的政治资产。

example.ex: He has cultivated the image of an elder statesman...
example.tran: 他已树立起一个政界元老的形象。

collins.def: An image is a picture of someone or something.

example.ex: ...photographic images of young children...
example.tran: 小孩子们的照片

example.ex: A computer in the machine creates an image on the screen.
example.tran: 机器上的计算机在屏幕上产生了影像。

collins.tran: 诗意的描绘;生动的描绘
collins.def: An image is a poetic description of something.

example.ex: The natural images in the poem are meant to be suggestive of realities beyond themselves.
example.tran: 诗中描绘的自然景象意在让人联想到景象以外的现实。

collins.def: If you are the image of someone else, you look very much like them.

example.ex: Marianne's son was the image of his father.
example.tran: 玛丽安娜的儿子长得酷似他父亲。

collins.tran: 自然的;正常的;合乎常情的
collins.def: If you say that it is natural for someone to act in a particular way or for something to happen in that way, you mean that it is reasonable in the circumstances.

example.ex: It is only natural for youngsters to crave the excitement of driving a fast car...
example.tran: 年轻人追求开快车的刺激是太正常不过的事情。

example.ex: It is only natural that he should resent you...
example.tran: 他怨恨你是很自然的事。

collins.tran: (行为)出于本性的，生来就有的
collins.def: Natural behaviour is shared by all people or all animals of a particular type and has not been learned.

example.ex: ...the insect's natural instinct to feed...
example.tran: 昆虫进食的本能

example.ex: Anger is the natural reaction we experience when we feel threatened or frustrated.
example.tran: 我们觉得受到威胁或遭受挫折时本能地会感到气愤。

collins.def: Someone with a natural ability or skill was born with that ability and did not have to learn it.

example.ex: She has a natural ability to understand the motives of others...
example.tran: 她有一种洞察他人动机的天赋。

example.ex: He had a natural flair for business.
example.tran: 他有做生意的天分。

collins.def: If you say that someone is a natural, you mean that they do something very well and very easily.

example.ex: He's a natural with any kind of engine...
example.tran: 他天生就会摆弄各种发动机。

example.ex: She proved to be a natural on camera.
example.tran: 事实证明她在镜头前很有表演天赋。

collins.tran: 轻松自如的;不局促的;不做作的
collins.def: If someone's behaviour is natural, they appear to be relaxed and are not trying to hide anything.

example.ex: Bethan's sister was as friendly and natural as the rest of the family...
example.tran: 贝唐的妹妹和她家的其他人一样友好、随意。

example.ex: Hannah's natural manner reassured her, and she relaxed.
example.tran: 汉娜轻松自然的举止消除了她的疑虑，于是她放松了下来。

collins.tran: 非人为的;自然的;天然的
collins.def: Natural things exist or occur in nature and are not made or caused by people.

example.ex: It has called the typhoon the worst natural disaster in South Korea in many years...
example.tran: 它称这次台风为韩国多年来最严重的自然灾害。

example.ex: The gigantic natural harbour of Poole is a haven for boats.
example.tran: 巨型天然港普尔港是船只的避风港。

collins.tran: (父母或子女)亲生的，有血缘关系的
collins.def: Someone's natural parent is their biological father or mother, as opposed to an adult who is looking after them or has adopted them. Someone's natural child is their biological son or daughter, as opposed to a child they are looking after or have adopted.

example.ex: She has been reunited with her natural mother...
example.tran: 她和亲生母亲团聚了。

example.ex: His commitments to the stepchildren will not reduce his obligation to his natural children.
example.tran: 他对继子女的关爱和投入不会减少他对亲生孩子的责任。

collins.tran: (音符)本位音的，标有还原号的
collins.def: In music, a natural note is the ordinary note, not its sharp or flat form.

example.ex: ...B natural. B
example.tran: 本位音

collins.def: If someone dies of or from natural causes, they die because they are ill or old rather than because of an accident or violence.

example.ex: According to the Home Office, your brother died of natural causes...
example.tran: 根据内政部的调查，你哥哥属正常死亡。

example.ex: A prisoner collapsed and died yesterday, apparently from natural causes.
example.tran: 一名囚犯昨天突然倒下死了，看上去像是正常死亡。

collins.def: If you feel a sense of relief, you feel happy because something unpleasant has not happened or is no longer happening.

example.ex: I breathed a sigh of relief...
example.tran: 我如释重负地松了口气。

example.ex: The news will come as a great relief to the French authorities...
example.tran: 这个消息会让法国当局大大松一口气。

collins.tran: (疼痛或苦痛的)解除，免除，减轻，缓解
collins.def: If something provides relief from pain or distress, it stops the pain or distress.

example.ex: This brought considerable relief from the pain.
example.tran: 这相当大地缓解了疼痛。

example.ex: ...a self-help programme which can give lasting relief from the torment of hay fever.
example.tran: 可以持续缓解枯草热病痛的自助项目

collins.def: Relief is money, food, or clothing that is provided for people who are very poor, or who have been affected by war or a natural disaster.

example.ex: Relief agencies are stepping up efforts to provide food, shelter and agricultural equipment.
example.tran: 救济机构正加大力度提供食物、住所和农用器械。

example.ex: ...famine relief.
example.tran: 饥荒救济

collins.def: A relief worker is someone who does your work when you go home, or who is employed to do it instead of you when you are sick.

example.ex: No relief drivers were available.
example.tran: 找不到代班司机。

collins.def: A relief is a sculpture that is carved out of a flat vertical surface.
Tonight is used to refer to the evening of today or the night that follows today.

example.ex: I'm at home tonight...
example.tran: 我今晚在家。

example.ex: Tonight, I think he proved to everybody what a great player he was...
example.tran: 我认为今晚他向所有人证明了他是个多么出色的选手。

collins.def: If you explain something, you give details about it or describe it so that it can be understood.

example.ex: Not every judge, however, has the ability to explain the law in simple terms...
example.tran: 然而，不是每个法官都能用简单的语言来解释法律。

example.ex: Don't sign anything until your solicitor has explained the contract to you...
example.tran: 在律师向你解释清楚合同之前，不要签署任何东西。

collins.def: If you explain something that has happened, you give people reasons for it, especially in an attempt to justify it.

example.ex: 'Let me explain, sir.' — 'Don't tell me about it. I don't want to know.'...
example.tran: “您听我解释，先生。”——“别跟我说，我不想知道。”

example.ex: Before she ran away, she left a note explaining her actions...
example.tran: 逃跑前，她留下一张便条解释原委。

means: （公共汽车和列车等的）常规路线

collins.def: A route is a way from one place to another.

example.ex: ...the most direct route to the town centre...
example.tran: 到市中心最直接的路线

example.ex: All escape routes were blocked by armed police...
example.tran: 所有逃跑的路都被武警封锁了。

collins.def: A bus, air, or shipping route is the way between two places along which buses, planes, or ships travel regularly.

example.ex: ...the main shipping routes to Japan.
example.tran: 去往日本的主要航运线路

collins.def: In the United States, Route is used in front of a number in the names of main roads between major cities.

example.ex: ...the Broadway-Webster exit on Route 580.
example.tran: 580号公路的百老汇－韦伯斯特出口

collins.def: Your route is the series of visits you make to different people or places, as part of your job.

example.ex: He began cracking open big blue tins of butter cookies and feeding the dogs on his route...
example.tran: 他打开装黄油饼干的蓝色大罐子，开始沿路给狗喂食。

example.ex: They would go out on his route and check him.
example.tran: 他们会到他那里走访一下，看看他的情况。

collins.def: You can refer to a way of achieving something as a route .

example.ex: Researchers are trying to get at the same information through an indirect route...
example.tran: 研究人员正试图通过间接的途径获得相同的信息。

example.ex: Buying the best is as sure a route to success in investment as in any other field.
example.tran: 和其他领域一样，投资领域获得成功的途径也是买进最佳商品。

collins.tran: 按特定路线发送(车辆、货物或乘客)
collins.def: If vehicles, goods, or passengers are routed in a particular direction, they are made to travel in that direction.

example.ex: Double-stack trains are taking a lot of freight that used to be routed via trucks...
example.tran: 以往由卡车运送的很多货物现在都改用双层列车运送了。

example.ex: Approaching cars will be routed into two lanes.
example.tran: 驶来的车辆会分流到两条车道。

collins.tran: 以…线路发送(电话或其他电子信号)
collins.def: If telephone calls or other electronic signals are routed in a particular way, the signals are sent through a particular series of connections.

example.ex: ...plans to route every emergency call in Britain through just three telephone exchanges.
example.tran: 只通过3次电话转接来传送英国境内所有紧急呼叫的计划

collins.tran: 在途中，沿途(在不规范英语中有时拼作on route)
collins.def: En route to a place means on the way to that place. En route is sometimes spelled on toute in non-standard English.

example.ex: They have arrived in London en route to the United States...
example.tran: 他们已经到达伦敦，正在前往美国的途中。

example.ex: One of the bags was lost en route.
example.tran: 其中一个包在途中丢失了。

collins.tran: （新闻用语）作为（较长进程）的一部分，在…之前
collins.def: Journalists sometimes use en route when they are mentioning an event that happened as part of a longer process or before another event.

example.ex: The German set three tournament records and equalled two others en route to grabbing golf's richest prize.
example.tran: 那个德国人在获得高尔夫球赛最高奖金的同时刷新了3项锦标赛纪录，平了其他两项纪录。

collins.tran: 把事情进行到底;贯彻始终
collins.def: If you go the route, you do something fully or continue with a task until you have completely finished.

example.ex: They have gone the route, in many cases, of just big — big bowls, big statues, big masks, big everything.
example.tran: 在很多情况下，他们从头到尾都只做大的东西——大碗，大雕像，大面具，所有东西都是大的。

collins.def: The sea is the salty water that covers about three-quarters of the earth's surface.

example.ex: Most of the kids have never seen the sea...
example.tran: 多数孩子从未见过海。

example.ex: All transport operations, whether by sea, rail or road, are closely monitored at all times.
example.tran: 所有的交通活动，无论是通过海路、铁路还是公路，都时刻受到密切监视。

collins.def: You use seas when you are describing the sea at a particular time or in a particular area.

example.ex: He drowned after 30 minutes in the rough seas...
example.tran: 他在汹涌的海浪中挣扎了 30 分钟后淹死了。

example.ex: The seas are warm further south.
example.tran: 海水的温度越往南越高。

collins.def: A sea is a large area of salty water that is part of an ocean or is surrounded by land.

example.ex: ...the North Sea.
example.tran: 北海

example.ex: ...the huge inland sea of Turkana.
example.tran: 图尔卡纳浩瀚的内陆海

collins.def: A sea of people or things is a very large number of them together.

example.ex: Down below them was the sea of upturned faces...
example.tran: 他们下面是无数张仰望的脸。

example.ex: His eyes ran over the sea of bottles and glasses on the table.
example.tran: 他扫了一眼满桌的瓶子和玻璃杯。

collins.def: You can say that someone is all at sea when they are in a state of confusion or uncertainty.

example.ex: If you had never seen a telly ad, you would be all at sea with popular culture.
example.tran: 如果你从没看过电视广告，你就搞不懂什么是大众文化。

collins.def: At sea means on or under the sea, far away from land.

example.ex: The boats remain at sea for an average of ten days at a time...
example.tran: 这些船只每次在海上平均航行 10 天。

example.ex: His body was found at sea in waters off the Canary Islands.
example.tran: 他的尸体在离加那利群岛不远的海上被发现。

collins.def: If you go or look out to sea, you go or look across the sea.

example.ex: ...fishermen who go to sea for two weeks at a time...
example.tran: 每次出海两周的渔夫们

example.ex: He pointed out to sea.
example.tran: 他指向大海。

collins.def: A corner is a point or an area where two or more edges, sides, or surfaces of something join.

example.ex: He saw the corner of a magazine sticking out from under the blanket...
example.tran: 他看见杂志的一角从毯子下露了出来。

example.ex: Write 'By Airmail' in the top left hand corner.
example.tran: 在左上角写上“航空邮递”。

collins.def: The corner of a room, box, or similar space is the area inside it where its edges or walls meet.

example.ex: ...a card table in the corner of the living room...
example.tran: 起居室角落里的牌桌

example.ex: The ball hurtled into the far corner of the net...
example.tran: 球飞进了球网的远角。

collins.def: The corner of your mouth or eye is the side of it.

example.ex: She flicked a crumb off the corner of her mouth...
example.tran: 她擦掉嘴角的面包屑。

example.ex: Out of the corner of her eye she saw that a car had stopped.
example.tran: 她用眼角的余光瞥见一辆车停了下来。

collins.def: The corner of a street is the place where one of its sides ends as it joins another street.

example.ex: She would spend the day hanging round street corners...
example.tran: 她会整天在街角附近游荡。

example.ex: We can't have police officers on every corner...
example.tran: 不可能每个街角都派驻警察。

collins.def: A corner is a bend in a road.

example.ex: ...a sharp corner...
example.tran: 急转弯

example.ex: The road is a succession of hairpin bends, hills, and blind corners.
example.tran: 这条路上急转弯、坡道和死拐角一个接一个。

collins.tran: (遥远或难以到达的)角落，偏远处
collins.def: If you talk about the corners of the world, a country, or some other place, you are referring to places that are far away or difficult to get to.

example.ex: Buyers came from all corners of the world...
example.tran: 买主来自世界各地。

example.ex: The group has been living in a remote corner of the Cambodian jungle.
example.tran: 该部落一直居住在柬埔寨的丛林深处。

collins.def: In football, hockey, and some other sports, a corner is a free shot or kick taken from the corner of the pitch.

collins.tran: 将…逼入死角；使走投无路
collins.def: If you corner a person or animal, you force them into a place they cannot escape from.

example.ex: A police motorcycle chased his car twelve miles, and cornered him near Rome...
example.tran: 一辆摩托警车跟在他的车后追了12英里，最后在快到罗马时将他截住。

example.ex: He was still sitting huddled like a cornered animal.
example.tran: 他还像一头困兽一样蜷缩着坐在那儿。

collins.def: If you corner someone, you force them to speak to you when they have been trying to avoid you.

example.ex: Golan managed to corner the young producer-director for an interview.
example.tran: 戈兰设法截住了那位兼任制片人的年轻导演，对其进行了采访。

collins.def: If a company or place corners an area of trade, they gain control over it so that no one else can have any success in that area.

example.ex: This restaurant has cornered the Madrid market for specialist paellas...
example.tran: 这家餐馆垄断了马德里的特色肉菜饭市场。

example.ex: Zurich's affluence came initially from cornering a sizeable chunk of the 14th Century silk trade.
example.tran: 苏黎世的富足最初来自于14世纪对丝绸贸易的高度垄断。

collins.def: If a car, or the person driving it, corners in a particular way, the car goes round bends in roads in this way.

example.ex: Peter drove jerkily, cornering too fast and fumbling the gears.
example.tran: 彼得转弯太急，换挡不利索，车开得一颠一颠的。

collins.def: If you say that something is around the corner, you mean that it will happen very soon. In British English, you can also say that something is round the corner .

example.ex: The Chancellor of the Exchequer says that economic recovery is just around the corner.
example.tran: 财政大臣说经济即将复苏。

collins.def: If you say that something is around the corner, you mean that it is very near. In British English, you can also say that something is round the corner .

example.ex: My new place is just around the corner.
example.tran: 我的新家就在附近。

collins.def: If you cut corners, you do something quickly by doing it in a less thorough way than you should.

example.ex: Take your time, don't cut corners and follow instructions to the letter.
example.tran: 慢慢来，不要图省事，要严格按照说明去做。

collins.tran: 天涯海角;世界各个角落
collins.def: You can use expressions such as the four corners of the world to refer to places that are a long way from each other.

example.ex: They've combed the four corners of the world for the best accessories...
example.tran: 为了找到最好的配件，他们寻遍了每个地方。

example.ex: Young people came from the four corners of the nation.
example.tran: 全国各地的年轻人都来到这里。

collins.def: If you are in a corner or in a tight corner, you are in a situation which is difficult to deal with and get out of.

example.ex: The government is in a corner on interest rates...
example.tran: 政府在利率问题上陷入了困境。

example.ex: He appears to have backed himself into a tight corner.
example.tran: 他似乎已把自己逼入了困境。

collins.def: If there is a choice of things, there are several of them and you can choose the one you want.

example.ex: It's available in a choice of colours...
example.tran: 有多种颜色可供选择。

example.ex: At lunchtime, there's a choice between the buffet or the set menu...
example.tran: 午餐可以吃自助餐，也可以选套餐。

collins.def: Your choice is someone or something that you choose from a range of things.

example.ex: Although he was only grumbling, his choice of words made Rodney angry.
example.tran: 尽管他只是在咕哝，可是他的措词却让罗德妮恼火。

collins.def: Choice means of very high quality.

example.ex: ...Fortnum and Mason's choicest chocolates.
example.tran: 福楠—梅森百货商店的上等巧克力

collins.def: If you have no choice but to do  something or have little choice but to do it, you cannot avoid doing it.

example.ex: They had little choice but to agree to what he suggested.
example.tran: 他们别无选择，只好接受他的提议。

collins.def: The thing or person of your choice is the one that you choose.

example.ex: ...tickets to see the football team of your choice...
example.tran: 观看自己喜欢的足球队比赛的门票

example.ex: In many societies children still marry someone of their parents' choice.
example.tran: 在许多社会，子女结婚仍然只能听从父母之命。

collins.def: The item of choice is the one that most people prefer.

example.ex: The drug is set to become the treatment of choice for asthma worldwide...
example.tran: 这种药将会成为全世界治疗哮喘的首选。

example.ex: The drink of choice seems to be vodka.
example.tran: 最受欢迎的酒似乎是伏特加。

collins.def: You can use suppose or supposing before mentioning a possible situation or action. You usually then go on to consider the effects that this situation or action might have.

example.ex: Suppose someone gave you an egg and asked you to describe exactly what was inside...
example.tran: 假设有人给了你一枚鸡蛋并要你准确描述鸡蛋里面有什么。

example.ex: Supposing he's right and I do die tomorrow? Maybe I should take out an extra insurance policy.
example.tran: 假设他是对的，我确实明天就会死，那该怎么办？也许我应该再买一份保险。

collins.def: If you suppose that something is true, you believe that it is probably true, because of other things that you know.

example.ex: The policy is perfectly clear and I see no reason to suppose that it isn't working...
example.tran: 这项政策非常清楚明了，我没有理由认为它不会奏效。

example.ex: I knew very well that the problem was more complex than he supposed...
example.tran: 我很清楚那个问题比他料想的要更复杂。

collins.def: You can say 'I suppose' when you want to express slight uncertainty.

example.ex: I get a bit uptight these days. Hormones, I suppose...
example.tran: 这些天我有点焦躁。我看是荷尔蒙在作怪。

example.ex: I suppose I'd better do some homework...
example.tran: 我看我最好做做功课。

collins.tran: (表示不耐烦或有些生气)我想，我看
collins.def: You can say 'I suppose' or 'I don't suppose' before describing someone's probable thoughts or attitude, when you are impatient or slightly angry with them.

example.ex: I suppose you think you're funny...
example.tran: 我想你认为自己很好笑。

example.ex: I don't suppose it occurred to you to notify the police.
example.tran: 我看你没想过要去通知警察。

collins.def: You can say 'I don't suppose' as a way of introducing a polite request.

example.ex: I don't suppose you could tell me where James Street is could you?
example.tran: 你能否告诉我詹姆斯街在哪儿？

collins.tran: (用于询问意见)你认为，你觉得
collins.def: You can use 'do you suppose' to introduce a question when you want someone to give their opinion about something, although you know that they are unlikely to have any more knowledge or information about it than you.

example.ex: Do you suppose he was telling the truth?...
example.tran: 你认为他说的是实话吗？

example.ex: What do you suppose they want with her?...
example.tran: 你认为他们想从她那里得到什么？

collins.def: You can use 'do you suppose' as a polite way of suggesting or requesting that someone does something.

example.ex: Do you suppose we could get together for a little chat sometime soon?
example.tran: 我们最近能抽空聚在一起聊上几句吗？

collins.def: When you dance, you move your body and feet in a way which follows a rhythm, usually in time to music.

example.ex: Polly had never learned to dance...
example.tran: 波莉从未学过跳舞。

example.ex: I like to dance to the music on the radio.
example.tran: 我喜欢随着广播里的音乐起舞。

collins.def: A dance is a particular series of graceful movements of your body and feet, which you usually do in time to music.

example.ex: Sometimes the people doing this dance hold brightly colored scarves...
example.tran: 有时跳这种舞的人会手拿色彩鲜艳的丝巾。

example.ex: She describes the tango as a very sexy dance.
example.tran: 她把探戈描述为一种非常性感的舞蹈。

collins.def: When you dance with someone, the two of you take part in a dance together, as partners. You can also say that two people dance.

example.ex: It's a terrible thing when nobody wants to dance with you...
example.tran: 没有人想和你跳舞是一件很糟糕的事情。

example.ex: Shall we dance?...
example.tran: 我们跳支舞好吗？

collins.def: A dance is a social event where people dance with each other.

example.ex: She often went to parties and dances at Littlecote...
example.tran: 她经常去利特尔科特参加聚会和舞会。

example.ex: ..the school dance.
example.tran: 学校舞会

collins.def: Dance is the activity of performing dances, as a public entertainment or an art form.

example.ex: She loves dance, drama and music...
example.tran: 她喜欢舞蹈、戏剧和音乐。

example.ex: No show prior to 'On The Town' had told so much of its story through dance...
example.tran: 《锦城春色》出现以前，还没有哪部电影的故事情节如此多地通过舞蹈展开。

collins.def: If you dance a particular kind of dance, you do it or perform it.

example.ex: Then we put the music on, and we all danced the Charleston...
example.tran: 接着我们打开音乐，一起跳起查尔斯顿舞来。

example.ex: They will dance two performances of Ashton's 'Romeo and Juliet'.
example.tran: 他们将表演阿什顿的《罗密欧与朱丽叶》中的两场舞。

collins.def: If you dance somewhere, you move there lightly and quickly, usually because you are happy or excited.

example.ex: He danced off down the road...
example.tran: 他蹦蹦跳跳地沿着马路走了。

example.ex: Amy went and kissed him, and then danced out of his reach.
example.tran: 埃米过去吻了他一下，接着就从他怀里跳开了。

collins.def: If you say that something dances, you mean that it moves about, or seems to move about, lightly and quickly.

example.ex: Light danced on the surface of the water...
example.tran: 灯光在水面上摇曳。

example.ex: She tried to read it more slowly and carefully, but the words danced and dissolved before her eyes.
example.tran: 她试图读得更慢更仔细一些，但那些字却在她眼前跳动而变得模糊起来。

collins.tran: 使…疲于奔波;使…白忙一场;给…造成许多麻烦
collins.def: If someone leads you a merry dance, they make you do things over a long period of time which cause you problems and do not benefit you in any way.
If something is obvious, it is easy to see or understand.

example.ex: ...the need to rectify what is an obvious injustice...
example.tran: 矫正明显不公的需要

example.ex: Determining how the Democratic challenger would conduct his presidency isn't quite so obvious.
example.tran: 这位民主党挑战者将如何履行总统职务还不能明确判断。

collins.tran: 不必要的;无新意的；缺乏想象力的
collins.def: If you describe something that someone says as obvious, you are being critical of it because you think it is unnecessary or shows lack of imagination.

example.ex: There are some very obvious phrases that we all know or certainly should know better than to use.
example.tran: 我们都知道或是肯定应该知道有些说法已毫无新意，最好避免使用。

collins.def: If you save someone or something, you help them to avoid harm or to escape from a dangerous or unpleasant situation.

example.ex: ...a final attempt to save 40,000 jobs in Britain's troubled aero industry...
example.tran: 为保住陷入困境中的英国航空业的 4 万份工作所作的最后一次努力

example.ex: One man was still missing last night after the Belgian trawler Lucky capsized off the Dutch coast. Three other men were saved...
example.tran: 昨晚比利时拖网渔船“幸运号”在荷兰海岸附近沉没后，仍有1人失踪，其余 3 人被救起。

collins.def: If you save, you gradually collect money by spending less than you get, usually in order to buy something that you want.

example.ex: The majority of people intend to save, but find that by the end of the month there is nothing left...
example.tran: 大多数人都打算存钱，但月末时就会发现已一文不剩。

example.ex: Tim and Barbara are now saving for a house in the suburbs...
example.tran: 蒂姆和芭芭拉正在攒钱，准备在郊区买一栋房子。

collins.def: If you save something such as time or money, you prevent the loss or waste of it.

example.ex: It saves time in the kitchen to have things you use a lot within reach...
example.tran: 把厨房里常用的东西放在触手可及的地方能节省做饭时间。

example.ex: More cash will be saved by shutting studios and selling outside-broadcast vehicles...
example.tran: 通过关闭演播室和出售实况转播车将节省更多资金。

collins.def: If you save something, you keep it because it will be needed later.

example.ex: Drain the beans thoroughly and save the stock for soup...
example.tran: 将豆角彻底控干，并把滤出的豆汁留下做汤。

example.ex: Scraps of material were saved, cut up and pieced together for quilts.
example.tran: 边角碎料都保留下来，剪好后拼在一起做成被子。

collins.def: If someone or something saves you from an unpleasant action or experience, they change the situation so that you do not have to do it or experience it.

example.ex: The scanner will save risk and pain for patients...
example.tran: 扫描仪将使病人免遭风险和痛苦。

example.ex: She was hoping that something might save her from having to make a decision...
example.tran: 她希望有什么能使自己不必作决定。

collins.def: If you save data in a computer, you give the computer an instruction to store the data on a tape or disk.

example.ex: Try to get into the habit of saving your work regularly...
example.tran: 要努力养成经常将工作内容存盘的习惯。

example.ex: Import your scanned images from the scanner and save as a JPG file.
example.tran: 从扫描仪导入扫描后的图像，并保存为 JPG 文件。

collins.def: If a goalkeeper saves, or saves a shot, they succeed in preventing the ball from going into the goal.

example.ex: He saved one shot when the ball hit him on the head.
example.tran: 球砸中他的脑袋，从而让他化解了一次射门。

collins.def: You can use save to introduce the only things, people, or ideas that your main statement does not apply to.

example.ex: There is almost no water at all in Mochudi save that brought up from bore holes.
example.tran: 除了从钻孔中抽上来的水外，莫丘迪几乎滴水无存。

collins.def: Your skin is the natural covering of your body.

example.ex: His skin is clear and smooth...
example.tran: 他的皮肤光洁平滑。

example.ex: There are three major types of skin cancer...
example.tran: 主要有 3 种皮肤癌。

collins.def: An animal skin is skin which has been removed from a dead animal. Skins are used to make things such as coats and rugs.

example.ex: That was real crocodile skin.
example.tran: 那是真正的鳄鱼皮。

example.ex: ...a leopard skin coat.
example.tran: 豹皮大衣

collins.def: The skin of a fruit or vegetable is its outer layer or covering.

example.ex: The outer skin of the orange is called the 'zest'.
example.tran: 橙子皮称为 zest。

example.ex: ...banana skins.
example.tran: 香蕉皮

collins.def: If a skin forms on the surface of a liquid, a thin, fairly solid layer forms on it.

example.ex: Stir the custard occasionally to prevent a skin forming.
example.tran: 要不时地搅拌牛奶蛋糊，防止其表面结皮。

collins.tran: 剥去(死动物)的皮;将…去皮
collins.def: If you skin a dead animal, you remove its skin.

example.ex: ...with the expertise of a chef skinning a rabbit.
example.tran: 具有大厨剥兔子皮的娴熟技艺

collins.tran: 吓得魂飞魄散;大吃一惊
collins.def: If something makes you jump out of your skin, it surprises or shocks you very much.

example.ex: He nearly jumped out of his skin when he saw two rats.
example.tran: 他看到两只老鼠，几乎给吓丢了魂。

collins.tran: 保命;保全自己;设法摆脱困境
collins.def: If you try to save your own skin or save your skin, you try to save yourself from something dangerous or unpleasant.

example.ex: He'd have done anything to anybody to save his own skin.
example.tran: 为了活命，他可以不顾任何人，不择手段。

collins.tran: 侥幸;好不容易才;险些儿没有
collins.def: If you do something by the skin of your teeth, you just manage to do it.

example.ex: He won, but only by the skin of his teeth.
example.tran: 他赢了，但是赢得十分勉强。

collins.def: If you say that someone has a thick skin, you mean that they are able to listen to criticism about themselves without becoming offended.

example.ex: You need a thick skin to be a headmaster.
example.tran: 要当校长，你就得脸皮厚一些。

means: （不寄宿的）仆人，白天做家务的女佣

collins.def: If something happens daily, it happens every day.

example.ex: Cathay Pacific flies daily non-stop to Hong Kong from Heathrow...
example.tran: 国泰航空公司每天都有从希思罗机场直飞香港的航班。

example.ex: The Visitor Centre is open daily 8.30 a.m. – 4.30 p.m.
example.tran: 游客中心每日上午 8:30 至下午 4:30 开放。

collins.def: Daily quantities or rates relate to a period of one day.

example.ex: ...a diet containing adequate daily amounts of fresh fruit...
example.tran: 包含了足量一天所需新鲜水果的饮食

example.ex: Our average daily turnover is about £300.
example.tran: 我们的平均日营业额约为 300 英镑。

collins.def: A daily is a newspaper that is published every day of the week except Sunday.

example.ex: Copies of the local daily had been scattered on a table.
example.tran: 几份当地的日报散放在桌子上。

collins.def: Your daily life is the things that you do every day as part of your normal life.

example.ex: ...the failure of the government to improve most people's daily lives.
example.tran: 政府没能改善大多数人的日常生活

means: 需要专门知识（或技术）的
以专家身份研究（或检查），像专家那样研究（或检查）
做专家工作，担任专家，成为高手（或能手）

collins.def: An expert is a person who is very skilled at doing something or who knows a lot about a particular subject.

example.ex: Our team of experts will be on hand to offer help and advice between 12 noon and 7pm daily.
example.tran: 每天中午12点到下午7点，我们的专家小组将随时提供帮助和建议。

example.ex: ...a yoga expert.
example.tran: 瑜伽大师

collins.tran: 技术娴熟的;熟练的;在行的
collins.def: Someone who is expert at doing something is very skilled at it.

example.ex: The Japanese are expert at lowering manufacturing costs...
example.tran: 日本人在降低制造成本方面很在行。

example.ex: There is a great deal to learn from Hal's expert approach.
example.tran: 从哈尔熟练的方法中可以学到很多。

collins.def: If you say that someone has expert hands or an expert eye, you mean that they are very skilful or experienced in using their hands or eyes for a particular purpose.

example.ex: When the horse suffered a back injury Harvey cured it with his own expert hands...
example.tran: 那匹马背部受伤后，哈维用他内行的双手把它治好了。

example.ex: The symptoms are very mild and it takes an expert eye to see them.
example.tran: 症状非常轻，要靠专家的眼睛才能看出来。

collins.def: Expert advice or help is given by someone who has studied a subject thoroughly or who is very skilled at a particular job.

example.ex: You'll also get expert advice on keeping your hair in good condition...
example.tran: 你还会获得有关如何保持良好发质的专家建议。

example.ex: We'll need an expert opinion...
example.tran: 我们需要听听专家的意见。

collins.def: A deputy is the second most important person in an organization such as a business or government department. Someone's deputy often acts on their behalf when they are not there.

example.ex: ...Jack Lang, France's minister for culture, and his deputy, Catherine Tasca.
example.tran: 法国文化部长杰克·朗和他的副部长凯瑟琳·塔斯卡

example.ex: ...the academy's deputy director, Vladimir Kudryatsev.
example.tran: 学院副院长弗拉基米尔·库德里亚夫采夫

collins.def: In some parliaments or law-making bodies, the elected members are called deputies .

example.ex: The president appealed to deputies to approve the plan quickly.
example.tran: 总统呼吁议员尽快通过这一方案。

collins.def: A prison is a building where criminals are kept as punishment or where people accused of a crime are kept before their trial.

example.ex: The prison's inmates are being kept in their cells...
example.tran: 这个监狱的犯人被关在他们的囚室里。

example.ex: He was sentenced to life in prison...
example.tran: 他被判处终身监禁。

collins.tran: 南方的;在南部的;来自南部的
collins.def: Southern means in or from the south of a region, state, or country.

example.ex: The Everglades National Park stretches across the southern tip of Florida.
example.tran: 大沼泽地国家公园位于佛罗里达州的最南端。

example.ex: ...a place where you can sample southern cuisine.
example.tran: 可以品尝到南方美食的地方

collins.def: If people gather somewhere or if someone gathers people somewhere, they come together in a group.

example.ex: In the evenings, we gathered around the fireplace and talked...
example.tran: 晚上，我们聚在火炉边聊天。

example.ex: The man signalled for me to gather the children together.
example.tran: 那人示意让我将孩子们召集起来。

collins.def: If you gather things, you collect them together so that you can use them.

example.ex: I suggest we gather enough firewood to last the night...
example.tran: 我建议大家捡足够多的木柴来撑过这一晚。

example.ex: She stood up and started gathering her things together.
example.tran: 她起身开始收拾自己的物品。

collins.tran: （尤指经过一段时间的辛苦工作）收集，搜集（情报、证据等）
collins.def: If you gather information or evidence, you collect it, especially over a period of time and after a lot of hard work.

example.ex: ...a private detective using a hidden tape recorder to gather information...
example.tran: 用暗藏的录音机搜集证据的私家侦探

example.ex: This would help the prosecutor gather evidence against him which could be used in court.
example.tran: 这将有利于控方律师搜集对他不利的证据以在法庭上指控他。

collins.tran: 逐渐增加（速度、动力、力量等）
collins.def: If something gathers speed, momentum, or force, it gradually becomes faster or more powerful.

example.ex: Demands for his dismissal have gathered momentum in recent weeks...
example.tran: 最近几周，要求将他解职的呼声越来越高。

example.ex: The raft gathered speed as the current dragged it toward the falls.
example.tran: 水流将木筏拽向瀑布，木筏的速度越来越快。

collins.tran: 集中（精力、思想等）；鼓起（勇气）；振作（精神）
collins.def: When you gather something such as your strength, courage, or thoughts, you make an effort to prepare yourself to do something.

example.ex: You must gather your strength for the journey.
example.tran: 你必须为这次行程打起精神来。

collins.tran: （用于引出已发现的信息，尤其是间接获得的信息）据我所知，据我了解
collins.def: You use gather in expressions such as 'I gather' and 'as far as I can gather' to introduce information that you have found out, especially when you have found it out in an indirect way.

example.ex: I gather his report is highly critical of the trial judge...
example.tran: 据我所知，他在报道中毫不留情地批评了初审法官。

example.ex: 'He speaks English,' she said to Graham. 'I gathered that.'...
example.tran: “他会说英语，”她对格雷厄姆说，“我料到了。”

collins.def: If you gather fabric or cloth, you make a row of very small folds in it by sewing a thread through it and then pulling the thread tight.

example.ex: Gather the skirt at the waist.
example.tran: 在裙子的腰部打褶。

collins.def: The residents of a house or area are the people who live there.

example.ex: The Archbishop called upon the government to build more low cost homes for local residents...
example.tran: 大主教呼吁政府为当地居民建造更多低成本的住宅。

example.ex: More than 10 percent of Munich residents live below the poverty line.
example.tran: 超过10％的慕尼黑居民生活在贫困线以下。

collins.def: Someone who is resident in a country or a town lives there.

example.ex: He moved to Belgium in 1990 to live with his son, who had been resident in Brussels since 1967.
example.tran: 他于1990年搬到比利时和儿子一起住。他儿子自1967年起就住在布鲁塞尔。

collins.def: A resident doctor or teacher lives in the place where he or she works.

example.ex: The morning after your arrival, you meet with the resident physician for a private consultation.
example.tran: 到达后的第二天早上，你就去见住院医生，进行私人问诊。

collins.def: A resident or a resident doctor is a doctor who is receiving a period of specialized training in a hospital after leaving university.
If an institution has a resident specialist, that specialist works for the institution.

example.ex: Having begun her career at Gray's Pottery, she stayed there as resident designer for seven years.
example.tran: 在格雷陶器场开始自己的职业生涯后，她在那里做了7年的特聘设计师。

collins.tran: 携带武器（通常为枪支）的
collins.def: Someone who is armed is carrying a weapon, usually a gun.

example.ex: City police said the man was armed with a revolver.
example.tran: 市警方称那名男子携带了一支左轮手枪。

example.ex: ...a barbed-wire fence patrolled by armed guards...
example.tran: 有武装警卫巡逻的带刺铁丝网围栏

collins.def: An armed attack or conflict involves people fighting with guns or carrying weapons.

example.ex: I call on everyone to renounce the use of violence and armed struggle...
example.tran: 我呼吁每个人都放弃使用暴力和武装斗争。

example.ex: They had been found guilty of armed robbery.
example.tran: 他们被判犯有持械抢劫罪。

means: 以电话传送（消息），给（某人）打电话

collins.def: The telephone is the electrical system of communication that you use to talk directly to someone else in a different place. You use the telephone by dialling a number on a piece of equipment and speaking into it.

example.ex: They usually exchanged messages by telephone...
example.tran: 他们一般通过电话互通消息。

example.ex: I dread to think what our telephone bill is going to be...
example.tran: 我不敢想象我们的电话费会有多少。

collins.def: A telephone is the piece of equipment that you use when you talk to someone by telephone.

example.ex: He got up and answered the telephone...
example.tran: 他起身去接了电话。

example.ex: The telephone in Rizzoli's room rang.
example.tran: 里佐利房间的电话响了。

collins.def: If you telephone someone, you dial their telephone number and speak to them by telephone.

example.ex: I felt so badly I had to telephone Owen to say I was sorry...
example.tran: 我心里实在难受，觉得必须给欧文打电话道个歉。

example.ex: They usually telephone first to see if she is at home.
example.tran: 他们通常先打个电话，看看她在不在家。

collins.def: If you are on the telephone, you are speaking to someone by telephone.

example.ex: Linda remained on the telephone to the police for three hours...
example.tran: 琳达在电话里和警察谈了 3 个小时。

example.ex: We talked on the telephone for quite a while.
example.tran: 我们在电话里谈了好一阵子。

collins.def: To be on the telephone means to have a telephone in your house or office which is connected to the rest of the telephone system.

example.ex: She wasn't on the telephone...
example.tran: 她没装电话。

example.ex: Are you on the telephone at home?
example.tran: 你家有没有电话？

means: 做（动物或植物组织）切片
把（精神病患者）正式送入精神病院

collins.def: A section of something is one of the parts into which it is divided or from which it is formed.

example.ex: He said it was wrong to single out any section of society for Aids testing...
example.tran: 他说把社会中的任何一部分人抽选出来做艾滋病检查都是不对的。

example.ex: They moulded a complete new bow section for the boat.
example.tran: 他们为这艘船铸造了一个完整的新船头。

collins.tran: 把…切成片;把…分成段(或组等)
collins.def: If something is sectioned, it is divided into sections.

example.ex: It holds vegetables in place while they are being peeled or sectioned.
example.tran: 将蔬菜削皮或切片时用它来固定。

collins.def: A section of an official document such as a report, law, or constitution is one of the parts into which it is divided.

example.ex: ...section 14 of the Trade Descriptions Act 1968.
example.tran: 1968 年《商品说明法》第 14 条

example.ex: ...the all-important section on the powers of the federal government.
example.tran: 规定联邦政府权力的至关重要的条款

collins.def: A section is a diagram of something such as a building or a part of the body. It shows how the object would appear to you if it were cut from top to bottom and looked at from the side.

example.ex: For some buildings a vertical section is more informative than a plan.
example.tran: 有些建筑的立面图能比平面图提供更多的信息。

collins.def: A table is a piece of furniture with a flat top that you put things on or sit at.

example.ex: She was sitting at the kitchen table eating a currant bun...
example.tran: 她正坐在餐桌旁，吃着葡萄干圆面包。

example.ex: I placed his drink on the small table at his elbow.
example.tran: 我把他的饮料放在他肘边的小桌子上。

collins.def: If you ask for a table in a restaurant, you want to have a meal there.

example.ex: I'd like a table for two at about 8:30, please...
example.tran: 我想订一张 8:30 左右的双人桌。

example.ex: I booked a table at the Savoy Grill...
example.tran: 我在萨沃伊烧烤店订了张桌子。

collins.def: If someone tables a proposal, they say formally that they want it to be discussed at a meeting.

example.ex: They've tabled a motion criticising the Government for doing nothing about the problem.
example.tran: 他们提交了一项动议，批评政府在该问题上无所作为。

collins.def: If someone tables a proposal or plan which has been put forward, they decide to discuss it or deal with it at a later date, rather than straight away.

example.ex: We will table that for later.
example.tran: 那个问题我们留到以后再讨论吧。

collins.def: A table is a written set of facts and figures arranged in columns and rows.

example.ex: Consult the table on page 104...
example.tran: 参阅 104 页的表格。

example.ex: Other research supports the figures in Table 3.3.
example.tran: 其他研究也可证实表 3.3 中的数据。

collins.def: A table is a list of the multiplications of numbers between one and twelve. Children often have to learn tables at school.

example.ex: He didn't know his eleven-times table...
example.tran: 他不知道11的乘法口诀。

example.ex: I attempted to learn my tables.
example.tran: 我努力背诵乘法表。

collins.def: If you put something on the table, you present it at a meeting for it to be discussed.

example.ex: This is one of the best packages we've put on the table in years...
example.tran: 这是我们几年来提交的最好的几套方案之一。

example.ex: It means that all the options are at least on the table.
example.tran: 这就意味着，至少所有的选择都已经摆到了桌面上。

collins.def: If you turn the tables on someone, you change the situation completely, so that instead of them causing problems for you, you are causing problems for them.

example.ex: The only question is whether the President can use his extraordinary political skills to turn the tables on his opponents.
example.tran: 唯一的问题是，总统能否运用他杰出的政治手腕化被动为主动，击败对手。

collins.tran: 简单地;只不过;仅仅;纯粹
collins.def: You use simply to emphasize that something consists of only one thing, happens for only one reason, or is done in only one way.

example.ex: The table is simply a chipboard circle on a base...
example.tran: 这张桌子只不过是在底座上安了一块圆形刨花板。

example.ex: Most of the damage that's occurred was simply because of fallen trees...
example.tran: 目前大部分损坏都是因为倒下的树木造成的。

collins.def: You use simply to emphasize what you are saying.

example.ex: This sort of increase simply cannot be justified...
example.tran: 这种增长根本就不合理。

example.ex: So many of these questions simply don't have answers...
example.tran: 这些问题有很多根本就没有答案。

means: （迫切的）要求（帮助、同情等）恳求

collins.def: If you appeal to someone to do something, you make a serious and urgent request to them.

example.ex: The Prime Minister appealed to young people to use their vote...
example.tran: 首相呼吁年轻人行使他们的投票权。

example.ex: He will appeal to the state for an extension of unemployment benefits...
example.tran: 他将呼吁国家延长领取失业救济金的时限。

collins.def: An appeal is a serious and urgent request.

example.ex: He has a message from King Fahd, believed to be an appeal for Arab unity...
example.tran: 法赫德国王传话给他，据信内容是呼吁整个阿拉伯世界团结起来。

example.ex: Romania's government issued a last-minute appeal to him to call off his trip.
example.tran: 罗马尼亚政府最后一刻恳请他取消行程。

collins.def: An appeal is an attempt to raise money for a charity or for a good cause.

example.ex: ...an appeal to save a library containing priceless manuscripts...
example.tran: 为挽救存有珍贵手稿的图书馆的一次募捐

example.ex: This is not another appeal for famine relief.
example.tran: 这不是为赈济饥荒的又一次募捐。

collins.def: If you appeal to someone in authority against a decision, you formally ask them to change it. In British English, you appeal against something. In American English, you appeal something.

example.ex: He said they would appeal against the decision...
example.tran: 他说他们将对该决议提出申诉。

example.ex: We intend to appeal the verdict...
example.tran: 我们打算对裁决提出上诉。

collins.def: An appeal is a formal request for a decision to be changed.

example.ex: Heath's appeal against the sentence was later successful...
example.tran: 希思对判决不服提出上诉，后来胜诉了。

example.ex: The jury agreed with her, but she lost the case on appeal.
example.tran: 陪审团同意她的说法，但在上诉时她败诉了。

collins.def: If something appeals to you, you find it attractive or interesting.

example.ex: On the other hand, the idea appealed to him...
example.tran: 从另一方面来说，这个想法又使他很感兴趣。

example.ex: The range has long appealed to all tastes.
example.tran: 该系列长期受到各类人士的欢迎。

collins.def: The appeal of something is a quality that it has which people find attractive or interesting.

example.ex: Its new title was meant to give the party greater public appeal...
example.tran: 新的党名意在使该党对公众具有更强的吸引力。

example.ex: Johnson's appeal is to people in all walks of life.
example.tran: 约翰逊广受各界人士欢迎。

collins.tran: (英国)托利党党员的，保守党党员的
collins.def: In Britain, a Tory politician or voter is a member of or votes for the Conservative Party.

example.ex: ...the former Tory Party chairman, Chris Patten.
example.tran: 托利党前主席彭定康

example.ex: …the constituency with the largest Tory majority in the country.
example.tran: 该国托利党多数票的票数居首的选区

collins.def: An airline is a company which provides regular services carrying people or goods in aeroplanes.

example.ex: ...the Dutch national airline KLM.
example.tran: 荷兰国家航空公司KLM

collins.def: Contact involves meeting or communicating with someone, especially regularly.

example.ex: Opposition leaders are denying any contact with the government in Kabul...
example.tran: 反对派领袖否认与喀布尔政府有任何联系。

example.ex: He forbade contacts between directors and executives outside his presence.
example.tran: 他禁止董事与管理层绕开他私下进行任何联系。

collins.def: If you are in contact with someone, you regularly meet them or communicate with them.

example.ex: He was in direct contact with the kidnappers...
example.tran: 他与绑架者有直接联系。

example.ex: We do keep in contact.
example.tran: 我们确实保持着联系。

collins.def: If you contact someone, you telephone them, write to them, or go to see them in order to tell or ask them something.

example.ex: Contact the Tourist Information Bureau for further details...
example.tran: 详情请洽旅游信息处。

example.ex: When she first contacted me Frances was upset.
example.tran: 弗朗西丝第一次与我联系时很心烦意乱。

collins.tran: (信息、电话号码等)供联系的，供联络的
collins.def: Your contact details or number are information such as a telephone number where you can be contacted.

example.ex: You must leave your full name and contact details when you phone.
example.tran: 打电话时须留下全名与联络信息。

collins.def: If you come into contact with someone or something, you meet that person or thing in the course of your work or other activities.

example.ex: Doctors I came into contact with voiced their concern...
example.tran: 我接触到的医生都表示了他们的担心。

example.ex: The college has brought me into contact with western ideas.
example.tran: 上大学使我接触了西方的思想。

collins.def: If you make contact with someone, you find out where they are and talk or write to them.

example.ex: Then, after she had become famous, he tried to make contact with her.
example.tran: 后来，她出名之后，他曾试图与她联系。

collins.tran: 与…失去联系;与…断了联系
collins.def: If you lose contact with someone who you have been friendly with, you no longer see them, speak to them, or write to them.

example.ex: Though they all live nearby, I lost contact with them really quickly...
example.tran: 虽然他们都住在附近，但我很快与他们失去了联系。

example.ex: Mother and son lost contact when Nicholas was in his early twenties.
example.tran: 尼古拉斯20岁出头的时候母子就失去了联系。

collins.def: When people or things are in contact, they are touching each other.

example.ex: They compared how these organisms behaved when left in contact with different materials...
example.tran: 他们比较了与不同材料接触时这些生物体的反应。

example.ex: The cry occurs when air is brought into contact with the baby's larynx...
example.tran: 婴儿的喉咙接触到空气时，就会哭出来。

collins.def: Radio contact is communication by means of radio.

example.ex: He failed to make radio contact.
example.tran: 他未能进行无线电联络。

example.ex: ...a technical problem reported by the pilot moments before he lost contact with the control tower.
example.tran: 飞行员与控制塔失去联络前不久报告的技术故障

collins.def: A contact is someone you know in an organization or profession who helps you or gives you information.

example.ex: Their contact in the United States Embassy was called Phil.
example.tran: 他们在美国大使馆的熟人叫菲尔。

collins.def: Something or someone that is fair is reasonable, right, and just.

example.ex: It didn't seem fair to leave out her father...
example.tran: 将她父亲排除在外似乎不公平。

example.ex: Do you feel they're paying their fair share?...
example.tran: 你觉得他们付了该付的那份钱吗？

collins.tran: (数量、程度、尺寸或距离)相当多(或大、长)的
collins.def: A fair amount, degree, size, or distance is quite a large amount, degree, size, or distance.

example.ex: My neighbours across the street travel a fair amount...
example.tran: 我街对面的邻居游历甚广。

example.ex: My mother's brother lives a fair distance away so we don't see him and his family very often.
example.tran: 我舅舅住在相当远的地方，所以我们很少见到他和他的家人。

collins.def: A fair guess or idea about something is one that is likely to be correct.

example.ex: It's a fair guess to say that the damage will be extensive...
example.tran: 说损失会很严重想必猜得不错。

example.ex: I have a fair idea of how difficult things can be.
example.tran: 我大致了解情况会有多困难。

collins.tran: (水平、质量)一般的，尚可的，不错的
collins.def: If you describe someone or something as fair, you mean that they are average in standard or quality, neither very good nor very bad.

example.ex: Reimar had a fair command of English.
example.tran: 赖马尔的英语说得还不错。

collins.def: Someone who is fair, or who has fair hair, has light-coloured hair.

example.ex: Both children were very like Robina, but were much fairer than she was.
example.tran: 两个孩子都很像罗比娜，但头发颜色比她浅得多。

collins.def: Fair skin is very pale and usually burns easily.

example.ex: It's important to protect my fair skin from the sun.
example.tran: 保护我白皙的皮肤不受日晒是很紧要的。

collins.def: When the weather is fair, it is quite sunny and not raining.

example.ex: Weather conditions were fair.
example.tran: 天气晴好。

collins.def: A county, state, or country fair is an event where there are, for example, displays of goods and animals, and amusements, games, and competitions.
A fair is the same as a funfair .

collins.tran: (尤指某类商品的)展销会,交易会
collins.def: A fair is an event at which people display and sell goods, especially goods of a particular type.

example.ex: ...an antiques fair.
example.tran: 古玩交易会

collins.def: You use fair in expressions such as to be fair and let's be fair when you want to add a favourable comment about someone or something that you have just mentioned and to correct a false impression that you might have given.

example.ex: To be fair, the team is young and not yet settled...
example.tran: 说句公道话，这个队还年轻，还没有成型。

example.ex: And, let us be fair, some MPs do work hard.
example.tran: 而且，说句公道话，有些下院议员工作还是很卖力的。

collins.tran: (说法、决定或行为)有些道理，说得过去
collins.def: You use fair enough when you want to say that a statement, decision, or action seems reasonable to a certain extent, but that perhaps there is more to be said or done.

example.ex: If you don't like it, fair enough, but that's hardly a justification to attack the whole thing...
example.tran: 如果你不喜欢，这说得过去，但把它批得一无是处就没什么道理了。

example.ex: Fair enough, you didn't have a perfectly happy childhood: but your childhood is over now.
example.tran: 没错，你的童年生活不那么幸福：但它已经过去了。

collins.def: You say fair enough to acknowledge what someone has just said and to indicate that you understand it.

example.ex: 'I'm taking it to our local police station.' — 'Oh right, fair enough.'...
example.tran: “我要告到本地警察局。”——“呵，对，干得有理。”

example.ex: 'The message was addressed to me and I don't see why I should show it to you.' — 'Fair enough.'
example.tran: “这条信息是写给我的，我不明白为什么要给你看。”——“说得在理。”

collins.tran: 做事光明正大;行事正直
collins.def: If you say that someone plays fair, you mean that they behave or act in a reasonable and honest way.

example.ex: The government is not playing fair, one union official told me.
example.tran: 政府在搞鬼，一位工会官员告诉我。

collins.def: You use fair in expressions such as It would be fair to say in order to introduce a statement which you believe to be true and reasonable.

example.ex: It would be fair to say he had one or two unhappy moments out there...
example.tran: 可以这么说，他在那里有过一两次不愉快。

example.ex: I think it's fair to say that it didn't sound quite right.
example.tran: 我想应该说那听起来可不太对。

collins.def: If you say that someone won a competition fair and square, you mean that they won honestly and without cheating.

example.ex: There are no excuses. We were beaten fair and square.
example.tran: 没话说，我们是给正大光明地打败的。

collins.def: Someone's environment is all the circumstances, people, things, and events around them that influence their life.

example.ex: Pupils in our schools are taught in a safe, secure environment...
example.tran: 我们学校的学生在安全无虑的环境中接受教育。

example.ex: The moral characters of men are formed not by heredity but by environment...
example.tran: 人的道德品质不是遗传的，而是由环境塑造而成。

collins.tran: 生存环境；特定自然环境
collins.def: Your environment consists of the particular natural surroundings in which you live or exist, considered in relation to their physical characteristics or weather conditions.

example.ex: If our environment cools, then messages from the skin alert the body's thermostat.
example.tran: 如果外在环境变冷，体表会将这一信息传递给身体的体温调节中枢。

example.ex: ...the maintenance of a safe environment for marine mammals.
example.tran: 为海洋哺乳动物维持安全的生存环境

collins.def: The environment is the natural world of land, sea, air, plants, and animals.

example.ex: ...Conservative spokesman on the environment.
example.tran: 保守党有关自然环境问题的发言人

example.ex: ...persuading people to respect the environment.
example.tran: 劝告人们保护生态环境

collins.def: A village consists of a group of houses, together with other buildings such as a church and a school, in a country area.

example.ex: He lives quietly in the country in a village near Lahti.
example.tran: 他在拉赫蒂附近的一个乡村里过着平静的日子。

example.ex: ...the village school.
example.tran: 乡村学校

collins.def: The winner of a prize, race, or competition is the person, animal, or thing that wins it.

example.ex: She will present the trophies to the award winners...
example.tran: 她将给获奖者颁奖。

example.ex: The winner was a horse called Last Town.
example.tran: 获胜的是一匹叫做“最后的城镇”的马。

collins.tran: 成功者;可能成功的人(或事物)
collins.def: If you say that something or someone is a winner, you mean that they are popular and successful, or that they are likely to be popular and successful.

example.ex: They think the appeal is a winner...
example.tran: 他们认为上诉能够成功。

example.ex: Selling was my game and I intended to be a winner.
example.tran: 销售是我的老本行，我想做一个成功的销售者。

collins.def: The winners in a particular situation are the people who have benefited from it and are in a better position than they previously were because of it.

example.ex: There are clear winners when a dam is built. Farmers get irrigation water, businesses get electricity...
example.tran: 大坝若是建成，会有一些明显的受益者：农民将得到灌溉用水，企业将得到电力。

example.ex: The real winners of the election, he said, were the Hungarian people.
example.tran: 他说，选举的真正赢家是匈牙利人民。

collins.tran: (足球、网球等比赛中的)制胜球
collins.def: In games such as football or tennis, the winner is the goal or shot that wins a particular match or point.

example.ex: Gough scored the winner in extra time.
example.tran: 高夫在加时赛中攻入制胜球。

collins.def: Meanwhile means while a particular thing is happening.

example.ex: Brush the aubergines with oil, add salt and pepper, and bake till soft. Meanwhile, heat the remaining oil in a heavy pan...
example.tran: 把油涂在茄子上，加盐和胡椒烤至松软。与此同时，在厚锅中加热剩余的油。

example.ex: Kate turned to beckon Peter across from the car, but Bill waved him back, meanwhile pushing Kate inside.
example.tran: 凯特转身示意汽车对面的彼得过来，可是比尔却挥手示意他回去，同时把凯特推进车内。

collins.def: Meanwhile means in the period of time between two events.

example.ex: You needn't worry; I'll be ready to greet them. Meanwhile I'm off to discuss the Fowler's party with Felix.
example.tran: 你不必担心，我会招呼他们的。其间，我还要去跟费利克斯商量一下福勒举办聚会的事。

collins.tran: (引出某一情形的另一方面，尤指与前面提到的完全相反时)与之相比，然而
collins.def: You use meanwhile to introduce a different aspect of a particular situation, especially one that is completely opposite to the one previously mentioned.

example.ex: He had always found his wife's mother a bit annoying. The mother-daughter relationship, meanwhile, was close.
example.tran: 他总是觉得丈母娘有点烦人，然而她们母女之间的关系却非常亲密。

collins.def: If you struggle to do something, you try hard to do it, even though other people or things may be making it difficult for you to succeed.

example.ex: They had to struggle against all kinds of adversity...
example.tran: 他们不得不同一切困境做斗争。

example.ex: Those who have lost their jobs struggle to pay their supermarket bills.
example.tran: 那些失业的人们想方设法以支付超市的账单。

collins.def: A struggle is a long and difficult attempt to achieve something such as freedom or political rights.

example.ex: Life became a struggle for survival.
example.tran: 生活成了一场奋力求生的斗争。

example.ex: ...a young lad's struggle to support his poverty-stricken family...
example.tran: 年轻的小伙子为了支撑他贫困的家庭所作的努力

collins.def: If you struggle when you are being held, you twist, kick, and move violently in order to get free.

example.ex: I struggled, but he was a tall man, well-built.
example.tran: 我使劲挣扎，但他又高又壮。

collins.def: If two people struggle with each other, they fight.

example.ex: She screamed at him to 'stop it' as they struggled on the ground...
example.tran: 他们在地上扭打成一团，她向他尖叫着“别打了”。

example.ex: We were struggling for the gun when it went off!...
example.tran: 我们正在争夺那把枪，这时它突然走火了！

collins.def: If you struggle to move yourself or to move a heavy object, you try to do it, but it is difficult.

example.ex: I could see the young boy struggling to free himself...
example.tran: 我看到小男孩正在奋力挣脱。

example.ex: I struggled with my bags, desperately looking for a porter.
example.tran: 我提着行李艰难地走着，迫切地寻找着搬运工。

collins.def: If you struggle somewhere, you succeed in moving there, but only with great difficulty.

example.ex: The pilot struggled out of the wreck almost uninjured...
example.tran: 飞行员艰难地从失事的飞机中爬出来，几乎没有受伤。

example.ex: Catherine struggled to her feet...
example.tran: 凯瑟琳艰难地站起来。

collins.def: If a person or organization is struggling, they are likely to fail in what they are doing, even though they might be trying very hard.

example.ex: The company is struggling to find buyers for its new product...
example.tran: 该公司正竭力为其新产品寻找买主。

example.ex: One in five young adults was struggling with everyday mathematics... 1/5
example.tran: 的年轻人做日常的数学计算都费劲。

collins.def: An action or activity that is a struggle is very difficult to do.

example.ex: Losing weight was a terrible struggle.
example.tran: 减肥是一件非常艰难的事。

collins.def: To introduce something means to cause it to enter a place or exist in a system for the first time.

example.ex: The Government has introduced a number of other money-saving moves...
example.tran: 政府已经采取了其他一些省钱的举措。

example.ex: I kept the birds indoors all winter and introduced them into an aviary the following June...
example.tran: 整个冬天我把鸟关在室内,然后在接下来的6月份把它们放入鸟类饲养场饲养。

collins.tran: 介绍;使了解;使初次接触
collins.def: If you introduce someone to something, you cause them to learn about it or experience it for the first time.

example.ex: He introduced us to the delights of natural food.
example.tran: 他让我们认识到食用天然食物的乐趣。

collins.def: If you introduce one person to another, or you introduce two people, you tell them each other's names, so that they can get to know each other. If you introduce yourself to someone, you tell them your name.

example.ex: Tim, may I introduce you to my uncle's secretary, Mary Waller?...
example.tran: 蒂姆,我来介绍一下，这位是我叔叔的秘书玛丽·沃勒。

example.ex: Someone introduced us and I sat next to him...
example.tran: 有人给我们作了介绍,我挨着他坐下了。

collins.tran: 为(电视或广播节目)做开场白;主持
collins.def: The person who introduces a television or radio programme speaks at the beginning of it, and often between the different items in it, in order to explain what the programme or the items are about.

example.ex: 'Health Matters' is introduced by Dick Oliver on BBC World Service.
example.tran: 英国广播公司对外广播频道的“健康动态”节目由迪克·奥利弗主持。

collins.def: An album is a record with about 25 minutes of music on each side. You can also refer to a collection of songs that is available on a record, cassette, or CD as an album .

example.ex: Chris likes music and has a large collection of albums and cassettes.
example.tran: 克里斯喜欢音乐，收集了大量的唱片和磁带。

collins.tran: （用于保存照片、邮票等的）专册，专辑簿
collins.def: An album is a book in which you keep things such as photographs or stamps that you have collected.

example.ex: Theresa showed me her photo album.
example.tran: 特雷莎给我看她的相册。

means: 用机器制造，用机器加工

collins.def: A machine is a piece of equipment which uses electricity or an engine in order to do a particular kind of work.

example.ex: I put the coin in the machine and pulled the lever...
example.tran: 我把硬币投入机器，拉动控制杆。

example.ex: The machine can be remotely operated and monitored.
example.tran: 这台机器可以远程操作和监控。

collins.tran: 用机器制造;用机器加工
collins.def: If you machine something, you make it or work on it using a machine.

example.ex: The material is machined in a factory...
example.tran: 这种材料在一家工厂里用机器加工成型。

example.ex: All parts are machined from top grade, high tensile aluminium.
example.tran: 所有零件都是用顶级高强度铝加工而成。

collins.def: You can use machine to refer to a large and well-controlled system or organization.

example.ex: ...Nazi Germany's military machine...
example.tran: 纳粹德国的军事机构

example.ex: He has put the party publicity machine behind another candidate.
example.tran: 他为另一位参选者在幕后组织政党宣传。

collins.tran: （由于工作过于劳累或乏味）机械般工作的人，做工作不动脑筋的人
collins.def: If you say that someone is a machine, you mean that they are so tired or bored that they do their work without thinking.

example.ex: I think I have got to stop or I might turn into a machine...
example.tran: 我想我得停下来了，否则我就会变成一台机器。

example.ex: He has dedicated himself to his work and become just a writing machine.
example.tran: 他忘我地投入工作，就像是一台写作机器。

collins.def: An institute is an organization set up to do a particular type of work, especially research or teaching. You can also use institute to refer to the building the organization occupies.
