example.ex: ...the National Cancer Institute.
example.tran: 国家癌症研究所

example.ex: ...an elite research institute devoted to computer software...
example.tran: 致力于计算机软件开发的精英研究机构

collins.tran: 建立(体系等);制定(规章等);开始;开创
collins.def: If you institute a system, rule, or course of action, you start it.

example.ex: We will institute a number of measures to better safeguard the public...
example.tran: 我们将实施一系列措施来更好地保护公众安全。

example.ex: Hormone replacement therapy is very important and should be instituted early.
example.tran: 激素替代治疗非常重要,应该及早开始。

collins.def: Your fingers are the four long thin parts at the end of each hand.

example.ex: She suddenly held up a small, bony finger and pointed across the room...
example.tran: 她突然伸出一根瘦小的手指，指向屋子的另一头。

example.ex: She ran her fingers through her hair...
example.tran: 她用手指捋了捋头发。

collins.def: The fingers of a glove are the parts that a person's fingers fit into.
A finger of something such as smoke or land is an amount of it that is shaped rather like a finger.

example.ex: ...a thin finger of land that separates Pakistan from the former Soviet Union...
example.tran: 分隔巴基斯坦和苏联的一块狭长地带

example.ex: Cover the base with a single layer of sponge fingers.
example.tran: 底部垫上一层海棉条。

collins.def: If you finger something, you touch or feel it with your fingers.

example.ex: He fingered the few coins in his pocket...
example.tran: 他拨弄着口袋里的几枚硬币。

example.ex: Self-consciously she fingered the emeralds at her throat.
example.tran: 她局促不安地摸抚着脖子上的绿宝石。

collins.def: If you finger a person or organization, you tell someone, usually the police, that the person or organization has done something illegal or wrong.

example.ex: Police and prosecutors manipulated the eyewitnesses so they would finger Aldo...
example.tran: 警方和检察官操纵目击证人指证奥尔多。

example.ex: People who have fingered crack houses and fingered drug dealers have been assassinated.
example.tran: 那些告发可卡因毒窟和毒品贩子的人遭到了暗杀。

collins.tran: 一指之宽(指表示容量的杯中酒的深度)
collins.def: A finger of a strong alcoholic drink is an amount of it which, when it is in a glass, is the same size as the width of a person's finger.

example.ex: I poured two final fingers of bourbon into my glass.
example.tran: 我把最后两指宽的波旁威士忌都倒进自己杯中。

collins.tran: (因自己的失败或错误而)吃苦头
collins.def: If you get your fingers burned or burn your fingers, you suffer because something you did or were involved in was a failure or a mistake.

example.ex: He has had his fingers burnt by deals that turned out badly...
example.tran: 几笔糟糕的生意让他吃了苦头。

example.ex: Mr Walesa burned his fingers by promising he would give every Pole 100m zlotys to start a business.
example.tran: 瓦文萨先生因为承诺给每个波兰人1亿兹罗提创办企业而尝到了苦果。

collins.tran: (把食指与中指交叉以)祈求好运
collins.def: If you cross your fingers, you put one finger on top of another and hope for good luck. If you say that someone is keeping their fingers crossed, you mean they are hoping for good luck.

example.ex: He crossed his fingers, asking for luck for the first time in his life...
example.tran: 他交叉手指，生平第一次祈求好运。

example.ex: I'm keeping my fingers crossed that they turn up soon.
example.tran: 我在心里祈求他们赶快露面。

collins.def: If you say that someone did not lay a finger on a particular person or thing, you are emphasizing that they did not touch or harm them at all.

example.ex: I must make it clear I never laid a finger on her.
example.tran: 我得说清楚，我可没有动过她一根毫毛。

collins.def: If you say that a person does not lift a finger or raise a finger to do something, especially to help someone, you are critical of them because they do nothing.

example.ex: She never lifted a finger around the house...
example.tran: 家里的活儿她从来一点忙都不帮。

example.ex: They will not lift a finger to help their country.
example.tran: 他们不愿为自己的国家出一点儿力。

collins.def: If you say that someone has a finger in every pie, you mean they are involved in a lot of things.

example.ex: He very much likes to have a finger in every pie...
example.tran: 他很喜欢什么事都插上一杠。

example.ex: He's a man with fingers in a lot of pies.
example.tran: 他这个人总是到处管闲事。

collins.def: If you point the finger at someone or point an accusing finger at someone, you blame them or accuse them of doing wrong.

example.ex: He said he wasn't pointing an accusing finger at anyone in the government or the army.
example.tran: 他说他并不是在指责政府或军方的任何人。

collins.tran: 将怀疑(或指责)的矛头指(向…)
collins.def: To point the finger of suspicion or blame at someone means to make people suspect them of doing wrong or blame them for doing wrong.

example.ex: Forensic evidence points the finger of suspicion firmly at him.
example.tran: 法医的证据将怀疑的矛头明确地指向了他。

collins.tran: (粗鲁地叫别人)赶紧(或努力)干起来
collins.def: If you tell someone to pull their finger out or to get their finger out, you are telling them rudely that you want them to start doing some work or making an effort.

example.ex: Isn't it about time that you pulled your finger out?
example.tran: 现在到了你该赶紧动起来的时候了吧？

collins.tran: 弄清，指出，确认(原因、问题等)
collins.def: If you put your finger on something, for example a reason or problem, you see and identify exactly what it is.

example.ex: Midge couldn't quite put her finger on the reason...
example.tran: 米吉还不能十分确定原因何在。

example.ex: He could never quite put his finger on who or what was responsible for all this.
example.tran: 他一直就搞不清楚是谁或者什么造成了这一切。

collins.def: If someone or something slips through your fingers, you just fail to catch them, get them, or keep them.

example.ex: Money has slipped through his fingers all his life...
example.tran: 他这一辈子都没能抓住金钱。

example.ex: You mustn't allow a golden opportunity to slip through your fingers or you will regret it later.
example.tran: 千万别错失良机，否则日后追悔莫及。

collins.def: An organization is an official group of people, for example a political party, a business, a charity, or a club.

example.ex: Most of these specialized schools are provided by voluntary organizations.
example.tran: 这些专业学校大多由志愿组织建立。

example.ex: ...a report by the International Labour Organisation.
example.tran: 国际劳工组织的报告

collins.def: The organization of an event or activity involves making all the necessary arrangements for it.

example.ex: ...the exceptional attention to detail that goes into the organisation of this event...
example.tran: 这次活动的组织筹备中对细节的特别关注

example.ex: Several projects have been delayed by poor organisation.
example.tran: 几个项目都因组织不力而被推迟。

collins.def: The organization of something is the way in which its different parts are arranged or relate to each other.

example.ex: I am aware that the organization of the book leaves something to be desired.
example.tran: 我知道该书的编排还有待改进。

collins.def: An agent is a person who looks after someone else's business affairs or does business on their behalf.

example.ex: You are buying direct, rather than through an agent.
example.tran: 你这是直接购买，而不是通过代理人。

example.ex: ...a written declaration by someone, authorizing another person to act as his agent.
example.tran: 一份某人授权他人为其代理人的书面申明

collins.def: An agent in the arts world is a person who gets work for an actor or musician, or who sells the work of a writer to publishers.
An agent is a person who works for a country's secret service.

example.ex: All these years he's been an agent for the East.
example.tran: 这些年来他一直是为东方国家效力的一位间谍。

collins.def: If you refer to someone or something as the agent of a particular effect, you mean that they cause this effect.

example.ex: In many societies young men regard themselves as highly active, the agents of change, shapers of the world.
example.tran: 在许多社会中，年轻人将自己看成是高度活跃的分子，是变革的推动者和世界的塑造者。

collins.def: A chemical that has a particular effect or is used for a particular purpose can be referred to as a particular kind of agent.

example.ex: ...the bleaching agent in white flour.
example.tran: 白面粉中的漂白剂

example.ex: ...fibrinogen, a blood clotting agent.
example.tran: 血纤维蛋白原，一种凝血剂

means: 喃喃地说，心不在焉地说，言不由衷地说

collins.def: Your mouth is the area of your face where your lips are or the space behind your lips where your teeth and tongue are.

example.ex: She clamped her hand against her mouth...
example.tran: 她用手捂着嘴。

example.ex: His mouth was full of peas.
example.tran: 他满嘴都是豌豆。

collins.def: You can say that someone has a particular kind of mouth to indicate that they speak in a particular kind of way or that they say particular kinds of things.

example.ex: I've always had a loud mouth, I refuse to be silenced...
example.tran: 我一贯大声说出自己的想法，不会迫于压力而一言不发。

example.ex: You've got such a crude mouth!
example.tran: 你说话真粗鲁！

collins.def: The mouth of a cave, hole, or bottle is its entrance or opening.

example.ex: By the mouth of the tunnel he bent to retie his lace.
example.tran: 到隧道出入口时，他弯腰重新系好鞋带。

collins.def: The mouth of a river is the place where it flows into the sea.

example.ex: ...the town at the mouth of the River Dart.
example.tran: 位于达特河入海口的城镇

collins.tran: 不出声地说;用口型默示
collins.def: If you mouth something, you form words with your lips without making any sound.

example.ex: I mouthed a goodbye and hurried in behind Momma...
example.tran: 我用口型默示告别，然后匆匆跟在妈妈身后走了进去。

example.ex: She winked broadly at him and silently mouthed something...
example.tran: 她使劲冲他使眼色，不出声地对他说了些什么。

collins.tran: 言不由衷地说；信口说；不知所云地说
collins.def: If you mouth something, you say it, especially without believing it or without understanding it.

example.ex: I mouthed some sympathetic platitudes...
example.tran: 我言不由衷地说了一些表示同情的客套话。

example.ex: They mouthed the values of family, religion and charity, but demonstrated the opposite in their private lives.
example.tran: 他们大谈家庭、宗教和慈善的价值，但他们在个人生活中的表现却恰恰相反。

collins.tran: 需要赡养的人;要养活的人
collins.def: If you have a number of mouths to feed, you have the responsibility of earning enough money to feed and look after that number of people.

example.ex: He had to feed his family on the equivalent of four hundred pounds a month and, with five mouths to feed, he found this very hard.
example.tran: 他要用相当于400英镑的月收入来维持五口之家的生计，感觉很艰难。

collins.def: If you say that someone does not open their mouth, you are emphasizing that they never say anything at all.

example.ex: Sometimes I hardly dare open my mouth...
example.tran: 有时我几乎不敢开口说话。

example.ex: He hasn't opened his mouth since he's been there.
example.tran: 他从到那儿后一直没有开口。

collins.def: If you keep your mouth shut about something, you do not talk about it, especially because it is a secret.

example.ex: You wouldn't be here now if she'd kept her mouth shut.
example.tran: 如果她守口如瓶的话，你现在就不会在这儿啦。

collins.def: A window is a space in the wall of a building or in the side of a vehicle, which has glass in it so that light can come in and you can see out.

example.ex: He stood at the window, moodily staring out...
example.tran: 他站在窗前，忧郁地凝视着外面。

example.ex: The room felt very hot and she wondered why someone did not open a window...
example.tran: 房间里感觉很热，她纳闷怎么没人开窗子。

collins.def: A window is a large piece of glass along the front of a shop, behind which some of the goods that the shop sells are displayed.

example.ex: I stood for a few moments in front of the nearest shop window.
example.tran: 我在最近的一家商店的橱窗前站了一会儿。

collins.tran: (银行、邮局、火车站、博物馆等处柜台的)窗口
collins.def: A window is a glass-covered opening above a counter, for example in a bank, post office, railway station, or museum, which the person serving you sits behind.

example.ex: The woman at the ticket window told me that the admission fee was $17.50.
example.tran: 售票窗口那个女的告诉我入场费是17.50美元。

collins.def: On a computer screen, a window is one of the work areas that the screen can be divided into.
If you have a window in your diary for something, or if you can make a window for it, you are free at a particular time and can do it then.

example.ex: Tell her I've got a window in my diary later on this week.
example.tran: 告诉她我这周晚些时候有空儿。

collins.tran: 消失殆尽;烟消云散;化为乌有
collins.def: If you say that something such as a plan or a particular way of thinking or behaving has gone out of the window or has flown out of the window, you mean that it has disappeared completely.

example.ex: By now all logic had gone out of the window...
example.tran: 到这时根本就不讲什么逻辑了。

example.ex: When he went, our happiness and our security flew out of the window.
example.tran: 他走后，我们幸福安稳的好日子便到头了。

collins.tran: 转瞬即逝的机会;稍纵即逝的机会
collins.def: If you say that there is a window of opportunity for something, you mean that there is an opportunity to do something but that this opportunity will only last for a short time and so it needs to be taken advantage of quickly.

example.ex: The king said there was now a window of opportunity for peace.
example.tran: 国王说现在有寻求和平的短暂机会。

collins.def: If there is some prospect of something happening, there is a possibility that it will happen.

example.ex: Unfortunately, there is little prospect of seeing these big questions answered...
example.tran: 不幸的是，几乎不可能看到这些重大问题得到回复。

example.ex: The prospects for peace in the country's eight-year civil war are becoming brighter...
example.tran: 该国经历8年内战之后重归和平的前景正逐渐变得光明。

collins.tran: 期望中的事；将要发生的事；预期；展望
collins.def: A particular prospect is something that you expect or know is going to happen.

example.ex: They now face the prospect of having to wear a cycling helmet by law...
example.tran: 他们现在面临的情形是：不久将需要依法佩戴摩托车头盔。

example.ex: After supper he'd put his feet up and read. It was a pleasant prospect.
example.tran: 晚饭后，他会架起脚来看书。想起来就让人愉快。

collins.tran: （尤指事业的）成功机会，前景，前途
collins.def: Someone's prospects are their chances of being successful, especially in their career.

example.ex: I chose to work abroad to improve my career prospects.
example.tran: 我选择出国工作以求在事业上有更好的发展。

example.ex: ...a detailed review of the company's prospects.
example.tran: 对该公司前景的详细考查

collins.def: When people prospect for oil, gold, or some other valuable substance, they look for it in the ground or under the sea.

example.ex: He had prospected for minerals everywhere from the Gobi Desert to the Transvaal...
example.tran: 他已在从戈壁沙漠到德兰士瓦的无数地方勘探过矿藏。

example.ex: In fact, the oil companies are already prospecting not far from here.
example.tran: 事实上，石油公司已经在离此不远处进行勘探。

collins.def: A model of an object is a physical representation that shows what it looks like or how it works. The model is often smaller than the object it represents.

example.ex: ...an architect's model of a wooden house.
example.tran: 一幢木屋的建筑模型

example.ex: ...a working scale model of the whole Bay Area...
example.tran: 实际应用的整个旧金山湾区比例模型

collins.def: A model is a system that is being used and that people might want to copy in order to achieve similar results.

example.ex: We believe that this is a general model of managerial activity...
example.tran: 我们认为这可以作为管理活动的普遍范例。

example.ex: He wants companies to follow the European model of social responsibility.
example.tran: 他希望各公司能够以欧洲公司为榜样，承担社会责任。

collins.def: A model of a system or process is a theoretical description that can help you understand how the system or process works, or how it might work.

example.ex: Darwin eventually put forward a model of biological evolution...
example.tran: 达尔文最终提出了生物进化的模型。

example.ex: He proposed a model of stress reaction in the body.
example.tran: 他提出了一个人体内应激反应的模型。

collins.tran: 创立(系统或过程）的（理论描述)模型
collins.def: If someone such as a scientist models a system or process, they make an accurate theoretical description of it in order to understand or explain how it works.

example.ex: ...the mathematics needed to model a nonlinear system like an atmosphere.
example.tran: 创立诸如大气层之类的非线性系统的模型所需的数学知识

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is a model of a particular quality, you are showing approval of them because they have that quality to a large degree.

example.ex: A model of good manners, he has conquered any inward fury...
example.tran: 作为一个非常懂礼貌的人，他已经学会了克制内心的任何愤怒情绪。

example.ex: His marriage and family life is a model of propriety.
example.tran: 他的婚姻和家庭生活都是规规矩矩的。

collins.def: You use model to express approval of someone when you think that they perform their role or duties extremely well.

example.ex: As a girl she had been a model pupil...
example.tran: 还是个小女孩的时候，她就是一个模范学生。

example.ex: Hospital staff say he is a model patient.
example.tran: 医务人员说他是一个模范病人。

collins.tran: 按特定模型制造;仿特定样式做出
collins.def: If one thing is modelled on another, the first thing is made so that it is like the second thing in some way.

example.ex: The quota system was modelled on those operated in America and continental Europe...
example.tran: 该配额制度是仿照美国以及欧洲大陆国家的同类制度制定的。

example.ex: The program will be modeled after a popular BBC series called 'The Archers'...
example.tran: 这个节目将仿照英国广播公司的人气系列剧《阿彻一家》制作。

collins.def: If you model yourself on someone, you copy the way that they do things, because you admire them and want to be like them.

example.ex: There's absolutely nothing wrong in modelling yourself on an older woman...
example.tran: 以年纪较长的女性作为自己仿效的对象绝没有什么不对。

example.ex: They will tend to model their behaviour on the teacher's behaviour.
example.tran: 他们会倾向于模仿老师的行为举止。

collins.def: A particular model of a machine is a particular version of it.

example.ex: To keep the cost down, opt for a basic model...
example.tran: 要想花钱少些，就选择基本的型号。

example.ex: The model number is 1870/285.
example.tran: 该型号的编号为1870/285。

collins.def: An artist's model is a person who stays still in a particular position so that the artist can make a picture or sculpture of them.
If someone models for an artist, they stay still in a particular position so that the artist can make a picture or sculpture  of them.

example.ex: Tullio has been modelling for Sandra for eleven years.
example.tran: 图利奥已为桑德拉做了11年的模特儿。

collins.def: A fashion model is a person whose job is to display clothes by wearing them.

example.ex: ...Paris's top photographic fashion model.
example.tran: 巴黎顶尖时装摄影模特儿

collins.def: If someone models clothes, they display them by wearing them.

example.ex: I wasn't here to model clothes...
example.tran: 我不是到这里来当时装模特儿的。

example.ex: She began modelling in Paris aged 15.
example.tran: 她15岁就开始在巴黎做时装模特儿。

collins.tran: (用黏土、木头等)做…的模型;塑造
collins.def: If you model shapes or figures, you make them out of a substance such as clay or wood.

example.ex: There she began to model in clay...
example.tran: 在那儿她开始用黏土做模型。

example.ex: Sometimes she carved wood and sometimes stone; sometimes she modelled clay...
example.tran: 她有时刻木雕，有时刻石雕，有时塑泥塑。

collins.def: Opposition is strong, angry, or violent disagreement and disapproval.

example.ex: The government is facing a new wave of opposition in the form of a student strike...
example.tran: 政府面临着学生通过罢课掀起的新一轮反对浪潮。

example.ex: Much of the opposition to this plan has come from the media.
example.tran: 该计划的主要反对声音来自媒体。

collins.tran: （与政府意见相左的）反对党，在野党，反对派
collins.def: The opposition is the political parties or groups that are opposed to a government.

example.ex: The main opposition parties boycotted the election, saying it would not be conducted fairly.
example.tran: 主要反对党联合抵制这次选举，认为该选举将缺乏公正性。

collins.tran: （议会或立法机构中的）反对党，在野党，反对派
collins.def: In a country's parliament or legislature, the opposition refers to the politicians or political parties that form part of the parliament or legislature, but are not the government.

example.ex: ...the Leader of the Opposition.
example.tran: 反对党领袖

collins.tran: （体育比赛中的）对手，竞争者，竞争队伍
collins.def: The opposition is the person or team you are competing against in a sports event.

example.ex: Poland provide the opposition for the Scots' last warm-up match at home.
example.tran: 苏格兰队在国内最后一场热身赛的对手是波兰队。

collins.def: A college is an institution where students study after they have left school.

example.ex: Their daughter Joanna is doing business studies at a local college...
example.tran: 他们的女儿乔安娜在当地的一所学院念商科。

example.ex: Stephanie took up making jewellery after leaving art college this summer...
example.tran: 斯蒂芬妮今年夏天离开艺术学院后开始从事珠宝制作。

collins.def: A college is one of the institutions which some British universities are divided into.

example.ex: He was educated at Balliol College, Oxford.
example.tran: 他上的是牛津大学的贝利奥尔学院。

collins.def: At some universities in the United States, colleges are divisions which offer degrees in particular subjects.

example.ex: ...a professor at the University of Florida College of Law.
example.tran: 佛罗里达大学法学院的一位教授

collins.tran: (用于英国某些收费中学的名称中)中学，公学
collins.def: College is used in Britain in the names of some secondary schools which charge fees.

example.ex: In 1854, Cheltenham Ladies' College became the first girls' public school.
example.tran: 1854年，切尔滕纳姆女子中学成为第一所女子公学。

collins.def: A college of a particular kind is an organized group of people who have special duties and powers.

example.ex: He is a member of the Royal College of Physicians...
example.tran: 他是皇家内科医师协会的成员。

example.ex: There is a college of international supervisors working together.
example.tran: 一群来自世界各地的主管在一起工作。

collins.def: Supporters are people who support someone or something, for example a political leader or a sports team.

example.ex: The fourth night of violence in the German city of Rostock was triggered by football supporters...
example.tran: 发生在德国城市罗斯托克的第四起夜间暴乱是由足球球迷们挑起的。

example.ex: Bradley was a major supporter of the 1986 tax reform plan.
example.tran: 布拉德利是 1986 年税收改革计划的主要支持者。

collins.tran: 吸引人的;美好的;令人愉快的
collins.def: If you say that something is nice, you mean that you find it attractive, pleasant, or enjoyable.

example.ex: I think silk ties can be quite nice...
example.tran: 我认为丝绸领带相当不错。

example.ex: It's nice to be here together again...
example.tran: 又在这儿相聚太好了。

collins.tran: (常用于表示谢意)好心的，体贴人的
collins.def: If you say that it is nice of someone to say or do something, you are saying that they are being kind and thoughtful. This is often used as a way of thanking someone.

example.ex: It's awfully nice of you to come all this way to see me...
example.tran: 你真是太好了，大老远来看我。

example.ex: 'How are your boys?' — 'How nice of you to ask.'...
example.tran: “你的几个儿子好么？”——“谢谢关心。”

collins.def: If you say that someone is nice, you mean that you like them because they are friendly and pleasant.

example.ex: I've met your father and he's rather nice...
example.tran: 我已经见过你爸爸了，他非常和蔼可亲。

example.ex: He was a nice fellow, very quiet and courteous.
example.tran: 他是个好小伙，非常温和，彬彬有礼。

collins.def: If you are nice to people, you are friendly, pleasant, or polite towards them.

example.ex: She met Mr and Mrs Ricciardi, who were very nice to her.
example.tran: 她见到了里恰尔迪夫妇，他们对她非常友好。

collins.def: When the weather is nice, it is warm and pleasant.

example.ex: He nodded to us and said, 'Nice weather we're having.'
example.tran: 他冲我们点点头，说道：“天气真不错。”

collins.tran: (用于加强语气)美好的，令人喜爱的
collins.def: You can use nice to emphasize a particular quality that you like.

example.ex: With a nice dark colour, the wine is medium to full bodied...
example.tran: 这种葡萄酒色泽深暗悦目，是中等浓郁至浓香型的。

example.ex: People have got used to nice glossy magazines...
example.tran: 人们已经习惯了用精美的亮光纸印刷的杂志了。

collins.tran: (观点、区别等)细致的，微妙的，精细的
collins.def: A nice point or distinction is very clear, precise, and based on good reasoning.

example.ex: Those are nice academic arguments, but what about the immediate future?
example.tran: 那些是微妙的学术上的辩论，但不久的将来怎么办？

collins.def: You can use nice when you are greeting people. For example, you can say 'Nice to meet you', 'Nice to have met you', or 'Nice to see you'.

example.ex: Good morning. Nice to meet you and thanks for being with us this weekend...
example.tran: 早上好！见到你真高兴，感谢你和我们共度这个周末。

example.ex: 'It's so nice to see you,' said Charles.
example.tran: 查尔斯说：“见到你真是太高兴了。”

collins.def: If someone says nice one, they are showing their approval of something clever or funny that they have just seen or heard.

example.ex: Knowles became Torquay's manager. Nice one.
example.tran: 诺尔斯成了托奇酒店的经理，干得很棒。

collins.def: A recession is a period when the economy of a country is doing badly, for example because industry is producing less and more people are becoming unemployed.

example.ex: The recession caused sales to drop off...
example.tran: 经济不景气使销量下降。

example.ex: We should concentrate on sharply reducing interest rates to pull the economy out of recession...
example.tran: 我们应该着力大幅下调利率以使经济走出衰退。

collins.def: The sixtieth item in a series is the one that you count as number sixty.

example.ex: He is to retire on his sixtieth birthday.
example.tran: 他准备在 60 岁生日那天退休。

collins.def: A sixtieth is one of sixty equal parts of something.
You use religious to describe things that are connected with religion or with one particular religion.

example.ex: ...religious groups.
example.tran: 宗教团体

example.ex: ...different religious beliefs.
example.tran: 不同的宗教信仰

collins.tran: 虔诚的;宗教信仰坚定的
collins.def: Someone who is religious has a strong belief in a god or gods.

example.ex: They are both very religious and felt it was a gift from God.
example.tran: 他们俩都很虔诚，感觉这是上帝的恩赐。

collins.def: A message is a piece of information or a request that you send to someone or leave for them when you cannot speak to them directly.

example.ex: I got a message you were trying to reach me...
example.tran: 我收到一条留言，说你想跟我联系。

example.ex: Would you like to leave a message?...
example.tran: 您要留言吗？

collins.tran: (书、戏剧等的)要旨，主题思想，寓意
collins.def: The message that someone is trying to communicate, for example in a book or play, is the idea or point that they are trying to communicate.

example.ex: The report's message was unequivocal...
example.tran: 报告中传达的信息是明确的。

example.ex: I no longer want to stay friendly with her but I don't know how to get the message across...
example.tran: 我再也不想和她做朋友了，但是又不知如何告诉她。

collins.tran: (用电脑、手机等)给…发消息，给…留言
collins.def: If you message someone, you send them a message electronically using a computer or another device such as a mobile phone.

example.ex: People who message a lot feel unpopular if they don't get many back...
example.tran: 如果人们发出大量短信但收到的回复却不多，就会觉得自己不受欢迎。

example.ex: She messaged him saying she wished they were together.
example.tran: 她给他留言说希望跟他在一起。

collins.def: Culture consists of activities such as the arts and philosophy, which are considered to be important for the development of civilization and of people's minds.

example.ex: There is just not enough fun and frivolity in culture today.
example.tran: 当今的文化恰恰是不够轻松有趣。

example.ex: ...aspects of popular culture.
example.tran: 大众文化的方方面面

collins.tran: 文化(尤指拥有特定信仰、生活方式或艺术形式的社会或文明）
collins.def: A culture is a particular society or civilization, especially considered in relation to its beliefs, way of life, or art.

example.ex: ...people from different cultures...
example.tran: 来自不同文化背景的人们

example.ex: I was brought up in a culture that said you must put back into the society what you have taken out.
example.tran: 我成长于其中的那个社会文化认为，取之社会必须回报社会。

collins.tran: 文化(某组织或群体的一致习惯和行为方式)
collins.def: The culture of a particular organization or group consists of the habits of the people in it and the way they generally behave.

example.ex: But social workers say that this has created a culture of dependency, particularly in urban areas...
example.tran: 然而社会工作者认为这使得人们普遍产生了依赖，尤其是在城市地区。

example.ex: The institutions have realised they need to change their culture to improve efficiency and service.
example.tran: 这些机构已经意识到需要改变他们的内部文化以提高效率、改进服务。

collins.tran: 培养物;培养菌;培养细胞
collins.def: In science, a culture is a group of bacteria or cells which are grown, usually in a laboratory as part of an experiment.

example.ex: ...a culture of human cells.
example.tran: 人类细胞的培养物

example.ex: ...a number of tissue culture experiments.
example.tran: 多次组织细胞培养实验

collins.def: In science, to culture a group of bacteria or cells means to grow them, usually in a laboratory as part of an experiment.

example.ex: To confirm the diagnosis, the hospital laboratory must culture a colony of bacteria.
example.tran: 为进一步确诊，医院实验室必须培养一个细菌菌落。

example.ex: ...cultured human blood cells.
example.tran: 培养的人体血细胞

means: 最后命运或结局如何已显然可见者

collins.def: A candidate is someone who is being considered for a position, for example someone who is running in an election or applying for a job.

example.ex: The Democratic candidate is still leading in the polls...
example.tran: 民主党候选人的得票数依然领先。

example.ex: He is a candidate for the office of Governor...
example.tran: 他是州长候选人之一。

collins.def: A candidate is someone who is taking an examination.

collins.tran: 攻读学位者;在读本科生(或硕士生、博士生)
collins.def: A candidate is someone who is studying for a degree at a college.

collins.tran: 适合…的人(或物);可能有…结局的人(或物)
collins.def: A candidate is a person or thing that is regarded as being suitable for a particular purpose or as being likely to do or be a particular thing.

example.ex: I think Birmingham City are prime candidates for relegation next season...
example.tran: 我认为下个赛季伯明翰城队最有可能降级。

example.ex: Those who are overweight or indulge in high-salt diets are candidates for hypertension.
example.tran: 体重偏高或口味偏咸者易患高血压。

collins.def: A ship is a large boat which carries passengers or cargo.

example.ex: Within ninety minutes the ship was ready for departure...
example.tran: 90分钟之内轮船准备出发。

example.ex: We went by ship over to America.
example.tran: 我们搭轮船去美国。

collins.def: If people or things are shipped somewhere, they are sent there on a ship or by some other means of transport.

example.ex: Food is being shipped to drought-stricken Southern Africa.
example.tran: 食物正被运往遭受旱灾的非洲南部。

collins.def: Annual events happen once every year.

example.ex: ...the annual conference of Britain's trade union movement...
example.tran: 英国工会运动的年会

example.ex: In its annual report, UNICEF says at least 40,000 children die every day.
example.tran: 在其年度报告中，联合国儿童基金会称每天至少有4万名儿童死亡。

collins.def: Annual quantities or rates relate to a period of one year.

example.ex: Annual costs, tuition and fees, £6,600...
example.tran: 每年的花销、学费和各项杂费6,600英镑。

example.ex: The electronic and printing unit has annual sales of about $80 million.
example.tran: 电子印刷部门每年销售额约为8,000万美元。

collins.def: An annual is a book or magazine that is published once a year.

example.ex: I looked for Wyman's picture in my high-school annual...
example.tran: 我在中学年刊中寻找怀曼的照片。

example.ex: He tried the various almanacs, annuals and gazettes which were held in the library.
example.tran: 他试着在图书馆里找过各种历书、年鉴和报纸。

collins.def: An annual is a plant that grows and dies within one year.

example.ex: The simplest way to deal with these hardy annuals is to sow them where they are to flower.
example.tran: 处理这些一年生耐寒植物最简单的办法是将他们种在能开花的地方。

collins.def: A card is a piece of stiff paper or thin cardboard on which something is written or printed.

example.ex: Check the numbers below against the numbers on your card.
example.tran: 把下列数字和你卡片上的数字比照一下。

collins.def: A card is a piece of cardboard or plastic, or a small document, which shows information about you and which you carry with you, for example to prove your identity.

example.ex: They check my bag and press card.
example.tran: 他们检查我的包和记者证。

example.ex: ...her membership card...
example.tran: 她的会员证

collins.tran: 银行卡;借记卡;工资卡;购物卡
collins.def: A card is a rectangular piece of plastic, issued by a bank, company, or shop, which you can use to buy things or obtain money.

example.ex: He paid the whole bill with an American Express card...
example.tran: 他用美国运通卡付了全部账款。

example.ex: Holidaymakers should beware of using plastic cards in foreign cash dispensers.
example.tran: 外出度假时,在外币取款机上使用银行卡一定要小心。

collins.def: A card is a folded piece of stiff paper with a picture and sometimes a message printed on it, which you send to someone on a special occasion.

example.ex: She sends me a card on my birthday.
example.tran: 我过生日时她寄来一张贺卡。

example.ex: ...millions of get-well cards.
example.tran: 数百万张祝愿康复的卡片

collins.def: A card is the same as a postcard .

example.ex: Send your details on a card to the following address.
example.tran: 在明信片上写明你的近况寄到下面的地址。

collins.def: A card is a piece of thin cardboard carried by someone such as a business person in order to give to other people. A card shows the name, address, telephone number, and other details of the person who carries it.

example.ex: Here's my card. You may need me.
example.tran: 这是我的名片,你也许会用得到我。

collins.def: Cards are thin pieces of cardboard with numbers or pictures printed on them which are used to play various games.

example.ex: ...a pack of cards...
example.tran: 一副扑克牌

example.ex: Kurt picked up his hand and fanned out the cards one by one.
example.tran: 库尔特拿起他那手牌,一张张成扇形铺开。

collins.def: If you are playing cards, you are playing a game using cards.

example.ex: They enjoy themselves drinking wine, smoking and playing cards.
example.tran: 他们又是喝酒抽烟,又是打牌,玩得很痛快。

collins.def: You can use card to refer to something that gives you an advantage in a particular situation. If you play a particular card, you use that advantage.

example.ex: It was his strongest card in their relationship — that she wanted him more than he wanted her...
example.tran: 在他俩的爱情关系中,他的最大优势是:她需要他超过他需要她。

example.ex: This permitted Western manufacturers to play their strong cards: capital and technology.
example.tran: 这让西方制造商得以亮出他们的王牌:资金和技术。

collins.def: Card is strong, stiff paper or thin cardboard.

example.ex: She put the pieces of card in her pocket.
example.tran: 她把那些硬纸片放进了口袋。

collins.def: In computing, a card is a circuit board that can be put into a computer to provide additional memory or functions.

collins.tran: (体育比赛的)赛事安排，比赛日程
collins.def: You can use card to refer to a series of races or matches at a particular sporting event.

example.ex: Paradise Boy and the Galloping General have clear chances in the opening two events on the card...
example.tran: “天堂男孩”和“飞奔将军”这两匹赛马在开赛的前两场胜算很大。

example.ex: He will now fight Kevin Ford on the five-bout card.
example.tran: 他将在五局制比赛中迎战凯文·福特。

collins.tran: 要求…出示证明文件(表明达到买酒或饮酒的年龄等)
collins.def: If you are carded, someone in authority asks you to show a document to prove that you are old enough to do something, for example, to buy or drink alcohol.

example.ex: For the first time in many years, I got carded.
example.tran: 这么多年来，头一回有人要我出示身份证。

collins.def: If you say that something is on the cards in British English, or in the cards in American English, you mean that it is very likely to happen.

example.ex: Last summer she began telling friends that a New Year marriage was on the cards.
example.tran: 去年夏天,她就和朋友们说她有可能在元旦期间结婚。

collins.tran: 处理得当;巧妙发挥优势
collins.def: If you say that someone will achieve success if they play their cards right, you mean that they will achieve success if they act skilfully and use the advantages that they have.

example.ex: He could even be the next manager of the England team if he plays his cards right.
example.tran: 如果他处理得好,说不定都能当上英格兰队的下任教练。

collins.tran: 摊牌;直抒己见;和盘托出(感觉、想法、计划)
collins.def: If you put or lay your cards on the table, you deal with a situation by speaking openly about your feelings, ideas, or plans.

example.ex: Put your cards on the table and be very clear about your complaints.
example.tran: 你有话就直说,有什么不满都说清楚。

collins.def: A bridge is a structure that is built over a railway, river, or road so that people or vehicles can cross from one side to the other.

example.ex: He walked back over the railway bridge.
example.tran: 他从铁路桥上走了回去。

example.ex: ...the Golden Gate Bridge.
example.tran: 金门大桥

collins.def: A bridge between two places is a piece of land that joins or connects them.

example.ex: ...a land bridge linking Serbian territories.
example.tran: 连接塞尔维亚不同地区的陆桥

collins.def: To bridge the gap between two people or things means to reduce it or get rid of it.

example.ex: It is unlikely that the two sides will be able to bridge their differences.
example.tran: 双方不太可能消除彼此之间的分歧。

collins.def: Something that bridges the gap between two very different things has some of the qualities of each of these things.

example.ex: ...the singer who bridged the gap between pop music and opera.
example.tran: 将通俗音乐与歌剧结合起来的歌手

collins.def: If something or someone acts as a bridge between two people, groups, or things, they connect them.

example.ex: We hope this book will act as a bridge between doctor and patient...
example.tran: 我们希望这本书能成为医生与患者之间沟通的桥梁。

example.ex: They saw themselves as a bridge to peace.
example.tran: 他们把自己看作实现和平的使者。

collins.def: The bridge is the place on a ship from which it is steered.
The bridge of your nose is the thin top part of it, between your eyes.

example.ex: On the bridge of his hooked nose was a pair of gold rimless spectacles.
example.tran: 他的鹰钩鼻上架着一副金色无框眼镜。

collins.def: The bridge of a pair of glasses is the part that rests on your nose.

collins.tran: （小提琴、吉他等弦乐器的）琴马，琴桥
collins.def: The bridge of a violin, guitar, or other stringed instrument is the small piece of wood under the strings that holds them up.
A bridge is a piece of metal or plastic that holds false teeth in place by connecting them to natural teeth.
Bridge is a card game for four players in which the players begin by declaring how many tricks they expect to win.
If you burn your bridges, you do something which forces you to continue with a particular course of action, and makes it impossible for you to return to an earlier situation or relationship.
If you say there is a possibility that something is the case or that something will happen, you mean that it might be the case or it might happen.

example.ex: We were not in the least worried about the possibility that sweets could rot the teeth...
example.tran: 我们以前完全不担心吃糖果有可能会蛀牙。

example.ex: Tax on food has become a very real possibility.
example.tran: 极有可能征收食物税。

collins.def: A possibility is one of several different things that could be done.

example.ex: The government now owns a lot of our land — one possibility would be  to compensate us with other property...
example.tran: 政府现在占了我们的大量土地，一种可能是用其他地产来对我们作出补偿。

example.ex: There were several possibilities open to each manufacturer.
example.tran: 每个制造商都可以有几种不同的选择。

collins.def: You can say 'It is not beyond the realms of possibility' or 'It is not beyond the bounds of possibility'  when you are stating something that you believe is possibly true, but which other people might consider unlikely or impossible.

example.ex: It's not beyond the realms of possibility that the security services do bug important public figures.
example.tran: 安全部门完全有可能窃听重要公众人物的谈话。

collins.tran: 奇怪的;怪异的;意料之外的
collins.def: Something that is strange is unusual or unexpected, and makes you feel slightly nervous or afraid.

example.ex: Then a strange thing happened...
example.tran: 然后一件奇怪的事发生了。

example.ex: There was something strange about the flickering blue light...
example.tran: 闪烁的蓝光有点怪异。

collins.def: A strange place is one that you have never been to before. A strange person is someone that you have never met before.

example.ex: I ended up alone in a strange city...
example.tran: 结果，我独自一人来到了一个陌生的城市。

example.ex: She was faced with a new job, in unfamiliar surroundings with strange people.
example.tran: 她面对着一份全新工作，周围是陌生的环境和陌生的人。

collins.tran: 局促不安的;不自在的;不舒服的
collins.def: If you feel strange, you have an unpleasant or uncomfortable feeling, either physical or emotional.

example.ex: I felt all dizzy and strange.
example.tran: 我感到非常头晕、不舒服。

collins.def: You use tomorrow to refer to the day after today.

example.ex: Bye, see you tomorrow...
example.tran: 再见，明天见。

example.ex: The first official results will be announced tomorrow.
example.tran: 第一批官方结果将于明天宣布。

collins.def: Tomorrow is also a noun.

example.ex: What's on your agenda for tomorrow?…
example.tran: 你明天的日程是怎么安排的？

example.ex: Davies plays for the Barbarians in tomorrow's match against England...
example.tran: 戴维斯将在明天对阵英格兰队的比赛中为野人队效力。

collins.tran: 在未来;(尤指)在不久的将来
collins.def: You can refer to the future, especially the near future, as tomorrow .

example.ex: What is education going to look like tomorrow?
example.tran: 未来的教育会是什么样子？

collins.tran: 有效的;能产生预期效果的
collins.def: Something that is effective works well and produces the results that were intended.

example.ex: The project looks at how we could be more effective in encouraging students to enter teacher training...
example.tran: 该项目着眼于我们如何能够更加有效地鼓励学生参与教师培训。

example.ex: Simple antibiotics are effective against this organism...
example.tran: 一般的抗生素能够有效对抗这种微生物。

collins.def: Effective means having a particular role or result in practice, though not officially or in theory.

example.ex: They have had effective control of the area since the security forces left.
example.tran: 自从安全部队撤离后，他们实际上控制了该地区。

example.ex: ...a restructuring that would have resulted in an effective increase on one of their most popular excursion fares.
example.tran: 原本会使他们最热门的一条短途旅游线路的费用出现实质性上涨的调整

collins.tran: （法律、协议等）生效的，起作用的
collins.def: When something such as a law or an agreement becomes effective, it begins officially to apply or be valid.

example.ex: The new rules will become effective in the next few days.
example.tran: 新规定将在几天后生效。

collins.def: You use indeed to confirm or agree with something that has just been said.

example.ex: Later, he admitted that the payments had indeed been made...
example.tran: 后来,他承认确实付过款了。

example.ex: He did indeed keep important documents inside his hat...
example.tran: 他确实把重要文件放在了他的帽子里。

collins.tran: (表示语气的递进)实际上,其实,确切说来
collins.def: You use indeed to introduce a further comment or statement which strengthens the point you have already made.

example.ex: We have nothing against diversity; indeed, we want more of it...
example.tran: 我们一点都不抵触多样化;实际上,我们需要多样性更丰富一些。

example.ex: When we asked to see more we were refused. Indeed we were escorted away by men with guns.
example.tran: 当我们要求进一步参观时却被拒绝了。实际上，我们是被一些带枪的人护送离开的。

collins.tran: (位于句末修饰very或强调某词)确实,实在
collins.def: You use indeed at the end of a clause to give extra force to the word 'very', or to emphasize a particular word.

example.ex: The engine began to sound very loud indeed...
example.tran: 发动机开始发出极大的声响。

example.ex: The wine was very good indeed...
example.tran: 红酒确实非常好。

collins.tran: (重复问题以作强调,尤用于答案未知时)到底,究竟
collins.def: You can use indeed as a way of repeating a question in order to emphasize it, especially when you do not know the answer.

example.ex: 'Now where are the real villains?' — 'Where indeed?'...
example.tran: “那么那些真正的恶棍在哪里？”——“是啊，到底在哪里？”

example.ex: 'And what do we do here?' — 'What, indeed?'
example.tran: “我们在这里做什么呢?”——“是啊，到底做什么?”

collins.def: Pink is the colour between red and white.

example.ex: ...pink lipstick.
example.tran: 粉红色的口红

example.ex: ...white flowers edged in pink.
example.tran: 带粉边的白花

collins.tran: （因窘迫、愤怒或剧烈活动而）脸色发红
collins.def: If you go pink, your face turns a slightly redder colour than usual because you are embarrassed or angry, or because you are doing something energetic.

example.ex: She went pink again as she remembered her mistake.
example.tran: 想起自己的错误，她又脸红了。

collins.def: Pink is used to refer to things relating to or connected with homosexuals.

example.ex: Businesses are now more aware of the importance of the 'pink pound'.
example.tran: 现在商家更加意识到同性恋族群消费力、即所谓“粉红英镑”的重要性。

collins.def: Pinks are small plants that people grow in their gardens. They have sweet-smelling pink, white, or red flowers.

collins.tran: 非常健康；满面红光；容光焕发
collins.def: If you are in the pink, you are fit, healthy, and happy.

example.ex: A glass of red wine keeps you in the pink.
example.tran: 一杯红酒有益健康。

collins.def: A crowd is a large group of people who have gathered together, for example to watch or listen to something interesting, or to protest about something.

example.ex: A huge crowd gathered in a square outside the Kremlin walls...
example.tran: 一大群人聚集在克里姆林宫墙外的广场上。

example.ex: It took some two hours before the crowd was fully dispersed...
example.tran: 大概花了两个小时才把人群全部疏散开。

collins.tran: (志趣相投或工作相同的)一伙人，一帮人
collins.def: A particular crowd is a group of friends, or a set of people who share the same interests or job.

example.ex: All the old crowd have come out for this occasion.
example.tran: 那些老伙计们都来参加这一庆典。

collins.def: When people crowd around someone or something, they gather closely together around them.

example.ex: The hungry refugees crowded around the tractors...
example.tran: 饥饿的难民聚集到拖拉机周围。

example.ex: Police blocked off the road as hotel staff and guests crowded around.
example.tran: 当酒店工作人员和旅客们都聚拢过来时，警察封锁了那条路。

collins.def: If people crowd into a place or are crowded into a place, large numbers of them enter it so that it becomes very full.

example.ex: Hundreds of thousands of people have crowded into the center of the Lithuanian capital, Vilnius...
example.tran: 几十万人涌入立陶宛首都维尔纽斯的市中心。

example.ex: One group of journalists were crowded into a minibus...
example.tran: 一群记者挤进一辆小型公共汽车。

collins.def: If a group of people crowd a place, there are so many of them there that it is full.

example.ex: Thousands of demonstrators crowded the streets shouting slogans.
example.tran: 数千名高喊着口号的示威者把街道挤得水泄不通。

collins.def: If people crowd you, they stand very closely around you trying to see or speak to you, so that you feel uncomfortable.

example.ex: It had been a tense, restless day with people crowding her all the time.
example.tran: 这是紧张、忙碌的一天，每时每刻都有人围在她身旁。

means: 拥护者[支持者，提倡者]的身分

collins.def: A championship is a competition to find the best player or team in a particular sport.

example.ex: ...the world chess championship.
example.tran: 国际象棋世界冠军赛

collins.tran: 冠军头衔;冠军称号;第一名
collins.def: The championship refers to the title or status of being a sports champion.

example.ex: He went on to take the championship...
example.tran: 他继而夺取冠军宝座。

example.ex: This season I expect us to retain the championship and win the European Cup.
example.tran: 这个赛季我期待我们能够保住冠军头衔，赢得欧洲杯。

collins.def: If you impose something on people, you use your authority to force them to accept it.

example.ex: Britain imposed fines on airlines which bring in passengers without proper papers...
example.tran: 英国会对运载证件不齐全的乘客进入国内的航空公司课以罚款。

example.ex: Many companies have imposed a pay freeze...
example.tran: 许多公司已经强制冻结了工资。

collins.def: If you impose your opinions or beliefs on other people, you try and make people accept them as a rule or as a model to copy.

example.ex: Parents of either sex should beware of imposing their own tastes on their children.
example.tran: 父母双方都应切记不要把自己的喜好强加给孩子。

collins.tran: 使遭受，使承受(压力、痛苦等)
collins.def: If something imposes strain, pressure, or suffering on someone, it causes them to experience it.

example.ex: The filming imposed an additional strain on her.
example.tran: 拍摄任务使她承受了格外大的压力。

example.ex: ...the pressures imposed upon teachers by ceaseless curriculum reforms.
example.tran: 无休止的课程改革使教师承受的压力

collins.tran: 把…硬加给;把…强塞给;勉强(某人)做事
collins.def: If someone imposes on you, they unreasonably expect you to do something for them which you do not want to do.

example.ex: I was afraid you'd simply feel we were imposing on you...
example.tran: 我担心你会觉得我们是在勉强你。

example.ex: 'Mum thinks I should stop imposing on your hospitality, Leo,' said Grace.
example.tran: “利奥,我妈妈觉得我不应该再在这儿麻烦你了，”格雷丝说。

collins.def: If someone imposes themselves on you, they force you to accept their company although you may not want to.

example.ex: I didn't want to impose myself on my married friends.
example.tran: 我不想打扰自己已婚的朋友。

collins.def: Energy is the ability and strength to do active physical things and the feeling that you are full of physical power and life.

example.ex: He was saving his energy for next week's race in Belgium...
example.tran: 他正为下周在比利时的比赛养精蓄锐。

example.ex: We try to boost our energy by eating.
example.tran: 我们试图通过吃东西来增强体力。

collins.def: Energy is determination and enthusiasm about doing things.

example.ex: At 54 years old her energy and looks are magnificent...
example.tran: 她54岁了，精力和气色都非常好。

example.ex: You have drive and energy for those things you are interested in.
example.tran: 你对那些感兴趣的事情干劲十足。

collins.def: Your energies are your efforts and attention, which you can direct towards a particular aim.

example.ex: She had started to devote her energies to teaching rather than performing...
example.tran: 她已经开始将精力从表演转移到教学中。

example.ex: We must concentrate our energies on treating addiction first.
example.tran: 我们必须首先集中精力治疗毒瘾。

collins.def: Energy is the power from sources such as electricity and coal that makes machines work or provides heat.

example.ex: ...those who favour nuclear energy...
example.tran: 那些支持利用核能的人

example.ex: Oil shortages have brought on an energy crisis...
example.tran: 石油短缺已经造成了能源危机。

means: （因吃惊、害怕或激动而）猛地一动

collins.def: If you jump, you bend your knees, push against the ground with your feet, and move quickly upwards into the air.

example.ex: I jumped over the fence...
example.tran: 我跳过了栅栏。

example.ex: They came into the front hall, stamping their boots and jumping up and down to knock the snow off...
example.tran: 他们进入了前厅，跺着靴子，蹦跳着抖掉身上的雪。

collins.def: If you jump from something above the ground, you deliberately push yourself into the air so that you drop towards the ground.

example.ex: He jumped out of a third-floor window...
example.tran: 他从3楼的窗户跳了出去。

example.ex: She has jumped from an aeroplane four times...
example.tran: 她已经4次从飞机上跳下。

collins.def: If you jump something such as a fence, you move quickly up and through the air over or across it.

example.ex: He jumped the first fence beautifully.
example.tran: 他轻松地跨过第一道栏。

collins.def: If you jump somewhere, you move there quickly and suddenly.

example.ex: Adam jumped from his seat at the girl's cry...
example.tran: 女孩儿一哭，亚当立即从座位上跳了起来。

example.ex: She jumped to her feet and ran downstairs...
example.tran: 她突然站起来，跑下楼去了。

collins.tran: （因害怕或吃惊）猛地一跳，突然一跳
collins.def: If something makes you jump, it makes you make a sudden movement because you are frightened or surprised.

example.ex: The phone shrilled, making her jump.
example.tran: 刺耳的电话铃响了起来，把她吓了一跳。

collins.def: If an amount or level jumps, it suddenly increases or rises by a large amount in a short time.

example.ex: Sales jumped from $94 million to over $101 million...
example.tran: 销售额从9, 400万美元激增到了1.0 1亿美元。

example.ex: The number of crimes jumped by ten per cent last year...
example.tran: 去年犯罪率猛升了10%。

collins.def: If someone jumps a queue, they move to the front of it and are served or dealt with before it is their turn.

example.ex: The prince refused to jump the queue for treatment at the local hospital.
example.tran: 王子在本地医院候诊时拒绝插队。

collins.tran: 突然袭击；出其不意地攻击
collins.def: If someone jumps on you or jumps you, they attack you suddenly or unexpectedly.

example.ex: A week later, the same guys jumped on me on our own front lawn...
example.tran: 一个星期后，同一伙人又在我们家门口的草坪上袭击了我。

example.ex: Two guys jumped me with clubs in the carpark.
example.tran: 两个家伙在停车场用球棒袭击了我。

collins.tran: 迫不及待地接受，欣然应承（建议或机会）
collins.def: If you jump at an offer or opportunity, you accept it quickly and eagerly.

example.ex: Members of the public would jump at the chance to become part owners of the corporation.
example.tran: 一些公众会迫不及待地想要抓住机会成为这家公司的持股人。

collins.tran: 毫不犹豫地批评；立即责备
collins.def: If someone jumps on you, they quickly criticize you if you do something that they do not approve of.

example.ex: A lot of people jumped on me about that, you know.
example.tran: 你知道，那件事让很多人逮着机会批评我。

collins.def: If you get a jump on something or someone or get the jump on them, you gain an advantage over them.

example.ex: Helicopters helped fire crews get a jump on the blaze...
example.tran: 直升机帮助消防队员控制住了火势。

example.ex: The idea is to get the jump on him.
example.tran: 想法是要胜过他。

collins.tran: 非常激动；欣喜若狂；暴跳如雷
collins.def: If you say that someone is jumping up and down, you mean they are very excited, happy, or angry about something.

example.ex: I don't think a lot of people will jump up and down and say 'thank heavens'..
example.tran: 我并不认为很多人会欣喜若狂地说“感谢上帝”。

example.ex: Everybody still jumps up and down about being rid of tyrants.
example.tran: 大家都还在为摆脱了暴君的统治而激动不已。

collins.def: If people negotiate with each other or negotiate an agreement, they talk about a problem or a situation such as a business arrangement in order to solve the problem or complete the arrangement.

example.ex: It is not clear whether the president is willing to negotiate with the democrats...
example.tran: 还不清楚总统是否愿意和民主人士洽谈。

example.ex: When you have two adversaries negotiating, you need to be on neutral territory...
example.tran: 让敌对双方坐下来谈判时，你得保持中立。

collins.def: If you negotiate an area of land, a place, or an obstacle, you successfully travel across it or around it.

example.ex: Frank Mariano negotiates the desert terrain in his battered pickup...
example.tran: 弗兰克·马里亚诺驾驶他那辆破烂不堪的皮卡车成功穿越了沙漠地带。

example.ex: I negotiated the corner on my motorbike and pulled to a stop...
example.tran: 我骑摩托车顺利通过拐角，然后停了下来。

collins.tran: （动植物）自然生长的，野生的，野的
collins.def: Wild animals or plants live or grow in natural surroundings and are not looked after by people.

example.ex: We saw two more wild cats creeping towards us in the darkness...
example.tran: 我们看见又有两只野猫在黑暗中悄悄向我们靠近。

example.ex: The lane was lined with wild flowers.
example.tran: 小路两边都是野花。

collins.def: Wild land is natural and is not used by people.

example.ex: Elmley is one of the few wild areas remaining in the South East.
example.tran: 埃尔姆利是东南部仅存的几块荒地之一。

collins.def: The wilds of a place are the natural areas that are far away from towns.

example.ex: They went canoeing in the wilds of Canada.
example.tran: 他们到加拿大的荒野之地去划独木舟。

collins.tran: 有暴风雨的;多风暴的;狂风暴雨的
collins.def: Wild is used to describe the weather or the sea when it is stormy.

example.ex: The wild weather did not deter some people from swimming in the sea.
example.tran: 尽管风雨交加，一些人还是会下海游泳。

collins.def: Wild behaviour is uncontrolled, excited, or energetic.

example.ex: The children are wild with joy...
example.tran: 孩子们欣喜若狂。

example.ex: As George himself came on stage they went wild...
example.tran: 乔治本人走上台时，他们都变得十分狂热。

collins.tran: 难以约束的;不受控制的;放荡的;无节制的
collins.def: If you describe someone or their behaviour as wild, you mean that they behave in a very uncontrolled way.

example.ex: When angry or excited, however, he could be wild, profane, and terrifying...
example.tran: 但愤怒或激动的时候，他也会发狂、会骂人、令人生畏。

example.ex: She lived a wild and incredible life...
example.tran: 她过去的生活极其放纵。

collins.def: If someone is wild, they are very angry.

example.ex: For a long time I daren't tell him I knew, and when I did he went wild.
example.tran: 很长时间我都不敢告诉他我知道了，但当我告诉他时，他简直气疯了。

collins.tran: (因恐惧、愤怒或精神失常而)双目圆睁的，眼睛瞪大的
collins.def: If you say that someone has wild eyes or a wild look, you mean that their eyes are wide open and staring because they are frightened, angry, or insane.

example.ex: She could see his face now, his eyes wild and his skin glistening with perspiration...
example.tran: 她现在可以看见他的脸了，他的眼睛瞪得溜圆，皮肤上闪着汗水。

example.ex: I could not forget the wild look in his eyes.
example.tran: 我忘不了他圆睁的双眼。

collins.tran: （想法）非同寻常的，极端的;(猜测)未经思索的，胡乱的
collins.def: A wild idea is unusual or extreme. A wild guess is one that you make without much thought.

example.ex: I was just a kid and full of all sorts of wild ideas...
example.tran: 我不过是个孩子，充满各种奇异的想法。

example.ex: Browning's prediction is no better than a wild guess.
example.tran: 勃朗宁的预测不过是妄加猜测而已。

collins.def: If you are wild about someone or something, you like them very much.

example.ex: I'm just wild about Peter, and he's just wild about me...
example.tran: 我为彼得疯狂，他对我也一样。

example.ex: Irene was wild about the play.
example.tran: 艾琳非常喜欢这出戏。

collins.tran: 在自然环境中；处于野生状态
collins.def: Animals that live in the wild live in a free and natural state and are not looked after by people.

example.ex: Fewer than a thousand giant pandas still live in the wild.
example.tran: 只有不到1,000只大熊猫仍然在野外生活。

collins.tran: （事物）疯狂发展；（尤指小孩）恣意妄为，失去控制
collins.def: If something or someone, especially a child, runs wild, they behave in a natural, free, or uncontrolled way.

example.ex: Everything that could grow was running wild for lack of attention...
example.tran: 凡是能长的都因为缺乏照管而疯长一气。

example.ex: Molly has let that girl run wild.
example.tran: 莫莉放任那个女孩恣意妄为。

collins.def: A mountain is a very high area of land with steep sides.

example.ex: Ben Nevis, in Scotland, is Britain's highest mountain.
example.tran: 苏格兰境内的本尼维斯山是英国最高的山。

example.ex: ...a lovely little mountain village.
example.tran: 怡人的小山村

collins.def: If you talk about a mountain of something, or mountains of something, you are emphasizing that there is a large amount of it.

example.ex: They are faced with a mountain of bureaucracy...
example.tran: 他们面对一大堆繁文缛节。

example.ex: They have mountains of coffee to sell.
example.tran: 他们有大量的咖啡要卖。

collins.tran: 极大的困难;难办的事情；棘手的难题
collins.def: If you say that someone has a mountain to climb, you mean that it will be difficult for them to achieve what they want to achieve.

example.ex: 'We had a mountain to climb after the second goal went in,' said Crosby.
example.tran: 克罗斯比说：“进第二个球之后，我们面临着严峻的挑战。”

collins.def: A representative is a person who has been chosen to act or make decisions on behalf of another person or a group of people.

example.ex: ...trade union representatives...
example.tran: 工会代表

example.ex: Employees from each department elect a representative.
example.tran: 每个部门的员工选举一名代表。

collins.def: A representative is a person whose job is to sell a company's products or services, especially by travelling round and visiting other companies.

example.ex: She had a stressful job as a sales representative.
example.tran: 作为一名销售代表，她的工作压力很大。

collins.tran: 由代表组成的;代议制的
collins.def: A representative group consists of a small number of people who have been chosen to make decisions on behalf of a larger group.

example.ex: The new head of state should be chosen by an 87 member representative council.
example.tran: 新的国家元首应该由包括87名成员的代表委员会选出。

example.ex: ...the institutions of a representative government.
example.tran: 代议制政府的各个机构

collins.def: Someone who is typical of the group to which they belong can be described as representative .

example.ex: He was in no way representative of dog-trainers in general.
example.tran: 他远不是一般意义上的驯狗师。

example.ex: ...fairly representative groups of adults.
example.tran: 相当典型的成年人群体

collins.def: In the United States, a Representative is a member of the House of Representatives, the less powerful of the two parts of Congress.
The seventieth item in a series is the one that you count as number seventy.

example.ex: ...the seventieth anniversary of the discovery of Tutankhamun's tomb.
example.tran: 图坦卡蒙墓发现 70 周年纪念日

collins.def: A seventieth is one of seventy equal parts of something.
If you escape from a place, you succeed in getting away from it.

example.ex: A prisoner has escaped from a jail in northern England...
example.tran: 一名囚犯从英格兰北部的一所监狱中越狱。

example.ex: They are reported to have escaped to the other side of the border...
example.tran: 有报道称他们已经逃过了国境线。

collins.def: Someone's escape is the act of escaping from a particular place or situation.

example.ex: The man made his escape.
example.tran: 那个人逃跑了。

collins.def: You can say that you escape when you survive something such as an accident.

example.ex: The two officers were extremely lucky to escape serious injury...
example.tran: 那两名警官极其幸运，没有受重伤。

example.ex: The man's girlfriend managed to escape unhurt...
example.tran: 那个男人的女朋友成功逃脱，毫发无损。

collins.def: If something is an escape, it is a way of avoiding difficulties or responsibilities.

example.ex: But for me television is an escape.
example.tran: 但是对我而言，看电视是一种逃避的方法。

example.ex: ...an escape from the depressing realities of wartime.
example.tran: 对于战时令人抑郁的现实生活的一种逃避

collins.tran: 使逃避困难的;使规避问题的
collins.def: You can use escape to describe things which allow you to avoid difficulties or problems. For example, an escape route is an activity or opportunity that lets you improve your situation. An escape clause is part of an agreement that allows you to avoid having to do something that you do not want to do.

example.ex: We all need the occasional escape route from the boring, routine aspects of our lives...
example.tran: 我们都时不时需要逃避生活中的无聊和平淡。

example.ex: This has, in fact, turned out to be a wonderful escape clause for dishonest employers everywhere.
example.tran: 事实上，这已经成为所有狡猾的雇主们用来躲避责任的绝妙条款。

collins.tran: 为…所不知;逃过…的注意;被…忘记
collins.def: If something escapes you or escapes your attention, you do not know about it, do not remember it, or do not notice it.

example.ex: It was an actor whose name escapes me for the moment...
example.tran: 那个男演员的名字我一时想不起来了。

example.ex: Blonde and slender, she was too striking to escape their attention.
example.tran: 金发细腰的她太引人注目了，他们很难不注意到她。

collins.tran: （气体、液体、热量等）泄露，逸出，露出
collins.def: When gas, liquid, or heat escapes, it comes out from a pipe, container, or place.

example.ex: Leave a vent open to let some moist air escape.
example.tran: 打开一个通风口，让潮气逸出一些。

collins.def: A prize is money or something valuable that is given to someone who has the best results in a competition or game, or as a reward for doing good work.

example.ex: You must claim your prize by telephoning our claims line...
example.tran: 您必须通过拨打我们的领奖电话来领取奖品。

example.ex: He won first prize at the Leeds Piano Competition...
example.tran: 他在利兹国际钢琴比赛中荣获一等奖。

collins.def: You use prize to describe things that are of such good quality that they win prizes or deserve to win prizes.

example.ex: ...a prize bull.
example.tran: 获奖的公牛

example.ex: ...prize blooms.
example.tran: 有望获奖的花

collins.tran: 非常珍贵的人（或物）；十分重要的人（或物）
collins.def: You can refer to someone or something as a prize when people consider them to be of great value or importance.

example.ex: With no lands of his own, he was no great matrimonial prize.
example.tran: 他没有自己的地产，不是结婚的上佳人选。

collins.def: Something that is prized is wanted and admired because it is considered to be very valuable or very good quality.

example.ex: Military figures, made out of lead are prized by collectors...
example.tran: 收藏家们对铅铸的军人塑像视若珍宝。

example.ex: One of the gallery's most prized possessions is the portrait of Ginevra de'Benci.
example.tran: 这个美术馆最珍贵的藏品之一是达芬奇的《女子肖像》。

collins.def: If you prize something open or prize it away from a surface, you force it to open or force it to come away from the surface.

example.ex: He tried to prize the dog's mouth open...
example.tran: 他试图把这条狗的嘴掰开。

example.ex: I prised off the metal rim surrounding one of the dials...
example.tran: 我把其中一个刻度盘的金属边撬开了。

collins.tran: 竭力打探（消息等）；说服…透露（消息）
collins.def: If you prize something such as information out of someone, you persuade them to tell you although they may be very unwilling to.

example.ex: Alison and I had to prize conversation out of him.
example.tran: 我和艾莉森只得从他口中撬出谈话内容。

means: （进行某活动连续的）一段时间

collins.def: A session is a meeting of a court, parliament, or other official group.

example.ex: ...an emergency session of parliament...
example.tran: 议会紧急会议

example.ex: After two late night sessions, the Security Council has failed to reach agreement...
example.tran: 在深夜召开两次会议后，安全理事会还是没有达成一致。

collins.tran: (议会等的)会期;(法庭的)开庭期
collins.def: A session is a period during which the meetings of a court, parliament, or other official group are regularly held.

example.ex: The parliamentary session ends on October 4th...
example.tran: 议会会期在10月4日结束。

example.ex: From September until December, Congress remained in session.
example.tran: 从 9 月到 12 月，国会一直都在开会。

collins.tran: (某项活动的)一段时间，一场，一节
collins.def: A session of a particular activity is a period of that activity.

example.ex: The two leaders emerged for a photo session.
example.tran: 两位领导现身接受记者拍照。

example.ex: ...group therapy sessions.
example.tran: 小组治疗时间

collins.def: Session musicians are employed to play backing music in recording studios.

example.ex: He established himself as a session musician.
example.tran: 他成为了一位伴奏音乐家。

example.ex: ...a session drummer.
example.tran: 伴奏鼓手

collins.def: Exact means correct in every detail. For example, an exact copy is the same in every detail as the thing it is copied from.

example.ex: I don't remember the exact words...
example.tran: 我不记得确切的话语。

example.ex: The exact number of protest calls has not been revealed...
example.tran: 抗议电话的确切数量并未透露。

collins.tran: （用于名词前表强调）刚好的，确切的
collins.def: You use exact before a noun to emphasize that you are referring to that particular thing and no other, especially something that has a particular significance.

example.ex: I hadn't really thought about it until this exact moment...
example.tran: 直到这时我才真正开始考虑它。

example.ex: Do you really think I could get the exact thing I want?...
example.tran: 你真的认为我能够得到我想要的东西么？

collins.def: If you describe someone as exact, you mean that they are very careful and detailed in their work, thinking, or methods.

example.ex: Formal, exact and obstinate, he was also cold, suspicious, touchy and tactless.
example.tran: 严肃、严谨、倔强的他同时又冷漠、多疑、敏感、不会变通。

collins.def: When someone exacts something, they demand and obtain it from another person, especially because they are in a superior or more powerful position.

example.ex: Already he has exacted a written apology from the chairman of the commission...
example.tran: 他已经强行要求委员会主席作出书面道歉。

example.ex: They, too, would be likely to exact a high price for their cooperation.
example.tran: 他们也可能会为提供合作而索要高价。

collins.def: If someone exacts revenge on a person, they have their revenge on them.

example.ex: She uses the media to help her exact a terrible revenge.
example.tran: 她利用媒体帮助自己进行可怕的复仇。

collins.def: If something exacts a high price, it has a bad effect on a person or situation.

example.ex: The sheer physical effort had exacted a heavy price...
example.tran: 纯粹的体力劳动已经产生了极其不利的影响。

example.ex: The strain of a violent ground campaign will exact a toll on troops.
example.tran: 激烈的地面战役带来的紧张压力将让军队付出代价。

collins.def: You say to be exact to indicate that you are slightly correcting or giving more detailed information about what you have been saying.

example.ex: A small number — five, to be exact—have been bad...
example.tran: 一小部分——确切地说是5个——已经坏了。

example.ex: I consider myself to be a liberal democrat, or to be more exact, a democratic liberal.
example.tran: 我认为自己是个自由主义的民主党人，或者更准确地说，是倡导民主的自由主义者。

collins.def: The seventh item in a series is the one that you count as number seven.

example.ex: I was the seventh child in a family of 11.
example.tran: 我在家里的 11 个孩子中排行老七。

collins.def: A seventh is one of seven equal parts of something.

example.ex: A million people died, a seventh of the population.
example.tran: 共有 100 万人丧生，占总人口的七分之一。

means: 匆忙离去（有时与 off 连用）

collins.def: When you pack a bag, you put clothes and other things into it, because you are leaving a place or going on holiday.

example.ex: When I was 17, I packed my bags and left home...
example.tran: 17岁时，我背起行囊离开了家。

example.ex: I decided to pack a few things and take the kids to my Mum's...
example.tran: 我决定收拾些东西，带孩子们去我妈妈家。

collins.def: When people pack things, for example in a factory, they put them into containers or parcels so that they can be transported and sold.

example.ex: They offered me a job packing goods in a warehouse...
example.tran: 他们给了我一份在货栈打包的工作。

example.ex: Machines now exist to pack olives in jars.
example.tran: 现在可用机器将橄榄装进罐子里。

collins.def: If people or things pack into a place or if they pack a place, there are so many of them that the place is full.

example.ex: Hundreds of thousands of people packed into the mosque...
example.tran: 几十万人挤进了那座清真寺。

example.ex: Seventy thousand people will pack the stadium.
example.tran: 将有7万人挤满整个体育场。

collins.def: A pack of things is a collection of them that is sold or given together in a box or bag.

example.ex: The club will send a free information pack.
example.tran: 这家俱乐部会邮寄一个免费资料包。

example.ex: ...a pack of cigarettes...
example.tran: 一包烟

collins.def: A pack is a bag containing your possessions that you carry on your back when you are travelling.

example.ex: I hid the money in my pack.
example.tran: 我把钱藏在旅行包里。

collins.def: You can refer to a group of people who go around together as a pack, especially when it is a large group that you feel threatened by.

example.ex: ...a pack of journalists eager to question him...
example.tran: 一群急着要问他问题的记者

example.ex: Sal was the leader of the pack.
example.tran: 萨尔是这伙人的头儿。

collins.def: A pack of wolves or dogs is a group of them that hunt together.
A pack of playing cards is a complete set of playing cards.

example.ex: ...a pack of cards.
example.tran: 一副纸牌

example.ex: ...shuffle the pack.
example.tran: 洗牌

collins.def: If someone packs a gun, they carry it.

example.ex: ...eight bodyguards, at least one of them packing a pistol.
example.tran: 8名保镖，其中至少有1人佩枪

collins.tran: 在（陪审团、委员会、会议等）中安插支持者
collins.def: If someone packs a jury, committee, or meeting, they make sure that it includes people who support them.

example.ex: Opposition parties have boycotted the proceedings, saying the government has packed the conference with its own supporters...
example.tran: 反对党派抵制了该议程，声称政府在大会上安插了亲信。

example.ex: John Major will not try to pack the House of Lords.
example.tran: 约翰·梅杰不会在上议院安插亲信。

collins.def: If you say that an account is a pack of lies, you mean that it is completely untrue.

example.ex: You told me a pack of lies.
example.tran: 你跟我说的都是一派胡言。

collins.def: If something packs a punch, it has a very powerful effect.

example.ex: W. Somerset Maugham's novel still packs an emotional punch.
example.tran: 威廉·萨默塞特·毛姆的小说仍具有强烈的情感冲击力。

example.ex: ...drinks that pack a punch.
example.tran: 烈酒

collins.def: If you send someone packing,  you make them go away.

example.ex: I decided I wanted to live alone and I sent him packing.
example.tran: 我决定要一个人生活，于是叫他走人。

collins.def: You can say that someone is ahead of the pack or leading the pack if they are ahead of everyone else in a race or competition.

example.ex: The Socialists may still finish ahead of the pack...
example.tran: 社会党最终仍可能会领先。

example.ex: Europe has got used to following rather than leading the pack.
example.tran: 欧洲已经习惯了跟从，而不是领头儿。

collins.def: If you trust someone, you believe that they are honest and sincere and will not deliberately do anything to harm you.

example.ex: 'I trust you completely,' he said...
example.tran: “我完全信任你，”他说。

example.ex: He did argue in a general way that the president can't be trusted.
example.tran: 他确实泛泛提过总统不可信赖。

collins.def: Your trust in someone is your belief that they are honest and sincere and will not deliberately do anything to harm you.

example.ex: He destroyed me and my trust in men...
example.tran: 他毁了我，也摧毁了我对男人的信任。

example.ex: You've betrayed their trust...
example.tran: 你已经背叛了他们的信任。

collins.def: If you trust someone to do something, you believe that they will do it.

example.ex: That's why I must trust you to keep this secret...
example.tran: 那就是为什么我必须得相信你会保守这个秘密的原因。

example.ex: They argued that the ruling party could not be trusted to oversee its own removal from power.
example.tran: 他们争辩说不能相信执政党会监督解除自身的权力。

collins.def: If you trust someone with something important or valuable, you allow them to look after it or deal with it.

example.ex: This could make your superiors hesitate to trust you with major responsibilities...
example.tran: 这样会使上级不敢对你委以重任。

example.ex: I'd trust him with my life.
example.tran: 我愿把终身托付给他。

collins.def: If you do not trust something, you feel that it is not safe or reliable.

example.ex: She nodded, not trusting her own voice...
example.tran: 她只点点头，没有说话。

example.ex: For one thing, he didn't trust his legs to hold him up...
example.tran: 首先，他不相信自己能站起来。

collins.def: If you trust someone's judgment or advice, you believe that it is good or right.

example.ex: Jake has raised two smashing kids and I trust his judgement…
example.tran: 杰克养大了两个了不起的孩子，我相信他的判断。

example.ex: I blame myself and will never be able to trust my instinct again.
example.tran: 我自责，而且今后再也不能相信自己的直觉了。

collins.tran: 希望…是对的;估计…是对的
collins.def: If you say you trust that something is true, you mean you hope and expect that it is true.

example.ex: I trust you will take the earliest opportunity to make a full apology...
example.tran: 我想你会一抓住机会就诚恳道歉的。

example.ex: We trust that he and his department are considering our suggestion.
example.tran: 我们估计他和他的部门正在考虑我们的建议。

collins.def: If you trust in someone or something, you believe strongly in them, and do not doubt their powers or their good intentions.

example.ex: He was a pastor who trusted in the Lord who lived to preach.
example.tran: 作为一名牧师，他相信上帝是用一生去传教的。

example.ex: Don't blindly trust in the good faith of any government official.
example.tran: 不要盲目信任任何政府官员的诚意。

collins.def: A trust is a financial arrangement in which a group of people or an organization keeps and invests money for someone.

example.ex: You could also set up a trust so the children can't spend any inheritance until they are a certain age…
example.tran: 你也可以设立财产信托，这样孩子们只有达到一定年龄才能动用遗产。

example.ex: The money will be put in trust until she is 18.
example.tran: 钱会交付他人托管，直到她年满 18 岁。

collins.tran: 信托基金机构;财产托管机构
collins.def: A trust is a group of people or an organization that has control of an amount of money or property and invests it on behalf of other people or as a charity.

example.ex: He had set up two charitable trusts...
example.tran: 他已设立了两个慈善信托机构。

example.ex: The National Childbirth Trust has recently conducted a survey of 1,271 new mothers.
example.tran: 国家生育信托基金会最近对 1,271 位新妈妈做了一个调查。

collins.tran: 公立医院(由政府资助、独立经营)
collins.def: In Britain, a trust or a trust hospital is a public hospital that receives its funding directly from the national government. It has its own board of governors and is not controlled by the local health authority.

example.ex: St Mary's Hospital in Paddington became a self-governing trust this week.
example.tran: 帕丁顿的圣玛丽医院这周成为政府资助的独立经营医院。

collins.def: If something valuable is kept in trust, it is held and protected by a group of people or an organization on behalf of other people.

example.ex: The British Library holds its collection in trust for the nation...
example.tran: 大不列颠图书馆为国家保存被托管藏书。

example.ex: Works of art are in trust to us during our lifetime.
example.tran: 艺术品交由我们托管一生。

collins.def: If you take something on trust after having heard or read it, you believe it completely without checking it.

example.ex: He was adamant that the allegations were untrue, so I took him on trust.
example.tran: 他坚持认为那些指控不属实，因此我也完全相信他。

collins.def: Someone's presence in a place is the fact that they are there.

example.ex: They argued that his  presence in the village could only stir up trouble...
example.tran: 他们认为他在村里出现只会招惹麻烦。

example.ex: Her Majesty later honoured the Headmaster with her presence at lunch.
example.tran: 随后女王陛下出席了午餐，令校长感到荣幸。

collins.def: If you say that someone has presence, you mean that they impress people by their appearance and manner.

example.ex: They do not seem to have the vast, authoritative presence of those great men...
example.tran: 他们看起来并没有那些伟人的翩翩风度和威严。

example.ex: Hendrix's stage presence appealed to thousands of teenage rebels.
example.tran: 亨德里克斯在台上的风采吸引了成千上万的叛逆少年。

collins.def: A presence is a person or creature that you cannot see, but that you are aware of.

example.ex: The forest was dark and silent, haunted by shadows and unseen presences...
example.tran: 这个森林黑暗寂静，经常有幽灵和看不见的鬼怪出没。

example.ex: She started to be affected by the ghostly presence she could feel in the house.
example.tran: 她觉得这座房子里有可怕的鬼怪，开始变得神经紧张。

collins.def: If a country has a military presence in another country, it has some of its armed forces there.

example.ex: The Philippine government wants the US to maintain a military presence in Southeast Asia.
example.tran: 菲律宾政府希望美国继续在东南亚驻军。

collins.def: If you refer to the presence of a substance in another thing, you mean that it is in that thing.

example.ex: The somewhat acid flavour is caused by the presence of lactic acid.
example.tran: 这种微酸的味道是因为含有乳酸造成的。

example.ex: ...the presence of a carcinogen in the water...
example.tran: 水中含有的一种致癌物质

collins.def: If you make your presence felt, you do something which makes people notice you or pay attention to you.

example.ex: Rather than politely lobbying politicians, Gay Dignity will be making its presence felt through demonstrations.
example.tran: “同性恋尊严”游行活动不会彬彬有礼地向政客们游说，而会通过示威引起关注。

collins.def: If you are in someone's presence, you are in the same place as that person, and are close enough to them to be seen or heard.

example.ex: The talks took place in the presence of a diplomatic observer.
example.tran: 会谈是在一位外交观察员在场的情况下进行的。

collins.def: If you say that someone had the presence of mind to do something, you approve of them because they were able to think and act calmly in a difficult situation.

example.ex: He had the presence of mind to put his emergency oxygen tube in his mouth.
example.tran: 他镇定自若地把应急输氧管放进了自己的嘴里。

collins.def: A settlement is an official agreement between two sides who were involved in a conflict or argument.

example.ex: Our objective must be to secure a peace settlement...
example.tran: 我们一定要达成和平协议。

example.ex: They are not optimistic about a settlement of the eleven year conflict.
example.tran: 他们不是很有信心能和平解决这场长达 11 年的纷争。

collins.tran: (通过赔偿等达成的)庭外和解
collins.def: A settlement is an agreement to end a disagreement or dispute without going to a court of law, for example by offering someone money.

example.ex: She accepted an out-of-court settlement of £4,000.
example.tran: 她同意支付 4,000 英镑的庭外和解赔偿金。

example.ex: ...a libel settlement.
example.tran: 一宗诽谤案的庭外和解

collins.def: The settlement of a debt is the act of paying back money that you owe.

example.ex: ...ways to delay the settlement of debts.
example.tran: 延期清偿债务的办法

collins.def: A settlement is a place where people have come to live and have built homes.

example.ex: The village is a settlement of just fifty houses.
example.tran: 这个村子里只住了 50户人。

example.ex: ...a Muslim settlement.
example.tran: 穆斯林聚居区

collins.def: The settlement of a group of people is the process in which they settle in a place where people from their country have never lived before.

example.ex: ...the settlement of immigrants in the occupied territories.
example.tran: 向占领地移民的殖民开拓

collins.def: A flight is a journey made by flying, usually in an aeroplane.

example.ex: The flight will take four hours.
example.tran: 这次航行要飞 4 个小时。

collins.def: You can refer to an aeroplane carrying passengers on a particular journey as a particular flight .

example.ex: I'll try to get on the flight down to Karachi tonight...
example.tran: 我尽量赶上今晚去卡拉奇的航班。

example.ex: BA flight 286 was two hours late.
example.tran: 英国航空公司 286 次航班晚点两个小时。

collins.def: Flight is the action of flying, or the ability to fly.

example.ex: These hawks are magnificent in flight, soaring and circling for long periods...
example.tran: 这些鹰飞行能力极其出色，可以长时间在空中翱翔和盘旋。

example.ex: Supersonic flight could become a routine form of travel in the 21st century.
example.tran: 搭乘超音速飞机会成为 21 世纪常规的旅行方式。

collins.def: A flight of birds is a group of them flying together.

example.ex: A flight of green parrots shot out of the cedar forest.
example.tran: 一群绿鹦鹉从杉木林里疾速飞出。

collins.def: Flight is the act of running away from a dangerous or unpleasant situation or place.

example.ex: Frank was in full flight when he reached them...
example.tran: 弗兰克正在拼命奔逃，这时他联系到了他们。

example.ex: The family was often in flight, hiding out in friends' houses.
example.tran: 这一家人常常东躲西藏，在朋友家里避风头。

collins.def: A flight of steps or stairs is a set of steps or stairs that lead from one level to another without changing direction.

example.ex: We walked in silence up a flight of stairs and down a long corridor.
example.tran: 我们默默地走上一段楼梯，穿过一个长长的走廊。

collins.def: An idea or statement that is very imaginative but complicated, silly, or impractical can be referred to as a flight of fancy .

example.ex: Cockburn engaged in a flight of fancy, never once allowing facts to get in the way.
example.tran: 科伯恩一直在想入非非，从不曾考虑现实状况。

collins.def: If someone takes flight, they run away from an unpleasant situation or place.

example.ex: He was told of the raid and decided to take flight immediately.
example.tran: 他得知要突击搜查，决定立刻逃走。

collins.def: Something that is hot has a high temperature.

example.ex: When the oil is hot, add the sliced onion...
example.tran: 油热了后，放入切好的洋葱。
