example.ex: What he needed was a hot bath and a good sleep...
example.tran: 他需要洗个热水澡，好好睡一觉。

collins.tran: 天气热的;气温高的;炎热的
collins.def: Hot is used to describe the weather or the air in a room or building when the temperature is high.

example.ex: It was too hot even for a gentle stroll...
example.tran: 天太热，连慢慢散步都吃不消。

example.ex: It was a hot, humid summer day...
example.tran: 这是个炎热潮湿的夏日。

collins.def: If you are hot, you feel as if your body is at an unpleasantly high temperature.

example.ex: I was too hot and tired to eat more than a few mouthfuls...
example.tran: 我又热又累，只吃了几口就吃不下了。

example.ex: My head was reeling. I felt hot all over.
example.tran: 我的头很晕。我感觉全身滚烫。

collins.def: You use hot to talk or ask about how high the temperature of something is.

example.ex: They are called incandescent lights, and their colour depends on how hot they are...
example.tran: 这种灯叫做白炽灯，其颜色取决于温度。

example.ex: Remember that the top of the oven will be hotter than the bottom.
example.tran: 记住，烤炉的顶部将比底部温度更高。

collins.def: Hot food is intended to be eaten as soon as it is cooked, as opposed to food that you eat when it has cooled or that you do not cook at all.

example.ex: If you live alone, you might not want to cook a hot meal every day.
example.tran: 如果单身居住，你可能不会想每天都做一顿热菜热饭。

collins.def: You can say that food is hot when it has a strong, burning taste caused by chillies, pepper, or ginger.

example.ex: ...hot curries.
example.tran: 辛辣的咖喱食品

example.ex: ...a dish that's spicy but not too hot.
example.tran: 加了香料但并不太辣的菜

collins.tran: （议题、话题）热门的，受到广泛关注的
collins.def: A hot issue or topic is one that is very important at the present time and is receiving a lot of publicity.

example.ex: The role of women in war has been a hot topic of debate in America since the Gulf conflict.
example.tran: 自海湾冲突以来，妇女在战争中的作用一直是美国国内一个备受争议的热门话题。

collins.tran: （消息）刚发布的，最新的，新近的
collins.def: Hot news is new, recent, and fresh.

example.ex: ...eight pages of the latest movies, video releases and the hot news from Tinseltown.
example.tran: 有关上档电影、发行影碟及好莱坞最新消息的8页报道

collins.tran: 风行的;走红的;炙手可热的
collins.def: You can use hot to describe something that is very exciting and that many people want to see, use, obtain, or become involved with.

example.ex: The hottest show in town was the Monet Exhibition at the Art Institute...
example.tran: 全城最轰动的展览是在美术学院举办的莫奈画展。

example.ex: When I was last there, the hot place was the Royal Bachelors' Club.
example.tran: 我上次在那里时，最热闹的地方是皇家单身汉俱乐部。

collins.tran: （常指非法获得的贵重或知名物品）烫手的，难以销赃的
collins.def: You can use hot to describe something that no one wants to deal with, often because it has been illegally obtained and is very valuable or famous.

example.ex: If too much publicity is given to the theft of important works, the works will become too hot to handle and be destroyed.
example.tran: 如果重要作品遭窃一事被大肆报道，这些作品就会因为难以转手而被销毁。

collins.def: You can describe a situation that is created by a person's behaviour or attitude as hot when it is unpleasant and difficult to deal with.

example.ex: When the streets get too hot for them, they head south in one stolen car after another.
example.tran: 当他们觉得在街头混不下去了时，就沿途不断偷车换开，一路往南去了。

collins.tran: （比赛）激烈的，双方全力以赴的
collins.def: A hot contest is one that is intense and involves a great deal of activity and determination.

example.ex: It took hot competition from abroad, however, to show us just how good Scottish cashmere really is.
example.tran: 然而，我们是通过来自国外的激烈竞争才认识到了苏格兰羊绒的优良品质。

collins.tran: 被看好的;最有望获胜的
collins.def: If a person or team is the hot favourite, people think that they are the one most likely to win a race or competition.

example.ex: Atlantic City is the hot favourite to stage the fight.
example.tran: 在大西洋城举行这场拳击比赛是众望所归。

collins.def: Someone who has a hot temper gets angry very quickly and easily.

example.ex: His hot temper was making it increasingly difficult for others to work with him.
example.tran: 他的火暴脾气使得别人越来越难以和他合作。

collins.def: If someone blows hot and cold, they keep changing their attitude towards something, sometimes being very enthusiastic and at other times expressing no interest at all.

example.ex: The media, meanwhile, has blown hot and cold on the affair.
example.tran: 同时，媒体对这件事的态度表现得忽冷忽热。

collins.tran: 焦虑不安;六神无主;举止失常
collins.def: If you are hot and bothered, you are so worried and anxious that you cannot think clearly or behave sensibly.

example.ex: Ray was getting very hot and bothered about the idea.
example.tran: 这个想法让雷心慌意乱。

collins.def: If you say that one person has the hots for another, you mean that they feel a strong sexual attraction to that person.

example.ex: I've had the hots for him ever since he came to college.
example.tran: 自从他来上大学后，我就对他春心萌动。

collins.def: A pattern is the repeated or regular way in which something happens or is done.

example.ex: All three attacks followed the same pattern...
example.tran: 3次袭击模式相同。

example.ex: A change in the pattern of his breathing became apparent.
example.tran: 他的呼吸方式明显起了变化。

collins.def: A pattern is an arrangement of lines or shapes, especially a design in which the same shape is repeated at regular intervals over a surface.

example.ex: ...a golden robe embroidered with red and purple thread stitched into a pattern of flames.
example.tran: 用红线和紫线绣着火焰图案的金色礼袍

collins.def: A pattern is a diagram or shape that you can use as a guide when you are making something such as a model or a piece of clothing.

example.ex: ...cutting out a pattern for trousers...
example.tran: 裁出裤子的样板

example.ex: Send for our free patterns to knit yourself.
example.tran: 欢迎函索免费式样体验自己编织的乐趣。

collins.def: Death is the permanent end of the life of a person or animal.

example.ex: 1.5 million people are in immediate danger of death from starvation.
example.tran: 150 万人正面临着被饿死的急迫危险。

example.ex: ...the thirtieth anniversary of her death...
example.tran: 她逝世 30 周年的纪念日

collins.def: A particular kind of death is a particular way of dying.

example.ex: They made sure that he died a horrible death...
example.tran: 他们让他死得很惨。

example.ex: He would rather have a decent death which served some purpose than a meaningless death.
example.tran: 他宁愿死得其所，也不想无谓地死去。

collins.def: The death of something is the permanent end of it.

example.ex: It meant the death of everything he had ever been or ever hoped to be.
example.tran: 这意味着他过去的一切存在或曾经希望的存在均已终结。

example.ex: ...the death of pop music.
example.tran: 流行音乐的死亡

collins.def: If you say that someone is at death's door, you mean they are very ill indeed and likely to die.

example.ex: He told his boss a tale about his mother being at death's door...
example.tran: 他向老板谎称自己的母亲病危。

example.ex: My dad was the same. He could be at death's door but wouldn't say a word.
example.tran: 我爸爸也一样。他就算已经病得快不行了也还是会一声不吭。

collins.def: If you say that you will fight to the death for something, you are emphasizing that you will do anything to achieve or protect it, even if you suffer as a consequence.

example.ex: He said they did not want war—but if attacked they would fight to the death...
example.tran: 他说他们不希望有战争——但一旦遭到攻击，定会战斗到底。

example.ex: She'd  have fought to the death for that child.
example.tran: 她会为了那个孩子抗争到底。

collins.def: If you refer to a fight or contest as a fight to the death, you are emphasizing that it will not stop until the death or total victory of one of the opponents.

example.ex: ...an eleven-hour fight to the death between a baboon and leopard...
example.tran: 一只狒狒和一头美洲豹之间长达 11小时的殊死搏斗

example.ex: He now faces a fight to the death to reach the quarter-finals.
example.tran: 他现在面临一场杀入四分之一决赛的殊死决战。

collins.tran: 生死攸关的;至关重要的
collins.def: If you say that something is a matter of life and death, you are emphasizing that it is extremely important, often because someone may die or suffer great harm if people do not act immediately.

example.ex: Well, never mind, John, it's not a matter of life and death...
example.tran: 好了，约翰，别太在意了。这又不是什么生死攸关的大事。

example.ex: We're dealing with a life-and-death situation here...
example.tran: 我们正面临一个生死关头。

collins.def: If someone is put to death, they are executed.

example.ex: Those put to death by firing squad included three generals.
example.tran: 行刑队处决的那些人里有 3 名将军。

collins.def: You use to death after a verb to indicate that a particular action or process results in someone's death.

example.ex: He was stabbed to death.
example.tran: 他被刀刺中身亡。

example.ex: ...relief missions to try to keep the country's population from starving to death...
example.tran: 努力确保该国人民不被饿死的救援任务

collins.tran: (用于形容词或动词后，表示强调)吓得要死/无聊得要命
collins.def: You use to death after an adjective or a verb to emphasize the action, state, or feeling mentioned. For example, if you are frightened to death or bored to death, you are extremely frightened or bored.

example.ex: He scares teams to death with his pace and power...
example.tran: 他的速度之快、力量之大让其他队胆战不已。

example.ex: Whereas 10 years ago I would have worried myself to death about it, now I accept it is part of the game...
example.tran: 10 年前我会为此担心得要命，但现在我接受了它是游戏的一部分。

collins.tran: 使…累死累活地工作（或劳动）
collins.def: If you say that someone works another person to death, you are emphasizing that they make them work very hard indeed, especially in a way that seems cruel or unfair.

example.ex: They worked themselves to death but never lost their humour.
example.tran: 他们累死累活地干活，但却从没有丢掉幽默感。

means: 行，用以表达准许或同意之意

collins.tran: （表示令人满意或可以接受）不错的，可以的
collins.def: If you say that something is okay, you find it satisfactory or acceptable.

example.ex: ...a shooting range where it's OK to use weapons...
example.tran: 可以使用武器的射击场

example.ex: Is it okay if I come by myself?...
example.tran: 我一个人来行吗？

collins.def: If you say that someone is okay, you mean that they are safe and well.

example.ex: Check that the baby's okay...
example.tran: 看看孩子是否还好。

example.ex: 'Don't worry about me,' I said. 'I'll be okay.'
example.tran: “别担心我，”我说，“我不会有事的。”

collins.def: You can say 'Okay' to show that you agree to something.

example.ex: 'Just tell him Sir Kenneth would like to talk to him.' — 'OK.'...
example.tran: “就跟他说肯尼思爵士想跟他谈谈。”——“好的。”

example.ex: 'Shall I give you a ring on Friday?' — 'Yeah okay.'
example.tran: “我星期五给你打电话好吗？”——“好的。”

collins.tran: （询问对方是否领会或同意）好吗，行吗，明白吗
collins.def: You can say 'Okay?' to check whether the person you are talking to understands what you have said and accepts it.

example.ex: Add them together, divide by five, and you've got the average. Okay?...
example.tran: 把它们相加再除以5就是平均数，明白吗？

example.ex: We'll get together next week, OK?
example.tran: 我们下周聚一聚，好吗？

collins.tran: （表示希望转换话题或做别的事情）好了
collins.def: You can use okay to indicate that you want to start talking about something else or doing something else.

example.ex: OK. Now, let's talk some business...
example.tran: 好了，我们现在言归正传吧。

example.ex: Tim jumped to his feet. 'Okay, let's go.'
example.tran: 蒂姆一跃而起，“好了，我们走吧。”

collins.tran: （不情愿地表示接受对方观点以制止其争辩）得了，行了
collins.def: You can use okay to stop someone arguing with you by showing that you accept the point they are making, though you do not necessarily regard it as very important.

example.ex: Okay, there is a slight difference...
example.tran: 行了，是略有不同。

example.ex: Okay, so I'm forty-two.
example.tran: 得了，我就算42岁吧。

collins.def: If someone in authority okays something, they officially agree to it or allow it to happen.

example.ex: His doctor wouldn't OK the trip...
example.tran: 医生不会同意他去旅行。

example.ex: We are all wondering why the government is suddenly okaying a brand new school on the island.
example.tran: 我们都很疑惑为什么政府突然批准在岛上建一所新学校。

collins.def: Investment is the activity of investing money.

example.ex: He said the government must introduce tax incentives to encourage investment...
example.tran: 他说政府必须推出税收激励政策来鼓励投资。

example.ex: One of the most important changes concerns the investment of pension contributions.
example.tran: 最重要的一个变化涉及养老保险基金的投资。

collins.def: An investment is an amount of money that you invest, or the thing that you invest it in.

example.ex: ...an investment of twenty-eight million pounds...
example.tran: 2,800万英镑的投资金额

example.ex: You'll be able to earn an average rate of return of 8% on your investments.
example.tran: 你将能获得 8% 的平均投资收益率。

collins.tran: 有用的投资物;值得买的东西
collins.def: If you describe something you buy as an investment, you mean that it will be useful, especially because it will help you to do a task more cheaply or efficiently.

example.ex: When selecting boots, fine, quality leather will be a wise investment...
example.tran: 在挑选长筒靴的时候,购买上等的好皮靴将是明智的选择。

example.ex: A small-screen portable TV can be a good investment.
example.tran: 小屏幕的便携式电视机很值得买。

collins.def: Investment of time or effort is the spending of time or effort on something in order to make it a success.

example.ex: I worry about this big investment of time and effort.
example.tran: 我担心投入这么多时间与精力却不起作用。

collins.def: A baby is a very young child, especially one that cannot yet walk or talk.

example.ex: She used to take care of me when I was a baby...
example.tran: 我还在襁褓中时，她曾经照顾过我。

example.ex: My wife has just had a baby...
example.tran: 我妻子刚生了孩子。

collins.def: A baby animal is a very young animal.

example.ex: ...a baby elephant.
example.tran: 幼象

example.ex: ...baby birds.
example.tran: 雏鸟

collins.def: Baby vegetables are vegetables picked when they are very small.

example.ex: Serve with baby new potatoes.
example.tran: 配上小个的新土豆。

collins.tran: 宝贝儿（昵称，尤用于年轻女性）
collins.def: Some people use baby as an affectionate way of addressing someone, especially a young woman, or referring to them.

example.ex: You have to wake up now, baby...
example.tran: 该起床了，宝贝儿。

example.ex: He was confused, poor baby.
example.tran: 他都懵了，可怜的家伙。

collins.tran: 把婴儿和洗澡水一起倒掉；将精华连同糟粕一起丢弃；不分好坏地全盘抛弃
collins.def: If you throw the baby out with the bath water, you lose the good parts of something as well as the bad parts, because you reject it as a whole instead of just removing what is bad.

collins.tran: 替他人擦屁股；替别人干苦差事
collins.def: If you are left holding the baby, you are put in a situation where you are responsible for something, often in an unfair way because other people fail or refuse to take responsibility for it.

example.ex: You go off round the world, and leave me to hold the baby.
example.tran: 你满世界地跑，把苦差事都扔给我。

collins.def: Equipment consists of the things which are used for a particular purpose, for example a hobby or job.

example.ex: ...computers, electronic equipment and machine tools.
example.tran: 计算机、电子设备和机床

example.ex: ...outdoor playing equipment.
example.tran: 户外游乐设备

collins.def: You use degree to indicate the extent to which something happens or is the case, or the amount which something is felt.

example.ex: These man-made barriers will ensure a very high degree of protection...
example.tran: 这些人造屏障将会确保提供高度的保护。

example.ex: Politicians have used television with varying degrees of success.
example.tran: 政客们已经利用电视取得了不同程度的成功。

collins.tran: （表示相对的数量、规模或范围）程度问题/ 程度上不同
collins.def: You use degree in expressions such as a matter of degree and different in degree to indicate that you are talking about the comparative quantity, scale, or extent of something, rather than other factors.

example.ex: The first change is a matter of degree, the second is a fundamental shift...
example.tran: 第一个改变只是程度上的变化，而第二个则是根本性的转变。

example.ex: Generally, the programs of the president and the proposals of the governor appear to differ in degree and emphasis rather than ideology.
example.tran: 总的来说，总统的方案和州长的提议似乎只是在程度和强调的重点上有所不同，根本的思想观念几乎无异。

collins.def: A degree is a unit of measurement that is used to measure temperatures. It is often written as ˚, for example 23˚.

example.ex: It's over 80 degrees outside...
example.tran: 外面的温度超过了 80 度。

example.ex: Pure water sometimes does not freeze until it reaches minus 40 degrees Celsius.
example.tran: 纯净水有时候要降到零下40摄氏度才会结冰。

collins.tran: 度，度数(可以表示角度、经度、纬度等)
collins.def: A degree is a unit of measurement that is used to measure angles, and also longitude and latitude. It is often written as as '˚', for example 23˚.

example.ex: It was pointing outward at an angle of 45 degrees.
example.tran: 它向外指向 45 度角的方向。

example.ex: ...McMurdo Station in Antarctica, which is at 78 degrees South.
example.tran: 位于南纬 78 度的麦克默多南极考察站

collins.def: A degree at a university or college is a course of study that you take there, or the qualification that you get when you have passed the course.

example.ex: He took a master's degree in economics at Yale.
example.tran: 他选择了攻读耶鲁大学的经济学硕士学位。

example.ex: ...an engineering degree.
example.tran: 工程学学位

collins.def: If something happens by degrees, it happens slowly and gradually.

example.ex: The crowd in Robinson's Coffee-House was thinning, but only by degrees.
example.tran: 鲁宾逊咖啡屋里的人正在变少，但也只是渐少而已。

collins.tran: 在一定/很大/ 某种程度上
collins.def: You use expressions such as to some degree ,to a large degree, or to a certain degree in order to indicate that something is partly true, but not entirely true.

example.ex: These statements are, to some degree, all correct.
example.tran: 这些声明从某种程度上来说全都属实。

collins.def: You use expressions such as to what degree and to the degree that when you are discussing how true a statement is, or in what ways it is true.

example.ex: To what degree would you say you had control over things that went on?...
example.tran: 你认为发生的事情在多大程度上是在你的掌控之下？

example.ex: He believes in himself to such a degree that he abuses his friends.
example.tran: 他对自己极为自信，以至于竟然辱骂朋友。

collins.tran: (尤指赴他国的)使命，重要任务
collins.def: A mission is an important task that people are given to do, especially one that involves travelling to another country.

example.ex: Salisbury sent him on a diplomatic mission to North America...
example.tran: 索尔兹伯里派他到北美执行一项外交任务。

example.ex: He has been on a mission to help end Lebanon's political crisis.
example.tran: 他已经被派执行一项旨在帮助结束黎巴嫩政治危机的使命。

collins.def: A mission is a group of people who have been sent to a foreign country to carry out an official task.

example.ex: ...the head of the mission in South Africa.
example.tran: 驻南非代表团团长

example.ex: ...a senior member of a diplomatic mission.
example.tran: 外交使团的高级成员

collins.tran: （军用飞机或航天火箭的）飞行任务
collins.def: A mission is a special journey made by a military aeroplane or space rocket.

example.ex: ...a bomber that crashed during a training mission in the west Texas mountains.
example.tran: 在得克萨斯州西部山区执行训练任务时坠毁的轰炸机

example.ex: ...the first shuttle mission.
example.tran: 首次航天飞行任务

collins.def: If you say that you have a mission, you mean that you have a strong commitment and sense of duty to do or achieve something.

example.ex: He viewed his mission in life as protecting the weak from the evil...
example.tran: 他认为自己毕生的使命就是保护弱者不受邪恶势力的欺凌。

example.ex: There is an enormous sense of mission in his speech and gesture.
example.tran: 他的一言一行都带着强烈的使命感。

collins.def: A mission is the activities of a group of Christians who have been sent to a place to teach people about Christianity.

example.ex: They say God spoke to them and told them to go on a mission to the poorest country in the Western Hemisphere.
example.tran: 他们说上帝让他们去西半球最贫困的国家传播教义。

collins.def: A mission is a building or group of buildings in which missionary work is carried out.

example.ex: I reside at the mission at St Michael's.
example.tran: 我住在圣·米歇尔教堂的传道会里。

example.ex: ...schools, monasteries and other mission buildings.
example.tran: 学校、修道院及其他布道场所

collins.tran: (用于疑问句，询问人的姓名或身份)谁
collins.def: You use whom in questions when you ask about the name or identity of a person or group of people.

example.ex: 'I want to send a telegram.' — 'Fine, to whom?'...
example.tran: “我想发份电报。”——“好的，发给谁？”

example.ex: Whom did he expect to answer his phone?...
example.tran: 他希望由谁来接电话？

collins.tran: (尤用于某些动词和形容词后，引导谈论某人或某一群人的姓名或身份的从句)谁
collins.def: You use whom after certain words, especially verbs and adjectives, to introduce a clause where you talk about the name or identity of a person or a group of people.

example.ex: He asked whom I'd told about his having been away...
example.tran: 他问我把他曾离开的消息告诉过谁。

example.ex: He likes to know whom you've met...
example.tran: 他想知道你见了谁。

collins.tran: (用于进行限定说明或提供更多信息的关系从句的句首)
collins.def: You use whom at the beginning of a relative clause when specifying the person or group of people you are talking about or when giving more information about them.

example.ex: One writer in whom I had taken an interest was Immanuel Velikovsky...
example.tran: 我感兴趣的其中一位作家是伊曼纽尔·韦利科夫斯基。

example.ex: The Homewood residents whom I knew had little money and little free time.
example.tran: 我所认识的霍姆伍德的居民没多少钱也没多少闲暇时间。

collins.def: If you collect a number of things, you bring them together from several places or from several people.

example.ex: Two young girls were collecting firewood...
example.tran: 两个小女孩正在拾柴火。

example.ex: Elizabeth had been collecting snails for a school project...
example.tran: 伊丽莎白一直在为完成学校的一份课题作业收集蜗牛。

collins.def: If you collect things, such as stamps or books, as a hobby, you get a large number of them over a period of time because they interest you.

example.ex: I used to collect stamps...
example.tran: 我曾经集过邮。

example.ex: One of Tony's hobbies was collecting rare birds.
example.tran: 托尼的业余爱好之一是搜集稀有鸟类。

collins.def: When you collect someone or something, you go and get them from the place where they are waiting for you or have been left for you.

example.ex: David always collects Alistair from school on Wednesdays...
example.tran: 戴维总是星期三去学校接阿利斯泰尔。

example.ex: She had just collected her pension from the post office...
example.tran: 她刚去邮局取了养老金。

collins.def: If a substance collects somewhere, or if something collects it, it keeps arriving over a period of time and is held in that place or thing.

example.ex: Methane gas does collect in the mines around here.
example.tran: 周围的矿井里的确有沼气聚积。

example.ex: ...water tanks which collect rainwater from the house roof.
example.tran: 积存屋顶雨水的水箱

collins.def: If something collects light, energy, or heat, it attracts it.

example.ex: Like a telescope it has a curved mirror to collect the sunlight.
example.tran: 和望远镜一样，它有一个曲面镜可以积聚阳光。

collins.tran: (为慈善事业或礼品)筹款，集资;募捐
collins.def: If you collect for a charity or for a present for someone, you ask people to give you money for it.

example.ex: Are you collecting for charity?...
example.tran: 你是在为慈善事业筹款吗？

example.ex: They collected donations for a fund to help military families.
example.tran: 他们为一个旨在帮助军人家属的基金筹集捐款。

collins.tran: 尽力镇静下来;整理(思绪)
collins.def: If you collect yourself or collect your thoughts, you make an effort to calm yourself or prepare yourself mentally.

example.ex: She paused for a moment to collect herself...
example.tran: 她停了一会儿，让自己镇定下来。

example.ex: He was grateful for a chance to relax and collect his thoughts.
example.tran: 他很庆幸有机会放松放松，整理一下自己的思绪。

collins.def: A collect call is a telephone call that is paid for by the person receiving it, not the person making it.

example.ex: She received a collect phone call from Alaska.
example.tran: 她接到一个从阿拉斯加打来的付费电话。

collins.def: A solution to a problem or difficult situation is a way of dealing with it so that the difficulty is removed.

example.ex: Although he has sought to find a peaceful solution, he is facing pressure to use greater military force.
example.tran: 尽管他试图寻求和平解决，但现在却面临使用更多武力的压力。

example.ex: ...the ability to sort out simple, effective solutions to practical problems.
example.tran: 找出简单有效的方法解决实际问题的能力

collins.def: The solution to a puzzle is the answer to it.

example.ex: ...the solution to crossword No. 19721.
example.tran: 第 19721 号纵横字谜的答案

collins.def: A solution is a liquid in which a solid substance has been dissolved.

example.ex: ...a warm solution of liquid detergent...
example.tran: 热洗涤剂溶液

example.ex: Vitamins in solution are more affected than those in solid foods.
example.tran: 溶液里的维生素比固体食物里的维生素受到的影响更大。

collins.def: Reform consists of changes and improvements to a law, social system, or institution. A reform is an instance of such a change or improvement.

example.ex: The party embarked on a programme of economic reform...
example.tran: 这个党开始进行经济改革。

example.ex: He has urged reform of the welfare system...
example.tran: 他极力主张进行福利制度改革。

collins.def: If someone reforms something such as a law, social system, or institution, they change or improve it.

example.ex: ...his plans to reform the country's economy...
example.tran: 他的国家经济改革计划

example.ex: A reformed party would have to win the approval of the people.
example.tran: 一个革新的政党需要赢得人民的认可。

collins.tran: （人）洗心革面；(使)改过自新；改造
collins.def: When someone reforms or when something reforms them, they stop doing things that society does not approve of, such as breaking the law or drinking too much alcohol.

example.ex: When his court case was coming up, James promised to reform...
example.tran: 他的案子即将开审的时候，詹姆斯保证会改过自新。

example.ex: We will try to reform him within the community.
example.tran: 我们将尽力在社区内部对他进行改造。

means: 意味着（ mean的第三人称单数）
打算或注定要某人成为或做某事

collins.tran: 方法;手段;工具(means 用于此意时单复数同形)
collins.def: A means of doing something is a method, instrument, or process which can be used to do it. Means is both the singular and the plural form for this use.

example.ex: The move is a means to fight crime...
example.tran: 采取这项举措是为了打击犯罪。

example.ex: The army had perfected the use of terror as a means of controlling the population...
example.tran: 军队已经深谙利用恐怖手段控制民众之道。

collins.def: You can refer to the money that someone has as their means .

example.ex: ...a person of means...
example.tran: 富人

example.ex: He did not have the means to compensate her.
example.tran: 他没有钱来补偿她。

collins.tran: 超出财力；入不敷出/在财力之内；量入为出
collins.def: If someone is living beyond their means, they are spending more money than they can afford. If someone is living within their means, they are not spending more money than they can afford.

example.ex: The more gifts she received, the more she craved, until he was living beyond his means...
example.tran: 得到的礼物越多，她的胃口就越大，直到他捉襟见肘为止。

example.ex: It is far better to pay off old debts steadily by living within your means.
example.tran: 量入为出地一步步偿还旧债，这个方法要好得多。

collins.def: If you do something by means of a particular method, instrument, or process, you do it using that method, instrument, or process.

example.ex: This is a two year course taught by means of lectures and seminars...
example.tran: 本课程为期两年，授课形式为讲座与研讨。

example.ex: The trailer was connected to the car by means of a complicated system of hoses, pipes and rods.
example.tran: 活动房屋通过一系列复杂的软管、管道和连杆与汽车相连。

collins.def: You can say 'by all means' to tell someone that you are very willing to allow them to do something.

example.ex: 'Can I come and have a look at your house?' — 'Yes by all means'.
example.tran: “我可以过来看看你的房子吗？”“当然可以。”

collins.tran: 决不;丝毫不;一点儿也不
collins.def: You use expressions such as 'by no means', 'not by any means', and 'by no manner of means' to emphasize that something is not true.

example.ex: This is by no means out of the ordinary...
example.tran: 这丝毫不足为奇。

example.ex: They were not finished, however, not by any means.
example.tran: 不过，他们并没有结束,绝对没有。

collins.def: If you say that something is a means to an end, you mean that it helps you to achieve what you want, although it may not be enjoyable or important itself.

example.ex: We seem to have lost sight of the fact that marketing is only a means to an end.
example.tran: 我们似乎忽略了这样一个事实：营销只是达到目的的手段。

collins.def: If a person threatens to do something unpleasant to you, or if they threaten you, they say or imply that they will do something unpleasant to you, especially if you do not do what they want.

example.ex: He said army officers had threatened to destroy the town...
example.tran: 他说陆军军官们曾威胁要摧毁那座小镇。

example.ex: He tied her up and threatened her with a six-inch knife...
example.tran: 他把她捆起来，拿着一把 6 英寸长的刀子威胁她。

collins.def: If something or someone threatens a person or thing, they are likely to harm that person or thing.

example.ex: The newcomers directly threaten the livelihood of the established workers...
example.tran: 新来的工人直接威胁到老工人的饭碗。

example.ex: The unity of our society is threatened by troublesome and restless minorities...
example.tran: 我们社会的团结遭到了一小撮滋扰生事、不安分守己的群体的威胁。

collins.def: If something unpleasant threatens to happen, it seems likely to happen.

example.ex: The fighting is threatening to turn into full-scale war...
example.tran: 这场战斗有可能会演变为全面的战争。

example.ex: Plants must be covered with a leaf-mould or similarly protected if frost threatens.
example.tran: 如果霜冻来临，植物必须盖上腐叶土或用类似方法加以保护。

collins.def: The rest is used to refer to all the parts of something or all the things in a group that remain or that you have not already mentioned.

example.ex: It was an experience I will treasure for the rest of my life...
example.tran: 我的余生都会珍惜这次经历。

example.ex: I'm going to throw a party, then invest the rest of the money...
example.tran: 我会开一个派对，然后把剩下的钱用来投资。

collins.tran: 诸如此类;如此等等;不一而足
collins.def: You can add and the rest or all the rest of it to the end of a statement or list when you want to refer in a vague way to other things that are associated with the ones you have already mentioned.

example.ex: ...a man with nice clothes, a Range Rover and the rest...
example.tran: 一个穿着体面、开着路虎如此等等的男人

example.ex: And what about racism and all the rest of it?
example.tran: 那种族主义之类的观念又怎么样呢？

collins.def: An executive is someone who is employed by a business at a senior level. Executives decide what the business should do, and ensure that it is done.

example.ex: ...an advertising executive.
example.tran: 广告主管

example.ex: ...Her husband is a senior bank executive.
example.tran: 她丈夫是银行高级主管。

collins.def: The executive sections and tasks of an organization are concerned with the making of decisions and with ensuring that decisions are carried out.

example.ex: A successful job search needs to be as well organised as any other executive task...
example.tran: 成功的求职与执行其他任何任务一样，都需要良好的条理性。

example.ex: I don't envisage I will take an executive role, but rather become a consultant on merchandise and marketing.
example.tran: 我不设想自己将成为管理人员，但很希望成为商品营销顾问。

collins.tran: 高级的;精美时髦的;供主管人员使用的
collins.def: Executive goods are expensive goods designed or intended for executives and other people at a similar social or economic level.

example.ex: ...an executive briefcase.
example.tran: 高级公文包

example.ex: ...a chain of shops specialising in pricey executive toys.
example.tran: 专卖价格昂贵的精美玩具的连锁商店

collins.tran: 执行委员会；行政委员会
collins.def: The executive committee or board of an organization is a committee within that organization which has the authority to make decisions and ensures that these decisions are carried out.

example.ex: He sits on the executive committee that manages Lloyds...
example.tran: 他是管理劳埃德保险公司的执行委员会成员。

example.ex: Some executive members have called for his resignation.
example.tran: 一些执行委员会成员要求他辞职。

collins.def: The executive is the part of the government of a country that is concerned with carrying out decisions or orders, as opposed to the part that makes laws or the part that deals with criminals.

example.ex: The government, the executive and the judiciary are supposed to be separate...
example.tran: 政府、行政部门和司法部门应该彼此分离。

example.ex: The matter should be resolved by the executive branch of government.
example.tran: 这个问题应该由政府的行政部门解决。

collins.def: Eventually means in the end, especially after a lot of delays, problems, or arguments.

example.ex: Eventually, the army caught up with him in Latvia...
example.tran: 最终，大部队在拉脱维亚赶上了他。

example.ex: The flight eventually got away six hours late.
example.tran: 那个航班推迟了6个小时后终于起飞。

collins.def: Eventually means at the end of a situation or process or as the final result of it.

example.ex: Eventually your child will leave home to lead her own life as a fully independent adult...
example.tran: 最后，你的孩子会离开家，作为一个完全独立的成年人过她自己的生活。

example.ex: She sees the bar as a starting point and eventually plans to run her own chain of country inns.
example.tran: 她把那间酒吧当作一个起点，最终计划是经营自己的乡村旅馆连锁店。

collins.def: The evening is the part of each day between the end of the afternoon and the time when you go to bed.

example.ex: All he did that evening was sit around the flat...
example.tran: 那天晚上他一直在公寓里无所事事地坐着。

example.ex: Supper is from 5.00 to 6.00 in the evening...
example.tran: 晚餐在傍晚5点到6点之间。

collins.def: A debt is a sum of money that you owe someone.

example.ex: Three years later, he is still paying off his debts...
example.tran: 都3年了，他仍在偿还债务。

example.ex: Shrinking economies mean falling tax revenues and more government debt.
example.tran: 经济收缩意味着税收的减少和政府债务的增加。

collins.def: Debt is the state of owing money.

example.ex: Stress is a main reason for debt.
example.tran: 重压是负债的一个主要原因。

collins.tran: (表示感激）我欠你个人情/我受你的恩惠
collins.def: You use debt in expressions such as I owe you a debt or I am in your debt when you are expressing gratitude for something that someone has done for you.

example.ex: He was so good to me that I can never repay the debt I owe him...
example.tran: 他对我太好了，我永远也还不清这份人情。

example.ex: I owe a debt of thanks to Joyce Thompson, whose careful and able research was of great help...
example.tran: 我要衷心地感谢乔伊斯·汤普森先生，他严谨而卓著的研究给予了我极大的帮助。

collins.def: If something proves to be true or to have a particular quality, it becomes clear after a period of time that it is true or has that quality.

example.ex: We have been accused of exaggerating before, but unfortunately all our reports proved to be true...
example.tran: 以前一直有人指责我们夸大事实，但遗憾的是，我们所有的报道都证明是真实的。

example.ex: In the past this process of transition has often proven difficult.
example.tran: 过去这一过渡过程常常很艰难。

collins.def: If you prove that something is true, you show by means of argument or evidence that it is definitely true.

example.ex: You brought this charge. You prove it!...
example.tran: 你提出了这项控告。你拿出证据来！

example.ex: The results prove that regulation of the salmon farming industry is inadequate.
example.tran: 结果证明对鲑鱼饲养行业的管理不够完善。

collins.def: If you prove yourself to have a certain good quality, you show by your actions that you have it.

example.ex: Margaret proved herself to be a good mother...
example.tran: 玛格丽特证明了自己是个好妈妈。

example.ex: As a composer he proved himself adept at large dramatic forms...
example.tran: 身为作曲家的他证明了自己在创作大型戏剧方面驾轻就熟。

collins.tran: 证明自己的能力（或知识）
collins.def: If you prove a point, you show other people that you know something or can do something, although your action may have no other purpose.

example.ex: They made a 3,000 mile detour simply to prove a point.
example.tran: 他们绕行3,000英里只是为了证明自己能够做到。

collins.def: The size of something is how big or small it is. Something's size is determined by comparing it to other things, counting it, or measuring it.

example.ex: Scientists have found the bones of a hoofed grazing animal about the size of a small horse...
example.tran: 科学家们已经发现了一种约有马驹般大小的有蹄草食性动物的骨骼。

example.ex: In 1970 the average size of a French farm was 19 hectares...
example.tran: 1970 年，法国农场的平均规模为 19 公顷。

collins.def: The size of something is the fact that it is very large.

example.ex: He knows the size of the task...
example.tran: 他明白这个任务有多艰巨。

example.ex: Jack walked around the hotel and was mesmerized by its sheer size.
example.tran: 杰克在宾馆里四处转了转，为其宏伟气势所倾倒。

collins.tran: (尤指衣服、鞋子等的)尺寸，尺码，号
collins.def: A size is one of a series of graded measurements, especially for things such as clothes or shoes.

example.ex: My sister is the same height but only a size 12...
example.tran: 我姐姐是一样的身高，不过只穿 12 号的。

example.ex: I tried them on and they were the right size.
example.tran: 我试穿了一下，大小正合适。

collins.tran: 使有自知之明;灭…的嚣张气焰
collins.def: If someone is cut down to size, something happens to make them realize that they are not as important as they think they are.

example.ex: The once-powerful post unions have been cut down to size.
example.tran: 一度很强势的邮政联盟已经威风不再。

collins.def: If an object is cut to size, its size is altered to make it suitable for a particular purpose.

example.ex: Every piece of timber was planed, cut to size and stained with cedar preservative.
example.tran: 每根木材都被刨平了，切割成一定尺寸，并涂上了雪松防腐剂。

collins.def: If you try something on for size, you try it to see if it is suitable for you.

example.ex: She was trying on an $8,000 jacket for size...
example.tran: 她正在试穿一件价值 8,000 美元的短外套。

example.ex: He suggests that Nietzsche was trying each style on for size.
example.tran: 他的言下之意是尼采当时正在尝试每一种风格。

means: 基本原则，基本原理，基本规律

collins.def: You use basic to describe things, activities, and principles that are very important or necessary, and on which others depend.

example.ex: One of the most basic requirements for any form of angling is a sharp hook.
example.tran: 不管以什么方式钓鱼，有一个锋利的鱼钩都是最基本的要求之一。

example.ex: ...the basic skills of reading, writing and communicating.
example.tran: 基本的读写和交流技巧

collins.def: Basic goods and services are very simple ones which every human being needs. You can also refer to people's basic needs for such goods and services.

example.ex: ...shortages of even the most basic foodstuffs...
example.tran: 最基本食物的短缺

example.ex: Hospitals lack even basic drugs for surgical operations.
example.tran: 医院连最基本的外科手术药物也没有。

collins.def: If one thing is basic to another, it is absolutely necessary to it, and the second thing cannot exist, succeed, or be imagined without it.

example.ex: ...an oily liquid, basic to the manufacture of a host of other chemical substances...
example.tran: 制造许多其他化学物质所必需的油性液体

example.ex: There are certain ethical principles that are basic to all the great religions.
example.tran: 某些道德原则在所有主要宗教中都是必不可少的。

collins.def: You can use basic to emphasize that you are referring to what you consider to be the most important aspect of a situation, and that you are not concerned with less important details.

example.ex: There are three basic types of tea...
example.tran: 茶主要分为三种。

example.ex: The basic design changed little from that patented by Edison more than 100 years ago...
example.tran: 其本质设计和100多年前爱迪生的专利设计相差无几。

collins.tran: 最简单的；最基本的；最朴实的
collins.def: You can use basic to describe something that is very simple in style and has only the most necessary features, without any luxuries.

example.ex: We provide 2-person tents and basic cooking and camping equipment.
example.tran: 我们提供双人帐篷和最基本的炊具以及露营装备。

example.ex: ...the extremely basic hotel room.
example.tran: 陈设极简单的旅馆房间

collins.def: Basic is used to describe a price or someone's income when this does not include any additional amounts.

example.ex: ...an increase of more than twenty per cent on the basic pay of a typical coalface worker...
example.tran: 普通采煤工人的底薪上浮超过20％

example.ex: The basic retirement pension will go up by £7.95 a week...
example.tran: 基本退休金每周将增加7.95英镑。

collins.tran: （所得税率）最低标准的，基本的
collins.def: The basic rate of income tax is the lowest or most common rate, which applies to people who earn average incomes.

example.ex: All this is to be done without big rises in the basic level of taxation.
example.tran: 所有这些都必须在未大幅度提高税收起征点的前提下完成。

example.ex: ...a basic-rate taxpayer.
example.tran: 适用最低标准税率的纳税人

collins.def: If there is a link between two things or situations, there is a relationship between them, for example because one thing causes or affects the other.

example.ex: ...the link between smoking and lung cancer.
example.tran: 吸烟与胃癌之间的关联

collins.tran: 使联系在一起；使相关联
collins.def: If someone or something links two things or situations, there is a relationship between them, for example because one thing causes or affects the other.

example.ex: The UN Security Council has linked any lifting of sanctions to compliance with the ceasefire terms...
example.tran: 联合国安全理事会将取消制裁与遵守停火协议挂钩。

example.ex: The study further strengthens the evidence linking smoking with early death...
example.tran: 这项研究进一步证实了吸烟与早逝之间的联系。

collins.def: A link between two things or places is a physical connection between them.

example.ex: ...the high-speed rail link between London and the Channel Tunnel...
example.tran: 伦敦与海峡隧道间的高速铁路连接线

example.ex: The new road schemes include a link between Chelmsford and the M25...
example.tran: 新的道路规划中包括了一条切姆斯福德与M25号高速公路的连接线。

collins.def: If two places or objects are linked or something links them, there  is a physical connection between them.

example.ex: ...the Rama Road, which links the capital, Managua, with the Caribbean coast...
example.tran: 连接首都马那瓜和加勒比海岸的拉马路

example.ex: The campus is linked by regular bus services to Coventry.
example.tran: 校园与考文垂之间由班车连接起来。

collins.tran: （友好的或商业上的）联系，关系
collins.def: A link between two people, organizations, or places is a friendly or business connection between them.

example.ex: Kiev hopes to cement close links with Bonn...
example.tran: 基辅希望能加强与波恩的密切关系。

example.ex: In 1984 the long link between AC Cars and the Hurlock family was severed...
example.tran: 1984年，AC汽车公司与赫洛克家族长久以来的关系破裂了。

collins.def: A link to another person or organization is something that allows you to communicate with them or have contact with them.

example.ex: She was my only link with the past...
example.tran: 她是我与过去的唯一纽带。

example.ex: The Red Cross was created to provide a link between soldiers in battle and their families at home...
example.tran: 红十字会是作为前线士兵和后方家人的一种联系方式而创立起来的。

collins.def: If you link one person or thing to  another, you claim that there is a relationship or connection between them.

example.ex: Criminologist Dr Ann Jones has linked the crime to social circumstances...
example.tran: 犯罪学家安·琼斯博士认为这起罪案与社会环境有关。

example.ex: They've linked her with various men, including magnate Donald Trump.
example.tran: 他们把她与不同的男人扯上关系，包括大亨唐纳德·特朗普。

collins.def: In computing, a link is a connection between different documents, or between different parts of the same document, using hypertext.
A link is one of the rings in a chain.
If you link one thing with another, you join them by putting one thing through the other.

example.ex: She linked her arm through his...
example.tran: 她挽住他的手臂。

example.ex: He linked the fingers of his hands together on his stomach.
example.tran: 他双手十指交叉放在腹部。

collins.def: The purpose of something is the reason for which it is made or done.

example.ex: The purpose of the occasion was to raise money for medical supplies...
example.tran: 那次活动是为筹集资金购买医药物资。

example.ex: Various insurance schemes already exist for this purpose.
example.tran: 已经有各种保险计划可以实现这一目的。

collins.def: Your purpose is the thing that you want to achieve.

example.ex: They might well be prepared to do you harm in order to achieve their purpose...
example.tran: 为达成自己的目的，他们说不定已经做好了伤害你的准备。

example.ex: His purpose was to make a profit by improving the company's performance.
example.tran: 他的目标是通过提高公司的业绩来实现盈利。

collins.def: Purpose is the feeling of having a definite aim and of being determined to achieve it.

example.ex: The teachers are enthusiastic and have a sense of purpose.
example.tran: 教师们很热情并且很有决心。

collins.def: You use for all practical purposes or to all intents and purposes to suggest that a situation is not exactly as you describe it, but the effect is the same as if it were.

example.ex: For all practical purposes the treaty has already ceased to exist...
example.tran: 实际上协议已经不复存在。

example.ex: To all intents and purposes the case was closed.
example.tran: 实际上该案已经了结了。

collins.def: If you do something on purpose, you do it intentionally.

example.ex: Was it an accident or did David do it on purpose?
example.tran: 是意外还是戴维故意所为？

means: 用化学方法制造的，化学作用的

collins.tran: 化学的;化学反应的;用化学方法生成的
collins.def: Chemical means involving or resulting from a reaction between two or more substances, or relating to the substances that something consists of.

example.ex: ...chemical reactions that cause ozone destruction.
example.tran: 导致臭氧受到破坏的化学反应

example.ex: ...the chemical composition of the ocean.
example.tran: 海洋的化学成分

collins.tran: 化学品;化合物;化学制品
collins.def: Chemicals are substances that are used in a chemical process or made by a chemical process.

example.ex: The whole food chain is affected by the overuse of chemicals in agriculture.
example.tran: 整个食物链因农业生产过程过多使用化学品而受到影响。

example.ex: ...a chemicals company.
example.tran: 化工公司

collins.def: If an event or a series of events has been mentioned and you want to talk about it again, you can refer to it as the affair .

example.ex: The government has mishandled the whole affair...
example.tran: 政府对整个事件处理不当。

example.ex: The affair began when customs officials inspected a convoy of 60 tankers...
example.tran: 就在海关关员检查一个60艘油轮的船队时，事情发生了。

collins.tran: …事件（指重要或有趣的事件或情况）
collins.def: You can refer to an important or interesting event or situation as 'the ... affair'.

example.ex: ...the damage caused to the CIA and FBI in the aftermath of the Watergate affair.
example.tran: 水门事件发生后给美国中央情报局和联邦调查局造成的不良影响

example.ex: ...confidential Bank of England documents relating to the BCCI affair.
example.tran: 与国际信贷商业银行事务相关的英格兰银行的机密文件

collins.def: You can describe the main quality of an event by saying that it is a particular kind of affair .

example.ex: Michael said that his planned 10-day visit would be a purely private affair...
example.tran: 迈克尔说他所计划的10天访问纯属个人私事。

example.ex: Breakfast will be a cheerless affair for the Prime Minister this morning.
example.tran: 今天的早餐会让首相感觉全然无味。

collins.tran: （不寻常的或具有某种特点的）东西
collins.def: You can describe an object as a particular kind of affair when you want to draw attention to a particular feature, or indicate that it is unusual.

example.ex: All their beds were distinctive; Mac's was an iron affair with brass knobs...
example.tran: 他们的床都各具特色；马克的床是张带球形黄铜柱头的铁家伙。

example.ex: He tried dividing it into two bundles, tying them to his walking stick, and slinging the whole affair across his back.
example.tran: 他试着将它分成两包绑在他的拐棍上，然后把所有东西都挂在后背上。

collins.def: If two people who are not married to each other have an affair, they have a sexual relationship.

example.ex: She was having an affair with someone at work.
example.tran: 她跟某一同事有染。

collins.def: You can use affairs to refer to all the important facts or activities that are connected with a particular subject.

example.ex: He does not want to interfere in the internal affairs of another country...
example.tran: 他不想干涉别国内政。

example.ex: With more details, here's our foreign affairs correspondent.
example.tran: 详细情况，请听我们外交事务记者的报道。

collins.def: Your affairs are all the matters connected with your life which you consider to be private and normally deal with yourself.

example.ex: He was rational and consistent in the conduct of his affairs...
example.tran: 他处理私事时头脑清楚，始终如一。

example.ex: The unexpectedness of my father's death meant that his affairs were not entirely in order.
example.tran: 家父的猝然离世留下了尚未完全安排妥当的身后事。

collins.def: If you say that a decision or situation is someone's affair, you mean that it is their responsibility, and other people should not interfere.

example.ex: If you wish to make a fool of yourself, that is your affair...
example.tran: 如果你想让自己出丑，那是你自己的事。

example.ex: If they want to stay and fight, then I guess that's their affair.
example.tran: 如果他们想留下来打架，我想那是他们自己的事。

collins.def: If there is a fire or a flame somewhere, you say that there is a fire or flame burning there.

example.ex: Fires were burning out of control in the center of the city...
example.tran: 市中心的火势失去了控制。

example.ex: There was a fire burning in the large fireplace...
example.tran: 大壁炉里火势正旺。

collins.def: If something is burning, it is on fire.

example.ex: When I arrived one of the vehicles was still burning.
example.tran: 当我到达时，其中一辆车还在燃烧。

example.ex: The building housed 1,500 refugees and it burned for hours...
example.tran: 这幢住有1,500名难民的大楼燃烧了好几个小时。

collins.def: If you burn something, you destroy or damage it with fire.

example.ex: Protesters set cars on fire and burned a building...
example.tran: 抗议者焚烧汽车，并烧毁了一座建筑。

example.ex: Incineration plants should be built to burn household waste...
example.tran: 应该建立焚烧厂以焚毁日常生活垃圾。

collins.def: If you burn a fuel or if it burns, it is used to produce heat, light, or energy.

example.ex: The power stations burn coal from the Ruhr region...
example.tran: 发电站烧的煤产自鲁尔地区。

example.ex: Manufacturers are working with new fuels to find one that burns more cleanly than petrol.
example.tran: 制造商们正在研制新型燃料，以找到一种比汽油更清洁的燃料。

collins.def: If you burn something that you are cooking or if it burns, you spoil it by using too much heat or cooking it for too long.

example.ex: I burnt the toast...
example.tran: 我把面包烤糊了。

example.ex: Watch them carefully as they finish cooking because they can burn easily.
example.tran: 就要做好时得小心看着，因为它们很容易烧糊。

collins.def: If you burn part of your body, burn yourself, or are burnt, you are injured by fire or by something very hot.

example.ex: Take care not to burn your fingers...
example.tran: 注意别烧着手指头。

example.ex: If you are badly burnt, seek medical attention.
example.tran: 如果是严重烧伤，就得去看医生。

collins.def: If someone is burnt or burnt to death, they are killed by fire.

example.ex: Women were burned as witches in the middle ages...
example.tran: 妇女在中世纪时被当成女巫烧死。

example.ex: At least 80 people were burnt to death when their bus caught fire.
example.tran: 大客车着火导致至少80人被烧死。

collins.def: If a light is burning, it is shining.

example.ex: The building was darkened except for a single light burning in a third-story window.
example.tran: 整座大楼一片漆黑，只有3层的一个窗户透出一丝光亮。

collins.def: If your face is burning, it is red because you are embarrassed or upset.

example.ex: Liz's face was burning.
example.tran: 利兹的脸红得发烫。

collins.tran: 有强烈的情感；极度渴望
collins.def: If you are burning with an emotion or are burning to do something, you feel that emotion or the desire to do that thing very strongly.

example.ex: The young boy was burning with a fierce ambition...
example.tran: 这个年轻人怀有极其远大的抱负。

example.ex: Dan burned to know what the reason could be.
example.tran: 丹急于想知道原因。

collins.def: If you burn or get burned in the sun, the sun makes your skin become red and sore.

example.ex: Build up your tan slowly and don't allow your skin to burn...
example.tran: 慢慢地将皮肤晒成古铜色，小心别让太阳把皮肤晒伤。

example.ex: Summer sun can burn fair skin in minutes.
example.tran: 夏天的太阳几分钟就能把白皙的皮肤晒黑。

collins.def: If a part of your body burns or if something burns it, it has a painful, hot or stinging feeling.

example.ex: My eyes burn from staring at the needle...
example.tran: 我的眼睛由于长时间盯着针看而疼痛。

example.ex: His face was burning with cold.
example.tran: 他的脸被冻得发痛。

collins.def: If you are burned or get burned, you lose something as a result of taking a risk, usually in a business deal.

example.ex: They always took chances and got burned very badly in past years.
example.tran: 他们总是冒险，在过去的几年里损失惨重。

collins.def: To burn a CD-ROM means to write or copy data onto it.

example.ex: You can use this software to burn custom compilations of your favorite tunes.
example.tran: 你可以用这个软件来刻录你最喜欢的乐曲。

collins.tran: 大致上；总体上；一般地说
collins.def: You use largely to say that a statement is not completely true but is mostly true.

example.ex: The fund is largely financed through government borrowing...
example.tran: 该基金大致上由政府借款支持。

example.ex: I largely work with people who already are motivated...
example.tran: 我大多和积极主动的人一起工作。

collins.def: Largely is used to introduce the main reason for a particular event or situation.

example.ex: Retail sales dipped 6/10ths of a percent last month, largely because Americans were buying fewer cars...
example.tran: 上月零售额下降了千分之六，主要是因为美国人买汽车少了。

example.ex: The French empire had expanded largely through military conquest.
example.tran: 法兰西帝国的扩张主要靠军事征服。

collins.def: If you invite someone to something such as a party or a meal, you ask them to come to it.

example.ex: She invited him to her 26th birthday party in New Jersey...
example.tran: 她邀请他去参加她在新泽西举行的 26 岁生日聚会。

example.ex: I invited her in for a coffee...
example.tran: 我请她进来喝杯咖啡。

collins.def: If you are invited to do something, you are formally asked or given permission to do it.

example.ex: At a future date, managers will be invited to apply for a management buy-out...
example.tran: 在将来的某天,经理们将受邀进行管理层收购。

example.ex: The person concerned would be shown the evidence in private and invited to stand down...
example.tran: 将会向有关人员私下出示该证据,并要求其暂时离开证人席。

collins.def: If something you say or do invites trouble or criticism, it makes trouble or criticism more likely.

example.ex: I realise that an Englishman who generalises about Ireland invites trouble...
example.tran: 我意识到英国人如果对爱尔兰问题加以泛化的话会招惹麻烦。

example.ex: Their refusal to compromise will inevitably invite more criticism from the UN.
example.tran: 他们拒绝妥协必然会引发联合国的更多批评。

collins.def: An invite is an invitation to something such as a party or a meal.

example.ex: They haven't got an invite to the wedding.
example.tran: 他们还没收到参加婚礼的请柬。

collins.def: You use neither in front of the first of two or more words or expressions when you are linking two or more things which are not true or do not happen. The other thing is introduced by 'nor'.

example.ex: Professor Hisamatsu spoke neither English nor German...
example.tran: 久松教授既不会讲英语，也不会讲德语。

example.ex: The play is neither as funny nor as disturbing as Tabori thinks it is.
example.tran: 这部戏既不像塔博里想象的那么滑稽，也不像他想象的那么让人讨厌。

collins.tran: 两个都不;(两者之中)无一个
collins.def: You use neither to refer to each of two things or people, when you are making a negative statement that includes both of them.

example.ex: At first, neither man could speak.
example.tran: 起初，两个人都不会说。

collins.def: If you say that one person or thing does not do something and neither does another, what you say is true of all the people or things that you are mentioning.

example.ex: I never learned to swim and neither did they...
example.tran: 我从没学过游泳，他们也没有。

example.ex: Britain does not agree and neither do Denmark, Portugal and Ireland.
example.tran: 英国不同意，丹麦、葡萄牙和爱尔兰也持反对意见。

collins.tran: (用于否定陈述后，强调要引出另一否定陈述)也不
collins.def: You use neither after a negative statement to emphasize that you are introducing another negative statement.

example.ex: I can't ever recall Dad hugging me. Neither did I sit on his knee.
example.tran: 我不记得爸爸曾经抱过我，我也没在他膝盖上坐过。

collins.def: If you say that something is neither here nor there, you mean that it does not matter because it is not a relevant point.

example.ex: 'I'd never heard of her before I came here.' — 'That is neither here nor there.'
example.tran: “来之前我从未听说过她。”——“那没什么。”

example.ex: Whether or not he realised the fact was neither here nor there.
example.tran: 他是否认识到事实真相无关紧要。

collins.def: A review of a situation or system is its formal examination by people in authority. This is usually done in order to see whether it can be improved or corrected.

example.ex: The president ordered a review of US economic aid to Jordan...
example.tran: 总统下令对美国向约旦提供的经济援助进行审查。

example.ex: The White House quickly announced that the policy is under review.
example.tran: 白宫很快宣布该项政策正在审核中。

collins.tran: 仔细研究;审视;细查;详查
collins.def: If you review a situation or system, you consider it carefully to see what is wrong with it or how it could be improved.

example.ex: The Prime Minister reviewed the situation with his Cabinet yesterday...
example.tran: 昨天，首相和他的内阁对局势进行了审度。

example.ex: The next day we reviewed the previous day's work.
example.tran: 第二天，我们仔细检查了头一天的工作。

collins.tran: （对书、电影等的）评论文章;书评;影评
collins.def: A review is a report in the media in which someone gives their opinion of something such as a new book or film.

example.ex: Disney's 'Beauty And The Beast' has won rave reviews...
example.tran: 迪斯尼出品的电影《美女与野兽》赢得了众多好评。

example.ex: We've never had a good review in the music press.
example.tran: 我们从未在音乐媒体获得过好评。

collins.tran: 写（新书、新上映电影等）的评论
collins.def: If someone reviews something such as a new book or film, they write a report or give a talk on television or radio in which they express their opinion of it.

example.ex: Richard Coles reviews all of the latest video releases...
example.tran: 理查德·科尔斯为所有最新发行的录影带都写了评论。

example.ex: His book about Afghanistan is reviewed here by Anthony Hyman.
example.tran: 安东尼·海曼在此就他那本关于阿富汗的书写了书评。

collins.def: When a military or political leader reviews troops, they examine them, or watch them marching.

example.ex: When he reviewed the troops they cheered him as he smiled and raised his hat.
example.tran: 他检阅军队时微笑着举起帽子，人们与此同时都向他欢呼。

collins.def: When you review for an examination, you read things again and make notes in order to be prepared for the examination.

example.ex: Reviewing for exams gives you a chance to bring together all the individual parts of the course...
example.tran: 考前复习让你有机会把一门课程所有零碎的知识都融会贯通。

example.ex: Review all the notes you need to cover for each course.
example.tran: 把每一门课程需要掌握的笔记都复习一下。

means: 提出挑战，要求竞赛（或竞争）

collins.def: A challenge is something new and difficult which requires great effort and determination.

example.ex: I like a big challenge and they don't come much bigger than this...
example.tran: 我喜欢大的挑战，而所有挑战中再没有比这更大的了。

example.ex: The new government's first challenge is the economy.
example.tran: 新政府面临的第一个难题是经济问题。

collins.def: If someone rises to the challenge, they act in response to a difficult situation which is new to them and are successful.

example.ex: The new Germany must rise to the challenge of its enhanced responsibilities...
example.tran: 一个崭新的德国必须迎接挑战，承担更多的责任。

example.ex: They rose to the challenge of entertaining 80 schoolchildren for an afternoon.
example.tran: 他们一个下午成功接待了80名学童。

collins.tran: (对真实性、价值、权威等提出的)怀疑，质疑
collins.def: A challenge to something is a questioning of its truth or value. A challenge to someone is a questioning of their authority.

example.ex: The demonstrators have now made a direct challenge to the authority of the government.
example.tran: 示威者现在直接对政府的权威发出了质疑。

collins.tran: 怀疑，质疑(真实性、价值、权威等)
collins.def: If you challenge ideas or people, you question their truth, value, or authority.

example.ex: Democratic leaders have challenged the president to sign the bill...
example.tran: 民主党领袖对总统签署这项法案提出了质疑。

example.ex: The move was immediately challenged by two of the republics...
example.tran: 此项动议立即遭到其中两个共和国的反对。

collins.def: If you challenge someone, you invite them to fight or compete with you in some way.

example.ex: A mum slashed a neighbour's car tyre and challenged her to a fight after their daughters fell out...
example.tran: 两家的女儿吵起来后，一个妈妈划破了邻居的车胎，说要和她较量较量。

example.ex: He left a note at the scene of the crime, challenging detectives to catch him...
example.tran: 他在犯罪现场留了个条儿，向警探挑衅。

collins.def: If someone is challenged by a guard, they are ordered to stop and say who they are or why they are there.

example.ex: The men apparently opened fire after they were challenged by a patrol.
example.tran: 显然，那些人是在受到一支巡逻队的盘问后开的火。

collins.def: A treaty is a written agreement between countries in which they agree to do a particular thing or to help each other.

example.ex: …the Treaty of Rome, which established the European Community.
example.tran: 建立了欧洲共同体的《罗马条约》

example.ex: ...negotiations over a 1992 treaty on global warming.
example.tran: 围绕 1992 年制定的遏制全球变暖问题的公约而进行的谈判

collins.def: If you have responsibility for something or someone, or if they are your responsibility, it is your job or duty to deal with them and to take decisions relating to them.

example.ex: Each manager had responsibility for just under 600 properties...
example.tran: 每位经理负责将近600处房产。

example.ex: We need to take responsibility for looking after our own health...
example.tran: 我们必须对自己的健康负责。

collins.def: If you accept responsibility for something that has happened, you agree that you were to blame for it or you caused it.

example.ex: No one admitted responsibility for the attacks...
example.tran: 没有人对这些袭击负责。

example.ex: Someone had to give orders and take responsibility for mistakes.
example.tran: 必须得有人下令，并为错误负责。

collins.def: Your responsibilities are the duties that you have because of your job or position.

example.ex: He handled his responsibilities as a counselor in an intelligent and caring fashion.
example.tran: 作为一名顾问他精明能干、热心周到。

example.ex: ...programmes to help employees balance work and family responsibilities.
example.tran: 帮助雇员兼顾工作和家庭责任的项目

collins.def: If someone is given responsibility, they are given the right or opportunity to make important decisions or to take action without having to get permission from anyone else.

example.ex: She would have loved to have a better-paying job with more responsibility...
example.tran: 她本想有一份报酬更高、职权更大的工作。

example.ex: Carrington held a position of responsibility within the government.
example.tran: 卡林顿在政府机构身居要职。

collins.def: If you think that you have a responsibility to do something, you feel that you ought to do it because it is morally right to do it.

example.ex: The court feels it has a responsibility to ensure that customers are not misled...
example.tran: 法院认为它有责任确保消费者不受误导。

example.ex: As parents we have a responsibility to give our children a sense of belonging.
example.tran: 作为父母，我们有责任给孩子一种归属感。

collins.def: If you think that you have a responsibility to someone, you feel that it is your duty to take action that will protect their interests.

example.ex: She had decided that as a doctor she had a responsibility to her fellow creatures.
example.tran: 她已经决定，作为医生，她应该对自己的同胞负责。

collins.def: If you blame a person or thing for something bad, you believe or say that they are responsible for it or that they caused it.

example.ex: The commission is expected  to blame the army for many of the atrocities...
example.tran: 委员会理应谴责军队的诸多暴行。

example.ex: Ms Carey appeared to blame her breakdown on EMI's  punishing work schedule...
example.tran: 凯丽女士似乎将她的精神崩溃归咎于百代唱片公司高度紧张的工作日程安排。

collins.def: The blame for something bad that has happened is the responsibility for causing it or letting it happen.

example.ex: Some of the blame for the miscarriage of justice must be borne by the solicitors...
example.tran: 律师们应对误判负部分责任。

example.ex: The president put the blame squarely on his opponent.
example.tran: 总统把责任完全推给了他的对手。

collins.def: If you say that you do not blame someone for doing something, you mean that you consider it was a reasonable thing to do in the circumstances.

example.ex: I do not blame them for trying to make some money...
example.tran: 我认为他们想赚一些钱也是情有可原的。

example.ex: He slammed the door and stormed off. I could hardly blame him.
example.tran: 他砰的一声关上门，气呼呼地走了。也难怪他会这么做。

collins.def: If someone is to blame for something bad that has happened, they are responsible for causing it.

example.ex: If their forces were not involved, then who is to blame?...
example.tran: 如果他们的部队没有介入，那么谁应该承担责任？

example.ex: The policy is partly to blame for causing the worst unemployment in Europe.
example.tran: 欧洲出现了最严重的失业情况，这应当部分归咎于这项政策。

collins.def: If you say that someone has only themselves to blame or has no-one but themselves to blame, you mean that they are responsible for something bad that has happened to them and that you have no sympathy for them.

example.ex: My life is ruined and I suppose I only have myself to blame.
example.tran: 我的一生都毁了，我想这只能怪我自己。

collins.def: The owner of something is the person to whom it belongs.

example.ex: The owner of the store was sweeping his floor when I walked in...
example.tran: 我进去的时候这家商店的店主正在扫地。

example.ex: Every pet owner knows their animal has its own personality...
example.tran: 宠物的主人都知道它们有自己的个性。

means: 说话，谈话，说话能力或方式

collins.def: Speech is the ability to speak or the act of speaking.

example.ex: ...the development of speech in children...
example.tran: 儿童言语能力的发展

example.ex: Intoxication interferes with speech and coordination.
example.tran: 醉酒会影响言语能力和协调性。

collins.def: Your speech is the way in which you speak.

example.ex: His speech became increasingly thick and nasal...
example.tran: 他说话的声音变得越来越粗，鼻音越来越重。

example.ex: I'd make fun of her dress and imitate her speech.
example.tran: 我会拿她的衣着开玩笑，并模仿她说话。

collins.tran: 口语，言语(与书面语相对而言)
collins.def: Speech is spoken language.

example.ex: He could imitate in speech or writing most of those he admired.
example.tran: 他能模仿大多数自己崇拜的偶像的讲话和写作风格。

example.ex: ...the way common letter clusters are usually pronounced in speech.
example.tran: 普通字母组合在口语中的常见读法

collins.def: A speech is a formal talk which someone gives to an audience.

example.ex: She is due to make a speech on the economy next week...
example.tran: 她将在下周作一个关于经济的演讲。

example.ex: He delivered his speech in French.
example.tran: 他用法语发表演说。

collins.def: A speech is a group of lines spoken by a character in a play.

example.ex: ...the hilarious speech from Alan Bennett's 'Forty Years On'.
example.tran: 艾伦·贝内特的《弹指四十年》中的一段非常有趣的台词

collins.def: When you pull something, you hold it firmly and use force in order to move it towards you  or away from its previous position.

example.ex: They have pulled out patients' teeth unnecessarily...
example.tran: 他们毫无必要地拔掉了病人的牙。

example.ex: He pulled on a jersey...
example.tran: 他套上一件运动衫。

collins.def: When you pull an object from a bag, pocket, or cupboard, you put your hand in and bring the object out.

example.ex: Jack pulled the slip of paper from his shirt pocket...
example.tran: 杰克从衬衫口袋里抽出这张纸条。

example.ex: Wade walked quickly to the refrigerator and pulled out another beer.
example.tran: 韦德快步走到冰箱边又拿出一罐啤酒。

collins.def: When a vehicle, animal, or person pulls a cart or piece of machinery, they are attached to it or hold it, so that it moves along behind them when they move forward.

example.ex: This is early-20th-century rural Sussex, when horses still pulled the plough...
example.tran: 这是20世纪早期的萨塞克斯乡村，那时还是用马拉犁。

example.ex: He pulls a rickshaw, probably the oldest form of human taxi service.
example.tran: 他拉黄包车，这可能是人类最古老的载客服务形式了。

collins.def: If you pull yourself or pull a part of your body in a particular direction, you move your body or a part of your body with effort or force.

example.ex: Hughes pulled himself slowly to his feet...
example.tran: 休斯慢慢站了起来。

example.ex: He pulled his arms out of the sleeves...
example.tran: 他把胳膊从袖子里抽出来。

collins.def: When a driver or vehicle pulls to a stop or a halt, the vehicle stops.

example.ex: He pulled to a stop behind a pickup truck...
example.tran: 他在一辆皮卡货车后面停了下来。

example.ex: The train pulled to a halt at the platform.
example.tran: 火车在站台边停下。

collins.def: In a race or contest, if you pull ahead of or pull away from an opponent, you gradually increase the amount by which you are ahead of them.

example.ex: He pulled away, extending his lead to 15 seconds...
example.tran: 他把领先优势逐渐扩大到了15秒。

example.ex: The six states he won in 1988 are the same states in which he has yet to pull ahead of his opponent.
example.tran: 1988年他获胜的6个州也是他目前有待领先于对手的几个州。

collins.def: If you pull something apart, you break or divide it into small pieces, often in order to put them back together again in a different way.

example.ex: If I wanted to improve the car significantly I would have to pull it apart and start again.
example.tran: 如果想好好地改进这辆车，我将不得不把它拆开重装。

collins.def: If someone pulls a gun or a knife on someone else, they take out a gun or knife and threaten the other person with it.

example.ex: They had a fight. One of them pulled a gun on the other...
example.tran: 他们打了起来。其中一人拔出枪指着另一个人。

example.ex: I pulled a knife and threatened her.
example.tran: 我拔出刀威胁她。

collins.tran: 吸引，拉拢（人群、观众或选民）
collins.def: To pull crowds, viewers, or voters means to attract them.

example.ex: The organisers have to employ performers to pull a crowd.
example.tran: 组织者不得不雇些演员来聚拢人气。

collins.def: If something pulls you or pulls your thoughts or feelings in a particular direction, it strongly attracts you or influences you in a particular way.

example.ex: Joe felt there was little he could do to help Betty, and his heart was pulling him elsewhere.
example.tran: 乔感到帮不上贝蒂什么忙，他的心思在别的地方。

collins.def: A pull is a strong physical force which causes things to move in a particular direction.

example.ex: ...the pull of gravity.
example.tran: 重力的牵引

collins.def: If you are pulling for someone, you support and encourage them, especially in a competition.

example.ex: We're all pulling for each other because we're desperate to win the Cup back...
example.tran: 因为我们非常想赢回奖杯，所以一直在互相打气。

example.ex: You know I've been pulling for you.
example.tran: 你知道我一直在为你加油。

collins.def: If you pull a muscle, you injure it by straining it.

example.ex: Dave pulled a back muscle and could barely kick the ball...
example.tran: 戴夫背部拉伤，几乎没法踢球。

example.ex: He suffered a pulled calf muscle.
example.tran: 他小腿肚肌肉拉伤。

collins.def: If someone pulls on a cigarette, they take a deep breath with the cigarette in their mouth.

example.ex: Jeff leaned back and pulled on his cigarette.
example.tran: 杰夫往后一靠，深深地吸了一口烟。

collins.def: To pull a stunt or a trick on someone means to do something dramatic or silly in order to get their attention or trick them.

example.ex: Everyone saw the stunt you pulled on me.
example.tran: 大家都看见了你对我耍的花招。

collins.def: If someone pulls someone else, they succeed in attracting them sexually and in spending the rest of the evening or night with them.
You can say to someone 'Pull the other one' or 'Pull the other one, it's got bells on' to tell them that you do not believe what they have told you and you think they must be joking.

example.ex: What! A big bloke like you, beaten by his wife! Pull the other one; it's got bells on.
example.tran: 什么！你这么一个大块头居然被他的妻子打了！别逗了。

collins.def: If you secure something that you want or need, you obtain it, often after a lot of effort.

example.ex: Federal leaders continued their efforts to secure a ceasefire...
example.tran: 联邦领导人继续争取促成停火协议。

example.ex: Graham's achievements helped secure him the job.
example.tran: 出色的成绩帮助格雷厄姆拿下了这份工作。

collins.tran: 使…免遭攻击(或伤害);保卫;保护
collins.def: If you secure a place, you make it safe from harm or attack.

example.ex: Staff withdrew from the main part of the prison but secured the perimeter...
example.tran: 工作人员从监狱的主要区域撤出，但外围仍派人守卫。

example.ex: The shed was secured by a hasp and staple fastener.
example.tran: 棚屋由一个搭钩和U型扣件固定着。

collins.def: A secure place is tightly locked or well protected, so that people cannot enter it or leave it.

example.ex: We shall make sure our home is as secure as possible from now on.
example.tran: 我们应该确保家里从今往后尽量锁紧门窗。

collins.def: If you secure an object, you fasten it firmly to another object.

example.ex: He helped her close the cases up, and then he secured the canvas straps as tight as they would go...
example.tran: 他帮她关上箱子，然后将帆布带子尽量系紧。

example.ex: The frames are secured by horizontal rails to the back wall.
example.tran: 框架用横杆牢牢固定在后墙上。

collins.tran: 固定不动的;绑紧的;系牢的
collins.def: If an object is secure, it is fixed firmly in position.

example.ex: Check joints are secure and the wood is sound...
example.tran: 检查一下连接处是否稳固及木料是否结实。

example.ex: Shelves are only as secure as their fixings.
example.tran: 架子的牢固程度取决于固件。

collins.def: If you describe something such as a job as secure, it is certain not to change or end.

example.ex: ...trade union demands for secure wages and employment...
example.tran: 工会要求稳定的工资和工作。

example.ex: Senior citizens long for a more predictable and secure future.
example.tran: 老年人渴望有一个更稳定、更可预见的未来。

collins.def: A secure base or foundation is strong and reliable.

example.ex: He was determined to give his family a secure and solid base.
example.tran: 他决定给家人一个牢固坚实的生活基础。

collins.tran: 安心的;心里踏实的;无忧无虑的
collins.def: If you feel secure, you feel safe and happy and are not worried about life.

example.ex: She felt secure and protected when she was with him...
example.tran: 和他在一起的时候，她感到一种被人保护的安全感。

example.ex: The government must feel secure before it will be willing to make the concessions needed for peace.
example.tran: 政府只有有足够的把够了才会愿意为和平作出让步。

collins.def: If a loan is secured, the person who lends the money may take property such as a house from the person who borrows the money if they fail to repay it.

example.ex: The loan is secured against your home...
example.tran: 这笔贷款以你的房子作为抵押。

example.ex: His main task is to raise enough finance to repay secured loans.
example.tran: 他的主要任务是筹集足够的资金以偿还抵押贷款。

collins.def: If you maintain something, you continue to have it, and do not let it stop or grow weaker.

example.ex: The Department maintains many close contacts with the chemical industry...
example.tran: 这个部门与化工行业保持着众多密切的联系。

example.ex: Push yourself to make friends and to maintain the friendships.
example.tran: 要求自己与人交友并保持友谊。

collins.def: If you say that someone maintains that something is true, you mean that they have stated their opinion strongly but not everyone agrees with them or believes them.

example.ex: He has maintained that the money was donated for international purposes...
example.tran: 他坚称这笔捐款将用于国际用途。

example.ex: Prosecutors maintain no deal was made...
example.tran: 原告坚持说不存在任何交易。

collins.tran: 保持，维持（在某一比率或水平上）
collins.def: If you maintain something at a particular rate or level, you keep it at that rate or level.

example.ex: The government was right to maintain interest rates at a high level.
example.tran: 政府维持高利率的做法是正确的。

example.ex: ...action is required to ensure standards are maintained at as high a level as possible.
example.tran: 要求采取行动确保标准维持在尽量高的水平上。

collins.def: If you maintain a road, building, vehicle, or machine, you keep it in good condition by regularly checking it and repairing it when necessary.

example.ex: ...a tough campaign to force authorities to maintain roads properly...
example.tran: 迫使当局妥善维修道路的艰难斗争

example.ex: The house costs a fortune to maintain...
example.tran: 维修这幢房子花销不菲。

collins.def: If you maintain someone, you provide them with money and other things that they need.

example.ex: He should pay and maintain you as well.
example.tran: 他得给你钱，还得供养你。

example.ex: ...the basic costs of maintaining a child.
example.tran: 抚养一个孩子的基本费用

collins.def: Traditional customs, beliefs, or methods are ones that have existed for a long time without changing.

example.ex: ...traditional teaching methods.
example.tran: 传统教学方法

example.ex: ...traditional Indian music.
example.tran: 传统印度音乐

collins.def: A traditional organization or person prefers older methods and ideas to modern ones.

example.ex: We're still a traditional school in a lot of ways.
example.tran: 我们在很多方面仍是一所旧式学校。

example.ex: …traditional parents, who believed in laying down the law for their children.
example.tran: 信奉需要对子女严立规矩的老派父母

collins.def: The nineteenth item in a series is the one that you count as number nineteen.

example.ex: ...my nineteenth birthday.
example.tran: 我的19岁生日

example.ex: ...the nineteenth century.
example.tran: 19世纪

collins.def: Your budget is the amount of money that you have available to spend. The budget for something is the amount of money that a person, organization, or country has available to spend on it.

example.ex: She will design a fantastic new kitchen for you — and all within your budget...
example.tran: 她将为你设计一个超级棒的新厨房，而且绝不会超出你的预算。

example.ex: Someone had furnished the place on a tight budget...
example.tran: 有人没花多少钱简单地把这个地方布置了一下。

collins.def: The budget of an organization or country is its financial situation, considered as the difference between the money it receives and the money it spends.

example.ex: The hospital obviously needs to balance the budget each year.
example.tran: 很明显，医院每年都要平衡其收支预算。

example.ex: ...his readiness to raise taxes as part of an effort to cut the budget deficit.
example.tran: 他已准备把增加税收作为削减预算赤字的措施之一

collins.tran: （英国的）政府年度预算案，政府年度预算演讲
collins.def: In Britain, the Budget is the financial plan in which the government states how much money it intends to raise through taxes and how it intends to spend it. The Budget is also the speech in which this plan is announced.

example.ex: The Chancellor could use the Budget to bring in taxation reforms.
example.tran: 财政大臣可以利用政府年度预算演讲的机会提出税收改革事宜。

example.ex: ...other indirect tax changes announced in the Budget.
example.tran: 在政府预算中公布的其他间接税收变动

collins.def: If you budget certain amounts of money for particular things, you decide that you can afford to spend those amounts on those things.

example.ex: The company has budgeted $10 million for advertising...
example.tran: 公司已经做了1,000万美元的广告预算。

example.ex: The movie is only budgeted at $10 million...
example.tran: 该电影的预算只有1,000万美元。

collins.def: Budget is used in advertising to suggest that something is being sold cheaply.

example.ex: Cheap flights are available from budget travel agent from £240.
example.tran: 收费低廉的旅行社可以提供240英镑起的低价机票。

collins.def: If you respect someone, you have a good opinion of their character or ideas.

example.ex: I want him to respect me as a career woman...
example.tran: 我希望他把我当作一个职业女性来尊重。

example.ex: He needs the advice of people he respects, and he respects you.
example.tran: 他需要从他敬重的人那里获得建议，而他一向都很敬重你。

collins.def: If you have respect for someone, you have a good opinion of them.

example.ex: I have tremendous respect for Dean...
example.tran: 我非常敬重迪安。

example.ex: His voice was warm with friendship and respect.
example.tran: 他的声音里充满了友善和敬意。

collins.def: If you respect someone's wishes, rights, or customs, you avoid doing things that they would dislike or regard as wrong.

example.ex: Finally, trying to respect her wishes, I said I'd leave.
example.tran: 最后，为了尊重她的意愿，我说我会离开。

collins.def: If you show respect for someone's wishes, rights, or customs, you avoid doing anything they would dislike or regard as wrong.

example.ex: They will campaign for the return of traditional lands and respect for aboriginal rights and customs.
example.tran: 他们会争取讨回世代相传的土地，并要求尊重土著居民的权利和风俗。

collins.tran: 遵守，遵从（法律或道德规范）
collins.def: If you respect a law or moral principle, you agree not to break it.

example.ex: It is about time tour operators respected the law and their own code of conduct.
example.tran: 旅行社是时候该遵守法律和行业规范了。

collins.tran: 恕我直言，恕我冒昧(用于礼貌地表示不同意见或批评)
collins.def: You can say with respect when you are politely disagreeing with someone or criticizing them.

example.ex: With respect, Minister, you still haven't answered my question...
example.tran: 部长，恕我冒昧，您还没有回答我的问题。

example.ex: With respect, I hardly think that's the point.
example.tran: 恕我直言，但我认为这不是重点。

collins.def: If you pay your respects to someone, you go to see them or speak to them. You usually do this to be polite, and not necessarily because you want to do it.

example.ex: Carl had asked him to visit the hospital and to pay his respects to Francis.
example.tran: 卡尔已经让他去医院看望弗朗西斯。

collins.tran: 和(死者)告别;参加…的葬礼
collins.def: If you pay your last respects to someone who has just died, you show your respect or affection for them by coming to see their body or their grave.

example.ex: The son had nothing to do with arranging the funeral, but came along to pay his last respects.
example.tran: 这个儿子没有参与葬礼的安排，但是来向遗体告别了。

collins.tran: 在这个方面/在许多方面
collins.def: You use expressions like in this respect and in many respects to indicate that what you are saying applies to the feature you have just mentioned or to many features of something.

example.ex: The children are not unintelligent—in fact, they seem quite normal in this respect...
example.tran: 这些孩子并非愚钝——事实上，在这个方面他们似乎很正常。

example.ex: In many respects Asian women see themselves as equal to their men.
example.tran: 在很多方面，亚洲女性都认为自己和丈夫是平等的。

collins.tran: 关于，至于（英国英语中也用in respect of）
collins.def: You use with respect to to say what something relates to. In British English, you can also say in respect of .

example.ex: Parents often have little choice with respect to the way their child is medically treated...
example.tran: 关于孩子的治疗方法，父母通常没有什么选择的余地。

example.ex: Where Dr Shapland feels the system is not working most effectively is in respect of professional training.
example.tran: 沙普兰博士认为系统在专业培训上的运作效率不是非常高。

collins.def: A disease is an illness which affects people, animals, or plants, for example one which is caused by bacteria or infection.

example.ex: ...the rapid spread of disease in the area.
example.tran: 疾病在这一区域的迅速蔓延

example.ex: ...illnesses such as heart disease...
example.tran: 诸如心脏病之类的疾病

collins.tran: （尤指社会某一群体的）弊病，积习，恶习
collins.def: You can refer to a bad attitude or habit, usually one that a group of people have, as a disease.
