example.ex: ...the wretched disease of racism eating away at the core of our society.
example.tran: 侵蚀着我们社会核心的种族主义恶疾

collins.def: A battle is a violent fight between groups of people, especially one between military forces during a war.

example.ex: ...the victory of King William III at the Battle of the Boyne.
example.tran: 国王威廉三世在博因河战役中的胜利

example.ex: ...after a gun battle between police and drug traffickers.
example.tran: 在警察和毒贩子一番枪战之后

collins.tran: （为争取成功或控制权的）斗争，冲突
collins.def: A battle is a conflict in which different people or groups compete in order to achieve success or control.

example.ex: ...a renewed political battle over Britain's  attitude to Europe.
example.tran: 围绕英国对欧洲的态度问题展开的新一轮政治斗争

example.ex: ...the eternal battle between good and evil in the world.
example.tran: 世界上正义与邪恶的永恒斗争

collins.def: You can use battle to refer to someone's  efforts to achieve something in spite of very difficult circumstances.

example.ex: ...the battle against crime...
example.tran: 打击犯罪的斗争

example.ex: She has fought a constant battle with her weight...
example.tran: 她一直在竭力控制体重。

collins.def: To battle with an opposing group means to take part in a fight or contest against them. In American English, you can also say that one group or person is battling another.

example.ex: Thousands of people battled with police and several were reportedly wounded...
example.tran: 数千人与警方发生冲突，据报道有数人在冲突中受伤。

example.ex: The sides must battle again for a quarter-final place on December 16...
example.tran: 双方将在12月16日再次交锋以争夺进入四分之一决赛的席位。

collins.tran: 奋战；（与…）搏斗（在英国英语中用battle against something或with something，在美国英语中用battle something）
collins.def: To battle means to try hard to do something in spite of very difficult circumstances. In British English, you battle against something or with something. In American English, you battle something.

example.ex: Doctors battled throughout the night to save her life.
example.tran: 医生们彻夜奋战来挽救她的生命。

example.ex: ...a lone yachtsman returning from his months of battling with the elements...
example.tran: 只身驾驶游艇与恶劣天气搏斗数月后成功归航的人

collins.def: If one person or group does battle with another, they take part in a battle or contest against them. You can also say that two people or groups do battle .

example.ex: ...the notorious Montonero guerrilla group who did battle with the army during the dirty war...
example.tran: 曾在那场肮脏的战争中与这支部队交战的臭名昭著的蒙特内罗游击队

example.ex: This March, a British and an American company will do battle in the High Court over the right to press compact discs.
example.tran: 今年3月，一家英国公司和一家美国公司将会在最高法院就光盘压制权展开争夺。

collins.tran: 成功的一半；成功的重要条件
collins.def: If you say that something is half the battle, you mean that it is the most important step towards achieving something.

example.ex: Choosing the right type of paint for the job is half the battle.
example.tran: 选对了涂料，这项工作就成功了一半。

collins.tran: 战线已划定；对垒之势已成
collins.def: If you say that the battle lines are drawn between opposing groups or people, you mean that they are ready to start fighting or arguing, and that it has become clear what the main points of conflict or disagreement will be.

example.ex: The battle lines were drawn after the government refused to budge from its final offer.
example.tran: 政府拒绝改变其最后条件之后，双方对立态势趋向明朗。

collins.def: If you are fighting a losing battle, you are trying to achieve something but are not going to be successful.

example.ex: The crew fought a losing battle to try to restart the engines.
example.tran: 全体船员努力尝试重新启动发动机，但结果徒劳无功。

example.ex: ...on a day when the sun is fighting a losing battle against the lowering clouds.
example.tran: 那天，太阳慢慢被低垂的云层遮蔽起来。

collins.def: If one group or person battles it out with another, they take part in a fight or contest against each other until one of them wins or a definite result is reached. You can also say that two groups or two people battle it out .

example.ex: In the Cup Final, Leeds battled it out with the old enemy, Manchester United...
example.tran: 在足总杯决赛中，利兹联队和宿敌曼彻斯特联队一决胜负。

example.ex: Barbados could have three new political parties battling it out in the next General Election.
example.tran: 在下一届大选中，巴巴多斯可能有三个新的政党参加角逐。

collins.tran: 虽败犹胜/ 虽胜犹败
collins.def: If you say that someone has lost the battle ,but won the war, you mean that although they have been defeated in a small conflict they have won a larger, more important one of which it was a part. If you say that someone has won the battle but lost the war, you mean that they have won the small conflict but lost the larger one.

example.ex: The strikers may have won the battle, but they lost the war.
example.tran: 罢工者们虽胜犹败。

collins.def: A battle of wills is a situation that involves people who try to defeat each other by refusing to change their own aims or demands and hoping that their opponents will weaken first.

example.ex: The President offered compromises to parliament to defuse the battle of wills over who should wield power.
example.tran: 总统对国会作出让步，以求结束这场旷日持久的权力争斗。

collins.def: If you refer to a situation as a battle of wits, you mean that it involves people with opposing aims who compete with each other using their intelligence, rather than force.

example.ex: With chess you're involved in a battle of wits from start to finish.
example.tran: 下国际象棋从头到尾都是在比拼智慧。

means: 地位较高的，资历较深的

collins.tran: (在组织或专业领域中)级别高的，资深的
collins.def: The senior people in an organization or profession have the highest and most important jobs.

example.ex: ...senior officials in the Israeli government.
example.tran: 以色列政府的高级官员

example.ex: ...the company's senior management...
example.tran: 公司的高级管理层

collins.tran: 职位高于…的;资格比…老的;更资深的
collins.def: If someone is senior to you in an organization or profession, they have a higher and more important job than you or they are considered to be superior to you because they have worked there for longer and have more experience.

example.ex: The position had to be filled by an officer senior to Haig...
example.tran: 这个位置必须由一个职位高于黑格的官员来担任。

example.ex: Williams felt himself to be senior to all of them.
example.tran: 威廉斯自认为比他们所有人资格都要老。

collins.tran: 较年长的人;比…大…岁的人
collins.def: Senior is used when indicating how much older one person is than another. For example, if someone is ten years your senior, they are ten years older than you.

example.ex: She became involved with a married man many years her senior.
example.tran: 她和一个比自己大很多岁的已婚男子好上了。

collins.tran: (中学或大学里的)高年级学生，毕业班学生
collins.def: Seniors are students in a high school, university, or college who are the oldest and who have reached an advanced level in their studies.
If you take part in a sport at senior level, you take part in competitions with adults and people who have reached a high degree of achievement in that sport.

example.ex: This will be his fifth international championship and his third at senior level.
example.tran: 这将是他第五个世界冠军，第三个成人级别赛事的冠军。

collins.tran: (高尔夫、网球等体育运动中的)年长的运动员，资深运动员
collins.def: In sports such as golf and tennis, a senior is a professional player who is fairly old and who plays in special competitions against other older players.
The function of something or someone is the useful thing that they do or are intended to do.

example.ex: The main function of the merchant banks is to raise capital for industry.
example.tran: 商业银行的主要职能是为产业融资。

collins.def: If a machine or system is functioning, it is working or operating.

example.ex: The authorities say the prison is now functioning normally...
example.tran: 当局称监狱现在运转正常。

example.ex: Conservation programs cannot function without local support.
example.tran: 没有地方的支持，自然环境保护项目就无法运作。

collins.tran: 发挥功能;起作用;行使职责
collins.def: If someone or something functions as a particular thing, they do the work or fulfil the purpose of that thing.

example.ex: On weekdays, one third of the room functions as workspace.
example.tran: 在工作日，房间的1/3用作办公区域。

collins.tran: (计算机的)功能(指执行的一系列操作)
collins.def: A function is a series of operations that a computer performs, for example when a single key or a combination of keys is pressed.

collins.tran: 应变量;随他物变化而变化的事物
collins.def: If you say that one thing is a function of another, you mean that its amount or nature depends on the other thing.

example.ex: Investment is a function of the interest rate.
example.tran: 投资随着利率的变化而变。

collins.def: A function is a large formal dinner or party.
A document is one or more official pieces of paper with writing on them.

example.ex: The foreign ministers of the two countries signed the documents today.
example.tran: 两国的外交大臣今天签署了文件。

example.ex: ...a policy document for the Labour Party conference...
example.tran: 为工党大会准备的政策文件

collins.def: A document is a piece of text or graphics, for example a letter, that is stored as a file on a computer and that you can access in order to read it or change it.

example.ex: When you are finished typing, remember to save your document.
example.tran: 完成录入后，记得将文档存盘。

collins.def: If you document something, you make a detailed record of it in writing or on film or tape.

example.ex: He wrote a book documenting his prison experiences...
example.tran: 他写书详细记录了他的狱中经历。

example.ex: The effects of smoking have been well documented.
example.tran: 有关吸烟的影响记录翔实。

means: 和 neither 或 not 连用

collins.tran: (在否定句中用于 neither 之后以引出第二项或几项中的最后一项)也不，也没有
collins.def: You use nor after 'neither' in order to introduce the second alternative or the last of a number of alternatives in a negative statement.

example.ex: Neither Mr Rose nor Mr Woodhead was available for comment yesterday...
example.tran: 昨天罗斯先生和伍德黑德先生都无暇发表意见。

example.ex: I can give you neither an opinion nor any advice...
example.tran: 我既不能给你意见，也不能提供任何建议。

collins.tran: (用于否定陈述后，表示该否定句也适用于自己、其他人或其他事物)也不，也没有
collins.def: You use nor after a negative statement in order to indicate that the negative statement also applies to you or to someone or something else.

example.ex: 'None of us has any idea how long we're going to be here.' — 'Nor do I.'...
example.tran: “我们没有人知道要在这儿呆多久。”——“我也不知道。”

example.ex: 'If my husband has no future,' she said, 'then nor do my children.'...
example.tran: “如果我丈夫没有前途，”她说，“那我的孩子们也没有。”

collins.tran: (用于否定句后，引出另一否定句补充前句)
collins.def: You use nor after a negative statement in order to introduce another negative statement which adds information to the previous one.

example.ex: Cooking up a quick dish doesn't mean you have to sacrifice flavour. Nor does fast food have to be junk food.
example.tran: 烹饪快餐并不意味着牺牲风味，快餐也不见得就一定是垃圾食品。

collins.def: An aircraft is a vehicle which can fly, for example an aeroplane or a helicopter.

example.ex: The return flight of the aircraft was delayed...
example.tran: 回程航班被延误了。

example.ex: At least three military aircraft were destroyed.
example.tran: 至少3架军用飞机被毁。

collins.def: Territory is land which is controlled by a particular country or ruler.

example.ex: The government denies that any of its territory is under rebel control.
example.tran: 政府否认有领土被反叛分子所控制。

example.ex: ...Russian territory.
example.tran: 俄罗斯领土

collins.tran: 属地，地区，托管地(指被别国控制的国家或地区)
collins.def: A territory is a country or region that is controlled by another country.

example.ex: They just want to return to their families in the occupied territories...
example.tran: 他们只是想回到在占领区的家人身边。

example.ex: He toured some of the disputed territories now under UN control.
example.tran: 他去一些目前由联合国接管的争议地区巡视了一番。

collins.def: You can use territory to refer to an area of knowledge or experience.

example.ex: Following the futuristic The Handmaid's Tale, Margaret Atwood's seventh novel, Cat's Eye, returns to more familiar territory...
example.tran: 写完了具有未来色彩的《女仆的故事》之后，玛格丽特·阿特伍德的第七部小说《猫眼》回归到了人们较熟悉的题材上。

example.ex: Reading from a tedious technical brief for hours on end, he would stray into difficult territory.
example.tran: 连续看上几个小时枯燥的技术简报后，他会不自觉地钻起牛角尖来。

collins.def: An animal's territory is an area which it regards as its own and which it defends when other animals try to enter it.

example.ex: The territory of a cat only remains fixed for as long as the cat dominates the area.
example.tran: 猫的地盘只在它占据那个地方的时候是固定不变的。

collins.def: Territory is land with a particular character.

example.ex: ...mountainous territory.
example.tran: 多山地带

example.ex: ...a vast and uninhabited territory.
example.tran: 广阔的无人居住区

collins.tran: 是难免的事;是必然的事
collins.def: If you say that something comes with the territory, you mean that you accept it as a natural result of the situation you are in.

example.ex: Doing human rights work is risky business. That comes with the territory...
example.tran: 做人权工作是要冒风险的。这是难免的。

example.ex: You can't expect not to have a debate; that's what comes with the territory in a democracy.
example.tran: 不要指望不会发生辩论，那在民主社会已成为必然。

collins.def: Loss is the fact of no longer having something or having less of it than before.

example.ex: ...loss of sight...
example.tran: 失明

example.ex: The loss of income for the government is about $250 million a month.
example.tran: 政府收入每月大概减少2.5亿美元。

collins.def: Loss of life occurs when people die.

example.ex: ...a terrible loss of human life...
example.tran: 伤亡惨重

example.ex: The allies suffered less than 20 casualties while enemy losses were said to be high.
example.tran: 盟军伤亡人数不到20，而敌军则据说人员损失惨重。

collins.tran: （亲人或朋友的）丧故，亡故，逝世
collins.def: The loss of a relative or friend is their death.

example.ex: They took the time to talk about the loss of Thomas and how their grief was affecting them.
example.tran: 他们慢慢谈到了托马斯的死和悲痛给他们带来的影响。

example.ex: ...the loss of his mother.
example.tran: 他母亲的亡故

collins.def: If a business makes a loss, it earns less than it spends.

example.ex: In 1986 Rover made a loss of nine hundred million pounds...
example.tran: 1986年，路虎亏损9亿英镑。

example.ex: The company said it will stop producing fertilizer in 1990 because of continued losses.
example.tran: 由于持续亏损，该公司说它将在1990年停止生产化肥。

collins.def: Loss is the feeling of sadness you experience when someone or something you like is taken away from you.

example.ex: Talk to others about your feelings of loss and grief...
example.tran: 把自己的失落和悲伤向他人倾诉。

example.ex: He always woke with a sense of deep sorrow and depressing loss.
example.tran: 他醒来时总是满怀哀愁，抑郁惆怅。

collins.def: A loss is the disadvantage you suffer when a valuable and useful person or thing leaves or is taken away.

example.ex: She said his death was a great loss to herself.
example.tran: 她说他的死对自己来说是巨大的损失。

collins.tran: （热量、血液、液体等的）流失，散失，减少
collins.def: The loss of something such as heat, blood, or fluid is the gradual reduction of it or of its level in a system or in someone's body.

example.ex: ...blood loss.
example.tran: 失血

example.ex: ...weight loss.
example.tran: 瘦身

collins.def: If a business produces something at a loss, they sell it at a price which is less than it cost them to produce it or buy it.

example.ex: New fashion designs have to be sold off at a loss if sales are poor.
example.tran: 新款时装遇上销路不畅就要蚀本卖出。

collins.tran: 茫然不知所措；不知如何是好
collins.def: If you say that you are at a loss, you mean that you do not know what to do in a particular situation.

example.ex: I was at a loss for what to do next...
example.tran: 下一步该怎么做，我完全没谱。

example.ex: The government is at a loss to know how to tackle the violence.
example.tran: 对于如何应对暴力问题，政府现在一筹莫展。

collins.def: If you cut your losses, you stop doing what you were doing in order to prevent the bad situation that you are in becoming worse.

example.ex: Directors are right to cut their losses, admit they chose the wrong man and make a change.
example.tran: 董事们当断则断，承认自己选错了人，并且作了人员变更，这样做是正确的。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is a dead loss, you have a low opinion of them because you think they are completely useless or unsuccessful.

example.ex: I'd had no experience of organizing anything of that sort. I think I was largely a dead loss.
example.tran: 筹办那类活动我毫无经验。我看我基本是个废物。

collins.def: The bottom of something is the lowest or deepest part of it.

example.ex: He sat at the bottom of the stairs...
example.tran: 他坐在最下面的一级楼梯上。

example.ex: Answers can be found at the bottom of page 8.
example.tran: 在第8页末尾可以找到答案。

collins.tran: 最下方的；底部的；底层的
collins.def: The bottom thing or layer in a series of things or layers is the lowest one.

example.ex: There's an extra duvet in the bottom drawer of the cupboard.
example.tran: 橱柜最底层的抽屉里还有一床羽绒被。

collins.def: The bottom of an object is the flat surface at its lowest point. You can also refer to the inside or outside of this surface as the bottom .

example.ex: Spread the onion slices on the bottom of the dish.
example.tran: 把洋葱片铺在盘底。

example.ex: ...the bottom of their shoes.
example.tran: 他们的鞋底

collins.tran: （某市场或产业的)最差状况，低谷
collins.def: If you say that the bottom has dropped or fallen out of a market or industry, you mean that people have stopped buying the products it sells.

example.ex: The bottom had fallen out of the city's  property market.
example.tran: 该市的房地产市场已陷入极度低迷。

collins.def: The bottom of a street or garden is the end farthest away from you or from your house.

example.ex: ...the Cathedral at the bottom of the street.
example.tran: 街道尽头的大教堂

collins.def: The bottom of a table is the end farthest away from where you are sitting. The bottom of a bed is the end where you usually rest your feet.

example.ex: Malone sat down on the bottom of the bed.
example.tran: 马隆在床脚坐下了。

collins.tran: （组织机构或职业架构的）最底层，基层
collins.def: The bottom of an organization or career structure is the lowest level in it, where new employees often start.

example.ex: He had worked in the theatre for many years, starting at the bottom.
example.tran: 他从最基础的干起，已经从事戏剧工作很多年了。

example.ex: ...a contract researcher at the bottom of the pay scale.
example.tran: 工资级别最低的合同研究人员

collins.tran: （调查、测试或联赛中的）表现最差者，最后一名
collins.def: If someone is bottom or at the bottom in a survey, test, or league their performance is worse than that of all the other people involved.

example.ex: He was always bottom of the class...
example.tran: 他一直是全班的最后一名。

example.ex: The team is close to bottom of the League.
example.tran: 这支球队快跌至联赛末席了。

collins.def: Your bottom is the part of your body that you sit on.

example.ex: If there was one thing she could change about her body it would be her bottom.
example.tran: 如果能对自己的身体做一点改变，那她会选择臀部。

collins.tran: （比基尼泳装的）泳裤；（田径服、睡衣的）裤子
collins.def: The lower part of a bikini, tracksuit, or pair of pyjamas can be referred to as the bottoms or the bottom.

example.ex: She wore blue tracksuit bottoms.
example.tran: 她穿了一件蓝色田径裤。

example.ex: ...a skimpy bikini bottom.
example.tran: 极其暴露的比基尼泳裤

collins.def: You use at bottom to emphasize that you are stating what you think is the real nature of something or the real truth about a situation.

example.ex: The two systems are, at bottom, conceptual models...
example.tran: 这两个系统实质上是两种概念模式。

example.ex: At bottom, such an attitude is born not of concern for your welfare, but out of fear of losing you.
example.tran: 实际上，这种态度并非源自对你幸福的关心，而是出于害怕失去你。

collins.tran: 是…的真正原因；是…的根源
collins.def: If something is at the bottom of a problem or unpleasant situation, it is the real cause of it.

example.ex: Often I find that anger and resentment are at the bottom of the problem.
example.tran: 我常常发现愤怒和不满是问题的真正根源。

collins.def: You can say that you mean something from the bottom of your heart to emphasize that you mean it very sincerely.

example.ex: I'm happy, and I mean that from the bottom of my heart...
example.tran: 我很开心，而且是那种发自肺腑的开心。

example.ex: I want to thank everyone from the bottom of my heart.
example.tran: 我要衷心感谢每一个人。

collins.tran: 找到…的真正起因；查寻到…的根源
collins.def: If you want to get to the bottom of a problem, you want to solve it by finding out its real cause.

example.ex: I have to get to the bottom of this mess.
example.tran: 我必须查清造成这一混乱局面的真正原因。

collins.def: Some people say bottoms up to each other just before drinking an alcoholic drink.
If you mention something, you say something about it, usually briefly.

example.ex: She did not mention her mother's absence...
example.tran: 她并没有说起她母亲不在场的事。

example.ex: I may not have mentioned it to her...
example.tran: 我可能没跟她提过这件事。

collins.def: A mention is a reference to something or someone.

example.ex: The statement made no mention of government casualties...
example.tran: 声明里没有提及政府方面的伤亡情况。

example.ex: At the community centre, mention of funds produces pained looks.
example.tran: 在社区中心一提到资金问题，大家就会愁眉不展。

collins.tran: （在文章中）提到，谈及(某人的名字)
collins.def: If someone is mentioned in writing, a reference is made to them by name, often to criticize or praise something that they have done.

example.ex: I was absolutely outraged that I could be even mentioned in an article of this kind...
example.tran: 我大为恼火，我的名字居然出现在这种文章里面。

example.ex: As for your father, he won't be mentioned in my will.
example.tran: 至于你父亲，我的遗嘱里不会提到他的名字。

collins.def: If someone is mentioned as a candidate for something such as a job, it is suggested that they might  become a candidate.

example.ex: His appointment is a complete surprise — he has never been mentioned as a front runner...
example.tran: 他的任命完全出人意料——他从来都不是呼声最高的候选人。

example.ex: Her name has been mentioned as a favoured leadership candidate.
example.tran: 提到她的名字时，说她是领导职位的热门候选人。

collins.def: A special or honourable mention is formal praise that is given for an achievement that is very good, although not usually the best of its kind.

example.ex: So many people have helped me with this book that it is hard to pick out the few for special mention.
example.tran: 帮助我完成本书的人数太多，难以从中选出几位特别致谢。

collins.def: People sometimes say 'don't mention it' as a polite reply to someone who has just thanked them for doing something.

example.ex: 'Thank you very much.' — 'Don't mention it.'
example.tran: “非常感谢！”——“别客气。”

collins.def: You use not to mention when you want to add extra information which emphasizes the point that you are making.

example.ex: The audience, not to mention the bewildered cast, were not amused...
example.tran: 观众们并没有觉得好笑，更不用说那些一头雾水的演员了。

example.ex: It was both deliberate and malicious, not to mention clever.
example.tran: 这件事是处心积虑、早有预谋的，更不用说其手段的高明。

collins.def: If a situation or activity involves something, that thing is a necessary part or consequence of it.

example.ex: Running a kitchen involves a great deal of discipline and speed...
example.tran: 料理好厨房需要把一切都安排得规规矩矩，且要讲求速度。

example.ex: Nicky's job as a public relations director involves spending quite a lot of time with other people.
example.tran: 尼基作为公共关系主管，需要花很多时间与别人打交道。

collins.def: If a situation or activity involves someone, they are taking part in it.

example.ex: If there was a cover-up, it involved people at the very highest levels of government.
example.tran: 如果有人想要隐瞒实情,那其中就涉及政府部门最高层的人物。

example.ex: ...a riot involving a hundred inmates...
example.tran: 有 100 名囚犯参与的暴动

collins.def: If you say that someone involves themselves in something, you mean that they take part in it, often in a way that is unnecessary or unwanted.

example.ex: I seem to have involved myself in something I don't understand.
example.tran: 我似乎卷入了一件我并不知情的事情当中。

collins.def: If you involve someone else in something, you get them to take part in it.

example.ex: Noel and I do everything together, he involves me in everything...
example.tran: 我和诺埃尔什么事情都一起做,他让我参与所有的事。

example.ex: Before too long he started involving me in the more confidential aspects of the job.
example.tran: 不久,他便开始让我介入工作中更机密的方面。

collins.def: If one thing involves you in another thing, especially something unpleasant or inconvenient, the first thing causes you to do or deal with the second.

example.ex: A late booking may involve you in extra cost...
example.tran: 预订晚了的话你可能要额外多花钱。

example.ex: This involved me in a round trip of over 400 miles.
example.tran: 为此我需要往返旅行 400 多英里。

collins.tran: 非常严重的;骇人的;糟糕的
collins.def: A terrible experience or situation is very serious or very unpleasant.

example.ex: Tens of thousands more suffered terrible injuries in the world's worst industrial disaster...
example.tran: 还有成千上万的人在那场全世界最严重的工业灾难中受了重伤。

example.ex: I often have the most terrible nightmares...
example.tran: 我常做很吓人的噩梦。

collins.tran: (感觉或看起来)病得很重的，心情很糟的
collins.def: If you feel terrible, you feel extremely ill or unhappy. If you tell someone that they look terrible, you mean that they look as if they are extremely ill or unhappy.

example.ex: He did feel terrible at the time but seems to be fine now...
example.tran: 他当时确实很难受，但现在似乎好了。

example.ex: Are you all right? You look terrible. Are you sick?
example.tran: 你没事儿吧？你的脸色很难看，生病了吗？

collins.def: If something is terrible, it is very bad or of very poor quality.

example.ex: She admits her French is terrible.
example.tran: 她承认自己的法语很蹩脚。

collins.tran: (用来加强语气)十足的，极度的，不折不扣的
collins.def: You use terrible to emphasize the great extent or degree of something.

example.ex: I was a terrible fool, you know. I remember that now...
example.tran: 你知道，我那时愚蠢至极。我至今还记得。

example.ex: Her death is a terrible waste.
example.tran: 她死得太不值了。

collins.def: If you have done something recently or if something happened recently, it happened only a short time ago.

example.ex: The bank recently opened a branch in Germany...
example.tran: 这家银行最近在德国开设了分行。

example.ex: It is only fairly recently that historians have begun to investigate the question...
example.tran: 只是到最近历史学家才开始探究这个问题。

collins.def: Someone who is poor has very little money and few possessions.

example.ex: The reason our schools cannot afford better teachers is because people here are poor...
example.tran: 我们的学校请不起好老师的原因是因为这里的人穷。

example.ex: He was one of thirteen children from a poor family.
example.tran: 他是13名来自贫困家庭的孩子之一。

collins.def: The people in a poor country or area have very little money and few possessions.

example.ex: Many countries in the Third World are as poor as they have ever been.
example.tran: 很多第三世界国家仍和过去一样穷困。

example.ex: ...a settlement house for children in a poor neighborhood.
example.tran: 为贫民区儿童设立的街坊文教馆

collins.def: You use poor to express your sympathy for someone.

example.ex: I feel sorry for that poor child...
example.tran: 我为那个可怜的孩子感到难过。

example.ex: Poor chap — he was killed in an air crash...
example.tran: 不幸的家伙，他死于空难。

collins.def: If you describe something as poor, you mean that it is of a low quality or standard or that it is in bad condition.

example.ex: The flat was in a poor state of repair...
example.tran: 公寓严重失修。

example.ex: The gap between the best and poorest childcare provision in the European Union has widened...
example.tran: 欧盟最好和最差的儿童保育服务之间的差距扩大了。

collins.tran: （数量、比率等）不理想的，不合理的
collins.def: If you describe an amount, rate, or number as poor, you mean that it is less than expected or less than is considered reasonable.

example.ex: ...poor wages and working conditions.
example.tran: 低薪和恶劣的工作条件

collins.def: You use poor to describe someone who is not very skilful in a particular activity.

example.ex: He was a poor actor...
example.tran: 他是个蹩脚的演员。

example.ex: Hospitals are poor at collecting information.
example.tran: 医院收集信息能力很差。

collins.def: If something is poor in a particular quality or substance, it contains very little of the quality or substance.

example.ex: Fats and sugar are very rich in energy but poor in vitamins, minerals and dietary fibre.
example.tran: 脂肪和糖类热量很高，但维生素、矿物质和膳食纤维贫乏。

example.ex: ...soil that is poor in zinc.
example.tran: 缺锌的土壤

collins.def: Something that is orange is of a colour between red and yellow.

example.ex: ...men in bright orange uniforms.
example.tran: 身着亮橙色制服的人

collins.def: An orange is a round juicy fruit with a thick, orange coloured skin.

example.ex: An orange a day will give you all the vitamin C you need.
example.tran: 每天吃一个橙子能充分摄取所需的维生素C。

example.ex: ...orange trees.
example.tran: 橙树

collins.def: Orange is a drink that is made from or tastes of oranges.

example.ex: ...vodka and orange.
example.tran: 橙汁伏特加酒

collins.def: The length of something is the amount that it measures from one end to the other along the longest side.

example.ex: It is about a metre in length.
example.tran: 它长约1米。

example.ex: ...the length of the fish...
example.tran: 鱼的身长

collins.def: The length of something such as a piece of writing is the amount of writing that is contained in it.

example.ex: ...a book of at least 100 pages in length...
example.tran: 一百多页厚的书

example.ex: The length of a paragraph depends on the information it conveys.
example.tran: 段落的长短取决于它所传达的信息量。

collins.def: The length of an event, activity, or situation is the period of time from beginning to end for which something lasts or during which something happens.

example.ex: The exact length of each period may vary...
example.tran: 每一阶段的确切时长可能会有所不同。

example.ex: His film, over two hours in length, is a subtle study of family life.
example.tran: 他这部片长逾两个小时的电影对家庭生活进行了巧妙的剖析。

collins.tran: （绳、布、木头等的）一段，一节，一截
collins.def: A length of rope, cloth, wood, or other material is a piece of it that is intended to be used for a particular purpose or that exists in a particular situation.

example.ex: ...a 30ft length of rope...
example.tran: 一根30英尺长的绳子

example.ex: You can hang lengths of fabric behind the glass.
example.tran: 你可以在玻璃后面挂几条织品。

collins.def: The length of something is its quality of being long.

example.ex: Many have been surprised at the length of time it has taken him to make up his mind...
example.tran: 他居然花了那么长时间才拿定主意，许多人都对此感到吃惊。

example.ex: I noticed, too, the length of her fingers.
example.tran: 我也注意到她的手指很长。

collins.def: If you swim a length in a swimming pool, you swim the distance from one end to the other.

example.ex: I swim 40 lengths a day.
example.tran: 我每天游20个来回。

collins.tran: （赛艇中的）艇位；（赛马中的）马位，马身长度
collins.def: In boat racing or horse racing, a length is the distance from the front to the back of the boat or horse. You can talk about one boat or horse being one or more lengths in front of or behind another.

example.ex: Harvard won by four lengths.
example.tran: 哈佛大学队领先4个艇位胜出。

collins.def: If something happens or exists along the length of something, it happens or exists for the whole way along it.

example.ex: I looked along the length of the building...
example.tran: 我的目光沿着大楼从首到尾扫过。

example.ex: The inspiration stemming from his travels lasted the length of his career.
example.tran: 由旅行得来的灵感伴随了他的整个职业生涯。

collins.def: If someone does something at length, they do it after a long period of time.

example.ex: At length my father went into the house.
example.tran: 我父亲最后还是进了屋。

collins.def: If someone does something at length, they do it for a long time or in great detail.

example.ex: They spoke at length, reviewing the entire incident.
example.tran: 他们把事情的整个经过详尽地复述了一遍。

collins.tran: 不遗余力；竭尽全力；千方百计
collins.def: If you say that someone goes to great lengths to achieve something, you mean that they try very hard and perhaps do extreme things in order to achieve it.

example.ex: Greta Garbo went to great lengths to hide from reporters and photographers.
example.tran: 葛丽泰·嘉宝想方设法躲开记者和摄影师。

means: 该死！（令人气愤的人应即被送毒气室处死）

collins.def: Gas is a substance like air that is neither liquid nor solid and burns easily. It is used as a fuel for cooking and heating.

example.ex: Coal is actually cheaper than gas...
example.tran: 煤实际上比煤气便宜。

example.ex: Shell signed a contract to develop oil and gas reserves near Archangel.
example.tran: 壳牌石油公司签订了一份开采阿尔汉格尔附近的石油和天然气资源的合同。

collins.def: A gas is any substance that is neither liquid nor solid, for example oxygen or hydrogen.

example.ex: Helium is a very light gas.
example.tran: 氦是一种非常轻的气体。

example.ex: ...a huge cloud of gas and dust from the volcanic eruption.
example.tran: 火山喷发形成的混杂着气体和尘埃的巨大云团

collins.def: Gas is a poisonous gas that can be used as a weapon.

example.ex: ...mustard gas...
example.tran: 芥子气

example.ex: The problem was that the exhaust gases contain many toxins.
example.tran: 问题在于废气中含有很多毒素。

collins.def: Gas is a gas used for medical purposes, for example to make patients feel less pain or go to sleep during an operation.

example.ex: ...an anaesthetic gas used by many dentists.
example.tran: 为许多牙医使用的一种麻醉气

collins.def: Gas is the fuel which is used to drive motor vehicles.

example.ex: ...a tank of gas.
example.tran: 一桶汽油

example.ex: ...gas stations.
example.tran: 加油站

collins.def: To gas a person or animal means to kill them by making them breathe poisonous gas.

example.ex: Her husband ran a pipe from her car exhaust to the bedroom in an attempt to gas her.
example.tran: 她的丈夫将一根与她的汽车排气管相通的管子导入卧室，企图用毒气将她杀死。

collins.tran: 活泼有趣的事；令人愉快的场面
collins.def: You can describe a situation or event as a gas when it is very lively, amusing, and enjoyable.

example.ex: It was really a gas to find someone I could talk with.
example.tran: 找到一个能和我谈得来的人真是一件让人高兴的事。

collins.def: If you step on the gas when you are driving a vehicle, you go faster.

means: （在公共电汽车或火车上）当售票员

collins.def: When you conduct an activity or task, you organize it and carry it out.

example.ex: I decided to conduct an experiment...
example.tran: 我决定进行一次实验。

example.ex: He said they were conducting a campaign against democrats across the country...
example.tran: 他说他们正在全国开展反对民主党人的运动。

collins.tran: (任务或活动的)组织方式，实施办法
collins.def: The conduct of a task or activity is the way in which it is organized and carried out.

example.ex: Also up for discussion will be the conduct of free and fair elections...
example.tran: 同样提出来进行讨论的还有如何进行自由公正的选举。

example.ex: The Conservative Party did not in the main disagree with Bevin's conduct of foreign policy.
example.tran: 保守党大体上不反对贝文的外交施政方式。

collins.def: If you conduct yourself in a particular way, you behave in that way.

example.ex: The way he conducts himself reflects on the party and will increase criticisms against him...
example.tran: 他个人的行事方式给该党招来非议，也会招致更多对他个人的批评。

example.ex: Most people believe they conduct their private and public lives in accordance with Christian morality.
example.tran: 大多数人认为他们是依照基督教的道德体系来处理自己的私生活和公共事务的。

collins.def: Someone's conduct is the way they behave in particular situations.

example.ex: For Europeans, the law is a statement of basic principles of civilised conduct...
example.tran: 对于欧洲人来说，法律是对基本文明行为准则的表述。

example.ex: He has trouble understanding that other people judge him by his conduct.
example.tran: 别人通过他的行为举止对他进行评判，这一点他很难理解。

collins.tran: 指挥(管弦乐队或合唱团)
collins.def: When someone conducts an orchestra or choir, they stand in front of it and direct its performance.

example.ex: Dennis had recently begun a successful career conducting opera in Europe...
example.tran: 丹尼斯最近开始在欧洲担任歌剧指挥，事业发展得很成功。

example.ex: Solti will continue to conduct here and abroad...
example.tran: 索尔蒂将继续在国内外担任指挥。

collins.def: If something conducts heat or electricity, it allows heat or electricity to pass through it or along it.

example.ex: Water conducts heat faster than air.
example.tran: 水的导热速度比空气快。

collins.def: If you conduct someone to a place, you go there with them.

example.ex: He asked if he might conduct us to the ball which was to bring the proceedings to an end.
example.tran: 他问是否可以带我们去舞会现场，整个仪式将在那儿结束。

collins.def: A reporter is someone who writes news articles or who broadcasts news reports.

example.ex: ...a TV reporter.
example.tran: 电视记者

example.ex: ...a trainee sports reporter...
example.tran: 见习体育记者

collins.def: The distance between two points or places is the amount of space between them.

example.ex: ...the distance between the island and the nearby shore...
example.tran: 该岛和附近陆地之间的距离

example.ex: Everything is within walking distance...
example.tran: 不管什么地方，都是走几步就到了。

collins.def: When two things are very far apart, you talk about the distance between them.

example.ex: The distance wouldn't be a problem.
example.tran: 距离不成问题。

collins.def: Distance learning or distance education involves studying at home and sending your work to a college or university, rather than attending the college or university in person.

example.ex: I'm doing a theology degree by distance learning.
example.tran: 我正通过远程教育课程攻读神学学位。

collins.tran: （人际关系的）疏远；（事物间的）差距
collins.def: When you want to emphasize that two people or things do not have a close relationship or are not the same, you can refer to the distance between them.

example.ex: ...the emotional distance between them...
example.tran: 他们之间情感上的疏远

example.ex: There was a vast distance between psychological clues and concrete proof...
example.tran: 心理提示和确凿证据之间相差甚远。

collins.def: If you can see something in the distance, you can see it, far away from you.

example.ex: We suddenly saw her in the distance...
example.tran: 我们突然看见她在远处。

example.ex: Mr. Dambar found himself gazing into the distance for a moment or two.
example.tran: 丹巴先生不知不觉朝远方凝视了片刻。

collins.def: Distance is coolness or unfriendliness in the way that someone behaves towards you.

example.ex: There were periods of sulking, of pronounced distance, of coldness.
example.tran: 沉闷、明显不友好和冷淡的场面多次出现。

collins.tran: 使疏远;对…冷淡;使不介入
collins.def: If you distance yourself from a person or thing, or if something distances you from them, you feel less friendly or positive towards them, or become less involved with them.

example.ex: The author distanced himself from some of the comments in his book...
example.tran: 作者使自己书中的某些评论不带个人色彩。

example.ex: Television may actually be distancing the public from the war.
example.tran: 电视实际上可能让公众远离战争。

collins.tran: 在远处;相距遥远;久远地
collins.def: If you are at a distance from something, or if you see it or remember it from a distance, you are a long way away from it in space or time.

example.ex: The only way I can cope with my mother is at a distance...
example.tran: 我可以和我妈妈相处的唯一方法就是保持距离。

example.ex: Now I can look back on the whole tragedy from a distance of forty years.
example.tran: 时隔40年后，现在我可以回顾整个悲剧了。

collins.def: If you keep your distance from someone or something or keep them at a distance, you do not become involved with them.

example.ex: Jay had always tended to keep his girlfriends at a distance.
example.tran: 杰伊一贯和他的女朋友们保持距离。

collins.def: If you keep your distance from someone or something, you do not get physically close to them.

example.ex: He walked towards the doorway, careful to keep his distance.
example.tran: 他走向门口，小心翼翼地保持着距离。

collins.def: If something such as a box, bag, room, or place contains things, those things are inside it.

example.ex: The bag contained a Christmas card...
example.tran: 这个包里装着一张圣诞卡。

example.ex: Factory shops contain a wide range of cheap furnishings...
example.tran: 工厂车间里陈设着种类繁多的廉价家具。

collins.def: If a substance contains something, that thing is a part of it.

example.ex: Greek yogurt contains much less fat than double cream...
example.tran: 希腊酸奶比高脂浓奶油所含脂肪要少得多。

example.ex: Many cars run on petrol which contains lead.
example.tran: 很多车使用含铅汽油。

collins.tran: (著作、讲话或电影中)包括，包含
collins.def: If writing, speech, or film contains particular information, ideas, or images, it includes them.

example.ex: This sheet contained a list of problems a patient might like to raise with the doctor...
example.tran: 这张单子列出了病人可能会向医生提出的一系列问题。

example.ex: The two discs also contain two of Britten's lesser-known song-cycles.
example.tran: 这两张唱片还包含了布里顿两首不甚知名的声乐套曲。

collins.def: If a group or organization contains a certain number of people, those are the people that are in it.

example.ex: The committee contains 11 Democrats and nine Republicans.
example.tran: 这个委员会包括11名民主党人和9名共和党人。

collins.def: If you contain something, you control it and prevent it from spreading or increasing.

example.ex: More than a hundred firemen are still trying to contain the fire at the plant...
example.tran: 上百名消防队员仍在试图控制工厂的火势。

example.ex: The city authorities said the curfew had contained the violence.
example.tran: 市政府称宵禁遏制住了暴力事件。

collins.def: If you cannot contain a feeling such as excitement or anger, or if you cannot contain yourself, you cannot prevent yourself from showing your feelings.

example.ex: But he was bursting with curiosity, and one day he just couldn't contain himself. 'What are you going to do?' he asked...
example.tran: 但他满心好奇，一天，他真的忍不住了。“你打算做什么？”他问道。

example.ex: Evans could barely contain his delight: 'I'm so proud of her,' he said.
example.tran: 埃文斯喜不自禁：“我真为她骄傲。”他说。

collins.def: A schedule is a plan that gives a list of events or tasks and the times at which each one should happen or be done.

example.ex: He has been forced to adjust his schedule...
example.tran: 他被迫调整了自己的日程安排。

example.ex: We both have such hectic schedules.
example.tran: 我们俩日程安排得都很紧。

collins.def: You can use schedule to refer to the time or way something is planned to be done. For example, if something is completed on schedule, it is completed at the time planned.

example.ex: The jet arrived in Johannesburg two minutes ahead of schedule...
example.tran: 喷气式飞机提前两分钟到达了约翰内斯堡。

example.ex: Everything went according to schedule...
example.tran: 一切都按计划进行。

collins.def: If something is scheduled to happen at a particular time, arrangements are made for it to happen at that time.

example.ex: The space shuttle had been scheduled to blast off at 04:38...
example.tran: 航天飞机已经预定于凌晨 4 点 38 分发射升空。

example.ex: A presidential election was scheduled for last December...
example.tran: 总统选举原计划在去年 12 月举行。

collins.tran: (价格、细节或条件等的)一览表，明细表，清单
collins.def: A schedule is a written list of things, for example a list of prices, details, or conditions.

collins.tran: (火车、客轮、公共汽车或航班的)时刻表,时间表
collins.def: A schedule is a list of all the times when trains, boats, buses, or aircraft are supposed to arrive at or leave a particular place.

example.ex: ...a bus schedule.
example.tran: 公共汽车时刻表

collins.def: In a school or college, a schedule is a diagram that shows the times in the week at which particular subjects are taught.

means: satellite positioning and tracking 卫星定位和跟踪

collins.def: Spots are small, round, coloured areas on a surface.

example.ex: The leaves have yellow areas on the top and underneath are powdery orange spots...
example.tran: 叶子的表面有黄色斑块，背面则有桔色粉状圆点。

example.ex: The swimsuit comes in navy with white spots or blue with green spots.
example.tran: 这款泳衣有藏青色带白色圆点的，也有蓝色带绿色圆点的。

collins.def: Spots on a person's skin are small lumps or marks.

example.ex: Never squeeze blackheads, spots or pimples.
example.tran: 千万不要挤黑头、小肿块或粉刺。

collins.def: A spot of a liquid is a small amount of it.

example.ex: Spots of rain had begun to fall...
example.tran: 雨点开始落下来了。

example.ex: Secure with a few spots of glue.
example.tran: 用几滴胶水粘住。

collins.def: If you have a spot of something, you have a small amount of it.

example.ex: Mr Brooke is undoubtedly in a spot of bother...
example.tran: 布鲁克先生肯定遇到了点小麻烦。

example.ex: A year or two ago I found myself indulging in a spot of yachting in Finnish waters...
example.tran: 一两年前，我有一阵子曾迷上了在芬兰海域中进行帆船运动。

collins.def: You can refer to a particular place as a spot .

example.ex: They stayed at several of the island's top tourist spots...
example.tran: 他们在岛上最著名的几处旅游景点作了停留。

example.ex: They all stood there staring, as if frozen to the spot.
example.tran: 他们都站在那儿发愣，就像被冻在那里似的。

collins.def: A spot in a television or radio show is a part of it that is regularly reserved for a particular performer or type of entertainment.

example.ex: Unsuccessful at screen writing, he got a spot on a CNN film show.
example.tran: 写电影剧本未获成功后，他在美国有线新闻网的一档电影节目中争取到了一个固定时段。

collins.def: If you spot something or someone, you notice them.

example.ex: Vicenzo failed to spot the error...
example.tran: 维森佐未能发现该错误。

example.ex: He left the party seconds before smoke was spotted coming up the stairs.
example.tran: 就在他离开聚会几秒钟后有人发现烟雾顺着楼梯冒上来了。

collins.def: If you are on the spot, you are at the actual place where something is happening.

example.ex: ...areas where troops are on the spot and protecting civilians...
example.tran: 有部队在现场保护平民的地区

example.ex: Mr Connolly is their 'man on the spot' and the person you can call if you have a complaint.
example.tran: 康诺利先生是他们的“现场代表”，要投诉可以和他联系。

collins.def: If you do something on the spot, you do it immediately.

example.ex: James was called to see the producer and got the job on the spot...
example.tran: 詹姆斯被叫去见制片人，当场就得到了那份工作。

example.ex: The surveyor will use a laptop computer to give on the spot advice.
example.tran: 检测员会用一台手提电脑当场给出意见。

collins.def: If you put someone on the spot, you cause them to have to answer a difficult question or make a difficult decision.

example.ex: He put me on the spot a bit because he invited me right in front of his mum and I didn't particularly want to go...
example.tran: 他让我有点难堪，因为他当着他母亲的面邀请我，而我又不太想去。

example.ex: Even clever people are not terribly clever when put on the spot.
example.tran: 即便是聪明人在面对难题时也未必就能表现得特别聪明。

collins.def: If you are in a tight spot, you are in a difficult situation.

example.ex: In a tight spot there is no one I would sooner see than Frank.
example.tran: 有麻烦时，我会首先去找弗兰克。

collins.tran: (委员会、组织机构的)主席;(公司)总裁
collins.def: The chairman of a committee, organization, or company is the head of it.

example.ex: Glyn Ford is chairman of the Committee which produced the report...
example.tran: 格林·福特是提交这份报告的委员会的主席。

example.ex: I had done business with the company's chairman.
example.tran: 我和那家公司的总裁有过生意往来。

collins.def: The chairman of a meeting or debate is the person in charge, who decides when each person is allowed to speak.

example.ex: The chairman declared the meeting open...
example.tran: 大会主席宣布会议开幕。

example.ex: I hear you, Mr. Chairman.
example.tran: 我明白，主席先生！

collins.tran: （用于陈述认为听者已经知道的事）显然地，无疑地
collins.def: You use obviously when you are stating something that you expect the person who is listening to know already.

example.ex: Obviously, they've had sponsorship from some big companies...
example.tran: 很显然，他们已经得到某些大公司的赞助。

example.ex: There are obviously exceptions to this.
example.tran: 这其中无疑存在特例。

collins.def: You use obviously to indicate that something is easily noticed, seen, or recognized.

example.ex: They obviously appreciate you very much...
example.tran: 他们显然对你十分感激。

example.ex: She's so obviously cleverer and prettier than I am.
example.tran: 她明显要比我聪明、漂亮得多。

collins.def: If you supply someone with something that they want or need, you give them a quantity of it.

example.ex: ...an agreement not to produce or supply chemical weapons.
example.tran: 不生产或供应化学武器的协议

example.ex: ...a pipeline which will supply the major Greek cities with Russian natural gas.
example.tran: 从俄罗斯向希腊主要城市输送天然气的管道

collins.tran: (尤指大量的)补给，补给品，日用物资
collins.def: You can use supplies to refer to food, equipment, and other essential things that people need, especially when these are provided in large quantities.

example.ex: What happens when food and gasoline supplies run low?...
example.tran: 如果食物和汽油供应减少，会出现什么情况呢？

example.ex: The country's only supplies are those it can import by lorry from Vietnam.
example.tran: 这个国家仅有的补给品是用卡车从越南进口来的。

collins.def: A supply of something is an amount of it which someone has or which is available for them to use.

example.ex: The brain requires a constant supply of oxygen...
example.tran: 大脑需要持续供氧。

example.ex: Most urban water supplies in the United States now contain fluoride in varying amounts.
example.tran: 现在美国大部分城市供水中都存在含量不一的氟化物。

collins.def: Supply is the quantity of goods and services that can be made available for people to buy.

example.ex: Prices change according to supply and demand.
example.tran: 价格受供求关系的影响。

collins.def: If you supply a missing word or piece of information, for example in a puzzle, you say or write it because you know it.

example.ex: Supply the missing word(s) and you could win a T-shirt.
example.tran: 填出所缺少的单词，你就会赢得一件T恤。

collins.def: If something is in short supply, there is very little of it available and it is difficult to find or obtain.

example.ex: Food is in short supply all over the country...
example.tran: 全国普遍食品供应不足。

example.ex: Nowadays that sort of innocence is in short supply.
example.tran: 现在那种天真烂漫很少见。

means: 坚强的，坚韧的，不屈不挠的

collins.tran: 坚强的;吃苦耐劳的;坚韧不拔的
collins.def: A tough person is strong and determined, and can tolerate difficulty or suffering.

example.ex: He built up a reputation as a tough businessman...
example.tran: 他树立了铁面生意人的名声。

example.ex: She is tough and ambitious.
example.tran: 她坚韧顽强，满怀抱负。

collins.def: If you describe someone as tough, you mean that they are rough and violent.

example.ex: He had shot three people dead earning himself a reputation as a tough guy.
example.tran: 他因枪杀三人得到了暴徒的恶名。

collins.tran: 治安很差的；充满犯罪与暴力的
collins.def: A tough place or area is considered to have a lot of crime and violence.

example.ex: She doesn't seem cut out for this tough neighbourhood...
example.tran: 她似乎不适合在这个治安恶劣的社区生活。

example.ex: Arthur grew up in a tough city.
example.tran: 阿瑟在一个到处是暴力与犯罪的城市长大。

collins.def: A tough way of life or period of time is difficult or full of suffering.

example.ex: She had a pretty tough childhood…
example.tran: 她的童年非常不幸。

example.ex: It's been a tough day…
example.tran: 这是难熬的一天。

collins.tran: 棘手的;难办的;难解决的
collins.def: A tough task or problem is difficult to do or solve.

example.ex: It was a very tough decision but we feel we made the right one...
example.tran: 这是个困难的决定，但是我们认为我们做出了正确的选择。

example.ex: Whoever wins the election is going to have a tough job getting the economy back on its feet…
example.tran: 不管是谁赢得选举都将面对复苏经济的棘手任务。

collins.def: Tough policies or actions are strict and firm.

example.ex: He is known for taking a tough line on security...
example.tran: 他因在安全问题上采取强硬路线而闻名。

example.ex: He announced tough measures to limit the money supply.
example.tran: 他公布了限制货币供应的严厉措施。

collins.def: A tough substance is strong, and difficult to break, cut, or tear.

example.ex: In industry, diamond can form a tough, non-corrosive coating for tools.
example.tran: 在工业上，金刚石可以用作工具表面坚固、耐腐蚀的覆盖层。

example.ex: …dark brown beans with a rather tough outer skin.
example.tran: 有着相当坚韧外壳的深棕色豆类

collins.tran: (肉)非常老的，切不下的，嚼不动的
collins.def: Tough meat is difficult to cut and chew.

example.ex: The steak was tough and the peas were like bullets.
example.tran: 牛排老得嚼不动，豌豆像子弹一样硬。

collins.def: If someone who is trying to achieve something hangs tough, they remain determined and do not give up, even when there are difficulties or problems.

example.ex: The White House is hanging tough for a good agreement to be reached.
example.tran: 白宫为达成一项有利协议寸步不让。

collins.def: If you protest against something or about something, you say or show publicly that you object to it. In American English, you usually say that you protest it.

example.ex: Groups of women took to the streets to  protest against the arrests...
example.tran: 成群结队的妇女上街抗议逮捕行动。

example.ex: The students were protesting at overcrowding in the university hostels...
example.tran: 学生们在抗议大学宿舍过于拥挤。

collins.def: A protest is the act of saying or showing publicly that you object to something.

example.ex: The opposition now seems too weak to stage any serious protests against the government...
example.tran: 反对党现在似乎势力非常弱小，无法针对政府发起真正的抗议。

example.ex: The unions called a two-hour strike in protest at the railway authority's announcement.
example.tran: 各工会号召罢工两小时，以对铁路当局所发通告表示抗议。

collins.def: If you protest that something is the case, you insist that it is the case, when other people think that it may not be.

example.ex: When we tried to protest that Mo was beaten up they didn't believe us...
example.tran: 我们试图申明莫遭到了毒打，他们却不相信我们。

example.ex: 'I never said any of that to her,' he protested...
example.tran: “我从来没有对她那么说过，”他申辩道。

collins.def: A protest that something is true is a strong declaration that it is true.

example.ex: That was how she usually dealt with their protests that she was spoiling her grandchildren.
example.tran: 当他们坚持说她是在溺爱孙儿，她通常会作出那样的回应。

means: 穿（衣）( clothe的第三人称单数)

collins.def: Clothes are the things that people wear, such as shirts, coats, trousers, and dresses.

example.ex: Moira walked upstairs to change her clothes...
example.tran: 莫伊拉上楼去换衣服。

example.ex: He dressed quickly in casual clothes.
example.tran: 他很快穿上休闲装。

collins.tran: 民主;民主制度;民主政体
collins.def: Democracy is a system of government in which people choose their rulers by voting for them in elections.

example.ex: ...the spread of democracy in Eastern Europe.
example.tran: 民主制度在东欧的传播

example.ex: ...the pro-democracy movement.
example.tran: 亲民主运动

collins.def: A democracy is a country in which the people choose their government by voting for it.

example.ex: The new democracies face tough challenges.
example.tran: 这些新兴的民主国家面临着严峻挑战。

collins.tran: 民主管理制度;民主作风
collins.def: Democracy is a system of running organizations, businesses, and groups in which each member is entitled to vote and take part in decisions.

example.ex: ...the union's emphasis on industrial democracy.
example.tran: 该工会对工业民主的强调

collins.tran: 起初的；最初的；原先的；原来的
collins.def: You use original when referring to something that existed at the beginning of a process or activity, or the characteristics that something had when it began or was made.

example.ex: The original plan was to hold an indefinite stoppage...
example.tran: 最初的计划是无限期停工。

example.ex: The inhabitants have voted overwhelmingly to restore the city's original name of Chemnitz.
example.tran: 居民以压倒多数票同意恢复该市原来的名字“开姆尼茨”。

collins.tran: 原物；原件；原作；原著；原文
collins.def: If something such as a document, a work of art, or a piece of writing is an original, it is not a copy or a later version.

example.ex: When you have filled in the questionnaire, copy it and send the original to your employer...
example.tran: 填好这份问卷后，复印一份并将原卷交给雇主。

example.ex: For once the sequel is as good as the original.
example.tran: 续集破天荒地与第一部一样精彩。

collins.tran: 原物的；原件的；原作的；非复制的
collins.def: An original document or work of art is not a copy.

example.ex: ...an original movie poster.
example.tran: 原版电影海报

collins.tran: 新创作的；未发表的；未发行的；未曾演出的
collins.def: An original piece of writing or music was written recently and has not been published or performed before.

example.ex: ...its policy of commissioning original work.
example.tran: 其委托创作新作品的政策

example.ex: ...with catchy original songs by Richard Warner.
example.tran: 以及理查德·沃纳最新创作的朗朗上口的歌曲

collins.def: If you describe someone or their work as original, you mean that they are very imaginative and have new ideas.

example.ex: It is one of the most original works of imagination in the language.
example.tran: 这是用该语言写成的最具独创性和想象力的作品之一。

example.ex: ...an original writer.
example.tran: 独树一帜的作家

collins.def: If you read or sing something in the original or, for example, in the original French, you read or sing it in the language it was written in, rather than a translation.

example.ex: He read every book or author it deals with, often in the original...
example.tran: 这方面的每一本书和每一位作家他都读过，而且通常均为原著。

example.ex: The texts were sung in the original Italian.
example.tran: 这些歌词是用原来的意大利语演唱的。

means: 夸张的行动或形象，小题大做

collins.def: Production is the process of manufacturing or growing something in large quantities.

example.ex: That model won't go into production before late 1990.
example.tran: 那种型号在20世纪90年代末以前不会批量生产。

example.ex: ...tax incentives to encourage domestic production of oil.
example.tran: 鼓励国内石油生产的税收优惠政策

collins.def: Production is the amount of goods manufactured or grown by a company or country.

example.ex: We needed to increase the volume of production...
example.tran: 我们需要提高产量。

example.ex: It expected to maintain production of cars at the same level as last year.
example.tran: 预期今年汽车的产量会和去年持平。

collins.def: The production of something is its creation as the result of a natural process.

example.ex: These proteins stimulate the production of blood cells.
example.tran: 这些蛋白质会刺激血细胞的产生。

collins.tran: （戏剧的）排演；（电影、电视节目的）制作；（唱片的）灌制
collins.def: Production is the process of organizing and preparing a play, film, programme, or CD, in order to present it to the public.

example.ex: During the film's production, the director wanted to shoot a riot scene but the filming was blocked...
example.tran: 在影片摄制期间，导演想拍摄一个暴乱场面，但是被禁止了。

example.ex: She is head of the production company.
example.tran: 她是制片公司的负责人。

collins.def: A production is a play, opera, or other show that is performed in a theatre.

example.ex: For this production she has learnt the role in Spanish.
example.tran: 为了这次演出，她已经学会了用西班牙语演这个角色。

example.ex: ...a critically acclaimed production of Othello.
example.tran: 获得好评的《奥赛罗》

collins.tran: 通过出示；通过展示；通过亮出
collins.def: When you can do something on production of or on the production of documents, you need to show someone those documents in order to be able to do that thing.

example.ex: Entry to the show is free to members on production of their membership cards.
example.tran: 会员只要出示会员卡就可以免费观看演出。

collins.def: If something is below something else, it is in a lower position.

example.ex: He appeared from the apartment directly below Leonard's...
example.tran: 他从伦纳德家正下方的公寓里走了出来。

example.ex: The path runs below a long brick wall...
example.tran: 小道位于长砖墙脚下。

collins.def: If something is below ground or below the ground, it is in the ground.

example.ex: They have designed a system which pumps up water from 70m below ground...
example.tran: 他们设计了一套从地下70米处抽水的系统。

example.ex: Coils buried in tunnels below the ground might soon be used to store large amounts of electricity.
example.tran: 埋在地下隧道里的线圈可能很快就会被用来储存大量的电。

collins.def: You use below in a piece of writing to refer to something that is mentioned later.

example.ex: Please write to me at the address below...
example.tran: 请按照下面的地址给我写信。

example.ex: The BBC Good Food Show is giving away free tickets in a competition. For details, see below.
example.tran: 英国广播公司“美食秀”正在派送比赛免费券，详情见下文。

collins.tran: （数量、比率或水平）低于，小于，少于
collins.def: If something is below a particular amount, rate, or level, it is less than that amount, rate, or level.

example.ex: Night temperatures can drop below 15 degrees Celsius...
example.tran: 夜间气温会降到15摄氏度以下。

example.ex: British Telecom agreed to keep overall price increases to 7.5 per cent below inflation...
example.tran: 英国电信同意将整体价格增幅控制在低于通货膨胀7.5%的水平。

collins.def: If someone is below you in an organization, they are lower in rank.

example.ex: Such people often experience less stress than those in the ranks immediately below them.
example.tran: 这些人承受的压力往往小于那些职位仅次于他们的人。

example.ex: ...pay rises awarded to all white-collar staff below chief officer level.
example.tran: 所有职位低于首席官员的白领员工的薪酬增长

means: （英国）保守党党员，保守党支持者

collins.tran: (英国)保守党的，支持保守党的
collins.def: A Conservative politician or voter is a member of or votes for the Conservative Party in Britain.

example.ex: Most Conservative MPs appear happy with the government's reassurances.
example.tran: 大多数保守党下议院议员似乎都对政府的再三保证感到满意。

example.ex: ...disenchanted Conservative voters.
example.tran: 不再抱任何幻想的保守党选民

collins.def: Someone who is conservative has right-wing views.

example.ex: ...counties whose citizens invariably support the most conservative candidate in any election.
example.tran: 其民众在任何选举中均铁定支持观点最右倾的候选人的几个郡

collins.def: Someone who is conservative or has conservative ideas is unwilling to accept changes and new ideas.

example.ex: People tend to be more aggressive when they're young and more conservative as they get older...
example.tran: 人们年轻的时候往往较为激进，而随着年龄的增长会变得保守起来。

example.ex: It is essentially a narrow and conservative approach to child care.
example.tran: 这实质上是一种狭隘的、因循守旧的照顾孩子的方法。

collins.def: If someone dresses in a conservative way, their clothes are conventional in style.

example.ex: The girl was well dressed, as usual, though in a more conservative style.
example.tran: 这个女孩穿得一如往日那样讲究，只是风格比平日更为传统。

collins.def: A conservative estimate or guess is one in which you are cautious and estimate or guess a low amount which is probably less that the real amount.

example.ex: A conservative estimate of the bill, so far, is about £22,000...
example.tran: 到目前为止，这笔账单保守估计为大约2.2万英镑。

example.ex: This guess is probably on the conservative side.
example.tran: 这个猜测可能偏于保守。

collins.def: Your strength is the physical energy that you have, which gives you the ability to perform various actions, such as lifting or moving things.

example.ex: She has always been encouraged to swim to build up the strength of her muscles...
example.tran: 一直有人鼓励她去游泳以强健体魄。

example.ex: He threw it forward with all his strength...
example.tran: 他使尽全力把它扔向前方。

collins.def: Someone's strength in a difficult situation is their confidence or courage.

example.ex: Something gave me the strength to overcome the difficulty...
example.tran: 有些事给了我克服困难的勇气。

example.ex: His strength is an inspiration to me in my life...
example.tran: 他的自信是对我人生的一种鼓舞。

collins.def: The strength of an object or material is its ability to be treated roughly, or to carry heavy weights, without being damaged or destroyed.

example.ex: He checked the strength of the cables.
example.tran: 他检查了一下钢索的强度。

example.ex: ...the properties of a material, such as strength or electrical conductivity.
example.tran: 一种材料的特性，比如强度或导电性

collins.def: The strength of a person, organization, or country is the power or influence that they have.

example.ex: America values its economic leadership, and the political and military strength that goes with it...
example.tran: 美国重视其经济领导地位以及随之产生的政治和军事实力。

example.ex: The Alliance in its first show of strength drew a hundred thousand-strong crowd to a rally...
example.tran: 该联盟的第一次实力展示便吸引了 10 万余众参加集会。

collins.tran: (情感、意见、信念的)深度，强烈程度，影响程度
collins.def: If you refer to the strength of a feeling, opinion, or belief, you are talking about how deeply it is felt or believed by people, or how much they are influenced by it.

example.ex: He was surprised at the strength of his own feeling...
example.tran: 他感情之强烈令他自己都很吃惊。

example.ex: ...the Civil War and the strength of feeling it had engendered among the Spanish people...
example.tran: 内战以及其在西班牙民众中所激发的强烈情感

collins.def: Someone's strengths are the qualities and abilities that they have which are an advantage to them, or which make them successful.

example.ex: Take into account your own strengths and weaknesses...
example.tran: 考虑一下你自己的优缺点。

example.ex: Vision and ambition are his great strengths...
example.tran: 目光远大、雄心勃勃是他的两大优点。

collins.def: If you refer to the strength of a currency, economy, or industry, you mean that its value or success is steady or increasing.

example.ex: ...the long-term competitive strength of the American economy...
example.tran: 美国经济的长期竞争力

example.ex: The drop was caused partly by the pound's strength against the dollar.
example.tran: 下降的部分原因在于英镑对美元的升值。

collins.def: The strength of a group of people is the total number of people in it.

example.ex: ...elite forces, comprising about one-tenth of the strength of the army.
example.tran: 约占军队总人数1/10的精锐部队

collins.def: The strength of a wind, current, or other force is its power or speed.

example.ex: Its oscillation depends on the strength of the gravitational field...
example.tran: 它的振动幅度取决于引力场的强度。

example.ex: A tropical storm is gaining strength in the eastern Atlantic.
example.tran: 在大西洋东部，一场热带风暴的风力正逐渐增强。

collins.tran: (饮料、化学品、药品的)浓度，浓淡程度
collins.def: The strength of a drink, chemical, or drug is the amount of the particular substance in it that gives it its particular effect.

example.ex: It is very alcoholic, sometimes near the strength of port...
example.tran: 它的酒精浓度很高，有时接近波尔图葡萄酒的浓度。

example.ex: Each capsule contains between 30 and 100 pellets of morphine sulphate according to the strength of dose required...
example.tran: 根据所需剂量的浓度不同，每颗胶囊里含有 30 至 100 个吗啡硫酸盐颗粒。

collins.tran: (味道、气味、颜色、声音、光照的)程度
collins.def: You can talk about the strength of a flavour, smell, colour, sound, or light to describe how intense or easily noticed it is.

example.ex: The wine has lots of strength of flavour.
example.tran: 该酒口味醇厚。

collins.tran: 日益兴隆;不断取得成功;信心倍增
collins.def: If a person or organization goes from strength to strength, they become more and more successful or confident.

example.ex: Since her heart and lung transplant operation she has gone from strength to strength...
example.tran: 做过心肺移植手术后，她的身体不断好转。

example.ex: A decade later, the company has gone from strength to strength.
example.tran: 十年后，该公司已经逐渐壮大。

collins.tran: (队伍或军队的)全员，满员，最佳阵容
collins.def: If a team or army is at full strength, all the members that it needs or usually has are present.

example.ex: He needed more time to bring US forces there up to full strength.
example.tran: 他需要更多时间来增派兵力，以确保驻扎在那里的美国军队兵力充足。

example.ex: ...a full-strength team.
example.tran: 阵容齐整的队伍

collins.def: If a group turns out in strength, they arrive in large numbers.

example.ex: Mr Gore called on voters and party workers to turn out in strength...
example.tran: 戈尔先生号召选民和政党工作人员积极前来投票。

example.ex: Security forces have been out in strength.
example.tran: 已经出动了大批安全部队。

collins.def: If one thing is done on the strength of another, it is done because of the influence of that other thing.

example.ex: He was elected to power on the strength of his charisma...
example.tran: 他凭借其个人魅力而当选掌权。

example.ex: On the strength of those grades, he won a scholarship to Syracuse University.
example.tran: 凭借那些成绩，他赢得了锡拉丘兹大学的奖学金。

collins.tran: (军队或队伍)人员不足，阵容不全
collins.def: If an army or team is under strength or below strength, it does not have all the members that it needs or usually has.

example.ex: His regiments were considerably under strength...
example.tran: 他的几个团兵力严重不足。

example.ex: They had been beaten by a below-strength side.
example.tran: 他们被一支阵容不齐的队伍打败了。

collins.tran: （人）准备就绪的;（物品）准备好的
collins.def: If someone is ready, they are properly prepared for something. If something is ready, it has been properly prepared and is now able to be used.

example.ex: It took her a long time to get ready for church...
example.tran: 她花了很长时间才做好去教堂的准备。

example.ex: The cocaine was ready for distribution...
example.tran: 那些可卡因已经准备好进行分销了。

collins.def: If you are ready for something or ready to do something, you have enough experience to do it or you are old enough and sensible enough to do it.

example.ex: She says she's not ready for marriage...
example.tran: 她说自己还没有准备好结婚。

example.ex: You'll have no trouble getting him into a normal school when you feel he's ready to go.
example.tran: 当你觉得他可以应付的时候再把他弄进一所普通学校是不会有问题的。

collins.tran: 愿意的；乐意的；情愿的；甘愿的
collins.def: If you are ready to do something, you are willing to do it.

example.ex: They were ready to die for their beliefs...
example.tran: 他们甘愿为信仰而死。

example.ex: She was always ready to give interviews.
example.tran: 她一向乐意接受采访。

collins.def: If you are ready for something, you need it or want it.

example.ex: I don't know about you, but I'm ready for bed...
example.tran: 我不知道你怎样，但是我要睡觉了。

example.ex: After five days in the heat of Bangkok, we were ready for the beach.
example.tran: 在曼谷的炎热天气中呆了5天之后，我们想要去海边。

collins.def: To be ready to do something means to be about to do it or likely to do it.

example.ex: She looked ready to cry...
example.tran: 她看起来要哭了。

example.ex: Just as we were ready to sit down to dinner, a little boy came running in...
example.tran: 正当我们要吃晚餐的时候，一个小男孩跑着进来了。

collins.tran: 现成的;就绪的;易于得到的
collins.def: You use ready to describe things that are able to be used very quickly and easily.

example.ex: I didn't have a ready answer for this dilemma...
example.tran: 我没有想出解决这个困境的现成答案。

example.ex: 'But not quite yet,' he says quickly, with that ready smile of his...
example.tran: “但还不至于如此，”他脱口而出，脸上保持着他那一贯的微笑。

collins.def: Ready money is in the form of notes and coins rather than cheques or credit cards, and so it can be used immediately.

example.ex: I'm afraid I don't have enough ready cash.
example.tran: 恐怕我身上没有足够的现金。

collins.def: When you ready something, you prepare it for a particular purpose.

example.ex: John's soldiers were readying themselves for the final assault...
example.tran: 约翰的手下正在为最后的进攻做准备。

example.ex: In Egypt, two new camps were readied for the absorption of refugees...
example.tran: 在埃及，两个新的营地已经准备好收留难民了。

collins.tran: （与过去分词连用）表示“已经…好的”，“事先…的”
collins.def: Ready combines with past participles to indicate that something has already been done, and that therefore you do not have to do it yourself.

example.ex: You can buy ready-printed forms for wills at stationery shops...
example.tran: 你可以在文具店买到已印好的遗嘱单。

example.ex: If you buy the fish ready filleted, make sure the flesh is firm and springy.
example.tran: 如果你要买已经片好的鱼片，一定要买鱼肉紧实有弹性的。

collins.tran: 现成的；可以立即使用的；在手边的
collins.def: If you have something at the ready, you have it in a position where it can be quickly and easily used.

example.ex: Soldiers came charging through the forest, guns at the ready.
example.tran: 荷枪实弹的士兵穿过林区冲了上来。

collins.def: If you want to emphasize that a person is properly prepared for something, or that something can now be used, you can say that they are ready and waiting .

example.ex: She liked to be ready and waiting at home when Bernard returned from work...
example.tran: 她想在伯纳德下班回家的时候把一切准备就绪。

example.ex: The chalet was kept ready and waiting for them at all times.
example.tran: 小屋已收拾好随时迎接他们的到来。

collins.tran: 已经准备就绪；就等你先开始
collins.def: If you say to someone 'Ready when you are', you are telling them that you are now ready to do something and that as soon as they are ready, you will do it.

example.ex: 'Are you ready to pull out?' — 'I'm ready when you are, Captain.'
example.tran: “准备好出发了吗?”——“就等你了，船长。”

collins.def: Transport refers to any vehicle that you can travel in or carry goods in.

example.ex: Have you got your own transport?...
example.tran: 你有自己的交通工具吗？

example.ex: Which type of transport do you prefer?
example.tran: 你更喜欢哪种类型的代步工具？

collins.tran: 交通运输系统;公共交通(网)
collins.def: Transport is a system for taking people or goods from one place to another, for example using buses or trains.

example.ex: The extra money could be spent on improving public transport...
example.tran: 多余的资金可以用于改善公共交通系统。

example.ex: The sudden onset of winter caused havoc with rail and air transport…
example.tran: 冬天的突然降临让铁路和航空运输系统陷入混乱。

collins.def: Transport is the activity of taking goods or people from one place to another in a vehicle.

example.ex: Local production virtually eliminates transport costs.
example.tran: 本地生产实际上消除了运输成本。

collins.def: To transport people or goods somewhere is to take them from one place to another in a vehicle.

example.ex: There's no petrol, so it's very difficult to transport goods...
example.tran: 没有汽油，因此很难运输货物。

example.ex: They use tankers to transport the oil to Los Angeles...
example.tran: 他们用油轮把石油输送到洛杉矶。

collins.def: If you say that you are transported to another place or time, you mean that something causes you to feel that you are living in the other place or at the other time.

example.ex: Dr Drummond felt that he had been transported into a world that rivalled the Arabian Nights...
example.tran: 德拉蒙德博士觉得自己仿佛被带入了一个可与《天方夜谭》相媲美的世界。

example.ex: In a dream you can be transported back in time…
example.tran: 在梦里你可以回到过去。

collins.def: A military or troop transport is a military vehicle, especially a plane, that is used to carry soldiers or equipment.
The growth of something such as an industry, organization, or idea is its development in size, wealth, or importance.

example.ex: ...the growth of nationalism.
example.tran: 民族主义的高涨

example.ex: ...Japan's  enormous economic growth.
example.tran: 日本经济的突飞猛进

collins.def: The growth in something is the increase in it.

example.ex: A steady growth in the popularity of two smaller parties may upset the polls...
example.tran: 两个较小政党的支持率稳步上升，可能会打乱投票结果。

example.ex: The area has seen a rapid population growth...
example.tran: 该地区人口激增。

collins.def: A growth industry, area, or market is one which is increasing in size or activity.

example.ex: Computers and electronics are growth industries and need skilled technicians...
example.tran: 计算机与电子行业属于蓬勃发展的产业，需要娴熟的技术人员。

example.ex: Real estate lending has become the biggest growth area for American banks.
example.tran: 房地产贷款已经成了美国银行业增长最快的业务领域。

collins.def: Someone's  growth is the development and progress of their character.

example.ex: ...the child's emotional and intellectual growth...
example.tran: 孩子的情感与智力发展

example.ex: Different teachers make different contributions to a student's growth.
example.tran: 不同的教师在学生的成长过程中起到不同的作用。

collins.def: Growth in a person, animal, or plant is the process of increasing in physical size and development.

example.ex: ...hormones which control fertility and body growth...
example.tran: 控制生殖和身体发育的荷尔蒙

example.ex: Cells divide and renew as part of the human growth process.
example.tran: 细胞不断地分裂更新，这是人体发育过程的一部分。

collins.tran: 新生发的植株；一茬植株
collins.def: You can use growth to refer to plants which have recently developed or which developed at the same time.

example.ex: This helps to ripen new growth and makes it flower profusely...
example.tran: 这有助于新生发植株的成熟，令其开出繁茂的花朵。

example.ex: Pinch out the tips of the young growths to make for compact, bushy plants.
example.tran: 掐掉幼株的芽尖以便让它们长得紧凑浓密，呈丛生状。

collins.def: A growth is a lump that grows inside or on a person, animal, or plant, and that is caused by a disease.

example.ex: This type of surgery could even be used to extract cancerous growths.
example.tran: 这种外科手术甚至可以用来切除癌性肿瘤。

collins.def: You refer to an activity or situation as fun if you think it is pleasant and enjoyable and it causes you to feel happy.

example.ex: This year promises to be terrifically good fun...
example.tran: 今年一定会非常有意思。

example.ex: It was such a success and we had so much fun doing it...
example.tran: 它大获成功，而我们也从中得到了很多乐趣。

collins.def: If you say that someone is fun, you mean that you enjoy being with them because they say and do interesting or amusing things.

example.ex: Liz was wonderful fun to be with.
example.tran: 莉兹是个非常有趣的伙伴。

collins.tran: 令人愉快的;让人开心的;有趣的
collins.def: If you describe something as a fun thing, you mean that you think it is enjoyable. If you describe someone as a fun person, you mean that you enjoy being with them.

example.ex: It was a fun evening...
example.tran: 那个晚上令人愉快。

example.ex: What a fun person he is!
example.tran: 他多么有趣啊！

collins.tran: 荒唐可笑的人;引人嘲笑的人
collins.def: Someone who is a figure of fun is considered ridiculous, so that people laugh at them or make jokes about them.
If you do something for fun or for the fun of it, you do it in order to enjoy yourself rather than because it is important or necessary.

example.ex: I took my M. A. just for fun really...
example.tran: 我拿文科硕士学位其实就是觉得好玩儿。

example.ex: He had just come for the fun of it.
example.tran: 他来只是为了好玩。

collins.tran: (尤指不负责任的)玩笑，嬉闹，恶作剧
collins.def: You can refer to playful behaviour as fun and games, especially if you disapprove of it because you think it is irresponsible.

example.ex: Police suspected that the boys, whose fun and games hurt a lot of people, were on drugs.
example.tran: 警察怀疑这些经常胡为瞎闹令不少人受害的男孩子在吸毒。

collins.def: If you do something in fun, you do it as a joke or for amusement, without intending to cause any harm.

example.ex: Don't say such things, even in fun.
example.tran: 不要说这些话，就算是开玩笑也不行。

collins.def: If you make fun of someone or something or poke fun at them, you laugh at them, tease them, or make jokes about them in a way that causes them to seem ridiculous.

example.ex: Don't make fun of me...
example.tran: 不要取笑我。

example.ex: She poked fun at people's shortcomings.
example.tran: 她拿别人的缺点开玩笑。

collins.def: Something that is warm has some heat but not enough to be hot.

example.ex: Wheat is grown in places which have cold winters and warm, dry summers...
example.tran: 小麦适宜在冬季寒冷而夏季温暖干燥的地方生长。

example.ex: Because it was warm, David wore only a white cotton shirt...
example.tran: 因为天气暖和，戴维只穿了一件白色的棉衬衣。

collins.def: Warm clothes and blankets are made of a material such as wool which protects you from the cold.

example.ex: They have been forced to sleep in the open without food or warm clothing...
example.tran: 他们被迫风餐露宿，吃不饱也穿不暖。

example.ex: The bed had clean sheets and warm blankets.
example.tran: 床上是干净的被单和暖和的毯子。

collins.def: Warm colours have red or yellow in them rather than blue or green, and make you feel comfortable and relaxed.

example.ex: We hope the colour gives the house a warm and inviting feel...
example.tran: 我们希望这种颜色能让房子给人一种暖意融融、宾至如归的感觉。

example.ex: The basement hallway is painted a warm yellow.
example.tran: 地下室的走廊漆成了暖黄色。

collins.def: A warm person is friendly and shows a lot of affection or enthusiasm in their behaviour.

example.ex: She was a warm and loving mother...
example.tran: 她是一位热情慈爱的母亲。

example.ex: 'Wonderful!' he exclaimed, in the familiar warm voice that made everybody who knew him feel welcome...
example.tran: “太棒了！”他欢呼道，他熟悉而热情的声音让所有认识他的人都感到如沐春风。

collins.def: If you warm a part of your body or if something hot warms it, it stops feeling cold and starts to feel hotter.

example.ex: The sun had come out to warm his back...
example.tran: 太阳出来了，把他后背晒得暖洋洋的。

example.ex: She went to warm her hands by the log fire.
example.tran: 她把手伸向木火堆取暖。

collins.tran: (对某人)产生好感;(对想法)开始感兴趣
collins.def: If you warm to a person or an idea, you become fonder of the person or more interested in the idea.

example.ex: Those who got to know him better warmed to his openness and honesty...
example.tran: 那些对他日渐了解的人被他的坦率和真诚所打动。

example.ex: Elizabeth warmed to her theme as the letter continued with her favourite lament.
example.tran: 随着这封信接下来进入到伊丽莎白最喜欢抱怨的内容，她开始奔向主题。

collins.tran: （足球、无板篮球或曲棍球等的）球门
collins.def: In games such as football, netball or hockey, the goal is the space into which the players try to get the ball in order to score a point for their team.

example.ex: David Seaman was back in the Arsenal goal after breaking a knuckle.
example.tran: 戴维·西曼在一个指关节骨折后又回到阿森纳队的球门前。

collins.tran: （足球或曲棍球赛等的）进球，进球得分
collins.def: In games such as football or hockey, a goal is when a player gets the ball into the goal, or the point that is scored by doing this.

example.ex: They scored five goals in the first half of the match...
example.tran: 他们在上半场比赛中攻入了5球。

example.ex: The scorer of the winning goal.
example.tran: 打进制胜一球的得分手

collins.def: Something that is your goal is something that you hope to achieve, especially when much time and effort will be needed.

example.ex: It's a matter of setting your own goals and following them.
example.tran: 这就需要设立自己的目标并为之努力。

example.ex: The goal is to raise as much money as possible.
example.tran: 目的是筹集到尽可能多的资金。

collins.tran: 持续不断的;重复的;一直存在的
collins.def: You use constant to describe something that happens all the time or is always there.

example.ex: She suggests that women are under constant pressure to be abnormally thin...
example.tran: 她暗示说女性总是处在保持身材异常瘦削的压力之下。

example.ex: Inflation is a constant threat...
example.tran: 通货膨胀始终是个威胁。

collins.def: If an amount or level is constant, it stays the same over a particular period of time.

example.ex: The average speed of the winds remained constant.
example.tran: 平均风速保持稳定。

collins.def: A constant is a thing or value that always stays the same.

example.ex: In the world of fashion it sometimes seems that the only constant is ceaseless change...
example.tran: 在时装界，有时似乎唯一永恒不变的东西就是不断的变化。

example.ex: Two significant constants have been found in a number of research studies.
example.tran: 若干研究已经发现了两个重要常量。

collins.def: A skill is a type of work or activity which requires special training and knowledge.

example.ex: Most of us will know someone who is always learning new skills, or studying new fields.
example.tran: 我们大多数人都会认识某个总是在不停地学习新技术或研究新领域的人。

collins.def: Skill is the knowledge and ability that enables you to do something well.

example.ex: The cut of a diamond depends on the skill of its craftsman.
example.tran: 钻石切割靠的是工匠的技艺。

collins.def: If you defeat someone, you win a victory over them in a battle, game, or contest.

example.ex: His guerrillas defeated the colonial army in 1954...
example.tran: 1954 年他领导的游击队打败了殖民军队。

example.ex: The NHL Stanley Cup was won by the Montreal Canadians, who defeated the Boston Bruins four games to one.
example.tran: 蒙特利尔加拿大人队以 4 比1战胜波士顿棕熊队，夺得了国家冰球联盟斯坦利杯。

collins.def: If a proposal or motion in a debate is defeated, more people vote against it than for it.

example.ex: The proposal was defeated by just one vote.
example.tran: 该提案仅以一票之差被否决。
