collins.def: If a task or a problem defeats you, it is so difficult that you cannot do it or solve it.

example.ex: There were times when the challenges of writing such a huge novel almost defeated her.
example.tran: 有些时候，创作如此宏大的一部小说所面临的挑战几乎把她给难倒了。

collins.tran: 挫败(行动或计划);使落空
collins.def: To defeat an action or plan means to cause it to fail.

example.ex: The navy played a limited but significant role in defeating the rebellion...
example.tran: 海军在平息这场叛乱的过程中起到了有限但却十分重要的作用。

example.ex: He swore to defeat Odin's plan.
example.tran: 他发誓一定要挫败奥丁的计划。

collins.def: Defeat is the experience of being beaten in a battle, game, or contest, or of failing to achieve what you wanted to.

example.ex: The most important thing is not to admit defeat until you really have to...
example.tran: 最重要的是不到万不得已绝不要认输。

example.ex: The vote is seen as a defeat for the anti-abortion lobby...
example.tran: 这一投票结果被看作是反堕胎游说团体的一次失败。

means: 码（等于3英尺或36英寸或0。9144米）

collins.tran: 码（长度单位，等于36英寸或约91.4厘米）
collins.def: A yard is a unit of length equal to thirty-six inches or approximately 91.4 centimetres.

example.ex: The incident took place about 500 yards from where he was standing...
example.tran: 事件发生在距他所站位置大约500码远的地方。

example.ex: A few yards away, Jos Vargas stands beside his small home.
example.tran: 几码之外，乔斯·瓦尔加斯站在他的小房子旁边。

collins.def: A yard is a flat area of concrete or stone that is next to a building and often has a wall around it.

example.ex: I saw him standing in the yard.
example.tran: 我看到他站在院子里。

collins.tran: （进行某项作业的）区域，场地，工场
collins.def: You can refer to a large open area where a particular type of work is done as a yard.

example.ex: ...a railway yard.
example.tran: 铁路调车场

example.ex: ...a ship repair yard.
example.tran: 船舶修理场

collins.def: A yard is a piece of land next to someone's house, with grass and plants growing in it.

example.ex: He dug a hole in our yard on Edgerton Avenue to plant a maple tree when I was born.
example.tran: 我出生的时候，他在埃杰顿大街我们家的园圃里挖了个坑，种了棵枫树。

collins.def: When you ride a horse, you sit on it and control its movements.

example.ex: I saw a girl riding a horse...
example.tran: 我看见一个骑马的女孩。

example.ex: Can you ride?...
example.tran: 你会骑马吗？

collins.tran: 骑(自行车或摩托车)；驾驶
collins.def: When you ride a bicycle or a motorcycle, you sit on it, control it, and travel along on it.

example.ex: Riding a bike is great exercise...
example.tran: 骑自行车是很好的运动。

example.ex: Two men riding on motorcycles opened fire on him...
example.tran: 两个骑摩托车的男人向他开了枪。

collins.def: When you ride in a vehicle such as a car, you travel in it.

example.ex: He prefers travelling on the Tube to riding in a limousine...
example.tran: 他更愿意乘地铁出行，不愿坐豪华轿车。

example.ex: I was riding on the back of a friend's bicycle...
example.tran: 我当时坐在一个朋友的自行车后座上。

collins.tran: (骑马、骑自行车或乘车的)旅行，旅程;车程
collins.def: A ride is a journey on a horse or bicycle, or in a vehicle.

example.ex: She took some friends for a ride in the family car...
example.tran: 她开着自己的家庭轿车载着几个朋友出去兜了一圈。

example.ex: Would you like to go for a ride?...
example.tran: 你想出去兜风吗？

collins.tran: (游乐场中)供骑乘的游乐设施
collins.def: In a fairground, a ride is a large machine that people ride on for fun.
If you say that one thing is riding on another, you mean that the first thing depends on the second thing.

example.ex: Billions of pounds are riding on the outcome of the election...
example.tran: 几十亿英镑都取决于这次选举的结果。

example.ex: Everything rides on the judgment of these few men.
example.tran: 一切都取决于对这几个人的判决。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is riding high, you mean that they are popular or successful at the present time.

example.ex: He was riding high in the public opinion polls...
example.tran: 他在民意调查中支持率颇高。

example.ex: His team is riding high.
example.tran: 他的团队正春风得意。

collins.def: If you say that someone faces a rough ride, you mean that things are going to be difficult for them because people will criticize them a lot or treat them badly.

example.ex: The Chancellor could face a rough ride unless the plan works...
example.tran: 除非这个计划能够奏效，否则财政大臣将举步维艰。

example.ex: The woman who is brave enough to pursue her own path must prepare herself for a rough ride.
example.tran: 勇于走自己道路的女人就必须准备好面对外界的非难。

collins.def: If you say that someone has been taken for a ride, you mean that they have been deceived or cheated.

example.ex: When he had not returned with my money an hour later I realized that I had been taken for a ride.
example.tran: 1个小时后他没有带着我的钱回来，我才意识到自己上当受骗了。

collins.def: A tree is a tall plant that has a hard trunk, branches, and leaves.

example.ex: I planted those apple trees.
example.tran: 我栽了那些苹果树。

example.ex: ...a variety of shrubs and trees.
example.tran: 各种灌木和乔木

collins.tran: 走错路线；搞错方向；想法不对路
collins.def: If you say that someone is barking up the wrong tree, you mean that they are following the wrong course of action because their beliefs or ideas about something are incorrect.

example.ex: Scientists in Switzerland realised that most other researchers had been barking up the wrong tree.
example.tran: 瑞士科学家意识到其他研究者大多研究方向不对头。

collins.tran: 只见树木，不见森林;只重细节，不顾整体
collins.def: If someone can't see the wood for the trees in British English, or can't see the forest for the trees in American English, they are very involved in the details of something and so they do not notice what is important about the thing as a whole.

means: 给（图片、照片等）加说明文字

collins.def: A caption is the words printed underneath a picture or cartoon which explain what it is about.

example.ex: On the back of the photo is written the simple caption, 'Mrs. Monroe'.
example.tran: 照片背面只有简单的几个字——“梦露女士”。

collins.tran: 为(照片或漫画)添加说明文字
collins.def: When someone captions a picture or cartoon, they put a caption under it.

example.ex: The Sun had captioned a picture of Princess Diana 'Princess of Veils'...
example.tran: 《太阳报》在黛安娜王妃的一张照片下写了一段说明文字——“披着面纱的王妃”。

example.ex: The photograph is captioned 'People Power'...
example.tran: 配图文字为“人民的力量”。

collins.def: If you require something or if something is required, you need it or it is necessary.

example.ex: If you require further information, you should consult the registrar...
example.tran: 如果需要进一步了解信息，请咨询教务主任。

example.ex: This isn't the kind of crisis that requires us to drop everything else...
example.tran: 这样的危机并不需要我们抛弃其他的一切。

collins.def: If a law or rule requires you to do something, you have to do it.

example.ex: The rules also require employers to provide safety training...
example.tran: 这些规定还要求雇主提供安全培训。

example.ex: At least 35 manufacturers have flouted a law requiring prompt reporting of such malfunctions...
example.tran: 至少有35名制造商触犯了要求此类故障出现后立即上报的法律。

collins.def: If you say that something is required reading for a particular group of people, you mean that you think it is essential for them to read it because it will give them information which they should have.

example.ex: ...an important research study that should be required reading for every member of the cabinet.
example.tran: 每一位内阁成员都应阅读的一份重要研究论文

collins.def: If you imagine something, you think about it and your mind forms a picture or idea of it.

example.ex: He could not imagine a more peaceful scene...
example.tran: 他想象不出比这更祥和的景象。

example.ex: She couldn't imagine living in a place like that...
example.tran: 她无法想象住在那样一个地方。

collins.def: If you imagine that something is the case, you think that it is the case.

example.ex: I imagine you're referring to Jean-Paul Sartre...
example.tran: 我猜你说的是让－保罗·萨特。

example.ex: We tend to imagine that the Victorians were very prim and proper...
example.tran: 我们往往认为维多利亚时代的人们都一本正经,谨言慎行。

collins.def: If you imagine something, you think that you have seen, heard, or experienced that thing, although actually you have not.

example.ex: I realised that I must have imagined the whole thing.
example.tran: 我意识到大概整件事都是我臆想出来的。

collins.def: A princess is a female member of a royal family, usually the daughter of a king or queen or the wife of a prince.

example.ex: Princess Anne topped the guest list.
example.tran: 安妮公主排在宾客名单之首。

example.ex: ...Caroline Lindon, Princess of Monaco.
example.tran: 摩纳哥公主卡罗琳·林登

means: 频繁的，时常发生的，常见的

collins.def: If something is frequent, it happens often.

example.ex: Bordeaux is on the main Paris-Madrid line so there are frequent trains...
example.tran: 波尔多位于巴黎到马德里的铁路主干线上，来往列车频繁。

example.ex: He is a frequent visitor to the house.
example.tran: 他是这家的常客。

collins.def: If someone frequents a particular place, they regularly go there.

example.ex: I hear he frequents the Cajun restaurant in Hampstead.
example.tran: 我听说他经常光顾汉普斯特德的卡津餐厅。

collins.def: A video is a film or television programme recorded on tape for people to watch on a television set.

example.ex: We were watching videos with her.
example.tran: 我们当时在和她一起看录像。

example.ex: ...the makers of films and videos.
example.tran: 电影和录像的制作者

collins.def: Video is the system of recording films and events on tape so that people can watch them on a television set.

example.ex: She has watched the race on video.
example.tran: 她看了比赛的录像。

example.ex: ...manufacturers of audio and video equipment.
example.tran: 录音和录像设备的制造商

collins.def: A video is a machine that you can use to record television programmes and play videotapes on a television set.

example.ex: He'd set the video for 8.00.
example.tran: 他把录像机的时间设在8点钟。

collins.def: If you video a television programme or event, you record it on tape using a video recorder or video camera, so that you can watch it later.

example.ex: She had been videoing the highlights of the tournament...
example.tran: 她一直在制作锦标赛集锦的录像。

example.ex: The club specialises in videoing its student golfers to correct their faults.
example.tran: 俱乐部专门为高尔夫学员制作录像，以纠正他们的错误。

collins.def: Video is a system by which you can see television images or films on your computer, rather than on a television set.
If you choose someone or something from several people or things that are available, you decide which person or thing you want to have.

example.ex: They will be able to choose their own leaders in democratic elections...
example.tran: 他们将能够通过民主选举选择自己的领导人。

example.ex: This week he has chosen Peter Mandelson to replace Mo Mowlam...
example.tran: 本周他选择了彼得·曼德尔森来代替莫·摩兰姆。

collins.def: If you choose to do something, you do it because you want to or because you feel that it is right.

example.ex: They knew that discrimination was going on, but chose to ignore it...
example.tran: 他们当时知道歧视现象仍然存在，但是宁愿装聋作哑。

example.ex: You can just take out the interest each year, if you choose.
example.tran: 你要是愿意，每年可以仅支取利息。

collins.def: If there is little to choose between people or things or nothing to choose between them, it is difficult to decide which is better or more suitable.

example.ex: There is very little to choose between the world's top tennis players.
example.tran: 世界顶级网球运动员之间往往难分伯仲。

collins.tran: 享受优厚待遇的少数人；精英
collins.def: The chosen few are a small group who are treated better than other people. You sometimes use this expression when you think this is unfair.

example.ex: Learning should no longer be an elitist pastime for the chosen few.
example.tran: 学习不应再是少数人的高级消遣。

collins.def: If you admit that something bad, unpleasant, or embarrassing is true, you agree, often unwillingly, that it is true.

example.ex: I am willing to admit that I do make mistakes...
example.tran: 我愿意承认我确实会犯错。

example.ex: Up to two thirds of 14 to 16 year olds admit to buying drink illegally...
example.tran: 14到16岁的青少年中多达2/3的人承认非法买过酒。

collins.def: If someone is admitted to hospital, they are taken into hospital for treatment and kept there until they are well enough to go home.

example.ex: She was admitted to hospital with a soaring temperature...
example.tran: 她因发高烧被送进医院。

example.ex: He was admitted yesterday for treatment of blood clots in his lungs.
example.tran: 他昨天入院治疗肺部的血块。

collins.def: If someone is admitted to an organization or group, they are allowed to join it.

example.ex: He was admitted to the Academie Culinaire de France...
example.tran: 他获准加入法兰西厨艺学会。

example.ex: The Parachute Regiment could be forced to admit women.
example.tran: 伞兵团可能会被迫招收女性。

collins.def: To admit someone to a place means to allow them to enter it.

example.ex: Embassy security personnel refused to admit him or his wife...
example.tran: 使馆保安人员不允许他和夫人进入。

example.ex: Journalists are rarely admitted to the region.
example.tran: 新闻记者很少获准进入该地区。

collins.def: Voters are people who have the legal right to vote in elections, or people who are voting in a particular election.

example.ex: The turnout was at least 62 percent of registered voters...
example.tran: 至少有62％的登记选民参加了投票。

example.ex: Austrian voters went to the polls this weekend to elect a successor to the President.
example.tran: 奥地利选民这周末去投票中心选举下届总统。

collins.def: Gone is the past participle of go .

collins.tran: 离开的；过去的；不复存在的
collins.def: When someone is gone, they have left the place where you are and are no longer there. When something is gone, it  is no longer present or no longer exists.

example.ex: While he was gone she had tea with the Colonel...
example.tran: 他不在时她跟上校一起喝了茶。

example.ex: He's already been gone four hours!...
example.tran: 他已经离开4个小时了！

collins.def: If you say it is gone a particular time, you mean it is later than that time.

example.ex: It was just gone 7 o'clock this evening when I finished.
example.tran: 今晚我做完的时候刚过7点。

collins.def: Spring is the season between winter and summer when the weather becomes warmer and plants start to grow again.

example.ex: The Labor government of Western Australia has an election due next spring...
example.tran: 西澳大利亚工党政府明年春天要举行选举。

example.ex: We met again in the spring of 1977.
example.tran: 我们于 1977 年春季再次见面。

collins.def: A spring is a spiral of wire which returns to its original shape after it is pressed or pulled.

example.ex: Unfortunately, as a standard mattress wears, the springs soften and so do not support your spine...
example.tran: 遗憾的是，当一张标准床垫用旧后，弹簧就会变软而无法支撑你的脊椎。

example.ex: Both springs in the fuel pump were broken.
example.tran: 燃料泵里的两个弹簧都断了。

collins.def: A spring is a place where water comes up through the ground. It is also the water that comes from that place.

example.ex: To the north are the hot springs of Banyas de Sant Loan.
example.tran: 北边是班亚斯德桑隆温泉。

collins.def: When a person or animal springs, they jump upwards or forwards suddenly or quickly.

example.ex: He sprang to his feet, grabbing his keys off the coffee table...
example.tran: 他一跃而起，从茶几上一把抓起自己的钥匙。

example.ex: Outside each door a guard sprang to attention as they approached...
example.tran: 当他们走近时，每扇门外都有一名卫兵肃身立正。

collins.tran: (突然朝某个方向)迅速移动，弹开
collins.def: If something springs in a particular direction, it moves suddenly and quickly.

example.ex: Sadly when the lid of the boot sprang open, it was empty.
example.tran: 不幸的是，当后备箱的盖子弹开时，里面却是空的。

collins.tran: 突然活跃起来;突然出现
collins.def: If things or people spring into action or spring to life, they suddenly start being active or suddenly come into existence.

example.ex: When she contacted me at the beginning of August to enlist support, Sharon and I sprang into action.
example.tran: 她 8 月初和我联系请求帮助时，我和沙伦便立即行动起来了。

example.ex: ...new industries which had sprung into life during the 1920s.
example.tran: 在 20 世纪 20 年代突然出现的新型工业

collins.def: If one thing springs from another thing, it is the result of it.

example.ex: Ethiopia's art springs from her early Christian as well as her Muslim heritage...
example.tran: 埃塞俄比亚的艺术起源于其早期的基督教和伊斯兰教文化遗产。

example.ex: His anger sprang from his suffering at the loss of the most important love he had ever known in his life.
example.tran: 失去一生中的至爱让他悲痛不已，愤怒涌上他的心头。

collins.def: If a boat or container springs a leak, water or some other liquid starts coming in or out through a crack.

example.ex: The yacht has sprung a leak in the hull.
example.tran: 帆船的船体上出现了一条裂缝。

collins.tran: 冷不防地说;突然告诉(或宣布)
collins.def: If you spring some news or a surprise on someone, you tell them something that they did not expect to hear, without warning them.

example.ex: The two superpower leaders sprang a surprise at a ceremony in the White House yesterday by signing a trade deal...
example.tran: 两个超级大国的领导人昨天在白宫的一个仪式上突然签署了一项贸易协定，令人倍感意外。

example.ex: Mclaren sprang a new idea on him.
example.tran: 麦克拉伦突然告诉他一个新想法。

collins.def: The tenth item in a series is the one that you count as number ten.
A tenth is one of ten equal parts of something.

example.ex: We received only two tenths of an inch of rain during the entire month of June.
example.tran: 整个 6 月，我们这里的降水量只有0.2英寸。

collins.def: A wind is a current of air that is moving across the earth's surface.

example.ex: There was a strong wind blowing...
example.tran: 狂风肆虐。

example.ex: Then the wind dropped and the surface of the sea was still...
example.tran: 后来风势渐弱，海面重归平静。

collins.tran: (影响事件的)趋势（或因素）（常作新闻用语）
collins.def: Journalists often refer to a trend or factor that influences events as a wind of a particular kind.

example.ex: The winds of change are blowing across the country...
example.tran: 改革之风吹遍全国。

example.ex: The world's entire aerospace industry is feeling the chill winds of recession.
example.tran: 全世界的航空航天工业都感受到了经济衰退的寒意。

collins.def: If you are winded by something such as a blow, the air is suddenly knocked out of your lungs so that you have difficulty breathing for a short time.

example.ex: He was winded and shaken...
example.tran: 他呼吸困难，身体发抖。

example.ex: The cow stamped on his side, winding him.
example.tran: 牛重重地踩在他的肋部，使他喘不上气来。

collins.def: Wind is the air that you sometimes swallow with food or drink, or gas that is produced in your intestines, which causes an uncomfortable feeling.
If you wind a baby, you hit its back gently in order to help it to release air from its stomach.

example.ex: If he cries when you put him down after a feed, try winding him.
example.tran: 如果你喂完后把他放下时他哭，给他拍拍嗝儿。

collins.def: The wind section of an orchestra or band is the group of people who produce musical sounds by blowing into their instruments.
If someone breaks wind, they release gas from their intestines through their anus.
If you get wind of something, you hear about it, especially when someone else did not want you to know about it.

example.ex: I don't want the public, and especially not the press, to get wind of it at this stage.
example.tran: 我不想让公众，尤其是新闻界，在这个阶段听到什么风声。

collins.def: If something is in the wind, it is likely to happen.

example.ex: By the mid-1980s, change was in the wind again.
example.tran: 20世纪80年代中期，变革又呈山雨欲来之势。

collins.def: If something or someone puts the wind up you, they frighten or worry you.

example.ex: 'I heard you had some funny phone calls.' — 'Yeah, that's why yours rather put the wind up me.'
example.tran: “我听说你接到了一些骚扰电话。”——“没错儿，所以你的电话把我吓坏了。”

collins.def: If you sail close to the wind, you take a risk by doing or saying something that may get you into trouble.

example.ex: Max warned her she was sailing dangerously close to the wind and risked prosecution.
example.tran: 马克斯警告她说她这是在玩火，有被起诉的危险。

collins.def: If something takes the wind out of your sails, it suddenly makes you much less confident in what you are doing or saying.

collins.tran: 可能发生何事;事态的发展
collins.def: If you realize or find out which way the wind is blowing or how the wind is blowing, you realize or find out what is likely to happen, for example whether something is likely to succeed.

example.ex: He didn't like to make pronouncements before he was sure which way the wind was blowing.
example.tran: 在没有弄清事态的走向前，他不想发表声明。

means: 反对的，相反的，颠倒的，背面的，里面的

collins.def: If you say there is something wrong, you mean there is something unsatisfactory about the situation, person, or thing you are talking about.

example.ex: Pain is the body's way of telling us that something is wrong...
example.tran: 疼痛是身体在告诉我们有地方出问题了。

example.ex: Nobody seemed to notice anything wrong...
example.tran: 似乎没有人注意到出了问题。

collins.def: If you choose the wrong thing, person, or method, you make a mistake and do not choose the one that you really want.

example.ex: He went to the wrong house...
example.tran: 他去错了房子。

example.ex: The wrong man had been punished...
example.tran: 罚错了人。

collins.tran: (决定、选择、行动等)错误的，不适当的
collins.def: If something such as a decision, choice, or action is the wrong one, it is not the best or most suitable one.

example.ex: I really made the wrong decision there...
example.tran: 在那点上我的决定确实错了。

example.ex: The wrong choice of club might limit your chances of success...
example.tran: 选错俱乐部也许会限制你成功的机会。

collins.tran: 不正确的;与事实不符的
collins.def: If something is wrong, it is incorrect and not in accordance with the facts.

example.ex: How do you know that this explanation is wrong?...
example.tran: 你怎么知道这个解释是错误的呢？

example.ex: 20 per cent of the calculations are wrong.
example.tran: 这些计算有20%是错误的。

collins.tran: （机器设备）出毛病的，出故障的
collins.def: If something is wrong or goes wrong with a machine or piece of equipment, it stops working properly.

example.ex: We think there's something wrong with the computer...
example.tran: 我们认为计算机出了故障。

example.ex: Something must have gone wrong with the satellite link.
example.tran: 卫星连接一定出了毛病。

collins.def: If you are wrong about something, what you say or think about it is not correct.

example.ex: I was wrong about it being a casual meeting...
example.tran: 我误以为这是个非正式会议。

example.ex: Am I wrong in thinking that?...
example.tran: 我这么想错了吗？

collins.tran: (通常用于生气时)你想错了／你听错了
collins.def: You can use wrong in expressions such as you thought wrong and you heard wrong to tell someone that what they thought or were told is incorrect, usually when you are annoyed.

example.ex: 'I thought you and I were going to spend the night together,' he whispered. 'You thought wrong,' Nancy whispered back.
example.tran: “我以为我和你要一起过夜呢。”他小声说。“你想错了。”南茜小声回应道。

collins.def: If you think that someone was wrong to do something, you think that they should not have done it because it was bad or immoral.

example.ex: She was wrong to leave her child alone...
example.tran: 她不该把孩子单独留在那儿。

example.ex: We don't consider we did anything wrong.
example.tran: 我们认为我们没有做错什么。

collins.tran: (活动或行动)不道德的，不可取的
collins.def: Wrong is used to refer to activities or actions that are considered to be morally bad and unacceptable.

example.ex: Is it wrong to try to save the life of someone you love?...
example.tran: 尽力挽救所爱之人的生命难道错了吗？

example.ex: It is wrong that we have to tell ill people to go somewhere else to look for treatment...
example.tran: 我们不得不让病人到别处求医的做法是不可取的。

collins.tran: 不公平行为;不道德行为
collins.def: A wrong is an unfair or immoral action.

example.ex: I intend to right that wrong...
example.tran: 我打算纠正那个错误。

example.ex: The insurance company should not be held liable for the wrongs of one of its agents.
example.tran: 保险公司不应该为其中一名保险代理所犯的错误负责。

collins.def: If someone wrongs you, they treat you in an unfair way.

example.ex: You have wronged my mother...
example.tran: 你冤枉了我妈妈。

example.ex: She felt she'd been wronged...
example.tran: 她觉得受委屈了。

collins.tran: 不能被社会所接受的;不可取的
collins.def: You use wrong to describe something which is not thought to be socially acceptable or desirable.

example.ex: If you went to the wrong school, you won't get the job...
example.tran: 如果你进错了学校，就得不到这份工作。

example.ex: The prospect of easy profits has attracted the wrong kind of businessman.
example.tran: 轻松捞取利润的可能性吸引了一拨不良商人。

collins.def: You say 'Don't get me wrong' when you want to make sure that someone does not get an incorrect idea about what you are doing or saying, or about why you are doing or saying it.

example.ex: Don't get me wrong, it's interesting work. But it's not permanent...
example.tran: 别误会我的意思，这个工作很有意思，可惜不是长期性的。

example.ex: I mean, don't get me wrong. Joanie's my best friend, but she can be kind of a pain sometimes.
example.tran: 别误会，我的意思是乔安妮是我最好的朋友，但她有时候可能有点儿招人烦。

collins.def: If a situation goes wrong, it stops progressing in the way that you expected or intended, and becomes much worse.

example.ex: It all went horribly wrong...
example.tran: 情况完全变得一团糟。

example.ex: Nearly everything that could go wrong has gone wrong.
example.tran: 差不多可能出乱子的地方都出了乱子。

collins.def: If someone who is involved in an argument or dispute has behaved in a way which is morally or legally wrong, you can say that they are in the wrong .

example.ex: He didn't press charges because he was in the wrong...
example.tran: 他没有起诉，因为过错在他。

example.ex: She was the one in the wrong.
example.tran: 她是有过错的一方。

collins.def: If someone says 'Two wrongs don't make a right', they mean that you should not do harm to a person who has done harm to you, even if you think that person deserves it.

collins.tran: 肯定的;有把握的;毫无疑问的
collins.def: If you are certain about something, you firmly believe it is true and have no doubt about it. If you are not certain about something, you do not have definite knowledge about it.

example.ex: She's absolutely certain she's going to make it in the world...
example.tran: 她坚信自己会出人头地。

example.ex: We are not certain whether the appendix had already burst or not...
example.tran: 我们不敢肯定阑尾是否已经破裂。

collins.def: If you say that something is certain to happen, you mean that it will definitely happen.

example.ex: However, the scheme is certain to meet opposition from fishermen's leaders...
example.tran: 然而，这项计划一定会遭到渔民领袖的反对。

example.ex: It's not certain they'll accept the Front's candidate if he wins...
example.tran: 即便来自阵线的候选人获胜，他们能否接受他还说不准。

collins.def: If you say that something is certain, you firmly believe that it is true, or have definite knowledge about it.

example.ex: One thing is certain, both have the utmost respect for each other...
example.tran: 有一点可以肯定，那就是双方都非常尊重对方。

example.ex: It is certain that Rodney arrived the previous day.
example.tran: 罗德尼肯定是头天到的。

collins.def: If you have certain knowledge, you know that a particular thing is true.

example.ex: He had been there four times to my certain knowledge.
example.tran: 我确定他去过那儿4次。

collins.def: If you know something for certain, you have no doubt at all about it.

example.ex: She couldn't know what time he'd go, or even for certain that he'd go at all...
example.tran: 她不知道他何时走，就连他到底走不走都说不准。

example.ex: Hill had to find out for certain.
example.tran: 希尔得弄个清楚。

collins.def: If you make certain that something is the way you want or expect it to be, you take action to ensure that it is.

example.ex: Firstly, they must make certain that their pension needs are adequately catered for...
example.tran: 首先，他们得确保他们能获得足够的养老金。

example.ex: To make extra certain, a police helicopter kept watch from the skies.
example.tran: 为确保万无一失，一架警用直升机一直在空中警戒。

collins.tran: 同辈表亲(或堂亲);堂兄弟(或姐妹);表兄弟(或姐妹)
collins.def: Your cousin is the child of your uncle or aunt.

example.ex: My cousin Mark helped me...
example.tran: 表兄马克帮了我。

example.ex: We are cousins.
example.tran: 我们是表亲。

collins.tran: 对等物;对等的人;相关的人(或事物)
collins.def: If you refer to two things or groups of people as cousins, you mean that they are equivalents or that there is a connection between them.

example.ex: Whereas West Germans drink wine, their Eastern cousins prefer Schnapps...
example.tran: 西德人喝葡萄酒，而他们东德的兄弟姐妹则喜欢喝杜松子酒。

example.ex: The average European kitchen is smaller than its American cousin.
example.tran: 欧式的厨房一般比美式厨房小。

collins.tran: 感到疑惑;纳闷儿;想弄明白
collins.def: If you wonder about something, you think about it, either because it interests you and you want to know more about it, or because you are worried or suspicious about it.

example.ex: I wondered what that noise was...
example.tran: 我纳闷儿那是什么声音。

example.ex: 'He claims to be her father,' said Max. 'We've been wondering about him.'...
example.tran: “他自称是她父亲，”马克斯说，“我们一直都在怀疑他。”

collins.def: If you wonder at something, you are very surprised about it or think about it in a very surprised way.

example.ex: He liked to sit and wonder at all that had happened...
example.tran: 他喜欢坐着对发生的一切惊叹不已。

example.ex: Walk down Castle Street, admire our little jewel of a cathedral, then wonder at the castle...
example.tran: 沿着城堡街走下去，欣赏我们视若珍宝的教堂，继而叹服于城堡的壮观。

collins.def: If you say that it is a wonder that something happened, you mean that it is very surprising and unexpected.

example.ex: It's a wonder that it took almost ten years...
example.tran: 这差不多用了10年的时间，真是桩奇事。

example.ex: The wonder is that Olivier was not seriously hurt.
example.tran: 奥利维尔伤得不重，真是奇迹。

collins.def: Wonder is a feeling of great surprise and pleasure that you have, for example when you see something that is very beautiful, or when something happens that you thought was impossible.

example.ex: 'That's right!' Bobby exclaimed in wonder. 'How did you remember that?'...
example.tran: “对呀！”博比惊奇地叫道。“你是怎么想起那件事的？”

example.ex: I was expressing some amazement and wonder at her good fortune...
example.tran: 我对她的好运既惊奇又感叹。

collins.def: A wonder is something that causes people to feel great surprise or admiration.

example.ex: ...a lecture on the wonders of space and space exploration.
example.tran: 关于宇宙奇观和太空探险的讲座

example.ex: ...the wonder of seeing his name in print...
example.tran: 看见他的名字出现在出版物上的诧异

collins.tran: 神奇的;奇妙的;有奇效的
collins.def: If you refer, for example, to a young man as a wonder boy, or to a new product as a wonder drug, you mean that they are believed by many people to be very good or very effective.

example.ex: Mickelson was hailed as the wonder boy of American golf...
example.tran: 米克尔森被誉为美国高尔夫球界的神奇小子。

example.ex: Dr Williams describes it as a potential wonder drug.
example.tran: 威廉斯医生称其可能会成为特效药。

collins.tran: 昙花一现的人(或事物);惊艳一时的人(或事物)
collins.def: If you say that someone or something is a nine-day wonder or a one-day wonder, you disapprove of the fact that they are attracting so much interest and attention, because you think that their popularity will only last for a very short time.

example.ex: Harry dismissed his old friend's speech as 'a nine-day wonder'...
example.tran: 哈里对老朋友的讲话不屑一顾，称之“火不了多久”。

example.ex: Some supernova researchers wondered if it might be just a nine-day wonder.
example.tran: 有些超新星研究者怀疑，这可能只是昙花一现。

collins.tran: (用于礼貌地请人做事、征求意见或打听消息时)不知…，请问…
collins.def: You can say 'I wonder' if you want to be very polite when you are asking someone to do something, or when you are asking them for their opinion or for information.

example.ex: I was just wondering if you could help me...
example.tran: 不知您是否能帮我个忙。

example.ex: I just wonder what you make of all that...
example.tran: 我只是纳闷儿你是怎么看待这一切的。

collins.def: If you say 'no wonder', 'little wonder', or 'small wonder', you mean that something is not surprising.

example.ex: No wonder my brother wasn't feeling well...
example.tran: 难怪我兄弟感觉不舒服了。

example.ex: Under such circumstances, it is little wonder that they experience difficulties...
example.tran: 在这种情形下，他们遇到困难就不足为怪了。

collins.tran: （表示找出某事的原因）难怪，怪不得
collins.def: You can say 'No wonder' when you find out the reason for something that has been puzzling you for some time.

example.ex: Brad was Jane's brother! No wonder he reminded me so much of her!
example.tran: 布拉德是简的兄弟！怪不得他老是让我想起她呢！

collins.def: If you say that a person or thing works wonders or does wonders, you mean that they have a very good effect on something.

example.ex: A few moments of relaxation can work wonders...
example.tran: 放松一会儿就可以收到奇效。

example.ex: Rushton has done wonders for the industry.
example.tran: 拉什顿创造了行业奇迹。

collins.def: If people discuss something, they talk about it, often in order to reach a decision.

example.ex: I will be discussing the situation with colleagues tomorrow...
example.tran: 明天我会和同事们讨论一下情况。

example.ex: The cabinet met today to discuss how to respond to the ultimatum.
example.tran: 内阁今天开会商量如何应对这道最后通牒。

collins.def: If you discuss something, you write or talk about it in detail.

example.ex: I will discuss the role of diet in cancer prevention in Chapter 7...
example.tran: 我会在第7章详细论述日常饮食在抗癌中的作用。

example.ex: Coming up after the news, Dan Schorr discusses the state of the presidential campaign.
example.tran: 新闻之后，丹·肖尔将带来对总统竞选活动的详细评述。

collins.def: If a particular factor determines the nature of a thing or event, it causes it to be of a particular kind.

example.ex: The size of the chicken pieces will determine the cooking time...
example.tran: 鸡块的大小将决定烹饪时间的长短。

example.ex: Social status is largely determined by the occupation of the main breadwinner...
example.tran: 社会地位很大程度上是由家里经济支柱的职业决定的。

collins.def: To determine a fact means to discover it as a result of investigation.

example.ex: The investigation will determine what really happened...
example.tran: 调查会查明到底发生了什么事情。

example.ex: Testing needs to be done to determine the long-term effects on humans...
example.tran: 需要进行检测以确定其对人的长期影响。

collins.def: If you determine something, you decide it or settle it.

example.ex: The Baltic people have a right to determine their own future...
example.tran: 波罗的海各国人民有权决定自己的未来。

example.ex: The final wording had not yet been determined...
example.tran: 最终措辞仍未敲定。

collins.def: If you determine to do something, you make a firm decision to do it.

example.ex: He determined to rescue his two countrymen...
example.tran: 他决意营救自己的两名同胞。

example.ex: I determined that I would ask him outright.
example.tran: 我下定决心要直截了当地问他。

collins.def: A limit is the greatest amount, extent, or degree of something that is possible.

example.ex: Her love for him was being tested to its limits...
example.tran: 她对他的爱经受着极其严峻的考验。

example.ex: There is no limit to how much fresh fruit you can eat in a day...
example.tran: 每天食用多少新鲜水果都可以。

collins.def: A limit of a particular kind is the largest or smallest amount of something such as time or money that is allowed because of a rule, law, or decision.

example.ex: The three month time limit will be up in mid-June...
example.tran: 3个月的限期截至6月中旬。

example.ex: The economic affairs minister announced limits on petrol sales.
example.tran: 经济部长宣布了对石油销售的限制。

collins.def: The limit of an area is its boundary or edge.

example.ex: ...the city limits of Baghdad.
example.tran: 巴格达市区

collins.def: The limits of a situation are the facts involved in it which make only some actions or results possible.

example.ex: She has to work within the limits of a fairly tight budget...
example.tran: 她不得不在相当紧张的预算范围内精打细算。

example.ex: He outlined the limits of British power.
example.tran: 他勾画了英国的势力范围。

collins.def: If you limit something, you prevent it from becoming greater than a particular amount or degree.

example.ex: He limited payments on the country's foreign debt...
example.tran: 他对该国外债的偿还作出了限制。

example.ex: The view was that the economy would grow by 2.25 per cent. This would limit unemployment to around 2.5 million.
example.tran: 这一观点认为经济将会增长2.25%，这将把失业人数限定在250万左右。

collins.def: If you limit yourself to something, or if someone or something limits you, the number of things that you have or do is reduced.

example.ex: It is now accepted that men should limit themselves to 20 units of alcohol a week...
example.tran: 现在人们已经接受，男性一周饮酒量不应超过20个单位。

example.ex: Voters cut councillors' pay and limited them to one staff member each.
example.tran: 选民削减了市政会委员的薪酬，并且限定他们每人只配一个工作人员。

collins.def: If something is  limited to a particular place or group of people, it exists only in that place, or is had or done only by that group.

example.ex: The protests were not limited to New York...
example.tran: 抗议活动不只限于纽约。

example.ex: Entry to this prize draw is limited to UK residents.
example.tran: 这次抽奖只限英国公民参加。

collins.def: If an area or a place is off limits, you are not allowed to go there.

example.ex: A one-mile area around the wreck is still off limits...
example.tran: 沉船方圆一英里内仍然禁止进入。

example.ex: These establishments are off limits to ordinary citizens.
example.tran: 这些建筑禁止普通公民入内。

collins.def: If you say that something is off limits, you mean that you are not allowed to do it.

example.ex: Smoking was off limits everywhere.
example.tran: 到处都禁止吸烟。

collins.tran: （驾驶时）血液中酒精浓度超标的
collins.def: If someone is over the limit, they have drunk more alcohol than they are legally allowed to when driving a vehicle.

example.ex: If police breathalyse me and find I am over the limit I face a long ban...
example.tran: 如果警察对我作呼气测醉试验，发现我饮酒过量，我将会被禁驾很长时间。

example.ex: He was found to be three times over the limit.
example.tran: 他血液中的酒精浓度是允许极限的3倍。

collins.tran: 没有任何限制；一切都是可能的（或能达到的）
collins.def: If you say the sky is the limit, you mean that there is nothing to prevent someone or something from being very successful.

example.ex: They have found that, in terms of both salary and career success, the sky is the limit.
example.tran: 他们发现，就收入和事业成功来讲，多高都有可能的。

collins.tran: 在一定范围内；有限度地
collins.def: If you add within limits to a statement, you mean that it is true or applies only when talking about reasonable or normal situations.

example.ex: In the circumstances we'll tell you what we can, within limits, of course, and in confidence.
example.tran: 在这种情况下，我们会把能告诉你的都告诉你，当然这是有限度的，而且需要保密。

collins.def: The quality of something is how good or bad it is.

example.ex: Everyone can greatly improve the quality of life...
example.tran: 每个人都可以大大改善生活质量。

example.ex: Other services vary dramatically in quality.
example.tran: 其他服务在质量上差别很大。

collins.def: Something of quality is of a high standard.

example.ex: ...a college of quality...
example.tran: 优秀的学院

example.ex: In our work, quality is paramount.
example.tran: 我们的工作追求品质至上。

collins.def: Someone's qualities are the good characteristics that they have which are part of their nature.

example.ex: Sometimes you wonder where your kids get their good qualities...
example.tran: 有时你会想，孩子们身上的优秀品质是从何而来呢？

example.ex: He wanted to introduce mature people with leadership qualities...
example.tran: 他想引进具有领导素质的成熟人才。

collins.def: You can describe a particular characteristic of a person or thing as a quality .

example.ex: ...a childlike quality.
example.tran: 孩子般的天真特质

example.ex: ...the pretentious quality of the poetry...
example.tran: 这首诗浮夸造作的特点

collins.def: The quality papers or the quality press are the more serious newspapers which give detailed accounts of world events, as well as reports on business, culture, and society.

example.ex: Even the quality papers agreed that it was a triumph.
example.tran: 即使是内容严肃的报纸也认为这是一次胜利。

collins.def: A producer is a person whose job is to produce plays, films, programmes, or CDs.

example.ex: Vanya Kewley is a freelance film producer.
example.tran: 万尼亚·丘利是自由电影制片人。

example.ex: ...Mike Morley, the producer of Central Television's Dennis Nilsen documentary.
example.tran: 迈克·摩利，中央电视台播出的丹尼斯·尼尔森纪录片的制片人

collins.def: A producer of a food or material is a company or country that grows or manufactures a large amount of it.

example.ex: The estate is generally a producer of high quality wines.
example.tran: 这片土地盛产优质葡萄酒。

example.ex: ...Saudi Arabia, the world's leading oil producer.
example.tran: 沙特阿拉伯，世界主要的石油生产国

collins.def: A quarter is one of four equal parts of something.

example.ex: A quarter of the residents are over 55 years old...
example.tran: 1/4的居民年龄在55岁以上。

example.ex: I've got to go in a quarter of an hour...
example.tran: 一刻钟以后我就得走了。

collins.def: A quarter is a fixed period of three months. Companies often divide their financial year into four quarters.

example.ex: The group said results for the third quarter are due on October 29.
example.tran: 该集团表示第三季度的结果将于10月29日公布。

collins.def: When you are telling the time, you use quarter to talk about the fifteen minutes before or after an hour. For example, 8.15 is quarter past eight, and 8.45 is quarter to nine. In American English, you can also say that 8.15 is a quarter after eight and 8.45 is a quarter of nine.

example.ex: It was a quarter to six...
example.tran: 当时是6点差一刻。

example.ex: See you about quarter to nine...
example.tran: 8点45分左右再见。

collins.def: If you quarter something such as a fruit or a vegetable, you cut it into four roughly equal parts.

example.ex: Chop the mushrooms and quarter the tomatoes.
example.tran: 把蘑菇切成丁，再把西红柿切成四瓣。

collins.tran: 把…降至原先的四分之一;把…减少四分之三
collins.def: If the number or size of something is quartered, it is reduced to about a quarter of its previous number or size.

example.ex: The doses I suggested for adults could be halved or quartered.
example.tran: 我之前建议成人服用的剂量可以降到1/2或者1/4。

collins.def: A quarter is an American or Canadian coin that is worth 25 cents.

example.ex: I dropped a quarter into the slot of the pay phone.
example.tran: 我向付费电话的投币孔里投了一枚25分硬币。

collins.tran: (城镇中某一类人群生活或工作的)区，地区
collins.def: A particular quarter of a town is a part of the town where a particular group of people traditionally live or work.

example.ex: Look for hotels in the French Quarter.
example.tran: 在法国人居住区寻找旅馆。

collins.tran: (做出反应或行动的)某位人士，某个团体
collins.def: To refer to a person or group you may not want to name, you can talk about the reactions or actions from a particular quarter .

example.ex: Help came from an unexpected quarter...
example.tran: 援助来自于一个意想不到的团体。

example.ex: There are fears in some quarters that the republic would have little chance of surviving on its own.
example.tran: 某些人士担心共和国独立支撑下去的希望很渺茫。

collins.tran: (军人、水手、仆人的)住处，宿舍，营房
collins.def: The rooms provided for soldiers, sailors, or servants to live in are called their quarters .

example.ex: Mckinnon went down from deck to the officers' quarters.
example.tran: 麦金农走下甲板，来到军官们的住处。

collins.def: If people are quartered somewhere, they are provided with accommodation for a short time, usually while they are working away from home.

example.ex: Our soldiers are quartered in Peredelkino.
example.tran: 我们的士兵在佩列杰利基诺扎营。

collins.tran: 近距离地;近在咫尺；接近地
collins.def: If you do something at close quarters, you do it very near to a particular person or thing.

example.ex: You can watch aircraft take off or land at close quarters...
example.tran: 你可以近距离观察飞机的起降。

collins.def: If you say that someone was given no quarter, you mean that they were not treated kindly by someone who had power or control over them.

example.ex: This is not war as you learned it. It is brutal work, with no quarter given.
example.tran: 这并不是你所了解的战争。它残酷无情，对人没有半点怜悯。

collins.def: If you say that something, usually something large, extends for a particular distance or extends from one place to another, you are indicating its size or position.

example.ex: The caves extend for some 18 kilometres...
example.tran: 那些洞穴深约18公里。

example.ex: The main stem will extend to around 12ft, if left to develop naturally...
example.tran: 如果任其自然生长，主干可以长到约12英尺。

collins.def: If an object extends from a surface or place, it sticks out from it.

example.ex: A shelf of land extended from the escarpment.
example.tran: 悬崖上凸出一块空地。

collins.def: If an event or activity extends over a period of time, it continues for that time.

example.ex: ...a playing career in first-class cricket that extended from 1894 to 1920...
example.tran: 从1894年延续至1920年的板球甲级比赛职业生涯

example.ex: The courses are based on a weekly two-hour class, extending over a period of 25 weeks.
example.tran: 这些课程每周上一节课，每节两个小时，持续25周。

collins.def: If something extends to a group of people, things, or activities, it includes or affects them.

example.ex: The service also extends to wrapping and delivering gifts...
example.tran: 服务项目还包括包装和递送礼物。

example.ex: The talks will extend to the church, human rights groups and other social organizations...
example.tran: 会谈将涉及教会、人权团体和其他社会组织。

collins.def: If you extend something, you make it longer or bigger.

example.ex: This year they have introduced three new products to extend their range...
example.tran: 今年他们发布了3种新产品，以扩大产品范围。

example.ex: The building was extended in 1500.
example.tran: 那座建筑于1500年扩建。

collins.def: If a piece of equipment or furniture extends, its length can be increased.

example.ex: ... a table which extends to accommodate extra guests...
example.tran: 展开后可坐更多客人的桌子

example.ex: The table extends to 220cm.
example.tran: 桌子伸展后长220厘米。

collins.def: If you extend something, you make it last longer than before or end at a later date.

example.ex: They have extended the deadline by twenty-four hours.
example.tran: 他们已经将最后期限延长了24小时。

example.ex: ...an extended contract.
example.tran: 延期的合同

collins.def: If you extend something to other people or things, you make it include or affect more people or things.

example.ex: It might be possible to extend the technique to other crop plants.
example.tran: 也许可以将这种技术应用于其他农作物。

collins.def: If someone extends their hand, they stretch out their arm and hand to shake hands with someone.

example.ex: The man extended his hand: 'I'm Chuck'.
example.tran: 那名男子伸出手说道：“我是查克。”

collins.def: To advance means to move forward, often in order to attack someone.

example.ex: Reports from Chad suggest that rebel forces are advancing on the capital...
example.tran: 来自乍得的报告显示叛军正向首都推进。

example.ex: The water is advancing at a rate of 5cm a day...
example.tran: 水位正以每天5厘米的速度上升。

collins.def: To advance means to make progress, especially in your knowledge of something.

example.ex: Medical technology has advanced considerably...
example.tran: 医学技术突飞猛进。

example.ex: Japan has advanced from a rural, feudal society to an urban, industrial power.
example.tran: 日本已从封建农业社会发展成一个城市化工业强国。

collins.def: If you advance someone a sum of money, you lend it to them, or pay it to them earlier than arranged.

example.ex: I advanced him some money, which he would repay on our way home...
example.tran: 我先借给他一些钱，在我们回家的路上他会还给我的。

example.ex: The bank advanced $1.2 billion to help the country with debt repayments.
example.tran: 银行预支12亿美元帮助该国偿还债务。

collins.def: An advance is money which is lent or paid to someone before they would normally receive it.

example.ex: She was paid a £100,000 advance for her next two novels.
example.tran: 她接下来的两部小说得到了10万英镑的预付稿费。

collins.tran: 提前（未来事件的日期）；使（未来事件）提前发生
collins.def: To advance an event, or the time or date of an event, means to bring it forward to an earlier time or date.

example.ex: Too much protein in the diet may advance the ageing process...
example.tran: 饮食中摄入过量蛋白质可能会加速衰老。

example.ex: The country's election commission has advanced the date of parliamentary elections by three days.
example.tran: 该国的选举委员会将议会选举日期提前了3天。

collins.tran: 促进，推动（事业、利益或主张）；使加速
collins.def: If you advance a cause, interest, or claim, you support it and help to make it successful.

example.ex: When not producing art of his own, Oliver was busy advancing the work of others.
example.tran: 奥利弗在不搞自己的艺术创作时，就会忙着帮助别人完成作品。

collins.def: When a theory or argument is advanced, it is put forward for discussion.

example.ex: Many theories have been advanced as to why some women suffer from depression...
example.tran: 就一些女性患抑郁症的原因，各种说法纷至沓来。

example.ex: An important set of ideas have been advanced by the biologist Rupert Sheldrake.
example.tran: 生物学家鲁珀特·谢尔德雷克已提出了一整套重要的观点。

collins.tran: （常指军事行动中的）前进，行进，推进
collins.def: An advance is a forward movement of people or vehicles, usually as part of a military operation.

example.ex: ...an advance on enemy positions...
example.tran: 向敌方阵地推进

example.ex: The defences are intended to obstruct any advance by tanks and other vehicles.
example.tran: 这些防御工事用于阻止坦克等车辆前进。

collins.def: If you make advances to someone, you try to start a sexual relationship with them.

example.ex: Mark had for some time been making advances towards her...
example.tran: 马克追她已经有一段时间了。

example.ex: She rejected his advances during the trip to Cannes.
example.tran: 在去往戛纳的途中，她拒绝了他的挑逗。

collins.def: An advance in a particular subject or activity is progress in understanding it or in doing it well.

example.ex: Air safety has not improved since the dramatic advances of the 1970s...
example.tran: 航空安全自从20世纪70年代得到显著提高之后，至今再没有任何改善。

example.ex: Their progress at work was mirrored by their children's educational advance.
example.tran: 子女在学业上有所进步，他们在工作上也就会有所起色。

collins.def: If something is an advance on what was previously available or done, it is better in some way.

example.ex: This could be an advance on the present situation.
example.tran: 这样可能会改善当前状况。

collins.def: Advance booking, notice, or warning is done or given before an event happens.

example.ex: They don't normally give any advance notice about which building they're going to inspect...
example.tran: 他们一般不会预先通知检查哪座大楼。

example.ex: The event received little advance publicity.
example.tran: 关于该事件事先几乎没有报道。

collins.def: An advance party or group is a small group of people who go on ahead of the main group.

example.ex: The 20-strong advance party will be followed by another 600 soldiers as part of UN relief efforts.
example.tran: 作为联合国救援行动的一部分，在这支由20多人组成的先头部队之后还将增派600名士兵。

collins.def: If one thing happens or is done in advance of another, it happens or is done before the other thing.

example.ex: I had asked everyone to submit questions in advance of the meeting.
example.tran: 我已请每个人在会议之前提交问题。

collins.def: If you do something in advance, you do it before a particular date or event.

example.ex: The subject of the talk is announced a week in advance.
example.tran: 会谈的主题已提前一周宣布。

collins.def: Everybody means the same as everyone  .

means: [航]钓锚器，撑夹桅杆的加固夹箍

collins.def: A fish is a creature that lives in water and has a tail and fins. There are many different kinds of fish.

example.ex: I was chatting to an islander who had just caught a fish...
example.tran: 我正在跟一个刚刚抓到一条鱼的岛民聊天。

example.ex: The fish were counted and an average weight recorded.
example.tran: 数了数鱼的数量，并把平均重量记录了下来。

collins.def: Fish is the flesh of a fish eaten as food.

example.ex: Does dry white wine go best with fish?
example.tran: 吃鱼时喝干白葡萄酒是最佳选择吗？

collins.def: If you fish, you try to catch fish, either for food or as a form of sport or recreation.

example.ex: Brian remembers learning to fish in the River Cam.
example.tran: 布赖恩记得曾在剑河学过钓鱼。

collins.def: If you fish a particular area of water, you try to catch fish in it.

example.ex: On Saturday we fished the River Arno.
example.tran: 周六我们在阿尔诺河钓鱼。

collins.tran: 旁敲侧击地打听;拐弯抹角地谋取
collins.def: If you say that someone is fishing for information or praise, you disapprove of the fact that they are trying to get it from someone in an indirect way.

example.ex: He didn't want to create the impression that he was fishing for information...
example.tran: 他不想让人觉得自己是在套话。

example.ex: She may be fishing for a compliment and welcome your reassurance...
example.tran: 她也许是在拐弯抹角地想获得称赞，希望得到你的肯定。

collins.tran: 如离水之鱼(指因离开熟悉的环境而感到不适)
collins.def: If you feel like a fish out of water, you do not feel comfortable or relaxed because you are in an unusual or unfamiliar situation.

example.ex: I think he thought of himself as a country gentleman and was like a fish out of water in Birmingham.
example.tran: 我想他认为自己是一名乡绅，在伯明翰就如离水之鱼一般浑身不自在。

collins.tran: 海里的鱼有的是;天涯何处无芳草
collins.def: If you tell someone that there are plenty more fish in the sea, you are comforting them by saying that although their relationship with someone has failed, there are many other people they can have relationships with.
If you fish something out from somewhere, you take or pull it out, often after searching for it for some time.

example.ex: Kelly fished out another beer from his cooler...
example.tran: 凯莉从他的冷藏箱里又拿出一瓶啤酒。

example.ex: She fished out a pair of David's socks for her cold feet.
example.tran: 她找出一双戴维的袜子穿在了冰冷的脚上。

means: 阵营（指观点相同且与持不同观点者对立的集团）
（度假者、旅游者，尤指青少年的）野营地
（男人或其举止）故意带女子气的

collins.tran: (为某一人群提供的)营地(如难民营、战俘营、军营等)
collins.def: A camp is a collection of huts and other buildings that is provided for a particular group of people, such as refugees, prisoners, or soldiers, as a place to live or stay.

example.ex: ...a refugee camp...
example.tran: 难民营

example.ex: 2,500 foreign prisoners-of-war, including Americans, had been held in camps near Tambov.
example.tran: 包括美国兵在内的 2,500名外国战俘一直被囚禁在坦波夫附近的战俘营。

collins.def: A camp is an outdoor area with buildings, tents, or caravans where people stay on holiday.
A camp is a collection of tents or caravans where people are living or staying, usually temporarily while they are travelling.

example.ex: ...gypsy camps...
example.tran: 吉卜赛营地

example.ex: We'll make camp on that hill ahead.
example.tran: 我们到前面那座小山上扎营。

collins.def: If you camp somewhere, you stay or live there for a short time in a tent or caravan, or in the open air.

example.ex: We camped near the beach.
example.tran: 我们靠近海滩宿营。

example.ex: ...the men, who are camping on the pavement in sleeping bags.
example.tran: 用睡袋在人行道上露宿的那些男人

collins.tran: (拥护某人、某政策或某观念的)阵营,集团,派别
collins.def: You can refer to a group of people who all support a particular person, policy, or idea as a particular camp .

example.ex: The press release provoked furious protests from the Gore camp and other top Democrats.
example.tran: 这份媒体发布的声明激起了戈尔阵营以及其他民主党高层人士的愤怒抗议。

example.ex: ...a close colleague, who had sided with the opposite camp in an office dispute.
example.tran: 一个亲密的同事,在一场办公室纠纷中站到对方一边去了

collins.tran: (常指男同性恋者的举止、表演、穿着)夸张而惹人发笑的,娘娘腔的，忸怩作态的
collins.def: If you describe someone's behaviour, performance, or style of dress as camp, you mean that it is exaggerated and amusing, often in a way that is thought to be typical of some male homosexuals.

example.ex: James Barron turns in a delightfully camp performance.
example.tran: 詹姆斯·巴伦献上了一段夸张逗笑的表演。

collins.tran: 故作夸张地表演;装腔作势;忸怩作态
collins.def: If  a performer camps it up, they deliberately perform in an exaggerated and often amusing way.

example.ex: He camped it up, he told bad taste jokes and endless anecdotes with no point at all.
example.tran: 他耍宝逗乐，讲荤段子，没完没了地说一堆毫无头绪的八卦。

collins.tran: 道德原则；行为准则；操守
collins.def: A principle is a general belief that you have about the way you should behave, which influences your behaviour.

example.ex: Buck never allowed himself to be bullied into doing anything that went against his principles...
example.tran: 巴克从来不会因为受到威胁而做违背自己原则的事情。

example.ex: ...moral principles...
example.tran: 道德准则

collins.def: The principles of a particular theory or philosophy are its basic rules or laws.

example.ex: ...a violation of the basic principles of Marxism...
example.tran: 违背马克思主义的基本原则

example.ex: The doctrine was based on three fundamental principles.
example.tran: 这个学说建立在三条基本原理之上。

collins.def: Scientific principles are general scientific laws which explain how something happens or works.

example.ex: These people lack all understanding of  scientific principles.
example.tran: 这些人对科学原理一窍不通。

example.ex: ...the principles of quantum theory.
example.tran: 量子论原理

collins.def: If you agree with something in principle, you agree in general terms to the idea of it, although you do not yet know the details or know if it will be possible.

example.ex: I agree with it in principle but I doubt if it will happen in practice.
example.tran: 我大体上同意这一点，但是怀疑它是否能够付诸实践。

collins.def: If something is possible in principle, there is no known reason why it should not happen, even though it has not happened before.

example.ex: Even assuming this to be in principle possible, it will not be achieved soon.
example.tran: 即使假定这在理论上行得通，它也不可能于短期内实现。

collins.def: If you refuse to do something on principle, you refuse to do it because of a particular belief that you have.

example.ex: He would vote against it on principle...
example.tran: 他会根据原则投反对票。

example.ex: His father, on principle, did not like to hear requests for money.
example.tran: 从原则上来说，他父亲不喜欢别人借钱。

collins.def: When you wear something such as clothes, shoes, or jewellery, you have them on your body or on part of your body.

example.ex: He was wearing a brown uniform...
example.tran: 他当时穿着褐色的制服。

example.ex: I sometimes wear contact lenses...
example.tran: 我有时戴隐形眼镜。

collins.def: If you wear your hair or beard in a particular way, you have it cut or styled in that way.

example.ex: She wore her hair in a long braid...
example.tran: 她梳着一根长辫子。

example.ex: He wore a full moustache.
example.tran: 他留着浓密的八字须。

collins.def: If you wear a particular expression, that expression is on your face and shows the emotions that you are feeling.

example.ex: When we drove through the gates, she wore a look of amazement...
example.tran: 我们驶过大门时，她流露出惊讶的神情。

example.ex: Millson's face wore a satisfied expression.
example.tran: 米尔森一脸的心满意足。

collins.def: You use wear to refer to clothes that are suitable for a certain time or place. For example, evening wear is clothes suitable for the evening.

example.ex: The shop stocks an extensive range of beach wear...
example.tran: 这家商店备有各式各样的沙滩服装。

example.ex: Bring informal casual wear.
example.tran: 带上休闲的衣服。

collins.tran: 耐用性;使用率;使用形式
collins.def: Wear is the amount or type of use that something has over a period of time.

example.ex: You'll get more wear out of a hat if you choose one in a neutral colour...
example.tran: 如果你选个中性颜色的帽子，戴的时间会更多一些。

example.ex: Rugs in the bedrooms got much less wear.
example.tran: 卧室里的小毯子用得少多了。

collins.def: Wear is the damage or change that is caused by something being used a lot or for a long time.

example.ex: ...a large, well-upholstered armchair which showed signs of wear.
example.tran: 有磨损痕迹、配垫考究的大扶手椅

collins.def: If something wears, it becomes thinner or weaker because it is constantly being used over a long period of time.

example.ex: The stone steps, dating back to 1855, are beginning to wear...
example.tran: 那些可以追溯到1855年的石阶开始出现磨损。

example.ex: Your horse needs new shoes if the shoe has worn thin or smooth.
example.tran: 如果马掌磨薄或磨平，就需要换新马掌了。

collins.def: You can use wear to talk about how well something lasts over a period of time. For example, if something wears well, it still seems quite new or useful after a long time or a lot of use.

example.ex: Casual shoes need to wear well...
example.tran: 休闲鞋得耐穿。

example.ex: Ten years on, the original concept was wearing well.
example.tran: 10年过去了，原先的概念仍不过时。

collins.tran: (尤指女性)当家，掌权(英国英语中用wear the trousers)
collins.def: If one person in a couple, especially the woman, wears the pants, or in British English wears the trousers, they are the one who makes all the decisions.

example.ex: She may give the impression that she wears the trousers but it's Tim who makes the final decisions.
example.tran: 她让人觉得是她当家，但实际上是蒂姆说了算。

collins.def: If your patience or temper is wearing thin, you are becoming annoyed and are likely to get angry soon.

example.ex: Her husband was sympathetic at first but his patience soon wore thin.
example.tran: 一开始她丈夫还抱以同情，可不久就失去耐心了。

collins.tran: (因听说的次数太多而)失去趣味，令人厌烦
collins.def: If you say that something is wearing thin, you mean that people do not find it funny or interesting any more and are becoming annoyed with it, because they have seen or heard it so many times.

example.ex: Some of Wilson's eccentricities are beginning to wear thin.
example.tran: 人们逐渐对威尔逊的古怪行为失去了兴趣。

collins.def: If you say that someone is the worse for wear, you mean that they are tired, ill, or in a bad state because they have been very active, been through a difficult experience, or been drinking alcohol.

example.ex: He arrived on January 9, disheveled and much the worse for wear.
example.tran: 他是1月9号到的，蓬头垢面，疲惫不堪。

collins.def: Evidence is anything that you see, experience, read, or are told that causes you to believe that something is true or has really happened.

example.ex: Ganley said he'd seen no evidence of widespread fraud...
example.tran: 甘利说他没有看见诈骗泛滥的证据。

example.ex: There is a lot of evidence that stress is partly responsible for disease...
example.tran: 有很多证据证明压力是造成疾病的原因之一。

collins.def: Evidence is the information which is used in a court of law to try to prove something. Evidence is obtained from documents, objects, or witnesses.

example.ex: The evidence against him was purely circumstantial.
example.tran: 对他不利的这项证据完全是间接证据。

example.ex: ...enough evidence for a successful prosecution.
example.tran: 足以胜诉的证据

collins.def: If you give evidence in a court of law or an official enquiry, you officially say what you know about people or events, or describe an occasion at which you were present.

example.ex: The forensic scientists who carried out the original tests will be called to give evidence...
example.tran: 进行最初化验的法医学家将被传唤到庭作证。

example.ex: Cabin crew have been giving evidence at the M1 aircrash enquiry.
example.tran: 机舱人员一直在为M1空难调查作证。

collins.def: If a particular feeling, ability, or attitude is evidenced by something or someone, it is seen or felt.

example.ex: He's wise in other ways too, as evidenced by his reason for switching from tennis to golf...
example.tran: 他在其他方面同样明智，这一点可以从他不打网球改打高尔夫的理由中得到证明。

example.ex: She was not calculating and evidenced no specific interest in money.
example.tran: 她没什么心计，而且能感觉出她对钱没什么兴趣。

collins.def: If someone or something is in evidence, they are present and can be clearly seen.

example.ex: Few soldiers were in evidence...
example.tran: 没看见几个士兵。

example.ex: Poverty and bad housing conditions are still very much in evidence.
example.tran: 贫困和糟糕的住房条件仍很常见。

means: （架设天线、支撑帐篷等用的）牵索

collins.def: A guy is a man.

example.ex: I was working with a guy from Manchester.
example.tran: 我与一个来自曼彻斯特的小伙子一起工作。

collins.tran: （美国英语）伙计们，兄弟们，姐妹们
collins.def: Americans sometimes address a group of people, whether they are male or female, as guys or you guys.

example.ex: Hi, guys. How are you doing?...
example.tran: 嗨，伙计们，大家还好吧？

example.ex: Mom wants to know if you guys still have that two-person tent.
example.tran: 妈妈想知道你们是否还有那顶双人帐篷。

collins.def: A guy is the same as a guy rope .

collins.tran: 盖伊模拟像（英国庆祝篝火之夜焚烧的身着古装的人像）
collins.def: In Britain, a guy is a model of a man that is made from old clothes filled with straw or paper. Guys are burned on bonfires as part of the celebrations for Guy Fawkes Night.
When you smile, the corners of your mouth curve up and you sometimes show your teeth. People smile when they are pleased or amused, or when they are being friendly.

example.ex: When he saw me, he smiled and waved...
example.tran: 他看见我的时候，微笑着朝我挥挥手。

example.ex: He rubbed the back of his neck and smiled ruefully at me...
example.tran: 他挠了挠脖梗儿，对我苦笑了一下。

collins.def: A smile is the expression that you have on your face when you smile.

example.ex: She gave a wry smile...
example.tran: 她苦笑了一下。

example.ex: 'There are some sandwiches if you're hungry,' she said with a smile...
example.tran: 她笑道：“你要是饿的话，这有一些三明治。”

collins.def: If you smile something, you say it with a smile or express it by a smile.

example.ex: 'Aren't we daft?' she smiled...
example.tran: 她微笑着问：“我们不是很傻吗?”

example.ex: She smiled her thanks and arranged the guitar under her arm.
example.tran: 她微笑着致了谢，把胳膊下面的吉他调整了一下。

collins.def: If you say that something such as fortune smiles on someone, you mean that they are lucky or successful.

example.ex: When fortune smiled on him, he made the most of it...
example.tran: 当好运来临时，他充分把握住了。

example.ex: God is not smiling on our cause.
example.tran: 我们的事业没有得到上帝的垂怜。

collins.tran: 满面笑容(常指先前因某事发愁)
collins.def: If you say that someone is all smiles, you mean that they look very happy, often when they have previously been worried or upset about something.
A crash is an accident in which a moving vehicle hits something and is damaged or destroyed.

example.ex: His elder son was killed in a car crash a few years ago.
example.tran: 他的长子几年前死于车祸。

example.ex: ...a plane crash.
example.tran: 坠机事件

collins.def: If a moving vehicle crashes or if the driver crashes it, it hits something and is damaged or destroyed.

example.ex: The plane crashed mysteriously near the island of Ustica.
example.tran: 那架飞机在乌斯蒂卡岛附近神秘坠毁了。

example.ex: ...when his car crashed into the rear of a van...
example.tran: 他的车撞进一辆货车尾部的时候

collins.def: If something crashes somewhere, it moves and hits something else violently, making a loud noise.

example.ex: The door swung inwards to crash against a chest of drawers behind it...
example.tran: 门朝里摆去，撞到了后面的大衣柜。

example.ex: My words were lost as the walls above us crashed down, filling the cellar with brick dust...
example.tran: 我们头顶的墙塌了下来，地下室里满是砖灰，我惊得说不出话来。

collins.def: A crash is a sudden, loud noise.

example.ex: Two people in the flat recalled hearing a loud crash about 1.30 a.m.
example.tran: 公寓楼里有两个人回想起凌晨1点半听见了一声巨响。

collins.tran: (生意或金融体制)倒闭，破产，失败
collins.def: If a business or financial system crashes, it fails suddenly, often with serious effects.

example.ex: When the market crashed, they assumed the deal would be cancelled.
example.tran: 当市场崩溃时，他们认为交易会被取消。

collins.tran: (计算机或计算机程序)崩溃，瘫痪
collins.def: If a computer or a computer program crashes, it fails suddenly.

example.ex: ...after the computer crashed for the second time in 10 days.
example.tran: 电脑在10天内第二次死机后

collins.def: A movie is a film.

example.ex: In the first movie Tony Curtis ever made he played a grocery clerk.
example.tran: 托尼·柯蒂斯在其首部电影里，扮演了一个食品杂货店店员。

example.ex: ...a horror movie.
example.tran: 恐怖电影

collins.def: You can talk about the movies when you are talking about seeing a movie in a movie theater.

example.ex: He took her to the movies.
example.tran: 他带她去看电影。

collins.def: An object is anything that has a fixed shape or form, that you can touch or see, and that is not alive.

example.ex: He squinted his eyes as though he were studying an object on the horizon.
example.tran: 他眯起眼睛，就好像在端详地平线上的某一物体。

example.ex: ...an object the shape of a coconut...
example.tran: 形似椰子的物体

collins.def: The object of what someone is doing is their aim or purpose.

example.ex: The object of the exercise is to raise money for the charity...
example.tran: 那样做旨在筹集善款。

example.ex: He made it his object in life to find the island...
example.tran: 他把找到那座岛屿当成自己的人生目标。

collins.def: The object of a particular feeling or reaction is the person or thing it is directed towards or that causes it.

example.ex: The object of her hatred was 24-year-old model Ros French...
example.tran: 令她心头生恨的是24岁的模特罗斯·弗伦奇。

example.ex: The object of great interest at the Temple was a large marble tower built in memory of Buddha...
example.tran: 这处庙宇最引人注目的是一座为纪念佛陀而修建的宏伟的大理石塔。

collins.def: In grammar, the object of a verb or a preposition is the word or phrase which completes the structure begun by the verb or preposition.
If you object to something, you express your dislike or disapproval of it.

example.ex: A lot of people will object to the book...
example.tran: 很多人都会对这本书表示反感。

example.ex: Cullen objected that his small staff would be unable to handle the added work...
example.tran: 卡伦提出反对，说他的人手较少，无法完成额外工作。

collins.tran: 钱不成问题/距离不在话下
collins.def: If you say that money is no object or distance is no object, you are emphasizing that you are willing or able to spend as much money as necessary or travel whatever distance is required.

example.ex: Hugh Johnson's shop in London has a range of superb Swedish crystal glasses that I would have if money were no object...
example.tran: 休·约翰逊伦敦店出售各种美轮美奂的瑞典水晶玻璃杯，不考虑钱的话我都想买。

example.ex: Although he was based in Wales, distance was no object.
example.tran: 虽然他主要住在威尔士，但是距离不成问题。

collins.def: Tea is a drink made by adding hot water to tea leaves or tea bags. Many people add milk to the drink and some add sugar.

example.ex: ...a cup of tea...
example.tran: 一杯茶

example.ex: Would you like some tea?...
example.tran: 要喝茶吗？

collins.tran: (用某些植物的叶子或花泡的)茶
collins.def: Drinks such as mint tea or chamomile tea are made by pouring hot water on the dried leaves of the particular plant or flower.
The chopped dried leaves of the plant that tea is made from is referred to as tea .

example.ex: ...a packet of tea...
example.tran: 一包茶叶

example.ex: America imports about 190 million pounds of tea a year...
example.tran: 美国每年进口大约 1.9 亿磅茶叶。

collins.def: Tea is a meal some people eat in the late afternoon. It consists of food such as sandwiches and cakes, with tea to drink.

example.ex: I'm doing the sandwiches for tea...
example.tran: 我在做下午茶吃的三明治。

example.ex: I took her to tea at the Ritz.
example.tran: 我带她去里茨饭店吃下午茶了。

collins.def: Some people refer to the main meal that they eat in the early part of the evening as tea.

example.ex: At five o'clock he comes back for his tea.
example.tran: 他 5 点钟回来吃晚餐。

collins.tran: 不感兴趣的人;不合胃口的事物
collins.def: If you say that someone or something is not your cup of tea, you mean that they are not the kind of person or thing that you like.

example.ex: Politics was not his cup of tea...
example.tran: 他对政治不感兴趣。

example.ex: I know I'm not everyone's cup of tea.
example.tran: 我知道自己不是人见人爱。

collins.tran: 车辆;交通工具;运输工具
collins.def: A vehicle is a machine such as a car, bus, or truck which has an engine and is used to carry people from place to place.

example.ex: The vehicle would not have the capacity to make the journey on one tank of fuel.
example.tran: 这辆车单靠一箱燃料无法跑完整趟旅程。

example.ex: ...a vehicle which was somewhere between a tractor and a truck.
example.tran: 一种介于拖拉机和卡车之间的机动车

collins.def: You can use vehicle to refer to something that you use in order to achieve a particular purpose.

example.ex: Her art became a vehicle for her political beliefs...
example.tran: 艺术成了她表达政治信仰的工具。

example.ex: The vehicle that permitted both communication and acceptability was social revolution.
example.tran: 既能实现交流又能被广为接受的手段就是社会革命。

collins.def: The phone is an electrical system that you use to talk to someone else in another place, by dialling a number on a piece of equipment and speaking into it.

example.ex: You can buy insurance over the phone...
example.tran: 你可以通过电话购买保险。

example.ex: She looked forward to talking to her daughter by phone...
example.tran: 她盼望着能打电话和女儿交谈。

collins.def: The phone is the piece of equipment that you use when you dial someone's phone number and talk to them.

example.ex: Two minutes later the phone rang...
example.tran: 两分钟后电话响了。

example.ex: Doug's 14-year-old son Jamie answered the phone.
example.tran: 道格14岁的儿子杰米接了电话。

collins.def: If you say that someone picks up or puts down the phone, you mean that they lift or replace the receiver.

example.ex: She picked up the phone, and began to dial Maurice Campbell's number...
example.tran: 她拿起电话听筒，开始拨打莫里斯·坎贝尔的号码。

example.ex: Trembling, she put the phone down. It rang again almost immediately.
example.tran: 她颤抖着放下电话听筒，电话几乎立刻又响了起来。

collins.def: When you phone someone, you dial their phone number and speak to them by phone.

example.ex: He'd phoned Laura to see if she was better...
example.tran: 他打电话给劳拉看她是不是好些了。

example.ex: I got more and more angry as I waited for her to phone.
example.tran: 我等她电话的时候，越等越生气。

collins.def: If you say that someone is on the phone, you mean that they are speaking to someone else by phone.

example.ex: She's always on the phone, wanting to know what I've been up to.
example.tran: 她老来电话，想知道我在做什么。

collins.tran: 装了电话的；可用电话联系的
collins.def: If you are on the phone, you have a phone in your home or place of work, so that you can be contacted by phone.

example.ex: The Frosts were not on the phone.
example.tran: 福罗斯特家没装电话。

means: 把…分隔开，留间隔于…之间

collins.def: You use space to refer to an area that is empty or available. The area can be any size. For example, you can refer to a large area outside as a large open space or to a small area between two objects as a small space .

example.ex: Under the plan, bits of open space — fields, golf-course borders and small parks — will be preserved.
example.tran: 在这份规划里，一些开放空间——运动场、高尔夫球场边缘以及小公园——将得以保留。

example.ex: ...cutting down yet more trees to make space for houses...
example.tran: 砍掉更多的树，腾出空间来盖房子

collins.tran: (活动或储藏用的)空间，场所，面积
collins.def: A particular kind of space is the area that is available for a particular activity or for putting a particular kind of thing in.

example.ex: ...the high cost of office space...
example.tran: 办公场所的高额成本

example.ex: You don't want your living space to look like a bedroom...
example.tran: 你可不希望自己居住的地方看上去像个卧室。

collins.def: If a place gives a feeling of space, it gives an impression of being large and open.

example.ex: Large paintings can enhance the feeling of space in small rooms...
example.tran: 大型油画可以增加小房间的宽敞感。

example.ex: The sense of space and emptiness is overwhelming.
example.tran: 巨大的空虚感汹涌袭来。

collins.tran: (思考问题、个人成长所需的)时间，余地，空间
collins.def: If you give someone space to think about something or to develop as a person, you allow them the time and freedom to do this.

example.ex: You need space to think everything over...
example.tran: 你需要时间把一切好好地考虑清楚。

example.ex: We will give each other space to develop.
example.tran: 我们会给彼此留出发展的空间。

collins.tran: (文件中用于讨论某个话题的)版面，篇幅
collins.def: The amount of space for a topic to be discussed in a document is the number of pages available to discuss the topic.

example.ex: We can't promise to publish a reply as space is limited.
example.tran: 由于版面有限，我们不能保证把回复登载出来。

example.ex: ...some work which we couldn't include because of lack of space in this issue.
example.tran: 由于这期篇幅有限，我们无法收纳进来的一些文章

collins.def: A space of time is a period of time.

example.ex: They've come a long way in a short space of time...
example.tran: 他们在很短的时间之内就大老远地赶了过来。

example.ex: I have known dramatic changes occur in the space of a few minutes with this method.
example.tran: 我知道用这种方法短短几分钟之内就能够产生急剧的变化。

collins.def: Space is the area beyond the Earth's atmosphere, where the stars and planets are.

example.ex: The six astronauts on board will spend ten days in space.
example.tran: 飞船上的6名宇航员将在太空度过 10 天。

example.ex: ...launching satellites into space.
example.tran: 发射人造卫星进入外层空间

collins.def: Space is the whole area within which everything exists.

example.ex: She felt herself transcending time and space...
example.tran: 她感到自己正在穿越时空。

example.ex: The physical universe is finite in space and time.
example.tran: 物质世界在时间和空间上是有限的。

collins.def: If you space a series of things, you arrange them so that they are not all together but have gaps or intervals of time between them.

example.ex: Women once again are having fewer children and spacing them further apart...
example.tran: 女人再次减少了生孩子的数量，而且生育之间相隔的时间也更长了。

example.ex: His voice was angry and he spaced the words for emphasis.
example.tran: 他的声音里透着愤怒，为了强调，他一字一顿。

collins.def: If you are staring into space, you are looking straight in front of you, without actually looking at anything in particular, for example because you are thinking or because you are feeling shocked.

example.ex: He just sat in the dressing-room staring into space...
example.tran: 他直愣愣地坐在化妆间里。

example.ex: Molly turned away and gazed off into space, a faraway look in her eyes.
example.tran: 莫莉转过脸去茫然瞪视，眼神似已飘到了远方。

collins.def: If you describe someone or something as a waste of space, you are indicating that you have a very low opinion of them.

example.ex: Even Sarah treated him as if he were a waste of space...
example.tran: 连萨拉对他都像是在对待一个废物。

example.ex: Are we expected to believe those scribblings are art? This piece of trash was a waste of space.
example.tran: 我们难道真要把那些乱涂乱画当作艺术吗？这种垃圾留着都占地方。

collins.tran: (新闻记者将进行后续报道时所说的话)请继续关注
collins.def: Journalists write 'Watch this space' in order to indicate in an informal way that they will be giving more information about something in the future.

example.ex: Watch this space for details of our next event.
example.tran: 请继续关注我们对下一事件的详细报道。

collins.def: If you guard a place, person, or object, you stand near them in order to watch and protect them.

example.ex: Gunmen guarded homes near the cemetery with shotguns...
example.tran: 持枪者手持猎枪守卫着墓地附近的房子。

example.ex: ...the heavily guarded courtroom.
example.tran: 戒备森严的法庭

collins.def: If you guard someone, you watch them and keep them in a particular place to stop them from escaping.

example.ex: Marines with rifles guarded them...
example.tran: 手持步枪的海军陆战队士兵监视着他们。

example.ex: He is being guarded by a platoon of police.
example.tran: 有一队警察看守着他。

collins.def: A guard is someone such as a soldier, police officer, or prison officer who is guarding a particular place or person.

example.ex: The prisoners overpowered their guards and locked them in a cell.
example.tran: 囚犯们制服了监狱看守，并将他们锁进了牢房。

collins.def: A guard is a specially organized group of people, such as soldiers or policemen, who protect or watch someone or something.

example.ex: We have a security guard around the whole area...
example.tran: 我们在该地区各处部署了保安。

example.ex: A heavily armed guard of police have sealed off the city centre.
example.tran: 一队全副武装的警察已经封锁了市中心。

collins.def: On a train, a guard is a person whose job is to travel on the train in order to help passengers, check tickets, and make sure that the train travels safely and on time.
If you guard some information or advantage that you have, you try to protect it or keep it for yourself.

example.ex: He closely guarded her identity.
example.tran: 他对她的身份守口如瓶。

example.ex: ...a threat to the country's jealously guarded unity.
example.tran: 对该国珍惜维护的统一局面的威胁

collins.tran: 保护装置；保护罩；保护器
collins.def: A guard is a protective device which covers a part of someone's body or a dangerous part of a piece of equipment.

example.ex: ...the chin guard of my helmet...
example.tran: 我头盔上的下巴保护罩

example.ex: A blade guard is fitted to protect the operator.
example.tran: 为保证操作人员的人身安全安装了桨叶保护罩。

collins.tran: （英国的）近卫军，禁军，近卫军士兵
collins.def: Some regiments in the British Army, or the soldiers in them, are referred to as Guards.

example.ex: ...the Grenadier Guards.
example.tran: 英国近卫步兵团

collins.def: If  someone catches you off guard, they surprise you by doing something you do not expect. If something catches you off guard, it surprises you by happening when you are not expecting it.

example.ex: Charm the audience and catch them off guard...
example.tran: 吸引观众的注意力，然后给他们来个出其不意。

example.ex: The invitation had caught me off guard.
example.tran: 收到这份邀请让我颇感意外。

collins.tran: 丧失警惕；放松警惕；不提防
collins.def: If you lower your guard ,let your guard down or drop your guard, you relax when you should be careful and alert, often with unpleasant consequences.

example.ex: The ANC could not afford to lower its guard until everything had been carried out...
example.tran: 非洲人国民大会在所有事项皆已完成前不敢有丝毫松懈。

example.ex: You can't let your guard down...
example.tran: 你不能放松警惕。

collins.def: If you mount guard or if you mount a guard, you organize people to watch or protect a person or place.

example.ex: They've  even mounted guard outside the main hotel in the capital...
example.tran: 他们甚至派人在首都的大饭店外面站岗。

example.ex: Police mounted round-the-clock guards on properties last night.
example.tran: 警方昨晚通宵值守财物。

collins.def: If you are on your guard or on guard, you are being very careful because you think a situation might become difficult or dangerous.

example.ex: The police have questioned him thoroughly, and he'll be on his guard...
example.tran: 警方已经对他进行了详细的盘问，因此他会保持戒备心理。

example.ex: He is constantly on guard against any threat of humiliation.
example.tran: 他时刻提防着任何有辱尊严之事。

collins.def: If someone is on guard, they are on duty and responsible for guarding a particular place or person.

example.ex: Police were on guard at Barnet town hall.
example.tran: 警察在巴尼特市政厅值守。

collins.def: If you stand guard, you stand near a particular person or place because you are responsible for watching or protecting them.

example.ex: One young policeman stood guard outside the locked embassy gates.
example.tran: 一位年轻的警察在大门紧闭的使馆外站岗。

collins.def: If someone is under guard, they are being guarded.

example.ex: Three men were arrested and one was under guard in hospital.
example.tran: 有3人被逮捕，1人在警方监护下送医院治疗。

collins.def: Conflict is serious disagreement and argument about something important. If two people or groups are in conflict, they have had a serious disagreement or argument and have not yet reached agreement.

example.ex: Try to keep any conflict between you and your ex-partner to a minimum...
example.tran: 尽量将自己与前配偶之间的摩擦减到最小。

example.ex: Employees already are in conflict with management over job cuts...
example.tran: 雇员已经就裁员一事与管理层发生了争执。

collins.def: Conflict is a state of mind in which you find it impossible to make a decision.

example.ex: ...the anguish of his own inner conflict.
example.tran: 内心矛盾给他带来的极大痛苦

collins.def: Conflict is fighting between countries or groups of people.

example.ex: ...talks aimed at ending four decades of conflict...
example.tran: 旨在结束持续了40年的冲突的会谈
