example.ex: The National Security Council has met to discuss ways of preventing a military conflict.
example.tran: 国家安全委员会开会讨论防止发生军事冲突的办法。

collins.tran: (信仰、观念或利益之间的)严重分歧，冲突
collins.def: A conflict is a serious difference between two or more beliefs, ideas, or interests. If two beliefs, ideas, or interests are in conflict, they are very different.

example.ex: There is a conflict between what they are doing and what you want...
example.tran: 他们所做的与你想要的之间存在冲突。

example.ex: Do you feel any conflict of loyalties?...
example.tran: 有没有觉得两面效忠存在冲突？

collins.tran: (想法、信仰或陈述)冲突，抵触，相互矛盾
collins.def: If ideas, beliefs, or accounts conflict, they are very different from each other and it seems impossible for them to exist together or to each be true.

example.ex: Personal ethics and professional ethics sometimes conflict...
example.tran: 个人道德和职业道德有时会相互抵触。

example.ex: He held firm opinions which usually conflicted with my own...
example.tran: 他所持的观点通常与我的相左，而且很难改变。

means: 知识（表示多方面的知识时有复数knowledges这一用法）

collins.def: Knowledge is information and understanding about a subject which a person has, or which all people have.

example.ex: She told Parliament she had no knowledge of the affair.
example.tran: 她告诉议会她对此事并不知情。

example.ex: ...the quest for scientific knowledge.
example.tran: 对科学知识的探索

collins.def: If you say that something is true to your knowledge or to the best of your knowledge, you mean that you believe it to be true but it is possible that you do not know all the facts.

example.ex: Alec never carried a gun to my knowledge...
example.tran: 据我所知亚历克从来不带枪。

example.ex: To the best of my knowledge, Gloria did not make these comments.
example.tran: 据我所知，格洛丽亚没这么说过。

collins.def: If you do something safe in the knowledge that something else is the case, you do the first thing confidently because you are sure of the second thing.

example.ex: You can let your kids play here, safe in the knowledge that they won't get sunburn.
example.tran: 你可以放心让孩子们在这儿玩，他们肯定不会晒黑。

means: （在公司、计划等中的）重大利益

collins.tran: 处于危险境地;处于成败关头
collins.def: If something is at stake, it is being risked and might be lost or damaged if you are not successful.

example.ex: The tension was naturally high for a game with so much at stake...
example.tran: 对于一场成败攸关的比赛来说气氛自然非常紧张。

example.ex: At stake is the success or failure of world trade talks...
example.tran: 世界贸易谈判正处于成败的重要关头。

collins.def: The stakes involved in a contest or a risky action are the things that can be gained or lost.

example.ex: The game was usually played for high stakes between two large groups...
example.tran: 游戏通常在两大集团之间进行，下的赌注一般都很大。

example.ex: By arresting the organisation's two top leaders the government and the army have now raised the stakes...
example.tran: 逮捕了该组织的两名主要头目后，政府和军队现在面临的风险更大了。

collins.def: If you stake something such as your money or your reputation on the result of something, you risk your money or reputation on it.

example.ex: He has staked his political future on an election victory...
example.tran: 他把自己的政治前途押在竞选获胜上。

example.ex: He has staked his reputation on the outcome.
example.tran: 他将自己的名声赌在了这个结果上。

collins.tran: 利害关系;重大利益;(企业等中的)股本，股份
collins.def: If you have a stake in something such as a business, it matters to you, for example because you own part of it or because its success or failure will affect you.

example.ex: He was eager to return to a more entrepreneurial role in which he had a big financial stake in his own efforts...
example.tran: 他渴望回到一个更多参与创业的角色，那样他所付出的努力会与自己的经济利益息息相关。

example.ex: Detectives now believe the Mafia also had a stake in the plot and killed him when it went wrong.
example.tran: 侦探们现在相信黑手党在这个阴谋中也有利害关系，并在事败后杀了他。

collins.def: You can use stakes to refer to something that is like a contest. For example, you can refer to the choosing of a leader as the leadership stakes .

example.ex: Britain lags behind in the European childcare stakes.
example.tran: 英国在儿童保育方面落后于欧洲其他国家。

collins.def: A stake is a pointed wooden post which is pushed into the ground, for example in order to support a young tree.

collins.tran: 提出权利要求;主张权利
collins.def: If you stake a claim, you say that something is yours or that you have a right to it.

example.ex: Jane is determined to stake her claim as an actress...
example.tran: 简决心主张自己作为一名女演员的权利。

example.ex: Baguet's success staked his claim for a place in Belgium's world championship team.
example.tran: 巴古埃特的成功使他有资格成为比利时世界锦标赛参赛队伍中的一员。

means: （书、报、杂志等的）一版印刷总数

collins.def: An edition is a particular version of a book, magazine, or newspaper that is printed at one time.

example.ex: A paperback edition is now available at bookshops.
example.tran: 平装本现在在书店可以买到。

collins.tran: (书或报纸的)一次印刷量，版次
collins.def: An edition is the total number of copies of a particular book or newspaper that are printed at one time.

example.ex: The second edition was published only in America.
example.tran: 第二版只在美国出版。

collins.tran: （电视或广播节目的）一集，一期
collins.def: An edition is a single television or radio programme that is one of a series about a particular subject.

example.ex: They appeared on an edition of BBC2's Arena.
example.tran: 他们在英国广播公司二台《竞技场》的一期节目中亮相。

collins.def: If you earn money, you receive money in return for work that you do.

example.ex: Charlie was earning eight pounds, I was earning five...
example.tran: 查利赚了8英镑，我赚了5英镑。

example.ex: What a lovely way to earn a living...
example.tran: 谋生妙道啊！

collins.def: If something earns money, it produces money as profit or interest.

example.ex: ...a current account which earns little or no interest...
example.tran: 利息很少或为零的活期账户

example.ex: We buy everything abroad with the money earned from oil imports.
example.tran: 我们用进口石油赚到的钱从国外购买一切商品。

collins.def: If you earn something such as praise, you get it because you deserve it.

example.ex: Companies must earn a reputation for honesty...
example.tran: 公司必须树立诚信的声誉。

example.ex: I think that's earned him very high admiration.
example.tran: 我认为那一点为他赢得了极高的赞誉。

collins.def: An analyst is a person whose job is to analyse a subject and give opinions about it.

example.ex: ...a political analyst.
example.tran: 政治分析家

collins.def: An analyst is someone, usually a doctor, who examines and treats people who are emotionally disturbed.
Professional means relating to a person's work, especially work that requires special training.

example.ex: His professional career started at Liverpool University.
example.tran: 他的职业生涯是从利物浦大学开始的。

collins.def: Professional people have jobs that require advanced education or training.

example.ex: ...highly qualified professional people like doctors and engineers.
example.tran: 像医生和工程师这样需要高技能的专业人员

collins.def: You use professional to describe people who do a particular thing to earn money rather than as a hobby.

example.ex: This has been my worst time for injuries since I started as a professional footballer...
example.tran: 这是我当职业足球运动员以来受伤来得最不是时候的一次。

example.ex: Jack Nicklaus has played in every Major Championship since he turned professional in 1961.
example.tran: 杰克·尼克劳斯自从1961年转为职业选手以来参加了四大赛的所有比赛。

collins.def: Professional sports are played for money rather than as a hobby.

example.ex: ...an art student who had played professional football for a short time.
example.tran: 踢过短时间职业足球的艺术系学生

collins.tran: 专业的；内行的；高水平的
collins.def: If you say that something that someone does or produces is professional, you approve of it because you think that it is of a very high standard.

example.ex: They run it with  a truly professional but personal touch.
example.tran: 他们的经营既有真正的专业水准又不乏个人特色。

collins.def: A prisoner  is a person who is kept in a prison as a punishment for a crime that they have committed.

example.ex: The committee is concerned about the large number of prisoners sharing cells.
example.tran: 这个委员会对牢房拥挤问题表示担忧。

collins.def: A prisoner is a person who has been captured by an enemy, for example in war.

example.ex: ...wartime hostages and concentration-camp prisoners...
example.tran: 战时的人质和集中营的战俘

example.ex: He was held prisoner in Vietnam from 1966 to 1973...
example.tran: 他在1966年到1973年间被作为战俘关押在越南。

collins.tran: 为…所困的人；陷于…不能摆脱的人
collins.def: If you say that you are a prisoner of a situation, you mean that your are trapped by it.

example.ex: We are all prisoners of our childhood and feel an obligation to it...
example.tran: 我们都无法忘记自己的童年时代，觉得仍然为它所缚。

example.ex: She was a prisoner of her own ego.
example.tran: 她为自己的自尊心所困。

collins.tran: 性爱的;性欲的;性行为的
collins.def: Sexual feelings or activities are connected with the act of sex or with people's desire for sex.

example.ex: This was the first sexual relationship I had had...
example.tran: 这是我第一次与人发生性关系。

example.ex: Men's sexual fantasies often have little to do with their sexual desire.
example.tran: 男性的性幻想通常和他们的性欲没什么关系。

collins.tran: 性别的;性别差异的;两性间的
collins.def: Sexual means relating to the differences between male and female people.

example.ex: Women's groups denounced sexual discrimination.
example.tran: 一些女性团体谴责性别歧视。

example.ex: ...sexual and racial equal opportunities.
example.tran: 不同性别、不同种族的人机会平等

collins.tran: 性取向的;不同性观念的
collins.def: Sexual means relating to the differences between heterosexuals and homosexuals.

example.ex: ...couples of all sexual persuasions.
example.tran: 有各种不同性观念的夫妇们

collins.def: Sexual means relating to the biological process by which people and animals produce young.

example.ex: Girls generally reach sexual maturity two years earlier than boys.
example.tran: 通常女孩性发育成熟要比男孩早两年。

example.ex: ...sexual reproduction.
example.tran: 有性繁殖

collins.def: If you examine something, you look at it carefully.

example.ex: He examined her passport and stamped it...
example.tran: 他仔细检查了她的护照，然后在上面盖了章。

example.ex: Forensic scientists are examining what police believe to have been the bombers' car.
example.tran: 法医学家正在对一辆警方怀疑属于投弹者的汽车进行仔细检查。

collins.def: If a doctor examines you, he or she looks at your body, feels it, or does simple tests in order to check how healthy you are.

example.ex: Another doctor examined her and could still find nothing wrong...
example.tran: 另外一名医生对她进行了诊察，仍旧没有发现任何问题。

example.ex: He was examined again and then prescribed a different herbal medicine.
example.tran: 医生又对他诊察了一遍，然后开了另外一种草药。

collins.def: If an idea, proposal, or plan is examined, it is considered very carefully.

example.ex: I have given the matter much thought, examining all the possible alternatives...
example.tran: 这个问题我已经考虑了很多，分析了各种可能的选择。

example.ex: The plans will be examined by EU environment ministers.
example.tran: 欧盟各国环境部部长将仔细研究这些计划。

collins.def: If you are examined, you are given a formal test in order to show your knowledge of a subject.

example.ex: ...learning to cope with the pressures of being judged and examined by our teachers.
example.tran: 学会应对老师评判和测验时的压力

collins.tran: 英里(等于1,760 码或约等于1.6公里)
collins.def: A mile is a unit of distance equal to 1,760 yards or approximately 1.6 kilometres.

example.ex: They drove 600 miles across the desert...
example.tran: 他们驱车600英里穿越沙漠。

example.ex: The hurricane is moving to the west at about 18 miles per hour...
example.tran: 飓风正以每小时18英里的速度向西推进。

collins.def: Miles is used, especially in the expression miles away, to refer to a long distance.

example.ex: If you enrol at a gym that's miles away, you won't be visiting it as often as you should...
example.tran: 如果你加入的健身馆非常远，就不会去得那么经常了。

example.ex: I was miles and miles from anywhere...
example.tran: 我离任何地方都非常远。

collins.tran: 很大的程度（强调区别或目标与现实的差距）
collins.def: Miles or a mile is used with the meaning 'very much' in order to emphasize the difference between two things or qualities, or the difference between what you aimed to do and what you actually achieved.

example.ex: You're miles better than most of the  performers we see nowadays...
example.tran: 你比当下我们见到的大多数表演者都强多了。

example.ex: With a Labour candidate in place they won by a mile...
example.tran: 有一个工党的候选人坐镇，他们大获全胜。

collins.tran: 思想不集中;开小差；走神
collins.def: If you say that someone is miles away, you mean that they are unaware of what is happening around them because they are thinking about something else.

example.ex: What were you thinking about? You were miles away.
example.tran: 你刚才在想什么呢？你开小差了。

collins.def: If you say that someone is willing to go the extra mile, you mean that they are willing to make a special effort to do or achieve something.

example.ex: The President is determined 'to go the extra mile for peace'.
example.tran: 总统决心“为实现和平而加倍努力”。

collins.def: If you say that you can see or recognize something a mile off, you are emphasizing that it is very obvious and easy to recognize.

example.ex: You can spot undercover cops a mile off.
example.tran: 你一眼就可以认出便衣警察。

collins.tran: (因极度害怕或不愿面对)避而远之，跑得远远的
collins.def: If you say that someone would run a mile when faced with a particular situation, you mean that they would be very frightened or unwilling to deal with it.

example.ex: If anybody had told me when I first got married that I was going to have seven children, I would have run a mile...
example.tran: 若是有人在我刚结婚时跟我说我会生7个孩子，我一定会躲得远远的。

example.ex: I'm very squeamish and when I see needles I run a mile.
example.tran: 我神经非常脆弱，见到针头就会逃之夭夭。

collins.def: If you say that something or someone sticks out a mile or stands out a mile, you are emphasizing that they are very obvious and easy to recognize.

example.ex: 'How do you know he's Irish?' —'Sticks out a mile.'...
example.tran: “你是怎么知道他是爱尔兰人的呢？”——“明摆的事嘛。”

example.ex: We stood out a mile on that first day at school.
example.tran: 上学第一天，我们就非常惹人注意。

collins.def: You can refer to problems or difficulties as trouble .

example.ex: I had trouble parking...
example.tran: 我停车有困难。

example.ex: You've caused us a lot of trouble...
example.tran: 你给我们造成了很多麻烦。

collins.tran: 麻烦;问题;引起麻烦的事
collins.def: If you say that one aspect of a situation is the trouble, you mean that it is the aspect which is causing problems or making the situation unsatisfactory.

example.ex: The trouble is that these restrictions have remained while other things have changed...
example.tran: 问题是其他事情都变了，而这些条条框框还在。

example.ex: Your trouble is that you can't take rejection.
example.tran: 你的问题是不能接受拒绝。

collins.def: Your troubles are the things that you are worried about.

example.ex: She tells me her troubles. I tell her mine…
example.tran: 我和她互相倾诉烦恼。

example.ex: She kept her troubles to herself.
example.tran: 她把烦心事都放在心里。

collins.def: If you have kidney trouble or back trouble, for example, there is something wrong with your kidneys or your back.

example.ex: An unsuitable bed is the most likely cause of back trouble…
example.tran: 不合适的床最有可能引起背部疼痛。

example.ex: Her husband had never before had any heart trouble...
example.tran: 她丈夫以前从来没得过任何心脏疾病。

collins.def: If there is trouble somewhere, especially in a public place, there is fighting or rioting there.

example.ex: Riot police are being deployed throughout the city to prevent any trouble...
example.tran: 正在全城部署防暴警察以防止发生骚乱。

example.ex: Fans who make trouble during the World Cup will be severely dealt with.
example.tran: 在世界杯期间闹事的球迷将受到严惩。

collins.def: If you tell someone that it is no trouble to do something for them, you are saying politely that you can or will do it, because it is easy or convenient for you.

example.ex: It's no trouble at all; on the contrary, it will be a great pleasure to help you...
example.tran: 根本不费事，恰恰相反，非常荣幸能帮到你。

example.ex: Will it be any trouble to get over here that quickly?
example.tran: 那么快来这里会不会有什么不便？

collins.tran: 需劳神费力的人(或动物)
collins.def: If you say that a person or animal is no trouble, you mean that they are very easy to look after.

example.ex: My little grandson is no trouble at all, but his 6-year-old elder sister is rude and selfish.
example.tran: 我的小孙子一点都不让人操心，但是他6岁大的姐姐却野蛮而又自私。

collins.def: If something troubles you, it makes you feel rather worried.

example.ex: Is anything troubling you?...
example.tran: 有什么事情让你烦恼吗？

example.ex: He was troubled by the lifestyle of his son.
example.tran: 他对儿子的生活方式感到很担心。

collins.def: If a part of your body troubles you, it causes you physical pain or discomfort.

example.ex: The ulcer had been troubling her for several years.
example.tran: 溃疡已经折磨她好几年了。

collins.def: If you say that someone does not trouble to do something, you are critical of them because they do not behave in the way that they should do, and you think that this would require very little effort.

example.ex: He yawns, not troubling to cover his mouth...
example.tran: 他打了个哈欠，都懒得抬抬手遮一下嘴巴。

example.ex: He hadn't troubled himself to check his mirrors...
example.tran: 他都没想要看看后视镜。

collins.def: You use trouble in expressions such as I'm sorry to trouble you when you are apologizing to someone for disturbing them in order to ask them something.

example.ex: I'm sorry to trouble you, but I wondered if by any chance you know where he is...
example.tran: 对不起打扰了，但我想打听一下您是否知道他在哪里。

example.ex: I hate to trouble you, but Aunt Lina's birthday is coming up and I would like to buy something nice for her.
example.tran: 我真不愿打扰您，但莉娜阿姨的生日就要到了，我想给她买点好东西。

collins.tran: 处于困境;惹麻烦;将受惩罚
collins.def: If someone is in trouble, they are in a situation in which a person in authority is angry with them or is likely to punish them because they have done something wrong.

example.ex: He was in trouble with his teachers...
example.tran: 老师们都想好好教训他。

example.ex: The person who loaned them to me got into terrible trouble for it.
example.tran: 把那笔钱借给我的那个人因此倒霉了。

collins.def: If you take the trouble to do something, you do something which requires a small amount of additional effort.

example.ex: It is worth taking the trouble to sieve the fruit by hand…
example.tran: 值得费点劲用手挑挑果子。

example.ex: He did not take the trouble to see the film before he attacked it.
example.tran: 他在批评那部电影之前都懒得费神欣赏。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is more trouble than they are worth, you mean that they cause you a lot of problems or take a lot of time and effort and you do not achieve or gain very much in return.

example.ex: Some grumbled that Johnson was more trouble than he was worth...
example.tran: 有人抱怨说根本不值得为约翰逊浪费精力。

example.ex: Learning more about it always seemed more trouble than it was worth.
example.tran: 似乎总是觉得没必要为进一步了解它而大费工夫。

collins.def: A type of something is a group of those things that have particular features in common.

example.ex: …several types of lettuce…
example.tran: 几个不同品种的莴苣

example.ex: There are various types of the disease...
example.tran: 该疾病有各种类型。

collins.def: If you refer to a particular thing or person as a type of something more general, you are considering that thing or person as an example of that more general group.

example.ex: Have you done this type of work before?...
example.tran: 你以前做过这种活儿吗？

example.ex: Rates of interest for this type of borrowing can be high...
example.tran: 这种类型的借款利率可能会很高。

collins.tran: 具有…特点的人；…类型的人
collins.def: If you refer to a person as a particular type, you mean that they have that particular appearance, character, or way of behaving.

example.ex: It's the first time I, a fair-skinned, freckly type, have sailed in the sun without burning...
example.tran: 身为那种皮肤白皙而又长雀斑的人，这是我第一次在阳光下航行而没有被晒伤。

example.ex: I was rather an outdoor type…
example.tran: 我是那种特别喜欢户外运动的人。

collins.tran: …不感兴趣的类型;并非…喜欢的类型
collins.def: If you say that someone is not your type, you mean that they are not the sort of person who you usually find attractive.

example.ex: At first I thought he was rather ordinary looking, a little chubby, not my type...
example.tran: 刚开始我认为他相貌很普通，有点胖乎乎的，并非我喜欢的类型。

example.ex: I'm not his type. I am probably too strong a character.
example.tran: 我不是他喜欢的类型。大概我性格太要强了。

collins.def: A museum is a building where a large number of interest-ing and valuable objects, such as works of art or historical items, are kept, studied, and displayed to the public.

example.ex: For months Malcolm had wanted to visit the Parisian art museums.
example.tran: 几个月来马尔科姆一直想参观巴黎的艺术博物馆。

example.ex: ...the American Museum of Natural History.
example.tran: 美国自然历史博物馆

collins.def: If something is beyond a place or barrier, it is on the other side of it.

example.ex: They heard footsteps in the main room, beyond a door...
example.tran: 他们听见门外的大厅里有脚步声。

example.ex: On his right was a thriving vegetable garden and beyond it a small orchard of apple trees.
example.tran: 他右边是一个生机勃勃的菜园，菜园的另一边是一个小小的苹果园。

collins.tran: 超过，迟于（某个时间）；逾（期）
collins.def: If something happens beyond a particular time or date, it continues after that time or date has passed.

example.ex: Few jockeys continue race-riding beyond the age of 40...
example.tran: 很少有职业赛马骑师超过40岁仍继续参加赛马的。

example.ex: You may be entitled to Child Benefit if a child continues getting full-time education beyond the date already notified by you.
example.tran: 如果小孩接受全日制教育的时间超过了您已告知我们的那个期限，您就有权申请儿童补助金。

collins.def: If something extends beyond a particular thing, it affects or includes other things.

example.ex: His interests extended beyond the fine arts to international politics and philosophy.
example.tran: 他兴趣广泛，涵盖了从美术到国际政治乃至哲学的各个领域。

collins.def: You use beyond to introduce an exception to what you are saying.

example.ex: He appears to have almost no personal staff, beyond a secretary who can't make coffee...
example.tran: 除了一个不会冲咖啡的秘书之外，他好像几乎没有什么随身的工作人员。

example.ex: I knew nothing beyond a few random facts.
example.tran: 除了一些零星的情况外，我什么也不知道。

collins.tran: 超出，超过（某个点或阶段）
collins.def: If something goes beyond a particular point or stage, it progresses or increases so that it passes that point or stage.

example.ex: Their five-year relationship was strained beyond breaking point...
example.tran: 他们五年的关系已经紧张到无法维系。

example.ex: It seems to me he's  beyond caring about what anybody does.
example.tran: 在我看来，他不关心别人做什么。

collins.def: If something is, for example, beyond understanding or beyond belief, it is so extreme in some way that it cannot be understood or believed.

example.ex: What Jock had done was beyond my comprehension...
example.tran: 我无法理解乔克的所作所为。

example.ex: Sweden is lovely in summer — cold beyond belief in winter...
example.tran: 瑞典的夏天非常宜人——冬天却冷得让人难以置信。

collins.tran: 非…能力所及；超出…的能力
collins.def: If you say that something is beyond someone, you mean that they cannot deal with it.

example.ex: Although he could give her sympathy, any practical help would almost certainly be beyond him...
example.tran: 虽然他可以对她表示同情，但是他几乎根本无法提供任何实际的帮助。

example.ex: The situation was beyond her control.
example.tran: 局势并非她能控制。

collins.tran: 除非；若不；除非在…的时候
collins.def: You use unless to introduce the only circumstances in which an event you are mentioning will not take place or in which a statement you are making is not true.

example.ex: Unless you are trying to lose weight to please yourself, it's going to be tough to keep your motivation level high...
example.tran: 除非减肥是为了悦已，否则很难保持积极性。

example.ex: We cannot understand disease unless we understand the person who has the disease...
example.tran: 若不了解患者我们就不能了解疾病。

collins.def: If you worry, you keep thinking about problems that you have or about unpleasant things that might happen.

example.ex: Don't worry, your luggage will come on afterwards by taxi...
example.tran: 别担心，你的行李随后会由出租车送过来。

example.ex: I worry about her constantly...
example.tran: 我无时无刻不为她担心。

collins.def: If someone or something worries you, they make you anxious because you keep thinking about problems or unpleasant things that might be connected with them.

example.ex: I'm still in the early days of my recovery and that worries me...
example.tran: 我还处于恢复的早期阶段，这让我很担心。

example.ex: 'Why didn't you tell us?' — 'I didn't want to worry you.'...
example.tran: “你为什么不告诉我们？”“我不想让你们担心。”

collins.def: If someone or something does not worry you, you do not dislike them or you are not annoyed by them.

example.ex: The cold doesn't worry me...
example.tran: 冷我不怕。

example.ex: It wouldn't worry me if he came to my house, but I don't know if I would go out of my way to ask him.
example.tran: 我倒不介意他来我家，但我不知道自己是否会特意邀请他。

collins.def: Worry is the state or feeling of anxiety and unhappiness caused by the problems that you have or by thinking about unpleasant things that might happen.

example.ex: The admission shows the depth of worry among the Tories over the state of the economy...
example.tran: 这一认可表明了保守党党内对经济状况的忧虑之深。

example.ex: His last years were overshadowed by financial worry.
example.tran: 他生命的最后几年穷困潦倒，十分惨淡。

collins.tran: 使人担心(或发愁)的问题；烦心事
collins.def: A worry is a problem that you keep thinking about and that makes you unhappy.

example.ex: My main worry was that Madeleine Johnson would still be there...
example.tran: 我最担心的是马德琳·约翰逊仍会在那儿。

example.ex: The worry is that the use of force could make life impossible for the UN peacekeepers...
example.tran: 让人担心的是，使用武力可能会使联合国维和人员性命难保。

collins.tran: （表示自己并不烦恼或生气）别担心；没关系
collins.def: You say not to worry to someone to indicate that you are not upset or angry when something has gone wrong.

example.ex: 'Not to worry, Baby,' he said, and kissed her tenderly.
example.tran: “没关系，宝贝儿。”他说道，然后温柔地吻了她一下。

collins.def: Something that is narrow measures a very small distance from one side to the other, especially compared to its length or height.

example.ex: ...through the town's narrow streets...
example.tran: 穿过该镇狭窄的街道

example.ex: She had long, narrow feet.
example.tran: 她的双脚瘦长。

collins.def: If something narrows, it becomes less wide.

example.ex: The wide track narrows before crossing another stream.
example.tran: 宽宽的小径在穿过另一条小溪前逐渐收窄。

collins.def: If your eyes narrow or if you narrow your eyes, you almost close them, for example because you are angry or because you are trying to concentrate on something.

example.ex: Coggins' eyes narrowed angrily. 'You think I'd tell you?'...
example.tran: 科金斯气得眯起眼睛。“你认为我会告诉你？”

example.ex: He paused and narrowed his eyes in concentration.
example.tran: 他停下来，眯起眼睛专注地看着。

collins.tran: (想法、态度或信仰)狭隘的，有局限的
collins.def: If you describe someone's ideas, attitudes, or beliefs as narrow, you disapprove of them because they are restricted in some way, and often ignore the more important aspects of an argument or situation.

example.ex: ...a narrow and outdated view of family life...
example.tran: 对家庭生活狭隘过时的看法

example.ex: I would have preferred somebody who had wider ideas, and he was rather narrow.
example.tran: 我会更倾向于一个思路开阔些的人，他的想法太狭隘了。

collins.def: If something narrows or if you narrow it, its extent or range becomes smaller.

example.ex: Most recent opinion polls suggest that the gap between the two main parties has narrowed...
example.tran: 最新的民意测验显示这两大主要政党之间的差距已经缩小了。

example.ex: Senate negotiators further narrowed their differences over the level of federal spending for anti-drug programs.
example.tran: 关于联邦政府在反毒品项目上的支出问题，参议院的谈判代表们进一步缩小了分歧。

collins.tran: (胜利)勉强的;(胜负)差距微弱的;险胜的
collins.def: If you have a narrow victory, you succeed in winning but only by a small amount.

example.ex: Delegates have voted by a narrow majority in favour of considering electoral reform.
example.tran: 代表们投票表决，以微弱多数票赞同考虑选举制度的改革。

collins.def: If you have a narrow escape, something unpleasant nearly happens to you.

example.ex: Two police officers had a narrow escape when separatists attacked their vehicles.
example.tran: 分裂主义者袭击他们的车辆时，两名警官死里逃生。

means: 感叹词（用于表示惊奇，并不强烈的愤怒或失望）

collins.def: If someone shoots a person or an animal, they kill them or injure them by firing a bullet or arrow at them.

example.ex: The police had orders to shoot anyone who attacked them...
example.tran: 警察接到命令可以枪击任何攻击他们的人。

example.ex: Namibian law permits ranchers to shoot cheetahs to protect their livestock...
example.tran: 纳米比亚法律允许农场主射杀猎豹以保护家畜。

collins.def: To shoot means to fire a bullet from a weapon such as a gun.

example.ex: He taunted armed officers by pointing to his head, as if inviting them to shoot...
example.tran: 他用手指着自己的头来嘲弄武装警察，好像在招引他们开枪一样。

example.ex: The police came around the corner and they started shooting at us...
example.tran: 警察拐过了街角，开始朝我们开枪。

collins.def: If someone or something shoots in a particular direction, they move in that direction quickly and suddenly.

example.ex: They had almost reached the boat when a figure shot past them...
example.tran: 他们差不多快到船边时，一个人影从他们旁边飞奔而过。

example.ex: Another car shot out of a junction and smashed into the back of them.
example.tran: 另一辆车从交叉路口飞驰而出，撞到了他们汽车的尾部。

collins.tran: (突然并迅速地)伸出，扔出，抛出
collins.def: If you shoot something somewhere or if it shoots somewhere, it moves there quickly and suddenly.

example.ex: Masters shot a hand across the table and gripped his wrist...
example.tran: 马斯特斯迅速把手伸到桌对面，紧紧抓住他的手腕。

example.ex: As soon as she got close, the old woman's hand shot out...
example.tran: 她一靠近，那老妇人的手就猛地伸了出来。

collins.def: If you shoot a look at someone, you look at them quickly and briefly, often in a way that expresses your feelings.

example.ex: Mary Ann shot him a rueful look...
example.tran: 玛丽·安懊悔地瞥了他一眼。

example.ex: The man in the black overcoat shot a penetrating look at the other man.
example.tran: 身穿黑大衣的男子目光犀利地扫了另外一名男子一眼。

collins.def: If someone shoots to fame, they become famous or successful very quickly.

example.ex: Alina Reyes shot to fame a few years ago with her extraordinary first novel...
example.tran: 阿林娜·雷耶斯几年前因她那部不同凡响的小说处女作而迅速成名。

example.ex: She shot to stardom on Broadway in a Noel Coward play.
example.tran: 她因在百老汇出演了一部诺埃尔·科沃德的戏一炮而红。

collins.def: When people shoot a film or shoot photographs, they make a film or take photographs using a camera.

example.ex: He'd love to shoot his film in Cuba...
example.tran: 他很乐意在古巴拍摄他的影片。

example.ex: Three CBS cameramen were on site to shoot and edit taped reports. 3
example.tran: 名哥伦比亚广播公司的摄影记者在现场拍摄并编辑录像报道。

collins.def: Shoots are plants that are beginning to grow, or new parts growing from a plant or tree.
In sports such as football or basketball, when someone shoots, they try to score by kicking, throwing, or hitting the ball towards the goal.

example.ex: Spencer scuttled away from Young to shoot wide when he should have scored...
example.tran: 斯潘塞绕开了扬却把球射偏了，他本该进球得分的。

example.ex: A time limit was set for a team to shoot at the basket.
example.tran: 球队在规定时间内必须要投篮。

collins.def: When someone shoots pool or shoots craps, they play a game of pool or the dice game called craps.

example.ex: People are still hanging out drinking beer, maybe shooting some pool.
example.tran: 人们仍聚在那里喝啤酒，可能还会打会儿台球。

collins.def: If you shoot the breeze or shoot the bull with someone, you talk to them about things which are not very serious or important.

example.ex: They expected me to sit up and shoot the breeze with them till one or two in the morning...
example.tran: 他们希望我晚上熬夜陪他们聊天到凌晨一两点。

example.ex: I also met with Pollack again to kind of shoot the bull.
example.tran: 我也再次和波拉克会面，两人闲聊了会儿。

collins.tran: 搬起石头砸自己的脚;自作自受
collins.def: If you shoot yourself in the foot, something you say or do causes you harm.

example.ex: If I was to insult the contestants I would be shooting myself in the foot.
example.tran: 如果我羞辱参赛者，就会搬起石头砸自己的脚。

collins.def: You use particularly to indicate that what you are saying applies especially to one thing or situation.

example.ex: Keep your office space looking good, particularly your desk...
example.tran: 保持办公环境的整洁，尤其是你的桌子。

example.ex: More local employment will be created, particularly in service industries...
example.tran: 当地会创造出更多的就业机会，尤其是服务行业。

collins.def: Particularly means more than usual or  more than other things.

example.ex: Progress has been particularly disap-pointing...
example.tran: 进展情况格外令人失望。

example.ex: I particularly liked the wooden chests and chairs.
example.tran: 我格外喜欢木箱子和木椅子。

collins.def: When a person or vehicle arrives at a place, they come to it at the end of a journey.

example.ex: Fresh groups of guests arrived...
example.tran: 新的客人接踵而来。

example.ex: ...a small group of commuters waiting for their train, which arrived on time...
example.tran: 几个通勤者等候的列车按时到达了

collins.def: When you arrive at a place, you come to it for the first time in order to stay, live, or work there.

example.ex: ...in the old days before the European settlers arrived in the country.
example.tran: 在欧洲殖民者来到这个国家之前的旧日时光

example.ex: ...a young student newly arrived in England from New Zealand.
example.tran: 从新西兰初次来到英格兰的年轻学生

collins.def: When something such as letter or meal arrives, it is brought or delivered to you.

example.ex: Any entry arriving after the closing date will not be considered...
example.tran: 截止日期之后报名参赛的人将不予考虑。

example.ex: Breakfast arrived while he was in the bathroom.
example.tran: 早餐送来的时候他还在浴室里。

collins.tran: （新产品或发明）出现，到来，问世
collins.def: When something such as a new product or invention arrives, it becomes available.

example.ex: Several long-awaited videos will finally arrive in the shops this month...
example.tran: 几部让人翘首企盼的录像片终于将在这个月到货。

example.ex: They'll be ready to embrace the new technology when it arrives.
example.tran: 他们随时准备迎接新技术的问世。

collins.tran: （尤指经过等待或期盼后）来临，到来
collins.def: When a particular moment or event arrives, it happens, especially after you have been waiting for it or expecting it.

example.ex: The time has arrived when I need to give up smoking.
example.tran: 我戒烟的时机已到。

example.ex: ...the belief that the army would be much further forward before winter arrived.
example.tran: 认为军队在冬季来临之前将会向前大举推进的看法

collins.def: When you arrive at something such as a decision, you decide something after thinking about it or discussing it.

example.ex: ...if the jury cannot arrive at a unanimous decision...
example.tran: 如果陪审团不能作出一致判决

example.ex: These figures are arrived at on the basis of dentists' receipts for 1991-1992.
example.tran: 这些数字是根据1991至1992年间的牙医收据统计得出的。

collins.def: When a baby arrives, it is born.

example.ex: It's very unlikely that your baby will arrive before you get to hospital.
example.tran: 你的孩子不大可能在你到达医院之前就出生。

collins.def: If you say that someone has arrived, you mean that they have become successful or famous.

example.ex: These are cars which show you've arrived and had a good time along the way.
example.tran: 这样的车可以显示你已功成名就，并且一路顺风顺水。

collins.def: A track is a narrow road or path.

example.ex: We set off once more, over a rough mountain track.
example.tran: 我们沿着一条崎岖的山间小路再度出发。

collins.def: A track is a piece of ground, often oval-shaped, that is used for races involving athletes, cars, bicycles, horses, or dogs called greyhounds.

example.ex: The two men turned to watch the horses going round the track.
example.tran: 那两个男人转身观看赛马沿赛道而行。

example.ex: ...the athletics track.
example.tran: 田径跑道

collins.def: Railway tracks are the rails that a train travels along.

example.ex: A woman fell on to the tracks.
example.tran: 一名女子摔倒在铁轨上。

collins.tran: (CD、唱片或磁带上的一首)歌曲，乐曲
collins.def: A track is one of the songs or pieces of music on a CD, record, or tape.

example.ex: Graeme Naysmith has produced two of the ten tracks on this album.
example.tran: 格雷姆·内史密斯创作了这张专辑十首歌中的两首。

collins.def: Tracks are marks left in the ground by the feet of animals or people.

example.ex: The only evidence of pandas was their tracks in the snow...
example.tran: 熊猫活动的唯一迹象是它们留在雪地上的足迹。

example.ex: McKee suddenly noticed tire tracks on the bank ahead.
example.tran: 麦基突然注意到前方岸边的轮胎痕迹。

collins.def: If you track animals or people, you try to follow them by looking for the signs that they have left behind, for example the marks left by their feet.

example.ex: He thought he had better track this wolf and kill it...
example.tran: 他认为最好跟踪这只狼，杀了它。

example.ex: I followed him, tracking him in the snow until finally he got tired.
example.tran: 我跟着他，在雪地里追踪他，直到他最终体力不支。

collins.def: To track someone or something means to follow their movements by means of a special device, such as a satellite or radar.

example.ex: Our radar began tracking the jets...
example.tran: 我们的雷达开始追踪喷气式飞机的动向。

example.ex: Forecasters are also tracking hurricane Josephine.
example.tran: 气象预报员也在追踪飓风“约瑟芬”的动向。

collins.def: If you track someone or something, you investigate them, because you are interested in finding out more about them.

example.ex: If it's possible, track the rumour back to its origin...
example.tran: 如果可能，应追查谣言的源头。

example.ex: The player is being tracked by Juventus.
example.tran: 该选手正为尤文图斯队所追踪关注。

collins.tran: (同等年龄、能力的孩子组成的)班级，班组
collins.def: In a school, a track is a group of children of the same age and ability who are taught together.

collins.tran: 把(学生)按能力分班(或组)
collins.def: To track students means to divide them into groups according to their ability.

example.ex: Students are already being tracked.
example.tran: 学生已经按能力分班了。

collins.tran: 掩盖行踪;隐匿身份(或活动)
collins.def: If someone covers their tracks, they hide or destroy evidence of their identity or their actions, because they want to keep them secret.

example.ex: He covered his tracks, burnt letters and diaries...
example.tran: 他掩盖形迹，烧毁了信件与日记。

example.ex: The killer may have returned to the scene of the crime to cover his tracks.
example.tran: 凶手可能曾回到犯罪现场掩盖自己的罪行。

collins.tran: 占优势;处于有利地位;了解内情
collins.def: If you say that someone has the inside track, you mean that they have an advantage, for example special knowledge about something.

example.ex: Denver has the inside track among 10 sites being considered...
example.tran: 丹佛在 10 个被考虑的地点之中具有优势。

example.ex: As an agent, you may have an inside track when good deals become available.
example.tran: 作为代理人，一旦有划算的买卖你恐怕能近水楼台先得月。

collins.tran: 跟上…的进展;掌握…的最新消息
collins.def: If you keep track of a situation or a person, you make sure that you have the newest and most accurate information about them all the time.

example.ex: With eleven thousand employees, it's very difficult to keep track of them all...
example.tran: 对于一支 1.1 万人的员工队伍，很难及时了解到所有有人的动态。

example.ex: It's hard to keep track of time in here.
example.tran: 在这里很容易忘了时间。

collins.tran: 跟不上…的进展;不再掌握…的最新情况
collins.def: If you lose track of someone or something, you no longer know where they are or what is happening.

example.ex: You become so deeply absorbed in an activity that you lose track of time...
example.tran: 你会因过于专注某项活动而失去时间概念。

example.ex: It's so easy to lose track of who's playing who and when.
example.tran: 很容易就忘记谁要和谁比赛，什么时候比。

collins.def: If you make tracks, you leave the place where you are, especially when you are in a hurry.

example.ex: We'd better make tracks soon, hadn't we?
example.tran: 我们最好马上就走，不是吗？

collins.def: If someone or something is on track, they are acting or progressing in a way that is likely to result in success.

example.ex: It may take some time to get the British economy back on track...
example.tran: 要使英国经济重新回到正轨可能需要一段时间。

example.ex: David put me back on track…
example.tran: 戴维让我重新回到了正轨。

collins.def: If you are on the track of someone or something, you are trying to find them, or find information about them.

example.ex: He was on the track of an escaped criminal...
example.tran: 他正在追踪一名逃犯。

example.ex: The research institute is on the track of what causes the artery damage.
example.tran: 研究所正在探究动脉损伤的诱因。

collins.tran: 循着正确/错误的路线;在正确/错误的道路上
collins.def: If you are on the right track, you are acting or progressing in a way that is likely to result in success. If you are on the wrong track, you are acting or progressing in a way that is likely to result in failure.

example.ex: Guests are returning in increasing numbers — a sure sign that we are on the right track...
example.tran: 回头客越来越多了——这显然表明我们的路走对了。

example.ex: We need a convincing win to put us back on the right track…
example.tran: 我们需要一场令人信服的大胜，以重回正轨。

collins.def: If someone or something stops you in your tracks, or if you stop dead in your tracks, you suddenly stop moving because you are very surprised, impressed, or frightened.

example.ex: This magnificent church cannot fail to stop you in your tracks…
example.tran: 这座宏伟的教堂一定会让你止步赞叹。

example.ex: They stopped in their tracks and stared at him in amazement…
example.tran: 他们突然停下，惊讶地盯着他。

collins.def: If someone or something stops a process or activity in its tracks, or if it stops dead in its tracks, they prevent the process or activity from continuing.

example.ex: Francis felt he would like to stop this conversation in its tracks…
example.tran: 弗朗西斯觉得他应该立即打断这一谈话。

example.ex: U.S. manufacturers may find the export boom stopping dead in its tracks.
example.tran: 美国制造商将会发现出口热戛然而止。

collins.def: If you search for something or someone, you look carefully for them.

example.ex: The Turkish security forces have started searching for the missing men...
example.tran: 土耳其安全部队已经开始搜寻失踪人员。

example.ex: They searched for a spot where they could sit on the floor...
example.tran: 他们在地板上寻找一处能够坐下的地方。

collins.tran: 在…中搜寻(或搜索);搜查(某地)
collins.def: If you search a place, you look carefully for something or someone there.

example.ex: Armed troops searched the hospital yesterday...
example.tran: 武装部队昨天搜查了该医院。

example.ex: She searched her desk for the necessary information...
example.tran: 她在她的书桌上搜寻必要的信息。

collins.def: A search is an attempt to find something or someone by looking for them carefully.

example.ex: There was no chance of him being found alive and the search was abandoned...
example.tran: 他没有生还的可能，因此人们放弃了搜寻。

example.ex: Egypt has said there is no time to lose in the search for a Middle East settlement.
example.tran: 埃及称寻求中东和解刻不容缓。

collins.def: If a police officer or someone else in authority searches you, they look carefully to see whether you have something hidden on you.

example.ex: The man took her suitcase from her and then searched her...
example.tran: 那名男子拿过她手中的提箱，然后对她搜身。

example.ex: His first task was to search them for weapons.
example.tran: 他首先要搜查他们身上是否携带武器。

collins.def: If you search for information on a computer, you give the computer an instruction to find that information.

example.ex: You can use a directory service to search for people on the Internet.
example.tran: 你可以利用因特网的目录服务搜索人名。

collins.def: If you go in search of something or someone, you try to find them.

example.ex: Miserable, and unexpectedly lonely, she went in search of Jean-Paul...
example.tran: 内心痛苦、突感寂寞的她去寻找琼－保罗。

example.ex: The law already denies entry to people in search of better economic opportunities.
example.tran: 法律已经将那些逐寻更好商机的人们拒之门外。

collins.def: You say 'search me' when someone asks you a question and you want to emphasize that you do not know the answer.

example.ex: 'So why did he get interested all of a sudden?' — 'Search me.'
example.tran: “那他为什么突然感兴趣了？”——“我怎么知道。”

collins.def: Paint is a coloured liquid that you put onto a surface with a brush in order to protect the surface or to make it look nice, or that you use to produce a picture.

example.ex: ...a pot of red paint...
example.tran: 一罐红漆

example.ex: They saw some large letters in white paint.
example.tran: 他们看见了用白漆写的几个大大的字母。

collins.def: On a wall or object, the paint is the covering of dried paint on it.

example.ex: The paint was peeling on the window frames...
example.tran: 窗框上的油漆在剥落。

example.ex: They'll probably scrape the paint off and make it look like a regular patrol car.
example.tran: 他们可能会将油漆刮掉，使它看起来像一部普通的巡逻警车。

collins.def: If you paint a wall or an object, you cover it with paint.

example.ex: They started to mend the woodwork and paint the walls...
example.tran: 他们开始修补木建部分，粉刷墙壁。

example.ex: I made a guitar and painted it red.
example.tran: 我做了一把吉他，并把它漆成了红色。

collins.def: If you paint something or paint a picture of it, you produce a picture of it using paint.

example.ex: He is painting a huge volcano...
example.tran: 他正在画一座巨大的火山。

example.ex: Why do people paint pictures?...
example.tran: 人们为什么画画？

collins.def: When you paint a design or message on a surface, you put it on the surface using paint.

example.ex: ...a machine for painting white lines down roads...
example.tran: 用漆在马路上划白线的机器

example.ex: They went around painting rude slogans on cars...
example.tran: 他们到处在汽车上涂写粗鲁的标语。

collins.def: If a woman paints her lips or nails, she puts a coloured cosmetic on them.

example.ex: She propped the mirror against her handbag and began to paint her lips...
example.tran: 她把镜子靠在手包上支好，开始涂口红。

example.ex: She painted her fingernails bright red.
example.tran: 她把指甲涂成了亮红色。

collins.def: If you paint a grim or vivid picture of something, you give a description of it that is grim or vivid.

example.ex: The report paints a grim picture of life there...
example.tran: 那则报道把那里的生活描绘得很凄惨。

example.ex: He went on to paint a rosy picture about how much has already been accomplished.
example.tran: 他继续描绘着已经取得多大成就的美好画卷。

collins.def: Technology refers to methods, systems, and devices which are the result of scientific knowledge being used for practical purposes.

example.ex: Technology is changing fast...
example.tran: 科技日新月异。

example.ex: They should be allowed to wait for cheaper technologies to be developed.
example.tran: 应该允许他们等到更廉价的技术被开发出来。

means: [语法学]可能语气的，表示可能性的

collins.def: You use potential to say that someone or something is capable of developing into the particular kind of person or thing mentioned.

example.ex: The firm has identified 60 potential customers at home and abroad...
example.tran: 该公司已在国内外找到60个潜在客户。

example.ex: ...potential party members...
example.tran: 有可能发展成党员的人

collins.def: If you say that someone or something has potential, you mean that they have the necessary abilities or qualities to become successful or useful in the future.

example.ex: The boy has great potential...
example.tran: 这个男孩非常有潜质。

example.ex: The school strives to treat pupils as individuals and to help each one to achieve their full potential...
example.tran: 学校力求对每一个学生因材施教，帮助他们充分发挥其潜力。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something has potential for doing a particular thing, you mean that it is possible they may do it. If there is the potential for something, it may happen.

example.ex: John seemed as horrified as I about his potential for violence...
example.tran: 约翰似乎和我一样害怕他自己会使用暴力。

example.ex: The meeting has the potential to be a watershed event...
example.tran: 这次会议有可能成为具有转折性的事件。

collins.def: You use extra to describe an amount, person, or thing that is added to others of the same kind, or that can be added to others of the same kind.

example.ex: Police warned motorists to allow extra time to get to work...
example.tran: 警方告诫驾车者出门上班要留出富余时间。

example.ex: Extra staff have been taken on to cover busy periods...
example.tran: 额外雇用了一些员工来应付繁忙时期。

collins.tran: 费用另计的；额外收费的
collins.def: If something is extra, you have to pay more money for it in addition to what you are already paying for something.

example.ex: For foreign orders postage is extra...
example.tran: 国外订单邮费另计。

example.ex: The price of your meal is extra.
example.tran: 你的餐费另计。

collins.def: Extras are additional amounts of money that are added to the price that you have to pay for something.

example.ex: She is disgusted by big hotels adding so many extras to the bill that it nearly doubles...
example.tran: 她非常厌恶大酒店额外收取这么多费用，账单金额都快翻倍了。

example.ex: There are no hidden extras.
example.tran: 没有隐性的额外费用。

collins.def: Extras are things which are not necessary in a situation, activity, or object, but which make it more comfortable, useful, or enjoyable.

example.ex: Optional extras include cooking tuition at a top restaurant...
example.tran: 可选的额外项目包括在顶级餐厅学习厨艺。

example.ex: They are also spending much less on extras like meals in restaurants.
example.tran: 他们花在下馆子等额外消费上的钱也少多了。

collins.tran: （电影中的）临时演员，群众演员
collins.def: The extras in a film are the people who play unimportant parts, for example as members of a crowd.
You can use extra in front of adjectives and adverbs to emphasize the quality that they are describing.

example.ex: I'd have to be extra careful...
example.tran: 我不得不格外小心。

example.ex: What makes a magnificent garden extra special?...
example.tran: 是什么让华丽的花园格外特别？

collins.tran: 凉的;凉爽的;温度不高的
collins.def: Something that is cool has a temperature which is low but not very low.

example.ex: I felt a current of cool air...
example.tran: 我感觉到一阵凉风。

example.ex: The water was slightly cooler than a child's bath...
example.tran: 这水比小孩的洗澡水稍微凉一些。

collins.def: If it is cool, or if a place is cool, the temperature of the air is low but not very low.

example.ex: Thank goodness it's cool in here...
example.tran: 谢天谢地，这里面挺凉快。

example.ex: Store grains and cereals in a cool, dry place.
example.tran: 将粮食和谷物储存在阴凉干燥的地方。

collins.def: Clothing that is cool is made of thin material so that you do not become too hot in hot weather.

example.ex: In warm weather, you should wear clothing that is cool and comfortable.
example.tran: 在热天里，应该穿凉快舒适的衣服。

collins.def: Cool colours are light colours which give an impression of coolness.

example.ex: Choose a cool colour such as cream...
example.tran: 选择冷色系，比如乳白色。

example.ex: The drawing-room was a cool silver green.
example.tran: 客厅是冷色调的银绿色。

collins.def: When something cools or when you cool it, it becomes lower in temperature.

example.ex: Drain the meat and allow it to cool...
example.tran: 把肉沥干水，让它冷却。

example.ex: Huge fans will have to cool the concrete floor to keep it below 150 degrees.
example.tran: 必须用巨大的风扇来冷却混凝土地面，将其温度控制在150度以下。

collins.def: When a feeling or emotion cools, or when you cool it, it becomes less powerful.

example.ex: Within a few minutes tempers had cooled...
example.tran: 几分钟之内，火气就变小了。

example.ex: His weird behaviour had cooled her passion.
example.tran: 他奇怪的举动使得她的激情冷却。

collins.tran: (人、行为等)冷静的，沉着的，泰然自若的
collins.def: If you say that a person or their behaviour is cool, you mean that they are calm and unemotional, especially in a difficult situation.

example.ex: He was marvelously cool again, smiling as if nothing had happened...
example.tran: 他又变得出奇地冷静，微笑着，好像什么也没有发生过。

example.ex: At that, Reno lost her cool composure.
example.tran: 听了那句话，雷诺失去了冷静。

collins.tran: (人、行为等)冷漠的，冷淡的，不友善的
collins.def: If you say that a person or their behaviour is cool, you mean that they are unfriendly or not enthusiastic.

example.ex: I didn't like him at all. I thought he was cool, aloof, and arrogant...
example.tran: 我一点也不喜欢他，觉得他冷漠、孤僻而且傲慢。

example.ex: The idea met with a cool response...
example.tran: 人们对这个想法反应冷淡。

collins.tran: (人、行为等)酷的，时尚的，吸引人的
collins.def: If you say that a person or their behaviour is cool, you mean that they are fashionable and attractive.

example.ex: He was trying to be really cool and trendy.
example.tran: 他竭力想扮酷，赶时髦。

example.ex: ...some 15-year-old kid who thinks it's cool to do heroin.
example.tran: 认为吸食海洛因很酷的一个15岁的孩子

collins.tran: 坦然接受的;心平气和的
collins.def: If you say that someone is cool about something, you mean that they accept it and are not angry or upset about it.

example.ex: Bev was really cool about it all.
example.tran: 贝芙对这一切都表现得相当平静。

collins.tran: 非常好的;特别棒的;绝妙的
collins.def: If you say that something is cool, you think it is very good.

example.ex: Kathleen gave me a really cool dress.
example.tran: 凯瑟琳给了我一件非常漂亮的衣服。

collins.tran: (尤指轻易得到的数额)巨大的，整整
collins.def: You can use cool to emphasize that an amount or figure is very large, especially when it has been obtained easily.

example.ex: Columbia recently resigned the band for a cool $30 million.
example.tran: 哥伦比亚唱片公司最近以3,000万美元的高价再次签下这个乐队。

collins.def: If you tell someone to cool it, you want them to stop being angry and aggressive and to behave more calmly.

example.ex: Can't you guys just cool it?
example.tran: 你们能不能冷静一下？

collins.def: If you keep your cool in a difficult situation, you manage to remain calm. If you lose your cool, you get angry or upset.

example.ex: She kept her cool and managed to get herself out of the ordeal...
example.tran: 她保持着冷静与克制，努力使自己走出了这次痛苦的经历。

example.ex: The big Irishman was on the verge of losing his cool.
example.tran: 那个高大的爱尔兰人快要失去冷静了。

collins.def: If you play it cool, you deliberately behave in a calm, unemotional way because you do not want people to know you are enthusiastic or angry about something.

example.ex: It's ridiculous to play it cool if someone you're mad about is mad about you too.
example.tran: 如果让你生气的人也在生你的气，而你还要假装冷静，那就太可笑了。

collins.def: You say 'Sorry' or 'I'm sorry' as a way of apologizing to someone for something that you have done which has upset them or caused them difficulties, or when you bump into them accidentally.

example.ex: 'We're all talking at the same time.' — 'Yeah. Sorry.'...
example.tran: “我们俩在同时讲话。”——“噢，抱歉。”

example.ex: Sorry I took so long...
example.tran: 我耽误了这么长时间，真是对不起。

collins.tran: 遗憾的;难过的;抱歉的;失望的
collins.def: If you are sorry about a situation, you feel regret, sadness, or disappointment about it.

example.ex: She was very sorry about all the trouble she'd caused...
example.tran: 她为自己引起了那么多麻烦而感到非常抱歉。

example.ex: I'm  sorry about what's happened...
example.tran: 我为所发生的事情感到遗憾。

collins.tran: (用于告诉别人其不愿意听到的事时)对不起，抱歉，很遗憾
collins.def: You use I'm sorry or sorry as an introduction when you are telling a person something that you do not think they will want to hear, for example when you are disagreeing with them or giving them bad news.

example.ex: No, I'm sorry, I can't agree with you...
example.tran: 不，很抱歉，我不同意你的看法。

example.ex: 'I'm sorry,' he told the real estate agent, 'but we really must go now.'...
example.tran: “对不起，”他对房地产代理人说，“但现在我们真的必须走了。”

collins.tran: (表示威胁或警告)你会后悔的
collins.def: If someone says 'You'll be sorry', they are threatening you or warning you and suggesting that something unpleasant will happen to you because of your actions.

example.ex: I'll tell Daddy, and then you'll be sorry because he'll give you another black eye...
example.tran: 我会告诉爸爸，到时候有你好受的，因为爸爸会再揍你一顿。

example.ex: Get back in there, or you'll be sorry.
example.tran: 滚回那边去，否则你会后悔的。

collins.tran: 很遗憾，很抱歉(包含失望或不赞成)
collins.def: You use the expression I'm sorry to say to express regret together with disappointment or disapproval.

example.ex: I've only done half of it, I'm sorry to say...
example.tran: 很遗憾，我只完成了一半。

example.ex: This, I am sorry to say, is almost entirely wishful thinking.
example.tran: 我很遗憾，这几乎完全是一厢情愿的想法。

collins.tran: (用于听到伤心或不愉快的消息时)我深感遗憾，我很难过
collins.def: You say 'I'm sorry' to express your regret and sadness when you hear sad or unpleasant news.

example.ex: I've heard about Mollie — I'm so sorry...
example.tran: 我已经听说了莫莉的事情——我很难过。

example.ex: 'I'm afraid he's ill.' — 'I'm sorry to hear that.'
example.tran: “恐怕他生病了。”——“真是遗憾。”

collins.tran: (为别人的不幸或不快)感到难过的，表示同情的
collins.def: If you feel sorry for someone who is unhappy or in an unpleasant situation, you feel sympathy and sadness for them.

example.ex: I felt sorry for him and his colleagues — it must have been so frustrating for them...
example.tran: 我为他和他的同事们感到难过——这件事一定让他们感到非常沮丧。

example.ex: I am very sorry for the family.
example.tran: 我十分同情这家人。

collins.tran: (为自己的遭遇等)感到闷闷不乐，垂头丧气
collins.def: You say that someone is feeling sorry for themselves when you disapprove of the fact that they keep thinking unhappily about their problems, rather than trying to be cheerful and positive.

example.ex: What he must not do is to sit around at home feeling sorry for himself.
example.tran: 他万万不可宅在家里自艾自怜。

collins.tran: (用于请对方重复所说的话)没听清，请再说一遍
collins.def: You say 'Sorry?' when you have not heard something that someone has said and you want them to repeat it.

collins.tran: (用于纠正自己刚才说错的话)不对，抱歉
collins.def: You use sorry when you correct yourself and use different words to say what you have just said, especially when what you say the second time does not use the words you would normally choose to use.

example.ex: Barcelona will be hoping to bring the trophy back to Spain — sorry, Catalonia — for the first time.
example.tran: 巴塞罗那将有望首次把奖杯捧回西班牙——抱歉，是捧回加泰罗尼亚。

example.ex: ...refugees (sorry, economic migrants) who refuse to return to Vietnam.
example.tran: 拒绝回到越南的难民(抱歉，应该说是经济移民)

collins.def: If someone or something is in a sorry state, they are in a bad state, mentally or physically.

example.ex: The fire left Kuwait's oil industry in a sorry state...
example.tran: 这场大火使科威特的石油产业陷入悲惨的境地。

example.ex: She is a sorry sight...
example.tran: 她的样子看上去糟透了。

means: 不确定，不能肯定或怀疑

collins.def: If you have doubt or doubts about something, you feel uncertain about it and do not know whether it is true or possible. If you say you have no doubt about it, you mean that you are certain it is true.

example.ex: This raises doubts about the point of advertising...
example.tran: 这对做广告的意义提出了疑问。

example.ex: I had my doubts when she started, but she's getting really good...
example.tran: 她刚开始做时我心存疑虑，但她真的做得很好。

collins.tran: 不能肯定;认为…未必可能
collins.def: If you doubt whether something is true or possible, you believe that it is probably not true or possible.

example.ex: Others doubted whether that would happen...
example.tran: 其他人认为那未必会发生。

example.ex: He doubted if he would learn anything new from Marie...
example.tran: 他认为他不太可能从玛丽那儿学到任何新东西。

collins.def: If you doubt something, you believe that it might not be true or genuine.

example.ex: No one doubted his ability...
example.tran: 没有人怀疑他的能力。

example.ex: Nobody that I spoke to doubted his sincerity as a politician.
example.tran: 和我谈过话的人中没有一个怀疑他作为一个政治家的诚意。

collins.tran: 怀疑，不相信（某人或某人的话）
collins.def: If you doubt someone or doubt their word, you think that they may not be telling the truth.

example.ex: No one directly involved with the case doubted him...
example.tran: 与此案直接相关的人中没有人怀疑他。

example.ex: I still have no reason to doubt his word.
example.tran: 我还是没有理由怀疑他的话。

collins.def: You say that something is beyond doubt or beyond reasonable doubt when you are certain that it is true and it cannot be contradicted or disproved.

example.ex: A referendum showed beyond doubt that voters wanted independence...
example.tran: 全民公决无疑显示选民支持独立。

example.ex: His ability is beyond any doubt.
example.tran: 他的能力毋庸置疑。

collins.def: If you are in doubt about something, you feel unsure or uncertain about it.

example.ex: He is in no doubt as to what is needed...
example.tran: 他很确定需要什么。

example.ex: When in doubt, call the doctor.
example.tran: 如有疑问，请联系医生。

collins.def: You say I doubt it as a response to a question or statement about something that you think is untrue or unlikely.

example.ex: 'Somebody would have seen her.' — 'I doubt it, not on Monday.'
example.tran: “可能有人见过她。”——“我认为不可能，不可能在星期一。”

collins.tran: 可疑的;不确定的;不可靠的
collins.def: If you say that something is in doubt or open to doubt, you consider it to be uncertain or unreliable.

example.ex: The outcome was still in doubt...
example.tran: 结果仍不确定。

example.ex: That claim is increasingly open to doubt.
example.tran: 那一说法越来越可疑。

collins.def: You use no doubt to emphasize that something seems certain or very likely to you.

example.ex: The contract for this will no doubt be widely advertised...
example.tran: 关于这个的合约无疑会受到广泛宣传。

example.ex: She's a very sweet woman, as you no doubt know by now.
example.tran: 她是一个非常温柔的女人，你现在肯定知道了。

collins.def: You use no doubt to indicate that you accept the truth of a particular point, but that you do not consider it is important or contradicts the rest of what you are saying.

example.ex: No doubt I'm biased, but it was the most cruel, evil human face I ever set eyes on...
example.tran: 我固然是有偏见的，但那是我所见到的最残忍、最邪恶的人。

example.ex: No doubt many will regard these as harsh words, but regrettably they are true.
example.tran: 固然会有很多人认为这些话过于刻薄，但是遗憾的是这些都是真话。

collins.def: If you say that something is true without doubt or without a doubt, you are emphasizing that it is definitely true.

example.ex: Without doubt this was the most important relationship I developed at college...
example.tran: 这无疑是我在大学时期建立的最重要的关系了。

example.ex: The refugees, without a doubt, are the most vulnerable.
example.tran: 难民无疑是最易受到伤害的。

means: 宣称，断言( allege的过去式和过去分词)

collins.tran: 声称的；被断言的；涉嫌的
collins.def: An alleged fact has been stated but has not been proved to be true.

example.ex: They have begun a hunger strike in protest at the alleged beating.
example.tran: 他们开始绝食以抗议有人所宣称的殴打行为。

example.ex: ...a list of alleged war criminals.
example.tran: 战争嫌犯名单

collins.def: The eleventh item in a series is the one that you count as number eleven.

example.ex: We were working on the eleventh floor.
example.tran: 我们在11层办公。

collins.tran: 地球（指宇宙组成部分时用Earth，指人类居住的星球时用the Earth）
collins.def: Earth or the Earth is the planet on which we live. People usually say Earth when they are referring to the planet as part of the universe, and the Earth when they are talking about the planet as the place where we live.

example.ex: The space shuttle Atlantis returned safely to earth today. “
example.tran: 亚特兰蒂斯”号航天飞机今天安全返回地球。

example.ex: ...a fault in the Earth's crust.
example.tran: 地壳断层

collins.def: The earth is the land surface on which we live and move about.

example.ex: The earth shook and the walls of neighbouring houses fell around them.
example.tran: 地面摇晃，周围房屋的墙体在他们身边倒塌。

collins.def: Earth is the substance on the land surface of the earth, for example clay or sand, in which plants grow.

example.ex: The road winds for miles through parched earth, scrub and cactus...
example.tran: 公路蜿蜒数英里，穿过炙烤的大地、灌木丛和仙人掌。

example.ex: They will revert to tilling the earth in an old-fashioned way.
example.tran: 他们将回归到用老方法耕地。

collins.def: An earth is a hole in the ground in which an animal such as a fox lives.
The earth in an electric plug or piece of electrical equipment is the wire through which electricity can pass into the ground, which makes the equipment safe if something goes wrong with it.

example.ex: The earth wire was not connected.
example.tran: 地线没有接上。

collins.tran: （用于以how, why, what 或 where 开始的问句，表示强调，通常表示问题没有答案或很难回答）究竟，到底
collins.def: On earth is used for emphasis in questions that begin with words such as 'how', 'why', 'what', or 'where'. It is often used to suggest that there is no obvious or easy answer to the question being asked.

example.ex: How on earth did that happen?...
example.tran: 那件事到底怎么发生的？

example.ex: What on earth had Luke done?...
example.tran: 卢克究竟做了什么？

collins.tran: （用于否定名词短语后表强调）根本，完全
collins.def: On earth is used for emphasis after some negative noun groups, for example 'no reason'.

example.ex: There was no reason on earth why she couldn't have moved in with us...
example.tran: 她没能搬过来和我们同住，这根本就说不通。

example.ex: There is no feeling on earth like winning for the first time.
example.tran: 初尝胜利滋味的感觉真是无可比拟。

collins.tran: (用于包含形容词最高级的名词短语后表示强调)世界上，人世间
collins.def: On earth is used for emphasis after a noun group that contains a superlative adjective.

example.ex: He wanted to be the fastest man on earth.
example.tran: 他想成为世界上跑得最快的人。

example.ex: ...the site of the worst ecological disaster on earth.
example.tran: 世界上最严重的生态灾难发生地

collins.tran: （激动之后）恢复正常生活，回到现实
collins.def: If you come down to earth or back to earth, you have to face the reality of everyday life after a period of great excitement.

example.ex: When he came down to earth after his win he admitted: 'It was an amazing feeling'...
example.tran: 从胜利的喜悦中平复后，他承认：“当时感觉棒极了。”

example.ex: I was shocked, brought down to earth by this revelation.
example.tran: 真相的披露让我深感震惊，我被带回了现实。

collins.tran: （经过长时间的寻找后）终于找到
collins.def: If you run someone or something to earth, you find them after searching for them for a long time.

example.ex: She ran him to earth in the pub at five to one.
example.tran: 1点差5分的时候，她终于在酒馆里找到了他。

collins.def: If you say that something cost the earth or that you paid the earth for it, you are emphasizing that it cost a very large amount of money.

example.ex: It must have cost the earth.
example.tran: 这肯定花了很多钱。

collins.def: The driver of a vehicle is the person who is driving it.

example.ex: The driver got out of his van.
example.tran: 司机从货车上下来。

example.ex: ...a taxi driver.
example.tran: 出租车司机

collins.def: A driver is a computer program that controls a device such as a printer.

example.ex: ...printer driver software.
example.tran: 打印机驱动软件

collins.def: Joint means shared by or belonging to two or more people.

example.ex: She and Frank had never gotten around to opening a joint account...
example.tran: 她和弗兰克还没有抽出时间去开联名账户。

example.ex: Jackie and Ben came to a joint decision as to where they would live.
example.tran: 关于他们将住哪里是杰姬和本共同决定的。

collins.def: A joint is a part of your body such as your elbow or knee where two bones meet and are able to move together.

example.ex: Her joints ache if she exercises.
example.tran: 她一运动关节就疼。

collins.tran: 接合处；连接点；接头；接缝
collins.def: A joint is the place where two things are fastened or fixed together.
A joint is a fairly large piece of meat which is suitable for roasting.

example.ex: He carved the joint of beef.
example.tran: 他切开了那一大块烤牛肉。

collins.tran: 廉价娱乐场所；下等娱乐场所
collins.def: You can refer to a cheap place where people go for some form of entertainment as a joint .

example.ex: They had come to the world's most famous pick-up joint...
example.tran: 他们来到了全世界最有名的寻花问柳之地。

example.ex: ...a hamburger joint.
example.tran: 汉堡包店

collins.def: A joint is a cigarette which contains cannabis or marijuana.

collins.tran: （因感到无足轻重或不受重视）心烦意乱，感到不快
collins.def: If something puts someone's nose out of joint, it upsets or offends them because it makes them feel less important or less valued.

example.ex: Barry had his nose put out of joint by Lucy's aloof sophistication...
example.tran: 露西的冷淡与世故使得巴里十分不快。

example.ex: Her sister-in-law's nose is a little out of joint.
example.tran: 她嫂子有点儿心烦。

collins.tran: 不太正常；不得体；无秩序；紊乱
collins.def: If something is out of joint, it is not quite right or appropriate, or does not work quite as it should.

example.ex: There was something out of joint in the situation. Something was strange...
example.tran: 情况有点儿不太正常。有些事有点儿古怪。

example.ex: The electoral timetable seems to be out of joint with the need for change.
example.tran: 选举时间表似乎有些混乱，需要改动一下。

collins.def: A judge is the person in a court of law who decides how the law should be applied, for example how criminals should be punished.

example.ex: The judge adjourned the hearing until next Tuesday...
example.tran: 法官将听证会延至下周二。

example.ex: Judge Mr Justice Schiemann jailed him for life.
example.tran: 法官席曼先生判处他终身监禁。

collins.def: A judge is a person who decides who will be the winner of a competition.

example.ex: A panel of judges is now selecting the finalists.
example.tran: 评判小组现在正选拔参加决赛的选手。

collins.tran: 为（竞赛等）担任裁判；评定
collins.def: If you judge something such as a competition, you decide who or what is the winner.

example.ex: Colin Mitchell will judge the entries each week...
example.tran: 科林·米切尔负责每周对参赛作品进行评判。

example.ex: Entrants will be judged in two age categories: 5-10 years and 11-14 years...
example.tran: 参赛者将分成两个年龄段接受评判：5 至10岁和11至14岁。

collins.def: If you judge something or someone, you form an opinion about them after you have examined the evidence or thought carefully about them.

example.ex: It will take a few more years to judge the impact of these ideas...
example.tran: 要再花上几年的时间才能判断出这些想法的影响。

example.ex: I am ready to judge any book on its merits...
example.tran: 我愿意根据每本图书各自的优点来作出评价。

collins.tran: 估计，猜测（数量、大小、价值等）
collins.def: If you judge something, you guess its amount, size, or value or you guess what it is.

example.ex: It is important to judge the weight of your washing load correctly...
example.tran: 正确估计待洗衣物的重量很重要。

example.ex: I judged him to be about forty...
example.tran: 我估计他40岁上下。

collins.def: If someone is a good judge of something, they understand it and can make sensible decisions about it. If someone is a bad judge of something, they cannot do this.

example.ex: I'm a pretty good judge of character...
example.tran: 我很善于判断人的性格。

example.ex: It would appear that my sister is a poor judge of masculine charm.
example.tran: 看来我妹妹全然不懂得欣赏男性的魅力。

collins.def: You use judging by ,judging from, or to judge from to introduce the reasons why you believe or think something.

example.ex: Judging by the opinion polls, he seems to be succeeding...
example.tran: 从民意测验来看，他似乎胜券在握。

example.ex: Judging from the way he laughed as he told it, it was meant to be humorous...
example.tran: 从他讲这件事时笑的样子来看，那应该是很幽默的了。

collins.def: If you say that something is true as far as you can judge or so far as you can judge, you are assuming that it is true, although you do not know all the facts about it.

example.ex: They were typed records of his bets, going back a couple of years as far as I could judge...
example.tran: 据我判断，这些是他过去几年下注打赌的书面记录。

example.ex: The book, so far as I can judge, is remarkably accurate.
example.tran: 就我看来，这本书内容相当准确。

collins.def: If you lift something, you move it to another position, especially upwards.

example.ex: The Colonel lifted the phone and dialed his superior...
example.tran: 上校拿起电话，拨通了上司的号码。

example.ex: She lifted the last of her drink to her lips.
example.tran: 她将最后一点饮料送到唇边。

collins.tran: 抬起，举起（身体的一部分）
collins.def: If you lift a part of your body, you move it to a higher position.

example.ex: Amy lifted her arm to wave. 'Goodbye,' she called...
example.tran: 埃米举起胳膊挥挥手。“再见，”她喊道。

example.ex: She lifted her foot and squashed the wasp into the ground.
example.tran: 她抬起脚，把黄蜂踩扁。

collins.def: If you lift your eyes or your head, you look up, for example when you have been reading and someone comes into the room.

example.ex: When he finished he lifted his eyes and looked out the window.
example.tran: 他完成之后抬起眼睛往窗外看去。

collins.def: If people in authority lift a law or rule that prevents people from doing something, they end it.

example.ex: The European Commission has urged France to lift its ban on imports of British beef.
example.tran: 欧盟委员会敦促法国解除进口英国牛肉的禁令。

collins.def: If something lifts your spirits or your mood, or if they lift, you start feeling more cheerful.

example.ex: He used his incredible sense of humour to lift my spirits...
example.tran: 他用自己不可思议的幽默感逗我开心。

example.ex: A brisk walk in the fresh air can lift your mood and dissolve a winter depression...
example.tran: 在清新的空气中轻快地散散步，会让你心情愉快，一扫冬日的抑郁。

collins.def: If something gives you a lift, it gives you a feeling of greater confidence, energy, or enthusiasm.

example.ex: My selection for the team has given me a tremendous lift.
example.tran: 入选该队给了我极大的鼓舞。

collins.def: A lift is a device that carries people or goods up and down inside tall buildings.

example.ex: They took the lift to the fourth floor.
example.tran: 他们坐电梯到了五楼。

collins.def: If you give someone a lift somewhere, you take them there in your car as a favour to them.

example.ex: He had a car and often gave me a lift home.
example.tran: 他有车，经常让我搭他的车回家。

collins.tran: （尤指在战争中）空运（居民或货物）
collins.def: If a government or organization lifts people or goods in or out of an area, it transports them there by aircraft, especially when there is a war.

example.ex: The army lifted people off rooftops where they had climbed to escape the flooding...
example.tran: 军队空运转移了为躲避洪水而爬到房顶的群众。

example.ex: The helicopters are designed to quickly lift soldiers and equipment to the battlefield.
example.tran: 这些直升机是为将士兵和装备快速空运到战场上而设计的。

collins.def: To lift something means to increase its amount or to increase the level or the rate at which it happens.

example.ex: The bank lifted its basic home loans rate to 10.99% from 10.75%...
example.tran: 银行将基本房屋贷款利率从10.75%提高到10.99%。

example.ex: A barrage would halt the flow upstream and lift the water level.
example.tran: 一道拦河坝将会在上游拦住水流，抬升水位。

collins.def: If fog, cloud, or mist lifts, it reduces, for example by moving upwards or by becoming less thick.

example.ex: The fog had lifted and revealed a warm, sunny day.
example.tran: 雾已经散了，看来是温暖晴朗的一天。

collins.tran: 掘出，挖出，拔起（根菜或球茎）
collins.def: If you lift root vegetables or bulbs, you dig them out of the ground.

example.ex: Lift carrots on a dry day and pack them horizontally in boxes of damp sand.
example.tran: 晴天时把胡萝卜挖出来，平放在装有湿沙的盒子里。

collins.def: If you display something that you want people to see, you put it in a particular place, so that people can see it easily.

example.ex: Among the protesters and war veterans proudly displaying their medals was Aubrey Rose...
example.tran: 在抗议者和骄傲地展示勋章的退伍老兵中，就有奥布里·罗斯。

example.ex: The cabinets display seventeenth-century blue-and-white porcelain.
example.tran: 展柜中陈列着17世纪的青花瓷。

collins.def: If you display something, you show it to people.

example.ex: She displayed her wound to the twelve gentlemen of the jury...
example.tran: 她给陪审团的 12 位男士看了她的伤口。

example.ex: The chart can then display the links connecting these groups.
example.tran: 这张图就会显示出这些群体之间的关联。

collins.tran: 显示，显露，表现(特性或情感)
collins.def: If you display a characteristic, quality, or emotion, you behave in a way which shows that you have it.

example.ex: It was unlike Gordon to display his feelings...
example.tran: 戈登不太可能表露他的情感。

example.ex: He has displayed remarkable courage in his efforts to reform the party.
example.tran: 在政党改革中，他表现出了非凡的勇气。

collins.def: When a computer displays information, it shows it on a screen.

example.ex: They started out by looking at the computer screens which display the images...
example.tran: 他们开始在显示那些图像的电脑屏幕上寻找。

example.ex: Using the option to display only text speeds things up a lot.
example.tran: 选用纯文本显示可以使速度大幅提升。

collins.def: A display is an arrangement of things that have been put in a particular place, so that people can see them easily.

example.ex: ...a display of your work...
example.tran: 你的成果展示

example.ex: She was leaning against a display case of prints of Paris.
example.tran: 她正倚靠在一个展示巴黎照片的陈列柜上。

collins.def: A display is a public performance or other event which is intended to entertain people.

example.ex: ...the firework display.
example.tran: 烟火表演

example.ex: ...gymnastic displays.
example.tran: 体操表演

collins.tran: (计算机屏幕上的)显示，显像;显示器
collins.def: The display on a computer screen is the information that is shown there. The screen itself can also be referred to as the display .

example.ex: A hard copy of the screen display can also be obtained from a printer.
example.tran: 屏幕上显示的内容也可以通过打印机打印一份。

example.ex: ...obscure error messages appearing on the display.
example.tran: 显示器上出现的令人费解的错误信息

means: 聚集，联合（起来）（通常与together 连用）

collins.def: A band is a small group of musicians who play popular music such as jazz, rock, or pop.

example.ex: He was a drummer in a rock band...
example.tran: 他曾是一个摇滚乐团的鼓手。

example.ex: Local bands provide music for dancing.
example.tran: 当地的乐队为跳舞伴乐。

collins.tran: （演奏铜管和打击乐器的）乐队，乐团
collins.def: A band is a group of musicians who play brass and percussion instruments.

example.ex: Bands played German marches.
example.tran: 乐队演奏了德军进行曲。

collins.def: A band of people is a group of people who have joined together because they share an interest or belief.

example.ex: Bands of government soldiers, rebels and just plain criminals have been roaming some neighborhoods.
example.tran: 成群结队的政府军士兵、反叛分子和彻头彻尾的犯罪分子一直在一些街区游荡。

example.ex: ...a small but growing band of Japanese companies taking their first steps into American publishing.
example.tran: 数量不多、但仍在增长的一批初次涉足美国出版业的日本公司

collins.def: band is a flat, narrow strip of cloth which you wear round your head or wrists, or which forms part of a piece of clothing.

example.ex: Almost all hospitals use a wrist-band of some kind with your name and details on it.
example.tran: 几乎所有的医院都用某种腕带记录名字和详细信息。

collins.def: A band is a strip of something such as colour, light, land, or cloth which contrasts with the areas on either side of it.

example.ex: ...bands of natural vegetation between strips of crops...
example.tran: 农作物狭地之间的野生植被带

example.ex: A band of light glowed in the space between floor and door.
example.tran: 一束阳光透过地板和门之间的缝隙照了进来

collins.def: A band is a strip or loop of metal or other strong material which strengthens something, or which holds several things together.

example.ex: Surgeons placed a metal band around the knee cap to help it knit back together.
example.tran: 外科医生在膝盖骨上套了个金属箍以帮助其愈合。

example.ex: ...a strong band of flat muscle tissue.
example.tran: 一圈坚韧的扁平肌肉组织

collins.def: A band is a range of numbers or values within a system of measurement.

example.ex: For an initial service, a 10 megahertz-wide band of frequencies will be needed.
example.tran: 初始服务需要10兆赫宽的频带。

example.ex: ...a new tax band of 20p in the pound on the first £2,000 of taxable income.
example.tran: 对应税收入的头两千英镑每镑征收20便士的新税阶

collins.def: If something such as a tax is banded, it is divided into bands according to the value of the thing being taxed.

example.ex: They appear to rule out some of the ideas that have been mentioned — banding the tax so higher earners would pay more.
example.tran: 他们看来要剔除其中提到的一些想法——如把税率分档，使收入越高，缴得越多。

example.ex: ...a banding system based on property values...
example.tran: 基于财产价值的分级制

means: 展览艺术品的小陈列室
通常陈列于柜橱内的，可保存的

collins.def: A cabinet is a cupboard used for storing things such as medicine or alcoholic drinks or for displaying decorative things in.

example.ex: The star of my medicine cabinet is the humble aspirin...
example.tran: 我家药柜里的压箱宝要算是那不起眼的阿司匹林。

example.ex: He looked at the display cabinet with its gleaming sets of glasses.
example.tran: 他看着陈列柜,里面摆着几套晶莹剔透的玻璃杯。

collins.def: The Cabinet is a group of the most senior ministers in a government, who meet regularly to discuss policies.

example.ex: The announcement came after a three-hour Cabinet meeting in Downing Street.
example.tran: 在唐宁街进行了长达3个小时的内阁会议后发布了这份公告。

example.ex: ...a former Cabinet Minister.
example.tran: 前内阁大臣

means: 领…到教堂接受宗教仪式

collins.def: A church is a building in which Christians worship. You usually refer to this place as church when you are talking about the time that people spend there.

example.ex: ...one of Britain's most historic churches.
example.tran: 英国最古老的教堂之一

example.ex: ...St Helen's Church...
example.tran: 圣海伦教堂

collins.def: A Church is one of the groups of people within the Christian religion, for example Catholics or Methodists, that have their own beliefs, clergy, and forms of worship.

example.ex: ...co-operation with the Catholic Church...
example.tran: 和天主教派的合作

example.ex: Church leaders said he was welcome to return.
example.tran: 教会领袖说欢迎他回来。

collins.tran: 广纳众议的机构（或团体）；兼收并蓄的活动
collins.def: You can refer to an organization, group, or area of activity as a broad church when it includes a wide range of opinions, beliefs, or styles.

example.ex: The party has responded by trying to become a broad church that appeals to devout pensioners, Munich punks and aerospace engineers...
example.tran: 该党的反应是要努力成为一个吸引笃信宗教的退休者、慕尼黑朋客族和航天工程师的兼收并蓄的政党。

example.ex: It rapidly became apparent that rock'n'roll was a very broad church indeed.
example.tran: 摇滚乐实际无所不包，这一点很快就显而易见了。

means: 选中的，当选而尚未就职的

collins.def: When people elect someone, they choose that person to represent them, by voting for them.

example.ex: The people of the Philippines have voted to elect a new president...
example.tran: 菲律宾人民已投票选举出了一位新总统。

example.ex: Manchester College elected him Principal in 1956...
example.tran: 曼彻斯特学院于1956年推选他做院长。

collins.def: If you elect to do something, you choose to do it.

example.ex: Those electing to smoke will be seated at the rear.
example.tran: 那些想吸烟的人将坐在后排。

collins.tran: 已当选但未就任的;候任的
collins.def: Elect is added after words such as 'president' or 'governor' to indicate that a person has been elected to the post but has not officially started to carry out the duties involved.

example.ex: ...the date when the president-elect takes office.
example.tran: 候任总统就职日

means: 〈美俚〉自以为了不得的，骄傲的

collins.tran: 受喜爱的；受欢迎的；当红的
collins.def: Something that is popular is enjoyed or liked by a lot of people.

example.ex: This is the most popular ball game ever devised...
example.tran: 这是有史以来发明出的最受欢迎的球类运动。

example.ex: Chocolate sauce is always popular with youngsters.
example.tran: 巧克力酱总是深受年轻人的喜爱。

collins.def: Someone who is popular is liked by most people, or by most people in a particular group.

example.ex: He remained  the most popular politician in France...
example.tran: 他一直是法国最受人爱戴的政治家。

example.ex: He was not only talented but immensely popular with his colleagues.
example.tran: 他不仅才华横溢，而且深受同事的喜爱。

collins.tran: （报纸、电视节目、艺术形式等）通俗的，流行的，大众化的
collins.def: Popular newspapers, television programmes, or forms of art are aimed at ordinary people and not at experts or intellectuals.
