example.ex: Once again the popular press in Britain has been rife with stories about their marriage.
example.tran: 英国通俗报刊又一次对他们的婚姻进行了铺天盖地的报道。

example.ex: ...one of the classics of modern popular music.
example.tran: 现代流行音乐的经典之一

collins.def: Popular ideas, feelings, or attitudes are approved of or held by most people.

example.ex: Contrary to popular belief, the oil companies can't control the price of crude...
example.tran: 与人们普遍的看法相反，石油公司并不能控制原油价格。

example.ex: The military government has been unable to win popular support...
example.tran: 军政府一直未能赢得广泛的支持。

collins.def: Popular is used to describe political activities which involve the ordinary people of a country, and not just members of political parties.

example.ex: The late President Ferdinand Marcos was overthrown by a popular uprising in 1986.
example.tran: 已故总统费迪南德·马科斯于1986年被民众起义赶下了台。

collins.tran: 震惊;惊愕;令人震惊的事
collins.def: If you have a shock, something suddenly happens which is unpleasant, upsetting, or very surprising.

example.ex: The extent of the violence came as a shock...
example.tran: 暴力程度令人震惊。

example.ex: He has never recovered from the shock of your brother's death...
example.tran: 他从未从你哥哥去世的打击中恢复过来。

collins.def: Shock is a person's emotional and physical condition when something very frightening or upsetting has happened to them.

example.ex: The little boy was speechless with shock...
example.tran: 那小男孩惊得说不出话来。

example.ex: She's still in a state of shock.
example.tran: 她仍惊魂未定。

collins.def: If someone is in shock, they are suffering from a serious physical condition in which their blood is not flowing round their body properly, for example because they have had a bad injury.

example.ex: He was found beaten and in shock...
example.tran: 发现他被打得休克了。

example.ex: They escaped the blaze but were rushed to hospital suffering from shock.
example.tran: 他们逃离了火海,却因休克而被迅速送往医院。

collins.def: If something shocks you, it makes you feel very upset, because it involves death or suffering and because you had not expected it.

example.ex: After forty years in the police force nothing much shocks me...
example.tran: 在警队呆了 40 年后，我对什么都见怪不怪了。

example.ex: Relief workers were shocked by what they saw.
example.tran: 救援人员被眼前的景象惊呆了。

collins.tran: (因行为粗鲁或不道德而)使不快，使气愤，使厌恶，使反感
collins.def: If someone or something shocks you, it upsets or offends you because you think it is rude or morally wrong.

example.ex: You can't shock me...
example.tran: 我不会被你激怒的。

example.ex: They were easily shocked in those days...
example.tran: 在那个年代，他们动不动就对一些事情看不顺眼。

collins.tran: (通告、事件等)令人惊愕的，令人震惊的
collins.def: A shock announcement or event is one which shocks people because it is unexpected.

example.ex: ...the shock announcement that she is to resign.
example.tran: 她将要辞职的惊人声明

example.ex: ...a shock defeat.
example.tran: 令人震惊的落败

collins.tran: (对经济、传统、生活方式的)冲击，撞击
collins.def: A shock is something sudden and unexpected that threatens the economy, traditions, or way of life of a group of people.

example.ex: This is the latest in a series of shocks to the Scandinavian banking system.
example.tran: 这是一系列对斯堪的纳维亚银行系统的冲击中最近的一次。

example.ex: ...the economic pain of two oil shocks.
example.tran: 两次原油冲击下的经济萧条

collins.def: A shock is the force of something suddenly hitting or pulling something else.

example.ex: Steel barriers can bend and absorb the shock.
example.tran: 钢制栅栏可以弯曲并能吸收冲击力。

collins.def: A shock is the same as an electric shock .
A shock is a shock absorber .

example.ex: Do you think I need new shocks?
example.tran: 你认为我需要换新的减震器吗？

collins.def: A shock of hair is a very thick mass of hair on a person's head.

example.ex: ...a very old priest with a shock of white hair.
example.tran: 满头白发、年事已高的神父

collins.def: A short, sharp shock is a punishment that is fairly harsh and severe but only lasts for a short time.
When someone makes an appearance at a public event or in a broadcast, they take part in it.

example.ex: It was the president's second public appearance to date...
example.tran: 这是总统到那时为止的第二次公开露面。

example.ex: Keegan made 68 appearances in two seasons for Southampton, scoring 37 times.
example.tran: 基冈为南安普敦队踢了两个赛季，共上场68次，进球37个。

collins.def: Someone's or something's appearance is the way that they look.

example.ex: She used to be so fussy about her appearance...
example.tran: 她过去非常在意自己的容貌。

example.ex: He had the appearance of a college student...
example.tran: 他的模样就像个大学生。

collins.def: The appearance of someone or something in a place is their arrival there, especially when it is unexpected.

example.ex: The sudden appearance of a few bags of rice could start a riot.
example.tran: 突然出现几袋大米可能会引起骚乱。

example.ex: ...last Christmas, when there'd been the welcome appearance of Cousin Fred.
example.tran: 去年圣诞，堂兄弗雷德的现身受到热烈欢迎。

collins.def: The appearance of something new is its coming into existence or use.

example.ex: Flowering plants were making their first appearance, but were still a rarity...
example.tran: 显花植物开始出现了，但仍然很少。

example.ex: Fears are growing of a cholera outbreak following the appearance of a number of cases in the city.
example.tran: 该市出现几起霍乱病例之后，人们对霍乱爆发的恐惧越来越强烈。

collins.def: If something has the appearance of a quality, it seems to have that quality.

example.ex: We tried to meet both children's needs without the appearance of favoritism or unfairness...
example.tran: 我们尽力对两个孩子的需要都予以满足，而不显得有所偏向或袒护。

example.ex: The US president risked giving the appearance that the US was taking sides.
example.tran: 美国总统冒险作出美国正在摆明立场的姿态。

collins.def: If something is true to all appearances ,from all appearances, or by all appearances, it seems from what you observe or know about it that it is true.

example.ex: He was a small and to all appearances an unassuming man.
example.tran: 他个子小，看上去不事张扬。

collins.tran: 装样子；撑场面；打肿脸充胖子
collins.def: If you keep up appearances, you try to behave and dress in a way that people expect of you, even if you can no longer afford it.

example.ex: His parents' obsession with keeping up appearances haunted his childhood.
example.tran: 父母过于爱面子的做法在他儿时一直困扰着他。

collins.tran: 露一下面;到场稍作停留
collins.def: If you put in an appearance at an event, you go to it for a short time although you may not really want to, but do not stay.

example.ex: You must put in an appearance, at least, or she'll think you're avoiding her.
example.tran: 至少，你必须露一下面，否则她会认为你在躲避她。

collins.def: If you are aware of something, you know about it.

example.ex: Smokers are well aware of the dangers to their own health...
example.tran: 吸烟的人都知道吸烟对自身健康的危害。

example.ex: He should have been aware of what his junior officers were doing...
example.tran: 他本应该清楚自己下级们的所作所为。

collins.tran: 注意到的；察觉到的；意识到的
collins.def: If you are aware of something, you realize that it is present or is happening because you hear it, see it, smell it, or feel it.

example.ex: She was acutely aware of the noise of the city...
example.tran: 她对城市噪音很敏感。

example.ex: Jane was suddenly aware that she was digging her nails into her thigh.
example.tran: 简突然间意识到她正在用指甲抠大腿。

collins.def: Someone who is aware notices what is happening around them or happening in the place where they live.

example.ex: They are politically very aware.
example.tran: 他们政治上非常警觉。

collins.def: Violence is behaviour which is intended to hurt, injure, or kill people.

example.ex: Twenty people were killed in the violence...
example.tran: 有20人在这一暴力事件中丧生。

example.ex: They threaten them with violence.
example.tran: 他们对其进行暴力威胁。

collins.def: If you do or say something with violence, you use a lot of force and energy in doing or saying it, often because you are angry.

example.ex: 'There's no need,' Amy said, with sudden violence...
example.tran: “没有必要，”埃米突然激愤地说。

example.ex: The violence in her tone gave Alistair a shock.
example.tran: 她语气之强烈令阿利斯泰尔深感震惊。

collins.def: A feature of something is an interesting or important part or characteristic of it.

example.ex: Patriotic songs have long been a feature of Kuwaiti life...
example.tran: 爱国歌曲长期以来一直是科威特生活的一个特色。

example.ex: The spacious gardens are a special feature of this property...
example.tran: 大花园是这处房产的特色。

collins.def: Your features are your eyes, nose, mouth, and other parts of your face.

example.ex: His features seemed to change...
example.tran: 他的容貌似乎有所改变。

example.ex: Her features were strongly defined.
example.tran: 她的五官轮廓分明。

collins.tran: 由…主演;以…为主要内容;重点介绍
collins.def: When something such as a film or exhibition features a particular person or thing, they are an important part of it.

example.ex: It's a great movie and it features a Spanish actor who is going to be a world star within a year...
example.tran: 这是一部精彩的影片，主演是一位西班牙演员，他不出一年就会成为国际巨星。

example.ex: The hour-long programme will be updated each week and feature highlights from recent games...
example.tran: 这个时长一小时的节目将每周更新，重点介绍最近比赛的精彩片断。

collins.tran: 出演重头戏;担任主演;(在展览、杂志中)为重点推出的部分
collins.def: If someone or something features in something such as a show, exhibition, or magazine, they are an important part of it.

example.ex: Jon featured in one of the show's most thrilling episodes.
example.tran: 乔恩主演剧中最引人入胜的剧集之一。

collins.tran: (报刊或杂志的)特写，专题;(电台或电视台的)特别节目
collins.def: A feature is a special article in a newspaper or magazine, or a special programme on radio or television.

example.ex: We are delighted to see the Sunday Times running a long feature on breast cancer.
example.tran: 我们高兴地看到《星期天时报》发表了有关乳腺癌的长篇专题文章。

example.ex: ...a special feature on the fund-raising project.
example.tran: 有关集资项目的专题报道

collins.def: A feature or a feature film or movie is a full-length film about a fictional situation, as opposed to a short film or a documentary.

example.ex: ...the first feature-length cartoon, Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs.
example.tran: 第一部卡通长片《白雪公主和七个小矮人》

collins.tran: 地理特征;地形地物;地貌
collins.def: A geographical feature is something noticeable in a particular area of country, for example a hill, river, or valley.
If you use something, you do something with it in order to do a job or to achieve a particular result or effect.

example.ex: Trim off the excess pastry using a sharp knife...
example.tran: 用一把快刀切去多余的饼皮。

example.ex: He had simply used a little imagination...
example.tran: 他只不过是用了一点点想象力。

collins.def: If you use a supply of something, you finish it so that none of it is left.

example.ex: You used all the ice cubes and didn't put the ice trays back...
example.tran: 你把所有的冰块都用完了，又不把冰格放回去。

example.ex: They've never had anything spare — they've always used it all.
example.tran: 他们从没有任何备用的东西——他们总是把什么都用得一干二净。

collins.def: If someone uses drugs, they take drugs regularly, especially illegal ones.

example.ex: He denied he had used drugs...
example.tran: 他否认自己吸过毒。

example.ex: You'll find that most people that don't use heroin don't like people that do.
example.tran: 你会发现绝大多数不吸海洛因的人都不喜欢吸食者。

collins.tran: 用（洗手间或卫生间）（礼貌说法）
collins.def: You can say that someone uses the toilet or bathroom as a polite way of saying that they go to the toilet.

example.ex: Wash your hands after using the toilet...
example.tran: 便后要洗手。

example.ex: He asked whether he could use my bathroom.
example.tran: 他问是否可以用我的卫生间。

collins.def: If you use a particular word or expression, you say or write it, because it has the meaning that you want to express.

example.ex: The judge liked using the word 'wicked' of people he had sent to jail...
example.tran: 这个法官喜欢使用“邪恶”一词来形容被他判罪入狱的人。

example.ex: When Johnson talks about cuts, he uses words like 'target price' and 'efficiency payments'.
example.tran: 约翰逊谈起降价时，会使用“目标价位”和“效率支付”之类的字眼。

collins.def: If you use a particular name, you call yourself by that name, especially when it is not the name that you usually call yourself.

example.ex: Now I use a false name if I'm meeting people for the first time...
example.tran: 现在和初次见面的人交往时我会用假名。

example.ex: I didn't want to use my married name because we've split.
example.tran: 我不想用我的夫姓，因为我们已经离婚了。

collins.def: If you say that someone uses people, you disapprove of them because they make others do things for them in order to benefit or gain some advantage from it, and not because they care about the other people.

example.ex: Be careful she's not just using you...
example.tran: 当心她不只是在利用你。

example.ex: Why do I have the feeling I'm being used again?
example.tran: 为什么我感觉又被利用了？

collins.def: A critical time, factor, or situation is extremely important.

example.ex: The incident happened at a critical point in the campaign...
example.tran: 该事件发生在竞选活动的关键时期。

example.ex: Environmentalists say a critical factor in the city's pollution is its population...
example.tran: 环境保护主义者说造成该城市污染问题的一个关键因素是其人口数量。

collins.def: A critical situation is very serious and dangerous.

example.ex: The German authorities are considering an airlift if the situation becomes critical...
example.tran: 如果局势变得危急，德国当局将考虑实施空运。

example.ex: Its day-to-day finances are in a critical state.
example.tran: 其日常财务状况十分糟糕。

collins.def: If a person is critical or in a critical condition in hospital, they are seriously ill.

example.ex: Ten of the injured are said to be in critical condition.
example.tran: 据说伤者中有10人情况危急。

collins.def: To be critical of someone or something means to criticize them.

example.ex: His report is highly critical of the trial judge...
example.tran: 他在报告中对主审法官有颇多批评。

example.ex: ...a few dozen intellectuals who've been critical of the regime...
example.tran: 几十名一直批判该政权的知识分子

collins.def: A critical approach to something involves examining and judging it carefully.

example.ex: We need to become critical text-readers...
example.tran: 我们需要培养对文章的评判能力。

example.ex: Marx's work was more than a critical study of capitalist production.
example.tran: 马克思的著作不仅仅是对资本主义生产的批判性研究。

collins.def: If something or someone receives critical acclaim, critics say that they are very good.

example.ex: The film met with considerable critical and public acclaim...
example.tran: 该影片受到了影评人和公众的高度评价。

example.ex: The show was also a resounding critical success.
example.tran: 这次演出同样好评如潮。

collins.def: A farm is an area of land, together with the buildings on it, that is used for growing crops or raising animals, usually in order to sell them.

example.ex: Farms in France are much smaller than those in the United States or even Britain.
example.tran: 法国的农场比美国甚至是英国的农场都要小很多。

collins.def: If you farm an area of land, you grow crops or keep animals on it.

example.ex: They farmed some of the best land in Scotland...
example.tran: 他们耕种着苏格兰最好的一部分土地。

example.ex: He has lived and farmed in the area for 46 years.
example.tran: 他已在此地生活耕作了 46 年。

collins.def: A mink farm or a fish farm, for example, is a place where a particular kind of animal or fish is bred and kept in large quantities in order to be sold.

example.ex: ...trout fresh from a local trout farm.
example.tran: 刚刚从当地鲑鱼养殖场捕捞的新鲜鲑鱼

collins.tran: (用在疑问句中，与I和we连用表示提出或征求意见)
collins.def: You use shall with 'I' and 'we' in questions in order to make offers or suggestions, or to ask for advice.

example.ex: Shall I get the keys?...
example.tran: 我去拿钥匙好吗？

example.ex: I bought some lovely raisin buns at the bakery. Shall I bring you one with some tea?...
example.tran: 我在面包店里买了些很好吃的葡萄干圆面包，要不要我给你拿一个，再来点儿茶？

collins.tran: (通常与 I 和 we 连用)将要，将会
collins.def: You use shall, usually with 'I' and 'we', when you are referring to something that you intend to do, or when you are referring to something that you are sure will happen to you in the future.

example.ex: We shall be landing in Paris in sixteen minutes, exactly on time...
example.tran: 我们将于 16 分钟后准时在巴黎降落。

example.ex: I shall sail out on the twenty-second...
example.tran: 我将于 22 日启航。

collins.tran: (与I和we连用，在演讲或文章中用于引出将要讨论或解释的内容)后面要，下文会
collins.def: You use shall with 'I' or 'we' during a speech or piece of writing to say what you are going to discuss or explain later.

example.ex: In Chapter 3, I shall describe some of the documentation that I gathered...
example.tran: 在第三章，我会介绍我收集到的一些文献记录。

example.ex: We shall refer here to three significant trends that arose in the previous decade...
example.tran: 这里我们将提及过去 10 年中出现的 3 个显著趋势。

collins.tran: (通常指按照规则或法律规定)必须，一定，将
collins.def: You use shall to indicate that something must happen, usually because of a rule or law. You use shall not to indicate that something must not happen.

example.ex: The president shall hold office for five years...
example.tran: 总统将任职 5 年。

example.ex: The Security Council shall decide what measures shall be taken to restore peace and security...
example.tran: 安理会将决定采取何种措施来恢复和平与安全。

collins.tran: (通常与 you 连用)可以，能够
collins.def: You use shall, usually with 'you', when you are telling someone that they will be able to do or have something they want.

example.ex: Very well, if you want to go, go you shall...
example.tran: 好吧，如果你想走，就走吧。

example.ex: 'I want to hear all the gossip, all the scandal.' — 'You shall, dearie, you shall!'
example.tran: “把所有的八卦，所有的丑闻都告诉我吧。”——“好的，亲爱的，好的。”

collins.tran: (用于 look forward to 和 hope 之类的动词前表示语气的委婉)
collins.def: You use shall with verbs such as 'look forward to' and 'hope' to say politely that you are looking forward to something or hoping to do something.

example.ex: Well, we shall look forward to seeing him tomorrow...
example.tran: 嗯，我们期待着明天与他会面。

example.ex: I shall hope to see you in my office, young lady, and we'll review your portfolio.
example.tran: 希望你能到我办公室来，小姐，我们将审查一下你的资料。

collins.tran: (表示可能的结果或后果)应该，就会
collins.def: You use shall when you are referring to the likely result or consequence of a particular action or situation.

example.ex: When big City firms cut down on their entertainments, we shall know that times really are hard...
example.tran: 当伦敦商业区的大公司削减他们的娱乐活动开支，我们就知道世道真的变得艰难了。

example.ex: This is our last chance and we shall need to take it if we are to compete and survive.
example.tran: 这是我们最后的机会，如果我们想要竞争并存活下来的话，就一定要抓住这次机会。

means: （个人）环境的，由个人环境产生的，周围的

collins.tran: 自然环境保护的;生态环境保护的；环保的
collins.def: Environmental means concerned with the protection of the natural world of land, sea, air, plants, and animals.

example.ex: ...economic and environmental legislation.
example.tran: 经济和生态环境保护法规

example.ex: ...the environmental claims being made for some products...
example.tran: 要求一些产品注重保护生态环境的主张

collins.tran: 与周围环境有关的;由生存环境引起的
collins.def: Environmental means relating to or caused by the surroundings in which someone lives or something exists.

example.ex: It protects against environmental hazards such as wind and sun...
example.tran: 它可以保护免受风、太阳等环境因素的危害。

example.ex: The form the human family takes is a response to environmental pressures.
example.tran: 人类的家庭形式是为了应对来自生存环境的压力。

means: （报刊上的）人事栏，分类人事广告版

collins.def: A personal opinion, quality, or thing belongs or relates to one particular person rather than to other people.

example.ex: He learned this lesson the hard way — from his own personal experience...
example.tran: 吃一堑长一智，他这个教训来之不易——是从他自己的亲身经历中得来的。

example.ex: That's my personal opinion.
example.tran: 那是我的个人观点。

collins.def: If you give something your personal care or attention, you deal with it yourself rather than letting someone else deal with it.

example.ex: ...a business that requires a great deal of personal contact.
example.tran: 经常需要本人亲自联系、打理的生意

example.ex: ...a personal letter from the President's secretary...
example.tran: 总统秘书亲自寄出的信

collins.tran: （感情、关系、健康方面）个人的，人际的，自己的
collins.def: Personal matters relate to your feelings, relationships, and health.

example.ex: ...teaching young people about marriage and personal relationships...
example.tran: 教导年轻人有关婚姻和人际关系方面的事情

example.ex: You never allow personal problems to affect your performance...
example.tran: 绝不要让个人问题影响你的表现。

collins.tran: 针对个人的；人身攻击的
collins.def: Personal comments refer to someone's appearance or character in an offensive way.

example.ex: Newspapers resorted to personal abuse...
example.tran: 报纸采取了人身攻击的手段。

example.ex: Myra was attacking something I'd written, and her attack got a little personal.
example.tran: 迈拉批评我写的东西，她的批评多少有些人身攻击的味道。

collins.def: Personal care involves looking after your body and appearance.

example.ex: ...men who take as much trouble over personal hygiene as women.
example.tran: 像女人一样不嫌麻烦打理个人卫生的男人

collins.def: A personal relationship is one that is not connected with your job or public life.

example.ex: He was a personal friend whom I've known for many many years...
example.tran: 他是一位我认识多年的私人朋友。

example.ex: What began as a professional relationship became a personal one pretty quickly, despite us coming from very different backgrounds.
example.tran: 尽管我们各自背景不同，但我们还是很快从工作关系发展成了私下的好朋友。

collins.tran: 居住，使用（建筑物或某地）
collins.def: The people who occupy a building or a place are the people who live or work there.

example.ex: There were over 40 tenants, all occupying one wing of the hospital...
example.tran: 共有40多位房客，他们全部住在这家医院的一个病区。

example.ex: Land is, in most instances, purchased by those who occupy it.
example.tran: 在大多数情况下，土地都是由其使用者购得。

collins.def: If a room or something such as a seat is occupied, someone is using it, so that it is not available for anyone else.

example.ex: The hospital bed is no longer occupied by his wife...
example.tran: 他的妻子不在这张病床上了。

example.ex: I saw three camp beds, two of which were occupied.
example.tran: 我看见了3张折叠床，其中两张已有人占了。

collins.def: If a group of people or an army occupies a place or country, they move into it, using force in order to gain control of it.

example.ex: U.S. forces now occupy a part of the country...
example.tran: 美国军队现在占领了该国的一部分。

example.ex: Alexandretta had been occupied by the French in 1918 after the defeat of Turkey.
example.tran: 土耳其溃败之后，亚历山大勒塔在1918年被法国人占领。

collins.def: If someone or something occupies a particular place in a system, process, or plan, they have that place.

example.ex: We occupy a quality position in the market place...
example.tran: 我们在市场上居于高端地位。

example.ex: Men still occupy more positions of power than women.
example.tran: 担任要职的男性仍然比女性多。

collins.def: If something occupies you, or if you occupy yourself, your time, or your mind with it, you are busy doing that thing or thinking about it.

example.ex: Her parliamentary career has occupied all of her time...
example.tran: 她整日忙于议会的工作。

example.ex: He hurried to take the suitcases and occupy himself with packing the car...
example.tran: 他急匆匆地去拎手提箱，忙着往车里装。

collins.tran: 使从事；使关注；使花费时间
collins.def: If something occupies you, it requires your efforts, attention, or time.

example.ex: I had other matters to occupy me, during the day at least...
example.tran: 至少白天我还有别的事情要做。

example.ex: This challenge will occupy Europe for a generation or more.
example.tran: 这将是欧洲在未来二三十年或者更长的时间里所要面临的挑战。

collins.def: If something occupies a particular area or place, it fills or covers it, or exists there.

example.ex: Even quite small aircraft occupy a lot of space...
example.tran: 哪怕很小的飞机也要占很大的空间。

example.ex: Bookshelves occupied most of the living room walls.
example.tran: 这些书架占了起居室的大部分墙面。

collins.def: If something such as a journey occupies a particular period of time, it takes that amount of time to complete.

example.ex: She reached Karachi on Monday evening, the journey having occupied three days and nine hours.
example.tran: 她在星期一晚上抵达了卡拉奇，这段行程耗时3天9小时。

collins.def: Dinner is the main meal of the day, usually served in the early part of the evening.

example.ex: She invited us to her house for dinner...
example.tran: 她请我们去她家吃晚餐。

example.ex: Would you like to stay and have dinner?...
example.tran: 你留下来一起吃饭好吗？

collins.def: Any meal you eat in the middle of the day can be referred to as dinner .
A dinner is a formal social event at which a meal is served. It is held in the evening.

example.ex: ...a series of official lunches and dinners...
example.tran: 一系列的正式午餐和晚宴

example.ex: The Professional Cricketers' Association held its annual dinner in London.
example.tran: 职业板球运动员协会在伦敦举办了自己的年度宴会。

collins.def: You use civil to describe events that happen within a country and that involve the different groups of people in it.

example.ex: ...civil unrest.
example.tran: 国内骚乱

collins.tran: 民用的;平民的;非军事的
collins.def: You use civil to describe people or things in a country that are not connected with its armed forces.

example.ex: ...the US civil aviation industry.
example.tran: 美国民用航空业

collins.tran: 政府的；国家的;世俗的;非宗教的
collins.def: You use civil to describe things that are connected with the state rather than with a religion.

example.ex: They were married on August 9 in a civil ceremony in Venice.
example.tran: 他们于8月9号在威尼斯举行了世俗婚礼。

example.ex: ...Jewish civil and religious law.
example.tran: 犹太民法和宗教法

collins.def: You use civil to describe the rights that people have within a society.

example.ex: ...a United Nations covenant on civil and political rights.
example.tran: 联合国公民和政治权利公约

collins.tran: 彬彬有礼的;斯文的;客气的
collins.def: Someone who is civil is polite in a formal way, but not particularly friendly.

example.ex: As visitors, the least we can do is be civil to the people in their own land.
example.tran: 作为来访者，我们最起码能做到的就是对当地人要彬彬有礼。

collins.def: If someone prints something such as a book or newspaper, they produce it in large quantities using a machine.

example.ex: He started to print his own posters to distribute abroad...
example.tran: 他开始印刷自己的海报并发往国外。

example.ex: The Slovene bank has printed a specimen bank note...
example.tran: 斯洛文尼亚银行已经印刷了纸币票样。

collins.tran: （在报纸、杂志上）刊印，刊登，发表
collins.def: If a newspaper or magazine prints a piece of writing, it includes it or publishes it.

example.ex: We can only print letters which are accompanied by the writer's name and address.
example.tran: 我们只能刊登附有作者姓名和地址的信件。

example.ex: ...a questionnaire printed in the magazine recently.
example.tran: 最近在杂志上刊登的一份调查问卷

collins.tran: 印（数字、字母或图案）；印染
collins.def: If numbers, letters, or designs are printed on a surface, they are put on it in ink or dye using a machine. You can also say that a surface is printed with numbers, letters, or designs.

example.ex: ...the number printed on the receipt...
example.tran: 印在发票上的数字

example.ex: The company has for some time printed its phone number on its products...
example.tran: 有一段时间，公司把电话号码印在产品上。

collins.tran: 印花织物；印刷品；印花；印制图案
collins.def: A print is a piece of clothing or material with a pattern printed on it. You can also refer to the pattern itself as a print .

example.ex: Her mother wore one of her dark summer prints...
example.tran: 她妈妈穿着一件深色印花夏装。

example.ex: In this living room we've mixed glorious floral prints.
example.tran: 在这间客厅，我们粘贴了各种美丽的印花纸。

collins.def: When you print a photograph, you produce it from a negative.

example.ex: Printing a black-and-white negative on to colour paper produces a similar monochrome effect...
example.tran: 将一张黑白底片冲印到彩色相纸上会产生相似的单色效果。

example.ex: I selected two negatives to print from.
example.tran: 我选了两张底片进行冲印。

collins.def: A print is a photograph from a film that has been developed.

example.ex: ...black and white prints of Margaret and Jean as children.
example.tran: 玛格丽特和吉恩小时候的黑白照片

example.ex: ...35mm colour print films.
example.tran: 35毫米的彩色胶片

collins.def: A print of a cinema film is a particular copy or set of copies of it.

example.ex: First released in 1957, the movie now appears in a new print.
example.tran: 1957年首次上映后，这部影片现在有了新的拷贝。

collins.def: A print is one of a number of copies of a particular picture. It can be either a photograph, something such as a painting, or a picture made by an artist who puts ink on a prepared surface and presses it against paper.

example.ex: ...William Hogarth's famous series of prints.
example.tran: 威廉·霍加斯著名的版画系列

collins.tran: 印出的字； 印刷字体
collins.def: Print is used to refer to letters and numbers as they appear on the pages of a book, newspaper, or printed document.

example.ex: ...columns of tiny print...
example.tran: 一栏栏极小的印刷字

example.ex: Laser printers give high quality print.
example.tran: 激光打印机的打印质量很好。

collins.def: The print media consists of newspapers and magazines, but not television or radio.

example.ex: I have been convinced that the print media are more accurate and more reliable than television.
example.tran: 我已经确信印刷媒体比电视更准确、更可靠。

example.ex: ...print journalists.
example.tran: 报刊业记者

collins.def: If you print words, you write in letters that are not joined together and that look like the letters in a book or newspaper.

example.ex: Print your name and address on a postcard and send it to us.
example.tran: 在明信片上用印刷体写上你的名字和地址，然后邮寄给我们。

collins.def: You can refer to a mark left by someone's foot as a print .

example.ex: He crawled from print to print, sniffing at the earth, following the scent left in the tracks.
example.tran: 它沿着脚印向前爬，在地面上嗅着，追踪着路上留下的气味。

example.ex: ...boot prints.
example.tran: 靴印

collins.def: You can refer to invisible marks left by someone's fingers as their prints .

example.ex: Fresh prints of both girls were found in the flat.
example.tran: 在公寓里发现了两个女孩不久前留下的指纹。

collins.def: If you appear in print, or get into print, what you say or write is published in a book, newspaper, or magazine.

example.ex: Many of these poets appeared in print only long after their deaths...
example.tran: 这些诗人中有很多都是在去世很久以后作品才得以发表的。

example.ex: There was no immediate prospect of the diaries getting into print.
example.tran: 这些日记近期不会发表。

collins.def: If a book is in print, copies of it are still being produced.

example.ex: Many of their books have been in print for nearly 40 years.
example.tran: 他们的很多书都印行将近40年了。

collins.def: If a book is out of print, copies of it are no longer being produced.

example.ex: I believe the book is now out of print, but it can easily be borrowed from libraries.
example.tran: 我想这本书现在已经停印了，但从图书馆很容易借到。

collins.tran: （广告、合同等的）细节，附属细则，小号字体印刷条款
collins.def: The small print or the fine print of something such as an advertisement or a contract consists of the technical details and legal conditions, which are often printed in much smaller letters than the rest of the text.

example.ex: I'm looking at the small print; I don't want to sign anything that I shouldn't sign...
example.tran: 我正在看附属细则，我可不想签署任何不应该签署的东西。

example.ex: This might be a good time for Button's management to study the fine print of his contract.
example.tran: 这可能是巴顿的管理人员研读他的合同细则的好时机。

collins.def: The  character of a person or place consists of all the qualities they have that make them distinct from other people or places.

example.ex: Perhaps there is a negative side to his character that you haven't seen yet...
example.tran: 或许，他性格中不好的一面你还没有看见。

example.ex: The character of this country has been formed by immigration.
example.tran: 这个国家的国民性是由移民形成的。

collins.def: If something has a particular character, it has a particular quality.

example.ex: The financial concessions granted to British Aerospace were, he said, of a precarious character...
example.tran: 他说，向英国宇航公司给予财政优惠未获证实。

example.ex: The state farms were semi-military in character.
example.tran: 那些国有农场从性质上讲是半军事的。

collins.tran: (某地人具有的)特点，特色，特征
collins.def: You can use character to refer to the qualities that people from a particular place are believed to have.

example.ex: Individuality is a valued and inherent part of the British character.
example.tran: 个性鲜明是英国人固有的、也是他们看重的特点。

collins.def: You use character to say what kind of person someone is. For example, if you say that someone is a strange character, you mean they are strange.

example.ex: It's that kind of courage and determination that makes him such a remarkable character...
example.tran: 就是那种勇气和决心使他成为如此了不起的人。

example.ex: What a sad character that Nigel is.
example.tran: 奈杰尔真是个可悲的人哪。

collins.def: Your character is your personality,  especially how reliable and honest you are. If someone is of good character, they are reliable and honest. If they are of bad character, they are unreliable and dishonest.

example.ex: He's begun a series of personal attacks on my character...
example.tran: 他开始对我进行一连串的人身攻击。

example.ex: Mr Bartman was a man of good character.
example.tran: 巴特曼先生品德高尚。

collins.def: If you say that someone has character, you mean that they have the ability to deal effectively with difficult, unpleasant, or dangerous situations.

example.ex: She showed real character in her attempts to win over the crowd...
example.tran: 她在努力获得民众的支持时，表现出真正的人格力量。

example.ex: I didn't know Ron had that much strength of character.
example.tran: 我当时不知道罗恩有那么坚强的个性。

collins.def: If you say that a place has character, you mean that it has an interesting or unusual quality which makes you notice it and like it.

example.ex: An ugly shopping centre stands across from one of the few buildings with character.
example.tran: 一座难看的购物中心对面，耸立着为数不多的几幢别具特色的大楼之一。

collins.def: The characters in a film, book, or play are the people that it is about.

example.ex: The film is autobiographical and the central character is played by Collard himself...
example.tran: 这部电影是自传体，其中的主角由科勒德亲自扮演。

example.ex: He's made the characters believable.
example.tran: 他让个个角色都逼真可信。

collins.tran: 有趣的人;怪人;滑稽的人
collins.def: If you say that someone is a character, you mean that they are interesting, unusual, or amusing.

example.ex: He'll be sadly missed. He was a real character.
example.tran: 人们会非常怀念他的，他可真是个有趣的人啊。

collins.def: A character is a letter, number, or other symbol that is written or printed.

collins.tran: 符合/不符合…的性格(或特点)
collins.def: If someone's actions are in character, they are doing what you would expect them to do, knowing what kind of person they are. If their actions are out of character, they are not doing what you would expect them to do.

example.ex: It was entirely in character for Rachel to put her baby first...
example.tran: 把自己的婴孩放在第一位，这完全符合雷切尔的性格。

example.ex: What else could make him behave so out of character?
example.tran: 还有什么能让他做出这种如此失常的行为来？

collins.def: If you defend someone or something, you take action in order to protect them.

example.ex: Every man who could fight was now committed to defend the ridge...
example.tran: 每个能够参加战斗的男子现在都决心要保卫这条山脊。

example.ex: His courage in defending religious and civil rights inspired many outside the church...
example.tran: 他在捍卫宗教和公民权利时所表现出来的勇气鼓舞了许多教会之外的人。

collins.def: If you defend someone or something when they have been criticized, you argue in support of them.

example.ex: Matt defended all of Clarence's decisions, right or wrong...
example.tran: 克拉伦斯的决定，不管对错，马特都予以维护。

example.ex: The author defends herself against charges of racism by noting that blacks are only one of her targets...
example.tran: 面对种族主义指控，作者替自己辩护说黑人只是她的抨击目标之一。

collins.def: When a lawyer defends a person who has been accused of something, the lawyer argues on their behalf in a court of law that the charges are not true.

example.ex: ...a lawyer who defended political prisoners during the military regime...
example.tran: 在军人政权时期为政治犯辩护的律师

example.ex: He has hired a lawyer to defend him against the allegations...
example.tran: 他已聘请了一位律师针对这些指控为自己辩护。

collins.def: When a sports player plays in the tournament which they won the previous time it was held, you can say that they are defending their title.

example.ex: Torrence expects to defend her title successfully in the next Olympics...
example.tran: 托伦斯希望在下届奥运会上能够卫冕成功。

example.ex: India had to struggle to beat defending champions South Korea 2-0.
example.tran: 印度队苦战之下才以 2 比 0 击败卫冕冠军韩国队。

collins.tran: （断下、撕下或切下的）块，片，段，截
collins.def: A piece of something is an amount of it that has been broken off, torn off, or cut off.

example.ex: ...a piece of cake.
example.tran: 一块蛋糕

example.ex: ...a piece of wood.
example.tran: 一截木头

collins.def: A piece of an object is one of the individual parts or sections which it is made of, especially a part that can be removed.

example.ex: ...assembling objects out of standard pieces...
example.tran: 用标准部件组装物品

example.ex: The equipment was taken down the shaft in pieces.
example.tran: 该设备被拆卸成几部分送下了井。

collins.def: A piece of land is an area of land.

example.ex: People struggle to get the best piece of land.
example.tran: 人们竞相争夺最好的土地。

collins.tran: （与不可数名词连用）桩，项，条，件
collins.def: You can use piece of with many uncount nouns to refer to an individual thing of a particular kind. For example, you can refer to some advice as a piece of advice.

example.ex: When I produced this piece of work, my lecturers were very critical...
example.tran: 当我拿出这件作品时，我的讲师们提出了诸多批评意见。

example.ex: It is a highly complex piece of legislation.
example.tran: 它是一项非常复杂的法规。

collins.tran: （报纸或杂志上的一篇）文章；（一首或一部）音乐作品；（一段）广播节目；（一出）戏剧
collins.def: You can refer to an article in a newspaper or magazine, some music written by someone, a broadcast, or a play as a piece .

example.ex: I disagree with Andrew Russell over his piece on British Rail.
example.tran: 我不同意安德鲁·拉塞尔那篇关于英国铁路公司的文章。

example.ex: ...a vaguely familiar orchestral piece...
example.tran: 隐约有点熟悉的一首管弦乐

collins.def: You can refer to a work of art as a piece .

example.ex: Each piece is unique, an exquisite painting of a real person, done on ivory...
example.tran: 每一件艺术品都是绘在象牙上的精美绝伦的真人肖像，都是独一无二的。

example.ex: None of the pieces is insured.
example.tran: 没有一件艺术品上过保险。

collins.def: You can refer to specific coins as pieces. For example, a 10p piece is a coin that is worth 10p.
The pieces which you use when you play a board game such as chess are the specially made objects which you move around on the board.
A piece of something is part of it or a share of it.

example.ex: They got a small piece of the net profits and a screen credit.
example.tran: 他们得到了一小部分纯利润以及电影演职人员字幕中的署名权。

example.ex: ...the disclosure that Texas Air might sell a piece or all of Continental.
example.tran: 得克萨斯航空公司可能会卖掉部分或整个大陆航空公司这一消息的披露

collins.def: If you give someone a piece of your mind, you tell them very clearly that you think they have behaved badly.

example.ex: How very thoughtless. I'll give him a piece of my mind.
example.tran: 真是太没头脑了，我要告诉他我很生气。

collins.def: If something with several different parts is all of a piece, each part is consistent with the others. If one thing is of a piece with another, it is consistent with it.

example.ex: At its peak in the Thirties, Underground design and architecture was all of a piece...
example.tran: 在30年代的顶峰时期，地铁的设计和建筑风格都一模一样。

example.ex: The essays that Parsons completed in the latter part of his life are of a piece with his earlier work.
example.tran: 帕森斯后半生完成的文章和他的早期著作一脉相承。

collins.tran: 安然无恙的；完好无损的
collins.def: If someone or something is still in one piece after a dangerous journey or experience, they are safe and not damaged or hurt.

example.ex: ...providing that my brother gets back alive and in one piece from his mission.
example.tran: 如果我哥哥执行任务能够平安归来

collins.tran: 说自己想说的话；（毫不保留且不受打断地）发表意见
collins.def: If you say your piece, you say everything you want to say about a particular matter without being interrupted, although people may be wanting to express opposing views.

example.ex: I'll answer your questions when I've said my piece.
example.tran: 说完我想说的，我会回答你的问题。

collins.tran: 成碎片地；散了架地；成组件地
collins.def: You use to pieces in expressions such as 'smash to pieces', and mainly in British English 'fall to pieces' or 'take something to pieces', when you are describing how something is broken or comes apart so that it is in separate pieces.

example.ex: If the shell had hit the boat, it would have blown it to pieces...
example.tran: 如果炮弹击中了小船，它早就被炸成碎片了。

example.ex: He took it all to pieces, cleaned it inside and out and put it together again...
example.tran: 他把它全拆了，里外清洁了一下，然后又装了起来。

collins.def: If you go to pieces, you are so upset or nervous that you lose control of yourself and cannot do what you should do.

example.ex: She's a strong woman, but she nearly went to pieces when Arnie died.
example.tran: 她是个坚强的女性，但阿尼去世时，她几乎崩溃了。

collins.tran: 把…说得一钱不值；把…批得体无完肤
collins.def: If someone tears you to pieces ,pulls your work to pieces, or picks your work to pieces, they criticize you or your work very severely.

example.ex: He made numerous errors of fact and was torn to pieces during the subsequent question time...
example.tran: 他犯了数不清的事实错误，并在随后的答疑时间中被批得体无完肤。

example.ex: Every error is captured, every decision picked to pieces.
example.tran: 每个错误都会被抓住，每个决定都会被骂得一无是处。

collins.def: If you say that someone is a nasty piece of work, you mean that they are very unkind or unpleasant.
Your ability to do something is the fact that you can do it.

example.ex: The public never had faith in his ability to handle the job...
example.tran: 公众从来不相信他有能力胜任这一职位。

example.ex: He has the ability to bring out the best in others.
example.tran: 他能做到扬人之长。

collins.def: Your ability is the quality or skill that you have which makes it possible for you to do something.

example.ex: Her drama teacher spotted her ability...
example.tran: 她的戏剧老师发现了她的才能。

example.ex: I have confidence in the ability of the players...
example.tran: 我对于球员们的能力充满信心。

collins.def: If you do something to the best of your abilities or to the best of your ability, you do it as well as you can.

example.ex: I take care of them to the best of my abilities...
example.tran: 我尽我所能地照顾他们。

example.ex: They tackled them to the best of their ability.
example.tran: 他们竭尽全力给予解决。

collins.def: If you encourage someone, you give them confidence, for example by letting them know that what they are doing is good and telling them that they should continue to do it.

example.ex: When things aren't going well, he encourages me, telling me not to give up.
example.tran: 事情进展不顺的时候，他鼓励我说不要放弃。

collins.def: If someone is encouraged by something that happens, it gives them hope or confidence.

example.ex: Investors were encouraged by the news...
example.tran: 那个消息给了投资者信心。

example.ex: Mr Blair said he had been encouraged by recent Irish statements about the issue.
example.tran: 布莱尔先生说最近爱尔兰有关这一问题的申明使他看到了希望。

collins.def: If you encourage someone to do something, you try to persuade them to do it, for example by telling them that it would be a pleasant thing to do, or by trying to make it easier for them to do it. You can also encourage an activity.

example.ex: We want to encourage people to go fishing, not put them off...
example.tran: 我们希望鼓励人们去垂钓，而不是打消他们的热情。

example.ex: Herbie Hancock was encouraged by his family to learn music at a young age...
example.tran: 赫尔比·汉考克年幼时家人就鼓励他学音乐。

collins.def: If something encourages a particular activity or state, it causes it to happen or increase.

example.ex: ...a natural substance that encourages cell growth...
example.tran: 促进细胞生长的天然物质

example.ex: Such secrecy breeds and encourages fear and suspicion...
example.tran: 如此保密的做法滋生并加剧了人们的恐惧和疑虑。

collins.def: When you push something, you use force to make it move away from you or away from its previous position.

example.ex: The woman pushed back her chair and stood up...
example.tran: 那女人把椅子往后一推站了起来。

example.ex: They pushed him into the car.
example.tran: 他们把他推进了车里。

collins.def: If you push through things that are blocking your way or push your way through them, you use force in order to move past them.

example.ex: I pushed through the crowds and on to the escalator...
example.tran: 我挤出人群，踏上了自动扶梯。

example.ex: Dix pushed forward carrying a glass...
example.tran: 迪克斯拿着杯子往前挤。

collins.def: If an army pushes into a country or area that it is attacking or invading, it moves further into it.

example.ex: One detachment pushed into the eastern suburbs towards the airfield...
example.tran: 一支小分队开进了东部郊区向飞机场挺进。

example.ex: The army may push southwards into the Kurdish areas.
example.tran: 军队可能南下向库尔德地区挺进。

collins.def: To push a value or amount up or down means to cause it to increase or decrease.

example.ex: Any shortage could push up grain prices...
example.tran: 任何一种短缺都会抬高粮食价格。

example.ex: The government had done everything it could to push down inflation...
example.tran: 政府已经采取了所有可能的措施来抑制通货膨胀。

collins.def: If someone or something pushes an idea or project in a particular direction, they cause it to develop or progress in a particular way.

example.ex: We are continuing to push the business forward...
example.tran: 我们正在继续推进业务的发展。

example.ex: The government seemed intent on pushing local and central government in opposite directions.
example.tran: 政府似乎一心想让地方政府和中央政府背道而驰。

collins.def: If you push someone to do something or push them into doing it, you encourage or force them to do it.

example.ex: She thanks her parents for keeping her in school and pushing her to study...
example.tran: 她感谢父母送她上学并督促她学习。

example.ex: James did not push her into stealing the money...
example.tran: 詹姆斯没有怂恿她去偷钱。

collins.def: If you push for something, you try very hard to achieve it or to persuade someone to do it.

example.ex: Britain's health experts are pushing for a ban on all cigarette advertising...
example.tran: 英国的健康专家正努力争取取缔任何形式的香烟广告。

example.ex: Germany is pushing for direct flights to be established.
example.tran: 德国正在努力争取直飞航班的开通。

collins.tran: 力劝接受；极力宣传；推销
collins.def: If someone pushes an idea, a point, or a product, they try in a forceful way to convince people to accept it or buy it.

example.ex: Ministers will push the case for opening the plant...
example.tran: 部长们将极力劝说人们接受开办工厂一事。

example.ex: She knew enough about publishing to know that they could push a hundred thousand copies into the bookshops.
example.tran: 关于出版业她非常了解，很清楚他们能够向书店推销10万本书。

collins.def: When someone pushes drugs, they sell them illegally.

example.ex: She was sent for trial yesterday accused of pushing drugs.
example.tran: 她因被控贩毒昨天被送交法院接受审判。

collins.def: If you say that someone is pushing it, you mean that their actions or claims are rather excessive or risky.

example.ex: I think that he was pushing it a bit when he said it was the best stadium in the world.
example.tran: 他说这是世界上最好的体育场，我觉得说得有些过头。

collins.def: If you get the push or are given the push, you are told that you are not wanted any more, either in your job or by someone you are having a relationship with.

example.ex: Two cabinet ministers also got the push.
example.tran: 两位内阁大臣也被撤职了。

collins.def: A bond between people is a strong feeling of friendship, love, or shared beliefs and experiences that unites them.

example.ex: The experience created a very special bond between us.
example.tran: 这种经历使我们之间产生了一种很特殊的关系。

example.ex: ...the bond that linked them.
example.tran: 将他们联结在一起的感情纽带

collins.tran: 与…紧密联系；（使）相互联结；（使）建立亲密关系
collins.def: When people bond with each other, they form a relationship based on love or shared beliefs and experiences. You can also say that people bond or that something bonds them.

example.ex: Belinda was having difficulty bonding with the baby...
example.tran: 贝琳达难以与孩子建立起亲密的关系。

example.ex: They all bonded while writing graffiti together...
example.tran: 他们都是在一起涂鸦时互相熟识的。

collins.tran: （个人或团体之间的）密切联系
collins.def: A bond between people or groups is a close connection that they have with each other, for example because they have a special agreement.

example.ex: ...the strong bond between church and nation...
example.tran: 教会和国家之间紧密相连的关系

example.ex: There are tangible signs that the republic's successfully breaking its bonds with Moscow.
example.tran: 有明显迹象表明该共和国成功地断绝了与莫斯科的密切联系。

collins.def: Bonds are feelings, duties, or customs that force you to behave in a particular way.

example.ex: Freed from the  bonds of convention and the fear of what others may think, the mind responds with new solutions...
example.tran: 从传统的束缚中解脱出来，不再担心别人会有什么看法，顿时感到柳暗花明。

example.ex: We must, somehow, find a way to loosen the bonds of tradition.
example.tran: 我们不管怎样都必须找到摆脱传统束缚的途径。

collins.def: A bond between two things is the way in which they stick to one another or are joined in some way.

example.ex: The superglue may not create a bond with some plastics...
example.tran: 强力胶水可能无法粘住某些塑料。

example.ex: The molecule contains four carbon atoms arranged in a ring with a triple bond between two of them.
example.tran: 这个分子包含四个呈环状排列的碳原子，每两个碳原子之间形成一个三价键。

collins.tran: 与…黏合（或连接）；（使）黏合（或连接）在一起
collins.def: When one thing bonds with another, it sticks to it or becomes joined to it in some way. You can also say that two things bond together, or that something bonds them together .

example.ex: Diamond may be strong in itself, but it does not bond well with other materials...
example.tran: 钻石本身可能很坚固，但却不易与其他物质很好地黏合。

example.ex: In graphite sheets, carbon atoms bond together in rings...
example.tran: 石墨层中的碳原子相互连接形成碳环。

collins.tran: （政府或公司发行的）公债，债券
collins.def: When a government or company issues a bond, it borrows money from investors. The certificate which is issued to investors who lend money is also called a bond.

example.ex: Most of it will be financed by government bonds.
example.tran: 大部分资金将通过发行政府债券来筹措。

example.ex: ...the recent sharp decline in bond prices.
example.tran: 最近债券价格的暴跌

collins.def: Slightly means to some degree but not to a very large degree.

example.ex: His family then moved to a slightly larger house...
example.tran: 然后他全家搬到了一个稍微大一点的房子里。

example.ex: They will be slightly more expensive but they last a lot longer...
example.tran: 它们的价钱要贵一些，可是更加耐用。

collins.def: Following a particular event means after that event.

example.ex: In the centuries following Christ's death, Christians genuinely believed the world was about to end...
example.tran: 在耶稣死后的几个世纪里，基督徒们真的相信世界将要灭亡。

example.ex: Following a day of medical research, the conference focused on educational practices.
example.tran: 在就医学研究专题讨论一天后，会议接下来的主题集中在教学实践上。

collins.def: The following day, week, or year is the day, week, or year after the one you have just mentioned.

example.ex: The following day the picture appeared on the front pages of every newspaper in the world...
example.tran: 第二天照片出现在全世界所有报纸的头版。

example.ex: We went to dinner the following Monday evening...
example.tran: 接下来那个周一的晚上，我们一起去吃了晚餐。

collins.def: You use following to refer to something that you are about to mention.

example.ex: Write down the following information: name of product, type, date purchased and price...
example.tran: 请写明如下信息：产品名称、类型、购买日期和价格。

example.ex: The method of helping such patients is explained in the following chapters.
example.tran: 关于如何帮助这种病人，下面章节中将会作出解释。

collins.def: A person or organization that has a following has a group of people who support or admire their beliefs or actions.

example.ex: Australian rugby league enjoys a huge following in New Zealand.
example.tran: 澳大利亚橄榄球联盟在新西兰有众多支持者。

collins.def: If a boat or vehicle has a following wind, the wind is moving in the same direction as the boat or vehicle.

example.ex: The following wind and eastward running tide had given us a very pleasant, lazy sail.
example.tran: 顺风和向东的潮水使我们的航行很惬意、很省力。

means: 筹备，进行各项准备工作

collins.def: If you prepare something, you make it ready for something that is going to happen.

example.ex: Two technicians were preparing a videotape recording of last week's programme...
example.tran: 两个技术人员正在准备上周节目的录像带。

example.ex: On average each report requires 1,000 hours to prepare...
example.tran: 准备一份报告平均需要1,000小时。

collins.def: If you prepare for an event or action that will happen soon, you get yourself ready for it or make the necessary arrangements.

example.ex: The Party leadership is using management consultants to help prepare for the next election...
example.tran: 该党的领导层正在管理顾问的帮助下筹备下一届的选举。

example.ex: President Castro has warned Cubans to prepare for a profound economic emergency...
example.tran: 卡斯特罗主席已经提醒古巴人民为严重的经济危急状况做准备。

collins.def: When you prepare food, you get it ready to be eaten, for example by cooking it.

example.ex: She made her way to the kitchen, hoping to find someone preparing dinner...
example.tran: 她走到厨房，希望看到有人在准备晚饭。

example.ex: The best way of preparing the nuts is to rehydrate them by soaking overnight.
example.tran: 做这些坚果的最好方法就是用水浸泡一个晚上，为其补充水分。

collins.def: Something that is heavy weighs a lot.

example.ex: These scissors are awfully heavy...
example.tran: 这把剪刀太沉了。

example.ex: Gosh, that was a heavy bag!...
example.tran: 啊呀，那个袋子真重！

collins.def: You use heavy to ask or talk about how much someone or something weighs.

example.ex: How heavy are you?...
example.tran: 你有多重？

example.ex: Protons are nearly 2000 times as heavy as electrons.
example.tran: 质子的质量几乎是电子的2,000倍。

collins.tran: 大量的;重大的;严重的;强烈的;剧烈的
collins.def: Heavy means great in amount, degree, or intensity.

example.ex: Heavy fighting has been going on...
example.tran: 激烈的战斗一直持续不断。

example.ex: The State fails to recognize the heavy responsibility that parents take on...
example.tran: 政府没有认识到家长所承担的重大责任。

collins.def: Someone or something that is heavy is solid in appearance or structure, or is made of a thick material.

example.ex: We talk in her Belgrade flat, full of heavy old brown furniture...
example.tran: 我们在她位于贝尔格莱德的公寓里进行了交谈，那屋里满是结实的老式棕色家具。

example.ex: He was short and heavy...
example.tran: 他矮小粗壮。

collins.def: A heavy substance is thick in texture.

example.ex: It is advisable to mix coarse grit into heavy soil to improve drainage.
example.tran: 建议将粗砂掺到黏重的土壤里，以提高排水性能。

example.ex: ...11 million gallons of heavy crude oil.
example.tran: 1,100万加仑重质原油

collins.def: A heavy meal is large in amount and often difficult to digest.

example.ex: He had been feeling drowsy, the effect of an unusually heavy meal.
example.tran: 他一直感到昏昏沉沉的，这是吃了一顿超级大餐的结果。

collins.def: Something that is heavy with things is full of them or loaded with them.

example.ex: The air is heavy with moisture...
example.tran: 空气的湿度很大。

example.ex: She brought in a tray heavy with elegant sandwiches, scones and cakes.
example.tran: 她端进来一只盘子，里面盛满了精美的三明治、烤饼和蛋糕。

collins.def: If a person's breathing is heavy, it is very loud and deep.

example.ex: Her breathing became slow and heavy.
example.tran: 她的呼吸变得缓慢而粗重。

collins.def: A heavy movement or action is done with a lot of force or pressure.

example.ex: ...a heavy blow on the back of the skull...
example.tran: 后脑勺遭到的一记重击

example.ex: The plane made a heavy landing.
example.tran: 飞机粗猛着陆。

collins.def: A heavy machine or piece of military equipment is very large and very powerful.

example.ex: ...government militia backed by tanks and heavy artillery.
example.tran: 以坦克和重型大炮为后盾的政府国民军

example.ex: ...armoured personnel carriers and other heavy vehicles.
example.tran: 装甲兵员运输车和其他重型车辆

collins.def: If you describe a period of time or a schedule as heavy, you mean it involves a lot of work.

example.ex: It's been a heavy day and I'm tired...
example.tran: 忙了一天，我累坏了。

example.ex: Hopefully, Max would be able to spend a few days with them, depending on his heavy schedule.
example.tran: 希望马克斯能从满档的日程中抽出时间和他们一起呆上几天。

collins.def: Heavy work requires a lot of strength or energy.

example.ex: The business is thriving and Philippa employs two full-timers for the heavy work.
example.tran: 业务蒸蒸日上，菲莉帕雇用了两个全职员工来应付繁重的工作。

collins.def: If you say that something is heavy on another thing, you mean that it uses a lot of that thing or too much of that thing.

example.ex: Tanks are heavy on fuel and destructive to roads.
example.tran: 坦克要耗费大量的燃料，而且会破坏道路。

example.ex: ...Linda, a platinum blonde, heavy on the lipstick.
example.tran: 琳达，一位口红涂得很厚的银发女郎

collins.def: Air or weather that is heavy is unpleasantly still, hot, and damp.

example.ex: The outside air was heavy and moist and sultry.
example.tran: 外面的空气沉滞、潮湿而闷热。

collins.tran: （表情）沉痛的，疲惫呆滞的，阴郁的
collins.def: If you describe a person's face as heavy, you mean that it looks sad, tired, or unfriendly.

example.ex: Many of them were policemen, with their heavy faces and cropped hair.
example.tran: 他们中有很多人表情阴郁，留着平头，一看就是警察。

collins.def: If your heart is heavy, you are sad about something.

example.ex: Mr Maddison handed over his resignation letter with a heavy heart.
example.tran: 麦迪逊先生心情沉重地递上自己的辞呈。

collins.def: A situation that is heavy is serious and difficult to cope with.

example.ex: I don't want any more of that heavy stuff.
example.tran: 我再也不想碰那种麻烦事了。

collins.tran: （雇作保镖或打手的）彪形大汉
collins.def: A heavy is a large strong man who is employed to protect a person or place, often by using violence.

example.ex: They had employed heavies to evict shop squatters from neighbouring sites.
example.tran: 他们雇了一些彪形大汉，将附近私自占点的商贩都赶走了。

collins.def: An occasion is a time when something happens, or a case of it happening.

example.ex: I often think fondly of an occasion some years ago at Covent Garden...
example.tran: 我时常愉快地回想起几年前在科文特花园的一个时刻。

example.ex: Mr Davis has been asked on a number of occasions.
example.tran: 戴维斯先生曾多次被问及。

collins.def: An occasion is an important event, ceremony, or celebration.

example.ex: Taking her with me on official occasions has been a challenge...
example.tran: 带着她出席正式场合对我来说一直是个挑战。

example.ex: It will be a unique family occasion.
example.tran: 这将是一次特别的家庭聚会。

collins.def: An occasion for doing something is an opportunity for doing it.

example.ex: It is an occasion for all the family to celebrate...
example.tran: 这是个值得举家庆祝的时刻。

example.ex: It is always an important occasion for setting out government policy.
example.tran: 这历来都是阐明政府政策的重要时机。

collins.def: To occasion something means to cause it.

example.ex: He argued that the release of hostages should not occasion a change in policy.
example.tran: 他认为释放人质不应造成政策的改变。

collins.def: If you have occasion to do something, it is necessary for you to do it.

example.ex: We have had occasion to deal with members of the group on a variety of charges.
example.tran: 我们有必要以多项罪名起诉该组织的成员。

collins.def: If something happens on occasion, it happens sometimes, but not very often.

example.ex: He treated them seriously and, on occasion, entertained them hilariously...
example.tran: 他对待他们严肃认真，偶尔又逗得他们捧腹不已。

example.ex: He translated not only from the French but also, on occasion, from the Polish.
example.tran: 他不仅做法文翻译，有时也做些波兰语翻译。

collins.tran: 成功应付困难局面；关键时刻发挥作用
collins.def: If you say that someone rose to the occasion, you mean that they did what was necessary to successfully overcome a difficult situation.

example.ex: Inverness, however, rose to the occasion in the second half, producing some of the best football they have played for some time.
example.tran: 然而，因弗内斯队在下半场经受住了考验，踢出了很长一段时间以来的最佳水平。

collins.tran: 没有一点儿;全无;没有一个(人或物)
collins.def: None of something means not even a small amount of it. None of a group of people or things means not even one of them.

example.ex: She did none of the maintenance on the vehicle itself...
example.tran: 她对车子本身没有进行半点养护。

example.ex: None of us knew how to treat her.
example.tran: 我们没有人知道该如何对待她。

collins.tran: 同…不沾边;不准;拒绝接受
collins.def: If you say that someone will have none of something, or is having none of something, you mean that they refuse to accept it.

example.ex: He knew his own mind and was having none of their attempts to keep him at home.
example.tran: 他心意已决，坚决不答应他们想要将自己留在家中。

collins.def: None but means only.

example.ex: None but God will ever know what I suffered...
example.tran: 只有上帝知道我受过什么苦。

example.ex: He whispered so softly that none but Julie heard him.
example.tran: 他这般低声耳语，只有朱莉听得见。

collins.tran: (用于形容词或副词前，强调提到的特质不存在)毫无，毫不
collins.def: You use none too in front of an adjective or adverb in order to emphasize that the quality mentioned is not present.

example.ex: He was none too thrilled to hear from me at that hour...
example.tran: 在那个钟点接到我的电话，他一点也兴奋不起来。

example.ex: Her hand grasped my shoulder, none too gently.
example.tran: 她的手紧紧抓住了我的肩膀。

collins.tran: (表示原有的特质现已失去)毫不，一点也不
collins.def: You use none the to say that someone or something does not have any more of a particular quality than they did before.

example.ex: You could end up committed to yet another savings scheme and none the wiser about managing your finances...
example.tran: 你可能最终又会把钱投入另一个储蓄计划，在理财方面丝毫没有变得明智些。

example.ex: He became convinced that his illness was purely imaginary: that made it none the better.
example.tran: 他逐渐相信了自己的病纯粹是想象出来的，但那也没有让他的病情有任何好转。

means: 办公时（或半正式场合）穿戴的

collins.def: A dress is a piece of clothing worn by a woman or girl. It covers her body and part of her legs.

example.ex: She was wearing a black dress.
example.tran: 她穿一条黑色连衣裙。

collins.def: You can refer to clothes worn by men or women as dress .

example.ex: He's usually smart in his dress.
example.tran: 他通常穿得很精神。

example.ex: ...hundreds of Cambodians in traditional dress.
example.tran: 数百名身着传统服装的柬埔寨人

collins.def: When you dress or dress yourself, you put on clothes.

example.ex: He told Sarah to wait while he dressed...
example.tran: 他让萨拉等他穿好衣服。

example.ex: Sue had dressed herself neatly for work.
example.tran: 休穿戴整洁地上班去了。

collins.def: If you dress someone, for example a child, you put clothes on them.

example.ex: She bathed her and dressed her in clean clothes.
example.tran: 她给她洗澡并穿上干净的衣服。

collins.def: If someone dresses in a particular way, they wear clothes of a particular style or colour.

example.ex: He dresses in a way that lets everyone know he's got authority...
example.tran: 他的穿着打扮让大家都知道他已经掌权了。

example.ex: She used to dress in jeans.
example.tran: 她过去常穿牛仔裤。

collins.def: If you dress for something, you put on special clothes for it.

example.ex: We don't dress for dinner here.
example.tran: 我们这儿赴宴不穿礼服。

collins.def: When someone dresses a wound, they clean it and cover it.

example.ex: The poor child never cried or protested when I was dressing her wounds.
example.tran: 我给这个可怜的孩子包扎伤口时,她不哭也不闹。

collins.def: If you dress a salad, you cover it with a mixture of oil, vinegar, and herbs or flavourings.

example.ex: Scatter the tomato over, then dress the salad.
example.tran: 把西红柿散放在上面,然后给色拉加调味汁。

example.ex: ...a bowl of dressed salad.
example.tran: 一碗已调制好的色拉

collins.tran: (在烹饪前)清洗,加工处理(鸡、鱼或肉类)
collins.def: To dress meat, chicken, or fish means to prepare it for cooking by cleaning it and removing the parts that you cannot eat.

example.ex: Her mother dressed the meat.
example.tran: 她母亲把肉洗好了。

example.ex: ...dressed crab.
example.tran: 洗好的螃蟹

collins.def: An incident is something that happens, often something that is unpleasant.

example.ex: These incidents were the latest in a series of disputes between the two nations...
example.tran: 这些事件是两国一系列争端中最近发生的几起。

example.ex: 26 people have been killed in a dramatic shooting incident...
example.tran: 已有 26 人在一起恶性枪击事件中被打死。

collins.def: Your heart is the organ in your chest that pumps the blood around your body. People also use heart to refer to the area of their chest that is closest to their heart.

example.ex: The bullet had passed less than an inch from Andrea's heart...
example.tran: 子弹在离安德烈亚的心脏不到一英寸的地方穿过。

example.ex: The only sound inside was the beating of his heart...
example.tran: 屋内唯一的声音就是他的心跳声。

collins.def: You can refer to someone's heart when you are talking about their deep feelings and beliefs.

example.ex: Alik's words filled her heart with pride...
example.tran: 亚利克的话让她心感自豪。

example.ex: I just couldn't bring myself to admit what I knew in my heart to be true.
example.tran: 我就是无法迫使自己承认心里知道的事实。

collins.def: You use heart when you are talking about someone's character and attitude towards other people, especially when they are kind and generous.

example.ex: She loved his brilliance and his generous heart...
example.tran: 她深爱他的才华横溢和古道热肠。

example.ex: She's got a good heart but she's calculating.
example.tran: 她心地善良，但却工于心计。

collins.def: If you refer to things of the heart, you mean love and relationships.

example.ex: This is an excellent time for affairs of the heart.
example.tran: 这是谈情说爱的绝佳时机。

collins.def: The heart of something is the most central and important part of it.

example.ex: The heart of the problem is supply and demand...
example.tran: 问题的核心是供求关系。

example.ex: Money lies at the heart of the debate over airline safety.
example.tran: 资金是空运安全争论中的实质问题。

collins.def: The heart of a place is its centre.

example.ex: ...a busy dentists' practice in the heart of London's West End.
example.tran: 位于伦敦西区中心的一个繁忙的牙科诊所

collins.def: The heart of a lettuce, cabbage, or other vegetable is its centre leaves.
A heart is a shape that is used as a symbol of love: ♥.

example.ex: ...heart-shaped chocolates.
example.tran: 心形巧克力

collins.def: Hearts is one of the four suits in a pack of playing cards. Each card in the suit is marked with one or more red symbols in the shape of a heart.

collins.tran: 全心全意地;真心实意地
collins.def: If you feel or believe something with all your heart, you feel or believe it very strongly.

example.ex: My own family I loved with all my heart.
example.tran: 我真心实意地爱我全家人。

collins.def: If you say that someone is a particular kind of person at heart, you mean that that is what they are really like, even though they may seem very different.

example.ex: He was a very gentle boy at heart.
example.tran: 他实际上是个非常温柔的男生。

collins.tran: 十分关心（某人的利益或福祉）
collins.def: If you say that someone has your interests or your welfare at heart, you mean that they are concerned about you and that is why they are doing something.

example.ex: She told him she only had his interests at heart.
example.tran: 她告诉他自己万事都是为了他好。

collins.tran: （通常指因感情破裂而）使…伤心，使…心碎
collins.def: If someone breaks your heart, they make you very sad and unhappy, usually because they end a love affair or close relationship with you.

collins.tran: （尤指因对他人的苦难无能为力而）使…伤心，使…心碎
collins.def: If something breaks your heart, it makes you feel very sad and depressed, especially because people are suffering but you can do nothing to help them.

example.ex: It really breaks my heart to see them this way.
example.tran: 看到他们这个样子可真让我伤心。

collins.def: If you say that someone has a broken heart, you mean that they are very sad, for example because a love affair has ended unhappily.

example.ex: She never recovered from her broken heart.
example.tran: 她心上的伤再也没能愈合。

collins.def: If you know something such as a poem by heart, you have learned it so well that you can remember it without having to read it.

example.ex: Mack knew this passage by heart.
example.tran: 麦克会背这一段。

collins.def: If someone has a change of heart, their attitude towards something changes.

example.ex: Several brokers have had a change of heart about prospects for the company...
example.tran: 几位经纪人对该公司前景的看法已经有所改变。

example.ex: Why the change of heart?
example.tran: 为什么变了态度？

collins.def: If something such as a subject or project is close to your heart or near to your heart, it is very important to you and you are very interested in it and concerned about it.

example.ex: Animal welfare is a subject very close to my heart.
example.tran: 动物福利是我非常关注的一个问题。

collins.def: If you can do something to your heart's content, you can do it as much as you want.

example.ex: I was delighted to be able to eat my favorite dishes to my heart's content.
example.tran: 我很高兴能够痛痛快快地吃我最喜爱的菜。

collins.tran: 我发誓（所说的是真的）/你敢发誓（所说的是真的）吗？
collins.def: You can say 'cross my heart' when you want someone to believe that you are telling the truth. You can also ask 'cross your heart?', when you are asking someone if they are really telling the truth.

example.ex: And I won't tell any of the other girls anything you tell me about it. I promise, cross my heart.
example.tran: 我不会把你告诉我的事告诉任何其他女孩。我发誓，保证不会。

collins.def: If you say something from the heart or from the bottom of your heart, you sincerely mean what you say.

example.ex: He spoke with confidence, from the heart...
example.tran: 他的话充满信心，发自心坎。

example.ex: I don't want to go away without thanking you from the bottom of my heart.
example.tran: 我离开之前一定要先衷心地感谢你。

collins.def: If something gives you heart, it makes you feel more confident or happy about something.

example.ex: It gave me heart to see one thug get what he deserves.
example.tran: 看到一个恶棍罪有应得真是大快我心。

collins.def: If you want to do something but do not have the heart to do it, you do not do it because you know it will make someone unhappy or disappointed.

example.ex: We knew all along but didn'thave the heart to tell her.
example.tran: 我们一直都知道，但却不忍心告诉她。

collins.def: If you believe or know something in your heart of hearts, that is what you really believe or think, even though it may sometimes seem that you do not.

example.ex: I know in my heart of hearts that I am the right man for that mission.
example.tran: 我心里深知我是完成那项任务的合适人选。

collins.def: If your heart isn't in the thing you are doing, you have very little enthusiasm for it, usually because you are depressed or are thinking about something else.

example.ex: I tried to learn some lines but my heart wasn't really in it.
example.tran: 我想要背几句台词，但我的心根本不在那上面。

collins.def: If you lose heart, you become sad and depressed and are no longer interested in something, especially because it is not progressing as you would like.

example.ex: He appealed to his countrymen not to lose heart.
example.tran: 他呼吁自己的同胞不要丧失信心。

collins.def: If you lose your heart to someone, you fall in love with them.

collins.tran: 激动非常;焦急万分;害怕得要命
collins.def: If your heart is in your mouth, you feel very excited, worried, or frightened.

example.ex: My heart was in my mouth when I walked into her office.
example.tran: 我走进她的办公室时，紧张得心都到了喉咙口。

collins.def: If you open your heart or pour out your heart to someone, you tell them your most private thoughts and feelings.

example.ex: She opened her heart to millions yesterday and told how she came close to suicide.
example.tran: 她昨天在数成百万人面前倾吐心声，讲述了自己是如何差点轻生的。

collins.tran: （尽管有其他缺点但）心地善良，心眼儿好
collins.def: If you say that someone's heart is in the right place, you mean that they are kind, considerate, and generous, although you may disapprove of other aspects of their character.

example.ex: He is a bit of a tearaway but his heart is in the right place.
example.tran: 他是有点像个阿飞，但心眼儿不错。

collins.tran: 一心想要得到;一心想要做
collins.def: If you have set your heart on something, you want it very much or want to do it very much.

example.ex: He had always set his heart on a career in the fine arts.
example.tran: 他一直以来都一心想把美术作为自己的事业。

collins.def: If you wear your heart on your sleeve, you openly show your feelings or emotions rather than keeping them hidden.

collins.tran: 全心全意地;尽心尽力地
collins.def: If you put your heart and soul into something, you do it with a great deal of enthusiasm and energy.

example.ex: He will always be successful when he puts his mind to something, because he puts his heart and soul into it.
example.tran: 当他专心想干某件事时，他总是能成功，因为他会全心全意地投入其中。

collins.def: If you take heart from something, you are encouraged and made to feel optimistic by it.

collins.tran: 对…耿耿于怀;为…感到不快
collins.def: If you take something to heart, for example someone's behaviour, you are deeply affected and upset by it.

example.ex: If someone says something critical I take it to heart.
example.tran: 如果有人提出批评，我会十分介意。

collins.def: If you regard something or someone with favour, you like or support them.

example.ex: It remains to be seen if the show will still find favour with a 1990s audience...
example.tran: 这个节目是否能继续赢得 90 后观众的喜爱，还要拭目以待。

example.ex: No one would look with favour on the continuing military rule...
example.tran: 没有人会赞成继续军政府统治。

collins.def: If you do someone a favour, you do something for them even though you do not have to.

example.ex: I've come to ask you to do me a favour...
example.tran: 我来这儿是想请你帮个忙。

example.ex: These are gestures of genuine friendship with no favours expected in return.
example.tran: 这是友谊的真正表现，不期待任何回报。

collins.def: If you say that one person gives or sells their favours to another, you mean that they have sex.

example.ex: In her extreme youth, Maria had sold her sexual favours for money.
example.tran: 玛丽亚在非常年轻的时候，曾靠卖淫来赚钱。

collins.def: If you favour something, you prefer it to the other choices available.

example.ex: The French say they favour a transition to democracy...
example.tran: 法国人说他们倾向于向民主过渡。

example.ex: He favours bringing the UN into touch with 'modern realities'.
example.tran: 他倾向于让联合国接触“当代现实”。

collins.def: If you favour someone, you treat them better or in a kinder way than you treat other people.

example.ex: The Government came under fire yesterday for favouring elitist arts groups in the South-east...
example.tran: 昨天，政府因为偏袒东南部的一些精英艺术群体而遭到抨击。

example.ex: Another possibility is that parents favour chicks that are strong.
example.tran: 另一种可能性是亲鸟会偏爱强壮的雏鸟。

collins.def: If you are in favour of something, you support it and think that it is a good thing.

example.ex: I wouldn't be in favour of income tax cuts...
example.tran: 我不会支持削减所得税。

example.ex: Yet this is a Government which proclaims that it is all in favour of openness...
example.tran: 但这却是个宣称全力支持开放的政府。

collins.def: If someone makes a judgment in your favour, they say that you are right about something.

example.ex: If the commission rules in Mr Welch's favour the case will go to the European Court of Human Rights.
example.tran: 如果委员会裁定韦尔奇有理，这个案件将送交欧洲人权法庭。

collins.def: If something is in your favour, it helps you or gives you an advantage.

example.ex: The protection that farmers have enjoyed amounts to a bias in favour of the countryside...
example.tran: 农民所受的保护几乎变成了对乡村的偏袒。

example.ex: Firms are trying to shift the balance of power in the labour market back in their favour.
example.tran: 各公司正在试图让劳动力市场的均势向有利于自己的方向倾斜。

collins.tran: (舍弃某物)宁愿选择;选…(而不选…)
collins.def: If one thing is rejected in favour of another, the second thing is done or chosen instead of the first.

example.ex: The policy was rejected in favour of a more cautious approach.
example.tran: 这项政策未被采纳，取而代之的是一项较为谨慎的策略。

collins.def: If someone or something is in favour, people like or support them. If they are out of favour, people no longer like or support them.
If something tends to happen, it usually happens or it often happens.

example.ex: A problem for manufacturers is that lighter cars tend to be noisy...
example.tran: 制造商们遇到的一个问题是，重量较轻的汽车往往噪音大。

example.ex: In older age groups women predominate because men tend to die younger...
example.tran: 在老年群体里女性占大多数，因为男性通常不易高寿。

collins.tran: 倾向于，容易表现出(某种特性)
collins.def: If you tend towards a particular characteristic, you often display that characteristic.

example.ex: Artistic and intellectual people tend towards left-wing views.
example.tran: 搞艺术的人和知识分子容易持“左倾”观点。

collins.def: You can say that you tend to think something when you want to give your opinion, but do not want it to seem too forceful or definite.

example.ex: I tend to think that members of parliament by and large do a good job.
example.tran: 我个人觉得，议会议员总体上工作还是不错的。

collins.def: If you tend someone or something, you do what is necessary to keep them in a good condition or to improve their condition.

example.ex: For years he tended her in her painful illness...
example.tran: 多年来她一直受到病痛的折磨，都是他在照料。

example.ex: He tends the flower beds and evergreens that he has planted in the driveway.
example.tran: 他打理着他栽在车道两旁的花坛和常青树。

collins.def: If you tend to someone or something, you pay attention to them and deal with their problems and needs.

example.ex: In our culture, girls are brought up to tend to the needs of others...
example.tran: 在我们的文化里，女孩从小就学着照料别人。

example.ex: She hurried away to pour more coffee and tend to the grill.
example.tran: 她匆忙走开，去添加咖啡和照看烤架。

collins.def: Your colleagues are the people you work with, especially in a professional job.

example.ex: Without consulting his colleagues he flew from Lisbon to Split...
example.tran: 没跟同事们商量，他就从里斯本飞到了斯普利特。

example.ex: A colleague urged him to see a psychiatrist, but Faulkner refused.
example.tran: 一位同事竭力劝福克纳去看精神病医生，但他拒绝了。

collins.def: Defence is action that is taken to protect someone or something against attack.

example.ex: The land was flat, giving no scope for defence...
example.tran: 这一地区非常平坦，根本没法进行防御。

example.ex: By wielding a knife in defence you run the risk of having it used against you.
example.tran: 若是挥刀自卫，有可能会被夺去而反受其害。

collins.def: Defence is the organization of a country's armies and weapons, and their use to protect the country or its interests.

example.ex: Twenty eight percent of the federal budget is spent on defense.
example.tran: 28%的联邦预算用于国防。

example.ex: ...the French defence minister.
example.tran: 法国国防部长

collins.def: The defences of a country or region are all its armed forces and weapons.

example.ex: ...the need to maintain Britain's defences at a sufficiently high level.
example.tran: 维持英国的防御力量在足够高水平之上的需要

collins.def: A defence is something that people or animals can use or do to protect themselves.

example.ex: The immune system is our main defence against disease...
example.tran: 人体的免疫系统是抵御疾病的主要屏障。

example.ex: The boy could have felt sorry for himself and become depressed, or he could have adopted hardened cynicism as a defense.
example.tran: 这个男孩本有可能自怜自哀、抑郁消沉，也有可能采取冷酷的愤世嫉俗态度来保护自己。

collins.def: A defence is something that you say or write which supports ideas or actions that have been criticized or questioned.

example.ex: Chomsky'sdefence of his approach goes further...
example.tran: 乔姆斯基对自己方法的辩护不止于此。

example.ex: The Party Congress has closed with a spirited defence of the government's economic programme from the Deputy Prime Minister...
example.tran: 党代表大会以副总理对政府经济计划热烈的辩护拉上了帷幕。

collins.def: In a court of law, an accused person's defence is the process of presenting evidence in their favour.

example.ex: He has insisted on conducting his own defence.
example.tran: 他坚持自己进行辩护。

collins.tran: (被告律师的)辩护方法（或理由）;辩护律师
collins.def: The defence is the case that is presented by a lawyer in a trial for the person who has been accused of a crime. You can also refer to this person's lawyers as the defence .

example.ex: The defence was that the records of the interviews were fabricated by the police...
example.tran: 辩护论点为问讯记录是警方捏造的。

example.ex: The defence pleaded insanity, but the defendant was found guilty and sentenced.
example.tran: 辩护律师申辩称被告精神错乱，但最后被告还是被认定有罪并判刑。

collins.tran: (足球、曲棍球等运动中的)防守（队员）
collins.def: In games such as football or hockey, the defence is the group of players in a team who try to stop the opposing players scoring a goal or a point.

example.ex: Their defence, so strong last season, has now conceded 12 goals in six games...
example.tran: 他们的防守上个赛季牢不可破，但在本赛季的 6 场比赛里已经丢了 12 个球。

example.ex: I still prefer to play in defence.
example.tran: 我还是更喜欢打防守。

collins.def: If you come to someone's defence, you help them by doing or saying something to protect them.

example.ex: He realized none of his schoolmates would come to his defense...
example.tran: 他意识到没有一个同学会挺身为他辩护。

example.ex: Tony sprang to the defence of the 21-year-old, saying he was not to blame.
example.tran: 托尼马上站出来为那个 21 岁的男孩辩护，说那不是他的错。

collins.def: The impact that something has on a situation, process, or person is a sudden and powerful effect that it has on them.

example.ex: They say they expect the meeting to have a marked impact on the future of the country...
example.tran: 他们称他们预期会议对国家的未来会产生显著影响。

example.ex: The major impact of this epidemic worldwide is yet to come...
example.tran: 这种传染病在世界范围内的重大影响还未完全显现。

collins.def: An impact is the action of one object hitting another, or the force with which one object hits another.

example.ex: The plane is destroyed, a complete wreck: the pilot must have died on impact...
example.tran: 飞机遭到毁坏,完全成了一堆残骸：飞行员肯定死于撞击。

example.ex: A running track should be capable of absorbing the impact of a runner's foot landing on it.
example.tran: 跑道应该能够吸收奔跑者踩踏地面时产生的撞击力。

collins.def: To impact on a situation, process, or person means to affect them.

example.ex: Such schemes mean little unless they impact on people.
example.tran: 这些计划没什么意义,除非它们对人民产生影响。

example.ex: That, in turn would increase pressure for higher wages and that, in turn, would impact on inflation and competition.
example.tran: 那样就会增加工资上涨的压力,而那样又会对通货膨胀和竞争产生影响。

collins.def: If one object impacts on another, it hits it with great force.

example.ex: ...the sharp tinkle of metal impacting on stone...
example.tran: 金属撞击石头发出的刺耳叮当声

example.ex: According to the air force, the missile merely impacted with the ground prematurely...
example.tran: 根据空军提供的消息，导弹只是提前撞向了地面。

means: （词之间性、数、人称方面与…）一致

collins.def: An agreement is a formal decision about future action which is made by two or more countries, groups, or people.

example.ex: It looks as though a compromise agreement has now been reached...
example.tran: 看起来好像现已达成一个妥协协定。

example.ex: The two countries signed an agreement to jointly launch satellites.
example.tran: 两国曾签订了联合发射人造卫星的协议。
