collins.def: Agreement on something is a joint decision that a particular course of action should be taken.

example.ex: The two men had not reached agreement on any issues...
example.tran: 两人还未就任何议题达成协议。

example.ex: But instead of ending in agreement, the talks broke up in acrimony at the end of the week.
example.tran: 但是到这个周末，谈判非但没有达成协议反而在唇枪舌剑中不欢而散。

collins.def: Agreement with someone means having the same opinion as they have.

example.ex: The judge kept nodding in agreement...
example.tran: 法官不停地点头表示同意。

example.ex: There was general agreement that every effort should be made to prevent the war from spreading.
example.tran: 人们一致认为应该竭尽全力阻止战事扩大。

collins.def: Agreement to a course of action means allowing it to happen or giving it your approval.

example.ex: The clinic doctor will then write to your GP to get his agreement.
example.tran: 然后门诊医生将会写信给你的全科医生以取得他的同意。

collins.def: If there is agreement between two accounts of an event or two sets of figures, they are the same or are consistent with each other.

example.ex: Many other surveys have produced results essentially in agreement with these figures.
example.tran: 许多其他调查已经得出了与这些数据基本一致的结果。

collins.tran: （与搭配名词或代词在数或性上的）一致，呼应
collins.def: In grammar, agreement refers to the way that a word has a form appropriate to the number or gender of the noun or pronoun it relates to.
You use industrial to describe things which relate to or are used in industry.

example.ex: ...industrial machinery and equipment.
example.tran: 工业机械与设备

example.ex: ...a link between industrial chemicals and cancer.
example.tran: 化工制品与癌症的联系

collins.tran: 工业高度发达的;工业化的
collins.def: An industrial city or country is one in which industry is important or highly developed.

example.ex: ...ministers from leading western industrial countries.
example.tran: 西方工业大国的部长们

collins.def: Something that is impossible cannot be done or cannot happen.

example.ex: It was impossible for anyone to get in because no one knew the password...
example.tran: 因为没人知道密码,所以任何人都不可能进得去。

example.ex: He thinks the tax is impossible to administer...
example.tran: 他认为税金没法管理。

collins.def: An impossible situation or an impossible position is one that is very difficult to deal with.

example.ex: The Government was now in an almost impossible position.
example.tran: 政府现在几乎陷入了进退维谷的境地。

collins.tran: 难以忍受的;让人受不了的
collins.def: If you describe someone as impossible, you are annoyed that their bad behaviour or strong views make them difficult to deal with.

example.ex: The woman is impossible, thought Frannie.
example.tran: 弗兰妮想,这个女人真让人受不了。

collins.def: If there is a risk of something unpleasant, there is a possibility that it will happen.

example.ex: There is a small risk of brain damage from the procedure...
example.tran: 该手术有导致脑损伤的轻微风险。

example.ex: In all the confusion, there's a serious risk that the main issues will be forgotten.
example.tran: 在一片混乱中，主要的问题很有可能会被遗忘。

collins.def: If something that you do is a risk, it might have unpleasant or undesirable results.

example.ex: You're taking a big risk showing this to Kravis...
example.tran: 你把这个给克拉维斯看会有很大的风险。

example.ex: This was one risk that paid off.
example.tran: 这是一个成功的冒险。

collins.tran: 冒险行为;威胁;隐患;危险的人
collins.def: If you say that something or someone is a risk, you mean they are likely to cause harm.

example.ex: It's being overfat that constitutes a health risk...
example.tran: 威胁健康的一个因素是身体过于肥胖。

example.ex: The restaurant has been refurbished — it was found to be a fire risk...
example.tran: 这家餐馆已经重新整修了——之前发现存在火灾隐患。

collins.def: If you are considered a good risk, a bank or shop thinks that it is safe to lend you money or let you have goods without paying for them at the time.

example.ex: Before providing the cash, they will have to decide whether you are a good or bad risk...
example.tran: 在提供资金之前，他们得确认你是不是信誉良好的贷款对象。

example.ex: If you are already considered a credit risk by a bank, a secured loan might be your only alternative.
example.tran: 如果银行已经认为你有信用风险，那么抵押贷款就是你唯一的选择了。

collins.tran: 冒着…的危险;担着…的风险
collins.def: If you risk something unpleasant, you do something which might result in that thing happening or affecting you.

example.ex: Those who fail to register risk severe penalties...
example.tran: 那些没有注册的人可能会受到严厉的处罚。

example.ex: Pregnant women who are heavy drinkers risk damaging the unborn foetus.
example.tran: 酗酒的孕妇可能会给体内的胎儿造成伤害。

collins.def: If you risk doing something, you do it, even though you know that it might have undesirable consequences.

example.ex: The captain was not willing to risk taking his ship through the straits in such bad weather.
example.tran: 船长不愿意在这样恶劣的天气里冒险将船驶过海峡。

example.ex: At the top, I risked a glance back...
example.tran: 在顶端，我壮着胆回头瞟了一眼。

collins.tran: 冒着（失去生命等）的危险
collins.def: If you risk your life or something else important, you behave in a way that might result in it being lost or harmed.

example.ex: She risked her own life to help a disabled woman...
example.tran: 她冒着生命危险去帮助一个残疾妇女。

example.ex: Why should he have risked all that to become an agent of a foreign power?
example.tran: 为什么就该他冒失去这一切的风险做外国势力的代理人呢？

collins.tran: 处境危险;有风险的;在危险中
collins.def: To be at risk means to be in a situation where something unpleasant might happen.

example.ex: Up to 25,000 jobs are still at risk...
example.tran: 多达25,000份工作仍受到威胁。

example.ex: An estimated seven million people are at risk of starvation...
example.tran: 估计有700万人面临着饿死的危险。

collins.def: If you do something at the risk of something unpleasant happening, you do it even though you know that the unpleasant thing might happen as a result.

example.ex: At the risk of being repetitive, I will say again that statistics are only a guide...
example.tran: 尽管会显得啰唆，但我还得再说一遍，统计数字只是一个参考。

example.ex: Americans wanted to aid Britain even at the risk of war.
example.tran: 哪怕冒着开战的危险，美国人也想帮助英国人。

collins.tran: 自担风险;责任自负;后果自负
collins.def: If you tell someone that they are doing something at their own risk, you are warning them that, if they are harmed, it will be their own responsibility.

example.ex: Those who wish to come here will do so at their own risk.
example.tran: 那些想来这里的人风险自负。

collins.def: If you run the risk of doing or experiencing something undesirable, you do something knowing that the undesirable thing might happen as a result.

example.ex: The officers had run the risk of being dismissed...
example.tran: 这些警官冒了被开除的风险。

example.ex: I knew I was running a great many risks.
example.tran: 我知道我正担着很多的风险。

collins.def: Physical qualities, actions, or things are connected with a person's body, rather than with their mind.

example.ex: ...the physical and mental problems caused by the illness...
example.tran: 这种病引起的生理和心理的问题

example.ex: Physical activity promotes good health...
example.tran: 体育活动促进身体健康。

collins.def: Physical things are real things that can be touched and seen, rather than ideas or spoken words.

example.ex: Physical and ideological barriers had come down in Eastern Europe.
example.tran: 物质和意识形态上的障碍在东欧已不复存在。

example.ex: ...physical evidence to support the story.
example.tran: 支持这种说法的实证

collins.def: Physical means relating to the structure, size, or shape of something that can be touched and seen.

example.ex: ...the physical characteristics of the terrain.
example.tran: 这种地形的外在特征

example.ex: ...the physical properties (weight, volume, hardness, etc.) of a substance.
example.tran: 物质的外部特性（重量、体积、硬度等）

collins.def: Physical means connected with physics or the laws of physics.

example.ex: ...the physical laws of combustion and thermodynamics.
example.tran: 燃烧和热力学物理定律

collins.tran: 喜欢动手动脚的；有大量身体接触（或碰撞）的
collins.def: Someone who is physical touches people a lot, either in an affectionate way or in a rough way.

example.ex: We decided that in the game we would be physical and aggressive.
example.tran: 我们决定在比赛中积极拼抢，大胆进攻。

collins.def: Physical is used in expressions such as physical love and physical relationships to refer to sexual relationships between people.

example.ex: the book celebrated the sublime joys of physical love...
example.tran: 本书赞美了性爱带来的无比美妙的愉悦。

example.ex: It had been years since they had shared any meaningful form of physical relationship.
example.tran: 他们已多年没有真正意义上的性生活了。

collins.def: A physical is a medical examination, done in order to see if someone is fit and well enough to do a particular job or to join the army.

example.ex: Bob failed his physical...
example.tran: 鲍勃体检不合格。

example.ex: Routine physicals are done by a nurse.
example.tran: 由一名护士做常规体检。

collins.def: If you have a dozen things, you have twelve of them.

example.ex: ...a dozen eggs...
example.tran: 一打鸡蛋

example.ex: You will be able to take ten dozen bottles free of duty through customs...
example.tran: 你可以携带120瓶免税通过海关。

collins.def: You can refer to a group of approximately twelve things or people as a dozen. You can refer to a group of approximately six things or people as half a dozen .

example.ex: I was sitting only a dozen feet away...
example.tran: 我正坐在只有十几英尺远的地方。

example.ex: In half a dozen words, he had explained the bond that linked them...
example.tran: 他用了六七个字就解释清楚了他们之间的关系。

collins.def: If you refer to dozens of things or people, you are emphasizing that there are very many of them.

example.ex: ...a storm which destroyed dozens of homes and buildings.
example.tran: 摧毁了许多房屋和建筑的暴风雨

collins.tran: （用于形容词和副词前）非常，极其
collins.def: You use extremely in front of adjectives and adverbs to emphasize that the specified quality is present to a very great degree.

example.ex: My mobile phone is extremely useful...
example.tran: 我的手机非常有用。

example.ex: These headaches are extremely common...
example.tran: 这类头痛非常常见。

collins.def: The readers of a newspaper, magazine, or book are the people who read it.

example.ex: If you are a regular reader of Homes & Gardens you will know what an invaluable source of inspiration it is...
example.tran: 如果你常读《家和花园》杂志的话，就会知道它是一个多么宝贵的灵感源泉。

example.ex: These texts give the reader an insight into the Chinese mind.
example.tran: 这些文章使读者对中国人的思维有了深层次的认识。

collins.tran: 爱读书的人；有读书习惯的人
collins.def: A reader is a person who reads, especially one who reads for pleasure.

example.ex: Thanks to that job I became an avid reader...
example.tran: 多亏了那份工作我才成了一个喜欢阅读的人。

example.ex: Their books are loved by young readers the world over.
example.tran: 他们的书得到了全世界年轻读者的喜爱。

collins.def: A reader is a person who reads books for a publisher in order to give an opinion on whether they should be published or not.

collins.tran: （英国大学中仅次于教授的）高级讲师
collins.def: In British universities, a reader is a senior lecturer, with a rank just below that of a professor.

example.ex: John Stevenson is Reader in History at the University of Sheffield.
example.tran: 约翰·史蒂文森是谢菲尔德大学的历史学高级讲师。

collins.def: In American universities and colleges, a reader is an assistant to a teacher. Readers' duties include reading and marking examination papers and other work.

collins.tran: （帮助阅读或学习外语的）读本，读物
collins.def: A reader is a book to help children to learn to read, or to help people to learn a foreign language. It contains passages of text, and often exercises to give practice in reading and writing.
Rain is water that falls from the clouds in small drops.

example.ex: I hope you didn't get soaked standing out in the rain...
example.tran: 我希望你站在外面没有被雨淋透。

example.ex: A spot of rain fell on her hand.
example.tran: 一滴雨落在她的手上。

collins.def: In countries where rain only falls in certain seasons, this rain is referred to as the rains .

example.ex: ...the spring, when the rains came...
example.tran: 春天，雨季来临时

example.ex: The rains have failed again in the Horn of Africa.
example.tran: 雨季又没有光顾非洲之角。

collins.def: When rain falls, you can say that it is raining .

example.ex: It rained the whole weekend...
example.tran: 整个周末都在下雨。

example.ex: It was raining hard, and she hadn't an umbrella.
example.tran: 雨下得很大，但她没有雨伞。

collins.tran: （使）如雨点般落下；（使）大量降下
collins.def: If someone rains blows, kicks, or bombs on a person or place, the person or place is attacked by many blows, kicks, or bombs. You can also say that blows, kicks, or bombs rain on a person or place.

example.ex: The police, raining blows on rioters and spectators alike, cleared the park...
example.tran: 警察不分闹事者与观众统统一顿猛击，把人们清除出了足球场。

example.ex: Rockets, mortars and artillery rounds rained on buildings.
example.tran: 火箭炮、迫击炮和各种炮弹如雨点般落在大楼上。

collins.def: A rain of things is a large number of things that fall from the sky at the same time.

example.ex: A rain of stones descended on the police.
example.tran: 一阵乱石砸向警察。

collins.def: You can use the expression it never rains but it pours to mean that several unfortunate events often happen at the same time.
If you say that someone is as right as rain, you mean that they are completely well or healthy again, for example when they have recovered from an illness or a shock.

example.ex: You'll be as right as rain as soon as you are back in your own home with your baby.
example.tran: 你一回家同孩子在一起就会完全没事了。

collins.tran: 不管晴天或下雨;风雨无阻
collins.def: If you say that someone does something rain or shine, you mean that they do it regularly, without being affected by the weather or other circumstances.

example.ex: Frances took her daughter walking every day, rain or shine.
example.tran: 弗朗西丝无论晴天还是下雨，每天都带女儿去散步。

collins.def: If someone establishes something such as an organization, a type of activity, or a set of rules, they create it or introduce it in such a way that it is likely to last for a long time.

example.ex: The UN has established detailed criteria for who should be allowed to vote...
example.tran: 联合国已经制定了有关投票资格的标准细则。

example.ex: The School was established in 1989 by an Italian professor.
example.tran: 这所学院由一名意大利教授于1989年创建。

collins.def: If you establish contact with someone, you start to have contact with them. You can also say that two people, groups, or countries establish contact.

example.ex: We had already established contact with the museum...
example.tran: 我们已经和那家博物馆建立了联系。

example.ex: Singapore and South Africa have established diplomatic relations.
example.tran: 新加坡和南非已经建立了外交关系。

collins.def: If you establish that something is true, you discover facts that show that it is definitely true.

example.ex: Medical tests established that she was not their own child...
example.tran: 医学化验证实她不是他们的亲骨肉。

example.ex: It will be essential to establish how the money is being spent...
example.tran: 查清楚这笔钱将作何用途至关重要。

collins.tran: 使立足;使被认可;确立(地位)
collins.def: If you establish yourself, your reputation, or a good quality that you have, you succeed in doing something, and achieve respect or a secure position as a result of this.

example.ex: This is going to be the show where up-and-coming comedians will establish themselves...
example.tran: 这将是大有前途的喜剧演员们让自己获得认可的节目。

example.ex: He has established himself as a pivotal figure in US politics...
example.tran: 他已经确立了自己在美国政界的核心地位。

collins.def: A fee is a sum of money that you pay to be allowed to do something.

example.ex: He hadn't paid his television licence fee.
example.tran: 他尚未缴纳电视机使用许可费。

collins.def: A fee is the amount of money that a person or organization is paid for a particular job or service that they provide.

example.ex: Find out how much your surveyor's and solicitor's fees will be.
example.tran: 弄清你要向鉴定员和律师支付多少费用。

collins.def: If you recognize someone or something, you know who that person is or what that thing is.

example.ex: The receptionist recognized him at once...
example.tran: 接待员一眼就认出他了。

example.ex: He did not think she could recognize his car in the snow...
example.tran: 他觉得她在雪天里认不出他的车子。

collins.def: If someone says that they recognize something, they acknowledge that it exists or that it is true.

example.ex: I recognize my own shortcomings...
example.tran: 我承认自己的缺点。

example.ex: Well, of course I recognize that evil exists.
example.tran: 嗯，我当然承认邪恶的存在。

collins.tran: 正式认可;承认;正式接受;赞成
collins.def: If people or organizations recognize something as valid, they officially accept it or approve of it.

example.ex: Most doctors appear to recognize homeopathy as a legitimate form of medicine...
example.tran: 大多数医生似乎都接受顺势疗法是一种合理的医疗手段。

example.ex: France is on the point of recognizing the independence of the Baltic States.
example.tran: 法国即将承认波罗的海诸国的独立。

collins.tran: 赞赏，认可（某人的所作所为）
collins.def: When people recognize the work that someone has done, they show their appreciation of it, often by giving that person an award of some kind.

example.ex: The RAF recognized him as an outstandingly able engineer...
example.tran: 英国皇家空军表彰他是一名非常能干的机械师。

example.ex: He had the insight to recognize their talents...
example.tran: 他很有眼力，慧眼识英才。

collins.def: The resources of an organization or person are the materials, money, and other things that they have and can use in order to function properly.

example.ex: Some families don't have the resources to feed themselves properly...
example.tran: 有些家庭无力维持生活。

example.ex: There's a great shortage of resource materials in many schools.
example.tran: 很多学校物资都十分短缺。

collins.def: A coun-try's resources are the things that it has and can use to increase its wealth, such as coal, oil, or land.

example.ex: ...resources like coal, tungsten, oil and copper...
example.tran: 煤、钨、石油和铜之类的资源

example.ex: Today we are overpopulated, straining the earth's resources.
example.tran: 现在我们人口过多，致使地球资源使用过度。

collins.def: A circle is a shape consisting of a curved line completely surrounding an area. Every part of the line is the same distance from the centre of the area.

example.ex: The flag was red, with a large white circle in the center...
example.tran: 旗子是红色的，中央有个白色大圆圈。

example.ex: I wrote down the number 46 and drew a circle around it.
example.tran: 我写下46这个数字，又画了个圆将它圈起来。

collins.def: A circle of something is a round flat piece or area of it.

example.ex: Cut out 4 circles of pastry.
example.tran: 切出四块圆形油酥面饼。

example.ex: ...a circle of yellow light.
example.tran: 圆形黄光区

collins.def: A circle of objects or people is a group of them arranged in the shape of a circle.

example.ex: The monument consists of a circle of gigantic stones...
example.tran: 纪念碑由一圈巨石组成。

example.ex: We stood in a circle holding hands.
example.tran: 我们站成一圈，手牵着手。

collins.def: If something circles an object or a place, or circles around it, it forms a circle around it.

example.ex: This is the ring road that circles the city.
example.tran: 这是环绕市区的环路。

example.ex: ...the long curving driveway that circled around the vast clipped lawn.
example.tran: 围绕着大片修剪过的草坪的长长的弧形车道

collins.def: If an aircraft or a bird circles or circles something, it moves round in a circle in the air.

example.ex: The plane circled, awaiting permission to land...
example.tran: 飞机在天上盘旋，等候着陆许可。

example.ex: There were two helicopters circling around.
example.tran: 有两架直升机在空中盘旋。

collins.def: To circle around someone or something, or to circle them, means to move around them.

example.ex: Emily kept circling around her mother...
example.tran: 埃米莉围着她妈妈转个不停。

example.ex: The silent wolves would track and circle them.
example.tran: 悄无声息的群狼会跟踪并包围他们。

collins.def: If you circle something on a piece of paper, you draw a circle around it.

example.ex: Circle the correct answers on the coupon below.
example.tran: 将下面参赛券上的正确答案圈出来。

collins.tran: (指朋友或有相同兴趣或职业的人组成的)圈子，界
collins.def: You can refer to a group of people as a circle when they meet each other regularly because they are friends or because they belong to the same profession or share the same interests.

example.ex: He has a small circle of friends...
example.tran: 他的朋友圈子很小。

example.ex: Alton has made himself fiercely unpopular in certain circles.
example.tran: 奥尔顿把自己搞得在某些圈子里极其不受欢迎。

collins.def: In a theatre or cinema, the circle is an area of seats on the upper floor.

collins.tran: 兜了一圈回到原地;循环
collins.def: If you say that you have come full circle or have turned full circle, you mean that after a long series of events or changes the same situation that you started with still exists.

example.ex: We've come full circle and dark-blue jeans are once again the height of style.
example.tran: 风水轮流转，时下最流行的又是深蓝色牛仔裤了。

collins.tran: 在原地兜圈子;原地踏步;毫无进展
collins.def: If you say that someone is going round in circles or around in circles, you mean that they are not achieving anything because they keep coming back to the same point or problem.
If you deliver something somewhere, you take it there.

example.ex: The Canadians plan to deliver more food to southern Somalia...
example.tran: 加拿大计划向索马里南部地区运送更多的食品。

example.ex: The spy returned to deliver a second batch of classified documents...
example.tran: 那名间谍返回来递送第二批机密文件。

collins.def: If you deliver something that you have promised to do, make, or produce, you do, make, or produce it.

example.ex: They have yet to show that they can really deliver working technologies...
example.tran: 他们尚未证明自己真的能够开发出实用技术。

example.ex: ... proving they could deliver the vote in their areas...
example.tran: 证明他们能够得到自己选区的选票

collins.def: If you deliver a person or thing into someone's care, you give them responsibility for that person or thing.

example.ex: Mrs Montgomery was delivered into Mr Hinchcliffe's care...
example.tran: 蒙哥马利夫人托给了欣奇利夫先生照顾。

example.ex: David delivered Holly gratefully into the woman's outstretched arms...
example.tran: 戴维非常感激地把霍利送进那个女人张开的双臂中。

collins.def: If you deliver a lecture or speech, you give it in public.

example.ex: The president will deliver a speech about schools...
example.tran: 总统将就学校问题发表讲话。

example.ex: It is shocking that only one woman has delivered the lecture in 44 years.
example.tran: 在 44 年间仅有一名女性作过讲座，这真令人震惊。

collins.def: When someone delivers a baby, they help the woman who is giving birth to the baby.

example.ex: Her husband had to deliver the baby himself.
example.tran: 她丈夫不得不自己接生孩子。

collins.def: If someone delivers a blow to someone else, they hit them.

example.ex: Those blows to the head could have been delivered by a woman.
example.tran: 头部所受的那些重击有可能出自一个女人之手。

collins.def: If someone delivers you from something, they rescue or save you from it.

example.ex: I have given thanks to God for delivering me from that pain.
example.tran: 我感谢上帝把我从那种痛苦中拯救出来。

collins.def: A man's suit consists of a jacket, trousers, and sometimes a waistcoat, all made from the same fabric.

example.ex: ...a dark pinstriped business suit.
example.tran: 黑色的细条纹正装

example.ex: ...a smart suit and tie.
example.tran: 帅气的西装和领带

collins.def: A woman's suit consists of a jacket and skirt, or sometimes trousers, made from the same fabric.

example.ex: I was wearing my tweed suit.
example.tran: 我穿着我的花呢套装。

collins.tran: (从事特定活动时穿的)成套服装
collins.def: A particular type of suit is a piece of clothing that you wear for a particular activity.

example.ex: ...a completely revolutionary atmospheric diving suit.
example.tran: 令人耳目一新的大气压潜水服

collins.tran: 对…方便;满足…需要;合…心意
collins.def: If something suits you, it is convenient for you or is the best thing for you in the circumstances.

example.ex: They will only release information if it suits them...
example.tran: 他们只会发布对他们有利的信息。

example.ex: They should be able to find you the best package to suit your needs.
example.tran: 他们应该能提供满足你需要的最佳套餐。

collins.def: If something suits you, you like it.

example.ex: I don't think a sedentary life would altogether suit me.
example.tran: 我认为长期伏案的生活一点也不适合我。

collins.tran: (服装、风格、颜色)使显得漂亮，与…相配;适合
collins.def: If a piece of clothing or a particular style or colour suits you, it makes you look attractive.

example.ex: Green suits you.
example.tran: 绿色很配你。

collins.tran: 随自己的意愿;随性子;自便
collins.def: If you suit yourself, you do something just because you want to do it, without bothering to consider other people.

example.ex: These large institutions make — and change—the rules to suit themselves...
example.tran: 这些大机构总是随意制定规定，而且说变就变。

example.ex: He made a dismissive gesture. 'Suit yourself.'
example.tran: 他做了一个很不屑的手势。“随你便。”

collins.def: In a court of law, a suit is a case in which someone tries to get a legal decision against a person or company, often so that the person or company will have to pay them money for having done something wrong to them.

example.ex: Up to 2,000 former employees have filed personal injury suits against the company...
example.tran: 多达 2,000 名旧职员以个人伤害为由向该公司提起诉讼。

example.ex: The judge dismissed the suit.
example.tran: 法官驳回了诉讼。

collins.def: A suit is one of the four types of card in a set of playing cards. These are hearts, diamonds, clubs, and spades.
If people follow suit, they do the same thing that someone else has just done.

example.ex: Efforts to persuade the remainder to follow suit have continued.
example.tran: 说服其余人跟着效仿的努力仍在继续。

collins.def: If something suits you down to the ground, you like it a great deal or find it very convenient.

example.ex: Their London house suits them down to the ground.
example.tran: 他们在伦敦的房子很合他们心意。

collins.def: When you respond to something that is done or said, you react to it by doing or saying something yourself.

example.ex: They are likely to respond positively to the President's request for aid...
example.tran: 他们可能会对总统的援助要求作出积极回应。

example.ex: The army responded with gunfire and tear gas...
example.tran: 军队用炮火和催泪瓦斯予以反击。

collins.tran: 应对;作出回应;作出反应
collins.def: When you respond to a need, crisis, or challenge, you take the necessary or appropriate action.

example.ex: This modest group size allows our teachers to respond to the needs of each student.
example.tran: 这样的小组规模适中，可以使老师照顾到每一个学生的需求。

collins.tran: 有良好反应;有积极效果
collins.def: If a patient or their injury or illness is responding to treatment, the treatment is working and they are getting better.

example.ex: I'm pleased to say that he is now doing well and responding to treatment.
example.tran: 我很高兴地说，他现在恢复得不错，治疗取得了积极的效果。

collins.tran: 从政者，政治家（尤指议会或国会成员）
collins.def: A politician is a person whose job is in politics, especially a member of parliament or congress.

example.ex: They have arrested a number of leading opposition politicians.
example.tran: 他们已经逮捕了数名反对党领袖。

collins.def: A package is a small parcel.

example.ex: I tore open the package.
example.tran: 我撕开了那个包裹。

example.ex: ...a package addressed to Miss Claire Montgomery.
example.tran: 寄给克莱尔·蒙哥马利小姐的包裹

collins.def: A package is a small container in which a quantity of something is sold. Packages are either small boxes made of thin cardboard, or bags or envelopes made of paper or plastic.

example.ex: ...a package of doughnuts...
example.tran: 一包炸面圈

example.ex: It is listed among the ingredients on the package.
example.tran: 它是包装盒标明的成分之一。

collins.def: A package is a set of proposals that are made by a government or organization and which must be accepted or rejected as a group.

example.ex: The government has announced a package of measures to help the British film industry...
example.tran: 政府已经公布了帮助英国电影产业的一揽子措施。

example.ex: They put together a Western economic aid package for Moscow.
example.tran: 他们为莫斯科准备了一整套西方经济援助计划。

collins.def: When a product is packaged, it is put into containers to be sold.

example.ex: The beans are then ground and packaged for sale as ground coffee...
example.tran: 然后那些咖啡豆被磨碎，包装好作为咖啡粉出售。

example.ex: Packaged foods have to show a list of ingredients.
example.tran: 包装食品必须列出食品成分。

collins.tran: （为提高吸引力或趣味性而）包装
collins.def: If something is packaged in a particular way, it is presented or advertised in that way in order to make it seem attractive or interesting.

example.ex: A city has to be packaged properly to be attractive to tourists.
example.tran: 城市必须进行适当的包装以吸引游客。

example.ex: ...entertainment packaged as information.
example.tran: 被包装成知识性节目的娱乐节目

collins.def: A package tour, or in British English a package holiday, is a holiday arranged by a travel company in which your travel and your accommodation are booked for you.

example.ex: If you are on a package holiday, your travel company's rep should act on your behalf.
example.tran: 如果你是参加包价旅游，你的旅行社代表将代为行事。

collins.tran: (拥有共同信仰、思想或目标的)运动，运动团体
collins.def: A movement is a group of people who share the same beliefs, ideas, or aims.

example.ex: It's part of a broader Hindu nationalist movement that's gaining strength throughout the country.
example.tran: 这是一场凝聚全国力量的更大规模的印度教民族主义运动的一部分。

example.ex: ...the women's movement.
example.tran: 妇女运动

collins.def: Movement involves changing position or going from one place to another.

example.ex: They actually monitor the movement of the fish going up river.
example.tran: 他们实际上在监测鱼类迁往上游的活动。

example.ex: ...the plan for free movement of people, goods, capital and services across internal Community borders...
example.tran: 劳动力、货物、资本和服务在共同体各成员国间自由流动的计划

collins.tran: (军队作战或演习时的)调遣，调动
collins.def: A movement is a planned change in position that an army makes during a battle or military exercise.

example.ex: There are reports of fresh troop movements across the border.
example.tran: 有报告说，新近有军队越过边境。

collins.tran: (态度、观点、政策等的)逐渐变化，趋势，动向
collins.def: Movement is a gradual development or change of an attitude, opinion, or policy.

example.ex: ...the movement towards democracy in Latin America...
example.tran: 拉丁美洲的民主进程

example.ex: There was a very good atmosphere at the talks and the participants believed movement forward was possible.
example.tran: 会谈气氛非常融洽，与会者相信会取得进展。

collins.tran: (某人在某一时期内的)行动，活动，动向
collins.def: Your movements are everything which you do or plan to do during a period of time.

example.ex: I want a full account of your movements the night Mr Gower was killed.
example.tran: 请你完整地描述一下高尔先生被杀的那天晚上你的一切行踪。

collins.def: A movement of a piece of classical music is one of its main sections.

example.ex: ...the first movement of Beethoven's 7th symphony.
example.tran: 贝多芬《第七交响曲》第一乐章

collins.tran: 新的;替代的;另外的;外加的
collins.def: A fresh thing or amount replaces or is added to a previous thing or amount.

example.ex: He asked Strathclyde police, which carried out the original investigation, to make fresh inquiries...
example.tran: 他要求原来负责案子的斯特拉斯克莱德警方展开新一轮的调查。

example.ex: I need a new challenge and a fresh start somewhere else.
example.tran: 我需要一个新的挑战，换个地方重新开始。

collins.def: Something that is fresh has been done, made, or experienced recently.

example.ex: There were no fresh car tracks or footprints in the snow...
example.tran: 雪地里没有留下新的车辙或脚印。

example.ex: A puppy stepped in the fresh cement...
example.tran: 一只小狗踩在刚抹好的水泥面上。

collins.tran: (食物)新鲜的，非冷冻的,非罐装的
collins.def: Fresh food has been picked or produced recently, and has not been preserved, for example by being frozen or put in a tin.

example.ex: ...locally caught fresh fish.
example.tran: 当地捕到的鲜鱼

example.ex: ...fresh fruit.
example.tran: 新鲜水果

collins.tran: 新颖的;别致的;有独创性的
collins.def: If you describe something as fresh, you like it because it is new and exciting.

example.ex: These designers are full of fresh ideas.
example.tran: 这些设计师满脑子都是新创意。

example.ex: ...a fresh image.
example.tran: 新颖的意象

collins.def: If you describe something as fresh, you mean that it is pleasant, bright, and clean in appearance.

example.ex: Gingham fabrics always look fresh and pretty.
example.tran: 方格花布织物看上去总是鲜亮好看。

collins.def: If something smells, tastes, or feels fresh, it is clean or cool.

example.ex: The air was fresh and for a moment she felt revived.
example.tran: 空气清新，有那么一会儿她感到恢复了活力。

collins.def: Fresh water is water that is not salty, for example the water from rivers or lakes.

example.ex: Fresh water and other commodities are in short supply.
example.tran: 淡水和其他商品短缺。

collins.def: If you say that the weather is fresh, you mean that it is fairly cold and windy.

example.ex: It was a fine, fresh summer morning...
example.tran: 那是一个晴好而清寒的夏日早晨。

example.ex: Outside the breeze was fresh and from the north.
example.tran: 外面凉飕飕的微风从北面吹来。

collins.def: Fresh colours are clear, bright, and fairly light.

example.ex: ...a semi-circular mosaic, its startling colours still fresh.
example.tran: 令人惊叹的颜色依旧鲜艳的半圆形镶嵌画

collins.def: If someone has a fresh face or complexion, their skin looks healthy.

example.ex: His fresh complexion made him look younger than he was.
example.tran: 他的好气色令他看上去比实际年龄年轻。

collins.tran: 精神抖擞的;精力充沛的
collins.def: If you feel fresh, you feel full of energy and enthusiasm.

example.ex: It's vital we are as fresh as possible for those matches...
example.tran: 尽可能保持旺盛的精力参加那几场比赛对我们来说至关重要。

example.ex: I nearly always wake up fresh and rested.
example.tran: 我几乎每天醒来都精神抖擞，得到了充分休息。

collins.def: Fresh paint is not yet dry.
If you are fresh from a particular place or experience, you have just come from that place or you have just had that experience. You can also say that someone is fresh out of a place.

example.ex: I returned to the office, fresh from Heathrow...
example.tran: 我刚从希思罗机场回到办公室。

example.ex: Fresh from their semi-final win over Germany, Britain took a promising early lead...
example.tran: 刚刚在半决赛中战胜德国队的英国队开场便取得了领先，形势一片大好。

collins.tran: 刚用完…的;一点儿不剩的
collins.def: If you are fresh out of something, you have recently used the last of it and have none left.

example.ex: When I needed a tape to record an interview on I found I was fresh out of cassettes.
example.tran: 我想找一盘带子为访谈录音时发现磁带刚刚都用完了。

collins.def: A professor in a British university is the most senior teacher in a department.

example.ex: ...Professor Cameron...
example.tran: 卡梅伦教授

example.ex: In 1979, only 2% of British professors were female.
example.tran: 1979年，英国只有2%的教授是女性。

collins.tran: （美国或加拿大的）大学教师，学院教师
collins.def: A professor in an American or Canadian university or college is a teacher of the highest rank.

example.ex: Robert Dunn is a professor of economics at George Washington University.
example.tran: 罗伯特·达恩是乔治·华盛顿大学经济学的教师。

collins.tran: 商店(英国英语中主要指大型百货商店，而美国英语中可指任何规模的商店)
collins.def: A store is a building or part of a building where things are sold. In British English, store is used mainly to refer to a large shop selling a variety of goods, but in American English a store can be any size of shop.

example.ex: Bombs were planted in stores in Manchester and Blackpool.
example.tran: 炸弹被安放在曼彻斯特和布莱克浦的几家商店里。

example.ex: ...grocery stores.
example.tran: 杂货店

collins.def: When you store things, you put them in a container or other place and leave them there until they are needed.

example.ex: Store the cookies in an airtight tin...
example.tran: 把饼干贮存在一个密封罐里。

example.ex: Some types of garden furniture must be stored inside in the winter.
example.tran: 有几类花园家具冬季必须存放在室内。

collins.def: When you store information, you keep it in your memory, in a file, or in a computer.

example.ex: Where in the brain do we store information about colours?
example.tran: 我们在大脑的哪个部位储存有关颜色的信息？

example.ex: ...chips for storing data in electronic equipment.
example.tran: 用于在电子仪器中储存数据的芯片

collins.def: A store of things is a supply of them that you keep somewhere until you need them.

example.ex: I handed over my secret store of chocolate biscuits...
example.tran: 我交出了自己偷偷藏起来的巧克力饼干。

example.ex: Dolly's store of drinking glasses had run out.
example.tran: 多利存放的酒杯已经用完了。

collins.def: A store is a place where things are kept while they are not being used.

example.ex: ...a decision taken in 1982 to build a store for spent fuel from submarines.
example.tran: 1982 年作出的为潜艇废燃料建立一个储存库的决定

example.ex: ...a grain store.
example.tran: 粮仓

collins.def: If you have a store of knowledge, jokes, or stories, you have a large amount of them ready to be used.

example.ex: He possessed a vast store of knowledge...
example.tran: 他知识渊博。

example.ex: Jessica dipped into her store of theatrical anecdotes.
example.tran: 杰西卡翻阅了自己收集的大量演艺界的趣闻轶事资料。

collins.tran: 就要出现在…身上;即将发生在…身上
collins.def: If something is in store for you, it is going to happen at some time in the future.

example.ex: There were also surprises in store for me...
example.tran: 也有一些令人吃惊的事在等着我。

example.ex: Who knows what lies in store for the President?
example.tran: 谁知道总统将要面临什么？

collins.tran: 重视;珍惜;认为…极为必要
collins.def: If you set great store by something, you think that it is extremely important or necessary.

example.ex: ...a retail group which sets great store by traditional values.
example.tran: 重视传统价值观念的零售团体

collins.def: The twelfth item in a series is the one that you count as number twelve.

example.ex: ...the twelfth anniversary of the April revolution.
example.tran: 四月革命 12 周年纪念

example.ex: ...a twelfth-century church.
example.tran: 12 世纪的教堂

collins.def: A twelfth is one of twelve equal parts of something.

example.ex: She is entitled to a twelfth of the cash.
example.tran: 她有权获得这笔钱的 1/12。

collins.def: A poll is a survey in which people are asked their opinions about something, usually in order to find out how popular something is or what people intend to do in the future.

example.ex: Polls show that the European treaty has gained support in Denmark...
example.tran: 民意测验显示该欧盟条约已在丹麦获得支持。

example.ex: We are doing a weekly poll on the president, and clearly his popularity has declined...
example.tran: 我们每周就总统进行一次民意调查，很显然他的支持率下降了。

collins.tran: 对…进行民意测验（或调查）
collins.def: If you are polled on something, you are asked what you think about it as part of a survey.

example.ex: More than 18,000 people were polled...
example.tran: 超过1.8万人接受了民意测验。

example.ex: Audiences were going to be polled on which of three pieces of contemporary music they liked best...
example.tran: 将对观众进行民意调查，询问他们在3部当代音乐作品中最喜欢哪一部。

collins.tran: 政治选举；大选；投票地点
collins.def: The polls means an election for a country's government, or the place where people go to vote in an election.

example.ex: In 1945, Winston Churchill was defeated at the polls...
example.tran: 温斯顿·丘吉尔在1945年的大选中被击败。

example.ex: Voters are due to go to the polls on Sunday to elect a new president...
example.tran: 选民应于星期日前往投票站选举新总统。

collins.def: If a political party or a candidate polls a particular number or percentage of votes, they get that number or percentage of votes in an election.

example.ex: It was a disappointing result for the Greens who polled three percent...
example.tran: 这个结果让绿党感到失望，他们只获得了3%的选票。

example.ex: The result showed he had polled enough votes to force a second ballot.
example.tran: 结果显示，他已获得了足够把对手拖入二次投票的票数。

collins.def: Wine is an alcoholic drink which is made from grapes. You can also refer to alcoholic drinks made from other fruits or vegetables as wine .

example.ex: ...a bottle of white wine...
example.tran: 一瓶白葡萄酒

example.ex: This is a nice wine.
example.tran: 这种葡萄酒味道不错。

collins.def: Wine is used to describe things that are very dark red in colour.

example.ex: She wore her wine-coloured gaberdine raincoat.
example.tran: 她穿着深红色华达呢雨衣。

example.ex: ...an olive and wine wool sweater.
example.tran: 橄榄绿与深红色相间的羊毛衫

collins.def: If you wine and dine, or if someone wines and dines you, you go out, for example to expensive restaurants, and spend a lot of money.

example.ex: Colleagues were furious at doing her work while she wined and dined...
example.tran: 同事们干着她的活儿，而她却在外面大吃大喝，这让大家都气坏了。

example.ex: A lot of money went on wining and dining prospective clients.
example.tran: 很多钱都花在宴请潜在客户上了。

collins.def: Taste is one of the five senses that people have. When you have food or drink in your mouth, your sense of taste makes it possible for you to recognize what it is.

example.ex: ...a keen sense of taste.
example.tran: 灵敏的味觉

collins.def: The taste of something is the individual quality which it has when you put it in your mouth and which distinguishes it from other things. For example, something may have a sweet, bitter, sour, or salty taste.

example.ex: I like the taste of wine and enjoy trying different kinds...
example.tran: 我喜欢葡萄酒的味道，喜欢品尝不同的口味。

example.ex: The taste of blood in her throat made her want to vomit...
example.tran: 她嗓子里的血腥味让她直恶心。

collins.def: If you have a taste of some food or drink, you try a small amount of it in order to see what the flavour is like.

example.ex: We have a taste of the white wine he's brought.
example.tran: 我们尝了尝他带来的白葡萄酒。

collins.def: If food or drink tastes of something, it has that particular flavour, which you notice when you eat or drink it.

example.ex: I drank a cup of tea that tasted of diesel...
example.tran: 我喝了杯有股柴油味的茶。

example.ex: It tastes like chocolate...
example.tran: 它吃起来像巧克力。

collins.def: If you taste some food or drink, you eat or drink a small amount of it in order to try its flavour, for example to see if you like it or not.

example.ex: He finished his aperitif and tasted the wine the waiter had produced...
example.tran: 他喝完开胃酒，又尝了点侍者端来的葡萄酒。

example.ex: Before proceeding any further, cut off a small bit of the meat and taste it.
example.tran: 在进行下一步之前，先切一小块肉尝尝。

collins.def: If you can taste something that you are eating or drinking, you are aware of its flavour.

example.ex: You can taste the chilli in the dish but it is a little sweet.
example.tran: 你可以尝出菜里面有辣椒，不过味道有点甜。

collins.def: If you have a taste of a particular way of life or activity, you have a brief experience of it.

example.ex: But having had a taste of the big time, he won't want to go back to playing in the reserves...
example.tran: 但是，有过一举成名的经历以后，他就不会再想回去当替补了。

example.ex: This voyage was his first taste of freedom.
example.tran: 这次航行使他初次体验到了自由的滋味。

collins.def: If you taste something such as a way of life or a pleasure, you experience it for a short period of time.

example.ex: Anyone who has tasted this life wants it to carry on for as long as possible.
example.tran: 任何过过这种日子的人都希望它持续得越久越好。

collins.def: If you have a taste for something, you have a liking or preference for it.

example.ex: She developed a taste for journeys to isolated hazardous regions in North America...
example.tran: 她喜欢上了到北美那些险象环生的偏远地区旅行。

example.ex: That gave me a taste for reading.
example.tran: 那使我喜欢上了读书。

collins.def: A person's taste is their choice in the things that they like or buy, for example their clothes, possessions, or music. If you say that someone has good taste, you mean that you approve of their choices. If you say that they have poor taste, you disapprove of their choices.

example.ex: His taste in clothes is extremely good...
example.tran: 他在穿衣方面很有品味。

example.ex: Oxford's social circle was far too liberal for her taste.
example.tran: 牛津的社交圈过于开放，不合她的胃口。

collins.tran: 格调庸俗的/格调高雅的;没品位的/高品位的;不合时宜的/得体的
collins.def: If you say that something that is said or done is in bad taste or in poor taste, you mean that it is offensive, often because it concerns death or sex and is inappropriate for the situation. If you say that something is in good taste, you mean that it is not offensive and that it is appropriate for the situation.

example.ex: He rejects the idea that his film is in bad taste...
example.tran: 他不接受那种认为他的电影格调不高的观点。

example.ex: I do not feel your actions were either appropriate or done in good taste.
example.tran: 我认为你的行为既不妥当又不合时宜。

collins.def: When a recipe tells you to add a particular spice or other flavouring to taste, it means that you can add as much of that ingredient as you like.

example.ex: Add tomato paste, salt and pepper to taste.
example.tran: 酌量添加番茄酱、盐和胡椒粉。

collins.def: If one thing indicates another, the first thing shows that the second is true or exists.

example.ex: A survey of retired people has indicated that most are independent and enjoying life...
example.tran: 对退休人员的调查表明，大部分人都自食其力,享受生活。

example.ex: Our vote today indicates a change in United States policy...
example.tran: 我们今天的选举表明了美国政策的一种变化。

collins.def: If you indicate an opinion, an intention, or a fact, you mention it in an indirect way.

example.ex: Mr Rivers has indicated that he may resign...
example.tran: 里弗斯先生暗示他可能会辞职。

example.ex: U.S. authorities have not yet indicated their monetary policy plans.
example.tran: 美国当局尚未透露他们的货币政策计划。

collins.def: If you indicate something to someone, you show them where it is, especially by pointing to it.

example.ex: He indicated a chair. 'Sit down.'
example.tran: 他指着一把椅子说，“坐下。”

example.ex: Pelham moved across to indicate a wall chart.
example.tran: 佩勒姆走过去指着一张挂图。

collins.def: If one thing indicates something else, it is a sign of that thing.

example.ex: Dreams can help indicate your true feelings...
example.tran: 梦可以反映你的真实感情。

example.ex: His language indicates a poor education.
example.tran: 他的言语反映出他没受过多少教育。

collins.def: If a technical instrument indicates something, it shows a measurement or reading.

example.ex: The needles that indicate your height are at the top right-hand corner...
example.tran: 显示你身高的指针在右上角。

example.ex: The temperature gauge indicated that it was boiling.
example.tran: 温度计显示它在沸腾。

collins.def: When drivers indicate, they make lights flash on one side of their vehicle to show that they are going to turn in that direction.

example.ex: He told us when to indicate and when to change gear.
example.tran: 他告诉我们何时打转向灯、何时换挡。

collins.def: When you recall something, you remember it and tell others about it.

example.ex: Henderson recalled that he first met Pollard during a business trip to Washington...
example.tran: 亨德森记起他第一次见到波拉德是在一次去华盛顿出差的时候。

example.ex: Her teacher recalled: 'She was always on about modelling.'...
example.tran: 她的老师回忆说：“她那时老是说要当模特。”

collins.tran: （用于引出双方都已意识到的事）记得
collins.def: You can say as I recall ,you might recall, or you will recall to someone that you are talking to when you want to mention something that you are both already aware of which is relevant to the discussion.

example.ex: As I recall, you're not on the board, Joe; you're only a minor shareholder...
example.tran: 我记得你并没有进董事会，乔，你只是一个小股东而已。

example.ex: You will recall that I sent you a warning of troubled times. Well now, almost everything I forecast has come about.
example.tran: 你还记得我警告过你时局会出现动荡吧。现在看来，几乎我预测的每件事都发生了。

collins.def: Recall is the ability to remember something that has happened in the past or the act of remembering it.

example.ex: He had a good memory, and total recall of her spoken words.
example.tran: 他记忆力很好，她当时说的话他全都记得起来。

collins.def: If you are recalled to your home, country, or the place where you work, you are ordered to return there.

example.ex: Spain has recalled its Ambassador after a row over refugees seeking asylum at the embassy...
example.tran: 在对难民到使馆寻求庇护一事产生严重分歧后，西班牙召回了其大使。

example.ex: Parliament was recalled from its summer recess.
example.tran: 国会在夏季休会之后又重新开议。

collins.def: In sport, if a player is recalled to a team, he or she is included in that team again after being left out.

example.ex: Dean Richards was recalled to the England squad for the match with Wales...
example.tran: 迪安·理查兹被召回英格兰队参加对阵威尔士的比赛。

example.ex: I had done enough after being recalled against Pakistan to have got on the tour to India.
example.tran: 在被征召入队参加与巴基斯坦的比赛后，我为前往印度的行程做了充分准备。

collins.def: If a company recalls a product, it asks the shops or the people who have bought that product to return it because there is something wrong with it.

example.ex: The company said it was recalling one of its drugs...
example.tran: 这个公司说正在召回他们生产的一种药。

example.ex: More than 3,000 cars were recalled yesterday because of a brake problem.
example.tran: 3,000多辆汽车因为刹车问题昨天被召回。

collins.tran: 记不起来；无法忆起；无法恢复原状；面目全非
collins.def: If something is beyond recall, it is no longer possible to remember how it was or to bring it back to its original condition.

example.ex: The ground has been polluted beyond recall...
example.tran: 这片土地已被污染得面目全非。

example.ex: ...the realities of operating a traditional canal boat can be readily imagined, even if the life itself is beyond recall.
example.tran: 经营一艘传统的运河船的现实情形很容易想象，尽管那种生活本身已经无法忆起了。

collins.def: You use finally to suggest that something happens after a long period of time, usually later than you wanted or expected it to happen.

example.ex: The word was finally given for us to get on board...
example.tran: 终于通知我们登乘了。

example.ex: The food finally arrived at the end of last week and distribution began...
example.tran: 食品总算在上周末运到并开始分发。

collins.def: You use finally to indicate that something is last in a series of actions or events.

example.ex: The action slips from comedy to melodrama and finally to tragedy.
example.tran: 剧情从喜剧逐渐发展为情节剧，最后又演变为悲剧。

collins.tran: (用于引出观点等)最后，最后要说的是
collins.def: You use finally in speech or writing to introduce a final point, question, or topic.

example.ex: Finally, who needs the theatre?...
example.tran: 最后要说的是，谁还需要剧院呢？

example.ex: And finally, a word about the winner and runner-up.
example.tran: 最后，来谈一谈冠亚军。

means: 诉说，申诉，控告[后面常跟从句]

collins.def: If you complain about a situation, you say that you are not satisfied with it.

example.ex: Miners have complained bitterly that the government did not fulfill their promises...
example.tran: 矿工们愤愤不平地抱怨说政府没有履行诺言。

example.ex: The American couple complained about the high cost of visiting Europe...
example.tran: 这对美国夫妇抱怨到欧洲旅行的花销太高。

collins.def: If you complain of pain or illness, you say that you are feeling pain or feeling ill.

example.ex: He complained of a headache.
example.tran: 他说头痛。

means: 造园，开辟（一小片土地）作为花园

collins.tran: （住宅旁的）花园，菜园，庭园，园子（美国英语中表示此义时常用yard，而garden仅用来指花园和菜园）
collins.def: In British English, a garden is a piece of land next to a house, with flowers, vegetables, other plants, and often grass. In American English, the usual word is yard, and a garden refers only to land which is used for growing flowers and vegetables.

example.ex: ...the most beautiful garden on Earth.
example.tran: 世界上最漂亮的花园

collins.def: If you garden, you do work in your garden such as weeding or planting.

example.ex: Jim gardened at the homes of friends on weekends.
example.tran: 吉姆周末帮忙打理朋友家的花园。

collins.def: Gardens are places like a park that have areas of plants, trees, and grass, and that people can visit and walk around.

example.ex: The Gardens are open from 10.30am until 5pm.
example.tran: 公园从上午10点半到下午5点之间开放。

example.ex: ...Kensington Gardens.
example.tran: 肯辛顿公园

collins.def: Gardens is sometimes used as part of the name of a street.

example.ex: He lives at 9, Acacia Gardens.
example.tran: 他住在金合欢街9号。

collins.def: A significant amount or effect is large enough to be important or affect a situation to a noticeable degree.

example.ex: A small but significant number of 11-year-olds are illiterate.
example.tran: 数量不多但仍有相当一部分 11 岁孩子是文盲。

example.ex: ...foods that offer a significant amount of protein...
example.tran: 富含蛋白质的食物

collins.def: A significant fact, event, or thing is one that is important or shows something.

example.ex: Time would appear to be the significant factor in this whole drama.
example.tran: 时间似乎是整部剧中一个举足轻重的因素。

example.ex: ...a very significant piece of legislation...
example.tran: 一条非常重要的法规

collins.tran: 别有含义的;意味深远的
collins.def: A significant action or gesture is intended to have a special meaning.

example.ex: Mrs Bycraft gave Rose a significant glance.
example.tran: 拜克拉夫特夫人意味深长地瞥了罗丝一眼。

means: 从科学实验中提取的价值

collins.tran: （尤指可用于分析的）资料，材料，数据（美国英语中通常用作复数名词;在专业或正式的英国英语中有时用作复数名词，有时用作不可数名词)
collins.def: You can refer to information as data, especially when it is in the form of facts or statistics that you can analyse. In American English, data is usually a plural noun. In technical or formal British English, data is sometimes a plural noun, but at other times, it is an uncount noun.

example.ex: The study was based on data from 2,100 women...
example.tran: 这项研究基于从 2,100 名女性那里收集来的资料。

example.ex: ...the latest year for which data is available...
example.tran: 有可利用资料的最近的年份

collins.tran: (可存储并为计算机程序所用的）数据
collins.def: Data is information that can be stored and used by a computer program.

example.ex: You can compress huge amounts of data on to a CD-ROM.
example.tran: 可以把大量的数据压缩到一张CD-ROM上。

collins.def: A straight line or edge continues in the same direction and does not bend or curve.

example.ex: Keep the boat in a straight line...
example.tran: 让船保持直线航行。

example.ex: Using the straight edge as a guide, trim the cloth to size...
example.tran: 用直尺比照着，将布料裁剪成合适的尺寸。

collins.def: Straight hair has no curls or waves in it.

example.ex: Grace had long straight dark hair which she wore in a bun.
example.tran: 格雷斯把一头长长的黑色直发盘成发髻。

collins.def: You use straight to indicate that the way from one place to another is very direct, with no changes of direction.

example.ex: The ball fell straight to the feet of Klinsmann...
example.tran: 球直接落到了克林斯曼的脚上。

example.ex: He finished his conversation and stood up, looking straight at me...
example.tran: 他说完话站起来，直视着我。

collins.def: If you go straight to a place, you go there immediately.

example.ex: As always, we went straight to the experts for advice...
example.tran: 像往常一样，我们马上去找专家咨询。

example.ex: We'll go to a meeting in Birmingham and come straight back.
example.tran: 我们将去伯明翰参加会议，然后马上回来。

collins.tran: 直截了当的;直率的;坦诚的
collins.def: If you give someone a straight answer, you answer them clearly and honestly.

example.ex: What a shifty arguer he is, refusing ever to give a straight answer.
example.tran: 他真是个狡诈的辩论家，总是拒绝给出直截了当的回答。

collins.def: Straight means following one after the other, with no gaps or intervals.

example.ex: They'd won 12 straight games before they lost.
example.tran: 他们在输掉比赛之前已连续赢了12场。

collins.tran: 只涉及两人(或两物)的;(选择)非此即彼的
collins.def: A straight choice or a straight fight involves only two people or things.

example.ex: It's a straight choice between low-paid jobs and no jobs...
example.tran: 只有两个选择：要么是报酬很低的工作，要么就是失业。

example.ex: Each has several times beaten the other in a straight fight.
example.tran: 双方都曾在单打比赛中击败过对方几次。

collins.tran: 正经的;正统的;规矩本分的
collins.def: If you describe someone as straight, you mean that they are normal and conventional, for example in their opinions and in the way they live.

example.ex: Dorothy was described as a very straight woman, a very strict Christian who was married to her job.
example.tran: 多萝西被形容成一个非常正统的女人，一个尽职尽责、非常虔诚的基督徒。

collins.def: If you describe someone as straight, you mean that they are heterosexual rather than homosexual.

example.ex: His sexual orientation was a lot more gay than straight...
example.tran: 从他的性取向来看，他不像异性恋，更像个同性恋。

example.ex: Marty of New York describes herself as a straight female.
example.tran: 纽约的马蒂称自己不是女同性恋者。

collins.tran: (尤指酒精饮料)纯的，不掺水的
collins.def: A straight drink, especially an alcoholic drink, has not had another liquid such as water added to it.

example.ex: ...a large straight whiskey without ice...
example.tran: 不加冰的大杯纯威士忌

example.ex: Children should not drink fruit juices straight.
example.tran: 儿童不应该喝纯果汁。

collins.def: On a racetrack, a straight is a section of the track that is straight, rather than curved.

example.ex: Our cars were clearly too slow along the straights...
example.tran: 我们的赛车在直道上跑得显然太慢了。

example.ex: I went to overtake him on the back straight on the last lap.
example.tran: 最后一圈时我在非终点直道上超过了他。

collins.def: If you get something straight, you make sure that you understand it properly or that someone else does.

example.ex: You need to get your facts straight...
example.tran: 你需要讲清楚你的情况。

example.ex: Let's get things straight. I didn't lunch with her.
example.tran: 咱们把事情说清楚。我没有和她一起吃午饭。

collins.tran: 改过自新;改邪归正;重新做人
collins.def: If a criminal is going straight, they are no longer involved in crime.
If something keeps people on the straight and narrow, it helps to keep them living an honest or healthy life.

example.ex: All her efforts to keep him on the straight and narrow have been rewarded.
example.tran: 她为了让他走正道所作出的一切努力都得到了回报。

collins.def: A stick is a thin branch which has fallen off a tree.

example.ex: ...people carrying bundles of dried sticks to sell for firewood.
example.tran: 背着成捆的干树枝去当薪柴卖的人们

collins.def: A stick is a long thin piece of wood which is used for supporting someone's weight or for hitting people or animals.

example.ex: He looks old and walks with a stick...
example.tran: 他看起来很老，走路时拄着一根拐棍。

example.ex: Crowds armed with sticks and stones took to the streets.
example.tran: 人群手持棍棒和石块走上了街头。

collins.tran: (用于某一特定用途的)木条，木棍
collins.def: A stick is a long thin piece of wood which is used for a particular purpose.

example.ex: ...kebab sticks.
example.tran: 烤肉扦

example.ex: ...lolly sticks.
example.tran: 冰棍棍

collins.def: Some long thin objects that are used in sports are called sticks .

example.ex: ...lacrosse sticks.
example.tran: 兜网球棍

example.ex: ...hockey sticks.
example.tran: 曲棍球棍

collins.def: A stick of something is a long thin piece of it.

example.ex: ...a stick of celery.
example.tran: 一根芹菜

example.ex: ...cinnamon sticks.
example.tran: 肉桂条

collins.tran: 严厉的批评;大肆的取笑
collins.def: If you give someone some stick, you criticize them or tease them roughly.

example.ex: It's not motorists who give you the most stick, it's the general public...
example.tran: 对你批评最严厉的并不是驾车人，而是普通民众。

example.ex: I get some stick from the lads because of my faith but I don't mind.
example.tran: 我由于自己的信仰遭到了伙伴们的取笑，但我不在乎。

collins.def: If you say that someone lives in the sticks, you mean that they live a long way from any large cities.

example.ex: He lived out in the sticks somewhere.
example.tran: 他住在某个偏远的乡村。

collins.def: If you say that something is a stick to beat someone with, you mean that it is used, or could be used, as a basis for criticism.

example.ex: Unfortunately historic American fiction is constantly being used as a stick to beat contemporary British writers with.
example.tran: 不幸的是，经典的美国小说经常被用来作为批评当代英国作家的依据。

collins.def: If someone gets the wrong end of the stick or gets hold of the wrong end of the stick, they do not understand something correctly and get the wrong idea about it.
If you say that there are more things than you could or can shake a stick at, you are emphasizing in a humorous way that there are a lot of them.

example.ex: ...a man with more medals than you can shake a stick at.
example.tran: 拥有很多奖章的人

collins.def: To ban something means to state officially that it must not be done, shown, or used.

example.ex: Canada will ban smoking in all offices later this year.
example.tran: 加拿大将从今年晚些时候起在办公场所全面禁烟。

example.ex: Last year arms sales were banned.
example.tran: 去年武器遭禁售。

collins.def: A ban is an official ruling that something must not be done, shown, or used.

example.ex: The General also lifted a ban on political parties.
example.tran: 将军同时取消了对政党的禁令。

collins.def: If you are banned from doing something, you are officially prevented from doing it.

example.ex: He was banned from driving for three years.
example.tran: 他被吊扣驾照3年。

collins.def: If you guess something, you give an answer or provide an opinion which may not be true because you do not have definite knowledge about the matter concerned.

example.ex: The suit was faultless: Wood guessed that he was a very successful publisher or a banker...
example.tran: 西装无可挑剔：伍德推测他可能是个相当成功的出版商或银行家。

example.ex: You can only guess at what mental suffering they endure...
example.tran: 你只能猜测他们忍受着多大的精神痛苦。

collins.def: If you guess that something is the case, you correctly form the opinion that it is the case, although you do not have definite knowledge about it.

example.ex: By now you will have guessed that I'm back in Ireland...
example.tran: 你现在应该已经猜出我回到了爱尔兰了。

example.ex: As you've probably guessed, the problem was electrical...
example.tran: 你们可能已经猜测出来了，这个问题与电有关。

collins.def: A guess is an attempt to give an answer or provide an opinion which may not be true because you do not have definite knowledge about the matter concerned.

example.ex: My guess is that the chance that these vaccines will work is zero...
example.tran: 我猜测这些疫苗根本不可能奏效。

example.ex: He'd taken her pulse and made a guess at her blood pressure...
example.tran: 他给她把过脉，估量了她的血压。

collins.def: If you say that something is anyone's guess or anybody's guess, you mean that no-one can be certain about what is really true.

example.ex: Just when this will happen is anyone's guess...
example.tran: 谁也说不准这事什么时候会发生。

example.ex: It's anybody's  guess what happened.
example.tran: 谁也说不清发生了什么事。

collins.def: You say at a guess to indicate that what you are saying is only an estimate or what you believe to be true, rather than being a definite fact.

example.ex: At a guess he's been dead for two days.
example.tran: 据猜测，他已死了两天。

collins.def: You say I guess to show that you are slightly uncertain or reluctant about what you are saying.

example.ex: I guess she thought that was pretty smart...
example.tran: 我想她可能认为那个很漂亮。

example.ex: I guess he's  right...
example.tran: 我认为他是正确的。

collins.def: If someone keeps you guessing, they do not tell you what you want to know.

example.ex: The author's intention is to keep everyone guessing until the bitter end...
example.tran: 这位作家打算把悲惨结局的悬念一直保留到最后。

example.ex: She was keeping everyone guessing about the latest love in her life.
example.tran: 她不让任何人知道自己最近的感情生活。

collins.def: You say guess what to draw attention to something exciting, surprising, or interesting that you are about to say.

example.ex: Guess what, I just got my first part in a movie.
example.tran: 你猜怎么着，我刚刚得到了自己的第一个电影角色。

collins.def: The eightieth item in a series is the one that you count as number eighty.

example.ex: Mr Stevens recently celebrated his eightieth birthday.
example.tran: 史蒂文斯先生最近庆祝了他的80大寿。

means: [印]现代字体，指印刷中所用的一种字体

collins.def: Modern means relating to the present time, for example the present decade or present century.

example.ex: ...the problem of materialism in modern society.
example.tran: 现代社会的实利主义问题

example.ex: ...the risks facing every modern marriage...
example.tran: 所有现代婚姻所面临的危机

collins.tran: 现代化的;新式的;最新的
collins.def: Something that is modern is new and involves the latest ideas or equipment.

example.ex: Modern technology has opened our eyes to many things...
example.tran: 现代科技开阔了我们的眼界，让我们了解了许多事物。

example.ex: In many ways, it was a very modern school for its time...
example.tran: 从很多方面来说，这所学校在当时是非常先进的。

collins.def: People are sometimes described as modern when they have opinions or ways of behaviour that have not yet been accepted by most people in a society.

example.ex: They were very modern Tories in almost every sense...
example.tran: 从几乎所有意义上说，他们都属于非常新潮的保守主义分子。

example.ex: She is  very modern in outlook.
example.tran: 她的观点非常新潮。

collins.tran: (艺术、舞蹈、音乐、建筑的风格)现代的，近代的
collins.def: Modern is used to describe styles of art, dance, music, and architecture that have developed in recent times, in contrast to classical styles.

example.ex: ...a modern dance company.
example.tran: 现代舞蹈团

example.ex: ...the Museum of Modern Art.
example.tran: 现代艺术博物馆

collins.tran: 巡回访问;巡回演出；巡回比赛
collins.def: A tour is an organized trip that people such as musicians, politicians, or theatre companies go on to several different places, stopping to meet people or perform.

example.ex: The band are currently on a two-month tour of Europe...
example.tran: 乐队目前正在欧洲进行为期两个月的巡回演出。

example.ex: It will be the first official cricket tour of South Africa for 22 years.
example.tran: 这将是 22 年来南非首次正式的板球巡回赛。

collins.tran: 作巡回活动(或演出、比赛)
collins.def: When people such as musicians, politicians, or theatre companies tour, they go on a tour, for example in order to perform or to meet people.

example.ex: A few years ago they toured the country in a roadshow...
example.tran: 几年前他们在全国作了巡回演出。

example.ex: He toured for nearly two years and played 500 sell-out shows...
example.tran: 他巡回演出了近两年，500场演出场场爆满。

collins.def: A tour is a journey during which you visit several places that interest you.

example.ex: It was week five of my tour of the major cities of Europe.
example.tran: 那是我在欧洲主要城市游历的第 5 周。

collins.def: A tour is a short trip that you make round a place, for example round a historical building, so that you can look at it.

example.ex: ...a guided tour of a ruined Scottish castle.
example.tran: 由导游带领游览苏格兰荒废城堡

collins.def: If you tour a place, you go on a journey or trip round it.

example.ex: You can also tour the site on modern coaches equipped with videos...
example.tran: 您也可以乘坐配有视频设备的现代化长途汽车游览那处遗址。

example.ex: We toured the streets of Milan.
example.tran: 我们游览了米兰的街道。

collins.def: A victory is a success in a struggle, war, or competition.

example.ex: Union leaders are heading for victory in their battle over workplace rights.
example.tran: 工会领袖们即将赢得争取工作场所权利斗争的胜利。

example.ex: ...the former Welsh rugby union skipper who led Great Britain to victory over France.
example.tran: 率领英国队战胜法国队的前威尔士橄榄球联队队长

collins.def: If you say that someone has won a moral victory, you mean that although they have officially lost a contest or dispute, they have succeeded in showing they are right about something.

example.ex: She said her party had won a moral victory...
example.tran: 她说她的党派虽败犹荣。

example.ex: We stood up to the West, and that's a moral victory.
example.tran: 我们勇敢反抗了西方强权，这是一种精神上的胜利。

collins.def: An island is a piece of land that is completely surrounded by water.

example.ex: ...a wonderful day trip to the picturesque island of Gozo...
example.tran: 到风景如画的戈佐岛享受美妙的一日游

example.ex: We spent a day on Caldey Island.
example.tran: 我们在科尔迪岛上度过了一天。

means: 邀请[常接不定式或从句]

collins.def: If you request something, you ask for it politely or formally.

example.ex: Mr Dennis said he had requested access to a telephone...
example.tran: 丹尼斯先生说他已经请求使用电话。

example.ex: She had requested that the door to her room be left open.
example.tran: 她要求不要关闭通向她房间的门。

collins.def: If you request someone to do something, you politely or formally ask them to do it.

example.ex: They requested him to leave...
example.tran: 他们要求他离开。

example.ex: Students are requested to park at the rear of the Department.
example.tran: 学生必须把车停在该系后面。

collins.def: If you make a request, you politely or formally ask someone to do something.

example.ex: France had agreed to his request for political asylum...
example.tran: 法国已经同意了他寻求政治庇护的请求。

example.ex: Vietnam made an official request that the meeting be postponed.
example.tran: 越南已经正式请求将会议推迟。

collins.def: A request is a song or piece of music which someone has asked a performer or disc jockey to play.

example.ex: If you have any requests, I'd be happy to play them for you.
example.tran: 您点播任何歌曲，我都会很乐意为您演奏。

collins.tran: 应邀;应…的请求;按照…的要求
collins.def: If you do something at someone's request, you do it because they have asked you to.

example.ex: The evacuation is being organised at the request of the United Nations Secretary General.
example.tran: 根据联合国秘书长的要求，正在组织撤退。

collins.def: If something is given or done on request, it is given or done whenever you ask for it.

example.ex: Leaflets giving details are available on request...
example.tran: 备有介绍详情的传单以供索取。

example.ex: Chambermaids will bring an iron or hair dryer on request.
example.tran: 只要提出要求，清理房间的女服务员就会送来熨斗或电吹风。

collins.def: A language is a system of communication which consists of a set of sounds and written symbols which are used by the people of a particular country or region for talking or writing.

example.ex: ...the English language...
example.tran: 英语

example.ex: Students are expected to master a second language...
example.tran: 学生们要掌握一门外语。

collins.def: Language is the use of a system of communication which consists of a set of sounds or written symbols.

example.ex: Students examined how children acquire language...
example.tran: 学生们仔细研究儿童如何习得语言。

example.ex: Language is not art but both are forms of human behavior.
example.tran: 言语不是艺术，但两者都是人类的行为方式。

collins.def: You can refer to the words used in connection with a particular subject as the language of that subject.

example.ex: ...the language of business.
example.tran: 商业用语

collins.def: You can refer to someone's use of rude words or swearing as bad language when you find it offensive.

example.ex: Television companies tend to censor bad language in feature films...
example.tran: 电视公司往往会在审查故事片时删去其中的粗话。

example.ex: There's a girl gonna be in the club, so you guys watch your language.
example.tran: 俱乐部里会有一位女孩，你们男的说话注意点。

collins.def: The language of a piece of writing or speech is the style in which it is written or spoken.

example.ex: ...a booklet summarising it in plain language...
example.tran: 以平实语言对其作出概述的小册子

example.ex: The tone of his language was diplomatic and polite...
example.tran: 他说话圆通得体、彬彬有礼。

collins.tran: 交流方式，交际方式（包括可识别符号、非语言声音、动作等）
collins.def: You can use language to refer to various means of communication involving recognizable symbols, non-verbal sounds, or actions.

example.ex: Some sign languages are very sophisticated means of communication.
example.tran: 有些手语可以表达非常复杂的内容。

example.ex: ...the digital language of computers.
example.tran: 计算机的数字语言

collins.def: The ninth item in a series is the one that you count as number nine.

example.ex: ...January the ninth.
example.tran: 1月9日

example.ex: ...students in the ninth grade.
example.tran: 9年级学生

collins.def: A ninth is one of nine equal parts of something.

example.ex: In Brussels the dollar rose by a ninth of a cent...
example.tran: 在布鲁塞尔美元升值了1/9美分。

example.ex: What you see is only the tip. Eight ninths of it is under the sea.
example.tran: 你看到的只是一角，8/9的部分在海里。

collins.def: Usual is used to describe what happens or what is done most often in a particular situation.

example.ex: It is a neighborhood beset by all the usual inner-city problems...
example.tran: 这是个为各种内城常见问题所困扰的社区。

example.ex: She's smiling her usual friendly smile...
example.tran: 她脸上挂着她一贯的微笑。

collins.def: You use as usual to indicate that you are describing something that normally happens or that is normally the case.

example.ex: As usual there will be the local and regional elections on June the twelfth...
example.tran: 照例，6月12日将会进行地方及区域选举。

example.ex: The front pages are, as usual, a mixture of domestic and foreign news.
example.tran: 像平常一样，头版上刊登着国内外新闻。

collins.tran: （尤指其他事情有变化时）照常
collins.def: If something happens as usual, it happens in the way that it normally does, especially when other things have changed.

example.ex: When somebody died everything went on as usual, as if it had never happened...
example.tran: 就算有人死了一切也都照常进行，好像什么事都没发生过。

example.ex: With medication, life at home goes on as usual.
example.tran: 接受药物治疗后，家里的生活还能一切如常。

collins.def: If one thing or person replaces another, the first is used or acts instead of the second.

example.ex: The council tax replaces the poll tax next April.
example.tran: 市政税在明年4月将取代人头税。

example.ex: ...the city lawyer who replaced Bob as chairman of the company...
example.tran: 取代鲍勃成为公司主席的市政律师

collins.def: If you replace one thing or person with another, you put something or someone else in their place to do their job.

example.ex: I clean out all the grease and replace it with oil so it works better in very low temperatures...
example.tran: 我把所有的油脂清除干净，然后用油来代替，从而使它在低温条件下运转得更好。

example.ex: The BBC decided it could not replace her.
example.tran: 英国广播公司认定那不能取代她。

collins.def: If you replace something that is broken, damaged, or lost, you get a new one to use instead.

example.ex: The shower that we put in a few years back has broken and we cannot afford to replace it.
example.tran: 我们几年前安装的淋浴器坏了，但买不起新的来换。

collins.def: If you replace something, you put it back where it was before.

example.ex: The line went dead. Whitlock replaced the receiver...
example.tran: 线路中断了，惠特洛克把听筒放回原处。

example.ex: Replace the caps on the bottles.
example.tran: 把瓶盖重新盖上。

collins.def: If something is worth a particular amount of money, it can be sold for that amount or is considered to have that value.

example.ex: These books might be worth £80 or £
example.tran: 90 or more to a collector... 这些书对收藏家而言可能值八九十英镑或更多。

example.ex: His mother inherited a farm worth 15,000 dollars a year...
example.tran: 他母亲继承了一处年产值为1.5万美元的农场。

collins.def: Worth combines with amounts of money, so that when you talk about a particular amount of money's worth of something, you mean the quantity of it that you can buy for that amount of money.

example.ex: I went and bought about six dollars' worth of potato chips...
example.tran: 我去买了大约6美元的薯条。

example.ex: Large numbers of deer now roam the forests and are causing thousands of millions of roubles-worth of damage.
example.tran: 现在大批鹿群在森林里游荡，造成价值几十亿卢布的损失。

collins.def: Worth combines with time expressions, so you can use worth when you are saying how long an amount of something will last. For example, a week's worth of food is the amount of food that will last you for a week.

example.ex: You've got three years' worth of research money to do what you want with...
example.tran: 你有可维持3年的研究经费去做自己想做的事。

example.ex: After an hour and a quarter's-worth of cleansing, toning and pampering, the difference to the way my skin felt was remarkable.
example.tran: 经过1小时15分钟的清洁、柔肤和精心护理后，我的皮肤摸上去感觉大不一样。

collins.def: If you say that something is worth having, you mean that it is pleasant or useful, and therefore a good thing to have.

example.ex: He's decided to get a look at the house and see if it might be worth buying...
example.tran: 他决定去瞧瞧那座房子，看是否值得买下。

example.ex: If this was what his job required, then the job wasn't really worth having...
example.tran: 如果这是他的工作所需，那么这份工作真的不值得去做。

collins.tran: 具有(某一行动)的价值;值得(做)
collins.def: If something is worth a particular action, or if an action is worth doing, it is considered to be important enough for that action.

example.ex: No one is worth a great deal of sacrifice...
example.tran: 没有谁值得付出重大的牺牲。

example.ex: I am spending a lot of money and time on this boat, but it is worth it...
example.tran: 我在这艘船上花了很多金钱和时间，但都很值得。

collins.def: Someone's worth is the value, usefulness, or importance that they are considered to have.

example.ex: He had never had a woman of her worth as a friend...
example.tran: 他从来没有过像她这样值得交往的女性朋友。

example.ex: The team would have need of a driver of his worth.
example.tran: 这支队伍需要一位他这样技术水平的司机。

collins.tran: 拼命地; 全力以赴地；热情高涨地
collins.def: If you do something for all you are worth, you do it with a lot of energy and enthusiasm.

example.ex: We both began waving to the crowd for all we were worth...
example.tran: 我们俩开始使劲地朝人群挥手。

example.ex: Push for all you're worth!
example.tran: 使足劲推！

collins.tran: 尽可能地利用;充分利用
collins.def: If someone does something for all it is worth, they do it as much as possible and for as long as they can get benefit from it.

example.ex: You get anywhere with legal aid only by playing the system for all it is worth.
example.tran: 你若想让法律援助多少发挥点作用，只有充分利用这一制度。

example.ex: ...taking an idea and exploiting it for all it's worth.
example.tran: 选取一种观点并对其充分加以挖掘

collins.tran: (尤为避免显得傲慢)不管好坏，不管有没有用
collins.def: If you add for what it's worth to something that you say, you are suggesting that what you are saying or referring to may not be very valuable or helpful, especially because you do not want to appear arrogant.

example.ex: For what it's worth, my feeling is that ice in whisky is fine...
example.tran: 不管怎么样，我觉得威士忌放冰很好。

example.ex: I've brought my notes, for what it's worth.
example.tran: 不管有没有用，我反正把我的笔记带来了。

collins.tran: (行为或活动)值得…去做，对…有好处
collins.def: If an action or activity is worth someone's while, it will be helpful, useful, or enjoyable for them if they do it, even though it requires some effort.

example.ex: It might be worth your while to go to court and ask for the agreement to be changed...
example.tran: 上法庭要求对协议进行改动也许对你有益。

example.ex: You'll find it well worth your while to learn something of each island's special features before visiting them.
example.tran: 你会发现游览之前先了解一下各岛的特色非常有帮助。

collins.def: You use present to describe things and people that exist now, rather than those that existed in the past or those that may exist in the future.

example.ex: He has brought much of the present crisis on himself...
example.tran: 目前的大部分危机都是他自己引起的。

example.ex: ...the government's present economic difficulties...
example.tran: 政府当前的经济难题

collins.def: The present is the period of time that we are in now and the things that are happening now.

example.ex: ...his struggle to reconcile the past with the present.
example.tran: 他为协调过去和现在所付出的努力。

example.ex: ...continuing right up to the present...
example.tran: 一直持续到现在

collins.def: In grammar, the present tenses of a verb are the ones that are used to talk about things that happen regularly or situations that exist at this time. The simple present tense uses the base form or the 's' form of a verb, as in 'I play tennis twice a week' and 'He works in a bank'.
A situation that exists at present exists now, although it may change.

example.ex: There is no way at present of predicting which individuals will develop the disease...
example.tran: 目前还没有办法预测谁会得这种病。

example.ex: At present children under 14 are not permitted in bars.
example.tran: 目前，14岁以下儿童不允许进酒吧。

collins.def: The present day is the period of history that we are in now.

example.ex: ...Western  European art from the period of Giotto to the present day.
example.tran: 从乔托时期直至现代的西欧艺术

example.ex: ...monastic music of the present day.
example.tran: 当代的寺庙音乐

collins.def: Something that exists or will be done for the present exists now or will continue for a while, although the situation may change later.

example.ex: The ministers had expressed the unanimous view that sanctions should remain in place for the present.
example.tran: 大臣们一致认为暂时还不能取消制裁。

collins.tran: 机不可失，失不再来；就在当下
collins.def: If you say 'There's no time like the present', you are suggesting to someone that they should do something now, not later.

example.ex: Don't wait until New Year to resolve to organise your life. There's no time like the present.
example.tran: 不要等到新年才下决心规划生活。要把握当下。

collins.def: Tape is a narrow plastic strip covered with a magnetic substance. It is used to record sounds, pictures, and computer information.

example.ex: Tape is expensive and loses sound quality every time it is copied...
example.tran: 磁带成本高，而且每录制一次音质就会变差一些。

example.ex: Many students declined to be interviewed on tape.
example.tran: 许多学生谢绝录音采访。

collins.tran: (盒式或卷盘式)录音带，录像带
collins.def: A tape is a cassette or spool with magnetic tape wound round it.

example.ex: ...a new cassette tape...
example.tran: 一盒新带子

example.ex: She still listens to the tapes I made her.
example.tran: 她还在听我为她录制的带子。

collins.tran: (用录音机、录像机)录制(音乐、声音或电视画面)
collins.def: If you tape music, sounds, or television pictures, you record them using a tape recorder or a video recorder.

example.ex: She has just taped an interview...
example.tran: 她刚录制完一次采访。

example.ex: He shouldn't be taping without the singer's permission.
example.tran: 他不该在没有征得演唱者同意的情况下录音。

collins.tran: (捆扎东西或注明衣物主人的)布条，布带
collins.def: A tape is a strip of cloth used to tie things together or to identify who a piece of clothing belongs to.

example.ex: The books were all tied up with tape.
example.tran: 所有书籍都用布条捆扎了起来。

collins.def: A tape is a ribbon that is stretched across the finishing line of a race.

example.ex: ...the finishing tape.
example.tran: 终点线

collins.def: Tape is a sticky strip of plastic used for sticking things together.

example.ex: ...strong adhesive tape.
example.tran: 强力胶带

collins.def: If you tape one thing to another, you attach it using sticky tape.

example.ex: I taped the base of the feather onto the velvet...
example.tran: 我用胶带把羽毛的根部粘在了天鹅绒上。

example.ex: There are notes from years ago taped to the walls...
example.tran: 墙上有多年前用胶带粘上去的字条。

collins.tran: (尤指长期的)战略，策略，行动计划
collins.def: A strategy is a general plan or set of plans intended to achieve something, especially over a long period.

example.ex: Next week, health ministers gather in Amsterdam to agree a strategy for controlling malaria...
example.tran: 下周，卫生部长们将在阿姆斯特丹聚首共商防治疟疾的策略。

example.ex: What should our marketing strategy have achieved?...
example.tran: 我们的销售策略应该取得了哪些成果呢？

collins.def: Strategy is the art of planning the best way to gain an advantage or achieve success, especially in war.

example.ex: I've just been explaining the basic principles of strategy to my generals.
example.tran: 我刚刚一直在向各位将军解释战略学的基本原理。

collins.def: A bomb is a device which explodes and damages or destroys a large area.

example.ex: Bombs went off at two London train stations...
example.tran: 伦敦的两个地铁站发生了炸弹爆炸事件。

example.ex: It's not known who planted the bomb...
example.tran: 安放炸弹者身份不明。

collins.def: Nuclear weapons are sometimes referred to as the bomb .

example.ex: They are generally thought to have the bomb.
example.tran: 人们普遍认为他们拥有核武器。
