example.ex: Fit windows with safety locks or catches.
example.tran: 给窗户装上安全锁或窗栓。

collins.def: A catch is a hidden problem or difficulty in a plan or an offer that seems surprisingly good.

example.ex: The catch is that you work for your supper, and the food and accommodation can be very basic...
example.tran: 圈套在于你是在挣钱糊口，但食宿其实有可能非常简单。

example.ex: 'It's your money. You deserve it.' — 'What's the catch?'
example.tran: “这钱归你，你该拿这个钱。”——“搞什么名堂？”

collins.def: When people have been fishing, their catch is the total number of fish that they have caught.

example.ex: The catch included one fish over 18 pounds.
example.tran: 捕获的鱼里有一条重逾18磅。

collins.def: If you describe someone as a good catch, you mean that they have lots of good qualities and you think their partner or employer is very lucky to have found them.

example.ex: I was so in love with him and all my friends said what a good catch he was.
example.tran: 我当时和他陷入热恋，我的朋友们都说能找到他是我的福气。

collins.def: Catch is a game in which children throw a ball to each other.
Catch is a game in which one child chases other children and tries to touch or catch one of them.
You can say things such as 'You wouldn't catch me doing that' to emphasize that you would never do a particular thing.

example.ex: You won't catch me giving him a bad review!...
example.tran: 我绝不会说他坏话的。

example.ex: You wouldn't catch me in there, I can tell you.
example.tran: 我可以告诉你，你永远别想在那里看见我。

collins.tran: 使猝不及防；使极其尴尬;使突陷窘境
collins.def: If someone is caught with their pants down, something happens that they are not prepared for and that reveals something embarrassing or shocking about them. In British English, you can also say that they are caught with their trousers down .

example.ex: It makes soldiers happy to know that somebody right at the top has been caught with his trousers down...
example.tran: 顶头上司出了大洋相，当兵的最高兴了。

example.ex: I think we caught them with their pants down. They're a bit confused.
example.tran: 我觉得我们让他们下不了台了。他们有点不知所措。

collins.def: When you drink a liquid, you take it into your mouth and swallow it.

example.ex: He drank his cup of tea...
example.tran: 他喝他的那杯茶。

example.ex: They'd stopped drinking beer and started on tequila...
example.tran: 他们已经不喝啤酒了,开始喝龙舌兰酒了。

collins.def: To drink means to drink alcohol.

example.ex: He was smoking and drinking too much...
example.tran: 他嗜烟酗酒。

example.ex: Never accept a ride with people who have been drinking.
example.tran: 千万别搭喝了酒的司机开的车。

collins.def: A drink is an amount of a liquid which you drink.

example.ex: I'll get you a drink of water.
example.tran: 我给你来杯水。

collins.def: A drink is an alcoholic drink.

example.ex: She felt like a drink after a hard day.
example.tran: 辛苦了一天后她想喝上一杯。

collins.tran: 酒(如啤酒、葡萄酒或威士忌)
collins.def: Drink is alcohol, such as beer, wine, or whisky.

example.ex: Too much drink is bad for your health.
example.tran: 酗酒有害健康。

collins.tran: 醉得不省人事;烂醉如泥;酩酊大醉
collins.def: If you drink yourself into a stupor or drink yourself into oblivion, you drink so much alcohol that you lose consciousness or fall deeply asleep.

example.ex: We drank ourselves into a stupor on cheap wine.
example.tran: 我们喝廉价葡萄酒喝得酩酊大醉。

collins.tran: 比…更能喝酒;酒量比…大;灌醉
collins.def: If someone drinks you under the table, they drink more alcohol than you are able to on a particular occasion.

example.ex: At sixteen he could drink me under the table.
example.tran: 16 岁的时候他就能把我灌醉了。

collins.def: If someone takes to drink, they start to drink a lot of alcohol regularly, usually because they are depressed or worried about something.

example.ex: He took to drink after his wife died.
example.tran: 他妻子过世后他就沉溺于酒中了。

collins.def: People say 'I'll drink to that' to show that they agree with and approve of something that someone has just said.
A computer is an electronic machine that can store and deal with large amounts of information.

example.ex: The data are then fed into a computer...
example.tran: 数据随后被输入电脑。

example.ex: The company installed a $650,000 computer system...
example.tran: 这家公司安装了价值65万美元的电脑系统。

collins.def: A square is a shape with four sides that are all the same length and four corners that are all right angles.

example.ex: Serve the cake warm or at room temperature, cut in squares...
example.tran: 等蛋糕温热或凉至室温时切成四方块端上桌。

example.ex: There was a calendar on the wall, with large squares around the dates...
example.tran: 墙上有一幅日历，每个日期都用大方框框着。

collins.def: In a town or city, a square is a flat open place, often in the shape of a square.

example.ex: The house is located in one of Pimlico's prettiest garden squares...
example.tran: 房子位于皮姆利科最美丽的一个花园广场上。

example.ex: The town centre is thick with churches and cafe-lined squares.
example.tran: 市中心随处都是教堂和被咖啡店包围的广场。

collins.def: Something that is square has a shape the same as a square or similar to a square.

example.ex: Round tables seat more people in the same space as a square table...
example.tran: 在相同的空间里，圆桌比起方桌可以坐下更多的人。

example.ex: His finger nails were square and cut neatly across.
example.tran: 他的手指甲是方形的，修剪得很齐。

collins.tran: (用于长度单位前表示面积)平方的
collins.def: Square is used before units of length when referring to the area of something. For example, if something is three metres long and two metres wide, its area is six square metres.

example.ex: Canary Wharf was set to provide 10 million square feet of office space...
example.tran: 金丝雀码头计划要提供 1,000 万平方英尺的办公面积。

example.ex: The Philippines has just 6,000 square kilometres of forest left.
example.tran: 菲律宾只剩下 6,000 平方公里的森林了。

collins.tran: (用于长度面积后表示四方形物的边长)长宽为…的
collins.def: Square is used after units of length when you are giving the length of each side of something that is square in shape.

example.ex: ...a linen cushion cover, 45 cm square.
example.tran: 一个亚麻靠垫套，长宽为 45 厘米

example.ex: ...two pieces of wood 4 inches square.
example.tran: 两块长宽均为 4 英寸的木片

collins.tran: 使成二次幂;将(数字)平方
collins.def: To square a number means to multiply it by itself. For example, 3 squared is 3 x 3, or 9. 3 squared is usually written as 32.

example.ex: Take the time in seconds, square it, and multiply by 5.12...
example.tran: 记下用了多少秒时间，将其平方，再乘以5.12。

example.ex: A squared plus B squared equals C squared.
example.tran: A 的平方加上 B 的平方等于 C 的平方。

collins.def: The square of a number is the number produced when you multiply that number by itself. For example, the square of 3 is 9.

example.ex: ...the square of the speed of light, an exceedingly large number.
example.tran: 光速的平方，一个天文数字

collins.tran: (使)(不同想法或行动)协调一致
collins.def: If you square two different ideas or actions with each other or if they square with each other, they fit or match each other.

example.ex: That explanation squares with the facts, doesn't it...
example.tran: 那个解释和事实相符，不是吗？

example.ex: He set out to square his dreams with reality.
example.tran: 他开始让自己的梦想接近现实。

collins.def: If you square something with someone, you ask their permission or check with them that what you are doing is acceptable to them.

example.ex: I squared it with Dan, who said it was all right so long as I was back next Monday morning...
example.tran: 我征得了丹的同意，他说只要我下周一早上能回来就行。

example.ex: She should have squared things with Jay before she went into this business with Walker.
example.tran: 她本该在和沃克联手进入这一行之前先征得杰伊的同意。

collins.tran: 将圆的变成方的;做不可能做到的事
collins.def: If you say that someone squares the circle, you mean that they bring together two things which are normally thought to be so different that they cannot exist together.

example.ex: He has squared the circle of keeping the City happy and doing something to improve business cash flow...
example.tran: 他做到了不可能做到的事，既让伦敦城满意，又增加了企业的现金流量。

example.ex: 'Nirvana' squared the circle by making a record that was both superb pop and rock music at the same time.
example.tran: “涅磐”乐队做到了不可能做到的事，录制了一张既有流行风又带有摇滚范儿的唱片。

collins.tran: (因行动失败而)重新开始，重起炉灶
collins.def: If you are back to square one, you have to start dealing with something from the beginning again because the way you were dealing with it has failed.

example.ex: If your complaint is not upheld, you may feel you are back to square one...
example.tran: 如果你的投诉没有得到支持，你可能会感到自己又得重新开始。

example.ex: We got a phone call from the lawyers and is was back to square one.
example.tran: 我们接到了律师的一个电话，一切又得从头开始。

collins.tran: 不适宜做某工作的人;与环境格格不入的人
collins.def: If you describe someone as a square peg in a round hole, you mean that they are completely unsuitable for the job they are doing or the situation they are in.

example.ex: Taylor is clearly the wrong man for the job—a square peg in a round hole.
example.tran: 泰勒显然不是做这份工作的合适人选——简直就是方枘圆凿。

collins.tran: 主题;题目;话题;题材;问题
collins.def: The subject of something such as a conversation, letter, or book is the thing that is being discussed or written about.

example.ex: It was I who first raised the subject of plastic surgery.
example.tran: 是我第一个提到整形手术这个话题的。

example.ex: ...the president's own views on the subject.
example.tran: 总统在此问题上的个人观点

collins.def: Someone or something that is the subject of criticism, study, or an investigation is being criticized, studied, or investigated.

example.ex: Over the past few years, some of the positions Mr. Meredith has adopted have made him the subject of criticism...
example.tran: 在过去的几年里，梅雷迪思先生所采取的某些立场使他成为了批评的对象。

example.ex: He's now the subject of an official inquiry.
example.tran: 他现在是官方调查的对象。

collins.tran: (知识、研究)领域;(尤指)学科，科目，课程
collins.def: A subject is an area of knowledge or study, especially one that you study at school, college, or university.

example.ex: Surprisingly, mathematics was voted their favourite subject.
example.tran: 令人惊讶的是，数学课被选为他们最喜欢的科目。

example.ex: ...a tutor in maths and science subjects.
example.tran: 辅导数学和理科课程的家教

collins.def: In an experiment or piece of research, the subject is the person or animal that is being tested or studied.

example.ex: 'White noise' was played into the subject's ears through headphones...
example.tran: 让受试者通过耳机听“白噪声”。

example.ex: Subjects in the study were asked to follow a modified diet.
example.tran: 要求研究对象按改进的食谱进食。

collins.tran: (艺术的)表现对象;绘画(或拍摄)题材
collins.def: An artist's subjects are the people, animals, or objects that he or she paints, models, or photographs.

example.ex: Her favourite subjects are shells spotted on beach walks.
example.tran: 她最喜爱的题材是那些在海边散步时发现的贝壳。

collins.def: In grammar, the subject of a clause is the noun group that refers to the person or thing that is doing the action expressed by the verb. For example, in 'My cat keeps catching birds', 'my cat' is the subject.

collins.tran: 可能受…影响的;易遭受…的
collins.def: To be subject to something means to be affected by it or to be likely to be affected by it.

example.ex: Prices may be subject to alteration...
example.tran: 价格可能会有所变动。

example.ex: In addition, interest on Treasury issues isn't subject to state and local income taxes.
example.tran: 另外，国债利息不需缴纳政府和地方所得税。

collins.def: If someone is subject to a particular set of rules or laws, they have to obey those rules or laws.

example.ex: The tribunal is unique because Mr Jones is not subject to the normal police discipline code.
example.tran: 因为琼斯先生不受一般的治安条例法规约束，所以专门设立了特别法庭。

example.ex: ...arguing that as a sovereign state it could not be subject to another country's laws.
example.tran: 争论说作为一个主权国家其不受其他国家法律的约束

collins.def: If you subject someone to something unpleasant, you make them experience it.

example.ex: ...the man who had subjected her to four years of beatings and abuse...
example.tran: 使她遭受了 4 年毒打和辱骂的男人

example.ex: Innocent civilians are being arrested and subjected to inhumane treatment.
example.tran: 无辜的平民正被逮捕并遭受非人的虐待。

collins.tran: (通常指君主制国家的)国民，臣民
collins.def: The people who live in or belong to a particular country, usually one ruled by a monarch, are the subjects of that monarch or country.

example.ex: ...his subjects regarded him as a great and wise monarch...
example.tran: 他的臣民把他视为伟大而英明的君主

example.ex: Roughly half of them are British subjects.
example.tran: 他们中大约有一半是英国国民。

collins.def: Subject peoples and countries are ruled or controlled by the government of another country.

example.ex: The subject peoples of her empire were anxious for their own independence.
example.tran: 她的帝国中被迫向她臣服的民族迫切渴望自身的独立。

example.ex: ...colonies and other subject territories.
example.tran: 殖民地和其他臣服的属地

collins.tran: (通常因为谈论的话题令人尴尬而)转换话题
collins.def: When someone involved in a conversation changes the subject, they start talking about something else, often because the previous subject was embarrassing.

example.ex: He tried to change the subject, but she wasn't to be put off.
example.tran: 他努力想换个话题，但她却兴趣正浓。

collins.def: If an event will take place subject to a condition, it will take place only if that thing happens.

example.ex: They denied a report that Egypt had agreed to a summit, subject to certain conditions.
example.tran: 他们否认了宣称埃及已同意在特定条件下参加峰会的报道。

collins.tran: 有权力的；有势力的；有影响力的
collins.def: A powerful person or organization is able to control or influence people and events.

example.ex: You're a powerful man — people will listen to you.
example.tran: 你是有影响力的人，大家会听你的。

example.ex: ...Russia and India, two large, powerful countries.
example.tran: 两大强国，俄罗斯和印度

collins.def: You say that someone's body is powerful when it is physically strong.

example.ex: Hans flexed his powerful muscles...
example.tran: 汉斯活动了一下他那强健的肌肉。

example.ex: It's such a big powerful dog.
example.tran: 它是一条如此强壮的大狗。

collins.tran: （机器）大功率的；强效的；高效能的
collins.def: A powerful machine or substance is effective because it is very strong.

example.ex: The more powerful the car the more difficult it is to handle.
example.tran: 汽车的功率越大，就越难驾驭。

example.ex: ...powerful computer systems...
example.tran: 功能强大的计算机系统

collins.def: A powerful smell is very strong.

example.ex: There was a powerful smell of stale beer.
example.tran: 有一种呛人的过期啤酒味。

example.ex: ...tiny creamy flowers with a powerful scent.
example.tran: 散发浓香的淡黄色小花

collins.def: A powerful voice is loud and can be heard from a long way away.

example.ex: At that moment Mrs. Jones's powerful voice interrupted them, announcing a visitor.
example.tran: 就在那一刻，琼斯夫人响亮的声音打断了他们，说有人来访。

collins.tran: （文章、演讲或艺术品）极具感染力的，有震撼力的
collins.def: You describe a piece of writing, speech, or work of art as powerful when it has a strong effect on people's feelings or beliefs.

example.ex: ...Bleasdale's powerful 11-part drama about a corrupt city leader.
example.tran: 布利兹戴尔创作的关于一个腐败市领导的极具感染力的电视剧，共有11集

example.ex: ...one of the world's most powerful and moving operas, Verdi's 'Otello'.
example.tran: 威尔第创作的《奥泰罗》，世界最具感染力、最动人的歌剧之一

collins.def: When you purchase something, you buy it.

example.ex: He purchased a ticket and went up on the top deck...
example.tran: 他买了一张票，然后上到顶层甲板。

example.ex: Most of those shares were purchased from brokers.
example.tran: 大部分的股份是从经纪人手中购得的。

collins.def: The purchase of something is the act of buying it.

example.ex: Some of the receipts had been for the purchase of cars.
example.tran: 其中一些收据是购买汽车时开的。

collins.def: A purchase is something that you buy.

example.ex: She opened the tie box and looked at her purchase. It was silk, with maroon stripes.
example.tran: 她打开领带盒，看着她买回的东西：一条带有褐红色条纹的丝制领带。

collins.def: If you get a purchase on something, you manage to get a firm grip on it.

example.ex: I got a purchase on the rope and pulled...
example.tran: 我紧抓住绳子，用力去拉。

example.ex: I couldn't get any purchase with the screwdriver on the damn screws.
example.tran: 我用螺丝刀拧那些该死的螺丝钉时一点也使不上劲儿。

collins.def: If you assume that something is true, you imagine that it is true, sometimes wrongly.

example.ex: It is a misconception to assume that the two continents are similar...
example.tran: 关于这两块大陆相似的假设是一种误解。

example.ex: If the package is wrapped well, we assume the contents are also wonderful...
example.tran: 如果包装精美，我们就会认为里面装的也是好东西。

collins.tran: 掌管，夺取，取得（权力）；承担（责任）
collins.def: If someone assumes power or responsibility, they take power or responsibility.

example.ex: Mr Cross will assume the role of Chief Executive with a team of four directors...
example.tran: 克劳斯先生将出任首席执行官，手下有4位经理。

example.ex: If there is no president, power will be assumed by the most extremist forces.
example.tran: 如果没有主席，权力就会落入最极端的过激分子手中。

collins.tran: 呈现，具有，显露（某种特质）
collins.def: If something assumes a particular quality, it begins to have that quality.

example.ex: In his dreams, the mountains assumed enormous importance.
example.tran: 在他的梦中，山有着至关重要的作用。

collins.tran: 表现出（某种表情）；装出，做出（某种样子）
collins.def: If you assume a particular expression or way of behaving, you start to look or behave in this way.

example.ex: He contented himself by assuming an air of superiority...
example.tran: 他表现出一副高高在上的样子以获得自我满足。

example.ex: Prue assumed a placatory tone of voice.
example.tran: 普吕以一种安慰人的语气说话。

collins.def: You can use let us assume or let's assume when you are considering a possible situation or event, so that you can think about the consequences.

example.ex: Let us assume those clubs actually win something. Then players will receive large bonuses...
example.tran: 倘若那些俱乐部真的赚了，那么球员就会获得一大笔奖金。

example.ex: Let's assume for a moment that I am a litigant in your court.
example.tran: 暂且假设我是你的诉讼当事人。

means: [棒球、板球等]担任外场员，担任守队队员
[体育]1)。 在田赛场地进行的2)。 田赛的

collins.def: A field is an area of grass, for example in a park or on a farm. A field is also an area of land on which a crop is grown.

example.ex: ...a field of wheat...
example.tran: 麦田

example.ex: They went for walks together in the fields.
example.tran: 他们一起在田野里漫步。

collins.def: A sports field is an area of grass where sports are played.

example.ex: ...a football field...
example.tran: 足球场

example.ex: He was the fastest thing I ever saw on a baseball field...
example.tran: 他是我在棒球场上见过的跑得最快的家伙。

collins.def: A field is an area of land or sea bed under which large amounts of a particular mineral have been found.

example.ex: ...an extensive natural gas field in Alaska.
example.tran: 阿拉斯加一个巨大的天然气田

collins.def: A magnetic, gravitational, or electric field is the area in which that particular force is strong enough to have an effect.

example.ex: Some people are worried that electromagnetic fields from electric power lines could increase the risk of cancer.
example.tran: 有些人担心输电线的电磁场可能增加致癌几率。

collins.def: A particular field is a particular subject of study or type of activity.

example.ex: Exciting artistic breakthroughs have recently occurred in the fields of painting, sculpture and architecture...
example.tran: 绘画、雕塑和建筑领域最近出现了激动人心的艺术突破。

example.ex: Each of the authors of the tapes is an expert in his field.
example.tran: 每盘磁带的撰稿人都是其研究领域的专家。

collins.def: A field is an area of a computer's memory or a program where data can be entered, edited, or stored.

example.ex: Go to a site like Yahoo! Finance and enter 'AOL' in the Get Quotes field.
example.tran: 登录诸如“雅虎财经”这样的站点，在“股票行情”栏输入“美国在线”。

collins.def: You can refer to the area where fighting or other military action in a war takes place as the field or the field of battle .

example.ex: We never defeated them on the field of battle.
example.tran: 我们从未在战场上打败过他们。

example.ex: ...the need for politicians to leave day-to-day decisions to commanders in the field.
example.tran: 政治家允许战地指挥官自主做出日常决定的必要

collins.def: Your field of vision or your visual field is the area that you can see without turning your head.

example.ex: Our field of vision is surprisingly wide.
example.tran: 我们的视野出人意料地开阔。

collins.tran: (体育比赛的)所有参赛者，出场阵容
collins.def: The field is a way of referring to all the competitors taking part in a particular race or sports contest.

example.ex: Going into the fourth lap, the two most broadly experienced riders led the field...
example.tran: 进入第四圈时，两名身经百战的骑手开始领先。

example.ex: The field were so close that they would have caught us if I hadn't begun the sprint.
example.tran: 其他参赛选手紧随身后，如果不是我开始冲刺，他们就会赶上我们了。

collins.def: You use field to describe work or study that is done in a real, natural environment rather than in a theoretical way or in controlled conditions.

example.ex: I also conducted a field study among the boys about their attitude to relationships...
example.tran: 我还对男孩子们进行了一项有关两性关系态度的实地调查。

example.ex: Our teachers took us on field trips to observe plants and animals, firsthand...
example.tran: 老师带我们去野游，对动植物进行实地观察。

collins.tran: (在板球、棒球或圆场棒球中)防守，担任守队
collins.def: In a game of cricket, baseball, or rounders, the team that is fielding is trying to catch the ball, while the other team is trying to hit it.

example.ex: When we are fielding, the umpires keep looking at the ball.
example.tran: 我们防守的时候，裁判们一直看着球。

collins.def: If you say that someone fields a question, you mean that they answer it or deal with it, usually successfully.

example.ex: He was later shown on television, fielding questions.
example.tran: 他后来出现在电视上，答复问题。

collins.def: If a sports team fields a particular number or type of players, the players are chosen to play for the team on a particular occasion.

example.ex: England intend fielding their strongest team in next month's World Youth Championship.
example.tran: 英格兰意欲在下月的世界青年锦标赛中推出他们的最强阵容。

collins.tran: 让…参加竞选;让…作竞选候选人
collins.def: If a candidate in an election is representing a political party, you can say that the party is fielding that candidate.

example.ex: There are signs that the new party aims to field candidates in elections scheduled for February next year.
example.tran: 有迹象表明新党意欲推举候选人参加定于明年 2 月举行的选举。

collins.tran: 纵情享受;肆意地做;尽情地做
collins.def: If someone is having a field day, they are very busy doing something that they enjoy, even though it may be hurtful for other people.

example.ex: In our absence the office gossips are probably having a field day...
example.tran: 我们不在的时候，办公室里大概谣言四起了吧。

example.ex: I suspect that the lawyers are going to have a field day before it's all sorted out.
example.tran: 我想律师们要好好忙活一通才能把一切都弄停当了。

collins.def: Work or study that is done in the field is done in a real, natural environment rather than in a theoretical way or in controlled conditions.

example.ex: The zoo is doing major conservation work, both in captivity and in the field.
example.tran: 无论在圈养场还是在野外，动物园在动物保护方面都承担了主要的工作。

collins.def: If you say that someone leads the field in a particular activity, you mean that they are better, more active, or more successful than everyone else who is involved in it.

example.ex: When it comes to picking up awards they lead the field by miles.
example.tran: 他们在拿奖方面遥遥领先。

collins.def: If someone plays the field, they have a number of different romantic or sexual relationships.

example.ex: He gave up playing the field and married a year ago.
example.tran: 他不再处处留情，一年前结了婚。

collins.def: In Britain, an MP is a person who has been elected to represent the people from a particular area in the House of Commons. MP is an abbreviation for (缩略 =) 'Member of Parliament'.

example.ex: ...Colin Pickthall, MP for West Lancashire...
example.tran: 西兰开夏郡的下院议员科林·皮克索尔

example.ex: Several Conservative MPs have voted against the government.
example.tran: 几个保守党下院议员给政府投了反对票。

collins.def: MP is written after someone's name to indicate that they have been elected as an MP.

example.ex: ...Margaret Beckett MP.
example.tran: 下院议员玛格丽特·贝克特

collins.def: If something is expensive, it costs a lot of money.

example.ex: Wine's so expensive in this country...
example.tran: 葡萄酒在这个国家非常昂贵。

example.ex: I get very nervous because I'm using a lot of expensive equipment.
example.tran: 因为正在使用很多昂贵的设备，所以我非常紧张。

collins.def: A previous event or thing is one that happened or existed before the one that you are talking about.

example.ex: She has a teenage daughter from a previous marriage...
example.tran: 她前一段婚姻有一个十几岁的女儿。

example.ex: He has no previous convictions.
example.tran: 他没有前科。

collins.def: You refer to the period of time or the thing immediately before the one that you are talking about as the previous one.

example.ex: It was a surprisingly dry day after the rain of the previous week...
example.tran: 上星期刚下过雨，天气却出奇地干燥。

example.ex: He recalled exactly what Bob had told him the previous night.
example.tran: 他清楚记得前一天晚上鲍勃告诉他的话。

collins.def: The ninetieth item in a series is the one that you count as number ninety.

example.ex: He celebrates his ninetieth birthday on Friday.
example.tran: 他周五过90大寿。

collins.def: An option is something that you can choose to do in preference to one or more alternatives.

example.ex: He's argued from the start that America and its allies are putting too much emphasis on the military option...
example.tran: 他从一开始就认为美国及其盟国过于强调军事手段。

example.ex: What other options do you have?
example.tran: 你还有什么别的选择吗？

collins.def: If you have the option of doing something, you can choose whether to do it or not.

example.ex: Criminals are given the option of going to jail or facing public humiliation...
example.tran: 罪犯可以选择要么坐牢，要么遭受当众羞辱。

example.ex: We had no option but to abandon the meeting.
example.tran: 我们别无选择，只有放弃这次会面。

collins.def: In business, an option is an agreement or contract that gives someone the right to buy or sell something such as property or shares at a future date.

example.ex: Each bank has granted the other an option on 19.9% of its shares.
example.tran: 两家银行都同意给予对方其19.9%股份的期权。

collins.def: An option is one of a number of subjects which a student can choose to study as a part of his or her course.

example.ex: Several options are offered for the student's senior year.
example.tran: 为毕业班学生开设了几门选修课。

collins.tran: 暂不作决定；保留选择权
collins.def: If you keep your options open or leave your options open, you delay making a decision about something.

example.ex: I am keeping my options open. I have not made a decision on either matter.
example.tran: 我保留选择权，这两件事我都还没有作出决定。

collins.tran: 最容易的选择；最保险的选择
collins.def: If you take the soft option, you do the thing that is easiest or least likely to cause trouble in a particular situation.

example.ex: We take the soft option. I like to keep the crowd happy because that's what they pay for...
example.tran: 我们决定采取最保险的方案。我希望让观众开心，因为他们就是为这个掏钱的。

example.ex: The job of chairman can no longer be regarded as a convenient soft option.
example.tran: 别再以为董事长这份工作是那么容易做的。

collins.def: The fourth item in a series is the one that you count as number four.

example.ex: Last year's winner Greg Lemond of the United States is in fourth place.
example.tran: 去年的冠军、来自美国的格雷格·莱蒙德现在排名第 4。

collins.def: A fourth is one of four equal parts of something.

example.ex: Three-fourths of the public say they favor a national referendum on the issue.
example.tran: 四分之三的公众表示希望就这个问题进行全民公决。

collins.def: A factory is a large building where machines are used to make large quantities of goods.

example.ex: He owned furniture factories in New York State.
example.tran: 他在纽约州有几家家具厂。

collins.def: If one thing guarantees another, the first is certain to cause the second thing to happen.

example.ex: Surplus resources alone do not guarantee growth.
example.tran: 仅有富余的资源并不能确保发展。

example.ex: ...a man whose fame guarantees that his calls will nearly always be returned.
example.tran: 其名望能确保他的呼吁几乎总能得到回应的人

collins.def: Something that is a guarantee of something else makes it certain that it will happen or that it is true.

example.ex: A famous old name on a firm is not necessarily a guarantee of quality...
example.tran: 公司悠久的品牌并不能确保商品的质量。

example.ex: There is still no guarantee that a formula could be found.
example.tran: 还没有把握是否能找到一个配方。

collins.tran: 保证…必定发生；承诺做；答应提供
collins.def: If you guarantee something, you promise that it will definitely happen, or that you will do or provide it for someone.

example.ex: Most states guarantee the right to free and adequate education...
example.tran: 大多数州都保障人们免费享受充分教育的权利。

example.ex: All students are guaranteed campus accommodation for their first year...
example.tran: 保证安排所有的学生第一年在校内住宿。

collins.def: A guarantee is a written promise by a company to replace or repair a product free of charge if it has any faults within a particular time.

example.ex: Whatever a guarantee says, when something goes wrong, you can still claim your rights from the shop...
example.tran: 不论保修单如何规定，若商品出了问题，消费者仍然可以去商店维护自身权益。

example.ex: It was still under guarantee.
example.tran: 它还在保修期内。

collins.def: If a company guarantees its product or work, they provide a guarantee for it.

example.ex: Some builders guarantee their work...
example.tran: 一些建筑公司对其承建工程提供质量保证。

example.ex: All Dreamland's  electric blankets are guaranteed for three years.
example.tran: 所有的梦乡牌电热毯质保3年。

collins.def: A guarantee is money or something valuable which you give to someone to show that you will do what you have promised.

example.ex: Males between 18 and 20 had to leave a deposit as a guarantee of returning to do their military service.
example.tran: 18至20岁的男性必须缴纳一笔保证金，作为回来服兵役的担保。

collins.def: The engine of a car or other vehicle is the part that produces the power which makes the vehicle move.

example.ex: He got into the driving seat and started the engine.
example.tran: 他坐进驾驶座，发动引擎。

example.ex: ...an engine failure that forced a jetliner to crash-land in a field.
example.tran: 迫使喷气式客机在田地里紧急降落的引擎故障

collins.def: An engine is also the large vehicle that pulls a railway train.

example.ex: In 1941, the train would have been pulled by a steam engine.
example.tran: 1941年，火车本可以由蒸汽机车拉动。

collins.def: The surface of something is the flat top part of it or the outside of it.

example.ex: Ozone forms a protective layer between 12 and 30 miles above the Earth's surface.
example.tran: 臭氧在地球表面上方 12 到 30 英里处形成一个保护层。

example.ex: ...tiny little waves on the surface of the water...
example.tran: 水面的涟漪

collins.def: A work surface is a flat area, for example the top of a table, desk, or kitchen cupboard, on which you can work.

example.ex: It can simply be left on the work surface...
example.tran: 把它放在操作台上就行了。

example.ex: Place the fish on a flat surface and sprinkle the flesh with lemon juice and pepper.
example.tran: 将鱼放在案面上并在鱼肉上撒柠檬汁和胡椒粉。

collins.def: When you refer to the surface of a situation, you are talking about what can be seen easily rather than what is hidden or not immediately obvious.

example.ex: Back in Britain, things appear, on the surface, simpler...
example.tran: 而在英国国内，事情表面上看来要简单一些。

example.ex: Social unrest, never far below the surface in Brazil, has erupted over the last few days...
example.tran: 巴西一直以来一触即发的社会不安定因素在过去的几天里爆发了。

collins.def: Surface is used to describe the parts of the armed forces which travel by ship or by land rather than underwater or in the air.

example.ex: In contrast with its surface fleet, Britain's submarine force was relatively small.
example.tran: 同其水面舰队相比，英国的潜艇部队规模相对较小。

example.ex: ...Nato surface forces.
example.tran: 北约地面部队

collins.def: If someone or something under water surfaces, they come up to the surface of the water.

example.ex: He surfaced, gasping for air.
example.tran: 他浮出水面，大口吸气。

collins.def: When something such as a piece of news, a feeling, or a problem surfaces, it becomes known or becomes obvious.

example.ex: The paper says the evidence, when it surfaces, is certain to cause uproar...
example.tran: 该报称该证据一经披露，一定会引起骚动。

example.ex: The emotions will surface at some point in life...
example.tran: 各种情绪都会在生活中的某个时刻流露出来。

collins.tran: (一段时间未见后)现身，露面;醒来
collins.def: When someone surfaces, they appear after not being seen for some time, for example because they have been asleep.

example.ex: There's no chance that he'll surface because he's bound to have heard by now...
example.tran: 他不会再出现了，因为他现在肯定听说了。

example.ex: What time do you surface?
example.tran: 你几点钟会醒？

collins.def: A person, animal, or plant that is dead is no longer living.

example.ex: Her husband's been dead a year now...
example.tran: 她的丈夫已经去世一年了。

example.ex: The group had shot dead another hostage.
example.tran: 该组织又开枪打死了一名人质。

collins.def: Land or water that is dead contains no living things.

example.ex: ...charred land, mountainsides of dead earth and stumps of trees...
example.tran: 烧焦的土地、无一活物的山坡和残存的树桩

example.ex: But this water seems dead: it's polluted and horribly stagnant.
example.tran: 但这似乎是一潭死水：受了污染而且恶臭无比。

collins.tran: (地方或时期)无生气的，死气沉沉的
collins.def: If you describe a place or a period of time as dead, you do not like it because there is very little activity taking place in it.

example.ex: ...some dead little town where the liveliest thing is the flies...
example.tran: 某个死气沉沉的小镇，那里最有活力的东西就是苍蝇

example.ex: This made that holiday week a particularly dead period.
example.tran: 这让那一周的假期显得特别沉闷。

collins.def: Something that is dead is no longer being used or is finished.

example.ex: The dead cigarette was still between his fingers...
example.tran: 那支已熄灭的香烟仍在他指间。

example.ex: This bottle's dead. But we've got another one.
example.tran: 这一瓶已经空了，不过我们还有一瓶。

collins.tran: (想法、计划或话题）不再令人感兴趣的，不值得再考虑的，已停滞的
collins.def: If you say that an idea, plan, or subject is dead, you mean that people are no longer interested in it or willing to develop it any further.

example.ex: It's a dead issue, Baxter...
example.tran: 这个问题已经没人再谈论了，巴克斯特。

example.ex: But that doesn't mean this brand of politics is dead or dying...
example.tran: 但那并不意味着这种政治主张已经或正在消亡。

collins.def: A dead language is no longer spoken or written as a means of communication, although it may still be studied.

example.ex: We used to grumble that we were wasting time learning a dead language.
example.tran: 我们过去常常抱怨自己是在浪费时间学一门死语言。

collins.tran: (电话等电气设备）不再运转的，没电的
collins.def: A telephone or piece of electrical equipment that is dead is no longer functioning, for example because it no longer has any electrical power.

example.ex: On another occasion I answered the phone and the line went dead.
example.tran: 还有一回，我一接电话，就掉线了。

collins.tran: (体育运动中的球）界外的，死的
collins.def: In sport, when a ball is dead, it has gone outside the playing area, or a situation has occurred in which the game has to be temporarily stopped, and none of the players can score points or gain an advantage.

collins.tran: (声音)沉闷的;(颜色)暗淡的，不鲜亮的
collins.def: A dead sound or colour is dull rather than lively or bright.

example.ex: 'That is correct, Meg,' he answered in his cold, dead voice...
example.tran: “没错，梅格。”他用冰冷、阴沉的声音答道。

example.ex: Then he heard a piercing scream echoing down the deep well, ending in a dull, dead thud.
example.tran: 接着他听见深井里回响起一声刺耳的尖叫，然后是砰的一声闷响，再之后就什么也听不见了。

collins.tran: 完全的，绝对的（尤用于修饰 centre, silence 和 stop）
collins.def: Dead is used to mean 'complete' or 'absolute', especially before the words 'centre', 'silence', and 'stop'.

example.ex: He adjusted each chesspiece so that it stood dead centre in its square...
example.tran: 他调整每颗棋子，使它们立于格子的正中央。

example.ex: They hurried about in dead silence, with anxious faces...
example.tran: 他们匆匆地走来走去，一言不发，面露焦急之色。

collins.def: Dead means 'precisely' or 'exactly'.

example.ex: Mars was visible, dead in the centre of the telescope...
example.tran: 可以看得见火星，就在望远镜的正中央。

example.ex: Their arrows are dead on target...
example.tran: 他们的箭正中靶心。

collins.def: Dead is sometimes used to mean 'very'.

example.ex: Meadowhall is also dead easy for people to get to...
example.tran: 去梅多霍尔购物中心也非常方便。

example.ex: His poems sound dead boring, actually...
example.tran: 实际上，他的诗听起来非常乏味。

collins.def: If you reply 'Over my dead body' when a plan or action has been suggested, you are emphasizing that you dislike it, and will do everything you can to prevent it.

example.ex: 'Let's invite her to dinner.' — 'Over my dead body!'
example.tran: “我们请她来吃晚饭吧。”——“除非我死了！”

collins.tran: 完全了结的;彻底过去的
collins.def: If you say that something such as an idea or situation is dead and buried, you are emphasizing that you think that it is completely finished or past, and cannot happen or exist again in the future.

example.ex: I thought the whole business was dead and buried...
example.tran: 我以为这整件事已经完全了结了。

example.ex: In two years, the British coal industry will be dead and buried.
example.tran: 英国煤炭工业只消两年就将彻底瓦解。

collins.def: If you say that a person or animal dropped dead or dropped down dead, you mean that they died very suddenly and unexpectedly.

example.ex: He dropped dead on the quayside.
example.tran: 他猝死在码头区。

collins.tran: 去死吧;见鬼去吧;别再烦人
collins.def: If you tell someone to drop dead, you are insulting them, rudely disagreeing with them, or refusing to do something, or telling them to stop bothering you.

example.ex: 75% of the firms he called were hostile and told him to 'drop dead.'
example.tran: 在他电话联系的公司里，75% 都怀有敌意，让他“见鬼去吧”。

collins.def: If you say that someone is dead and gone, you are emphasizing that they are dead, and thinking about what happened or will happen after their death.

example.ex: Often a genius is recognized only after he is dead and gone.
example.tran: 天才往往在离开人世之后才得到认可。

collins.def: If you say that you feel dead or are half dead, you mean that you feel very tired or ill and very weak.

example.ex: You looked half dead after that journey...
example.tran: 经过那趟旅程之后,你看上去真是累坏了。

example.ex: I feel pretty dead right now.
example.tran: 我觉得自己现在几乎快要死了。

collins.tran: 在夜晚万籁俱寂之时/在隆冬
collins.def: If something happens in the dead of night ,at dead of night, or in the dead of winter, it happens in the middle part of the night or the winter, when it is darkest or coldest.

example.ex: I couldn't fly illegally into a country in the dead of night...
example.tran: 我不能在深夜乘飞机非法进入一个国家。

example.ex: We buried it in the garden at dead of night...
example.tran: 我们在夜深人静的时候把它埋到了花园里。

collins.def: When Christians say that Jesus Christ rose from the dead or raised someone from the dead, they mean that Jesus came back to life after he had died, or brought a dead person back to life.

collins.tran: 卷土重来;重新活跃起来（或获得成功）
collins.def: If you say that someone or something rises or comes back from the dead, you mean that they become active or successful again after being inactive for a while.

example.ex: This was a company that, by all appearances, had risen from the dead...
example.tran: 从一切迹象来看，这是一家已经起死回生的公司。

example.ex: Faldo came back from the dead to win his third Open golf championship.
example.tran: 福尔多重整旗鼓，赢得了他的第三个高尔夫球公开赛冠军。

collins.tran: 死也（不会），绝对（不会）（穿某种衣服、去某个地方或处于某种境地)
collins.def: If you say that you wouldn't be seen dead or be caught dead in particular clothes, places, or situations, you are expressing strong dislike or disapproval of them.

example.ex: I wouldn't be seen dead in a straw hat.
example.tran: 我死也不会戴草帽。

example.ex: ...men who wouldn't be seen dead pushing a pram...
example.tran: 死也不会去推婴儿车的男人们

collins.def: To stop dead means to suddenly stop happening or moving. To stop someone or something dead means to cause them to suddenly stop happening or moving.

example.ex: We all stopped dead and looked at it...
example.tran: 我们一下子全都停了下来看着它。

example.ex: She had meant to make a discreet entrance, but conversation stopped dead...
example.tran: 她本打算悄悄进去，但谈话却突然中断了。

collins.tran: 败局已定的;不太可能成功的
collins.def: If you say that someone or something is dead in the water, you are emphasizing that they have failed, and that there is little hope of them being successful in the future.

example.ex: A 'no' vote would have left the treaty dead in the water.
example.tran: 一张否决票可能就会使这个条约胎死腹中。

collins.def: The audience at a play, concert, film, or public meeting is the group of people watching or listening to it.

example.ex: The entire audience broke into loud applause...
example.tran: 全场观众爆发出热烈的掌声。

example.ex: He was speaking to an audience of students at the Institute for International Affairs.
example.tran: 他在国际事务学院给学生们作演讲。

collins.tran: （电视或广播节目的）观众，听众
collins.def: The audience for a television or radio programme consists of all the people who watch or listen to it.

example.ex: The concert will be relayed to a worldwide television audience estimated at one thousand million.
example.tran: 这场音乐会将向全球约10亿电视观众转播。

collins.def: The audience of a writer or artist is the people who read their books or look at their work.

example.ex: Say's writings reached a wide audience during his lifetime...
example.tran: 在塞伊有生之年，他的作品拥有大量的读者。

example.ex: She began to find a receptive audience for her work.
example.tran: 她开始为作品寻找知音。

collins.def: If you have an audience with someone important, you have a formal meeting with them.

example.ex: The Prime Minister will seek an audience with the Queen later this morning.
example.tran: 今天上午晚些时候首相将会觐见女王陛下。

collins.def: A beautiful person is very attractive to look at.

example.ex: She was a very beautiful woman...
example.tran: 她是个大美女。

example.ex: To me he is the most beautiful child in the world.
example.tran: 对我来说，他是世界上最美丽的孩子。

collins.def: If you describe something as beautiful, you mean that it is very attractive or pleasing.

example.ex: New England is beautiful...
example.tran: 新英格兰很美。

example.ex: It was a beautiful morning...
example.tran: 那是一个美妙的早晨。

collins.def: You can describe something that someone does as beautiful when they do it very skilfully.

example.ex: That's a beautiful shot!
example.tran: 射得漂亮！

collins.def: Rock is the hard substance which the Earth is made of.

example.ex: The hills above the valley are bare rock...
example.tran: 山谷上方的小山全是光秃秃的石头。

example.ex: A little way below the ridge was an outcrop of rock that made a rough shelter.
example.tran: 山脊下方不远处有一块露出地面的岩石，大致形成了一个掩蔽处。

collins.def: A rock is a large piece of rock that sticks up out of the ground or the sea, or that has broken away from a mountain or a cliff.

example.ex: She sat cross-legged on the rock.
example.tran: 她盘腿坐在那块巨大的岩石上。

example.ex: ...the sound of the sea crashing against the rocks...
example.tran: 海浪冲击岩石的声音

collins.def: A rock is a piece of rock that is small enough for you to pick up.

example.ex: She bent down, picked up a rock and threw it into the trees.
example.tran: 她弯腰捡起一块石子，扔进了树丛中。

collins.def: When something rocks or when you rock it, it moves slowly and regularly backwards and forwards or from side to side.

example.ex: His body rocked from side to side with the train...
example.tran: 他的身体随着火车左右摇晃。

example.ex: He stood a few moments, rocking back and forwards on his heels...
example.tran: 他站了一会儿，踮着脚跟前后摇晃。

collins.def: If an explosion or an earthquake rocks a building or an area, it causes the building or area to shake. You can also say that the building or area rocks.

example.ex: Three people were injured yesterday when an explosion rocked one of Britain's best known film studios...
example.tran: 昨天，一起爆炸使得英国最著名的电影制片厂之一发生强烈震动，导致3人受伤。

example.ex: ...a country that's rocked by dozens of earthquakes every year...
example.tran: 每年遭受十几次地震袭击的国家

collins.def: If an event or a piece of news rocks a group or society, it shocks them or makes them feel less secure.

example.ex: His death rocked the fashion business.
example.tran: 他的去世震惊了整个时装界。

example.ex: ...the latest scandal to rock the monarchy...
example.tran: 震惊了整个王国的最新丑闻

collins.def: Rock is loud music with a strong beat that is usually played and sung by a small group of people using instruments such as electric guitars and drums.

example.ex: He once told an interviewer that he didn't even like rock music.
example.tran: 他曾告诉一位采访者，他甚至都不喜欢摇滚乐。

example.ex: ...a rock concert.
example.tran: 摇滚音乐会

collins.tran: （常在英国海滨城镇销售的）棒形硬糖
collins.def: Rock is a sweet that is made in long, hard sticks and is often sold in towns by the sea in Britain.

example.ex: ...a stick of rock.
example.tran: 一条硬棒糖

collins.def: If you are caught between a rock and a hard place, you are in a difficult situation where you have to choose between two equally unpleasant courses of action.
If you have an alcoholic drink such as whisky on the rocks, you have it with ice cubes in it.

example.ex: ...a Scotch on the rocks.
example.tran: 加冰块的苏格兰威士忌

collins.tran: （婚姻）濒临破裂;（企业等）濒临失败;岌岌可危
collins.def: If something such as a marriage or a business is on the rocks, it is experiencing very severe difficulties and looks likely to end very soon.

example.ex: She confided to her mother six months ago that her marriage was on the rocks...
example.tran: 6个月前，她向母亲透露自己的婚姻已经岌岌可危。

example.ex: Our film industry is on the rocks.
example.tran: 我们的电影业困难重重。

collins.def: Aresolution is a formal decision taken at a meeting by means of a vote.

example.ex: He replied that the UN had passed two major resolutions calling for a complete withdrawal.
example.tran: 他答复说联合国已经通过了两项号召全面撤军的重要决议。

example.ex: ...a draft resolution on the occupied territories.
example.tran: 针对被占领领土的决议草案

collins.def: If you make a resolution, you decide to try very hard to do something.

example.ex: They made a resolution to lose all the weight gained during the Christmas period.
example.tran: 他们下定决心要减去圣诞期间增加的体重。

collins.def: Resolution is determination to do something or not do something.

example.ex: 'I think I'll try a hypnotist,' I said with sudden resolution.
example.tran: “我会找催眠师试试，”我突然坚决地说。

collins.def: The resolution of a problem or difficulty is the final solving of it.

example.ex: ...the successful resolution of a dispute involving UN inspectors in Baghdad.
example.tran: 涉及联合国驻巴格达观察员的争端的成功解决

example.ex: ...in order to find a peaceful resolution to the crisis.
example.tran: 为了和平解决此次危机

collins.def: The resolution of an image is how clear the image is.

example.ex: Now this machine gives us such high resolution that we can see very small specks of calcium.
example.tran: 现在这台机器可以呈现很高的分辨率，我们可以看见非常小的钙微粒。

collins.def: A bright colour is strong and noticeable, and not dark.

example.ex: ...a bright red dress.
example.tran: 鲜红的连衣裙

example.ex: ...the bright uniforms of the guards parading at Buckingham Palace.
example.tran: 参加白金汉宫阅兵式的卫兵们色彩鲜艳的制服

collins.def: A bright light, object, or place is shining strongly or is full of light.

example.ex: ...a bright October day...
example.tran: 10月的一天，天气晴朗

example.ex: She leaned forward, her eyes bright with excitement.
example.tran: 她身体前倾，眼里闪动着兴奋的光芒。

collins.def: If you describe someone as bright, you mean that they are quick at learning things.

example.ex: I was convinced that he was brighter than average.
example.tran: 我确信他比一般人聪明。

collins.def: A bright idea is clever and original.

example.ex: There are lots of books crammed with bright ideas...
example.tran: 许多书里都有很多绝妙的想法。

example.ex: Ford had the bright idea of paying workers enough to buy cars.
example.tran: 福特公司想出了付给工人足够的薪水去购买汽车这一绝妙的主意。

collins.def: If someone looks or sounds bright, they look or sound cheerful and lively.

example.ex: The boy was so bright and animated...
example.tran: 这个男孩活泼开朗，充满活力。

example.ex: 'May I help you?' said a bright American voice over the telephone.
example.tran: “请问您需要什么帮助？”电话里传出一个充满活力的美国人的声音。

collins.def: If the future is bright, it is likely to be pleasant or successful.

example.ex: Both had successful careers and the future looked bright...
example.tran: 两个人都事业有成，前程似锦。

example.ex: There are much brighter prospects for a comprehensive settlement than before.
example.tran: 综合性的社区具有比以前更加光明的前景。

collins.tran: （汽车或其他车辆）打开的前灯
collins.def: The brights on a car or other vehicle are the headlights when they are switched on fully.

collins.tran: 看光明的一面；抱乐观态度
collins.def: If you look on the bright side, you try to be cheerful about a bad situation by thinking of some advantages that could result from it, or thinking that it is not as bad as it could have been.

means: 准备( prepare的过去式和过去分词)

collins.def: If you are prepared to do something, you are willing to do it if necessary.

example.ex: Are you prepared to take industrial action?...
example.tran: 你们愿意采取劳工行动吗？

example.ex: Members of the KGB service were only prepared to take orders from the President.
example.tran: 克格勃的成员只接受总统的命令。

collins.def: If you are prepared for something that you think is going to happen, you are ready for it.

example.ex: Police are prepared for large numbers of demonstrators...
example.tran: 警方已经为应对大量示威者做好了准备。

example.ex: I'm well prepared for a 12-round fight.
example.tran: 我已经为迎战12个回合的拳击比赛作好了充分准备。

collins.tran: 预先准备好的；事先做好的
collins.def: You can describe something as prepared when it has been done or made beforehand, so that it is ready when it is needed.

example.ex: He ended his prepared statement by thanking the police.
example.tran: 在这份事先准备好的声明的最后，他对警方表示了感谢。

means: 身体某部分的疼痛[不适]

collins.def: Pain is the feeling of great discomfort you have, for example when you have been hurt or when you are ill.

example.ex: ...back pain.
example.tran: 背痛

example.ex: ...a bone disease that caused excruciating pain...
example.tran: 造成剧痛的骨病

collins.def: Pain is the feeling of unhappiness that you have when something unpleasant or upsetting happens.

example.ex: ...grey eyes that seemed filled with pain.
example.tran: 似乎充满了痛苦的灰眼睛

collins.def: If a fact or idea pains you, it makes you feel upset and disappointed.

example.ex: This public acknowledgment of Ted's disability pained my mother...
example.tran: 这一下大家都知道了特德的残疾，这让母亲非常痛苦。

example.ex: It pains me to think of you struggling all alone.
example.tran: 想到你一个人苦苦挣扎，我很难过。

collins.tran: 讨厌鬼，烦心事（英国英语亦用a pain in the arse, a pain in the backside等，美国英语亦用a pain in the ass, a pain in the butt等，但多数人认为具冒犯意味）
collins.def: In informal English, if you call someone or something a pain or a pain in the neck, you mean that they are very annoying or irritating. Expressions such as a pain in the arse and a pain in the backside in British English, or a pain in the ass and a pain in the butt in American English, are also used, but most people consider them offensive.

collins.tran: （尤指为避免困境而）急切想做，迫切想要做
collins.def: If someone is at pains to do something, they are very eager and anxious to do it, especially because they want to avoid a difficult situation.

example.ex: Mobil is at pains to point out that the chances of an explosion at the site are remote.
example.tran: 美孚公司急于说明那个地点发生爆炸的可能性微乎其微。

collins.tran: 作为辛劳的回报；付出千辛万苦，到头来却…
collins.def: You say that something was all you got for your pains when you are mentioning the disappointing result of situation into which you put a lot of work or effort.

example.ex: All Corfield got for his pains was a bullet in the head...
example.tran: 科菲尔德千辛万苦，到头来却被一枪爆头。

example.ex: The Professor lavished his learning on the young visitor but gained little gratitude for his pains.
example.tran: 教授将自己的学识倾囊传授给那位年轻访客，到头来却没有获得一点感激。

collins.def: If someone is ordered not to do something on pain of or under pain of death, imprisonment, or arrest, they will be killed, put in prison, or arrested if they do it.

example.ex: We were forbidden, under pain of imprisonment, to use our native language.
example.tran: 我们被禁止使用母语，违者将被关进监狱。

collins.def: If you take pains to do something or go to great pains to do something, you try hard to do it, because you think it is important to do it.

example.ex: Social workers went to great pains to acknowledge men's domestic rights...
example.tran: 社会工作者尽量尊重男性的家庭权利。

example.ex: I had taken great pains with my appearance.
example.tran: 我在自己的容貌上下了很多工夫。

collins.def: A task is an activity or piece of work which you have to do, usually as part of a larger project.

example.ex: Walker had the unenviable task of breaking the bad news to Hill...
example.tran: 沃克不得不把这个坏消息告诉希尔。

example.ex: She used the day to catch up with administrative tasks.
example.tran: 她白天忙着处理行政工作。

collins.def: If you are tasked with doing a particular activity or piece of work, someone in authority asks you to do it.

example.ex: The minister was tasked with checking that British aid money was being spent wisely.
example.tran: 部长被指派去督查英国的援助资金是否已用到实处。

collins.def: If you take someone to task, you criticize them or tell them off because of something bad or wrong that they have done.

example.ex: The country's intellectuals are also being taken to task for their failure to speak out against the regime.
example.tran: 该国知识分子也因未能公开反对该政权受到了指责。

collins.def: Something that is complex has many different parts, and is therefore often difficult to understand.

example.ex: ...in-depth coverage of today's complex issues.
example.tran: 对时下一些复杂问题的深度报道

example.ex: ...a complex system of voting.
example.tran: 错综复杂的选举体制

collins.def: In grammar, a complex sentence contains one or more subordinate clauses as well as a main clause.
A complex is a group of buildings designed for a particular purpose, or one large building divided into several smaller areas.

example.ex: ...plans for constructing a new stadium and leisure complex.
example.tran: 修建新体育场和休闲中心的计划

example.ex: ...a complex of offices and flats.
example.tran: 商住综合楼

collins.tran: 错综复杂的组合;复合体
collins.def: A complex of things is a group or system of things that are connected with each other in a complicated way.

example.ex: ...the complex of clans which occupied the land.
example.tran: 生活在这片土地上的关系复杂的氏族群落

example.ex: ...the military-industrial complex.
example.tran: 军工综合企业

collins.tran: (通常指由于过去不愉快的经历而形成的)情结
collins.def: If someone has a complex about something, they have a mental or emotional problem relating to it, often because of an unpleasant experience in the past.

example.ex: I have never had a complex about my height.
example.tran: 我从来没有担心过自己的身高。

example.ex: ...a deranged attacker, driven by a persecution complex.
example.tran: 患有受迫害妄想症、精神失常的袭击者

collins.def: If you avoid something unpleasant that might happen, you take action in order to prevent it from happening.

example.ex: The pilots had to take emergency action to avoid a disaster...
example.tran: 飞行员不得不采取紧急措施避免灾难的发生。

example.ex: Women have to dress modestly, to avoid being harassed by the locals.
example.tran: 女士穿着应当庄重，以免受到当地人的骚扰。

collins.def: If you avoid doing something, you choose not to do it, or you put yourself in a situation where you do not have to do it.

example.ex: By borrowing from dozens of banks, he managed to avoid giving any of them an overall picture of what he was up to...
example.tran: 他向许多银行借款，使得任何一家都搞不清楚他到底要做什么。

example.ex: He was always careful to avoid embarrassment.
example.tran: 他总是小心谨慎地避免尴尬。

collins.def: If you avoid a person or thing, you keep away from them. When talking to someone, if you avoid the subject, you keep the conversation away from a particular topic.

example.ex: She eventually had to lock herself in the toilets to avoid him...
example.tran: 她最后只好把自己锁在厕所里来躲开他。

example.ex: All through lunch he had carefully avoided the subject of the house.
example.tran: 整个午饭期间，他一直在小心翼翼地回避房子的话题。

collins.def: If a person or vehicle avoids someone or something, they change the direction they are moving in, so that they do not hit them.

example.ex: The driver had ample time to brake or swerve and avoid the woman.
example.tran: 司机有足够的时间刹车或急转弯，来避开那个女人。

collins.def: A marriage is the relationship between a husband and wife.

example.ex: In a good marriage, both husband and wife work hard to solve any problems that arise...
example.tran: 美满的婚姻中，夫妻双方会共同努力去解决出现的任何问题。

example.ex: When I was 35 my marriage broke up...
example.tran: 35岁时我的婚姻破裂了。

collins.def: A marriage is the act of marrying someone, or the ceremony at which this is done.

example.ex: I opposed her marriage to Darryl.
example.tran: 我反对她嫁给达里尔。

collins.def: Marriage is the state of being married.

example.ex: Marriage might not suit you...
example.tran: 婚姻也许并不适合你。

example.ex: In twenty years of marriage he has only taken two proper vacations.
example.tran: 结婚二十年里，他只像样地度过两次假。

collins.def: You refer to the buildings in which people live as housing when you are talking about their standard, price, or availability.

example.ex: ...a shortage of affordable housing...
example.tran: 保障房的短缺

example.ex: Poor housing and family stress can affect both physical and mental health.
example.tran: 住房条件差、家庭压力大会影响身心两方面的健康。

collins.def: Housing is the job of providing houses for people to live in.

example.ex: ...graduate courses in housing and public administration...
example.tran: 住房建设和公共管理的研究生课程

example.ex: If you are a council tenant call the housing department about it.
example.tran: 市建住房租户请就该问题致电住房部。

collins.def: A housing is a case or covering which protects parts of a machine.

example.ex: Both housings are waterproof to a depth of two metres.
example.tran: 两个机罩的防水深度均为两米。

collins.def: Your shoulders are between your neck and the tops of your arms.

example.ex: She led him to an armchair, with her arm round his shoulder...
example.tran: 她揽着他的肩膀，将他领到一把扶手椅旁。

example.ex: He glanced over his shoulder and saw me watching him.
example.tran: 他扭头瞥了一眼，看见我正看他。

collins.def: The shoulders of a piece of clothing are the parts that cover your shoulders.

example.ex: ...extravagant fashions with padded shoulders.
example.tran: 带垫肩的华丽时装

collins.tran: (问题、责任等)由…承担，落在…肩上
collins.def: When you talk about someone's problems or responsibilities, you can say that they carry them on their shoulders .

example.ex: No one suspected the anguish he carried on his shoulders...
example.tran: 没人觉察出他所承担的痛苦。

example.ex: I fervently hope he recognizes and understands the burden that's on his shoulders.
example.tran: 我热诚地希望他能认识到并懂得自己肩负的重任。

collins.def: If you shoulder the responsibility or the blame for something, you accept it.

example.ex: He has had to shoulder the responsibility of his father's mistakes...
example.tran: 他得为他父亲的过错承担责任。

example.ex: Some of the blame for the disastrous night must be shouldered by the promoters.
example.tran: 筹办方必须为那个灾难性的夜晚承担一部分责任。

collins.def: If you shoulder something heavy, you put it across one of your shoulders so that you can carry it more easily.

example.ex: The rest of the group shouldered their bags, gritted their teeth and set off...
example.tran: 那群人中其余的人扛起包，咬着牙出发了。

example.ex: He shouldered his bike and walked across the finish line.
example.tran: 他扛着自行车走过了终点线。

collins.def: If you shoulder someone aside or if you shoulder your way somewhere, you push past people roughly using your shoulder.

example.ex: The policemen rushed past him, shouldering him aside...
example.tran: 警察从他身边匆匆而过，把他挤到一边。

example.ex: She could do nothing to stop him as he shouldered his way into the house...
example.tran: 他使劲往屋子里挤，她根本没法儿阻止他。

collins.def: A shoulder is a joint of meat from the upper part of the front leg of an animal.

example.ex: ...shoulder of lamb.
example.tran: 小羊的前腿连肩肉

collins.def: If someone offers you a shoulder to cry on or is a shoulder to cry on, they listen sympathetically as you talk about your troubles.

example.ex: Mrs Barrantes longs to be at her daughter's side to offer her a shoulder to cry on...
example.tran: 巴兰特斯夫人很希望能在女儿身边听她倾诉。

example.ex: Roland sometimes saw me as a shoulder to cry on.
example.tran: 罗兰有时把我看作是一个可以倾诉的对象。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something stands head and shoulders above other people or things, you mean that they are a lot better than them.

example.ex: The two candidates stood head and shoulders above the rest...
example.tran: 这两名候选人从所有人中脱颖而出。

example.ex: I am very impressed by your magazine. It is head and shoulders above any other.
example.tran: 我对你们的杂志印象非常深刻。感觉比其他杂志好多了。

collins.tran: 惴惴不安;小心翼翼;小心提防
collins.def: If you say that someone is looking over their shoulder, you mean that they feel anxious all the time about what someone may do to them.

example.ex: When a company keeps making people redundant, those who are left behind might start looking over their shoulder.
example.tran: 当一家公司不停地裁员时，那些留下来的员工也会开始惴惴不安了。

collins.def: If two or more people stand shoulder to shoulder, they are standing next to each other, with their shoulders touching.

example.ex: They fell into step, walking shoulder to shoulder with their heads bent against the rain...
example.tran: 他们开始迈着一致的步伐并肩而行，低着头躲避雨水。

example.ex: We went on board and saw these people packed shoulder to shoulder on the decks.
example.tran: 我们上了船，看见这些人在甲板上肩挨着肩挤在一起。

collins.def: If people work or stand shoulder to shoulder, they work together in order to achieve something, or support each other.

example.ex: They could fight shoulder-to-shoulder against a common enemy...
example.tran: 他们可以同心协力，对抗共同的敌人。

example.ex: We will need you and the chairman standing shoulder to shoulder on basic positions.
example.tran: 我们需要你和主席在一些基本立场上共同进退。

means: （因干了蠢事、失去良机等）对（自己）生气
如足球和橄榄球踢球得分

collins.def: If you kick someone or something, you hit them forcefully with your foot.

example.ex: He kicked the door hard...
example.tran: 他使劲儿踢门。

example.ex: He threw me to the ground and started to kick...
example.tran: 他把我摔倒在地开始踢我。

collins.def: When you kick a ball or other object, you hit it with your foot so that it moves through the air.

example.ex: I went to kick the ball and I completely missed it...
example.tran: 我去踢球却踢了个空。

example.ex: He kicked the ball away...
example.tran: 他把球踢开了。

collins.def: If you kick or if you kick your legs, you move your legs with very quick, small, and forceful movements, once or repeatedly.

example.ex: They were dragged away struggling and kicking...
example.tran: 他们被拖走时挣扎着又踢又蹬。

example.ex: First he kicked the left leg, then he kicked the right...
example.tran: 他先踢左腿，然后踢右腿。

collins.def: If you kick your legs, you lift your legs up very high one after the other, for example when you are dancing.

example.ex: He was kicking his legs like a Can Can dancer...
example.tran: 他像跳康康舞一样踢着腿。

example.ex: She begins dancing, kicking her legs high in the air.
example.tran: 她开始跳舞，做了空中高踢腿动作。

collins.def: If you kick a habit, you stop doing something that is bad for you and that you find difficult to stop doing.

example.ex: She's kicked her drug habit and learned that her life has value...
example.tran: 她已经戒了毒，并且认识到了生命可贵。

example.ex: I've kicked cigarettes, heroin, and booze.
example.tran: 我已经戒了烟，不再吸食海洛因和酗酒了。

collins.tran: 极度兴奋；极度刺激；极大的乐趣
collins.def: If something gives you a kick, it makes you feel very excited or very happy for a short period of time.

example.ex: I got a kick out of seeing my name in print.
example.tran: 当看到我的名字印成铅字时，我感到无比兴奋。

collins.def: If you say that someone kicks you when you are down, you think they are behaving unfairly because they are attacking you when you are in a weak position.

example.ex: In the end I just couldn't kick Jimmy when he was down.
example.tran: 最后我就是无法做到在吉米倒霉时落井下石。

collins.def: If you say that someone does something for kicks, you mean that they do it because they think it will be exciting.

example.ex: They made a few small bets for kicks.
example.tran: 他们觉得好玩便小赌了几把。

collins.def: If you say that someone is dragged kicking and screaming into a particular course of action, you are emphasizing that they are very unwilling to do what they are being made to do.

example.ex: He had to be dragged kicking and screaming into action.
example.tran: 他要被强拉硬拽才肯行动起来。

collins.tran: 令人极度失望的事；重大的挫折
collins.def: If you describe an event as a kick in the teeth, you are emphasizing that it is very disappointing and upsetting.

example.ex: We've been struggling for years and it's a real kick in the teeth to see a new band make it ahead of us.
example.tran: 我们奋斗了多年，看到一支新的乐队反而超越了我们，真让人大失所望。

collins.tran: 我真生自己的气/ 你会感到懊恼的
collins.def: You use kick yourself in expressions such as I could have kicked myself and you're going to kick yourself to indicate that you were annoyed or are going to be annoyed that you got something wrong.

example.ex: I was still kicking myself for not paying attention...
example.tran: 我仍在怪自己没有注意。

example.ex: I immediately regretted having said this— I could have kicked myself.
example.tran: 我一说完这话就后悔了——我都想抽自己。

collins.def: If an event is due to something, it happens or exists as a direct result of that thing.

example.ex: The country's economic problems are largely due to the weakness of the recovery...
example.tran: 该国的经济问题很大程度上是因为复苏乏力。

example.ex: If the trip is a success, a lot of this will be due to Mr Green's efforts.
example.tran: 如果说这次旅行获得了成功,那很大程度上要归功于格林先生的努力。

collins.tran: 由于,因为(构成原因状语,有些英语国家的人认为该用法不正确)
collins.def: You can say due to to introduce the reason for something happening. Some speakers of English believe that it is not correct to use due to in this way.

example.ex: Due to the large volume of letters he receives Dave regrets he is unable to answer queries personally...
example.tran: 因信件数量繁多,戴夫无法亲自答复提出的问题，他为此表示歉意。

example.ex: Jobs could be lost in the defence industry due to political changes sweeping Europe.
example.tran: 因横扫欧洲的政治变故,国防行业中有些人可能会失业。

collins.tran: 到期的;预期的;预定到达的
collins.def: If something is due at a particular time, it is expected to happen, be done, or arrive at that time.

example.ex: The results are due at the end of the month...
example.tran: 预计月底会有结果。

example.ex: The first price increases are due to come into force in July...
example.tran: 第一批提价预计将在7月开始执行。

collins.def: Due attention or consideration is the proper, reasonable, or deserved amount of it under the circumstances.

example.ex: After due consideration it was decided to send him away to live with foster parents...
example.tran: 充分考虑之后决定将他送到养父母那儿生活。

example.ex: I do hope that people will make use of footpaths and treat them with due attention that is needed.
example.tran: 我真希望人们使用人行道并给予应有的关注。

collins.tran: 应有的;应得的;应得到的
collins.def: Something that is due, or that is due to someone, is owed to them, either as a debt or because they have a right to it.

example.ex: I was sent a cheque for £1,525 and advised that no further pension was due...
example.tran: 我收到了一张 1,525 英镑的支票，并被告知我应得的养老金到此为止。

example.ex: I've got some leave due to me and I was going to Tasmania for a fortnight.
example.tran: 我打算利用应享有的假期去塔斯马尼亚呆两周。

collins.tran: (期待很长时间后)预期应得的,预计应到的
collins.def: If someone is due for something, that thing is planned to happen or be given to them now, or very soon, often after they have been waiting for it for a long time.

example.ex: The deputy chief inspector rang me up and said, 'Miss Smith, you know you are due for a move?'...
example.tran: 副总督察给我打电话说,“史密斯小姐,你知道你要搬家了吗？”

example.ex: He is not due for release until 2020.
example.tran: 他要到 2020 年才能被释放。

collins.def: Dues are sums of money that you give regularly to an organization that you belong to, for example a social club or trade union, in order to pay for being a member.

example.ex: Only 18 of the UN's 180 members had paid their dues by the January deadline.
example.tran: 在一月最后期限前联合国 180 个成员国只有 18 个缴纳了会费。

collins.def: Due is used before the words 'north', 'south', 'east', or 'west' to indicate that something is in exactly the direction mentioned.

example.ex: They headed due north...
example.tran: 他们朝正北方向行进了。

example.ex: The Thames flows due south from Oxford, through the market town of Abingdon.
example.tran: 泰晤士河从牛津向正南方向流去，穿过阿宾顿的集镇。

collins.tran: 在适当的时候;到一定的时候
collins.def: If you say that something will happen or take place in due course, you mean that you cannot make it happen any quicker and it will happen when the time is right for it.

example.ex: In due course the baby was born...
example.tran: 婴儿足月降生了。

example.ex: The arrangements will be published in due course.
example.tran: 计划将在适当的时候公布。

collins.tran: 给…以应有的评价;公道地对待…
collins.def: You can say 'to give him his due', or 'giving him his due' when you are admitting that there are some good things about someone, even though there are things that you do not like about them.

example.ex: To give Linda her due, she had tried to encourage John in his school work.
example.tran: 说句公道话,琳达努力规劝过约翰要好好学习。

example.ex: You can say 'with due respect' when you are about to disagree politely with someone.
example.tran: (发表不同意见前的谦语)恕我冒昧,恕我直言

means: 废弃的， 无用的， 荒芜的

collins.def: If you waste something such as time, money, or energy, you use too much of it doing something that is not important or necessary, or is unlikely to succeed.

example.ex: There could be many reasons and he was not going to waste time speculating on them...
example.tran: 原因可能有很多，他不打算浪费时间对此妄加猜测。

example.ex: I resolved not to waste money on a hotel...
example.tran: 我决心不住酒店，以免浪费钱。

collins.def: Waste is the use of money or other resources on things that do not need it.

example.ex: The packets are measured to reduce waste...
example.tran: 包裹的大小经过测量以减少浪费。

example.ex: I hate waste.
example.tran: 我讨厌浪费。

collins.def: Waste is material which has been used and is no longer wanted, for example because the valuable or useful part of it has been taken out.

example.ex: Congress passed a law that regulates the disposal of waste...
example.tran: 国会通过了一项规范废弃物处理的法律。

example.ex: Up to 10 million tonnes of toxic wastes are produced every year in the UK.
example.tran: 英国每年会产生多达1,000万吨的有毒废弃物。

collins.def: If you waste an opportunity for something, you do not take advantage of it when it is available.

example.ex: Let's not waste an opportunity to see the children...
example.tran: 咱们别错过了看孩子们的机会。

example.ex: It was a wasted opportunity.
example.tran: 这是一个错失了的良机。

collins.tran: （因不被接受、理解等而）浪费（建议等）；使徒劳无益
collins.def: If you say that something is wasted on someone, you mean that there is no point giving it or telling it to them as they will not appreciate, understand, or pay any attention to it.

example.ex: All the well-meant, sincere advice is largely wasted on him.
example.tran: 他对所有善意、真挚的建议基本都无动于衷。

collins.tran: (尤指市内或市郊的土地)荒芜的，荒废的
collins.def: Waste land is land, especially in or near a city, which is not used or looked after by anyone, and so is covered by wild plants and rubbish.

example.ex: There was a patch of waste land behind the church...
example.tran: 教堂的后面有一块荒地。

example.ex: Yarrow can be found growing wild in fields and on waste ground.
example.tran: 田野里和荒地上会疯长蓍草。

collins.def: Wastes are a large area of land, for example a desert, in which there are very few people, plants, or animals.

example.ex: ...the barren wastes of the Sahara.
example.tran: 贫瘠的撒哈拉沙漠

collins.def: If something goes to waste, it remains unused or has to be thrown away.

example.ex: So much of his enormous effort and talent will go to waste if we are forced to drop one hour of the film...
example.tran: 如果我们被迫把电影缩短1小时，那么他付出的许多努力就会白费，他的才华也将大半被淹没。

example.ex: Mexican cookery is economical, she says. Nothing goes to waste.
example.tran: “墨西哥的烹调注重俭省，”她说，“任何东西都不会浪费。”

collins.def: If something or someone lays waste an area or town or lays waste to it, they completely destroy it.

example.ex: The war has laid waste large regions of the countryside.
example.tran: 这场战争摧毁了大片村庄。

example.ex: ...cities laid waste by the decline of traditional industries...
example.tran: 因传统工业衰落而没落的城市

collins.def: The expression waste not, want not means that if you do not use too much of something now you will have some left later when you need it.

example.ex: ...a nation that prides itself on its 'waste not, want not' thrift and its environmental conscience.
example.tran: 为其“俭以防匮”的节俭作风和环保意识而自豪的国家

collins.def: Goods or services that are cheap cost less money than usual or than you expected.

example.ex: I'm going to live off campus if I can find somewhere cheap enough...
example.tran: 要是能找到足够便宜的地方，我就不在校园里住了。

example.ex: Smoke detectors are cheap and easy to put up...
example.tran: 烟雾报警器既不贵又易于安装。

collins.def: If you describe goods as cheap, you mean they cost less money than similar products but their quality is poor.

example.ex: Don't resort to cheap copies; save up for the real thing.
example.tran: 别买廉价的仿冒品，攒点钱买正品吧。

example.ex: ...a tight suit made of some cheap material.
example.tran: 用廉价面料做的紧身套装

collins.def: If you describe the cost of someone's work as cheap, you disapprove of the way people are taking advantage of a situation to pay someone less than they should for the work that they do.

example.ex: ...unscrupulous employers who treat children as a cheap source of labour.
example.tran: 把儿童当廉价劳动力使用的黑心雇主

collins.tran: (言行)讨便宜的，刻薄的，不怀好意的
collins.def: If you describe someone's remarks or actions as cheap, you mean that they are unkindly or insincerely using a situation to benefit themselves or to harm someone else.

example.ex: These tests will inevitably be used by politicians to make cheap political points.
example.tran: 这些测试必然会被政客们不失时机地拿去大做政治文章。

collins.def: If you describe someone as cheap, you are criticizing them for being unwilling to spend money.

example.ex: Oh, please, Dad, just this once don't be cheap.
example.tran: 哦，求求你，爸爸，就这一回，别抠门儿了。

collins.tran: 人命不值钱;人命如草芥
collins.def: You use life is cheap or life has become cheap to refer to a situation in which nobody cares that large numbers of people are dying.

example.ex: We will end up living in a society where life is cheap.
example.tran: 我们最终将生活在一个视人命为儿戏的社会。

collins.def: If someone does or buys something on the cheap, they spend less money than they should because they are more concerned with what it costs than with its quality.

example.ex: Most modern housing estates are terrible and inevitably done on the cheap.
example.tran: 现在的房子大多质量差劲透顶，肯定都是偷工减料盖起来的。

collins.tran: 重大的;根本的;基本的;彻底的
collins.def: Radical changes and differences are very important and great in degree.

example.ex: The country needs a period of calm without more surges of radical change...
example.tran: 国家需要一段时间的稳定，其间不要再有重大的变革。

example.ex: The Football League has announced its proposals for a radical reform of the way football is run in England.
example.tran: 足联宣布了它关于对目前英格兰足球运作方式进行彻底改革的提议。

collins.def: Radical people believe that there should be great changes in society and try to bring about these changes.

example.ex: ...threats by left-wing radical groups to disrupt the proceedings.
example.tran: 来自于左翼激进团体可能破坏会议进程的威胁

example.ex: ...political tension between radical and conservative politicians.
example.tran: 激进派和保守派政治人士之间的紧张对峙

collins.tran: （尤指经历或观点相同的）一代人，同代人，同辈人
collins.def: A generation is all the people in a group or country who are of a similar age, especially when they are considered as having the same experiences or attitudes.

example.ex: ...the younger generation of Party members...
example.tran: 年轻一代的党员

example.ex: David Mamet has long been considered the leading American playwright of his generation.
example.tran: 长期以来，戴维·马梅特一直被视为同代人中最杰出的美国剧作家。

collins.tran: 代，一代，一辈（通常认为大约是30年）
collins.def: A generation is the period of time, usually considered to be about thirty years, that it takes for children to grow up and become adults and have children of their own.

example.ex: Within a generation flight has become the method used by many travellers.
example.tran: 就在不到一代人的时间里，坐飞机已经成了很多旅行者的出行方式。

collins.tran: （机械设备的设计和制造的）代
collins.def: You can use generation to refer to a stage of development in the design and manufacture of machines or equipment.

example.ex: ...a new generation of IBM/Apple computers.
example.tran: 新一代的IBM/苹果电脑

collins.tran: （表示家庭成员拥有某国国籍的时间长短情况）第…代的
collins.def: Generation is used to indicate how long members of your family have had a particular nationality. For example, second generation means that you were born in the country you live in, but your parents were not.

example.ex: ...second generation Asians in Britain...
example.tran: 英国的第二代亚洲移民

example.ex: She is a first generation American.
example.tran: 她是第一代美国移民。

collins.def: Generation is also the production of a form of energy or power from fuel or another source of power such as water.

example.ex: Japan has announced plans for a sharp rise in its nuclear power generation.
example.tran: 日本宣布了大幅增加核能发电的计划。

collins.def: If you say that a person or animal is fat, you mean that they have a lot of flesh on their body and that they weigh too much. You usually use the word fat when you think that this is a bad thing.

example.ex: I could eat what I liked without getting fat...
example.tran: 我怎么吃都不胖。

example.ex: After five minutes, the fat woman in the seat in front of me was asleep.
example.tran: 5分钟后，我前排座位上的胖女人便睡着了。

collins.def: Fat is the extra flesh that animals and humans have under their skin, which is used to store energy and to help keep them warm.

example.ex: Because you're not burning calories, everything you eat turns to fat.
example.tran: 由于没有消耗卡路里，你吃的所有东西都会变成脂肪。

collins.def: Fat is a solid or liquid substance obtained from animals or vegetables, which is used in cooking.

example.ex: When you use oil or fat for cooking, use as little as possible.
example.tran: 烹调时不论是植物油还是动物油，都要尽量少用。

example.ex: ...vegetable fats, such as coconut oil and palm oil.
example.tran: 椰子油和棕榈油一类的植物油

collins.def: Fat is a substance contained in foods such as meat, cheese, and butter which forms an energy store in your body.

example.ex: An easy way to cut the amount of fat in your diet is to avoid eating red meats...
example.tran: 减少饮食中脂肪摄入量的简单方法就是避免吃红肉。

example.ex: Most low-fat yogurts are about 40 calories per 100g.
example.tran: 大多数低脂酸奶每100克约含40卡热量。

collins.def: A fat object, especially a book, is very thick or wide.

example.ex: ...'Europe in Figures', a fat book published on September 22nd...
example.tran: 9 月 22 日出版的大部头书《数说欧洲》

example.ex: He took out his fat wallet and peeled off some notes.
example.tran: 他掏出鼓鼓的钱包，抽出几张钞票。

collins.def: A fat profit or fee is a large one.

example.ex: They are set to make a big fat profit.
example.tran: 他们下定决心要大赚一笔。

collins.def: If you say that there is fat chance of something happening, you mean that you do not believe that it will happen.

example.ex: 'Would your car be easy to steal?' — 'Fat chance. I've got a device that shuts down the gas and ignition.'
example.tran: “你的汽车容易被盗吗？”——“不太可能。有个装置，可关闭油门和点火开关。”

collins.tran: (靠…)发财，致富，大发横财，肥起来
collins.def: If you say that a person or organization has grown fat on something, you mean that they have become very rich as a result of it.

example.ex: Liverpool grew fat on the basis of the slave trade.
example.tran: 利物浦是靠奴隶贸易肥起来的。

collins.tran: 无济于事;于事无补;毫无用处
collins.def: If you say that something is a fat lot of good or a fat lot of help, you are saying rudely that it is no good or no help at all.

example.ex: 'I think we should go in and hammer them.' — 'And a fat lot of good that would do us.'
example.tran: “我觉得我们应该进去把他们狠揍一顿。”——“那对我们有个屁用。”

collins.def: Treatment is medical attention given to a sick or injured person or animal.

example.ex: Many patients are not getting the medical treatment they need.
example.tran: 很多病人没有得到他们需要的医治。

example.ex: …a veterinary surgeon who specialises in the treatment of cage birds.
example.tran: 专门诊治笼养鸟类的兽医

collins.def: Your treatment of someone is the way you behave towards them or deal with them.

example.ex: We don't want any special treatment...
example.tran: 我们不想要任何特殊待遇。

example.ex: Ginny's initial rage at his treatment of Chris had simmered down to resentment.
example.tran: 金尼起初因他对待克丽丝的态度而怒火中烧，后来这种愤怒慢慢沉淀为了憎恶。

collins.def: Treatment of something involves putting a particular substance onto or into it, in order to clean it, to protect it, or to give it special properties.

example.ex: There should be greater treatment of sewage before it is discharged...
example.tran: 污水排放之前应该进行更充分的处理。

example.ex: As with all oily hair treatments, shampoo needs to be applied first.
example.tran: 跟所有油性头发的护理一样，必须要先用洗发露。

collins.tran: 盛情款待;特别严厉的对待
collins.def: If you say that someone is given the full treatment, you mean either that they are treated extremely well or that they are treated extremely severely.

example.ex: If you've got friends or family coming to stay, make it really special by giving them the full treatment...
example.tran: 如果你有朋友或家人要过来住，那就搞得特别一些，给予他们以热情款待。

example.ex: She'll be interrogated, jailed, interrogated again, get what's usually known as the full treatment.
example.tran: 她将被审问，监禁，然后再被提审，接受通常所说的“全套款待”。

collins.def: If you apply for something such as a job or membership of an organization, you write a letter or fill in a form in order to ask formally for it.

example.ex: I am continuing to apply for jobs...
example.tran: 我正在继续找工作。

example.ex: They may apply to join the organization.
example.tran: 他们可以申请加入该组织。

collins.tran: 使（自己）全神贯注于；使（注意力等）集中于
collins.def: If you apply yourself to something or apply your mind to something, you concentrate hard on doing it or on thinking about it.

example.ex: Faulks has applied himself to this task with considerable energy...
example.tran: 福克斯为这项任务倾注了大量精力。

example.ex: In spare moments he applied his mind to how rockets could be used to make money.
example.tran: 在业余时间他潜心研究如何能用火箭来赚钱。
