collins.def: If something such as a rule or a remark applies to a person or in a situation, it is relevant to the person or the situation.

example.ex: The convention does not apply to us...
example.tran: 这条惯例对我们不适用。

example.ex: The rule applies where a person owns stock in a corporation.
example.tran: 该规定适用于持有公司股票的人。

collins.def: If you apply something such as a rule, system, or skill, you use it in a situation or activity.

example.ex: The Government appears to be applying the same principle...
example.tran: 政府似乎是在运用相同的原则。

example.ex: His project is concerned with applying the technology to practical business problems.
example.tran: 他的项目是将这项技术应用于实际的商务问题。

collins.def: A name that is applied to someone or something is used to refer to them.

example.ex: Connell said a new medical term should be applied to Berg's actions. He calls it 'medicide'.
example.tran: 康奈尔说应该用一个新的医学名词描述伯格的行为。他称之为“医生协助自杀”。

collins.def: If you apply something to a surface, you put it on or rub it into the surface.

example.ex: The right thing would be to apply direct pressure to the wound...
example.tran: 正确的做法是直接按住伤口。

example.ex: Applying the dye can be messy, particularly on long hair.
example.tran: 涂抹染发剂可能会搞得一团糟，特别是长发。

collins.def: When the driver of a vehicle applies the brakes, he or she uses them to slow the vehicle down or to stop it from moving.

example.ex: They forgot to apply the handbrake and the car rolled 60ft into the river.
example.tran: 他们忘了拉手刹，汽车翻滚了60英尺，掉进了河里。

collins.def: If you stress a point in a discussion, you put extra emphasis on it because you think it is important.

example.ex: The spokesman stressed that the measures did not amount to an overall ban...
example.tran: 该发言人强调这些措施并不等同于全面禁止。

example.ex: They also stress the need for improved employment opportunities, better transport and health care...
example.tran: 他们同时也强调需要增加就业机会，改善交通和医疗保健服务。

collins.tran: 精神压力;心理负担;紧张
collins.def: If you feel under stress, you feel worried and tense because of difficulties in your life.

example.ex: Katy could think clearly when not under stress...
example.tran: 在没有精神压力的情况下凯蒂思路清晰。

example.ex: Of course, the British will suffer such daily stresses patiently.
example.tran: 当然，英国人将会耐心地承受这些日常压力。

collins.def: Stresses are strong physical pressures applied to an object.

example.ex: Earthquakes happen when stresses in rock are suddenly released as the rocks fracture.
example.tran: 当岩石碎裂时其承受的压力突然释放出来，地震就发生了。

collins.def: If you stress a word or part of a word when you say it, you put emphasis on it so that it sounds slightly louder.

example.ex: 'Sit down,' she replied, stressing each word.
example.tran: “坐下，”她一字一顿地说道。

collins.tran: 做，执行，履行（尤指复杂的任务或行动）
collins.def: When you perform a task or action, especially a complicated one, you do it.

example.ex: We're looking for people of all ages who have performed outstanding acts of bravery, kindness or courage...
example.tran: 我们正在寻找那些见义勇为、乐于助人、勇气可嘉的人，年龄不限。

example.ex: His council had had to perform miracles on a tiny budget...
example.tran: 他的委员会不得不以极少的预算去创造奇迹。

collins.def: If something performs a particular function, it has that function.

example.ex: A complex engine has many separate components, each performing a different function.
example.tran: 一个复杂发动机有很多独立零部件，每个零部件具有不同作用。

collins.def: If you perform a play, a piece of music, or a dance, you do it in front of an audience.

example.ex: Gardiner has pursued relentlessly high standards in performing classical music...
example.tran: 加德纳一直不懈地追求古典音乐演奏的高水准。

example.ex: This play was first performed in 411 BC...
example.tran: 该剧于公元前411年首演。

collins.tran: （人）表现良好/很差；（事物）运转良好/糟糕
collins.def: If someone or something performs well, they work well or achieve a good result. If they perform badly, they work badly or achieve a poor result.

example.ex: He had not performed well in his exams...
example.tran: 他考试没考好。

example.ex: England performed so well against France at Wembley...
example.tran: 在温布利球场上，英格兰队表现出色，击败了法国队。

collins.def: Danger is the possibility that someone may be harmed or killed.

example.ex: My friends endured tremendous danger in order to help me...
example.tran: 为了帮助我，朋友们冒了极大的危险。

example.ex: His life could be in danger.
example.tran: 他的生命可能会有危险。

collins.tran: 危险的事物（或人）；危害;威胁
collins.def: A danger is something or someone that can hurt or harm you.

example.ex: ...the dangers of smoking...
example.tran: 吸烟的危害

example.ex: ...the danger of open conflict...
example.tran: 公开冲突的危险

collins.tran: (不愉快之事发生的)可能性，风险
collins.def: If there is a danger that something unpleasant will happen, it is possible that it will happen.

example.ex: There is a real danger that some people will no longer be able to afford insurance...
example.tran: 一些人很可能再也负担不起保险了。

example.ex: There was no danger that any of these groups would be elected to power...
example.tran: 不存在这些团体中的任何一个当选的风险。

collins.def: If someone who has been seriously ill is out of danger, they are still ill, but they are not expected to die.

collins.tran: (电视、电脑的)屏幕;(电影的)银幕
collins.def: A screen is a flat vertical surface on which pictures or words are shown. Television sets and computers have screens, and films are shown on a screen in cinemas.
You can refer to film or television as the screen .

example.ex: Many viewers have strong opinions about violence on the screen...
example.tran: 许多观众对银幕暴力心存反感。

example.ex: She was the ideal American teenager, both on and off screen.
example.tran: 无论是在荧幕上还是在生活中，她都是人们心目中完美的美国青少年。

collins.tran: 放映(电影);播放(电视节目)
collins.def: When a film or a television programme is screened, it is shown in the cinema or broadcast on television.

example.ex: The series is likely to be screened in January...
example.tran: 这个系列剧可能在 1 月份播放。

example.ex: TV firms were later banned from screening any pictures of the demo.
example.tran: 后来各电视台被禁止播放任何有关这次游行的画面。

collins.def: A screen is a vertical panel which can be moved around. It is used to keep cold air away from part of a room, or to create a smaller area within a room.

example.ex: They put a screen in front of me so I couldn't see what was going on.
example.tran: 他们在我面前竖了一面屏风，所以我看不到发生了什么事情。

collins.def: If something is screened by another thing, it is behind it and hidden by it.

example.ex: Most of the road behind the hotel was screened by a block of flats.
example.tran: 宾馆后面的那条路大部分被一片公寓楼遮住了。

collins.tran: 检查，筛查(以确定是否患病)
collins.def: To screen for a disease means to examine people to make sure that they do not have it.

example.ex: ...a quick saliva test that would screen for people at risk of tooth decay.
example.tran: 能快速核查是否长蛀牙的唾液检验

collins.def: When an organization screens people who apply to join it, it investigates them to make sure that they are not likely to cause problems.

example.ex: They will screen all their candidates.
example.tran: 他们会对所有求职者进行筛选。

example.ex: ...screening procedures for the regiment.
example.tran: 参军的筛选程序

collins.tran: 对(人、行李)进行安全检查
collins.def: To screen people or luggage means to check them using special equipment to make sure they are not carrying a weapon or a bomb.

example.ex: The airline had been screening baggage on X-ray machines.
example.tran: 该航空公司已采用X光机对行李进行安全检查。

collins.tran: 转接，甄别(来电以决定是否接听)
collins.def: If you screen your telephone calls, calls made to you are connected to an answering machine or are answered by someone else, so that you can choose whether or not to speak to the people phoning you.

example.ex: I employ a secretary to screen my calls.
example.tran: 我雇用了一名秘书转接打给我的电话。

collins.def: If you refer to a particular subject or person, you talk about them or mention them.

example.ex: In his speech, he referred to a recent trip to Canada.
example.tran: 他在讲演中提到了前不久的加拿大之行。

collins.def: If you refer to someone or something as a particular thing, you use a particular word, expression, or name to mention or describe them.

example.ex: Marcia had referred to him as a dear friend...
example.tran: 马西娅把他称作好朋友。

example.ex: He simply referred to him as Ronnie...
example.tran: 他就叫他龙尼。

collins.def: If a word refers to a particular thing, situation, or idea, it describes it in some way.

example.ex: The term electronics refers to electrically-induced action.
example.tran: 电子学这个术语涉及电感作用。

collins.tran: 将…转到（医院就医）；将…转给（专科医生）
collins.def: If a person who is ill is referred to a hospital or a specialist, they are sent there by a doctor in order to be treated.

example.ex: Patients are mostly referred to hospital by their general practitioners...
example.tran: 病人大多数是在他们的全科医生建议下转往医院就医。

example.ex: The patient should be referred for tests immediately.
example.tran: 病人必须马上转去医院做化验。

collins.def: If you refer a task or a problem to a person or an organization, you formally tell them about it, so that they can deal with it.

example.ex: He could refer the matter to the high court.
example.tran: 他可以将此事交由高等法院裁决。

collins.def: If you refer someone to a person or organization, you send them there for the help they need.

example.ex: Now and then I referred a client to him.
example.tran: 我不时地介绍客户给他。

collins.def: If you refer to a book or other source of information, you look at it in order to find something out.

example.ex: He referred briefly to his notebook.
example.tran: 他简单地看了看自己的笔记。

collins.def: If you refer someone to a source of information, you tell them the place where they will find the information which they need or which you think will interest them.

example.ex: Mr Bryan also referred me to a book by the American journalist Anthony Scaduto.
example.tran: 布赖恩先生还建议我去查阅美国记者安东尼·斯卡杜托的一本书。

means: （北非和西亚常见的海枣树的）海枣

collins.def: A date is a specific time that can be named, for example a particular day or a particular year.

example.ex: What's the date today?...
example.tran: 今天是几号？

example.ex: You will need to give the dates you wish to stay and the number of rooms you require.
example.tran: 需要提供想要入住的起止日期以及所需的房间数目。

collins.def: If you date something, you give or discover the date when it was made or when it began.

example.ex: You cannot date the carving and it is difficult to date the stone itself...
example.tran: 无法确定这一雕刻的年代，连石头本身的年代都难以判断。

example.ex: I think we can date the decline of Western Civilization quite precisely...
example.tran: 我认为我们可以相当准确地确定西方文明开始衰落的年代。

collins.tran: 在（信件、支票等）上注明日期
collins.def: When you date something such as a letter or a cheque, you write that day's date on it.

example.ex: Once the decision is reached, he can date and sign the sheet...
example.tran: 一旦决议达成，他就可以在这张纸上签署日期和姓名了。

example.ex: The letter is dated 2 July 1993.
example.tran: 信件上的日期是 1993 年 7 月 2 日。

collins.tran: 在（某个）日期;在（某个）时间
collins.def: If you want to refer to an event without saying exactly when it will happen or when it happened, you can say that it will happen or happened at some date in the future or past.

example.ex: Retain copies of all correspondence, since you may need them at a later date...
example.tran: 要保留好所有信件的副本，日后可能会用到。

example.ex: He did leave open the possibility of direct American aid at some unspecified date in the future...
example.tran: 他确实没有排除将来某一天美国可能会提供直接援助的可能。

collins.def: To date means up until the present time.

example.ex: 'Dottie' is by far his best novel to date...
example.tran: 《多蒂》是他迄今为止最好的小说。

example.ex: She is without question the craziest person  I've met to date...
example.tran: 她无疑是我到目前为止所遇到的最疯狂之人。

collins.def: If something dates, it goes out of fashion and becomes unacceptable to modern tastes.

example.ex: A black coat always looks smart and will never date...
example.tran: 黑色外套看起来总是很潇洒，而且永远也不会落伍。

example.ex: This album has hardly dated at all.
example.tran: 这张专辑几乎一点都不过时。

collins.def: If your ideas, what you say, or the things that you like or can remember date you, they show that you are quite old or older than the people you are with.

example.ex: It's going to date me now. I attended that school from 1969 to 1972.
example.tran: 现在说起来我就显老了。我 1969至 1972 年就读于那所学校。

collins.def: A date is an appointment to meet someone or go out with them, especially someone with whom you are having, or may soon have, a romantic relationship.

example.ex: I have a date with Bob...
example.tran: 我和鲍勃有个约会。

example.ex: He had made a date with a girl he had met the day before...
example.tran: 他和前一天遇到的那个女孩定下了约会。

collins.def: If you have a date with someone with whom you are having, or may soon have, a romantic relationship, you can refer to that person as your date .

example.ex: He lied to Essie, saying his date was one of the girls in the show.
example.tran: 他对埃茜撒谎说跟他约会的是参加演出的一个女孩。

collins.def: If you are dating someone, you go out with them regularly because you are having, or may soon have, a romantic relationship with them. You can also say that two people are dating.

example.ex: For a year I dated a woman who was a research assistant...
example.tran: 我曾与一位女研究助理约会了一年的时间。

example.ex: They've been dating for three months...
example.tran: 他们已约会3个月了。

collins.def: A date is a small, dark-brown, sticky fruit with a stone inside. Dates grow on palm trees in hot countries.
The twentieth item in a series is the one that you count as number twenty.

example.ex: ...the twentieth century.
example.tran: 20 世纪

collins.def: A twentieth is one of twenty equal parts of something.

example.ex: A few twentieths of a gram can be critical.
example.tran: 即使重量仅有1克的二十分之几都可能是关键性的。

collins.def: You use suspect when you are stating something that you believe is probably true, in order to make it sound less strong or direct.

example.ex: I suspect they were right...
example.tran: 我感觉他们是对的。

example.ex: The above complaints are, I suspect, just the tip of the iceberg...
example.tran: 我想，以上的抱怨只是冰山一角。

collins.def: If you suspect that something dishonest or unpleasant has been done, you believe that it has probably been done. If you suspect someone of doing an action of this kind, you believe that they probably did it.

example.ex: He suspected that the woman staying in the flat above was using heroin...
example.tran: 他怀疑楼上公寓里的那个女人正在吸食海洛因。

example.ex: Police said they suspected that Sobhraj had accomplices who are drug smugglers...
example.tran: 警方说他们怀疑索布拉还有一些走私毒品的同伙。

collins.def: A suspect is a person who the police or authorities think may be guilty of a crime.

example.ex: Police have arrested a suspect in a series of killings and sexual assaults in the city.
example.tran: 警察已经逮捕了一名涉嫌在该市犯下一系列杀人及强奸案的嫌疑犯。

collins.tran: 不可靠的;不可信的;可能有假的;可疑的
collins.def: Suspect things or people are ones that you think may be dangerous or may be less good or genuine than they appear.

example.ex: Delegates evacuated the building when a suspect package was found...
example.tran: 发现可疑包裹后，代表们撤离了这座楼。

example.ex: The firm has taken out adverts in national newspapers to urge customers to return suspect products...
example.tran: 该公司在全国性的报纸上登出广告，催促顾客退回疑似假冒产品。

collins.def: A desire is a strong wish to do or have something.

example.ex: I had a strong desire to help and care for people...
example.tran: 我非常渴望能够帮助和照顾他人。

example.ex: They seem to have lost their desire for life.
example.tran: 他们似乎已丧失了对生活的热望。

collins.def: If you desire something, you want it.

example.ex: She had remarried and desired a child with her new husband...
example.tran: 她又结婚了，并且渴望和新任丈夫生个小孩。

example.ex: But Fred was bored and desired to go home...
example.tran: 但弗雷德觉得很无聊，想要回家。

collins.def: Desire for someone is a strong feeling of wanting to have sex with them.

example.ex: Teenage sex, for instance, may come not out of genuine desire but from a need to get love.
example.tran: 例如，青少年的性行为可能并不是源于真正的情欲，而是出于一种对爱的需要。

collins.def: If you desire someone, you want to have sex with them.

example.ex: It never occurred to him that she might not desire him.
example.tran: 他从没有想过她可能不想跟他上床。

collins.tran: （用于说明性的书面语中）如果需要的话,如果愿意的话
collins.def: If desired is used in instructions in written English to indicate that someone can choose to take the course of action mentioned.

example.ex: Additional courses may be taken if desired...
example.tran: 如有需要可选修额外的课程。

example.ex: Transfer this sauce to a separate saucepan, if desired.
example.tran: 如果愿意的话，可以把这些调味汁倒入一只单独的长柄锅里。

collins.tran: 心里想望之人;心中渴望之物
collins.def: If you say that someone or something is your heart's desire, you mean that you want that person or thing very much.

example.ex: He was extremely devious in his efforts to achieve his heart's desire.
example.tran: 他在设法得到自己的中意之物时会不择手段。

collins.tran: 尚有（许多）需要改进之处;有待（大幅）提高
collins.def: If you say that something leaves a lot to be desired, you mean that it is not as good as it should be.

example.ex: The selection of TV programmes, especially at the weekend, leaves a lot to be desired...
example.tran: 可供选择的电视节目，尤其是在周末的时候，还有大幅提升的空间。

example.ex: Food seems to have been available, even if the quality left much to be desired...
example.tran: 食品似乎能够买到了，虽然质量还远不尽如人意。

collins.def: Freedom is the state of being allowed to do what you want to do. Freedoms are instances of this.

example.ex: ...freedom of speech...
example.tran: 言论自由

example.ex: They want greater political freedom...
example.tran: 他们想要更多的政治自由。

collins.def: When prisoners or slaves are set free or escape, they gain their freedom .

example.ex: ...the agreement worked out by the UN, under which all hostages and detainees would gain their freedom.
example.tran: 联合国拟定的恢复所有人质和被拘禁者人身自由的协议

collins.tran: 摆脱;免除;不受…影响的状态
collins.def: Freedom from something you do not want means not being affected by it.

example.ex: ...all the freedom from pain that medicine could provide.
example.tran: 医药可以提供的对痛苦的解脱

example.ex: ...freedom from government control.
example.tran: 不受政府控制

collins.def: The freedom of a particular city is a special honour which is given to a famous person who is connected with that city, or to someone who has performed some special service for the city.

example.ex: He was given the Freedom of the City of Dublin by the Lord Mayor.
example.tran: 市长阁下亲自向他颁发了都柏林市荣誉市民称号。

collins.def: A weapon is an object such as a gun, a knife, or a missile, which is used to kill or hurt people in a fight or a war.

example.ex: ...nuclear weapons.
example.tran: 核武器

collins.def: A weapon is something such as knowledge about a particular subject, which you can use to protect yourself or to get what you want in a difficult situation.

example.ex: I attack politicians with the one weapon they don't have, a sense of humor.
example.tran: 我运用一种政客不具备的武器攻击他们，那就是幽默感。

collins.def: A technique is a particular method of doing an activity, usually a method that involves practical skills.

example.ex: ...tests performed using a new technique.
example.tran: 用新技术进行的试验

collins.tran: (艺术、体育等方面的)技艺，技法，技能
collins.def: Technique is skill and ability in an artistic, sporting, or other practical activity that you develop through training and practice.

example.ex: He went off to the Amsterdam Academy to improve his technique.
example.tran: 他动身前往阿姆斯特丹学院去进修技艺。

collins.def: If you say, for  example, that one thing is large or small compared with another or compared to another, you mean that it is larger or smaller than the other thing.

example.ex: The room was light and lofty compared with our Tudor ones...
example.tran: 跟我们都铎风格的房间比起来，这个房间显得素雅而大气。

example.ex: Columbia was a young city compared to venerable Charleston.
example.tran: 与历史悠久的查尔斯顿相比，哥伦比亚是个年轻的城市。

collins.def: You talk about one situation or thing compared with another or compared to another when contrasting the two situations or things.

example.ex: Women are smoking two extra cigarettes a week, compared with four years ago...
example.tran: 与四年前相比， 现在女性每周要多抽两支烟。

example.ex: In 1800 Ireland's population was nine million, compared to Britain's 16 million.
example.tran: 1800年，爱尔兰的人口数为900万，而英国则有1,600万。

means: [生态]取食者，食物链中以其他生物为食物的生物

collins.def: A consumer is a person who buys things or uses services.

example.ex: ...claims that tobacco companies failed to warn consumers about the dangers of smoking.
example.tran: 声称烟草公司未能警示消费者吸烟的危害

example.ex: ...improving public services and consumer rights.
example.tran: 改善公共事业，增进消费者权益

collins.def: Reporting is the presenting of news in newspapers, on radio, and on television.

example.ex: ...honest and impartial political reporting.
example.tran: 坦诚而公正的政治新闻报道

collins.def: If you organize an event or activity, you make sure that the necessary arrangements are made.

example.ex: In the end, we all decided to organize a concert for Easter.
example.tran: 最终，我们一致决定组织一场复活节音乐会。

example.ex: ...a two-day meeting organised by the United Nations...
example.tran: 由联合国组织的为期两天的会议

collins.tran: 提供，准备（想要或所需之物）
collins.def: If you organize something that someone wants or needs, you make sure that it is provided.

example.ex: I will organize transport...
example.tran: 我来安排交通。

example.ex: He rang his wife and asked her to organize coffee and sandwiches.
example.tran: 他给妻子打电话，叫她准备好咖啡和三明治。

collins.tran: 整理；使有条理；使具结构
collins.def: If you organize a set of things, you arrange them in an ordered way or give them a structure.

example.ex: He began to organize his materials...
example.tran: 他开始整理材料。

example.ex: She took a hasty cup of coffee and tried to organize her scattered thoughts.
example.tran: 她匆匆喝了杯咖啡，试图整理一下纷乱的思绪。

collins.def: If you organize yourself, you plan your work and activities in an ordered, efficient way.

example.ex: ...changing the way you organize yourself...
example.tran: 改变自我规划的方式

example.ex: Go right ahead, I'm sure you don't need me to organize you...
example.tran: 只管干吧，我相信你用不着我来为你安排。

collins.def: If someone organizes workers or if workers organize, they form a group or society such as a trade union in order to have more power.

example.ex: ...helping to organize women working abroad...
example.tran: 帮助组织在国外工作的妇女

example.ex: It's the first time farmers have decided to organize.
example.tran: 这是农场主首次决定组织起来。

collins.def: If you withdraw something from a place, you remove it or take it away.

example.ex: He reached into his pocket and withdrew a sheet of notepaper...
example.tran: 他把手伸进口袋，掏出一张便签。

example.ex: Cassandra withdrew her hand from Roger's.
example.tran: 卡桑德拉将手从罗杰手里抽了回来。

collins.def: When groups of people such as troops withdraw or when someone withdraws them, they leave the place where they are fighting or where they are based and return nearer home.

example.ex: He stated that all foreign forces would withdraw as soon as the crisis ended...
example.tran: 他声明危机一结束，所有外国军队都将撤离。

example.ex: Unless Hitler withdrew his troops from Poland by 11 o'clock that morning, a state of war would exist between Great Britain and Germany...
example.tran: 如果希特勒那天上午11点前不从波兰撤兵，英德两国便将处于战争状态。

collins.def: If you withdraw money from a bank account, you take it out of that account.

example.ex: Open a savings account that does not charge ridiculous fees to withdraw money...
example.tran: 开一个取款时不会乱收费的储蓄账户。

example.ex: They withdrew 100 dollars from a bank account after checking out of their hotel.
example.tran: 他们在旅馆结账后，从银行账户中取了100美元。

collins.tran: 退出，返回(至另一个房间)
collins.def: If you withdraw to another room, you go there.

example.ex: He and the others withdrew to their rented rooms...
example.tran: 他和其他人回到了他们租住的房间。

example.ex: He poured the wine and then withdrew again...
example.tran: 他斟完酒，然后就又退下了。

collins.def: If you withdraw from an activity or organization, you stop taking part in it.

example.ex: The African National Congress threatened to withdraw from the talks.
example.tran: 非洲国民大会威胁要退出会谈。

collins.tran: 收回，撤回(所说的话或声明)
collins.def: If you withdraw a remark or statement that you have made, you say that you want people to ignore it.

example.ex: He withdrew his remarks and explained what he had meant to say.
example.tran: 他收回所说的话，然后又解释他本来想说什么。

collins.def: The seventeenth item in a series is the one that you count as number seventeen.

example.ex: She gave birth to Annabel just after her seventeenth birthday.
example.tran: 她 17 岁生日刚过便生下了安娜贝尔。

collins.def: A seventeenth is one of seventeen equal parts of something.
A song is words sung to a tune.

example.ex: ...a voice singing a Spanish song.
example.tran: 正在演唱一首西班牙歌曲的声音

example.ex: ...a love song.
example.tran: 情歌

collins.def: Song is the art of singing.

example.ex: ...dance, music, mime and song.
example.tran: 舞蹈、音乐、哑剧以及歌唱

example.ex: ...the history of American popular song.
example.tran: 美国流行音乐史

collins.def: A bird's song is the pleasant, musical sounds that it makes.

example.ex: It's been a long time since I heard a blackbird's song in the evening.
example.tran: 我很久没有听见乌鸫的夜鸣了。

collins.def: If someone bursts into song or breaks into song, they start singing.

example.ex: I feel as if I should break into song.
example.tran: 我觉得自己应该放声歌唱。

collins.tran: 用很便宜的价钱(买下);非常便宜地
collins.def: If you buy something for a song, you buy it for much less than its real value.

example.ex: We found two second-hand chairs that were going for a song.
example.tran: 我们发现了两把准备低价出售的二手椅子。

collins.tran: 竭尽全力，鼓足劲头，处于良好的竞技状态(新闻用语，形容运动员)
collins.def: Journalists sometimes describe sports players as being on song when they are playing really well.

example.ex: Ward is not the most consistent of players, but when he is on song he looks a world-beater.
example.tran: 沃德并不是发挥最稳定的球员，可是一旦进入状态，他似乎就是天下无敌的王者。

collins.def: The author of a piece of writing is the person who wrote it.

example.ex: ...Jill Phillips, author of the book 'Give Your Child Music'.
example.tran: 吉尔·菲利普斯，《给孩子音乐》一书的作者

collins.def: An author is a person whose job is writing books.

example.ex: Haruki Murakami is Japan's best-selling author.
example.tran: 村上春树是日本当红的畅销书作家。

collins.tran: (计划或建议的）筹划者，制定者
collins.def: The author of a plan or proposal is the person who thinks of it and works out the details.

example.ex: The authors of the plan believe they can reach this point within about two years.
example.tran: 该计划的提出者相信他们约在两年内可以达成该目标。

collins.def: To author something means to be the author of it.

example.ex: Then he opened a restaurant, authored a book, and landed his own radio show.
example.tran: 后来他开了个餐馆，写了本书，还制作了自己的广播剧。

example.ex: ...a proposal authored by subcommittee chairman Quentin Burdick.
example.tran: 专门小组委员会主席昆廷·伯迪克提出的建议

collins.def: When a company publishes a book or magazine, it prints copies of it, which are sent to shops to be sold.

example.ex: They publish reference books...
example.tran: 他们出版工具书。

example.ex: His latest book of poetry will be published by Faber in May.
example.tran: 他的最新诗集将由菲贝尔出版公司于5月出版。

collins.def: When the people in charge of a newspaper or magazine publish a piece of writing or a photograph, they print it in their newspaper or magazine.

example.ex: The ban was imposed after the magazine published an article satirising the government...
example.tran: 这家杂志刊登了一篇讽刺政府的文章后被停刊。

example.ex: I don't encourage people to take photographs like this without permission, but by law we can publish.
example.tran: 我不鼓励人们未经允许就拍摄这样的照片，但根据法律我们可以刊登。

collins.def: If someone publishes a book or an article that they have written, they arrange to have it published.

example.ex: John Lennon found time to publish two books of his humorous prose.
example.tran: 约翰·列侬抽时间出版了两本幽默散文。

collins.def: If you publish information or an opinion, you make it known to the public by having it printed in a newspaper, magazine, or official document.

example.ex: The demonstrators called on the government to publish a list of registered voters.
example.tran: 游行者呼吁政府公布注册选民的名单。

collins.tran: 干净的;洁净的;无污迹的
collins.def: Something that is clean is free from dirt or unwanted marks.

example.ex: He wore his cleanest slacks, a clean shirt and a navy blazer...
example.tran: 他穿着他最干净的便裤，洁净的衬衫和藏青色上装。

example.ex: Disease has not been a problem because clean water is available...
example.tran: 不必担心会生病，因为能喝上干净水。

collins.tran: (人或动物)讲卫生的，爱干净的
collins.def: You say that people or animals are clean when they keep themselves or their surroundings clean.

collins.tran: (燃料或化学作用)无害的，无污染的，清洁的
collins.def: A clean fuel or chemical process does not create many harmful or polluting substances.

example.ex: Fans of electric cars say they are clean, quiet and economical.
example.tran: 电动汽车迷们说，电动车清洁、无噪音而且经济。

collins.def: If you clean something or clean dirt off it, you make it free from dirt and unwanted marks, for example by washing or wiping it. If something cleans easily, it is easy to clean.

example.ex: Her father cleaned his glasses with a paper napkin...
example.tran: 她父亲用纸巾把眼镜擦干净。

example.ex: It took half an hour to clean the orange powder off the bath...
example.tran: 花了半个钟头才把浴缸上的柑橘粉擦洗掉。

collins.def: If you clean a room or house, you make the inside of it and the furniture in it free from dirt and dust.

example.ex: With them also lived Mary Burinda, who cooked and cleaned...
example.tran: 和他们同住的还有玛丽·伯琳达，她负责做饭和打扫卫生。

example.ex: She got up early and cleaned the flat.
example.tran: 她早早就起了床，把公寓打扫干净。

collins.tran: (书籍、笑话、生活方式)文明的，不淫秽的，不下流的
collins.def: If you describe something such as a book, joke, or lifestyle as clean, you think that they are not sexually immoral or offensive.

example.ex: They're trying to show clean, wholesome, decent movies...
example.tran: 他们尽量播放文明、健康、正派的电影。

example.ex: Flirting is good clean fun...
example.tran: 打情骂俏无伤大雅，还别有一番趣味。

collins.def: If someone has a clean reputation or record, they have never done anything illegal or wrong.

example.ex: Accusations of tax evasion have tarnished his clean image...
example.tran: 避税的指控使他的清白形象蒙污。

example.ex: You can hire these from most car hire firms, provided you have a clean driving licence.
example.tran: 只要你的驾照没有违规记录，就可以从多数租车公司租到这些车。

collins.tran: (比赛或打斗)无舞弊行为的，公平的，不违规的
collins.def: A clean game or fight is carried out fairly, according to the rules.

example.ex: He called for a clean fight in the election and an end to 'negative campaigning'...
example.tran: 他呼吁选举中进行公平竞争，结束“负面竞选”。

example.ex: It was a clean match, well refereed.
example.tran: 比赛没有舞弊行为，裁判很公正。

collins.tran: (口味、气味或色彩)淡雅的，清新的，明快的
collins.def: If you describe a flavour, smell, or colour as clean, you like it because it is light and fresh.

example.ex: ...the fresh, clean smell of the sea...
example.tran: 大海清新舒爽的气味

example.ex: Soft tones of blue and grey create a clean, bright look.
example.tran: 蓝色和灰色的柔和色调营造出明快、亮丽的视觉感观。

collins.def: A clean sheet of paper has no writing or drawing on it.

example.ex: Take a clean sheet of paper and down the left-hand side make a list.
example.tran: 拿张白纸，在左下方列个单子。

collins.def: If you make a clean break or start, you end a situation completely and start again in a different way.

example.ex: She wanted to make a clean break from her mother and father.
example.tran: 她想和父母一刀两断。

collins.def: Clean is used to emphasize that something was done completely.

example.ex: It burned clean through the seat of my overalls...
example.tran: 它把我工装裤屁股那块烧透了。

example.ex: The thief got clean away with the money...
example.tran: 那个贼拿着钱逃之夭夭了。

collins.tran: (形状)规则的，简洁的，边缘平滑的
collins.def: A clean shape is simple and regular, with definite, smooth edges.

example.ex: He admires the clean lines of Shaker furniture...
example.tran: 他欣赏夏克家具流畅的线条。

example.ex: The drill should be slowly rotated to ensure a clean hole.
example.tran: 钻头必须缓慢转动，以保证钻孔平整光滑。

collins.tran: (动作)干脆利落的，快速无误的
collins.def: You can describe an action as clean to indicate that it is carried out simply and quickly without mistakes.

example.ex: They were more concerned about the dogs' welfare than a clean getaway...
example.tran: 他们更加关心那些狗的安危，而非自己如何干净利落地脱身。

example.ex: Paul had arrested countless men like this one before and was expecting a clean, quick job.
example.tran: 此前，保罗逮捕过无数个这样的家伙，他估计这次能手到擒来。

collins.def: If you come clean about something that you have been keeping secret, you admit it or tell people about it.

example.ex: It would be better if you come clean about it and let her know what kind of man she is seeing.
example.tran: 你最好一五一十地告诉她，让她知道她正在交往的那个男人是个什么货色。

collins.def: If you regard someone or something as being a particular thing or as having a particular quality, you believe that they are that thing or have that quality.

example.ex: He was regarded as the most successful Chancellor of modern times...
example.tran: 他被认为是现代最为成功的财政大臣。

example.ex: I regard creativity both as a gift and as a skill.
example.tran: 我认为创造力既是一种天赋也是一种技巧。

collins.tran: 对…怀有（某种感情）;以（某种感情）看待
collins.def: If you regard something or someone with a feeling such as dislike or respect, you have that feeling about them.

example.ex: He regarded drug dealers with loathing...
example.tran: 他对贩毒分子深恶痛绝。

example.ex: Displays of emotion are regarded with suspicion...
example.tran: 情感的流露会招致猜疑。

collins.def: If you regard someone in a certain way, you look at them in that way.

example.ex: She regarded him curiously for a moment...
example.tran: 她好奇地看了他一会儿。

example.ex: The clerk regarded him with benevolent amusement.
example.tran: 这个职员好心而又饶有兴趣地看着他。

collins.def: If you have regard for someone or something, you respect them and care about them. If you hold someone in high regard, you have a lot of respect for them.

example.ex: I have a very high regard for him and what he has achieved...
example.tran: 我非常钦佩他的为人和成就。

example.ex: There were armed people about, people with little regard for human life...
example.tran: 到处都是武装分子，视人命如草芥。

collins.tran: 问候，致意（尤用于信中表示问好）
collins.def: Regards are greetings. You use regards in expressions such as best regards and with kind regards as a way of expressing friendly feelings towards someone, especially in a letter.

example.ex: Give my regards to your family...
example.tran: 请代我向你家人问好。

example.ex: My best regards to Mary.
example.tran: 请转达我对玛丽的良好祝愿。

collins.def: You can use as regards to indicate the subject that is being talked or written about.

example.ex: As regards the war, Haig believed in victory at any price.
example.tran: 至于这场战争，黑格认为要不惜任何代价取得胜利。

collins.def: You can use with regard to or in regard to to indicate the subject that is being talked or written about.

example.ex: The department is reviewing its policy with regard to immunisation.
example.tran: 这个部门正在审度其有关疫苗接种的政策。

collins.tran: 在这/那方面；就这/那一点
collins.def: You can use in this regard or in that regard to refer back to something that you have just said.

example.ex: In this regard nothing has changed...
example.tran: 在这方面没什么变化。

example.ex: I may have made a mistake in that regard.
example.tran: 我在那一点上可能已经犯了一个错误。

collins.def: An adult is a mature, fully developed person. An adult has reached the age when they are legally responsible for their actions.

example.ex: Becoming a father signified that he was now an adult...
example.tran: 当了父亲意味着他已是个成年人了。

example.ex: Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult.
example.tran: 14岁以下的儿童必须由成人陪同。

collins.def: An adult is a fully developed animal.

example.ex: ...a pair of adult birds.
example.tran: 一对成年鸟

collins.def: Adult means relating to the time when you are an adult, or typical of adult people.

example.ex: I've lived most of my adult life in London.
example.tran: 我成年之后的大部分时间都是在伦敦度过的。

collins.def: If you say that someone is adult about something, you think that they act in a mature, intelligent way, especially when faced with a difficult situation.

example.ex: We were very adult about it. We discussed it rationally over a drink.
example.tran: 在这件事上我们表现得很成熟。我们一边喝酒一边心平气和地谈了谈。

example.ex: ...dealing with emerging sexuality in an adult way.
example.tran: 平静对待出现的性征

collins.tran: （涉及性内容的电影或书籍）仅限于成人的
collins.def: You can describe things such as films or books as adult when they deal with sex in a very clear and open way.

example.ex: ...an adult movie.
example.tran: 成人电影

collins.def: A hostage is someone who has been captured by a person or organization and who may be killed or injured if people do not do what that person or organization demands.

example.ex: It is hopeful that two hostages will be freed in the next few days.
example.tran: 有两名人质可望在几天后获释。

collins.def: If someone is taken hostage or is held hostage, they are captured and kept as a hostage.

example.ex: He was taken hostage while on his first foreign assignment as a television journalist.
example.tran: 他第一次作为电视记者出国采访时就被扣作人质。

collins.tran: 受限制的人;不由自主的人
collins.def: If you say you are hostage to something, you mean that your freedom to take action is restricted by things that you cannot control.

example.ex: With the reduction in foreign investments, the government will be even more a hostage to the whims of the international oil price...
example.tran: 随着外资的减少，政府将更加受制于起伏不定的国际油价。

example.ex: Wine growers say they've been held hostage to the interests of the cereal and soybean farmers.
example.tran: 葡萄种植兼酿酒者说他们一直都为谷物和大豆种植者的利益所绑架。

collins.def: An investor is a person or organization that buys stocks or shares, or pays money into a bank in order to receive a profit.

example.ex: The main investor in the project is the French bank Credit National.
example.tran: 该项目的主要投资商是法国的国民信贷银行。

collins.def: If something is correct, it is in accordance with the facts and has no mistakes.

example.ex: The correct answers can be found at the bottom of page 8...
example.tran: 正确答案在第8页末尾。

example.ex: The following information was correct at time of going to press...
example.tran: 下列信息在付印时准确无误。

collins.def: If someone is correct, what they have said or thought is true.

example.ex: You are absolutely correct. The leaves are from a bay tree...
example.tran: 你说得很对，这是月桂树的叶子。

example.ex: If Casey is correct, the total cost of the cleanup would come to $110 billion.
example.tran: 如果凯西是对的，清理的总花费将达1,100亿美元。

collins.def: The correct thing or method is the thing or method that is required or is most suitable in a particular situation.

example.ex: The use of the correct materials was crucial...
example.tran: 使用恰当的材料至关重要。

example.ex: White was in no doubt the referee made the correct decision.
example.tran: 怀特确信裁判作出了公正的判罚。

collins.def: If you say that someone is correct in doing something, you approve of their action.

example.ex: You are perfectly correct in trying to steer your mother towards increased independence...
example.tran: 你试图让自己的母亲变得越来越独立，这样做很正确。

example.ex: I think the president was correct to reject the offer.
example.tran: 我认为总统拒绝这一提议是正确的。

collins.tran: 纠正(问题);改正，修正(错误)
collins.def: If you correct a problem, mistake, or fault, you do something which puts it right.

example.ex: He may need surgery to correct the problem...
example.tran: 要解决这个问题，他可能需要做外科手术。

example.ex: He has criticised the government for inefficiency and delays in correcting past mistakes.
example.tran: 他批评政府在纠正过去的错误问题上效率低下，并且拖拖拉拉。

collins.def: If you correct someone, you say something which you think is more accurate or appropriate than what they have just said.

example.ex: 'Actually, that isn't what happened,' George corrects me...
example.tran: “实际上，并不是那样，”乔治纠正我。

example.ex: I must correct him on a minor point.
example.tran: 我必须纠正他的一处小错误。

collins.def: When someone corrects a piece of writing, they look at it and mark the mistakes in it.

example.ex: It took an extraordinary effort to focus on preparing his classes or correcting his students' work.
example.tran: 备课和批改学生的作业花费了他很多精力。

collins.tran: (行为)符合社会公认标准的，得体的
collins.def: If a person or their behaviour is correct, their behaviour is in accordance with social or other rules.

example.ex: I think English men are very polite and very correct...
example.tran: 我认为英国人很有礼貌，举止非常得体。

example.ex: We were rather surprised by their sporting and correct behaviour.
example.tran: 他们富有体育精神而且举止得体，让我们感到相当惊讶。

collins.tran: 若是我说错了就请指出
collins.def: You say 'correct me if I'm wrong' to indicate that you are not entirely sure that what you are about to say is true.

example.ex: As I recall, but correct me if I'm wrong, it was in a car park in Carmarthen.
example.tran: 如果我没记错的话，那是在卡马森的一个停车场内。

collins.def: A loan is a sum of money that you borrow.

example.ex: The country has no access to foreign loans or financial aid...
example.tran: 该国得不到任何外国贷款或经济援助。

example.ex: The president wants to make it easier for small businesses to get bank loans.
example.tran: 总统希望能让小企业更方便地获得银行贷款。

collins.def: If someone gives you a loan of something, you borrow it from them.

example.ex: I am in need of a loan of a bike for a few weeks...
example.tran: 我需要借辆自行车用几个星期。

example.ex: He had offered the loan of his small villa at Cap Ferrat.
example.tran: 他愿意借出在费拉角的小别墅。

collins.def: If you loan something to someone, you lend it to them.

example.ex: He had kindly offered to loan us all the plants required for the exhibit...
example.tran: 他善解人意地提出愿意把展览需要的植物通通借给我们。

example.ex: We were approached by the Royal Yachting Association to see if we would loan our boat to them.
example.tran: 皇家游艇协会的人找过我们，问我们能不能把船借给他们。

collins.def: If something is on loan, it has been borrowed.

example.ex: ...impressionist paintings on loan from the National Gallery...
example.tran: 从国家美术馆借出的印象派画作

example.ex: Many of these are on display in the Museum, but some have been sent out on loan to other museums.
example.tran: 其中很多在博物馆展出，但也有一些借给了其他博物馆。

collins.def: If a person is on loan from one organization to another, they are temporarily working for the second organization while still employed by the first.

example.ex: David Speedie, on loan from Southampton, scored his first goal for Birmingham...
example.tran: 从南安普敦转借来的戴维·斯皮迪为伯明翰进了他的第一球。

example.ex: She's on loan to us from the CIA.
example.tran: 她是从中央情报局借调给我们的。

collins.def: A kitchen is a room that is used for cooking and for household jobs such as washing dishes.

means: （表示不在乎，什么都可接受）什么都可以

collins.tran: 任何…的事物;凡是…的东西
collins.def: You use whatever to refer to anything or everything of a particular type.

example.ex: Franklin was free to do pretty much whatever he pleased...
example.tran: 富兰克林几乎可以做自己喜欢做的任何事情。

example.ex: When you're older I think you're better equipped mentally to cope with whatever happens...
example.tran: 你年龄再大一些后，我想你就会有更强的心理承受能力来面对所发生的任何事。

collins.def: You use whatever to say that something is the case in all circumstances.

example.ex: We shall love you whatever happens, Diana...
example.tran: 戴安娜，不管发生什么，我们都爱你。

example.ex: People will judge you whatever you do...
example.tran: 不论你做什么，人们都会品头论足。

collins.tran: (用于名词词组后，强调否定陈述)任何，丝毫
collins.def: You use whatever after a noun group in order to emphasize a negative statement.

example.ex: There is no evidence whatever that competition in broadcasting has ever reduced costs...
example.tran: 没有任何证据表明，广播业的竞争使成本有所降低。

example.ex: I have nothing whatever to say.
example.tran: 我无话可说。

collins.def: You use whatever to ask in an emphatic way about something which you are very surprised about.

example.ex: Whatever can you mean?...
example.tran: 你到底是什么意思？

example.ex: Whatever is the matter with you both?
example.tran: 你们俩究竟怎么回事？

collins.tran: (用于表示不清楚刚才所提到事物的准确特征、含义、价值等)不管什么，随便怎样
collins.def: You use whatever when you are indicating that you do not know the precise identity, meaning, or value of the thing just mentioned.

example.ex: I thought that my upbringing was 'normal', whatever that is...
example.tran: 我认为我的成长过程甭管怎么说还算“正常”。

example.ex: 'I love you,' he said. — 'Whatever that means,' she said.
example.tran: 他说：“我爱你。”—— 她说：“你懂什么是爱吗？”

collins.def: You say or whatever to refer generally to something else of the same kind as the thing or things that you have just mentioned.

example.ex: You may like a Malt whisky that is peatier, or smokier, or sweeter, or whatever.
example.tran: 你可能想来一杯麦芽威士忌，炭香味重些的、烟熏味重些的或者更甘甜些的，或者什么别的口味的。

collins.tran: (表示勉强接受)随便你怎么说
collins.def: You say 'whatever you say' to indicate that you accept what someone has said, even though you do not really believe them or do not think it is a good idea.

example.ex: 'We'll go in your car, Billy.'—'Whatever you say.'
example.tran: “比利，我们要坐你的车。”——“随便。”

collins.tran: (用于提出建议或警告)不管做什么，无论怎样
collins.def: You say whatever you do when giving advice or warning someone about something.

example.ex: Whatever you do, don't look for a pay increase when you know the company is going through some difficulty...
example.tran: 不管怎样，在知道公司遭遇困境时不要指望加薪。

example.ex: Whatever you do, don't upset the women.
example.tran: 不管你做什么，不要让女士们感到不安。

collins.def: Administration is the range of activities connected with organizing and supervising the way that an organization or institution functions.

example.ex: Too much time is spent on administration.
example.tran: 在管理上花费了太多时间。

example.ex: ...a master's degree in business administration.
example.tran: 工商管理的硕士学位

collins.def: The administration of something is the process of organizing and supervising it.

example.ex: Standards in the administration of justice have degenerated...
example.tran: 执法标准下降了。

example.ex: The cost of administration is around £500.
example.tran: 监管费约为500英镑。

collins.tran: （公司或机构的）管理部门，行政部门
collins.def: The administration of a company or institution is the group of people who organize and supervise it.

example.ex: ... a member of the college administration.
example.tran: 学院行政部门的成员

collins.def: You can refer to a country's government as the administration; used especially in the United States.

example.ex: O'Leary served in federal energy posts in both the Ford and Carter administrations...
example.tran: 在福特和卡特两届政府执政期间，奥利里都在联邦能源机构中任职。

example.ex: He urged the administration and Congress to come up with a credible package to reduce the budget deficit.
example.tran: 他敦促政府和国会出台一整套切实可行的方案，以缩减预算赤字。

collins.def: Failure is a lack of success in doing or achieving something, especially in relation to a particular activity.

example.ex: This policy is doomed to failure...
example.tran: 这项政策注定会失败。

example.ex: Three attempts on the British 200-metre record also ended in failure.
example.tran: 对英国 200 米纪录发起的3 次冲击也均以失败而告终。

collins.def: If something is a failure, it is not a success.

example.ex: The marriage was a failure and they both wanted to be free of it...
example.tran: 他们的婚姻很失败，两人都想摆脱它。

example.ex: His six-year transition programme has by no means been a complete failure.
example.tran: 他的六年转型计划绝没有彻底失败。

collins.def: If you say that someone is a failure, you mean that they have not succeeded in a particular activity, or that they are unsuccessful at everything they do.

example.ex: Elgar received many honors and much acclaim and yet he often considered himself a failure...
example.tran: 人们对埃尔加赞誉有加，但他却常觉得自己是个失败者。

example.ex: I just felt I had been a failure in my personal life.
example.tran: 我就是觉得我的个人生活很失败。

collins.def: Your failure to do a particular thing is the fact that you do not do it, even though you were expected to do it.

example.ex: She accused the Foreign Office of disgraceful failure to support British citizens arrested overseas.
example.tran: 她指责说，外交部未能给在海外被捕的英国公民提供支持是可耻的。

example.ex: ...their failure to get the product mix right.
example.tran: 他们没有把产品组合弄对

collins.tran: (机器的)故障，失灵;(身体机能的)衰竭
collins.def: If there is a failure of something, for example a machine or part of the body, it goes wrong and stops working or developing properly.

example.ex: There were also several accidents mainly caused by engine failures on take-off...
example.tran: 还有几次事故主要是起飞时引擎出现故障造成的。

example.ex: He was being treated for kidney failure...
example.tran: 他因肾衰竭正在接受治疗。

collins.def: If there is a failure of a business or bank, it is no longer able to continue operating.

example.ex: Business failures rose 16% last month.
example.tran: 上个月倒闭公司的数量上升了 16％。

collins.def: If you say that someone has a failure of a particular quality or ability, you mean that they do not have enough of it.

example.ex: There is, too, a simple failure of imagination...
example.tran: 还有，就是纯粹缺乏想象力。

example.ex: He remained on his knees for a long time afterwards, ashamed by his failure of nerve.
example.tran: 他后来在地上跪了很久，为自己缺乏胆量而感到羞耻。

collins.def: A train is a number of carriages, cars, or trucks which are all connected together and which are pulled by an engine along a railway. Trains carry people and goods from one place to another.

example.ex: The train pulled into a station...
example.tran: 列车驶入了一个车站。

example.ex: We can catch the early morning train...
example.tran: 我们能赶上凌晨的火车。

collins.def: A train of vehicles, people, or animals is a long line of them travelling slowly in the same direction.

example.ex: In the old days this used to be done with a baggage train of camels.
example.tran: 在过去，这往往由一队驮载行李的骆驼完成。

example.ex: ...a long train of oil tankers.
example.tran: 一长队油轮

collins.tran: (想法、事件等的)(一)连串，(一)系列
collins.def: A train of thought or a train of events is a connected sequence, in which each thought or event seems to occur naturally or logically as a result of the previous one.

example.ex: He lost his train of thought for a moment, then recovered it...
example.tran: 他一时思维短路，然后又重新想了起来。

example.ex: Giles set in motion a train of events which would culminate in tragedy.
example.tran: 贾尔斯触发了随后的一系列事件，这些事件最终将以悲剧收场。

collins.def: The train of a woman's formal dress or wedding dress is the long part at the back of it which flows along the floor behind her.
If a process or event is in train or has been set in train, it is happening or starting to happen.

example.ex: In a moment the ceremony was in train…
example.tran: 仪式马上就要开始了。

example.ex: He praised the economic reforms set in train by the government.
example.tran: 他称赞政府启动的经济改革。

collins.def: If something brings problems or difficulties in its train, the problems or difficulties occur as a natural or logical result of it.

example.ex: The cars have brought in their train a host of other problems.
example.tran: 汽车随之带来其他一大堆问题。

means: 在（某人或某事物的）前面

collins.def: Something that is ahead is in front of you. If you look ahead, you look directly in front of you.

example.ex: Brett looked straight ahead...
example.tran: 布雷特直视前方。

example.ex: I peered ahead through the front screen...
example.tran: 我透过面前的挡风玻璃凝视前方。

collins.tran: （与push，move和forge等动词连用表示计划或组织等）进展迅速地
collins.def: You use ahead with verbs such as 'push', 'move', and 'forge' to indicate that a plan, scheme, or organization is making fast progress.

example.ex: We are moving ahead with plans to send financial aid...
example.tran: 我们提供财政援助的计划进展顺利。

example.ex: Now BBC World Television is forging ahead on its own.
example.tran: 现在英国广播公司的全球电视节目正靠自己的力量稳步推进。

collins.def: If you are ahead in your work or achievements, you have made more progress than you expected to and are performing well.

example.ex: The North Korean economy was pretty strong in its time, and was ahead until maybe 1970...
example.tran: 朝鲜的经济曾经相当强大，大约在1970年之前都是超前发展。

example.ex: First half profits have charged ahead from £127.6m to £134.2m...
example.tran: 上半年的利润已超过预计的1.276亿英镑达到1.342亿英镑。

collins.def: If a person or a team is ahead in a competition, they are winning.

example.ex: Australia were ahead throughout the game...
example.tran: 澳大利亚队在整场比赛都处于领先地位。

example.ex: Scotland were ahead in their European championship qualifier in Iceland...
example.tran: 苏格兰队在冰岛举行的欧洲杯预选赛中处于领先位置。

collins.def: Ahead also means in the future.

example.ex: A much bigger battle is ahead for the president...
example.tran: 一场更为艰巨的战斗正等待着总统。

example.ex: Anne Garrels reports there are still difficult times ahead for Poland...
example.tran: 安妮·加雷尔斯报道说波兰仍然将面临一段艰苦的时期。

collins.def: If you prepare or plan something ahead, you do it some time before a future event so that everything is ready for that event to take place.

example.ex: The government wants figures that help it to plan ahead...
example.tran: 政府需要一些有助于其提前制订计划的数据。

example.ex: Do book ahead as the restaurant is very popular...
example.tran: 该饭店非常受欢迎，请务必提前预订。

collins.def: If you go ahead, or if you go on ahead, you go in front of someone who is going to the same place so that you arrive there some time before they do.

example.ex: I went ahead and waited with Sean...
example.tran: 我先走的，和肖恩一起在那儿等。

example.ex: You just go on ahead. I'll come by later...
example.tran: 你只管先往前走。我随后就来。

collins.def: If someone, especially an official, investigates an event, situation, or claim, they try to find out what happened or what is the truth.

example.ex: Gas officials are investigating the cause of an explosion which badly damaged a house in Hampshire...
example.tran: 煤气系统的官员正在调查一起瓦斯爆炸的起因,这起事故严重毁坏了汉普郡的一所房屋。

example.ex: The two officers were being investigated by the director of public prosecutions...
example.tran: 两名警官正在接受检察官的审查。

collins.def: A deficit is the amount by which something is less than what is required or expected, especially the amount by which the total money received is less than the total money spent.

example.ex: They're ready to cut the federal budget deficit for the next fiscal year.
example.tran: 他们已准备好削减下一财年的联邦预算赤字。

example.ex: ...a deficit of 3.275 billion francs.
example.tran: 32.75亿法郎的赤字

collins.def: A wish is a desire or strong feeling that you want to have something or do something.

example.ex: She was sincere and genuine in her wish to make amends for the past...
example.tran: 她真诚地希望弥补从前的过失。

example.ex: Clearly she had no wish for conversation...
example.tran: 她显然无意谈话。

collins.def: If you wish to do something or to have it done for you, you want to do it or have it done.

example.ex: If you wish to go away for the weekend, our office will be delighted to make hotel reservations...
example.tran: 如果您想外出度周末，我们办事处将很乐意为您预订旅馆。

example.ex: We can dress as we wish now...
example.tran: 我们现在着装可以随心所欲。

collins.tran: (用于要说的话可能使人不快或担心等时)不想，无意
collins.def: Wish is used in expressions such as I don't wish to be rude or without wishing to be rude as a way of apologizing or warning someone when you are going to say something which might upset, annoy, or worry them.

example.ex: I don't wish to sound callous, but I am glad I wasn't here...
example.tran: 我不想让自己的话听上去麻木不仁，但我真的很庆幸我当时没在这儿。

example.ex: Without wishing to be unkind, she's not the most interesting company.
example.tran: 我不想那么刻薄，不过她并不是非常有情趣的伴侣。

collins.tran: 希望(不可能或可能性很小的事发生)
collins.def: If you wish something were true, you would like it to be true, even though you know that it is impossible or unlikely.

example.ex: I wish I could do that...
example.tran: 我希望我能做那件事。

example.ex: I wish it weren't true...
example.tran: 但愿这不是真的。

collins.def: If you wish for something, you express the desire for that thing silently to yourself. In fairy stories, when a person wishes for something, the thing they wish for often happens by magic.

example.ex: We have all wished for men who are more considerate...
example.tran: 我们都曾祈求能找到更加体贴的男人。

example.ex: A philosopher once said, 'Be careful what you wish for; you might get it.'
example.tran: 一位哲学家曾说过：“别轻易许愿——你可能会如愿以偿。”

collins.tran: 这是再好不过的;没有比这更好的了
collins.def: Wish is used in sentences such as I could not wish for anything better to indicate that you are very pleased with what you have and could not imagine anything better.

example.ex: I really could not have wished for a better teacher...
example.tran: 这个老师对我来说是再好不过的了。

example.ex: Who could wish for a better opportunity?
example.tran: 谁还会企求能得到比这更好的机会呢？

collins.def: If you say that you would not wish a particular thing on someone, you mean that the thing is so unpleasant that you would not want them to be forced to experience it.

example.ex: It's a horrid experience and I wouldn't wish it on my worst enemy.
example.tran: 这种经历太痛苦了，我甚至都不希望它发生在死对头身上。

collins.def: If you wish someone something such as luck or happiness, you express the hope that they will be lucky or happy.

example.ex: I wish you both a very good journey...
example.tran: 我祝愿你们两人旅途愉快。

example.ex: Goodbye, Hanu. I wish you well.
example.tran: 再见，哈努，祝你顺心如意。

collins.def: If you express your good wishes towards someone, you are politely expressing your friendly feelings towards them and your hope that they will be successful or happy.

example.ex: I found George's story very sad. Please give him my best wishes...
example.tran: 我觉得乔治的经历很悲惨，请向他转达我最诚挚的祝福。

example.ex: Western leaders sent good wishes to the new American president.
example.tran: 西方领导人向新任美国总统致以良好的祝愿。

collins.def: A coach is someone who trains a person or team of people in a particular sport.

example.ex: Tony Woodcock has joined German amateur team SC Brueck as coach.
example.tran: 托尼·伍德科克加盟德国业余队SC布吕克队担任教练。

collins.def: When someone coaches a person or a team, they help them to become better at a particular sport.

example.ex: Beckenbauer coached the West Germans to success in the World Cup final in Italy...
example.tran: 贝肯鲍尔执教西德队，带领他们在意大利世界杯决赛中获胜。

example.ex: I had coached the Alliance team for some time.
example.tran: 我曾在联盟队担任过一段时间的教练。

collins.def: A coach is a person who is in charge of a sports team.

collins.tran: (棒球运动中，站在一垒或三垒附近，给其他选手信号的)跑垒指挥员
collins.def: In baseball, a coach is a member of a team who stands near the first or third base, and gives signals to other members of the team who are on bases and are trying to score.

collins.tran: (尤指辅导备考的)私人教师，辅导教师
collins.def: A coach is someone who gives people special teaching in a particular subject, especially in order to prepare them for an examination.

example.ex: What you need is a drama coach.
example.tran: 你需要的是一位戏剧辅导老师。

collins.tran: 给…补习;(尤指)为…辅导备考
collins.def: If you coach someone, you give them special teaching in a particular subject, especially in order to prepare them for an examination.

example.ex: He gently coached me in French.
example.tran: 他为我补习法语，态度十分温和。

collins.def: A coach is a large, comfortable bus that carries passengers on long journeys.

example.ex: As we headed back to Calais, the coach was badly delayed by roadworks...
example.tran: 返回加来时，由于道路施工，我们乘坐的长途大巴严重误点。

example.ex: I hate travelling by coach.
example.tran: 我不喜欢坐长途汽车。

collins.def: A coach is one of the separate sections of a train that carries passengers.

example.ex: The train was an elaborate affair of sixteen coaches.
example.tran: 这列火车由16节车厢组成，设计复杂精巧。

collins.tran: 四轮大马车，公共马车(旧时用于载客，现在英国等国仍用于庆典场合)
collins.def: A coach is an enclosed vehicle with four wheels which is pulled by horses, and in which people used to travel. Coaches are still used for ceremonial events in some countries, such as Britain.
A champion is someone who has won the first prize in a competition, contest, or fight.

example.ex: ...a former Olympic champion...
example.tran: 前奥运会冠军

example.ex: Kasparov became world champion.
example.tran: 卡斯帕罗夫成为世界冠军。

collins.def: If you are a champion of a person, a cause, or a principle, you support or defend them.

example.ex: He received acclaim as a champion of the oppressed...
example.tran: 他因维护被压迫者的利益而备受称赞。

example.ex: He was once known as a champion of social reform.
example.tran: 他曾经是社会改革的拥护者。

collins.def: If you champion a person, a cause, or a principle, you support or defend them.

example.ex: He passionately championed the poor...
example.tran: 他满腔热情地捍卫穷人的利益。

example.ex: The amendments had been championed by pro-democracy activists.
example.tran: 修正案一直受到亲民主的活跃分子的支持。

collins.def: A sentence is a group of words which, when they are written down, begin with a capital letter and end with a full stop, question mark, or exclamation mark. Most sentences contain a subject and a verb.
In a law court, a sentence is the punishment that a person receives after they have been found guilty of a crime.

example.ex: They are already serving prison sentences for their part in the assassination...
example.tran: 他们因参与这起刺杀已经开始在监狱服刑了。

example.ex: He was given a four-year sentence...
example.tran: 他被判了4年徒刑。

collins.def: When a judge sentences someone, he or she states in court what their punishment will be.

example.ex: A military court sentenced him to death in his absence...
example.tran: 一所军事法庭在他缺席的情况下判处他死刑。

example.ex: She was sentenced to nine years in prison...
example.tran: 她被判 9 年徒刑。

collins.def: Medical means relating to illness and injuries and to their treatment or prevention.

example.ex: Several police officers received medical treatment for cuts and bruises.
example.tran: 几名警官因割伤和擦伤而接受了医治。

example.ex: ...the medical profession.
example.tran: 医疗行业

collins.def: A medical is a thorough examination of your body by a doctor, for example before you start a new job.
If you are allowed credit, you are allowed to pay for goods or services several weeks or months after you have received them.

example.ex: The group can't get credit to buy farming machinery...
example.tran: 这些人无法赊购到农用机械。

example.ex: You can ask a dealer for a discount whether you pay cash or buy on credit.
example.tran: 无论是付现还是赊购，都可以要求经销商打折。

collins.def: If someone or their bank account is in credit, their bank account has money in it.

example.ex: The idea that I could be charged when I'm in credit makes me very angry...
example.tran: 想到账户里有余额时还要收费，我就非常气愤。

example.ex: I made sure the account stayed in credit...
example.tran: 我确保账户里有余额。

collins.def: When a sum of money is credited to an account, the bank adds that sum of money to the total in the account.

example.ex: She noticed that only $80,000 had been credited to her account...
example.tran: 她注意到自己的账户里只存进了80,000美元。

example.ex: Midland decided to change the way it credited payments to accounts...
example.tran: 米兰银行决定改变付款贷记的方式。

collins.def: A credit is a sum of money which is added to an account.

example.ex: The statement of total debits and credits is known as a balance.
example.tran: 总借记和总贷记的结算即账户余额。

collins.def: A credit is an amount of money that is given to someone.

example.ex: Senator Bill Bradley outlined his own tax cut, giving families $350 in tax credits per child...
example.tran: 比尔·布拉德利参议员概述了自己的减税计划，提出每个孩子可为家庭减免350美元的课税。

example.ex: Japan has provided about $2.5 billion in credits to Russia and about $50 million in direct aid.
example.tran: 日本向俄罗斯提供了约25亿美元的借款和价值约5,000万美元的直接援助。

collins.def: If you get the credit for something good, people praise you because you are responsible for it, or are thought to be responsible for it.

example.ex: We don't mind who gets the credit so long as we don't get the blame...
example.tran: 谁受到表扬无所谓，只要我们不挨批就好。

example.ex: It would be wrong for us to take all the credit...
example.tran: 如果我们把所有功劳都揽到自己身上，那就不对了。

collins.def: If people credit someone with an achievement or if it is credited to them, people say or believe that they were responsible for it.

example.ex: The staff are crediting him with having saved Hythe's life...
example.tran: 职员们称赞他救了海丝的命。

example.ex: The 74-year-old mayor is credited with helping make Los Angeles the financial capital of the West Coast...
example.tran: 洛杉矶成为西海岸的金融中心，那位74岁的市长功不可没。

collins.def: If you credit someone with a quality, you believe or say that they have it.

example.ex: I wonder why you can't credit him with the same generosity of spirit...
example.tran: 我想知道你为什么不认为他具有同样崇高的思想境界。

example.ex: They are crediting science with power it doesn't possess.
example.tran: 他们过分夸大了科学的力量。

collins.tran: 为…赢得好感的人(或事物)
collins.def: If you say that someone is a credit to someone or something, you mean that their qualities or achievements will make people have a good opinion of the person or thing mentioned.

example.ex: He is one of the greatest British players of recent times and is a credit to his profession.
example.tran: 他是近代英国最伟大的运动员之一，是这一体育运动的骄傲。

collins.def: If you cannot credit something, you cannot believe that it is true.

example.ex: Roosevelt either did not learn of the scandal or refused to credit what he heard...
example.tran: 罗斯福要么是不知道那桩丑闻，要么是不相信他所听到的。

example.ex: It seems hard to credit that such things went on among senior Directors.
example.tran: 高级主管中竟发生了这样的事，真是令人难以置信。

collins.tran: 演职员表;摄制人员名单
collins.def: The list of people who helped to make a film, a CD, or a television  programme is called the credits .

example.ex: The star Marlon Brando wants his name removed from the credits.
example.tran: 影星马龙·白兰度要求把他的名字从演职员表中删掉。

example.ex: ...a moviegoer who remains in his seat until the credits are over.
example.tran: 直到演职员表播完才离座的影迷

collins.tran: (某些大学获得学位所必需的)学分，学习单元
collins.def: A credit is a successfully completed part of a higher education course. At some universities and colleges you need a certain number of credits to be awarded a degree.
If you say that something does someone credit, you mean that they should be praised or admired because of it.

example.ex: You're a nice girl, Lettie, and your kind heart does you credit.
example.tran: 你是个好女孩儿，莱蒂，你的善良值得称赞。

collins.tran: （某人的成绩或优点）值得表扬，应予肯定
collins.def: If you say 'credit where credit's due', you are admitting that you ought to praise someone for something that they have done or for a good quality that they possess.

example.ex: His gift was an extremely kind gesture. Credit where credit's due.
example.tran: 他的礼物是很友好的表示，这值得称赞。

collins.tran: 相信…具有(某种优良品质);称赞;认可
collins.def: To give someone credit for a good quality means to believe that they have it.

example.ex: Bratbakk had more ability than the media gave him credit for.
example.tran: 布拉特巴克比媒体称赞的要有才华。

collins.tran: (常用于提出缺点之后)就优点而言
collins.def: You say on the credit side in order to introduce one or more good things about a situation or person, usually when you have already mentioned the bad things about them.

example.ex: On the credit side, he's always been wonderful with his mother.
example.tran: 就优点而言，他对母亲一直很孝顺。

collins.def: If something is to someone's credit, they deserve praise for it.

example.ex: She had managed to pull herself together and, to her credit, continued to look upon life as a positive experience...
example.tran: 她已经努力振作起来，而且值得称赞的是，她仍然积极乐观地看待生活。

example.ex: Although the offences were horrific it was to her credit that she had owned up.
example.tran: 她的犯罪手段很残忍，但她的供认不讳还是可以认可的。

collins.def: If you already have one or more achievements to your credit, you have achieved them.

example.ex: I have twenty novels and countless magazine stories to my credit.
example.tran: 我著有20部小说，还在杂志上发表了无数篇文章。

means: （广播或电视上题材或角色相同的）系列节目

collins.tran: 一连串;一系列;连续;接连
collins.def: A series of things or events is a number of them that come one after the other.

example.ex: ...a series of meetings with students and political leaders.
example.tran: 与学生和政治领袖的一系列会面

example.ex: ...a series of explosions.
example.tran: 一连串的爆炸事件

collins.tran: (广播或电视的)系列节目,系列片
collins.def: A radio or television series is a set of programmes of a particular kind which have the same title.

example.ex: ...the TV series 'The Trials of Life' presented by David Attenborough.
example.tran: 由戴维·阿滕伯勒主持的电视系列片《生命之源》

example.ex: ...the world's longest-running radio series, Britain's 'The Archers'.
example.tran: 世界上最长的广播剧，英国的《阿彻一家》

collins.def: Absolutely means totally and completely.

example.ex: Jill is absolutely right...
example.tran: 吉尔完全正确。

example.ex: I absolutely refuse to get married...
example.tran: 我决不结婚。

collins.def: Some people say absolutely as an emphatic way of saying yes or of agreeing with someone. They say absolutely not as an emphatic way of saying no or of disagreeing with someone.

example.ex: 'It's worrying, isn't it?' – 'Absolutely.'...
example.tran: “这让人担忧，不是吗？”——“确实是。”

example.ex: 'Did they approach you?' – 'No, absolutely not.'
example.tran: “他们找过你了吗？”——“没有，绝对没有。”

collins.def: The weather is the condition of the atmosphere in one area at a particular time, for example if it is raining, hot, or windy.

example.ex: The weather was bad...
example.tran: 天气很糟。

example.ex: I like cold weather...
example.tran: 我喜欢冷天。

collins.def: If something such as wood or rock weathers or is weathered, it changes colour or shape as a result of the wind, sun, rain, or cold.

example.ex: Unpainted wooden furniture weathers to a grey colour...
example.tran: 没有上漆的木制家具会褪成灰色。

example.ex: This rock has been weathered and eroded.
example.tran: 这块岩石经风吹日晒已被侵蚀。

collins.def: If you weather a difficult time or a difficult situation, you survive it and are able to continue normally after it has passed or ended.

example.ex: The company has weathered the recession...
example.tran: 这家公司从经济萧条中挺了过来。

example.ex: The government has weathered its worst political crisis.
example.tran: 政府平安度过了其最严重的政治危机。

collins.tran: 警惕;密切注意；留心观察
collins.def: If you keep a weather eye on someone or something, you stay alert so that you will notice if anything unpleasant happens.

example.ex: Street committees keep a weather eye on the families in their district.
example.tran: 街道委员会留意所辖区域内的家家户户。

collins.tran: 夸大…的困难；对…小题大做
collins.def: If you say that someone is making heavy weather of a task, you are critical of them because they are doing it in an inefficient way and are making it seem more difficult than it really is.

example.ex: Some of the riders in this section made heavy weather of the cross-country race.
example.tran: 这个环节的部分骑手夸大了这场越野比赛的困难。

collins.def: If you say that you are under the weather, you mean that you feel slightly ill.

example.ex: I was still feeling a bit under the weather.
example.tran: 我仍觉得身体有些不舒服。

collins.def: Something that is safe does not cause physical harm or danger.

example.ex: Officials arrived to assess whether it is safe to bring emergency food supplies into the city...
example.tran: 官员们赶来评估向该市调拨紧急救援食品是否安全。

example.ex: Most foods that we eat are safe for birds.
example.tran: 我们食用的大多数食物对鸟类都无害。

collins.tran: 不会受伤的;不会受损的
collins.def: If a person or thing is safe from something, they cannot be harmed or damaged by it.

example.ex: In the future people can go to a football match knowing that they are safe from hooliganism...
example.tran: 今后人们去看足球比赛时可以不必担心会受到足球流氓的骚扰。

example.ex: On beaches, keep your camera safe from sand by enveloping it inside a plastic bag...
example.tran: 在沙滩上时，将相机用塑料袋包裹起来以防止进沙子。

collins.tran: 安全的;没有受伤的;安然无恙的
collins.def: If you are safe, you have not been harmed, or you are not in danger of being harmed.

example.ex: Where is Sophy? Is she safe?...
example.tran: 索菲在哪里？她没有受伤吧？

example.ex: A baby boy is safe after rescue workers pulled him from a 12-foot-deep construction hole...
example.tran: 营救人员将一名男婴从 12 英尺深的建筑工地的深坑里拉出来时，他安然无恙。

collins.def: A safe place is one where it is unlikely that any harm, damage, or unpleasant things will happen to the people or things that are there.

example.ex: Many refugees have fled to safer areas...
example.tran: 许多难民已经逃往了更安全的地方。

example.ex: The elimination of all nuclear weapons would make the world a safer place...
example.tran: 销毁所有的核武器将会使世界变得更安全。

collins.tran: (旅途)平安的，无损的，一路顺风的
collins.def: If people or things have a safe journey, they reach their destination without harm, damage, or unpleasant things happening to them.

example.ex: 'I'm heading back to Ireland again for another weekend.' — 'Have a safe journey.'
example.tran: “我要再回爱尔兰过一个周末。”——“一路平安。”

example.ex: ...the UN plan to deploy 500 troops to ensure the safe delivery of food and other supplies.
example.tran: 联合国部署一支 500 人的军队以确保食物和其他补给物资安全运送的计划

collins.tran: (距离)安全的，不会遭到伤害的
collins.def: If you are at a safe distance from something or someone, you are far enough away from them to avoid any danger, harm, or unpleasant effects.

example.ex: I shall conceal myself at a safe distance from the battlefield...
example.tran: 我会躲在一个远离战场的安全地带。

example.ex: He thinks he can find a way to vaccinate the elephants from a safe distance.
example.tran: 他认为自己能找到一种从安全距离给大象接种疫苗的方法。

collins.tran: 不会丢失的;志在必得的;稳操胜券的
collins.def: If something you have or expect to obtain is safe, you cannot lose it or be prevented from having it.

example.ex: We as consumers need to feel confident that our jobs are safe before we will spend spare cash...
example.tran: 我们作为消费者在把闲钱花掉之前，需要确信自己不会失业。

example.ex: Is the National Health Service safe with the Conservative party?...
example.tran: 保守党能否继续实行国民医疗保健制度？

collins.tran: (行动)风险小的，万无一失的，保险的
collins.def: A safe course of action is one in which there is very little risk of loss or failure.

example.ex: Electricity shares are still a safe investment...
example.tran: 电力股仍然是低风险投资。

example.ex: It might not be safe politically for the President to leave the country.
example.tran: 总统离开国家可能会有政治上的危险。

collins.tran: 四平八稳的;缺乏新意的;不够刺激的
collins.def: If you disapprove of something because you think it is not very exciting or original, you can describe it as safe .

example.ex: ...frustrated artists who became lawyers at an early age because it seemed a safe option...
example.tran: 趁年轻改行从事律师这一看似稳定的职业的失意落泊的艺术家们

example.ex: Rock'n'roll has become so commercialised and safe since punk.
example.tran: 摇滚乐自从朋克乐以后就已经过于商业化而缺乏新意了。

collins.tran: 有把握的;不会有错的;可以肯定的
collins.def: If it is safe to say or assume something, you can say it with very little risk of being wrong.

example.ex: I think it is safe to say that very few students expend the effort to do quality work in school...
example.tran: 我认为可以肯定地说学校里很少有学生肯为学好功课下功夫。

example.ex: The only safe assumption is that the world's financial markets will have to find solutions themselves.
example.tran: 唯一可以断定的是世界金融市场将不得不自己寻找出路。

collins.tran: (秘密)不会被泄漏的，会被保守的，安全的
collins.def: If you say to someone that their secret is safe with you, you are promising not to tell it to anyone.

example.ex: Don't worry, Mr Palin, your secret is safe with me.
example.tran: 别担心，佩林先生，我会保守你的秘密。

collins.def: A safe is a strong metal cupboard with special locks, in which you keep money, jewellery, or other valuable things.

example.ex: The files are now in a safe to which only he has the key.
example.tran: 文件目前放在一个只有他才能打开的保险柜里。

collins.tran: 得到妥善照顾的;由可靠的人保护(或保管)的
collins.def: If you say that a person or thing is in safe hands, or is safe in someone's hands, you mean that they are being looked after by a reliable person and will not be harmed.

example.ex: I had a huge responsibility to ensure these packets remained in safe hands...
example.tran: 我负有确保这些包裹得到妥善保管的重大责任。

example.ex: Don't worry, Uncle Tim, your future is safe in our hands.
example.tran: 别担心，蒂姆大叔，你将来由我们照顾。

collins.tran: 非常安全的;绝对安全的
collins.def: If you say that something or someone is as safe as houses, you mean that they are completely safe.

example.ex: The Government insisted that Britain's nuclear power stations are as safe as houses.
example.tran: 英国政府坚称英国的核电站非常安全。

collins.tran: 使(某地)适合开展(某活动);使适宜
collins.def: If someone tries to make a place safe for a particular activity, they try to make the place suitable for that activity, although their efforts may have very undesirable effects.

example.ex: Why did these men fight and die? Supposedly it was to make the world safe for democracy.
example.tran: 为什么这些人战死了呢？据说，是为了在全世界实现民主。

collins.def: If you play safe or play it safe, you do not take any risks.

example.ex: If you want to play safe, cut down on the amount of salt you eat...
example.tran: 如果想要谨慎点的话，就减少盐的摄入量。

example.ex: The pilot decided that Christchurch was too far away, and played it safe and landed at Wellington.
example.tran: 飞行员认为克赖斯特彻奇距离太远，为求稳妥，就降落在了惠灵顿。

collins.tran: 谨慎为是;以防万一;为安全起见
collins.def: If you say you are doing something to be on the safe side, you mean that you are doing it in case something undesirable happens, even though this may be unnecessary.

example.ex: You might still want to go for an X-ray, however, just to be on the safe side.
example.tran: 不过，为稳妥起见，你可能还想要照一个 X 光。

collins.tran: 宁可事先谨慎有余，不要事后追悔莫及
collins.def: If you say 'it's better to be safe than sorry', you are advising someone to take action in order to avoid possible unpleasant consequences later, even if this seems unnecessary.

example.ex: Don't be afraid to have this checked by a doctor — better safe than sorry!
example.tran: 不要害怕找医生检查一下——宁求稳妥以免后悔！

collins.tran: 平平安安的;安然无恙的
collins.def: You say that someone is safe and sound when they are still alive or unharmed after being in danger.

example.ex: All I'm hoping for is that wherever Trevor is he will come home safe and sound.
example.tran: 我只希望不管特雷弗在哪里，他都能平平安安回家。

collins.def: Activity is a situation in which a lot of things are happening or being done.

example.ex: ...an extraordinary level of activity in the government bonds market.
example.tran: 政府公债市场异常活跃

example.ex: ...the electrical activity of the brain.
example.tran: 脑电波的活动

collins.def: An activity is something that you spend time doing.

example.ex: You can take part in activities from canoeing to bird watching.
example.tran: 你可以参与从划独木舟到观鸟等各种活动。

collins.tran: （团体为达到某种目的而采取的）活动，行动
collins.def: The activities of a group are the things that they do in order to achieve their aims.

example.ex: ...a jail term for terrorist activities...
example.tran: 因参与恐怖活动而被判的刑期

example.ex: On April 29, the activities of the company were suspended on the orders of the Bank of England.
example.tran: 4月29日，奉英国银行之命，该公司的各项活动被暂停。

collins.def: A material is a solid substance.

example.ex: ...electrons in a conducting material such as a metal.
example.tran: 金属等导电材料中的电子

example.ex: ...the design of new absorbent materials.
example.tran: 新型高吸水性材料的设计

collins.def: Material is cloth.

example.ex: ...the thick material of her skirt...
example.tran: 她的裙子的厚布料

example.ex: The materials are soft and comfortable to wear.
example.tran: 这些布料质地柔软，穿着很舒服。

collins.def: Materials are the things that you need for a particular activity.

example.ex: The builders ran out of materials.
example.tran: 建筑商耗尽了材料。

example.ex: ...sewing materials.
example.tran: 缝纫材料

collins.def: Ideas or information that are used as a basis for a book, play, or film can be referred  to as material .

example.ex: In my version of the story, I added some new material.
example.tran: 我在讲述这个故事时加入了新的素材。

example.ex: ...the film producer's debt to the author of original screen material.
example.tran: 影片的制片人受到了创作影片原始素材的作者的启发

collins.tran: （指与抽象相对）物质的，有形的，实体的
collins.def: Material things are related to possessions or money, rather than to more abstract things such as ideas or values.

example.ex: Every room must have been stuffed with material things.
example.tran: 每个房间肯定都塞满了东西。

example.ex: ...the material world.
example.tran: 物质世界

collins.def: If you say that someone is a particular kind of material, you mean that they have the qualities or abilities to do a particular job or task.

example.ex: She was not university material...
example.tran: 她不是上大学的料。

example.ex: His message has changed little since he became presidential material.
example.tran: 成为总统候选人后，他的宣言并没有多少变化。

collins.tran: (证据或信息)直接相关的，实质性的，重要的
collins.def: Material evidence or information is directly relevant and important in a legal or academic argument.

example.ex: The nature and availability of material evidence was not to be discussed...
example.tran: 实质性证据的性质和可用性毋庸讨论。

example.ex: They contend that the company failed to disclose material information.
example.tran: 他们坚持认为该公司并未透露实质性的信息。

collins.def: A guest is someone who is visiting you or is at an event because you have invited them.

example.ex: She was a guest at the wedding...
example.tran: 她是参加婚礼的客人。

example.ex: Their guests sipped drinks on the veranda.
example.tran: 他们的客人在游廊里浅酌着美酒。

collins.def: A guest is someone who visits a place or organization or appears on a radio or television show because they have been invited to do so.

example.ex: ...a frequent chat show guest...
example.tran: 经常出现在访谈节目中的特邀嘉宾

example.ex: Dr Gerald Jeffers is the guest speaker...
example.tran: 杰拉尔德·杰弗斯博士是特邀演讲人。

collins.def: A guest is someone who is staying in a hotel.

example.ex: I was the only hotel guest...
example.tran: 我是宾馆里唯一的住客。

example.ex: Hotels operate a collection service for their guests from the airports.
example.tran: 宾馆为客人提供机场接机服务。

collins.tran: 做特邀嘉宾；做特邀演员；客串
collins.def: To guest means to take part in a performance or a match as a guest, rather than as a regular member.

example.ex: He guested for one or two League sides...
example.tran: 他在一两支联赛队伍中做过外援。

example.ex: The band have recently guested on records by Ringo Starr and Tears For Fears.
example.tran: 这个乐队最近在林戈·斯塔尔和“恐惧之泪”乐队的唱片中客串过。

collins.def: If you say be my guest to someone, you are giving them permission to do something.

example.ex: If anybody wants to work on this, be my guest.
example.tran: 如果哪位想干这个，请便。

collins.tran: 达到目的;成功做成;办到
collins.def: If you succeed in doing something, you manage to do it.

example.ex: We have already succeeded in working out ground rules with the Department of Defense...
example.tran: 我们已经成功地与国防部敲定了基本原则。
