example.ex: Some people will succeed in their efforts to stop smoking...
example.tran: 一些人经过努力可以成功戒烟。

collins.tran: 取得预期效果;表现良好
collins.def: If something succeeds, it works in a satisfactory way or has the result that is intended.

example.ex: If marriage is to succeed in the 1990's, then people have to recognise the new pressures it is facing.
example.tran: 在 20 世纪 90 年代人们要想婚姻美满，那就不得不认识到它所面临的新压力。

example.ex: ...a move which would make any future talks even more unlikely to succeed.
example.tran: 可能使今后的所有对话都更加难以取得什么成果的举动

collins.def: Someone who succeeds gains a high position in what they do, for example in business or politics.

example.ex: ...the skills and qualities needed to succeed in small and medium-sized businesses.
example.tran: 经营好中小企业所需的技能和素质

collins.def: If you succeed another person, you are the next person to have their job or position.

example.ex: David Rowland is almost certain to succeed him as chairman on January 1...
example.tran: 戴维·罗兰将在 1 月 1 日接替他任主席几乎已成定局。

example.ex: The present ruler, Prince Rainier III, succeeded to the throne on 9 May 1949.
example.tran: 现任元首，兰尼埃三世亲王于 1949 年 5 月 9 日继位。

collins.def: If one thing is succeeded by another thing, the other thing happens or comes after it.

example.ex: A quick divorce can be succeeded by a much longer — and more agonising — period of haggling over the fate of the family.
example.tran: 闪电式离婚后可能紧接着就是一段在家庭命运上互相纠结的更加漫长、更加痛苦的时期。

means: 未必的，不一定有把握的

collins.tran: 不太可能的；未必会发生的
collins.def: If you say that something is unlikely to happen or unlikely to be true, you believe that it will not happen or that it is not true, although you are not completely sure.

example.ex: A military coup seems unlikely...
example.tran: 看起来不太可能会发生军事政变。

example.ex: As with many technological revolutions, you are unlikely to be aware of it...
example.tran: 就像诸多的技术革命一样，你可能不太会注意到它。

means: 足球〔美国通常指橄榄球〕
屡屡引起争论（或分歧）的问题

collins.def: Football is a game played by two teams of eleven players using a round ball. Players kick the ball to each other and try to score goals by kicking the ball into a large net.

example.ex: Several boys were still playing football on the waste ground.
example.tran: 几个男孩还在那片废弃的空地上踢足球。

example.ex: ...Arsenal Football Club.
example.tran: 阿森纳足球俱乐部

collins.def: Football is a game played by two teams of eleven players using an oval ball. Players carry the ball in their hands or throw it to each other as they try to score goals that are called touchdowns.

example.ex: Two blocks beyond our school was a field where boys played football...
example.tran: 离我们学校两个街区远的地方有个男孩们玩橄榄球的球场。

example.ex: This year's national college football championship was won by Princeton.
example.tran: 今年全国高校橄榄球锦标赛的冠军是普林斯顿队。

collins.def: A football is a ball that is used for playing football.
If you travel, you go from one place to another, often to a place that is far away.

example.ex: You had better travel to Helsinki tomorrow...
example.tran: 你最好明天赶赴赫尔辛基。

example.ex: Granny travelled down by train…
example.tran: 奶奶是乘火车过来的。

collins.def: Travel is the activity of travelling.

example.ex: Information on travel in New Zealand is available at the hotel…
example.tran: 新西兰的旅行信息可以在宾馆获取。

example.ex: He detested air travel.
example.tran: 他厌恶乘飞机旅行。

collins.def: If you travel the world, the country, or the area, you go to many different places in the world or in a particular country or area.

example.ex: Dr Ryan travelled the world gathering material for his book...
example.tran: 瑞安博士周游世界为他的书搜集资料。

example.ex: He has had to travel the country in search of work.
example.tran: 他不得不走遍全国寻找工作。

collins.def: When light or sound from one place reaches another, you say that it travels to the other place.

example.ex: When sound travels through water, strange things can happen...
example.tran: 当声音在水中传播时，可能会发生奇怪的现象。

example.ex: Light travels at around 300,000,000 metres per second.
example.tran: 光以每秒约 30 万公里的速度传播。

collins.def: When news becomes known by people in different places, you can say that it travels to them.

example.ex: News of his work traveled all the way to Asia...
example.tran: 有关他研究成果的消息一路传到了亚洲。

example.ex: Seems like news travels pretty fast around here.
example.tran: 这里似乎消息传播得很快。

collins.def: Someone's travels are the journeys that they make to places a long way from their home.

example.ex: He also collects things for the house on his travels abroad.
example.tran: 他在国外旅游时也为家宅搜集物品作为摆设。

collins.def: If you travel light, you travel without taking much luggage.

collins.tran: (食品等货物)宜于长途运输，经得起长途运输
collins.def: If goods such as food products travel well, they can be transported a long way without being damaged or their quality being spoiled.

example.ex: Ripe fruit does not travel well, but unripe fruit can be transported worldwide.
example.tran: 熟透的水果不宜长途运输，但未成熟的水果却可以运往全世界。

collins.tran: (思想、方法或样式)广为流传，盛行各地
collins.def: If you say that an idea, a method, or a style travels well, you mean that it can be appreciated or used by people in several different countries, and not just in the country where it began.

example.ex: That brand of humour generally travels well.
example.tran: 那种风格的幽默通常在各地都喜闻乐见。

collins.def: If you exercise something such as your authority, your rights, or a good quality, you use it or put it into effect.

example.ex: They are merely exercising their right to free speech...
example.tran: 他们只是在行使他们的言论自由权。

example.ex: 'The powers delegated to me,' the President said, 'will be exercised with due responsibility.'...
example.tran: “赋予我的权力，”总统说，“我将尽责履行。”

collins.def: When you exercise, you move your body energetically in order to get fit and to remain healthy.

example.ex: She exercises two or three times a week...
example.tran: 她每周锻炼两三次。

example.ex: Never keep on exercising if you have even the slightest chest pain...
example.tran: 即使你只感到很轻微的胸部疼痛，也不要继续锻炼。

collins.def: If a movement or activity exercises a part of your body, it keeps it strong, healthy, or in good condition.

example.ex: They call rowing the perfect sport. It exercises every major muscle group.
example.tran: 他们称划船是最佳运动，它可以锻炼每一处主要肌肉群。

collins.def: Exercises are a series of movements or actions which you do in order to get fit, remain healthy, or practise for a particular physical activity.

example.ex: These stomach exercises will tighten abdominal muscles...
example.tran: 这些腹部练习会增强腹肌。

example.ex: I do special neck and shoulder exercises...
example.tran: 我做专门的颈部和肩部运动。

collins.def: Exercises are military activities and operations which are not part of a real war, but which allow the armed forces to practise for a real war.

example.ex: General Powell predicted that in the future it might even be possible to stage joint military exercises...
example.tran: 鲍威尔将军预测将来甚至可能举行联合军事演习。

example.ex: The military truck was taking 14 men on exercise in a remote area of Norway.
example.tran: 那辆军用卡车正载着14名士兵到挪威的一个偏远地区进行操练。

collins.def: An exercise is a short activity or piece of work that you do, for example in school, which is designed to help you learn a particular skill.

example.ex: Try working through the opening exercises in this chapter...
example.tran: 做一做本章节的开篇习题。

example.ex: He took up piano lessons, combining standard classical exercises with his own attempts at Gershwin.
example.tran: 他上钢琴课，一边进行标准的经典作品的练习，一边自己尝试练习格什温的作品。

collins.def: Exercises is an official ceremony, in which people make speeches and present awards.

example.ex: Vicky and Gary attended the graduation exercises at Columbia.
example.tran: 维基和加里参加了哥伦比亚大学的毕业典礼。

collins.def: If you describe an activity as an exercise in a particular quality or result, you mean that it has that quality or result, especially when it was not intended to have it.

example.ex: Her morning was an exercise in indecision. She tried on everything in her closet but couldn't remember what he'd liked...
example.tran: 她整个早晨都犹豫不决。她试穿了衣橱中的所有衣服，却不记得他喜欢哪一件。

example.ex: As an exercise in stating the obvious, this could scarcely be faulted...
example.tran: 这说的都是些显而易见的事情，几乎不可能出错。

collins.def: If something exercises you or your mind, you think or talk about it a great deal, especially because you are worried or concerned about it.

example.ex: This has been a major problem exercising the minds of scientists around the world...
example.tran: 这一直是困扰全世界科学家的一个重要问题。

example.ex: The proper role of appeal judges is an issue that has long exercised the finest legal minds.
example.tran: 上诉法官应当扮演何种角色，这一问题长期以来困扰着那些最出色的法律人士。

collins.def: The thirteenth item in a series is the one that you count as number thirteen.
The cast of a play or film is all the people who act in it.

example.ex: The show is very amusing and the cast are very good.
example.tran: 演出妙趣横生，演员的表演也很出彩。

collins.tran: 挑选(演员);使…出演(某角色)
collins.def: To cast an actor in a play or film means to choose them to act a particular role in it.

example.ex: The world premiere of Harold Pinter's new play casts Ian Holm in the lead role...
example.tran: 哈罗德·品特新剧的世界首演由伊恩·霍尔姆担纲主演。

example.ex: He was cast as a college professor...
example.tran: 他被安排饰演一个大学教授。

collins.def: To cast someone in a particular way or as a particular thing means to describe them in that way or suggest they are that thing.

example.ex: Democrats have been worried about being cast as the party of the poor...
example.tran: 民主党人一直担心被描绘成穷人的政党。

example.ex: Holland would never dare cast himself as a virtuoso pianist.
example.tran: 霍兰永远不敢说自己是位钢琴名家。

collins.def: If you cast your eyes or cast a look in a particular direction, you look quickly in that direction.

example.ex: He cast a stern glance at the two men...
example.tran: 他朝那两个人狠狠地瞪了一眼。

example.ex: I cast my eyes down briefly...
example.tran: 我向下瞥了一眼。

collins.def: If something casts a light or shadow somewhere, it causes it to appear there.

example.ex: The moon cast a bright light over the yard...
example.tran: 明亮的月光洒在院子里。

example.ex: They flew in over the beach, casting a huge shadow.
example.tran: 它们飞到海滩上空，抛下一大片黑影。

collins.def: To cast doubt on something means to cause people to be unsure about it.

example.ex: Last night a top criminal psychologist cast doubt on the theory.
example.tran: 昨天晚上，一位顶级犯罪心理学家使人们对该理论产生了怀疑。

collins.def: When you cast your vote in an election, you vote.

example.ex: About ninety-five per cent of those who cast their votes approve the new constitution...
example.tran: 参加投票的人中有大约95%支持新宪法。

example.ex: Gaviria had been widely expected to obtain well over half the votes cast.
example.tran: 人们普遍认为加维里亚能获得远远超过半数的选票。

collins.def: To cast something or someone somewhere means to throw them there.

example.ex: Any true lover casting a pin into the fountain and gazing into it will see his or her future partner...
example.tran: 只要你心诚，往喷泉里扔下一根大头针，然后盯着泉水看，就能看见未来伴侣的影子。

example.ex: John had Maude and her son cast into a dungeon.
example.tran: 约翰让人将莫德和她的儿子关进了地牢。

collins.def: If someone casts a fishing line or casts, they throw one end of the fishing line into the water.

example.ex: Some way from them, the fisherman cast his line.
example.tran: 在离他们稍远的地方，渔夫下了钩。

collins.def: To cast an object means to make it by pouring a liquid such as hot metal into a specially shaped container and leaving it there until it becomes hard.

example.ex: ...sculptures cast in bronze.
example.tran: 青铜铸造的雕像

collins.def: A cast is a model that has been made by pouring a liquid such as plaster or hot metal onto something or into something, so that when it hardens it has the same shape as that thing.

example.ex: An orthodontist took a cast of the inside of Billy's mouth.
example.tran: 正畸医生从比利的口腔内部取了模型。

collins.def: A cast is the same as a plaster cast .
If someone has a particular cast of mind or cast of thought, they have that kind of character or way of thinking of things.

example.ex: The Social Democratic Party was full of people of an academic cast of mind...
example.tran: 社会民主党内尽是些学究式思维的人。

example.ex: Hers was an essentially sunny cast of mind.
example.tran: 她本质上是属于阳光快乐的性格。

collins.def: When you cook a meal, you prepare food for eating by heating it.

example.ex: I have to go and cook the dinner...
example.tran: 我得去做饭了。

example.ex: Chefs at the St James Court restaurant have cooked for the Queen...
example.tran: 圣詹姆斯皇家饭店的厨师们曾经为女王烹制菜肴。

collins.def: When you cook food, or when food cooks, it is heated until it is ready to be eaten.

example.ex: ...some basic instructions on how to cook a turkey...
example.tran: 烹饪火鸡的一些基本的做法指导

example.ex: Let the vegetables cook gently for about 10 minutes...
example.tran: 用小火将蔬菜煮大约10分钟。

collins.def: A cook is a person whose job is to prepare and cook food, especially in someone's home or in an institution.

example.ex: They had a butler, a cook, and a maid.
example.tran: 他们有一个男管家、一个厨师和一个女佣。

collins.def: If you say that someone is a good cook, you mean they are good at preparing and cooking food.
If you say that someone has cooked the books, you mean that they have changed figures or a written record in order to deceive people.

means: （关于）过去某一特定历史时期的
（家具、服饰、建筑等）某一时代的

collins.def: A period is a length of time.

example.ex: This crisis might last for a long period of time.
example.tran: 这次危机可能持续很长时间。

example.ex: ...a period of a few months.
example.tran: 几个月时间

collins.tran: （个人、组织或社会的）阶段，时期，时代
collins.def: A period in the life of a person, organization, or society is a length of time which is remembered for a particular situation or activity.

example.ex: ...a period of economic good health and expansion...
example.tran: 经济健康发展并且不断扩张的一段时期

example.ex: He went through a period of wanting to be accepted...
example.tran: 有一段时间他很想被人接受。

collins.def: A particular length of time in history is sometimes called a period. For example, you can talk about the Victorian period or the Elizabethan period in Britain.

example.ex: ...the Roman period...
example.tran: 罗马帝国时代

example.ex: No reference to their existence appears in any literature of the period.
example.tran: 这一时期的文学作品中都没有提及他们的存在。

collins.tran: （服装、家具、乐器）过去的，古代的，具有某个时代特征的
collins.def: Period costumes, furniture, and instruments were made at an earlier time in history, or look as if they were made then.

example.ex: ...dressed in full period costume.
example.tran: 穿着宽松的古装

example.ex: ...replicas of period instruments.
example.tran: 古乐器的复制品

collins.def: Exercise, training, or study periods are lengths of time that are set aside for exercise, training, or study.

example.ex: They accompanied him during his exercise periods.
example.tran: 练习的时候他们陪着他。

collins.def: At a school or college, a period is one of the parts that the day is divided into during which lessons or other activities take place.

example.ex: ...periods of private study.
example.tran: 自习课

example.ex: ...taking his scripts to school in order to learn the lines in free periods.
example.tran: 把他的剧本带到学校以便空闲的时候背台词

collins.def: When a woman has a period, she bleeds from her womb. This usually happens once a month, unless she is pregnant.
Some people say period after stating a fact or opinion when they want to emphasize that they are definite about something and do not want to discuss it further.

example.ex: I don't want to do it, period.
example.tran: 我不想做，这事就到此为止吧。

collins.def: A period is the punctuation mark (.) which you use at the end of a sentence when it is not a question or an exclamation.
The division of a large unit into two or more distinct parts is the act of separating it into these parts.

example.ex: ...the unification of Germany, after its division into two states at the end of World War Two.
example.tran: 二战结束时曾被一分为二的德国实现了统一

collins.def: The division of something among people or things is its separation into parts which are distributed among the people or things.

example.ex: The current division of labor between workers and management will alter.
example.tran: 当前工人与管理部门的分工将会改变。

collins.def: Division is the arithmetical process of dividing one number into another number.

example.ex: I taught my daughter how to do division at the age of six.
example.tran: 女儿6岁时我就教她如何做除法了。

collins.def: A division is a significant distinction or argument between two groups, which causes the two groups to be considered as very different and separate.

example.ex: The division between the prosperous west and the impoverished east remains.
example.tran: 繁荣的西部和贫穷的东部之间的差距仍然存在。

collins.def: In a large organization, a division is a group of departments whose work is done in the same place or is connected with similar tasks.

example.ex: ...the bank's Latin American division.
example.tran: 该银行的拉丁美洲分部

example.ex: ...the sales division.
example.tran: 销售部

collins.def: A division is a group of military units which fight as a single unit.

example.ex: Several armoured divisions are being moved from Germany.
example.tran: 正从德国调动几个装甲师。

collins.def: In the British Parliament, a division is a vote where the Members of Parliament go into separate rooms in order to record their vote.

collins.tran: (足球等体育运动中联赛的)级
collins.def: In some sports, such as football, baseball, and basketball, a division is one of the groups of teams which make up a league. The teams in each division are considered to be approximately the same standard, and they all play against each other during the season.

example.ex: Villa had just been relegated from the First Division.
example.tran: 维拉队刚刚从甲级联赛中降级。

example.ex: ...the Scottish Premier Division leaders, Dundee United.
example.tran: 苏格兰超级联赛的领头羊，邓迪联队

collins.def: Lunch is the meal that you have in the middle of the day.

example.ex: Shall we meet somewhere for lunch?...
example.tran: 我们找地方见面一起吃个午饭好不好？

example.ex: He did not enjoy business lunches...
example.tran: 他不喜欢吃工作午餐。

collins.def: When you lunch, you have lunch, especially at a restaurant.

example.ex: Only the extremely rich could afford to lunch at the Mirabelle...
example.tran: 只有非常有钱的人才能在米拉贝勒餐厅吃得起午餐。

example.ex: Having not yet lunched, we went to the refreshment bar for ham sandwiches.
example.tran: 我们都没吃午饭，于是便去小吃店买了火腿三明治。

collins.def: If you say there's no such thing as a free lunch, you are saying that most things that are worth having need to be paid for or worked for, and that you cannot expect to get things for nothing.

example.ex: The book includes 25 Lessons for Life: Lesson 1: There is no free lunch. Don't  feel entitled to anything you don't sweat and struggle for...
example.tran: 本书共包括25堂“人生课”：第一课，没有免费的午餐。别以为可以不劳而获。

example.ex: But, even in Hollywood, there is no such thing as a free lunch.
example.tran: 但即使是在好莱坞也没有免费的午餐。

collins.def: A bird is a creature with feathers and wings. Female birds lay eggs. Most birds can fly.

collins.tran: 小妞儿（可能具冒犯意味）
collins.def: Some men refer to young women as birds. This use could cause offence.
Some people refer to the birds and the bees when they are talking about sex, especially to children.
Someone who is doing bird is in prison.

example.ex: They warned him that next time he'd find himself doing bird.
example.tran: 他们警告他下次他可能就要进监狱了。

collins.def: If you refer to two people as birds of a feather, you mean that they have the same interests or are very similar.
If an audience gives someone the bird, they shout loudly in order to show their disappointment or disapproval.

collins.tran: （表示侮辱）被竖中指/冲…竖中指
collins.def: If you get the bird or if someone gives you the bird, they make a rude gesture with their middle finger at you.
A bird in the hand is something that you already have and do not want to risk losing by trying to get something else.
If you say that a little bird told you about something, you mean that someone has told you about it, but you do not want to say who it was.
Some people use the phrase old bird to refer to someone and say what they are like.

example.ex: As usual, Wheeler, a wise old bird, got it right...
example.tran: 和往常一样，惠勒——一个非常聪明的人——又做对了。

example.ex: She was such a decent old bird.
example.tran: 她是一个如此端庄的女人。

collins.tran: 少见的人；稀有之物；凤毛麟角
collins.def: If you say that someone or something is a rare bird, you mean that they are very unusual.

collins.tran: 一石二鸟；一箭双雕；一举两得
collins.def: If you say that doing something will kill two birds with one stone, you mean that it will enable you to achieve two things that you want to achieve, rather than just one.
To prevent something means to ensure that it does not happen.

example.ex: These methods prevent pregnancy...
example.tran: 这些方法能防止怀孕。

example.ex: Further treatment  will prevent cancer from developing...
example.tran: 进一步的治疗将阻止癌症恶化。

collins.def: To prevent someone from doing something means to make it impossible for them to do it.

example.ex: He said this would prevent companies from creating new jobs...
example.tran: 他说这将使公司无法创造新的工作机会。

example.ex: Its nationals may be prevented from leaving the country...
example.tran: 其国民可能会被禁止出境。

collins.def: A performance involves entertaining an audience by doing something such as singing, dancing, or acting.

example.ex: Inside the theatre, they were giving a performance of Bizet's Carmen.
example.tran: 在剧院里，他们正在演出比才的作品《卡门》。

example.ex: ...her performance as the betrayed Medea...
example.tran: 她所演绎的遭人背叛的美狄亚

collins.tran: 表现；业绩；性能；运行情况
collins.def: Someone's or something's performance is how successful they are or how well they do something.

example.ex: That study looked at the performance of 18 surgeons...
example.tran: 那项研究调查了18名外科医生的工作表现。

example.ex: The poor performance has been blamed on the recession and cheaper sports car imports...
example.tran: 业绩不佳的原因被归咎于经济衰退和低价跑车的进口。

collins.def: A car's performance is its ability to go fast and to increase its speed quickly.
A performance car is one that can go very fast and can increase its speed very quickly.
The performance of a task is the fact or action of doing it.

example.ex: He devoted in excess of seventy hours a week to the performance of his duties...
example.tran: 为了完成任务，他每周工作70多个小时。

example.ex: The people believe that the performance of this ritual is the will of the Great Spirit.
example.tran: 该部族的人认为举行这种仪式是大神的意志。

collins.def: You can describe something that is or looks complicated or difficult to do as a performance .

example.ex: The whole process is quite a performance...
example.tran: 整个过程相当复杂。

example.ex: She made a big performance of sprinkling all the spices on.
example.tran: 她费了不少劲才把所有的香料都撒在上面。

collins.def: Running is the activity of moving fast on foot, especially as a sport.

example.ex: We chose to do cross-country running.
example.tran: 我们选择了越野赛跑。

example.ex: ...running shoes.
example.tran: 跑鞋

collins.def: The running of something such as a business is the managing or organizing of it.

example.ex: ...the committee in charge of the day-to-day running of the party.
example.tran: 负责党内日常事务管理的委员会

collins.def: You use running to describe things that continue or keep occurring over a period of time.

example.ex: He also began a running feud with Dean Acheson...
example.tran: 他也开始接二连三地和艾奇逊院长发生争执。

example.ex: The song turned into a running joke between him and the press.
example.tran: 这首歌一时成了他和媒体之间的一个笑料。

collins.tran: 不断增加的;持续增长的
collins.def: A running total is a total which changes because numbers keep being added to it as something progresses.

example.ex: He kept a running tally of who had called him, who had visited, who had sent flowers...
example.tran: 他不断记录着又有谁给他打电话，拜访过他，或给他送花。

example.ex: So far, his running total in transfers fees is £2 million.
example.tran: 到目前为止，他持续增长的转会费已高达200万英镑。

collins.def: You can use running when indicating that something keeps happening. For example, if something has happened every day for three days, you can say that it has happened for the third day running or for three days running .

example.ex: He said drought had led to severe crop failure for the second year running...
example.tran: 他说干旱已经连续两年导致农作物严重歉收。

example.ex: She changes her look so often that she never seems the same woman two days running.
example.tran: 她经常改变形象，一天一个样。

collins.def: Running water is water that is flowing rather than standing still.

example.ex: The forest was filled with the sound of running water...
example.tran: 森林中处处都能听到流水声。

example.ex: Wash the lentils under cold running water.
example.tran: 用流动的凉水冲洗小扁豆。

collins.def: If a house has running water, water is supplied to the house through pipes and taps.

example.ex: ...a house without electricity or running water in a tiny African village.
example.tran: 非洲一座小村庄里既没有电，也没有自来水的房子

collins.tran: 有/没有希望获胜;有/没有机会得到
collins.def: If someone is in the running for something, they have a good chance of winning or obtaining it. If they are out of the running for something, they have no chance of winning or obtaining it.

example.ex: Her role in Death and the Maiden, which put her in the running for the Laurence Olivier Award...
example.tran: 她在电影《不道德的审判》中的演出使她很有希望获得劳伦斯·奥利弗奖

example.ex: Until this week he appeared to have ruled himself out of the running because of his age.
example.tran: 他似乎一直因为年龄问题不认为自己有获胜的可能，但情况在这周改变了。

collins.def: If someone is making the running in a situation, they are more active than the other people involved.

example.ex: Republicans are furious that the Democrats currently seem to be making all the running.
example.tran: 现在民主党人好像成了领头羊，这让共和党人非常愤怒。

collins.tran: (系统或地方等)正常运转，正常运营
collins.def: If something such as a system or place is up and running, it is operating normally.

example.ex: We're trying to get the medical facilities up and running again.
example.tran: 我们正努力让这些医疗机构恢复正常运营。

collins.def: Latest is the superlative of late.
You use latest to describe something that is the most recent thing of its kind.

example.ex: ...her latest book...
example.tran: 她的新书

example.ex: Latest reports say another five people have been killed...
example.tran: 最新报道称又有5人被害。

collins.def: You can use latest to describe something that is very new and modern and is better than older things of a similar kind.

example.ex: Crooks are using the latest laser photocopiers to produce millions of fake banknotes...
example.tran: 犯罪分子正利用最新式的激光复印机制造数以百万计的假钞。

example.ex: I got to drive the latest model...
example.tran: 我开上了最新款的车。

collins.def: You use at the latest in order to indicate that something must happen at or before a particular time and not after that time.

example.ex: She should be back by ten o'clock at the latest.
example.tran: 她最晚应该在10点前回来。

collins.tran: 各种各样的;不同种类的
collins.def: If you say that there are various things, you mean there are several different things of the type mentioned.

example.ex: His plan is to spread the capital between various building society accounts...
example.tran: 他打算把资金分散存到不同的购房互助会的账户上。

example.ex: The school has received various grants from the education department.
example.tran: 学校得到了教育部门的多项资助。

collins.def: If a number of things are described as various, they are very different from one another.

example.ex: The methods are many and various.
example.tran: 方法很多且各不相同。

example.ex: ...the country's rich and various heritage.
example.tran: 该国丰富多样的传统

collins.def: Justice is fairness in the way that people are treated.

example.ex: He has a good overall sense of justice and fairness...
example.tran: 他极富正义感和公平意识。

example.ex: He only wants freedom, justice and equality...
example.tran: 他只要自由、公正和平等。

collins.tran: （理由、要求或论点的）合理，正当，正确，公道
collins.def: The justice of a cause, claim, or argument is its quality of being reasonable, fair, or right.

example.ex: We are a minority and must win people round to the justice of our cause.
example.tran: 我们属于少数群体，必须赢得人们对我们的正义事业的支持。

collins.def: Justice is the legal system that a country uses in order to deal with people who break the law.

example.ex: Many in Toronto's black community feel that the justice system does not treat them fairly...
example.tran: 多伦多的黑人群体中有很多人觉得司法制度对待他们有失公正。

example.ex: A lawyer is part of the machinery of justice.
example.tran: 律师是司法体系的一部分。

collins.def: A justice is a judge.

example.ex: Thomas will be sworn in today as a justice on the Supreme Court.
example.tran: 托马斯今天将宣誓就任最高法院法官。

collins.def: Justice is used before the names of judges.

example.ex: A preliminary hearing was due to start today before Mr Justice Hutchison, but was adjourned.
example.tran: 今天法官哈奇森先生本来要主持一项预审，但暂时休庭了。

collins.tran: 将…绳之以法；把…缉拿归案
collins.def: If a criminal is brought to justice, he or she is punished for a crime by being arrested and tried in a court of law.

example.ex: They demanded that those responsible be brought to justice...
example.tran: 他们要求将责任人缉拿归案。

example.ex: She'd need proof to bring Jason to justice.
example.tran: 她需要有证据才能将贾森绳之以法。

collins.tran: 准确地再现；逼真地重现
collins.def: To do justice to a person or thing means to reproduce them accurately and show how good they are.

example.ex: The photograph I had seen didn't  do her justice...
example.tran: 我看到的那张照片把她拍得走样了。

example.ex: Most TV sets don't have the sound quality to do justice to the music.
example.tran: 大多数电视机的音质不好，无法播出原来的音乐效果。

collins.tran: 妥善应付；恰当处理；尽力全面做好
collins.def: If you do justice to someone or something, you deal with them properly and completely.

example.ex: No one article can ever do justice to the topic of fraud...
example.tran: 没有哪一篇文章能把欺诈这一话题讲得恰到好处。

example.ex: It is impossible here to do justice to the complex history of the Legion.
example.tran: 在这里不可能完整地论述古罗马军团复杂的历史。

collins.tran: 充分发挥能力；尽最大的努力
collins.def: If you do yourself justice, you do something as well as you are capable of doing it.

example.ex: I don't think he could do himself justice playing for England...
example.tran: 我认为他为英格兰队效力时不可能充分发挥自己的水平。

example.ex: I don't think I can win, but I want to do myself justice.
example.tran: 我认为我不会获胜，但我会尽自己最大的努力。

collins.def: If you describe someone's treatment or punishment as rough justice, you mean that it is not given according to the law.

example.ex: Trial by television makes for very rough justice indeed.
example.tran: 电视庭审实际上会令审判不公。

collins.def: If you say that something is rough justice for someone, you mean that they have not been treated fairly.

example.ex: It would have been rough justice had he been deprived of this important third European win.
example.tran: 要是他被剥夺了这一意义重大的第三个欧洲冠军头衔，那对他简直是太不公平了。

collins.def: A site is a piece of ground that is used for a particular purpose or where a particular thing happens.

example.ex: He became a hod carrier on a building site.
example.tran: 他在建筑工地上当起了小工。

example.ex: ...a bat sanctuary with special nesting sites...
example.tran: 专门辟出了筑巢处的蝙蝠禁猎区

collins.def: The site of an important event is the place where it happened.

example.ex: Scientists have described the Aral sea as the site of the worst ecological disaster on earth...
example.tran: 科学家把咸海描述成地球上最严重的生态灾难发生地。

example.ex: Plymouth Hoe is renowned as the site where Drake played bowls before tackling the Spanish Armada.
example.tran: 普利茅斯高地是德雷克在打败西班牙无敌舰队之前玩木球游戏的旧址，因此广为人知。

collins.tran: (建造房屋等的)地皮，地基，遗址
collins.def: A site is a piece of ground where something such as a statue or building stands or used to stand.

example.ex: ...the site of Moses' tomb.
example.tran: 摩西的墓址

example.ex: ...the Church of the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem, which is regarded by some as Christianity's holiest site.
example.tran: 耶路撒冷圣墓教堂——一些人眼中基督教最神圣的地方

collins.def: A site is the same as a website .
If something is sited in a particular place or position, it is put there or built there.

example.ex: He said chemical weapons had never been sited in Germany.
example.tran: 他声称从未在德国部署过化学武器。

example.ex: ...a damp, old castle, romantically sited on a river estuary.
example.tran: 坐落在河湾之上的一座阴冷潮湿的古城堡，仿佛传奇中描述的一般

collins.def: If someone or something is on site, they are in a particular area or group of buildings where people work, study, or stay.

example.ex: It is cheaper to have extra building work done when the builder is on site.
example.tran: 建筑工在现场干活时，让他额外做工的话工钱会便宜一些。

example.ex: ...the on-site supermarket.
example.tran: 附近的超市

collins.def: If someone or something is off site, they are away from a particular area or group of buildings where people work, study, or stay.

example.ex: There is ample car parking off site.
example.tran: 外面有很多地方可以停车。

example.ex: ...off-site accommodation.
example.tran: 住在校外

collins.def: You use entire when you want to emphasize that you are referring to the whole of something, for example, the whole of a place, time, or population.

example.ex: He had spent his entire life in China as a doctor...
example.tran: 他一生都在中国当医生。

example.ex: There are only 60 swimming pools in the entire country...
example.tran: 全国总共只有60个游泳池。

collins.def: Fashion is the area of activity that involves styles of clothing and appearance.

example.ex: There are 20 full-colour pages of fashion for men...
example.tran: 书中有 20 张有关男性时尚的彩色插页。

example.ex: The fashion world does not mind what the real world thinks.
example.tran: 时尚界并不在意现实世界的想法。

collins.def: A fashion is a style of clothing or a way of behaving that is popular at a particular time.

example.ex: In the early seventies I wore false eyelashes, as was the fashion...
example.tran: 70 年代初我戴假睫毛，这在当时是时尚。

example.ex: Queen Mary started the fashion for blue and white china in England...
example.tran: 玛丽女王开启了青花瓷在英格兰的流行风尚。

collins.def: If you do something in a particular fashion or after a particular fashion, you do it in that way.

example.ex: There is another drug called DHE that works in a similar fashion...
example.tran: 另外还有一种叫 DHE 的药物，药效也差不多。

example.ex: It is happening in this fashion because of the obstinacy of one woman.
example.tran: 事情会如此发展是因为一个女人的固执己见。

collins.def: If you fashion an object or a work of art, you make it.

example.ex: Stone Age settlers fashioned necklaces from sheep's teeth.
example.tran: 石器时代的移居者用羊的牙做成项链。

collins.def: If you say that something was done after a fashion, you mean that it was done, but not very well.

example.ex: She was educated — after a fashion — at home...
example.tran: 她算得上是受过教育——家庭教育。

example.ex: He knew the way, after a fashion.
example.tran: 他勉强认路。

collins.def: If something is in fashion, it is popular and approved of at a particular time. If it is out of fashion, it is not popular or approved of.

example.ex: That sort of house is back in fashion...
example.tran: 那种房子又时兴起来了。

example.ex: Marriage seems to be going out of fashion.
example.tran: 婚姻似乎快要过时了。

collins.def: A block of flats or offices is a large building containing them.

example.ex: ...blocks of council flats.
example.tran: 一栋栋市政公寓大楼

example.ex: ...a white-painted apartment block.
example.tran: 一栋漆成白色的公寓大楼

collins.def: A block in a town is an area of land with streets on all its sides.

example.ex: She walked four blocks down High Street...
example.tran: 她沿着商业大街走了4个街区。

example.ex: He walked around the block three times.
example.tran: 他绕着这个街区转了3圈。

collins.def: A block of a substance is a large rectangular piece of it.

example.ex: ...a block of ice.
example.tran: 一大块冰

collins.def: To block a road, channel, or pipe means to put an object across it or in it so that nothing can pass through it or along it.

example.ex: Some students today blocked a highway that cuts through the center of the city...
example.tran: 今天一些学生堵塞了一条贯穿市中心的公路。

example.ex: When the shrimp farm is built it will block the stream...
example.tran: 一旦养虾场建起来，将会截断这条河流。

collins.def: If something blocks your view, it prevents you from seeing something because it is between you and that thing.

example.ex: ...a row of spruce trees that blocked his view of the long north slope of the mountain.
example.tran: 一排云杉挡住了他的视线，使他看不到这座山绵长的北坡

collins.def: If you block someone's way, you prevent them from going somewhere or entering a place by standing in front of them.

example.ex: I started to move round him, but he blocked my way...
example.tran: 我准备绕过他，但他挡住了我。

example.ex: Mr Calder tried to leave the shop but the police officer blocked his path.
example.tran: 考尔德先生想离开商店，但是那位警员拦住了他。

collins.def: If you block something that is being arranged, you prevent it from being done.

example.ex: For years the country has tried to block imports of various cheap foreign products...
example.tran: 多年来，这个国家一直竭力阻挠各种廉价外国产品的进口。

example.ex: His persistent attempts to complain to his superiors were blocked and ignored.
example.tran: 他一再试图向上级投诉，但都被挡了回来并置之不理。

collins.tran: （体育运动中）拦截，阻截（进球、对手等）
collins.def: In some sports, if a player blocks a shot or kick, they stop the ball reaching its target. If one player blocks another, the first stops the second from reaching or moving with the ball.

example.ex: In the final seconds, Gunn goalie Kevin Cantwell blocked two shots.
example.tran: 在最后的几秒钟，甘恩队的守门员凯文·坎特维尔扑出了两次射门。

collins.tran: （尤指按特定顺序同时售出的）大量，大批，大套（票、股票等）
collins.def: A block of something such as tickets or shares is a large quantity of them, especially when they are all sold at the same time and are in a particular sequence or order.

example.ex: Those booking a block of seats get them at reduced rates.
example.tran: 团体订座可享受折扣价。

collins.tran: （短时间的）思维停滞，思维中断
collins.def: If you have a mental block or a block, you are temporarily unable to do something that you can normally do which involves using, thinking about, or remembering something.

collins.tran: 冒着败坏名声的风险；拿名誉（或地位）做赌注
collins.def: If someone lays their head on the block, or puts their head on the block, they are risking their reputation or position by taking a particular course of action.

example.ex: The Chancellor, by his unusual statement, has put his head on the block.
example.tran: 这位总理冒着丢乌纱帽的风险发表了一份非同寻常的声明。

collins.def: When you eat something, you put it into your mouth, chew it, and swallow it.

example.ex: She was eating a sandwich...
example.tran: 她在吃三明治。

example.ex: The bananas should be eaten within two days...
example.tran: 那些香蕉应该在两天内吃掉。

collins.def: If you eat sensibly or healthily, you eat food that is good for you.

example.ex: ...a campaign to persuade people to eat more healthily.
example.tran: 劝说人们饮食更加健康的宣传活动

collins.def: If you eat, you have a meal.

example.ex: Let's go out to eat...
example.tran: 我们出去吃吧。

example.ex: We ate lunch together a few times.
example.tran: 我们一起吃过几次午餐。

collins.def: If something is eating you, it is annoying or worrying you.

example.ex: 'What the hell's eating you?' he demanded.
example.tran: “到底什么事让你心烦啊？”他问道。

collins.tran: 完全听命于;完全受…支配
collins.def: If you have someone eating out of your hand, they are completely under your control.

example.ex: She usually has the press eating out of her hand.
example.tran: 她通常都能将新闻界抓在自己手心。

collins.def: People use eat your heart out with the name of a person when they are doing something that they think the person named might be jealous of.

example.ex: A limousine was sent to pick me up and deliver me to the set. Eat your heart out, Tom Selleck!...
example.tran: 他们派了一辆豪华轿车来接我去片场，你就眼红吧，汤姆·塞立克！

example.ex: I want everyone back in Cleveland to be eating their crummy little hearts out.
example.tran: 我想让家乡克利夫兰所有那些烂人都懊悔不已。

collins.def: If you eat someone out of house and home, you eat a lot of their food, especially when you are living with them.

example.ex: Is Karen still eating you out of house and home?
example.tran: 卡伦还在只顾吃光你的家当吗？

means: （汽车或自行车）（尤指不用动力向山坡下）滑行
（不用多少动力）快速平稳地移动

collins.def: The coast is an area of land that is next to the sea.

example.ex: Camp sites are usually situated along the coast, close to beaches.
example.tran: 野营地一般都位于海滨，靠近沙滩。

example.ex: ...the west coast of Scotland.
example.tran: 苏格兰西海岸

collins.tran: (车辆熄火后或不用动力)靠惯性滑行
collins.def: If a vehicle coasts somewhere, it continues to move there with the motor switched off, or without being pushed or pedalled.

example.ex: I switched off the engine and coasted round the corner.
example.tran: 我熄掉引擎，靠惯性转过弯去。

example.ex: They picked up momentum, then slipped into neutral and coasted quietly down the slope.
example.tran: 他们加大油门，再切入空挡，随后没大响动地滑下山坡。

collins.tran: 毫不费力地做;(尤指)轻松获胜
collins.def: If a person or a team is coasting, they are doing something easily, especially winning a competition.

example.ex: Ivan Lendl coasted to a 6-3, 6-2, 6-3 victory over Roger Rasheed...
example.tran: 伊万·伦德尔以6:3，6:2和6:3的比分轻松战胜了罗杰·拉希德。

example.ex: The company was coasting on the enormous success of its early products.
example.tran: 公司凭借早期产品的巨大成功而在市场上遥遥领先。

collins.def: If you say that someone is coasting, you are emphasizing that they are not putting enough effort into what they are doing.

example.ex: There was a time when Charles was coasting at school and I should have told him to buckle down.
example.tran: 有一段时间查尔斯在学校不太用功，我当时应该让他加把劲的。

collins.tran: 没有被发现(或捉住)的危险;危险已过
collins.def: If you say that the coast is clear, you mean that there is nobody around to see you or catch you.

example.ex: 'You can come out now,' he called. 'The coast is clear. She's gone.'
example.tran: “你现在可以出来了。”他喊道，“没危险了，她已经走了。”

collins.def: An institution is a large important organization such as a university, church, or bank.

example.ex: ...the Institution of Civil Engineers...
example.tran: 土木工程学院

example.ex: Class size varies from one type of institution to another...
example.tran: 班级大小因院校类型而异。

collins.tran: (精神病院、孤儿院等)社会收容机构
collins.def: An institution is a building where certain people are looked after, for example people who are mentally ill or children who have no parents.

example.ex: He was transferred to Shoal Creek Mental Institution for an indefinite period...
example.tran: 他被转到了肖尔溪精神病院，要在那里无限期地呆下去。

example.ex: Larry has been in an institution since he was four...
example.tran: 拉里从4岁起就一直生活在孤儿院。

collins.def: An institution is a custom or system that is considered an important or typical feature of a particular society or group, usually because it has existed for a long time.

example.ex: I believe in the institution of marriage.
example.tran: 我相信婚姻制度。

example.ex: ...the institution of the family.
example.tran: 家庭制度

collins.def: The institution of a new system is the act of starting it or bringing it in.

example.ex: There was never an official institution of censorship in Albania.
example.tran: 在阿尔巴尼亚从未设立过官方审查制度。

example.ex: ...the institution of the forty-hour week.
example.tran: 每周 40 小时工作制的建立

means: 人生或历史上的重要时期

collins.def: A chapter is one of the parts that a book is divided into. Each chapter has a number, and sometimes a title.

example.ex: Chromium supplements were used successfully in the treatment of diabetes (see Chapter 4)...
example.tran: 铬补充剂被成功运用于治疗糖尿病(见第4章)。

example.ex: I took the title of this chapter from one of my favorite books.
example.tran: 我这章的标题来自我最喜欢的一本书。

collins.tran: (人生或历史上的)阶段，时期，篇章
collins.def: A chapter in someone's life or in history is a period of time during which a major event or series of related events takes place.

example.ex: This had been a particularly difficult chapter in Lebanon's recent history.
example.tran: 这在黎巴嫩的近代史上是个特别困难的时期。

example.ex: ...one of the most dramatic chapters of recent British politics.
example.tran: 英国政治近来最富戏剧性的阶段之一

collins.tran: 大教堂全体教士(或全体相关神职人员)
collins.def: A chapter is a group of Christian clergy who work in or who are connected with a cathedral.

example.ex: The Archbishop began his address, thanking the Dean and Chapter of Westminster for inviting him to the Abbey.
example.tran: 大主教在开始演讲之前，首先感谢威斯敏斯特大教堂的主教和全体教士邀请他来到这里。

collins.def: A chapter is a branch of a society or club.

example.ex: To find out more about cancer warning signs call your local chapter of the American Cancer Society.
example.tran: 想要了解更多有关癌症的征兆，请给美国癌症协会本地分会打电话。

collins.def: If you say that someone gives you chapter and verse on a particular subject, you are emphasizing that they tell you every detail about it.

example.ex: In the course of the evening he gave me chapter and verse on the mosses of the Islay peat bogs.
example.tran: 整个晚上，他向我详细讲述艾莱岛泥炭沼泽地上的各种青苔。

collins.tran: 构成威胁的人(或事物);祸根
collins.def: A threat to a person or thing is a danger that something unpleasant might happen to them. A threat is also the cause of this danger.

example.ex: Some couples see single women as a threat to their relationships...
example.tran: 有些夫妇把单身女人看成是对他们婚姻的威胁。

example.ex: The Hurricane Center warns people not to take the threat of tropical storms lightly...
example.tran: 飓风中心警告人们，不要对热带风暴的危险掉以轻心。

collins.def: A threat is a statement by someone that they will do something unpleasant, especially if you do not do what they want.

example.ex: He may be forced to carry out his threat to resign...
example.tran: 他也许会被迫把自己的辞职威胁付诸行动。

example.ex: The priest remains in hiding after threats by former officials of the ousted dictatorship...
example.tran: 受到被驱逐下台的独裁政府官员的威胁后，那个牧师一直藏匿不出。

collins.def: If a person or thing is under threat, there is a danger that something unpleasant might be done to them, or that they might cease to exist.

example.ex: His position as leader will be under threat at a party congress due next month...
example.tran: 在定于下月举行的党代表大会上，他的领导地位将受到威胁。

example.ex: She lives daily under threat of violence...
example.tran: 她每天都生活在暴力威胁之下。

collins.def: A boat is something in which people can travel across water.

example.ex: One of the best ways to see the area is in a small boat...
example.tran: 游览该地区的一个最好方式是乘坐小船。

example.ex: The island may be reached by boat from the mainland.
example.tran: 这个岛屿可以从大陆乘小船到达。

collins.def: You can refer to a passenger ship as a boat .

example.ex: When the boat reached Cape Town, we said a temporary goodbye.
example.tran: 客轮到达开普敦时，我们暂时分别。

collins.def: If you say that someone has missed the boat, you mean that they have missed an opportunity and may not get another.

collins.tran: （尤指为了庆祝）挥金如土，大事铺张
collins.def: If you push the boat out, you spend a lot of money on something, especially in order to celebrate.

example.ex: I earn enough to push the boat out now and again.
example.tran: 我挣的钱足以时不时摆摆阔了。

collins.def: If you say that someone is rocking the boat, you mean that they are upsetting a calm situation and causing trouble.

example.ex: I said I didn't want to rock the boat in any way.
example.tran: 我说过我根本不想挑事。

collins.tran: 处于相同的倒霉境地；同病相怜
collins.def: If two or more people are in the same boat, they are in the same unpleasant situation.
If something hangs in a high place or position, or if you hang it there, it is attached there so it does not touch the ground.

example.ex: Notices painted on sheets hang at every entrance...
example.tran: 写在纸上的告示悬挂在每个入口。

example.ex: A light-bulb hanging from the ceiling filled the room with a cold yellow light...
example.tran: 屋子里天花板上吊着的一个灯泡散发着冷冷的黄光。

collins.def: If a piece of clothing or fabric hangs in a particular way or position, that is how it is worn or arranged.

example.ex: ...a ragged fur coat that hung down to her calves...
example.tran: 她穿的一件长及小腿肚的破旧毛皮大衣

example.ex: Look for a suit made from good, sturdy cloth to ensure it hangs well...
example.tran: 找一套用结实的好布料做的套装，这样的衣服垂感好。

collins.def: If something hangs loose or hangs open, it is partly fixed in position, but is not firmly held, supported, or controlled, often in such a way that it moves freely.

example.ex: ...her long golden hair which hung loose about her shoulders...
example.tran: 她那松散着披在肩上的长长的金发

example.ex: The window sashes were missing, the doors hung open, or were gone altogether...
example.tran: 窗框都不见了，门都敞开着，或者干脆说压根就没有门了。

collins.def: If something such as a wall is hung with pictures or other objects, they are attached to it.

example.ex: The walls were hung with huge modern paintings.
example.tran: 墙上挂着巨幅的现代画。

example.ex: ...a line of wall hooks hung with old anoraks and mud-stained overalls.
example.tran: 挂着旧的短风衣和沾有泥污的工装裤的一排墙钩

collins.def: If someone is hanged or if they hang, they are killed, usually as a punishment, by having a rope tied around their neck and the support taken away from under their feet.

example.ex: The five were expected to be hanged at 7 am on Tuesday...
example.tran: 那5个人将在周二早上7点被施以绞刑。

example.ex: It is right that their murderers should hang...
example.tran: 谋杀他们的凶手就应该被绞死。

collins.def: If something such as someone's breath or smoke hangs in the air, it remains there without appearing to move or change position.

example.ex: His breath was hanging in the air before him...
example.tran: 他的哈气悬浮在自己面前。

example.ex: A haze of expensive perfume hangs around her.
example.tran: 高档香水的气雾弥漫在她周围。

collins.def: If a possibility hangs over you, it worries you and makes your life unpleasant or difficult because you think it might happen.

example.ex: A constant threat of unemployment hangs over thousands of university researchers...
example.tran: 持续存在的失业威胁困扰着数千名大学科研人员。

example.ex: A question mark hangs over many of their futures.
example.tran: 他们的不少期货都还是个问号。

collins.tran: 对…毫不操心;对…满不在乎
collins.def: Hang is used in expressions such as hang it and hang the money to indicate that you are not concerned about something or the consequences of doing something.

example.ex: Once the Americans decide to do a thing, they do it well, and hang the cost.
example.tran: 一旦美国人决定要做一件事，他们就会把它做好，且丝毫不计代价。

collins.tran: 掌握…的窍门;熟悉…的门道
collins.def: If you get the hang of something such as a skill or activity, you begin to understand or realize how to do it.

example.ex: It's a bit tricky at first till you get the hang of it.
example.tran: 刚开始有点儿难，掌握窍门后就好了。

collins.def: If you tell someone to hang in there or to hang on in there, you are encouraging them to keep trying to do something and not to give up even though it might be difficult.

example.ex: Hang in there and you never know what you might achieve.
example.tran: 坚持下去，你永远都无法预料会有什么样的收获。

collins.def: If you let it all hang out, you relax completely and enjoy yourself without worrying about hiding your emotions or behaving politely.
A patient is a person who is receiving medical treatment from a doctor or hospital. A patient is also someone who is registered with a particular doctor.

example.ex: The earlier the treatment is given, the better the patient's chances...
example.tran: 病人越早接受治疗，康复的可能性就越大。

example.ex: She was tough but wonderful with her patients...
example.tran: 她很严厉，但对患者却很好。

collins.def: If you are patient, you stay calm and do not get annoyed, for example when something takes a long time, or when someone is not doing what you want them to do.

example.ex: Please be patient — your cheque will arrive...
example.tran: 请耐心点——你的支票会来的。

example.ex: He was endlessly kind and patient with children.
example.tran: 他对孩子们总是非常好，很有耐心。

collins.def: If you approve of an action, event, or suggestion, you like it or are pleased about it.

example.ex: Not everyone approves of the festival...
example.tran: 不是所有人都赞成庆祝该节日。

example.ex: I approved of the proposal.
example.tran: 我赞成该提案。

collins.def: If you approve of someone or something, you like and admire them.

example.ex: You've never approved of Henry, have you?...
example.tran: 你从来没有喜欢过亨利，对吗？

example.ex: I didn't approve of his manner.
example.tran: 我不喜欢他的态度。

collins.def: If someone in a position of authority approves a plan or idea, they formally agree to it and say that it can happen.

example.ex: The Russian Parliament has approved a program of radical economic reforms...
example.tran: 俄罗斯议会已经通过一项重大经济改革方案。

example.ex: MPs approved the Bill by a majority of 97.
example.tran: 议员们以97票的多数票通过了该议案。

collins.def: If a product or person is approved by an official organization, they are declared to be of a good enough standard to be used or employed.

example.ex: We have three suppliers in all who are approved by the Organic Farm Food Association.
example.tran: 我们总共有3家获有机农产品协会认可的供货商。

collins.def: If you make a mistake, you do something which you did not intend to do, or which produces a result that you do not want.

example.ex: They made the big mistake of thinking they could seize its border with a relatively small force...
example.tran: 他们大错特错，居然认为以较少的兵力就能够夺取其边境地区。

example.ex: I think it's a serious mistake to confuse books with life...
example.tran: 我认为把书本同生活混为一谈是大错特错。

collins.def: A mistake is something or part of something which is incorrect or not right.

example.ex: Her mother sighed and rubbed out another mistake in the crossword puzzle.
example.tran: 她的母亲叹了口气，擦去了纵横填字游戏里另一个填错的地方。

example.ex: ...spelling mistakes.
example.tran: 拼写错误

collins.tran: 搞错;把…误认为；把…错当成
collins.def: If you mistake one person or thing for another, you wrongly think that they are the other person or thing.

example.ex: I mistook you for Carlos...
example.tran: 我把你错当成卡洛斯了。

example.ex: When hay fever first occurs it is often mistaken for a summer cold.
example.tran: 花粉病初期常被误认为是风热感冒。

collins.def: If you mistake something, you fail to recognize or understand it.

example.ex: The government completely mistook the feeling of the country...
example.tran: 政府完全没有把握住该国民意。

example.ex: No one should mistake how serious the issue is.
example.tran: 任何人都不该低估该问题的严重性。

collins.def: You can say there is no mistaking something when you are emphasizing that you cannot fail to recognize or understand it.

example.ex: There's no mistaking the eastern flavour of the food...
example.tran: 那种食物就是东方风味，绝对错不了。

example.ex: There was no mistaking Magda's sincerity, or her pain.
example.tran: 玛格达的真诚和痛苦都绝不可能是假装的。

collins.def: Something that is necessary is needed in order for something else to happen.

example.ex: I kept the engine running because it might be necessary to leave fast...
example.tran: 我没让发动机熄火，因为也许需要迅速离开。

example.ex: We will do whatever is necessary to stop them...
example.tran: 我们要采取一切必要措施去阻止他们。

collins.def: A necessary consequence or connection must happen or exist, because of the nature of the things or events involved.

example.ex: Wastage was no doubt a necessary consequence of war...
example.tran: 巨大的损耗无疑是战争的必然结果。

example.ex: Scientific work is differentiated from art by its necessary connection with the idea of progress.
example.tran: 科学工作与艺术的区别在于它与人类进步有着必然联系。

collins.def: Necessaries are things, such as food or clothing, that you need to have in order to live.

example.ex: ...a small parcel of necessaries tied up in a handkerchief and carried on a stick.
example.tran: 用手绢包好挑在棍子上的一小包生活必需品

collins.def: If you say that something will happen if necessary ,when necessary, or where necessary, you mean that it will happen if it is necessary, when it is necessary, or where it is necessary.

example.ex: If necessary, the airship can stay up there for days to keep out of danger...
example.tran: 必要时，飞艇能在那里停留数天以躲避危险。

example.ex: The army needs men who are willing to fight, when necessary...
example.tran: 军队需要在必要时愿意投入战斗的军人。

collins.tran: （尤指某专门学科的）杂志，刊物
collins.def: A journal is a magazine, especially one that deals with a specialized subject.

example.ex: All our results are published in scientific journals.
example.tran: 我们的研究结果全都发表在科学刊物上了。

collins.tran: 日报，周报，…报（常用于报纸名称中）
collins.def: A journal is a daily or weekly newspaper. The word journal is often used in the name of the paper.

example.ex: He was a newspaperman for The New York Times and some other journals.
example.tran: 他是个记者，为《纽约时报》和其他一些报刊撰稿。

example.ex: ...The Wall Street Journal.
example.tran: 《华尔街日报》

collins.def: A journal is an account which you write of your daily activities.

example.ex: Sara confided to her journal...
example.tran: 萨拉在日记中倾诉心事。

example.ex: On the plane he wrote in his journal.
example.tran: 他在飞机上写日记。

collins.def: A theatre is a building with a stage in it, on which plays, shows, and other performances take place.

example.ex: If we went to the theatre it was a very big event...
example.tran: 我们要是去看场戏，那可是件大事。

example.ex: I worked at the Grand Theatre.
example.tran: 我在大剧院上班。

collins.tran: 戏剧工作;舞台表演;戏剧创作
collins.def: You can refer to work in the theatre such as acting or writing plays as the theatre .

example.ex: You can move up to work in films and the theatre...
example.tran: 你可以转行从事影视戏剧业。

example.ex: Very soon he took the first steps towards a career in the theatre.
example.tran: 不久他便开始涉足戏剧。

collins.def: Theatre is entertainment that involves the performance of plays.

example.ex: Companies across the country are beginning to show a healthy interest in theatre for children.
example.tran: 全国有多家公司都开始对儿童戏剧表现出极大的兴趣。

collins.def: A theater or a movie theater is a place where people go to watch films for entertainment.
In a hospital, a theatre is a special room where surgeons carry out medical operations.

example.ex: She is back from theatre and her condition is comfortable.
example.tran: 她从手术室出来了，身体状况良好。

collins.def: A theatre of war or other conflict is the area or region in which the war or conflict is happening.

example.ex: The Middle East has often been a theatre of war.
example.tran: 中东这一地区一直战乱频仍。

means: （人、动植物、化学药品等的）表现方式

collins.def: People's or animals' behaviour is the way that they behave. You can refer to a typical and repeated way of behaving as a behaviour .

example.ex: Make sure that good behaviour is rewarded.
example.tran: 确保懿行得到嘉奖。

example.ex: ...human sexual behaviour...
example.tran: 人类性行为

collins.tran: （科学领域中的）运动方式，活动方式，性能，特点
collins.def: In science, the behaviour of something is the way that it behaves.

example.ex: It will be many years before anyone can predict a hurricane's behavior with much accuracy.
example.tran: 要能够相当准确地预测出飓风的特性尚需多年。

collins.tran: 极力表现；尽量做到举止得体
collins.def: If someone is on their best behaviour, they are trying very hard to behave well.

means: [精神病学]（表露或觉察到的）情绪反应

collins.def: If something affects a person or thing, it influences them or causes them to change in some way.

example.ex: Nicotine adversely affects the functioning of the heart and arteries...
example.tran: 尼古丁会对心脏及动脉功能造成损害。

example.ex: More than seven million people have been affected by drought.
example.tran: 已有超过700万的民众受到旱灾的影响。

collins.def: If a disease affects someone, it causes them to become ill.

example.ex: Arthritis is a crippling disease which affects people all over the world.
example.tran: 关节炎是一种会危害全人类健康的致残性疾病。

collins.tran: （感情上）打动，震动，使悲伤（或怜悯）
collins.def: If something or someone affects you, they make you feel a strong emotion, especially sadness or pity.

example.ex: The divorce affected Jim deeply...
example.tran: 离婚对吉姆打击很大。

example.ex: Gregor loved his sister, and her loss clearly still affects him.
example.tran: 格雷戈尔爱他的姐姐，她的去世显然仍令他悲伤不已。

collins.def: If you affect a particular characteristic or way of behaving, you pretend that it is genuine, or natural for you.

example.ex: He listened to them, affecting an amused interest...
example.tran: 他装作饶有兴致地听他们说话。

example.ex: Ms. Redgrave affects a heavy Italian accent.
example.tran: 雷德格雷夫女士假装带有浓重的意大利口音。

collins.def: If you promise that you will do something, you say to someone that you will definitely do it.

example.ex: The post office has promised to resume first class mail delivery to the area on Friday...
example.tran: 邮局承诺于星期五恢复对这个地区第一类邮件的递送。

example.ex: He had promised that the rich and privileged would no longer get preferential treatment...
example.tran: 他已经保证富人和特权阶层不会再得到优惠待遇。

collins.tran: 答应给予；承诺给予；保证让…得到
collins.def: If you promise someone something, you tell them that you will definitely give it to them or make sure that they have it.

example.ex: In 1920 the great powers promised them an independent state...
example.tran: 1920年，列强承诺让他们成为一个独立的国家。

example.ex: The officers promise a return to multiparty rule.
example.tran: 这些官员承诺恢复多党统治。

collins.def: A promise is a statement which you make to a person in which you say that you will definitely do something or give them something.

example.ex: If you make a promise, you should keep it...
example.tran: 如果做出了承诺，就应该遵守。

example.ex: The program has lived up to its promise to promote family welfare.
example.tran: 这个项目恪守了其改善家庭福利的承诺。

collins.def: If a situation or event promises to have a particular quality or to be a particular thing, it shows signs that it will have that quality or be that thing.

example.ex: While it will be fun, the seminar also promises to be most instructive.
example.tran: 这次的研讨会不仅会有趣，而且有可能会颇具启发意义。

collins.tran: （非常好的或成功的）希望，迹象，指望
collins.def: If someone or something shows promise, they seem likely to be very good or successful.

example.ex: The boy first showed promise as an athlete in grade school.
example.tran: 这个男孩在上小学的时候就初次显示出成为运动员的潜力。

collins.def: An editor is the person who is in charge of a newspaper or magazine and who decides what will be published in each edition of it.

collins.tran: （报纸或杂志专栏的）编辑，主笔
collins.def: An editor is a journalist who is responsible for a particular section of a newspaper or magazine.

example.ex: Cookery Editor Moyra Fraser takes you behind the scenes.
example.tran: 烹调专栏主笔莫伊拉·弗雷泽会带您了解幕后的故事。

example.ex: ...by Alan Travis, Home Affairs Editor.
example.tran: 由家庭事务专栏编辑艾伦·特拉维斯执笔

collins.def: An editor is a person who checks and corrects texts before they are published.

example.ex: Your role as editor is important, for you can look at a piece of writing objectively.
example.tran: 你的编辑角色很重要，因为你能够客观地审视作品。

collins.tran: （报道某类广播、电视新闻的）记者，编辑
collins.def: An editor is a radio or television journalist who reports on a particular type of news.

example.ex: ...our economics editor, Dominic Harrod.
example.tran: 我台经济新闻记者多米尼克·哈罗德

collins.tran: （电影、广播或电视节目的）剪辑员，剪辑师
collins.def: An editor is a person who prepares a film, or a radio or television programme, by selecting some of what has been filmed or recorded and putting it in a particular order.

example.ex: She worked at 20th Century Fox as a film editor.
example.tran: 她在20世纪福克斯公司担任电影剪辑师。

collins.def: An editor is a person who collects pieces of writing by different authors and prepares them for publication in a book or a series of books.

example.ex: Michael Rosen is the editor of the anthology.
example.tran: 迈克尔·罗森是这本选集的编者。

collins.def: An editor is a computer program that enables you to change and correct stored data.
Your memory is your ability to remember things.

example.ex: All the details of the meeting are fresh in my memory...
example.tran: 我对会议的所有细节都记忆犹新。

example.ex: He'd a good memory for faces, and he was sure he hadn't seen her before...
example.tran: 他对别人的长相过目不忘，他确信自己以前没有见过她。

collins.tran: 记忆;记忆中的事物;回忆
collins.def: A memory is something that you remember from the past.

example.ex: She cannot bear to watch the film because of the bad memories it brings back...
example.tran: 她看不了那部电影，因为它会勾起一些痛苦的回忆。

example.ex: Her earliest memory is of singing at the age of four to wounded soldiers...
example.tran: 她最早的记忆是在4岁时为受伤的战士唱歌。

collins.def: A computer's memory is the part of the computer where information is stored, especially for a short time before it is transferred to disks or magnetic tapes.

example.ex: The data are stored in the computer's memory.
example.tran: 资料存在计算机内存里。

collins.def: If you talk about the memory of someone who has died, especially someone who was loved or respected, you are referring to the thoughts, actions, and ceremonies by which they are  remembered.

example.ex: She remained devoted to his memory...
example.tran: 她对他仍十分怀念。

example.ex: The congress opened with a minute's silence in memory of those who died in the struggle.
example.tran: 代表大会开幕时进行了一分钟的默哀，以怀念在斗争中牺牲的人。

collins.def: If you do something from memory, for example speak the words of a poem or play a piece of music, you do it without looking at it, because you know it very well.

example.ex: Many members of the church sang from memory...
example.tran: 许多教徒都是凭记忆唱颂歌。

example.ex: Children write down the word, cover it up and then try to spell it from memory.
example.tran: 孩子们把这个词写下来蒙住，然后试着凭记忆拼出来。

collins.tran: 在人们的记忆中（最…的事情）
collins.def: If you say that something is, for example, the best, worst, or first thing of its kind in living memory, you are emphasizing that it is the only thing of that kind that people can remember.

example.ex: The floods are the worst in living memory...
example.tran: 那次洪水是人们记忆中最严重的一次。

example.ex: No-one in living memory has come back from that place alive.
example.tran: 在人们的记忆中，没有人从那个地方生还。

collins.def: If you lose your memory, you forget things that you used to know.

example.ex: His illness caused him to lose his memory.
example.tran: 疾病使他失忆了。

collins.def: If you estimate a quantity or value, you make an approximate judgment or calculation of it.

example.ex: Try to estimate how many steps it will take to get to a close object...
example.tran: 尽力估算一下达到一个近距离目标需要多少步。

example.ex: I estimate that the total cost for treatment will be $12,500...
example.tran: 我估计治疗费用总共会有12,500美元。

collins.def: An estimate is an approximate calculation of a quantity or value.

example.ex: ...the official estimate of the election result...
example.tran: 竞选结果的官方预测

example.ex: This figure is five times the original estimate...
example.tran: 这个数据是最初估算的5倍。

collins.def: An estimate is a judgment about a person or situation which you make based on the available evidence.

example.ex: I hadn't been far wrong in my estimate of his grandson's capabilities.
example.tran: 我对他孙子的能力的判断还不算太离谱。

collins.def: An estimate from someone who you employ to do a job for you, such as a builder or a plumber, is a written statement of how much the job is likely to cost.

example.ex: The shop also offers a curtain-making and fitting service. Quotes and estimates can be prepared by computer on the spot.
example.tran: 那家商店还提供窗帘制作和安装服务，而且可以用计算机现场制作报价单和预算书。

collins.def: A standard is a level of quality or achievement, especially a level that is thought to be acceptable.

example.ex: The standard of professional cricket has never been lower...
example.tran: 职业板球的水平从来没有这么低过。

example.ex: There will be new national standards for hospital cleanliness.
example.tran: 有关医院清洁的新国家标准将会出台。

collins.def: A standard is something that you use in order to judge the quality of something else.

example.ex: ...systems that were by later standards absurdly primitive.
example.tran: 以后来的标准来衡量显得非常原始的系统

collins.def: Standards are moral principles which affect people's attitudes and behaviour.

example.ex: My father has always had high moral standards.
example.tran: 我父亲一直具有很高的道德准则。

collins.def: You use standard to describe things which are usual and normal.

example.ex: It was standard practice for untrained clerks to advise in serious cases such as murder...
example.tran: 让未经过训练的书记员在诸如谋杀等重大案件中提供建议是普遍的做法。

example.ex: No other executive car can offer you the same level of standard equipment at this price.
example.tran: 再无其他高级轿车能按这个价格水平为你提供同样水准的标准配置。

collins.tran: (作品等)受广泛阅读的，最受推崇的，最具权威性的
collins.def: A standard work or text on a particular subject is one that is widely read and often recommended.

means: 调查（表），调查所，测量，测量部，测量图

collins.tran: 调查;民意调查;民意测验
collins.def: If you carry out a survey, you try to find out detailed information about a lot of different people or things, usually by asking people a series of questions.

example.ex: The council conducted a survey of the uses to which farm buildings are put...
example.tran: 市政会就农场建筑的使用情况进行了调查。

example.ex: According to the survey, overall world trade has also slackened.
example.tran: 根据这项调查，世界贸易整体上也有所放慢。

collins.tran: 调查;对…作民意调查;对…进行民意测验
collins.def: If you survey a number of people, companies, or organizations, you try to find out information about their opinions or behaviour, usually by asking them a series of questions.

example.ex: Business Development Advisers surveyed 211 companies for the report...
example.tran: 企业发展顾问公司为此报告调查了 211 家公司。

example.ex: Only 18 percent of those surveyed opposed the idea.
example.tran: 被调查者中只有 18%的人反对该主张。

collins.tran: 总体研究;审视;全面观察
collins.def: If you survey something, you look at or consider the whole of it carefully.

example.ex: He pushed himself to his feet and surveyed the room...
example.tran: 他站起来仔细打量整间屋子。

example.ex: He surveys American politics with a conservative world view.
example.tran: 他用一种保守的世界观审视美国政治。

collins.def: If you give something a brief survey or a quick survey, you look at or consider all of it quickly, but not in detail.

example.ex: ...a brief survey of some important books on astrology...
example.tran: 有关占星术的几本重要著作的简要概述

example.ex: He sniffed the perfume she wore, then gave her a quick survey.
example.tran: 他闻了闻她身上的香水味，然后又飞快地打量了她一眼。

collins.def: If someone carries out a survey of an area of land, they examine it and measure it, usually in order to make a map of it.

example.ex: ...the organizer of the geological survey of India...
example.tran: 印度地质勘察活动的组织者

example.ex: The scientists conducted two aerial surveys followed by two ground surveys.
example.tran: 科学家们在两次地面勘测后又进行了两次空中勘测。

collins.def: If someone surveys an area of land, they examine it and measure it, usually in order to make a map of it.

example.ex: Scarborough Council commissioned geological experts earlier this year to survey the cliffs.
example.tran: 斯卡伯勒市政会在今年早些时候委托地质专家对这些悬崖进行勘测。

collins.tran: (通常指为欲购房者作的)房屋鉴定
collins.def: A survey is a careful examination of the condition and structure of a house, usually carried out in order to give information to a person who wants to buy it.

example.ex: ...a structural survey undertaken by a qualified surveyor.
example.tran: 由一位有资质的房屋鉴定员所作的结构评估

collins.tran: 对(建筑物)进行评估;鉴定;检查
collins.def: If someone surveys a house, they examine it carefully and report on its structure, usually in order to give advice to a person who is thinking of buying it.

example.ex: ...the people who surveyed the house for the mortgage.
example.tran: 抵押贷款房屋的评估人员

collins.def: If you adopt a new attitude, plan, or way of behaving, you begin to have it.

example.ex: Parliament adopted a resolution calling for the complete withdrawal of troops...
example.tran: 议会采纳了要求全部撤军的决议。

example.ex: Pupils should be helped to adopt a positive approach to the environment.
example.tran: 应帮助学生对环境采取积极的态度。

collins.def: If you adopt someone else's child, you take it into your own family and make it legally your son or daughter.

example.ex: There are hundreds of people desperate to adopt a child...
example.tran: 有数以百计的人渴望领养孩子。

example.ex: The adopted child has the right to see his birth certificate.
example.tran: 被收养的孩子有权看自己的出生证明。

collins.def: If you adopt a physical position, you move yourself into it.

example.ex: I tried to adopt a curled-up position to avoid damaging my limbs.
example.tran: 我努力保持蜷曲的姿势以免四肢受伤。

collins.tran: 移居（某国）;选择（某国）定居
collins.def: If you adopt a country, you choose it as a place to live.

example.ex: Podulski had joined the U.S. Navy as an aviator, adopting a new country and a new profession.
example.tran: 波度尔斯基加入美国海军当上了飞行员，不仅改了国籍还换了行当。

example.ex: ...their adopted home in England.
example.tran: 他们移居英国的家

collins.def: If you adopt an accent or a particular tone of voice, you speak differently from normal, especially to create an effect in a particular situation.

example.ex: He has adopted the accent of a Second World War newscaster...
example.tran: 他承袭了二战时期播音员的口音。

example.ex: The girl was uncertain what to do, or what tone of voice to adopt.
example.tran: 女孩不知道该做什么，也不知道该用什么口气说。

collins.def: A desk is a table, often with drawers, which you sit at to write or work.

collins.tran: (宾馆、医院、机场等的)服务台，问询台
collins.def: The place in a hotel, hospital, airport, or other building where you check in or obtain information is referred to as a particular desk .

example.ex: I spoke to the girl on the reception desk...
example.tran: 我跟服务台的女孩说了一下。

example.ex: A map and a bird-watchers' field checklist are available at the front desk.
example.tran: 前台有地图和观鸟地点一览表可供拿取。

collins.tran: (广播公司、报社、杂志社等的)部，室，组
collins.def: A particular department of a broadcasting company, or of a newspaper or magazine company, can be referred to as a particular desk .

example.ex: Let our news desk know as quickly as possible on 414 3926...
example.tran: 请尽快拨打电话 4143926 通知我们的新闻部。

example.ex: Over now to Simon Ingram at the sports desk.
example.tran: 现在交给体育组的西蒙·英格拉姆。

collins.def: Management is the control and organizing of a business or other organization.

example.ex: The zoo needed better management rather than more money...
example.tran: 这座动物园需要更好的管理，而不是更多的资金。

example.ex: The dispute is about wages, working conditions and the management of the mining industry.
example.tran: 这场争论围绕着工资、工作条件以及矿业管理展开。

collins.def: You can refer to the people who control and organize a business or other organization as the management .

example.ex: The management is doing its best to improve the situation...
example.tran: 管理部门正在竭尽全力改善局面。

example.ex: We need to get more women into top management...
example.tran: 我们需要让更多的女性进入高层管理。

collins.def: Management is the way people control different parts of their lives.

example.ex: ...her management of her professional life.
example.tran: 她对自己职业生涯的规划

example.ex: ...intelligent money management, for example paying big bills monthly where possible.
example.tran: 聪明的理财手法，例如尽量按月支付大宗的账单

collins.tran: （尤指女孩）漂亮的，好看的，标致的
collins.def: If you describe someone, especially a girl, as pretty, you mean that they look nice and are attractive in a delicate way.

example.ex: She's a very charming and very pretty girl.
example.tran: 她是一个非常迷人的漂亮女孩。

collins.tran: （地方或事物）漂亮的，美丽的（但无特殊之处）
collins.def: A place or a thing that is pretty is attractive and pleasant, in a charming but not particularly unusual way.

example.ex: Whitstable is still a very pretty little town.
example.tran: 惠特斯特布尔仍然是一个非常漂亮的小镇。

example.ex: ...comfortable sofas covered in a pretty floral print.
example.tran: 罩着漂亮的印花布的舒适沙发

collins.def: You can use pretty before an adjective or adverb to mean 'quite' or 'rather'.

example.ex: I had a pretty good idea what she was going to do...
example.tran: 我很清楚她会怎么做。

example.ex: Pretty soon after my arrival I found lodgings.
example.tran: 我到达之后，很快就找到了住处。

collins.def: Pretty much or pretty well means 'almost'.

example.ex: His new government looks pretty much like the old one...
example.tran: 他的新政府看起来和旧政府没什么两样。

example.ex: I travel pretty well every week.
example.tran: 我几乎每周都出去旅行。

collins.tran: 处于有利的位置；处境优越
collins.def: If you say that someone is sitting pretty, you mean that they are in a good, safe, or comfortable position.

example.ex: When the war started, they thought they were sitting pretty, because they had all that extra grain.
example.tran: 战争开始的时候，他们认为自己境况不错，因为他们粮食准备充足。

collins.def: Your opinion about something is what you think or believe about it.

example.ex: I wasn't asking for your opinion, Dick...
example.tran: 我并不是在征求你的意见，迪克。

example.ex: He held the opinion that a government should think before introducing a tax...
example.tran: 他认为政府在开征新税前应仔细斟酌。

collins.def: Your opinion of someone is your judgment of their character or ability.

example.ex: That improved Mrs Goole's already favourable opinion of him.
example.tran: 那件事更加深了古尔太太对他的好印象。

collins.def: You can refer to the beliefs or views that people have as opinion .

example.ex: Some, I suppose, might even be in positions to influence opinion...
example.tran: 有的人，我认为，甚至有可能影响舆论。

example.ex: There is a broad consensus of opinion about the policies which should be pursued.
example.tran: 对应当实行何种政策，舆论达成了广泛一致的意见。

collins.def: An opinion from an expert is the advice or judgment that they give you in the subject that they know a lot about.

example.ex: Even if you have had a regular physical check-up recently, you should still seek a medical opinion.
example.tran: 即使近期做过一次常规体检，也应当征求医生的意见。

collins.def: You add expressions such as 'in my opinion' or 'in their opinion' to a statement in order to indicate that it is what you or someone else thinks, and is not necessarily a fact.

example.ex: The book is, in Henry's opinion, the best book on the subject...
example.tran: 依照亨利的看法，这本书是关于该主题的最佳著述。

example.ex: Well he's not making a very good job of it in my opinion.
example.tran: 然而，在我看来，这件事他做得不尽如人意。

collins.def: If someone is of the opinion that something is the case, that is what they believe.

example.ex: Frank is of the opinion that the 1934 yacht should have won.
example.tran: 弗兰克认为本该是那艘1934年的帆船获胜。

means: test vehicle 实验用飞行器

collins.def: TV means the same as television .

example.ex: The TV was on...
example.tran: 电视开着。

example.ex: I prefer going to the cinema to watching TV.
example.tran: 我更喜欢看电影而不是看电视。

collins.def: A project is a task that requires a lot of time and effort.

example.ex: Money will also go into local development projects in Vietnam...
example.tran: 钱也会用于越南的地方发展项目当中。

example.ex: ...an international science project...
example.tran: 国际科学项目

collins.def: A project is a detailed study of a subject by a pupil or student.

example.ex: Students complete projects for a personal tutor, working at home at their own pace.
example.tran: 学生完成了做私人家教的课题，在家里按自己的步调工作。

collins.def: If something is projected, it is planned or expected.

example.ex: Africa's mid-1993 population is projected to more than double by 2025...
example.tran: 预计到2025年，非洲的人口会是1993年年中人口的两倍多。

example.ex: The government had been projecting a 5% consumer price increase for the entire year.
example.tran: 政府预测全年消费价格将增长5%。

collins.def: If you project someone or something in a particular way, you try to make people see them in that way. If you project a particular feeling or quality, you show it in your behaviour.

example.ex: Bradley projects a natural warmth and sincerity...
example.tran: 布拉德利表现出一种自然的热情和真诚。

example.ex: He just hasn't been able to project himself as the strong leader...
example.tran: 他根本没能表现出一个强有力的领导者的样子。

collins.tran: 把（情感、想法）投射转移（到他人身上）
collins.def: If you project feelings or ideas on to other people, you imagine that they have the same ideas or feelings as you.

example.ex: He projects his own thoughts and ideas onto her.
example.tran: 他以为她有着和自己相同的想法和观点。

collins.def: If you project a film or picture onto a screen or wall, you make it appear there.

example.ex: The team tried projecting the maps with two different projectors onto the same screen.
example.tran: 这个小组想用两台不同的投影仪把这些地图投射到同一个屏幕上。

collins.def: If something projects, it sticks out above or beyond a surface or edge.

example.ex: ...the remains of a war-time defence which projected out from the shore.
example.tran: 海滨凸立着的战时防御工事的遗迹

example.ex: ...a piece of projecting metal.
example.tran: 一块凸立着的金属

collins.def: You can refer to something that people do regularly as a practice .

example.ex: Some firms have cut workers' pay below the level set in their contract, a practice that is illegal in Germany...
example.tran: 一些公司把工人薪水减至低于合同规定的水平，这种做法在德国是非法的。

example.ex: Gordon Brown has demanded a public inquiry into bank practices.
example.tran: 戈登·布朗已要求对银行的惯例做法进行公开调查。

collins.def: Practice means doing something regularly in order to be able to do it better. A practice is one of these periods of doing something.

example.ex: She was taking all three of her daughters to basketball practice every day...
example.tran: 她每天都带3个女儿进行篮球训练。

example.ex: ...the hard practice necessary to develop from a learner to an accomplished musician...
example.tran: 从初学者成长为有造诣的音乐家所必需的艰苦训练

collins.tran: （医生或律师的）业务活动，工作；宗教活动
collins.def: The work done by doctors and lawyers is referred to as the practice of medicine and law. People's religious activities are referred to as the practice of a religion.

example.ex: ...the practice of internal medicine...
example.tran: 内科业务

example.ex: I eventually realized I had to change my attitude toward medical practice.
example.tran: 我终于认识到自己不得不改变对医务工作的看法。

collins.def: A doctor's or lawyer's practice is his or her business, often shared with other doctors or lawyers.

example.ex: The new doctor's practice was miles away from where I lived...
example.tran: 新开的诊所离我住的地方有几英里远。

example.ex: My law practice isn't the most important thing in my life, you know.
example.tran: 你知道，我的律师事务所不是我生活里最重要的事情。

collins.def: What happens in practice is what actually happens, in contrast to what is supposed to happen.

example.ex: ...the difference between foreign policy as presented to the public and foreign policy in actual practice...
example.tran: 公布于众的外交政策和实际外交政策的区别

example.ex: In practice, workers do not work to satisfy their needs.
example.tran: 事实上，工人工作并不是为了满足本身的需要。

collins.def: If something such as a procedure is normal practice or standard practice, it is the usual thing that is done in a particular situation.

example.ex: It is normal practice not to reveal details of a patient's condition...
example.tran: 不透露患者病情的细节是惯常的做法。
