example.ex: The transcript is full of codewords, which is standard practice in any army.
example.tran: 抄本上全是密码，这种做法是所有军队的惯例。

collins.def: If you are out of practice at doing something, you have not had much experience of it recently, although you used to do it a lot or be quite good at it.

example.ex: 'How's your German?' — 'Not bad, but I'm out of practice.'
example.tran: “你的德语如何？”——“还行，只是长时间没练习了。”

collins.def: If you say 'practice makes perfect ', you mean that it is possible to learn something or develop a skill if you practise enough. People often say this to encourage someone to keep practising.
If you put a belief or method into practice, you behave or act in accordance with it.

example.ex: Now that he is back, the prime minister has another chance to put his new ideas into practice...
example.tran: 既然首相又掌权了，他就重新有机会实施他的新想法。

example.ex: We weren't allowed to put into practice in our daily lives the teachings we received.
example.tran: 我们不能够将所受的教义在日常生活中付诸实践。

collins.def: When there is a strike, workers stop doing their work for a period of time, usually in order to try to get better pay or conditions for themselves.

example.ex: French air traffic controllers have begun a three-day strike in a dispute over pay...
example.tran: 法国空中交通管制员因为薪资纠纷已开始了为期 3 天的罢工。

example.ex: Staff at the hospital went on strike in protest at the incidents.
example.tran: 医院员工举行罢工，抗议这几起事件。

collins.def: When workers strike, they go on strike.

example.ex: ...their recognition of the workers' right to strike...
example.tran: 他们对工人罢工权的认同

example.ex: They shouldn't be striking for more money...
example.tran: 他们不该为了得到更多的钱而罢工。

collins.def: If you strike someone or something, you deliberately hit them.

example.ex: She took two quick steps forward and struck him across the mouth...
example.tran: 她向前紧走两步，上去扇了他一嘴巴。

example.ex: He struck the ball straight into the hospitality tents...
example.tran: 他将球直接打进迎宾帐篷里。

collins.def: If something that is falling or moving strikes something, it hits it.

example.ex: His head struck the bottom when he dived into the 6ft end of the pool...
example.tran: 他一头扎进 6 英尺深的游泳池时头撞到池底了。

example.ex: One 16-inch shell struck the control tower...
example.tran: 一枚 16 英寸的炮弹击中了指挥塔台。

collins.def: If you strike one thing against another, or if one thing strikes against another, the first thing hits the second thing.

example.ex: Wilde fell and struck his head on the stone floor...
example.tran: 怀尔德摔倒了，头撞在石头地上。

example.ex: My right toe struck against a submerged rock.
example.tran: 我的右脚趾踢到水下的一块石头上了。

collins.def: If something such as an illness or disaster strikes, it suddenly happens.

example.ex: Bank of England officials continued to insist that the pound would soon return to stability but disaster struck...
example.tran: 英格兰银行官员仍然坚持说英镑不久就会恢复稳定，但结果灾难爆发了。

example.ex: Both of them were afflicted with a rare genetic disease, which struck in their thirties...
example.tran: 他们两个都得了一种罕见的遗传病，这种病在他们30 多岁时发作。

collins.def: To strike means to attack someone or something quickly and violently.

example.ex: The attacker struck as she was walking near a housing estate at Monacurra...
example.tran: 她行走到莫纳卡拉的一个居民区附近时遭人攻击。

example.ex: The killer says he will strike again...
example.tran: 凶手称他还会再次下手。

collins.def: A military strike is a military attack, especially an air attack.

example.ex: ...a punitive air strike.
example.tran: 惩罚性空袭

example.ex: ...a nuclear strike.
example.tran: 核武器攻击

collins.tran: 直击(要害);与…起(原则性)冲突
collins.def: If something strikes at the heart or root of something, it attacks or conflicts with the basic elements or principles of that thing.

example.ex: ...a rejection of her core beliefs and values, which strikes at the very heart of her being...
example.tran: 对她的核心信念和价值观的否定，也就否定了她存在的根本

example.ex: The issue strikes at the very foundation of our community.
example.tran: 该问题直指我们社会的根基。

collins.tran: 突然想到，猛地意识到，一下子想起(想法或念头)
collins.def: If an idea or thought strikes you, it suddenly comes into your mind.

example.ex: A thought struck her. Was she jealous of her mother, then?...
example.tran: 她猛地冒出一个念头：那么难道她在嫉妒母亲吗？

example.ex: At this point, it suddenly struck me that I was wasting my time.
example.tran: 在这一刻，我突然意识到自己是在浪费时间。

collins.def: If something strikes you as being a particular thing, it gives you the impression of being that thing.

example.ex: He struck me as a very serious but friendly person...
example.tran: 他让我感觉他是一个十分严肃但友好的人。

example.ex: What struck me as interesting is how much we judge other people by the clothes they wear...
example.tran: 让我觉得很有意思的是我们经常以衣取人。

collins.def: If you are struck by something, you think it is very impressive, noticeable, or interesting.

example.ex: She was struck by his simple, spellbinding eloquence...
example.tran: 她被他那率直、富有鼓动性的口才迷住了。

example.ex: Theresa was struck by her own lack of forethought...
example.tran: 特蕾莎强烈意识到自己事先太欠考虑了。

collins.def: If you strike a deal or a bargain with someone, you come to an agreement with them.

example.ex: They struck a deal with their paper supplier, getting two years of newsprint on credit...
example.tran: 他们同纸张供应商达成协议，可赊购两年的新闻用纸。

example.ex: The two struck a deal in which Rendell took half of what a manager would...
example.tran: 两个人达成协议，伦德尔获得相当于经理所得的一半。

collins.tran: 达到(两全其美);找到(折中的办法)
collins.def: If you strike a balance, you do something that is halfway between two extremes.

example.ex: At times like that you have to strike a balance between sleep and homework.
example.tran: 在这种情形下你得在休息和做作业之间找到一种平衡。

collins.def: If you strike a pose or attitude, you put yourself in a particular position, for example when someone is taking your photograph.

example.ex: She struck a pose, one hand on her hip and the other waving an imaginary cigarette.
example.tran: 她摆了个姿势，一只手叉腰，另一只手夹着一支假想的香烟。

collins.def: If something strikes fear into people, it makes them very frightened or anxious.

example.ex: If there is a single subject guaranteed to strike fear in the hearts of parents, it is drugs.
example.tran: 如果只有一样东西定能让父母感到恐惧，那就是毒品。

collins.tran: 使顿时(看不见或说不出)
collins.def: If you are struck dumb or blind, you suddenly become unable to speak or to see.

example.ex: I was struck dumb by this and had to think it over for a moment...
example.tran: 这让我吃惊得说不出话来，我不得不仔细考虑一会儿。

example.ex: For this revelation he was struck blind by the goddess Hera.
example.tran: 由于揭露此事，他被女神赫拉弄瞎了眼。

collins.def: When a clock strikes, its bells make a sound to indicate what the time is.

example.ex: The clock struck nine...
example.tran: 钟敲了 9 下。

example.ex: Finally, the clock strikes.
example.tran: 最后，钟敲响了。

collins.def: If you strike words from a document or an official record, you remove them.

example.ex: Strike that from the minutes...
example.tran: 从备忘录中将之删去。

example.ex: Her achievements were struck from the record book.
example.tran: 她所取得的成就被从档案中删去了。

collins.def: When you strike a match, you make it produce a flame by moving it quickly against something rough.

example.ex: Robina struck a match and held it to the crumpled newspaper in the grate.
example.tran: 罗比娜划着一根火柴去点壁炉里揉皱的报纸。

collins.def: If someone strikes oil or gold, they discover it in the ground as a result of mining or drilling.

example.ex: Hamilton Oil announced that it had struck oil in the Liverpool Bay area of the Irish Sea.
example.tran: 汉密尔顿石油公司宣布其已在爱尔兰海域的利物浦海湾地区开采出石油。

collins.def: When a coin or medal is struck, it is made.

example.ex: Another medal was specially struck for him.
example.tran: 专门为他铸造了另一枚奖章。

collins.def: If someone has two strikes against them, things cause them to be in a bad situation or at a disadvantage.

example.ex: The Hotel has two strikes against it. One, it's an immense ugly concrete building. Second,  it lies in a rather awkward position...
example.tran: 该旅馆有两个缺点。其一，它是个非常难看的大型混凝土建筑。其二，它位于一个相当偏僻的地段。

example.ex: When I got out I couldn't find any work, and for being an ex-con, that was a strike against me.
example.tran: 我出狱后找不到任何工作，曾经服过刑的身份对我很不利。

collins.def: If you are within striking distance of something, or if something is within striking distance, it is quite near, so it could be reached or achieved quite easily.

example.ex: I believe we are within striking distance of an agreement...
example.tran: 我相信我们即将达成协议。

example.ex: The airport was within striking distance: no more than sixty miles to the west.
example.tran: 机场近在咫尺，西行不到 60 英里即到。

collins.tran: 打开成功(或财富)之门;踏上通往成功(或财富)之路
collins.def: If you strike gold, you find, do, or produce something that brings you a lot of money or success.

example.ex: The company has struck gold with its new holiday development, Center Parcs.
example.tran: 该公司凭借其新开发的“中央公园”度假村而赚了个盆满钵满。

collins.def: If you strike it rich, you make a lot of money, especially in a short time.

example.ex: He hoped to strike it rich by investing in ginseng.
example.tran: 他希望通过投资人参发大财。

means: 脱水保存（如肉或其它食物）
[复数] drys [非正式用语]主张禁酒的人

collins.def: If something is dry, there is no water or moisture on it or in it.

example.ex: Clean the metal with a soft dry cloth...
example.tran: 用柔软的干布擦拭金属。

example.ex: Pat it dry with a soft towel...
example.tran: 用柔软的毛巾将它拍干。

collins.def: When something dries or when you dry it, it becomes dry.

example.ex: The washing might dry outside today, the sun's shining...
example.tran: 洗过的衣物可能今天晾在外面就能干,阳光正足。

example.ex: Leave your hair to dry naturally whenever possible...
example.tran: 尽可能让头发自然晾干。

collins.def: When you dry the dishes after a meal, you wipe the water off the plates, cups, knives, pans, and other things when they have been washed, using a cloth.

example.ex: Mrs. Madrigal began drying dishes.
example.tran: 马德里加尔夫人开始擦干碟子。

collins.tran: (皮肤或头发)发干的,无水分的
collins.def: If you say that your skin or hair is dry, you mean that it is less oily than, or not as soft as, normal.

example.ex: Nothing looks worse than dry, cracked lips...
example.tran: 没有什么比干燥开裂的嘴唇更难看的了。

example.ex: Dry hair can be damaged by washing it too frequently...
example.tran: 干性头发洗得太频繁容易受损。

collins.tran: 干旱的;雨量少的;无雨的
collins.def: If the weather or a period of time is dry, there is no rain or there is much less rain than average.

example.ex: Exceptionally dry weather over the past year had cut agricultural production...
example.tran: 去年罕见的干旱天气已导致农业减产。

example.ex: The spring had been unusually dry and we received only two tenths of an inch of rain during the entire month of June.
example.tran: 春天异常干旱，我们在整个 6 月只有 0.2 英寸的降雨量。

collins.def: A dry place or climate is one that gets very little rainfall.

example.ex: It was one of the driest and dustiest places in Africa.
example.tran: 那是非洲最干旱、尘土最多的地方之一。

example.ex: ...a hot, dry climate where the sun is shining all the time.
example.tran: 终年阳光明媚的炎热干旱气候

collins.def: In the dry means in a place or at a time that is not damp, wet, or rainy.

example.ex: Such cars, however, do grip the road well, even in the dry.
example.tran: 不过，这种车即使在干燥路面上也表现出了良好的抓地性能。

collins.tran: (通常指河流、湖泊或水井由于天热少雨而)干涸的
collins.def: If a river, lake, or well is dry, it is empty of water, usually because of hot weather and lack of rain.

example.ex: The aquifer which had once fed the wells was pronounced dry...
example.tran: 曾为水井供水的蓄水层正式宣告干涸了。

example.ex: The single-engine plane landed at a dry lake in western Arizona...
example.tran: 单引擎飞机在亚利桑那州西部的一个干涸的湖底着陆了。

collins.def: If an oil well is dry, it is no longer producing any oil.

example.ex: To harvest oil and gas profitably from the North Sea, it must focus on the exploitation of small reserves as the big wells run dry.
example.tran: 随着大型油井的枯竭，要想从北海的石油和天然气开采中盈利,必须着力于开采小储量的油井。

collins.def: If you are dry, you need to drink something.

example.ex: She was suddenly thirsty and dry.
example.tran: 她突然口渴了。

collins.tran: (因紧张、生病等)口干的,喉咙干的
collins.def: If your mouth or throat is dry, it has little or no saliva in it, and so feels very unpleasant, perhaps because you are tense or ill.

example.ex: His mouth was dry, he needed a drink...
example.tran: 他口很干,需要喝上一杯。

example.ex: My throat was dry. I was at a loss for words.
example.tran: 我喉咙很干,不知说什么才好。

collins.def: A dry cough is one that does not produce any mucus.
If someone has dry eyes, there are no tears in their eyes; often used with negatives or in contexts where you are expressing surprise that they are not crying.

example.ex: There were few dry eyes in the house when I finished...
example.tran: 我说完后房间里没几个人不掉泪的。

example.ex: She didn't wince and her eyes were dry. Talk about brave. She was unbelievable.
example.tran: 她连眉头也未皱一下,也没哭。说到勇敢,她令人难以置信。

collins.def: If a country, state, or city is dry, it has laws or rules which forbid anyone to drink, sell, or buy alcoholic drink.

example.ex: Gujurat has been a totally dry state for the past thirty years.
example.tran: 在过去的 30 年里古吉拉特一直是完全禁酒的一个州。

collins.def: If you say that someone is sucking something dry or milking it dry, you are criticizing them for taking all the good things from it until there is nothing left.

example.ex: ...a shady rip-off industry that sucks its talent dry then discards it...
example.tran: 见不得人的山寨行业吸干了它的才华后又将它抛弃

example.ex: He's just milking the company dry.
example.tran: 他是要把公司榨干。

collins.tran: (幽默)不露声色的,含蓄不露的,机敏的
collins.def: Dry humour is very amusing, but in a subtle and clever way.

example.ex: Fulton has retained his dry humour...
example.tran: 富尔顿保持着他含而不露的幽默。

example.ex: Mr Brooke is renowned for his dry wit.
example.tran: 布鲁克先生因他不露声色的机智而闻名。

collins.tran: 冷淡的;淡然的;不动感情的;冷冰冰的
collins.def: If you describe a voice as dry, you mean that it is cold or dull, and does not express any emotions.

example.ex: When he crept back to his desk, he heard the dry voice of Father Laurence.
example.tran: 当他轻手轻脚地回到读经台时,他听到了劳伦斯神父冷冰冰的声音。

collins.tran: 枯燥乏味的;干巴巴的;无趣的
collins.def: If you describe something such as a book, play, or activity as dry, you mean that it is dull and uninteresting.

example.ex: ...dry, academic phrases.
example.tran: 枯燥无味的学术词汇

example.ex: A lot of the work was very dry and boring in Westminster.
example.tran: 威斯敏斯特的许多工作非常枯燥无味令人厌烦。

collins.tran: (面包或吐司)不涂黄油和果酱的
collins.def: Dry bread or toast is plain and not covered with butter or jam.

example.ex: For breakfast, they had dry bread and tea.
example.tran: 他们早餐吃了无黄油的面包，还喝了茶。

collins.def: Dry sherry or wine does not have a sweet taste.

example.ex: ...a glass of chilled, dry white wine.
example.tran: 一杯冰镇干白葡萄酒

collins.def: If a river, lake, or well dries up, it becomes empty of water, usually because of hot weather and a lack of rain.

example.ex: Reservoirs are drying up and farmers have begun to leave their land...
example.tran: 水库逐渐干涸,农民开始背井离乡。

example.ex: The fountain is reputed never to dry up.
example.tran: 这口泉号称从不干涸。

collins.def: If a supply of something dries up, it stops.

example.ex: Investment could dry up and that could cause the economy to falter...
example.tran: 投资可能会中断,而这会引起经济衰退。

example.ex: Credit from foreign banks is drying up...
example.tran: 外资银行的放贷金额持续萎缩，面临枯竭。

collins.def: If you dry up when you are speaking, you stop in the middle of what you were saying, because you cannot think what to say next.

example.ex: If you ask her what she's good at she will dry up after two minutes.
example.tran: 如果你问她擅长什么，两分钟后她就没话说了。

means: 达到预期的目的，实现预期的结果，如愿以偿

collins.def: If you achieve a particular aim or effect, you succeed in doing it or causing it to happen, usually after a lot of effort.

example.ex: There are many who will work hard to achieve these goals...
example.tran: 有志之士将会共同为实现这些目标而努力。

example.ex: We have achieved what we set out to do.
example.tran: 我们已经达成了原初的目标。

collins.def: To launch a rocket, missile, or satellite means to send it into the air or into space.

example.ex: NASA plans to launch a satellite to study cosmic rays...
example.tran: 美国国家航空航天局计划发射一颗卫星上天，对宇宙射线进行研究。

example.ex: A Delta II rocket was launched from Cape Canaveral early this morning.
example.tran: 今天一早，一枚“德尔塔”Ⅱ型火箭在卡纳维拉尔角发射升空。

collins.tran: 使（船）下水；使（新船）首次下水
collins.def: To launch a ship or a boat means to put it into water, often for the first time after it has been built.

example.ex: There was no time to launch the lifeboats because the ferry capsized with such alarming speed.
example.tran: 渡轮瞬间倾覆，根本没时间放救生艇下水。

collins.tran: 开展（重大活动）；发起，发动（军事袭击等）
collins.def: To launch a large and important activity, for example a military attack, means to start it.

example.ex: Heavy fighting has been going on after the guerrillas had launched their offensive...
example.tran: 游击队发起攻击后，激烈的战斗一直持续不断。

example.ex: The police have launched an investigation into the incident...
example.tran: 警方已对该事件展开调查。

collins.def: If a company launches a new product, it makes it available to the public.

example.ex: Crabtree & Evelyn has just launched a new jam, Worcesterberry Preserve...
example.tran: 瑰珀翠刚推出一款新果酱——伍斯特浆果果酱。

example.ex: Marks & Spencer recently hired model Linda Evangelista to launch its new range.
example.tran: 玛莎百货最近聘请模特儿琳达·埃万杰利斯塔为其发布新系列产品。

collins.tran: （在江河、湖泊和港口载人的）大型汽艇
collins.def: A launch is a large motorboat that is used for carrying people on rivers and lakes and in harbours.

example.ex: The captain was on the deck of the launch, steadying the boat for the pilot...
example.tran: 船长站在汽艇甲板上为领航员保向。

example.ex: We'll make a trip by launch to White Island.
example.tran: 我们将乘汽艇到怀特岛。

collins.tran: （除鸟、鱼、昆虫或人类之外的）动物，兽类
collins.def: An animal is a living creature such as a dog, lion, or rabbit, rather than a bird, fish, insect, or human being.

example.ex: He was attacked by wild animals...
example.tran: 他遭到野兽的袭击。

example.ex: He had a real knowledge of animals, birds and flowers.
example.tran: 他在花鸟走兽方面知之甚多。

collins.tran: 动物（泛指人类以外的任何生物）
collins.def: Any living creature other than a human being can be referred to as an animal .

example.ex: Language is something which fundamentally distinguishes humans from animals.
example.tran: 语言是将人类与动物区分开来的基本特征。

example.ex: ...a habitat for plants and animals.
example.tran: 动植物的栖息地

collins.tran: 动物（包括人类在内的任何生物）
collins.def: Any living creature, including a human being, can be referred to as an animal .

example.ex: Watch any young human being, or any other young animal.
example.tran: 注意儿童或其他幼小动物。

collins.tran: 动物的；野兽的；取自动物的
collins.def: Animal products come from animals rather than from plants.

example.ex: The illegal trade in animal products continues to flourish...
example.tran: 野生动物制品的非法交易仍旧猖獗。

example.ex: Cut down on animal fats found in red meat, hard cheeses and so on.
example.tran: 减少摄入存在于红色肉类、硬干酪等中的动物脂肪。

collins.def: If you say that someone is an animal, you find their behaviour disgusting or very unpleasant.

example.ex: This man is an animal, a beast...
example.tran: 这人是个畜生，是个野兽。

example.ex: He was an animal in his younger days.
example.tran: 他年轻时，是个衣冠禽兽。

collins.tran: 肉体的；肉欲的；动物的；非理性的
collins.def: Animal qualities, feelings, or abilities relate to someone's physical nature and instincts rather than to their mind.

example.ex: There was no doubting the animal magnetism of the man...
example.tran: 这个男人无疑有一种野性的魅力。

example.ex: You feel an animal panic to run and hide.
example.tran: 你会感到一种本能的恐惧而想要去逃避。

collins.def: You can refer to someone as a particular type of animal in order to say what their interests are or what their typical behaviour is.

example.ex: You're quite a party animal aren't you, out there every night...
example.tran: 你就是为派对而生的，不是吗，每天晚上你都去参加派对。

example.ex: The entrepreneur at twenty-five is a different animal from the entrepreneur at fifty.
example.tran: 25岁的企业家和50岁的企业家是两种不同的人。

collins.def: A cell is the smallest part of an animal or plant that is able to function independently. Every animal or plant is made up of millions of cells.

example.ex: Those cells divide and give many other different types of cells.
example.tran: 那些细胞分裂，产生出许多不同种类的细胞。

example.ex: ...blood cells...
example.tran: 血细胞

collins.tran: 单人牢房；(修道院的)单人小室
collins.def: A cell is a small room in which a prisoner is locked. A cell is also a small room in which a monk or nun lives.
You can refer to a small group of people within a larger organization as a cell .

example.ex: ...Communist Party cells.
example.tran: 共产党的基层组织

means: 艾滋病，获得性免疫缺乏综合症（Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome）

collins.tran: 艾滋病；获得性免疫缺陷综合征
collins.def: AIDS is a disease which destroys the natural system of protection that the body has against other diseases. AIDS is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'acquired immune deficiency syndrome'.

means: 信基督教的，基督教的，基督教徒的
<口>人（类）的，文明的，<口>正派的，高尚的

collins.def: A Christian is someone who follows the teachings of Jesus Christ.

example.ex: He was a devout Christian...
example.tran: 他是个虔诚的基督徒。

example.ex: Last week there were clashes during protests by Christians and Muslims.
example.tran: 上周在基督徒和伊斯兰教徒举行的抗议活动中发生了冲突。

collins.def: Christian means relating to Christianity or Christians.

example.ex: ...the Christian Church.
example.tran: 基督教会

example.ex: ...the Christian faith...
example.tran: 基督教信仰

collins.def: To emerge means to come out from an enclosed or dark space such as a room or a vehicle, or from a position where you could not be seen.

example.ex: Richard was waiting outside the door as she emerged...
example.tran: 她出现的时候，理查德正在门外等着。

example.ex: The postman emerged from his van soaked to the skin.
example.tran: 邮递员从他的厢式货车中出来，浑身湿透了。

collins.tran: （从困境或不好的经历中）摆脱出来，熬出来
collins.def: If you emerge from a difficult or bad experience, you come to the end of it.

example.ex: There is growing evidence that the economy is at last emerging from recession.
example.tran: 有越来越多的证据表明经济终于开始摆脱萧条。

example.ex: ...their plans to emerge from bankruptcy by February of next year.
example.tran: 他们计划于明年2月之前摆脱破产困境

collins.def: If a fact or result emerges from a period of thought, discussion, or investigation, it becomes known as a result of it.

example.ex: ...the growing corruption that has emerged in the past few years...
example.tran: 过去几年暴露出来的越来越多的腐败现象

example.ex: It soon emerged that neither the July nor August mortgage repayment had been collected...
example.tran: 很快就发现，原来7月和8月的抵押还款都没有偿还。

collins.def: If someone or something emerges as a particular thing, they become recognized as that thing.

example.ex: Mr Shevardnadze emerged as a major figure in the reform movement...
example.tran: 谢瓦尔德纳泽先生逐渐成为改革运动的重要人物。

example.ex: Vietnam has emerged as the world's third-biggest rice exporter...
example.tran: 越南已跃居世界第三大稻米出口国。

collins.def: When something such as an organization or an industry emerges, it comes into existence.

example.ex: ...the new republic that emerged in October 1917.
example.tran: 1917年10月成立的新共和国

example.ex: ...a loose alliance of developed and emerging countries.
example.tran: 发达国家和新兴国家之间的松散联盟

collins.def: Writing is something that has been written or printed.

example.ex: 'It's from a notebook,' the sheriff said, 'And there's writing on it.'...
example.tran: “这是在一个笔记本里找到的，”法官道，“上面还有文字。”

example.ex: If you have a complaint about your holiday, please inform us in writing.
example.tran: 如果您对您的假日有什么意见，请书面告知我们。

collins.tran: (尤指评论语言风格时的)文字作品，文章
collins.def: You can refer to any piece of written work as writing, especially when you are considering the style of language used in it.

example.ex: The writing is brutally tough and savagely humorous...
example.tran: 该作品带有残酷的强悍和野性的幽默感。

example.ex: It was such a brilliant piece of writing.
example.tran: 这真是一篇才华横溢的文章。

collins.tran: (尤指为赚取稿费而进行的)写作
collins.def: Writing is the activity of writing, especially of writing books for money.

example.ex: She had begun to be a little bored with novel writing.
example.tran: 她开始对写小说有些厌倦了。

example.ex: ...activities to help prepare children for writing.
example.tran: 帮助孩子准备写作的活动

collins.def: Your writing is the way that you write with a pen or pencil, which can usually be recognized as belonging to you.

example.ex: It was a little difficult to read your writing...
example.tran: 你写的字有点不好认。

example.ex: I think it's due to being left handed that he's got terrible writing.
example.tran: 我想他的书写这么糟糕是因为他是左撇子。

collins.tran: (尤指某一作者有关某一专题的全部)著作，作品
collins.def: An author's writings are all the things that he or she has written, especially on a particular subject.

example.ex: Althusser's writings are focused mainly on France...
example.tran: 阿尔都塞的著作主要是论述法国的。

example.ex: The pieces he is reading are adapted from the writings of Michael Frayn.
example.tran: 他目前阅读的作品改编自迈克尔·弗雷恩的著作。

collins.tran: 凶兆毕现；有大难临头的预兆
collins.def: If you say that the writing is on the wall, you mean that there are clear signs that a situation is going to become very difficult or unpleasant.

example.ex: The writing is clearly on the wall. If we do nothing about it, we shall only have ourselves to blame.
example.tran: 凶兆显而易见。如果我们对此毫无行动，就只能怨自己了。

means: 慢慢向前移动，侧身移动

collins.def: The edge of something is the place or line where it stops, or the part of it that is furthest from the middle.

example.ex: We were on a hill, right on the edge of town...
example.tran: 我们在恰位于城镇边缘的一座小山上。

example.ex: She was standing at the water's edge...
example.tran: 她正站在水边。

collins.def: The edge of something sharp such as a knife or an axe is its sharp or narrow side.

example.ex: ...the sharp edge of the sword.
example.tran: 锋利的剑刃

collins.def: If someone or something edges somewhere, they move very slowly in that direction.

example.ex: He edged closer to the telephone, ready to grab it...
example.tran: 他慢慢挪向电话机，准备抓起听筒。

example.ex: He is edging ahead in the opinion polls.
example.tran: 他在民意测验中的支持率正一点点攀升。

collins.def: The edge of something, especially something bad, is the point at which it may start to happen.

example.ex: They have driven the rhino to the edge of extinction...
example.tran: 他们已经令犀牛濒临灭绝。

example.ex: She was on the edge of tears.
example.tran: 她泪水盈眶。

collins.def: If someone or something has an edge, they have an advantage that makes them stronger or more likely to be successful than another thing or person.

example.ex: The three days France have to prepare could give them the edge over England...
example.tran: 法国有3天的准备时间，这可能会让他们在对阵英格兰时占上风。

example.ex: Through superior production techniques they were able to gain the competitive edge.
example.tran: 凭借先进的生产技术，他们得以占据竞争优势。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something has an edge, you mean that they have a powerful quality.

example.ex: Featuring new bands gives the show an edge...
example.tran: 以新乐队为主打是这次演出的一个亮点。

example.ex: Greene's stories had an edge of realism.
example.tran: 格林的小说有强烈的现实主义色彩。

collins.def: If someone's voice has an edge to it, it has a sharp, bitter, or emotional quality.

example.ex: But underneath the humour is an edge of bitterness...
example.tran: 但是幽默的背后却透着怨气。

example.ex: There was a nervous edge to his voice.
example.tran: 他的声音有些紧张。

collins.def: If you or your nerves are on edge, you are tense, nervous, and unable to relax.

example.ex: My nerves were constantly on edge.
example.tran: 我的神经时刻处于紧绷状态。

collins.def: If you say that someone is on the edge of their seat or chair, you mean that they are very interested in what is happening or what is going to happen.

example.ex: Most of the time the audience is on the edge of its seat.
example.tran: 大多数时候，观众都屏息凝神。

collins.def: If you say that a person or a piece of entertainment has rough edges, you mean that they have some small faults, although generally you approve of them.

example.ex: The show, despite some rough edges, was an instant success.
example.tran: 虽然有一些瑕疵，演出还是一举获得了成功。

collins.def: If something takes the edge off a situation, usually an unpleasant one, it weakens its effect or intensity.

example.ex: A spell of poor health took the edge off her performance.
example.tran: 一度身体欠佳令她表现有失水准。

means: 为…供给资金， 从事金融活动

collins.def: When someone finances something such as a project or a purchase, they provide the money that is needed to pay for them.

example.ex: The fund has been used largely to finance the construction of federal prisons...
example.tran: 该基金大部分用于了资助联邦监狱的建造。

example.ex: Government expenditure is financed by taxation and by borrowing.
example.tran: 政府开支依靠征税款和借贷来维持。

collins.def: Finance is the commercial or government activity of managing money, debt, credit, and investment.

example.ex: ...a major player in the world of high finance...
example.tran: 高级金融界的大户

example.ex: The report recommends an overhaul of public finances...
example.tran: 该报告建议对公共财政进行彻底改革。

collins.def: You can refer to the amount of money that you have and how well it is organized as your finances .

example.ex: Be prepared for unexpected news concerning your finances...
example.tran: 对财务上的意外状况要做到有备无患。

example.ex: In general, women manage the day-to-day finances but leave most longer-term decisions to men...
example.tran: 通常，妇女管理日常财务，而把大多数较长期的决策交给男人。

collins.def: A dream is an imaginary series of events that you experience in your mind while you are asleep.

example.ex: He had a dream about Claire...
example.tran: 他梦见了克莱尔。

example.ex: I had a dream that I was in an old study, surrounded by leather books.
example.tran: 我梦见我在一间古老的书房里,四周全是皮装书。

collins.def: When you dream, you experience imaginary events in your mind while you are asleep.

example.ex: Ivor dreamed that he was on a bus...
example.tran: 艾弗梦见他在一辆公共汽车上。

example.ex: She dreamed about her baby.
example.tran: 她梦见了她的宝宝。

collins.def: You can refer to a situation or event as a dream if you often think about it because you would like it to happen.

example.ex: He had finally accomplished his dream of becoming a pilot...
example.tran: 他最终实现了成为一名飞行员的梦想。

example.ex: My dream is to have a house in the country...
example.tran: 我梦想在乡间拥有一栋房子。

collins.def: If you often think about something that you would very much like to happen or have, you can say that you dream of it.

example.ex: As a schoolgirl, she had dreamed of becoming an actress...
example.tran: 她上学时曾梦想成为一名女演员。

example.ex: For most of us, a brand new designer kitchen is something we can only dream about...
example.tran: 对我们大多数人来说,一间崭新的由著名设计师设计的厨房只能是一种梦想。

collins.tran: 理想的;梦幻般的;完美的
collins.def: You can use dream to describe something that you think is ideal or perfect, especially if it is something that you thought you would never be able to have or experience.

example.ex: He had his dream house built on the banks of the river Bure.
example.tran: 他在布尔河畔建造了他的梦幻屋。

example.ex: ...a dream holiday to Jamaica.
example.tran: 牙买加梦幻之旅

collins.tran: 理想;夙愿;梦寐以求的事物
collins.def: If you describe something as a particular person's dream, you think that it would be ideal for that person and that he or she would like it very much.

example.ex: Greece is said to be a botanist's dream...
example.tran: 据说希腊是植物学家梦寐以求的地方。

example.ex: He's every girl's dream!
example.tran: 他是所有姑娘的梦中情人！

collins.def: If you say that something is a dream, you mean that it is wonderful.
You can refer to a situation or event that does not seem real as a dream, especially if it is very strange or unpleasant.

example.ex: When the right woman comes along, this bad dream will be over.
example.tran: 当有合适的女人出现时,这种胡思乱想就会停止了。

collins.def: If you say that you would not dream of doing something, you are emphasizing that you would never do it because you think it is wrong or is not possible or suitable for you.

example.ex: I wouldn't dream of making fun of you...
example.tran: 我绝不会取笑你。

example.ex: My sons would never dream of expecting their clothes to be ironed.
example.tran: 我的几个儿子从不指望别人帮他们熨好衣服。

collins.def: If you say that you never dreamed that something would happen, you are emphasizing that you did not think that it would happen because it seemed very unlikely.

example.ex: I never dreamed that I would be able to afford a home here...
example.tran: 我从没想到我在这儿能买得起房子。

example.ex: Who could ever dream of a disaster like this?...
example.tran: 谁能想到会发生这样的灾难？

collins.def: If you tell someone to dream on, you mean that something they are hoping for is unlikely to happen.

example.ex: 'Perhaps one day I may go on a relaxing holiday.' — 'Yeah, dream on.'
example.tran: “也许有一天我可以享受一个放松身心的假期。”——“是啊,你就做梦吧。”

collins.def: If you say that you are in a dream, you mean that you do not concentrate properly on what you are doing because you are thinking about other things.

example.ex: All day long I moved in a dream.
example.tran: 整整一天我都心不在焉。

collins.tran: 梦幻般地;美妙地;完美地
collins.def: If you say that someone does something like a dream, you think that they do it very well. If you say that something happens like a dream, you mean that it happens successfully without any problems.

example.ex: She cooked like a dream...
example.tran: 她烹饪技艺精湛。

example.ex: His ship had sailed like a dream.
example.tran: 他的船行驶十分顺畅。

collins.def: If you describe someone or something as the person or thing of your dreams, you mean that you consider them to be ideal or perfect.

example.ex: This could be the man of my dreams.
example.tran: 这就是我理想中的男子。

collins.tran: （强调极为奇怪或完全不可能）再怎么想也
collins.def: If you say that you could not imagine a particular thing in your wildest dreams, you are emphasizing that you think it is extremely strange or unlikely.

example.ex: Never in my wildest dreams did I think we could win.
example.tran: 我做梦也没想到我们会赢。

collins.tran: 超出想象的;比希望中要好的
collins.def: If you describe something as being beyond your wildest dreams, you are emphasizing that it is better than you could have imagined or hoped for.

example.ex: She had already achieved success beyond her wildest dreams.
example.tran: 她已经取得超乎想象的成功。

collins.def: If you do something in order to achieve a particular thing or in order that something can happen, you do it because you want to achieve that thing.

example.ex: Most schools are extremely unwilling to cut down on staff in order to cut costs.
example.tran: 大部分学校都很不愿意为减少开支而裁员。

example.ex: ...asking them to risk their lives in order that the rest of us can sleep better.
example.tran: 为了让我们其余这些人能够睡得更安稳而要他们冒生命危险

collins.def: If someone must be in a particular situation in order to achieve something they want, they cannot achieve that thing if they are not in that situation.

example.ex: We need to get rid of the idea that we must be liked all the time in order to be worthwhile...
example.tran: 我们必须抛弃那种认为要想活得有价值就得始终取悦他人的想法。

example.ex: They need hostages in order to bargain with the government.
example.tran: 他们要想同政府讨价还价就得有人质。

collins.def: If something must happen in order for something else to happen, the second thing cannot happen if the first thing does not happen.

example.ex: In order for their computers to trace a person's records, they need both the name and address of the individual.
example.tran: 在他们的电脑上查询个人记录，需要提供被查询人的姓名和地址。

means: 汹涌的行动（或思想）态势

collins.def: If you wave or wave your hand, you move your hand from side to side in the air, usually in order to say hello or goodbye to someone.

example.ex: Jessica caught sight of Lois and waved to her...
example.tran: 杰茜卡看到了洛伊丝，就冲她挥手致意。

example.ex: He waved at the waiter, who rushed to the table...
example.tran: 他冲服务员招了招手，服务员就急忙跑到桌边。

collins.tran: 挥手示意(方向);挥手指引
collins.def: If you wave someone away or wave them on, you make a movement with your hand to indicate that they should move in a particular direction.

example.ex: Leshka waved him away with a show of irritation...
example.tran: 廖什克恼火地挥手让他离开。

example.ex: He waited for a policeman to stop the traffic and wave the people on...
example.tran: 他等着警察来让车辆停下，指挥人们前行。

collins.def: If you wave something, you hold it up and move it rapidly from side to side.

example.ex: Hospital staff were outside to welcome him, waving flags and applauding...
example.tran: 医院的工作人员都在外面一边挥动旗子一边鼓掌欢迎他。

example.ex: She was apt to raise her voice and wave her hands about.
example.tran: 她经常会提高嗓门，双手胡乱挥舞。

collins.def: If something waves, it moves gently from side to side or up and down.

example.ex: ...grass and flowers waving in the wind.
example.tran: 随风摇曳的花草

collins.def: A wave is a raised mass of water on the surface of water, especially the sea, which is caused by the wind or by tides making the surface of the water rise and fall.

example.ex: ...the sound of the waves breaking on the shore.
example.tran: 海浪拍岸的声音

collins.def: If someone's hair has waves, it curves slightly instead of being straight.
A wave is a sudden increase in heat or energy that spreads out from an earthquake or explosion.

example.ex: The shock waves of the earthquake were felt in Teheran...
example.tran: 地震带来的冲击波在德黑兰也能感觉到。

example.ex: The blast wave crushed the breath from Neil, but he survived.
example.tran: 爆炸冲击波震得尼尔喘不过气来，不过他还是得以幸存。

collins.def: Waves are the form in which things such as sound, light, and radio signals travel.

example.ex: Sound waves, light waves, and radio waves have a certain frequency, or number of waves per second.
example.tran: 声波、光波或无线电波等都有特定的频率，或者说是每秒的波数。

collins.def: If you refer to a wave of a particular feeling, you mean that it increases quickly and becomes very intense, and then often decreases again.

example.ex: She felt a wave of panic, but forced herself to leave the room calmly...
example.tran: 她感到一阵恐慌，但还是强作镇定地离开了房间。

example.ex: A wave of sympathy for her swept Ireland...
example.tran: 爱尔兰举国上下都同情她。

collins.def: A wave is a sudden increase in a particular activity or type of behaviour, especially an undesirable or unpleasant one.

example.ex: ...the current wave of violence.
example.tran: 目前的暴力浪潮

example.ex: ...an even newer crime wave.
example.tran: 更新一波的犯罪风潮

collins.def: A wave is a sudden increase in the number of people moving somewhere.

example.ex: A wave of immigrants is washing over Western Europe.
example.tran: 移民潮正席卷西欧。

collins.def: If a crowd of people do the wave, each person in the crowd stands up and puts their arms in the air after the person to one side of them, then sits down again, creating a continuous wave-like motion through the crowd.
If one thing is upon another, it is on it.

example.ex: He set the tray upon the table...
example.tran: 他把盘子放在桌子上。

example.ex: He bent forward and laid a kiss softly upon her forehead...
example.tran: 他弯身向前，在她额头上轻轻一吻。

collins.def: You use upon when mentioning an event that is followed immediately by another event.

example.ex: The door on the left, upon entering the church, leads to the Crypt of St Issac...
example.tran: 一进教堂左边的那扇门通往圣以撒墓。

example.ex: Upon conclusion of these studies, the patient was told that she had a severe problem.
example.tran: 这些研究的结果出来后，病人被告知她的病情严重。

collins.def: You use upon between two occurrences of the same noun in order to say that there are large numbers of the thing mentioned.

example.ex: Row upon row of women surged forwards...
example.tran: 一排排的女人涌上前去。

example.ex: I looked across the mountains, ridge upon ridge.
example.tran: 我放眼绵延起伏的群山。

collins.def: If an event is upon you, it is just about to happen.

example.ex: The long-threatened storm was upon us...
example.tran: 酝酿多时的暴风雨就要向我们袭来。

example.ex: The wedding season is upon us...
example.tran: 结婚旺季就要来了。

collins.def: Inflation is a general increase in the prices of goods and services in a country.

example.ex: ...rising unemployment and high inflation.
example.tran: 不断增长的失业人数与高通货膨胀

example.ex: ...an inflation rate of only 2.2%.
example.tran: 仅 2.2% 的通货膨胀率

collins.def: Fruit or a fruit is something which grows on a tree or bush and which contains seeds or a stone covered by a substance that you can eat.

example.ex: Fresh fruit and vegetables provide fibre and vitamins.
example.tran: 新鲜水果和蔬菜提供植物纤维素和维生素。

example.ex: ...bananas and other tropical fruits...
example.tran: 香蕉和其他热带水果

collins.def: If a plant fruits, it produces fruit.

example.ex: The scientists will study the variety of trees and observe which are fruiting.
example.tran: 科学家将研究各种树木，并观察哪些会结果实。

collins.def: The fruits or the fruit of someone's work or activity are the good things that result from it.

example.ex: The team have really worked hard and Mansell is enjoying the fruits of that labour...
example.tran: 这支队伍真正付出了辛劳，而曼塞尔正在享受着这种辛劳的成果。

example.ex: The findings are the fruit of more than three years research.
example.tran: 这些发现是3年多研究的成果。

collins.tran: 取得成果;奏效;产生好的结果
collins.def: If the effort that you put into something or a particular way of doing something bears fruit, it is successful and produces good results.

example.ex: Eleanor's work among the women will, I trust, bear fruit...
example.tran: 我相信埃莉诺在妇女中所做的工作会见成效的。

example.ex: He was naturally disappointed when the talks failed to bear fruit.
example.tran: 会谈没有取得成果，他自然感到失望。

collins.tran: (项目或活动的)初步成果，最初成效
collins.def: The first fruits or the first fruit of a project or activity are its earliest results or profits.

example.ex: This project is one of the first fruits of commercial co-operation between the two countries.
example.tran: 这个项目是两国商业合作的初步成果之一。

collins.def: A difficulty is a problem.

example.ex: ...the difficulty of getting accurate information...
example.tran: 获取准确信息的难题

example.ex: The country is facing great economic difficulties.
example.tran: 该国正面临巨大的经济困难。

collins.def: If you have difficulty doing something, you are not able to do it easily.

example.ex: Do you have difficulty getting up?...
example.tran: 你能站起来吗？

example.ex: The injured man mounted his horse with difficulty.
example.tran: 受伤的男子艰难地上了马。

collins.def: If you are in difficulty or in difficulties, you are having a lot of problems.

example.ex: You have to admit that you are, in fact, in difficulties...
example.tran: 你不得不承认，你事实上是陷入了困境。

example.ex: Rumours spread about banks being in difficulty.
example.tran: 有传闻称银行现在处境艰难。

means: 裂开的，劈开的，分离的，分裂的

collins.def: If something splits or if you split it, it is divided into two or more parts.

example.ex: In a severe gale the ship split in two...
example.tran: 在一次大风中，船断成了两截。

example.ex: If the chicken is fairly small, you may simply split it in half...
example.tran: 如果鸡比较小，你把它切成两半就行了。

collins.def: If an organization splits or is split, one group of members disagrees strongly with the other members, and may form a group of their own.

example.ex: Yet it is feared the Republican leadership could split over the agreement...
example.tran: 但有人担心，共和党的领导层可能会在该协议上出现意见分歧。

example.ex: Women priests are accused of splitting the church.
example.tran: 女牧师被指责分裂教会。

collins.def: A split in an organization is a disagreement between its members.

example.ex: They accused both radicals and conservatives of trying to provoke a split in the party.
example.tran: 他们指责激进派和保守派都在试图挑起党内分歧。

collins.def: A split between two things is a division or difference between them.

example.ex: ...a split between what is thought and what is felt.
example.tran: 所想到的和感受到的之间的不同

collins.tran: (使)(木头、衣服)开裂，出现裂缝;撕开
collins.def: If something such as wood or a piece of clothing splits or is split, a long crack or tear appears in it.

example.ex: The seat of his short grey trousers split...
example.tran: 他的灰色短裤的臀部开裂了。

example.ex: Twist the mixture into individual sausages without splitting the skins...
example.tran: 将混合物拧成一段段的香肠，不要把皮弄破。

collins.def: A split is a long crack or tear.

example.ex: The plastic-covered seat has a few small splits around the corners.
example.tran: 塑料面椅子的四角上有几道小裂缝。

collins.def: If two or more people split something, they share it between them.

example.ex: I would rather pay for a meal than watch nine friends pick over and split a bill...
example.tran: 我宁可掏钱请客，也不愿看到9位朋友算来算去分摊账单。

example.ex: Split the wages between you...
example.tran: 工钱由你们两人平分。

collins.tran: 意想不到的事;突如其来的事;令人惊奇的事(或消息等)
collins.def: A surprise is an unexpected event, fact, or piece of news.

example.ex: I have a surprise for you: We are moving to Switzerland!...
example.tran: 我有一个惊喜的消息要告诉你：我们要搬去瑞士了！

example.ex: It may come as a surprise to some that a normal, healthy child is born with many skills...
example.tran: 一个身体健康正常的小孩天生就会许多技能，这或许会令有些人感到惊奇。

collins.def: Surprise is the feeling that you have when something unexpected happens.

example.ex: The Foreign Office in London has expressed surprise at these allegations...
example.tran: 位于伦敦的英国外交部对这些说法表示惊讶。

example.ex: 'You mean he's going to vote against her?' Scobie asked in surprise...
example.tran: 斯科比惊讶地问道：“你是说他会投她的反对票吗？”

collins.tran: 使惊奇;使诧异;使感到意外
collins.def: If something surprises you, it gives you a feeling of surprise.

example.ex: We'll solve the case ourselves and surprise everyone...
example.tran: 我们要自己解决这件事，然后让所有人感到吃惊。

example.ex: It surprised me that a driver of Alain's experience should make those mistakes...
example.tran: 令我惊讶的是像阿兰这样经验丰富的司机竟然会犯那样的错误。

collins.def: If you surprise someone, you give them, tell them, or do something pleasant that they are not expecting.

example.ex: Surprise a new neighbour with one of your favourite home-made dishes.
example.tran: 做一道拿手的家常小菜，给你的新邻居一个惊喜。

collins.tran: 使人惊异(或意想不到)的事物;让人大吃一惊的人
collins.def: If you describe someone or something as a surprise, you mean that they are very good or pleasant although you were not expecting this.

example.ex: ...Senga MacFie, one of the surprises of the World Championships three months ago...
example.tran: 森加·麦克菲，三个月前世界锦标赛上的一匹黑马

example.ex: My father decided to slip a little extra spending money into my purse as a surprise.
example.tran: 为了给我一个惊喜，父亲决定往我的钱包里多塞一些零花钱。

collins.tran: 突袭;使措手不及;使毫无防备
collins.def: If you surprise someone, you attack, capture, or find them when they are not expecting it.

example.ex: Marlborough led his armies across the Rhine and surprised the French and Bavarian armies near the village of Blenheim.
example.tran: 马尔伯勒带领他的部队穿过莱茵河，在离布莱尼姆村不远的地方向法国和巴伐利亚联军发动了突袭。

collins.tran: 一点儿都不稀奇;可想而知
collins.def: You can say 'surprise, surprise' if you disapprove of something because it is not surprising or original, or could easily have been predicted.

example.ex: There is a shortage of carrots. So everybody starts growing carrots. Next season, surprise, surprise, there is a glut of carrots.
example.tran: 胡萝卜紧缺，于是大家都去种胡萝卜。等到来年这个时候，可想而知，胡萝卜就会过剩。

collins.tran: (用于遇见熟人或给别人一些意想不到的东西时)想不到吧
collins.def: You can say 'surprise, surprise' if you meet someone you know or give them something when they are not expecting it.

example.ex: He came back in as I was heading up to the shower. 'Surprise, surprise,' he said.
example.tran: 我正要去淋浴时他回来了。“想不到吧，”他说。

collins.def: If something takes you by surprise, it happens when you are not expecting it or when you are not prepared for it.

example.ex: His question took his two companions by surprise...
example.tran: 他提的问题让他的两个伙伴都愣住了。

example.ex: Whenever it snows in Britain we are taken by surprise.
example.tran: 每次英国下雪，我们都会感到惊讶。

collins.def: To reveal something means to make people aware of it.

example.ex: She has refused to reveal the whereabouts of her daughter...
example.tran: 她不肯透露她女儿的行踪。

example.ex: A survey of the British diet has revealed that a growing number of people are overweight...
example.tran: 对英国人饮食进行的一项调查显示有越来越多的人超重。

collins.def: If you reveal something that has been out of sight, you uncover it so that people can see it.

example.ex: A grey carpet was removed to reveal the original pine floor.
example.tran: 一块灰色的地毯被揭开，露出了原来的松木地板。

collins.def: A particular sector of a country's economy is the part connected with that specified type of industry.

example.ex: ...the nation's manufacturing sector.
example.tran: 该国的制造业

example.ex: ...the service sector of the Hong Kong economy.
example.tran: 香港经济中的服务行业

collins.def: A sector of a large group is a smaller group which is part of it.

example.ex: Workers who went to the Gulf came from the poorest sectors of Pakistani society.
example.tran: 前往海湾的工人来自巴基斯坦最贫穷的社会阶层。

collins.tran: 军事管制区;军事防御区
collins.def: A sector is an area of a city or country which is controlled by a military force.

example.ex: Officers were going to retake sectors of the city.
example.tran: 军官们打算重新夺回该市的防御区。

collins.def: A sector is a part of a circle which is formed when you draw two straight lines from the centre of the circle to the edge.
If something usually happens, it is the thing that most often happens in a particular situation.

example.ex: The best information about hotels usually comes from friends and acquaintances who have been there...
example.tran: 关于酒店的最可靠信息通常来自曾经去过那里的朋友和熟人。

example.ex: They ate, as they usually did, in the kitchen...
example.tran: 像平常一样，他们是在厨房吃的饭。

collins.def: You use more than usually to show that something shows even more of a particular quality than it normally does.

example.ex: She felt more than usually hungry after her excursion...
example.tran: 远足后，她比平时感觉更饿。

example.ex: He was more than usually depressed by problems at work.
example.tran: 工作上的问题使他异常沮丧。

collins.def: The majority of people or things in a group is more than half of them.

example.ex: The majority of my patients come to me from out of town...
example.tran: 大多数来找我看病的患者都是外省人。

example.ex: The vast majority of our cheeses are made with pasteurised milk...
example.tran: 我们生产的绝大部分奶酪都是用巴氏消毒过的牛奶制成的。

collins.tran: 多数票;超过对方的票数
collins.def: A majority is the difference between the number of votes or seats in parliament or legislature that the winner gets in an election, and the number of votes or seats that the next person or party gets.

example.ex: Members of parliament approved the move by a majority of ninety-nine...
example.tran: 议员以99张的多数票批准了这项动议。

example.ex: According to most opinion polls, he is set to win a clear majority...
example.tran: 从大多数民意调查的结果来看，他很有可能以绝对多数票胜出。

collins.tran: (观点、决定、体制等)多数人支持的，多数人拥护的
collins.def: Majority is used to describe opinions, decisions, and systems of government that are supported by more than half the people involved.

example.ex: ...her continuing disagreement with the majority view...
example.tran: 她与大多数人的观点依旧不一致

example.ex: A majority vote of 75% is required from shareholders for the plan to go ahead.
example.tran: 这项计划若要实施，必须获得股东 75%的多数票。

collins.tran: 法定成年年龄(英国和美国大多数州规定为18周岁)
collins.def: Majority is the state of legally being an adult. In Britain and most states in the United States, people reach their majority at the age of eighteen.

example.ex: The age of majority in Romania is eighteen...
example.tran: 罗马尼亚的法定成年年龄为18周岁。

example.ex: Once you reach your majority, you may do what you damned well please.
example.tran: 等你成年后，就可以随心所欲了。

collins.tran: 付款额；支付的款项；支付；付款
collins.def: A payment is an amount of money that is paid to someone, or the act of paying this money.

example.ex: Thousands of its customers are in arrears with loans and mortgage payments...
example.tran: 有数千客户拖欠其贷款和抵押贷款还款。

example.ex: The fund will make payments of just over £1 billion next year.
example.tran: 该基金明年的支付额刚好过10亿英镑。

collins.def: Payment is the act of paying money to someone or of being paid.

example.ex: He had sought to obtain payment of a sum which he had claimed was owed to him.
example.tran: 他声称别人欠他一笔钱，他在想方设法讨要回来。

collins.tran: 法律（上）的；司法的；法制的
collins.def: Legal is used to describe things that relate to the law.

example.ex: He vowed to take legal action.
example.tran: 他誓言要采取法律行动。

example.ex: ...the British legal system...
example.tran: 英国的法律体系

collins.def: An action or situation that is legal is allowed or required by law.

example.ex: What I did was perfectly legal.
example.tran: 我所做的绝对合法。

example.ex: ...drivers who have more than the legal limit of alcohol.
example.tran: 血液中酒精含量超过法定限度的司机

collins.def: If you say that one thing depends on another, you mean that the first thing will be affected or determined by the second.

example.ex: The cooking time needed depends on the size of the potato...
example.tran: 所需的烹饪时间取决于土豆的大小。

example.ex: What happened later would depend on his talk with De Solina...
example.tran: 日后之事将有赖于他与德索利纳的谈话结果。

collins.def: If you depend on someone or something, you need them in order to be able to survive physically, financially, or emotionally.

example.ex: They may hate what he does but their survival depends on him...
example.tran: 他们或许讨厌他的营生，但他们要想活下来必须依靠他。

example.ex: He depended on his writing for his income...
example.tran: 他靠写作赚取收入。

collins.def: If you can depend on a person, organization, or law, you know that they will support you or help you when you need them.

example.ex: 'You can depend on me,' Cross assured him.
example.tran: “你可以信赖我，”克罗斯向他保证。

collins.def: You use depend in expressions such as it depends to indicate that you cannot give a clear answer to a question because the answer will be affected or determined by other factors.

example.ex: 'But how long can you stay in the house?' – 'I don't know. It depends.'...
example.tran: “但你能在这所房子里呆多久呢？”——“我不知道，这要看情况。”

example.ex: It all depends on your definition of punk, doesn't it?
example.tran: “这全视乎你对朋克摇滚乐的定义，不是吗？”

collins.def: You use depending on when you are saying that something varies according to the circumstances mentioned.

example.ex: I tend to have a different answer, depending on the family...
example.tran: 根据家庭的不同，我往往会给出不同的答案。

example.ex: People in the rest of the country celebrated independence even later, depending on when the news of Congress's action reached them.
example.tran: 该国其他地区的人们庆祝独立的时间甚至更晚，这要取决于有关国会决定的消息何时传到了他们那里。

collins.def: When you deny something, you state that it is not true.

example.ex: She denied both accusations...
example.tran: 她对两项指控均予以否认。

example.ex: The government has denied that there was a plot to assassinate the president...
example.tran: 政府否认曾有人密谋暗杀总统。

collins.tran: 否认与…有关系;否认…是自己的;不承认;抛弃
collins.def: If you deny someone or something, you say that they have no connection with you or do not belong to you.

example.ex: I denied my father because I wanted to become someone else.
example.tran: 我和父亲断绝了关系，因为我想成为一个不一样的自己。

collins.def: If you deny someone something that they need or want, you refuse to let them have it.

example.ex: If he is unlucky, he may find that his ex-partner denies him access to his children...
example.tran: 如果不走运的话，他可能会发现前妻拒绝让他接近自己的孩子。

example.ex: Don't deny yourself pleasure...
example.tran: 不要有乐不享。

collins.def: A festival is an organized series of events such as musical concerts or drama productions.

example.ex: Numerous Umbrian towns hold their own summer festivals of music, theatre, and dance...
example.tran: 很多翁布里亚小镇举办自己的夏季音乐、戏剧和舞蹈节。

example.ex: There are over 350 films in the Edinburgh Film Festival this year.
example.tran: 今年爱丁堡电影节有超过 350 部影片参展。

collins.def: A festival is a day or time of the year when people have a holiday from work and celebrate some special event, often a religious event.

example.ex: ...the Hindu festival of Diwali.
example.tran: 印度排灯节

collins.def: If someone such as a lawyer or a politician represents a person or group of people, they act on behalf of that person or group.

example.ex: ...the politicians we elect to represent us...
example.tran: 我们选举出来代表我们的政界人士

example.ex: The offer has yet to be accepted by the lawyers representing the victims.
example.tran: 受害者的代理律师还没有接受这个提议。

collins.def: If you represent a person or group at an official event, you go there on their behalf.

example.ex: The general secretary may represent the president at official ceremonies.
example.tran: 总书记可以在一些官方仪式上代表主席。

collins.tran: (在竞赛或体育赛事中)代表（国家或地区）
collins.def: If you represent your country or town in a competition or sports event, you take part in it on behalf of the country or town where you live.

example.ex: My only aim is to represent Britain at the Olympics.
example.tran: 我唯一的目标是代表英国参加奥运会。

collins.def: If a group of people or things is well represented in a particular activity or in a particular place, a lot of them can be found there.

example.ex: Women are already well represented in the area of TV drama...
example.tran: 女性在电视剧领域占据了一席之地。

example.ex: In New Mexico all kinds of cuisines are represented.
example.tran: 在新墨西哥州， 有各种各样的烹饪方法。

collins.tran: 相当于，代表着（变化、成就、胜利等）
collins.def: If you say that something represents a change, achievement, or victory, you mean that it is a change, achievement, or victory.

example.ex: The pieces on view are not grouped around any one theme, but rather represent superb examples from various periods...
example.tran: 展出的作品并非围绕着一个主题，而是不同时期的经典之作。

example.ex: These developments represented a major change in the established order.
example.tran: 这些发展代表了现有秩序的重大转变。

collins.tran: (标志或符号)意味着，代表着，标志着
collins.def: If a sign or symbol represents something, it is accepted as meaning that thing.

example.ex: ...a black dot in the middle of the circle is supposed to represent the source of the radiation.
example.tran: 圆圈中心的黑点应该是表示放射源。

collins.def: To represent an idea or quality means to be a symbol or an expression of that idea or quality.

example.ex: We believe you represent everything British racing needs.
example.tran: 我们相信你代表了英国赛马所需要的一切。

collins.def: If you represent a person or thing as a particular thing, you describe them as being that thing.

example.ex: The popular press tends to represent him as an environmental guru.
example.tran: 大众媒体往往把他描绘成环保领袖。

collins.def: If a liquid, gas, or electrical current flows somewhere, it moves there steadily and continuously.

example.ex: A stream flowed gently down into the valley...
example.tran: 一条小溪潺潺流进山谷。

example.ex: The current flows into electric motors that drive the wheels.
example.tran: 电流流向电机，电机带动轮子转动。

collins.def: If a number of people or things flow from one place to another, they move there steadily in large groups, usually without stopping.

example.ex: Large numbers of refugees continue to flow from the troubled region into the no-man's land...
example.tran: 大批难民不断从骚乱地区涌入无人地带。

example.ex: Troops would patrol major roads to ensure that traffic flows freely throughout the country.
example.tran: 军队将在主要道路巡逻以确保全国的交通通畅。

collins.def: If information or money flows somewhere, it moves freely between people or organizations.

example.ex: A lot of this information flowed through other police departments...
example.tran: 大量此类信息在警察机关其他部门中流传。

example.ex: An interest rate reduction is needed to get more money flowing and create jobs.
example.tran: 需要下调利率来推动资金流动以及创造就业机会。

collins.def: If an emotion flows through someone, they feel it very intensely, often so that other people notice it.

example.ex: In that moment a surge of hatred flowed through my blood...
example.tran: 那一刻，一股仇恨在我的血液中翻涌。

example.ex: Waves of emotion flowed across his huge face.
example.tran: 他那张大脸上一时间表情千变万化。

collins.def: If a quality or situation flows from something, it comes from it or results naturally from it.

example.ex: Undesirable consequences flow from these misconceptions.
example.tran: 这些误解造成了不良的影响。

example.ex: ...the psychological effects that can flow from childhood experiences of sexual abuse.
example.tran: 可能由于儿时受到性侵犯而产生的心理影响

collins.def: If someone's words flow, they are spoken smoothly and continuously.

example.ex: His words flowed more readily.
example.tran: 他说得更加流利了。

collins.def: If someone's hair or clothing flows about them, it hangs freely and loosely.

example.ex: ...a long white dress which flowed over her body.
example.tran: 她身上穿的一条飘逸的白色长裙

example.ex: ...long black flowing hair.
example.tran: 飘逸的黑色长发

collins.def: If you say that something flows or that a place flows with it, you are indicating that there is a great deal of that thing in the place.

example.ex: The wine flowed and we danced the night away...
example.tran: 我们喝了很多酒，跳了一个晚上的舞。

example.ex: The square was packed, and the cobbled streets flowed with coloured petals.
example.tran: 广场上挤满了人，鹅卵石铺就的街道上满是五颜六色的花朵。

collins.def: Someone who is in full flow is talking easily and continuously and seems likely to go on talking for some time.

example.ex: He had been replying for some 40 minutes already and was still in full flow.
example.tran: 他已经就就此问题回答了 40 分钟左右，仍然不见有停下来的意思。

collins.tran: (活动)如火如荼地进行;(人)全力以赴，充满激情
collins.def: If you say that an activity, or the person who is performing the activity, is in full flow, you mean that the activity has started and is being carried out with a great deal of energy and enthusiasm.

example.ex: Lunch at Harry's Bar was in full flow when Irene made a splendid entrance...
example.tran: 当艾琳光彩照人地出现在门口时，哈里酒吧的午餐会正是热闹非凡。

example.ex: The Everton keeper needed all his courage to thwart a charging Vinny Jones in full flow.
example.tran: 埃弗顿的守门员需要鼓足全部勇气才有可能抵挡住状态正佳的维尼·琼斯的冲锋射门。

collins.def: If you go with the flow, you let things happen or let other people tell you what to do, rather than trying to control what happens yourself.

example.ex: There's nothing I can do about the problem, so I might as well go with the flow.
example.tran: 关于这个问题我无能为力，所以我不如就顺其自然好了。

collins.def: Something that is perfect is as good as it could possibly be.

example.ex: He spoke perfect English...
example.tran: 他英语说得棒极了。

example.ex: Hiring a nanny has turned out to be the perfect solution...
example.tran: 雇用保姆结果成了解决问题的最佳方法。

collins.def: If you say that something is perfect for a particular person, thing, or activity, you are emphasizing that it is very suitable for them or for that activity.

example.ex: Carpet tiles are perfect for kitchens because they're easy to take up and wash...
example.tran: 方块地毯非常适用于厨房，因为其便于揭起来清洗。

example.ex: So this could be the perfect time to buy a home.
example.tran: 所以这可能是买房子的绝佳时机。

collins.tran: 无瑕的；完好的；完美无缺的
collins.def: If an object or surface is perfect, it does not have any marks on it, or does not have any lumps, hollows, or cracks in it.

example.ex: Use only clean, Grade A, perfect eggs.
example.tran: 只用表面干净、无磕碰的A级鸡蛋。

example.ex: ...their perfect white teeth.
example.tran: 他们洁白无瑕的牙齿

collins.def: You can use perfect to give emphasis to the noun following it.

example.ex: She was a perfect fool...
example.tran: 她愚蠢至极。

example.ex: Some people are always coming up to perfect strangers and asking them what they do...
example.tran: 有些人总爱和完全不认识的人搭讪，询问人家的职业。

collins.def: If you perfect something, you improve it so that it becomes as good as it can possibly be.

example.ex: We perfected a hand-signal system so that he could keep me informed of hazards...
example.tran: 我们完善了一套手势信号，这样他就能随时告知我什么时候有危险了。

example.ex: I removed the fibroid tumours, using the techniques that I have perfected.
example.tran: 我用完善后的技术摘掉了纤维瘤。

collins.def: The perfect tenses of a verb are the ones used to talk about things that happened or began before a particular time, as in 'He's already left' and 'They had always liked her'. The present perfect tense is sometimes called the perfect tense.

collins.tran: (尤指商业或政治方面的)谈判，协商，磋商
collins.def: Negotiations are formal discussions between people who have different aims or intentions, especially in business or politics, during which they try to reach an agreement.

example.ex: We have had meaningful negotiations and I believe we are very close to a deal...
example.tran: 我们已进行了有益的磋商，我相信我们很快能成交。

example.ex: After 10 years of negotiation, the Senate ratified the strategic arms reduction treaty.
example.tran: 经过10年协商，参议院已经正式批准了《削减战略武器条约》。

means: [体]巩固球队领先局面，使对手不能因增加一分而成平局的

collins.def: Insurance is an arrangement in which you pay money to a company, and they pay money to you if something unpleasant happens to you, for example if your property is stolen or damaged, or if you get a serious illness.

example.ex: The insurance company paid out for the stolen jewellery and silver...
example.tran: 保险公司赔付了遭窃的珠宝和银器。

example.ex: We recommend that you take out travel insurance on all holidays.
example.tran: 我们建议您为所有假期都购买旅行保险。

collins.def: If you do something as insurance against something unpleasant happening, you do it to protect yourself in case the unpleasant thing happens.

example.ex: The country needs a defence capability as insurance against the unexpected.
example.tran: 国家需要有一定的防御能力，以应对不可预知的情况。

collins.def: A doctor is someone who is qualified in medicine and treats people who are ill.

example.ex: Do not discontinue the treatment without consulting your doctor...
example.tran: 未经医嘱不要擅自中断治疗。

example.ex: Doctor Paige will be here right after lunch to see her.
example.tran: 佩奇医生一吃完午饭就会来这儿看她。

collins.def: A dentist or veterinarian can also be called doctor .
The doctor's is used to refer to the surgery or office where a doctor works.

example.ex: I have an appointment at the doctors.
example.tran: 我在诊所有个预约。

collins.def: A doctor is someone who has been awarded the highest academic or honorary degree by a university.

example.ex: He is a doctor of philosophy.
example.tran: 他是哲学博士。

collins.def: If someone doctors something, they change it in order to deceive people.

example.ex: They doctored the prints to make her look as awful as possible.
example.tran: 他们修改了照片，尽可能地丑化她的容貌。

example.ex: ...a cleverly doctored photograph.
example.tran: 巧妙加工的照片

collins.tran: (将毒药、麻药等)掺入(食物或饮料中)
collins.def: If someone doctors food or drink, they add a poison or drug to it.

example.ex: She had no doubt that it was he who had doctored her milk.
example.tran: 她毫不怀疑是他在她的牛奶里下了药。

example.ex: ...doctored wine.
example.tran: 掺了药的酒

means: （比准确的时间或宣布的时间）快

collins.def: Fast means happening, moving, or doing something at great speed. You also use fast in questions or statements about speed.

example.ex: ...fast cars with flashing lights and sirens...
example.tran: 闪着灯、鸣着笛、飞速行驶的车辆

example.ex: Brindley was known as a very, very fast driver...
example.tran: 众所周知，布林德利是个喜欢飞车的人。

collins.def: You use fast to say that something happens without any delay.

example.ex: When you've got a crisis like this you need professional help — fast!...
example.tran: 当你遇到这样的危急情况，就需要专业救援了——要快！

example.ex: We'd appreciate your leaving as fast as possible.
example.tran: 如果您能尽快离开，我们将不胜感激。

collins.def: If a watch or clock is fast, it is showing a time that is later than the real time.

example.ex: That clock's an hour fast.
example.tran: 那个钟快了一个小时。

collins.def: If you hold something fast, you hold it tightly and firmly. If something is stuck fast, it is stuck very firmly and cannot move.

example.ex: She climbed the staircase cautiously, holding fast to the rail...
example.tran: 她紧紧地抓着栏杆，小心翼翼地爬楼梯。

example.ex: The tanker is stuck fast on the rocks.
example.tran: 油轮紧卡在礁石中间动弹不得。

collins.def: If you hold fast to a principle or idea, or if you stand fast, you do not change your mind about it, even though people are trying to persuade you to.

example.ex: We can only try to hold fast to the age-old values of honesty, decency and concern for others...
example.tran: 我们只能努力坚守那些古老的价值观：诚实、正派、关心他人。

example.ex: He told supporters to stand fast over the next few vital days.
example.tran: 他叫支持者在接下来的几个重要日子里站稳立场。

collins.tran: (颜色或染料)不褪色的，不掉色的
collins.def: If colours or dyes are fast, they do not come out of the fabrics they are used on when they get wet.

example.ex: The fabric was ironed to make the colours fast.
example.tran: 为防止掉色，织物已经过熨烫。

collins.tran: 骄奢淫逸的;刺激而快乐的
collins.def: A fast way of life is one which involves a lot of enjoyable and expensive or dangerous activities.

example.ex: Life in Detroit no longer satisfied him; he wanted the fast life of California.
example.tran: 他不再满意底特律的生活，想要过加利福尼亚那种刺激快乐的生活。

collins.def: If you fast, you eat no food for a period of time, usually for either religious or medical reasons, or as a protest.

example.ex: I fasted for a day and half and asked God to help me.
example.tran: 我斋戒了一天半，祈求上帝伸出援手。

collins.def: Someone who is fast asleep is completely asleep.

example.ex: When he went upstairs five minutes later, she was fast asleep.
example.tran: 他5分钟后上楼时，她已睡熟。

collins.def: If you say that someone is playing fast and loose, you are expressing disapproval of them for behaving in a deceitful, immoral, or irresponsible way.

example.ex: There have been people who have played fast and loose with the rules.
example.tran: 有人在玩弄这些规则。

collins.def: If you say that someone has pulled a fast one on you, you mean that they have cheated or tricked you.

example.ex: No doubt someone had pulled a fast one on her over a procedural matter.
example.tran: 无疑有人在程序性问题上骗了她。

collins.def: Earlier is the comparative of early.
Earlier is used to refer to a point or period in time before the present or before the one you are talking about.

example.ex: As mentioned earlier, the University supplements this information with an interview...
example.tran: 如前所述，大学将通过面试对这一信息进行补充。

example.ex: Earlier, it had been hoped to use the indoor track.
example.tran: 之前曾经希望能使用室内跑道。

collins.def: A person or animal's legs are the long parts of their body that they use to stand on.

example.ex: He was tapping his walking stick against his leg.
example.tran: 他用手杖轻敲着腿。

collins.def: The legs of a pair of trousers are the parts that cover your legs.

example.ex: He moved on through wet grass that soaked his trouser legs.
example.tran: 他继续前行，穿过湿漉漉的草地，裤腿全湿透了。

collins.def: A leg of lamb, pork, chicken, or other meat is a piece of meat that consists of the animal's or bird's leg, especially the thigh.

example.ex: ...a chicken leg.
example.tran: 鸡腿

example.ex: ...a leg of mutton.
example.tran: 羊腿

collins.def: The legs of a table, chair, or other piece of furniture are the parts that rest on the floor and support the furniture's weight.

example.ex: His ankles were tied to the legs of the chair...
example.tran: 他的脚脖子被绑在椅腿上。

example.ex: The teak table has fluted legs.
example.tran: 这张柚木桌子的桌腿有凹槽纹饰。

collins.def: A leg of a long journey is one part of it, usually between two points where you stop.

example.ex: The first leg of the journey was by boat to Lake Naivasha in Kenya.
example.tran: 行程的首段是乘船到肯尼亚的奈瓦沙湖。

collins.def: A leg of a sports competition is one of a series of games that are played to find an overall winner.

example.ex: The first round of the cup was decided over two legs...
example.tran: 杯赛的首轮以两场分胜负。

example.ex: They will televise both legs of Leeds' European Cup clash with Rangers.
example.tran: 欧洲杯利兹联队与流浪者队的两场争夺战都将进行电视转播。

collins.def: If you leg it, you run very quickly, usually in order to escape from someone.

example.ex: We saw some kids shinning up a drainpipe before legging it clutching a TV and hi-fi...
example.tran: 我们看见几个年轻人爬上了排水管，后来就见他们提着一台电视机和音响跑掉了。

example.ex: He was now to be seen legging it across the field.
example.tran: 现在可以看到他快步跑过田地。

collins.def: If you say that something or someone is on their last legs, you mean that the period of time when they were successful or strong is ending.

example.ex: This relationship is on its last legs.
example.tran: 这段关系已经快玩儿完了。

collins.def: If you are pulling someone's leg, you are teasing them by telling them something shocking or worrying as a joke.

example.ex: Of course I won't tell them; I was only pulling your leg.
example.tran: 我当然不会告诉他们啦。我跟你开玩笑的。

collins.tran: 能够证实/无法证实；站得住脚/站不住脚
collins.def: If you say that someone does not have a leg to stand on, or hasn't got a leg to stand on, you mean that a statement or claim they have made cannot be justified or proved.

example.ex: It's only my word against his, I know. So I don't have a leg to stand on.
example.tran: 现在是我和他各说各的，这我知道。所以我的话无法证实。

collins.def: If an idea, plan, or activity has legs, it is likely to continue or succeed.

example.ex: The American economy still has legs.
example.tran: 美国经济仍可持续发展。

means: （争议一方的情况或论点）要点摘录

collins.def: Something that is brief lasts for only a short time.

example.ex: She once made a brief appearance on television...
example.tran: 她曾经在电视上短暂露面。

example.ex: This time their visit is brief.
example.tran: 他们这次的访问时间很短。

collins.def: A brief speech or piece of writing does not contain too many words or details.

example.ex: In a brief statement, he concentrated entirely on international affairs...
example.tran: 他作了一个简短的声明，集中阐述了在国际事务方面的立场。

example.ex: Write a very brief description of a typical problem.
example.tran: 就一个典型问题作简要的描述。

collins.def: If you are brief, you say what you want to say in as few words as possible.

example.ex: Now please be brief — my time is valuable...
example.tran: 请长话短说——我的时间宝贵。

example.ex: I hope to be brief and to the point.
example.tran: 我希望简明扼要，抓住重点。

collins.def: You can describe a period of time as brief if you want to emphasize that it is very short.

example.ex: For a few brief minutes we forgot the anxiety and anguish.
example.tran: 短短几分钟我们就忘记了焦虑与苦恼。

collins.def: Men's or women's  underpants can be referred to as briefs .

example.ex: A bra and a pair of briefs lay on the floor.
example.tran: 地板上有一个胸罩和一条短内裤。

collins.tran: （尤指就某项工作或某一重大事件）向…简要介绍情况
collins.def: If someone briefs you, especially about a piece of work or a serious matter, they give you information that you need before you do it or consider it.

example.ex: A Defense Department spokesman briefed reporters...
example.tran: 一位国防部发言人向记者们简要介绍了情况。

example.ex: The Prime Minister has been briefed by her parliamentary aides.
example.tran: 首相已听取了她议会助手的简要汇报。

collins.def: If someone gives you a brief, they officially give you responsibility for dealing with a particular thing.

example.ex: ...customs officials with a brief to stop foreign porn coming into Britain.
example.tran: 受命阻止国外淫秽出版物流入英国的海关官员

collins.def: If you refer to something in brief, you are referring to a shortened version of it with few details.

example.ex: ...and now sport in brief.
example.tran: 现在播报体育简讯

collins.def: You can say in brief to indicate that you are about to say something in as few words as possible or to give a summary of what you have just said.

example.ex: In brief, take no risks.
example.tran: 总之，不能冒险。

means: 穆斯林的，伊斯兰教信徒的

collins.def: A Muslim is someone who believes in Islam and lives according to its rules.
Muslim means relating to Islam or Muslims.

example.ex: ...Iran and other Muslim countries.
example.tran: 伊朗和其他伊斯兰国家

collins.def: Troops are soldiers, especially when they are in a large organized group doing a particular task.

example.ex: The next phase of the operation will involve the deployment of more than 35,000 troops from a dozen countries...
example.tran: 下一阶段的军事行动将要对来自 12 个国家的 35,000多名士兵进行部署。

example.ex: There were reports of troop movements.
example.tran: 有报道称将要调动军队。

collins.def: A troop is a group of soldiers within a cavalry or armoured regiment.

example.ex: ...a troop of enemy cavalry trotting towards the Dutch right flank.
example.tran: 敌方一支骑兵队正冲向荷兰军右翼

collins.def: A troop of boy scouts is a local group of them that meets regularly.

example.ex: …a Scout troop.
example.tran: 一队童子军

collins.def: A troop of people or animals is a group of them.

example.ex: Amy was aware of the little troop of travellers watching the two of them...
example.tran: 埃米知道那一小队旅行者正在看着她们俩。

example.ex: Out of beams and cracks came troops of beetles, ants and spiders.
example.tran: 从横梁上和裂缝里爬出来了一群群甲虫、蚂蚁和蜘蛛。

collins.tran: (常指疲惫或忧伤地)成群移动，结队前行
collins.def: If people troop somewhere, they walk there in a group, often in a sad or tired way.

example.ex: They all trooped back to the house for a rest...
example.tran: 他们都成群结队地回到房子里休息。

example.ex: The men trooped into work with resignation.
example.tran: 男人们被迫只好一伙伙地开始工作。

collins.def: A method is a particular way of doing something.

example.ex: The pill is the most efficient method of birth control.
example.tran: 服用避孕药是最有效的避孕方法。

example.ex: ...new teaching methods...
example.tran: 新式教学法

collins.def: If you measure the quality, value, or effect of something, you discover or judge how great it is.

example.ex: I continued to measure his progress against the charts in the doctor's office...
example.tran: 我继续比照医生办公室里的图表来判断他病情的发展。

example.ex: A grammar school's success was measured in terms of the number of pupils who got into university...
example.tran: 一所文法学校成功与否是以考上大学的学生人数为衡量依据的。

collins.def: If you measure a quantity that can be expressed in numbers, such as the length of something, you discover it using a particular instrument or device, for example a ruler.

example.ex: Measure the length and width of the gap...
example.tran: 测量一下这条缝隙的长与宽。

example.ex: He measured the speed at which ultrasonic waves travel along the bone.
example.tran: 他测出了超声波穿过骨头的速度。

collins.tran: 距离(或长度、宽度、数量等)为…
collins.def: If something measures a particular length, width, or amount, that is its size or intensity, expressed in numbers.

example.ex: The house is more than twenty metres long and measures six metres in width...
example.tran: 这座房子长20多米，宽6米。

example.ex: This hand-decorated plate measures 30cm across...
example.tran: 这只手工绘制的盘子直径为30厘米。

collins.def: A measure of a particular quality, feeling, or activity is a fairly large amount of it.

example.ex: With the exception of Juan, each attained a measure of success...
example.tran: 除了胡安之外，每个人都获得了相当大的成功。

example.ex: The colonies were claiming a larger measure of self-government.
example.tran: 殖民地正要求获得更大程度上的自治。

collins.tran: （情形严重或发展到了一定程度的）体现，表现，标志
collins.def: If you say that one aspect of a situation is a measure of that situation, you mean that it shows that the situation is very serious or has developed to a very great  extent.

example.ex: It is a measure of their plight that few of them have anywhere to go to...
example.tran: 他们几乎全都无处可归，看得出他们是陷入了困境。

example.ex: That is a measure of how bad things have become at the bank.
example.tran: 那简直就是银行里糟糕局面的写照。

collins.def: When someone, usually a government or other authority, takes measures to do something, they carry out particular actions in order to achieve a particular result.

example.ex: The government warned that police would take tougher measures to contain the trouble...
example.tran: 政府警告说，警方将采取更为强硬的措施来遏制动乱。

example.ex: He said stern measures would be taken against the killers...
example.tran: 他说将会采取严厉措施惩罚凶手。

collins.def: A measure of a strong alcoholic drink such as brandy or whisky is an amount of it in a glass. In pubs and bars, a measure is an official standard amount.

example.ex: He poured himself another generous measure of malt.
example.tran: 他又为自己倒了满满一大杯麦芽威士忌。

example.ex: ...a pub measure of spirits.
example.tran: 一杯烈酒

collins.def: In music, a measure is one of the several short parts of the same length into which a piece of music is divided.
If you say that something has changed or that it has affected you beyond measure, you are emphasizing that it has done this to a great extent.

example.ex: Mankind's knowledge of the universe has increased beyond measure...
example.tran: 人类对于宇宙的了解已经大为增加。

example.ex: She irritated him beyond measure.
example.tran: 她让他大为光火。

collins.def: If you say that something is done for good measure, you mean that it is done in addition to a number of other things.

example.ex: I repeated my question for good measure...
example.tran: 另外，我重复了我的问题。

example.ex: For good measure, a few details of hotels were included.
example.tran: 除此之外还包括对宾馆的一些详细介绍。

collins.tran: 了解;熟悉;估量…的能力/掂量出…的分量;摸清…的底细
collins.def: If you get or take the measure of someone or something, you discover what they are like, so that you are able to control them or deal with them. If you have the measure of someone or something, you have succeeded in doing this.

example.ex: The governments of the industrialized world had failed to get the measure of the crisis...
example.tran: 工业化国家的政府没能意识到这次危机的严重程度。

example.ex: Has he taken the measure of us and concluded that we're not willing to risk a life?...
example.tran: 他有没有掂掂我们的分量，知道我们并不愿冒生命危险？

collins.tran: 在某种程度上/在很大程度上
collins.def: If something is true in some measure or in large measure, it is partly or mostly true.

example.ex: Power is in some measure an act of will...
example.tran: 权力在某种程度上是意志的表现。

example.ex: In Britain, we have so far escaped, in large measure, either of these afflictions.
example.tran: 在英国，我们迄今为止已经远远地避开了这两类麻烦。

collins.def: If something happens suddenly, it happens quickly and unexpectedly.

example.ex: Suddenly, she looked ten years older...
example.tran: 突然间她看起来老了 10 岁。

example.ex: Her expression suddenly altered...
example.tran: 她的表情一下子变了。

collins.def: If there is discussion about something, people talk about it, often in order to reach a decision.

example.ex: There was a lot of discussion about the wording of the report...
example.tran: 关于此则报道的措辞议论纷纷。

example.ex: Council members are due to have informal discussions later on today...
example.tran: 委员会成员定于今日晚些时候进行非正式讨论。

collins.def: A discussion of a subject is a piece of writing or a lecture in which someone talks about it in detail.

example.ex: For a discussion of biology and sexual politics, see chapter 4.
