example.tran: 生态政治和性别政治论述请见第4章。

collins.def: A discussion document or paper is one that contains information and usually proposals for people to discuss.
Something that is broad is wide.

example.ex: His shoulders were broad and his waist narrow...
example.tran: 他细腰宽肩膀。

example.ex: The hills rise green and sheer above the broad river.
example.tran: 这些小山碧绿陡峭，矗立在这条宽阔的河流之上。

collins.def: A broad smile is one in which your mouth is stretched very wide because you are very pleased or amused.

example.ex: He greeted them with a wave and a broad smile.
example.tran: 他向他们挥一下手，热情地笑着向他们打招呼。

collins.def: You use broad to describe something that includes a large number of different things or people.

example.ex: A broad range of issues was discussed.
example.tran: 讨论涉及了范围十分广泛的一系列议题。

example.ex: ...a broad coalition of workers, peasants, students and middle class professionals.
example.tran: 工人、农民、学生和中产阶级职业人士的广泛联盟

collins.def: You use broad to describe a word or meaning which covers or refers to a wide range of different things.

example.ex: The term Wissenschaft has a much broader meaning than the English word 'science'.
example.tran: Wissenschaft这个术语比英语词science含义更广。

example.ex: ...restructuring in the broad sense of the word.
example.tran: 按这个词最广义的解释进行重构

collins.def: You use broad to describe a feeling or opinion that is shared by many people, or by people of many different kinds.

example.ex: The agreement won broad support in the US Congress.
example.tran: 这一协议在美国国会中赢得了广泛的支持。

example.ex: ...a film with broad appeal.
example.tran: 具有广泛吸引力的电影

collins.tran: （描述或想法）大致的，概括的，笼统的
collins.def: A broad description or idea is general rather than detailed.

example.ex: These documents provided a broad outline of the Society's development...
example.tran: 这些文件勾画出了社会发展的大致框架。

example.ex: In broad terms, this means that the closer you live to a school, the more likely it is that your child will get a place there.
example.tran: 笼统地说，你住得离某学校越近，你的孩子就越有可能进入该校上学。

collins.def: A broad hint is a very obvious hint.

example.ex: They've been giving broad hints about what to expect.
example.tran: 他们对将会出现什么情况已作了明白的暗示。

collins.def: A broad accent is strong and noticeable.

example.ex: ...a Briton who spoke in a broad Yorkshire accent.
example.tran: 一个讲话带有浓重约克郡口音的英国人

collins.tran: 女人，娘们（可能具冒犯意味）
collins.def: Some men refer to women as broads. This use could cause offence.

collins.tran: 媒体，传播工具，传播媒介(如电视、广播、报纸和杂志等)
collins.def: You can refer to television, radio, newspapers, and magazines as the media .

example.ex: It is hard work and not a glamorous job as portrayed by the media.
example.tran: 这是份苦差，并非像媒体描绘的那般令人向往。

example.ex: ...bias in the news media...
example.tran: 新闻媒体的偏见

collins.def: Media is a plural of medium .
Somebody means the same as someone .
The details of something are its individual features or elements.

example.ex: The details of the plan are still being worked out...
example.tran: 计划的细节仍在制订中。

example.ex: No details of the discussions have been given...
example.tran: 没有透露讨论的细节。

collins.def: Details about someone or something are facts or pieces of information about them.

example.ex: See the bottom of this page for details of how to apply for this exciting offer...
example.tran: 有关如何申请这一令人兴奋的工作的详情请参见本页底部。

example.ex: Full details will be announced soon.
example.tran: 具体信息很快就会公布。

collins.def: A detail is a minor point or aspect of something, as opposed to the central ones.

example.ex: Only minor details now remain to be settled.
example.tran: 现在仅剩一些细枝末节的问题需要解决。

collins.def: You can refer to the small features of something which are often not noticed as detail .

example.ex: We like his attention to detail and his enthusiasm.
example.tran: 我们喜欢他的细心和热情。

collins.def: A detail of a picture is a part of it that is printed separately and perhaps made bigger, so that smaller features can be clearly seen.
If you detail things, you list them or give information about them.

example.ex: The report detailed the human rights abuses committed during the war.
example.tran: 这份报告详述了战争期间所发生的践踏人权的情况。

collins.def: If someone is detailed to do a task or job, they are officially ordered to do it.

example.ex: He detailed a constable to take it to the Incident Room.
example.tran: 他派了一名警察把它送到重案调查室。

collins.def: If someone does not go into details about a subject, or does not go into the detail, they mention it without explaining it fully or properly.

example.ex: He said he had been in various parts of Britain but did not go into details...
example.tran: 他说曾去过英国的许多地方，但没有细讲。

example.ex: Neither of them were prepared to go into the detail of their talks.
example.tran: 他们俩都没准备要详细说明他们会谈的情况。

collins.def: If you examine or discuss something in detail, you do it thoroughly and carefully.

example.ex: We examine the wording in detail before deciding on the final text.
example.tran: 我们彻底仔细地检查了措词后才最终定稿。

collins.def: If something attracts people or animals, it has features that cause them to come to it.

example.ex: The Cardiff Bay project is attracting many visitors...
example.tran: 加的夫海湾项目吸引了众多游客。

example.ex: Warm weather has attracted the flat fish close to shore...
example.tran: 煦暖的气候将比目鱼引到了近海。

collins.tran: 引起…的注意（或兴趣、赞赏等）；诱惑
collins.def: If someone or something attracts you, they have particular qualities which cause you to like or admire them. If a particular quality attracts you to a person or thing, it is the reason why you like them.

example.ex: He wasn't sure he'd got it right, although the theory attracted him by its logic...
example.tran: 该理论的逻辑性吸引了他，但他不能确定自己的理解是否正确。

example.ex: What first attracted me to her was her incredible experience of life...
example.tran: 她离奇的人生经历最先吸引了我。

collins.def: If you are attracted to someone, you are interested in them sexually.

example.ex: In spite of her hostility, she was attracted to him...
example.tran: 尽管自己心存敌意，她还是为他所吸引。

example.ex: I was married to a man who had ceased to attract me.
example.tran: 我嫁给了一个我已不再钟情的男人。

collins.tran: 吸引，招引（支持、关注或金钱）
collins.def: If something attracts support, publicity, or money, it receives support, publicity, or money.

example.ex: President Mwinyi said his country would also like to attract investment from private companies...
example.tran: 姆维尼总统说他的国家同样愿意吸收来自私营公司的投资。

example.ex: Opinion polls suggest that the two rebels have attracted a lot of sympathy.
example.tran: 民意测验显示两名反对者获得了大量支持。

collins.def: If one object attracts another object, it causes the second object to move towards it.

example.ex: Anything with strong gravity attracts other things to it.
example.tran: 任何有较强重力的物体都会对其他物体产生引力。

means: 用意志力驱使（某事发生）
愿意， 希望， 想要

collins.def: You use will to indicate that you hope, think, or have evidence that something is going to happen or be the case in the future.

example.ex: The Prime Minister is now 64 years old and in all probability this will be the last election that he is likely to contest...
example.tran: 首相现年64岁，这多半将会是他可能参加的最后一次选举了。

example.ex: You will find a wide variety of choices available in school cafeterias...
example.tran: 在学校的自助餐厅里你会发现有很多饮食可供选择。

collins.def: You use will in order to make statements about official arrangements in the future.

example.ex: The show will be open to the public at 2pm; admission will be 50p...
example.tran: 演出下午两点开始，入场费50便士。

example.ex: When will I be released, sir?
example.tran: 什么时候放我出去，先生？

collins.def: You use will in order to make promises and threats about what is going to happen or be the case in the future.

example.ex: I'll call you tonight...
example.tran: 我晚上会给你打电话。

example.ex: Price quotes on selected product categories will be sent on request...
example.tran: 所选产品类别的报价承索即寄。

collins.def: You use will to indicate someone's intention to do something.

example.ex: I will say no more on these matters, important though they are...
example.tran: 虽然这些事很重要，我也不想再说什么了。

example.ex: In this section we will describe common myths about cigarettes, alcohol, and marijuana...
example.tran: 在这一节，我们将说明有关烟、酒和大麻的常见谬论。

collins.tran: (用于问句，表示礼貌地邀请或提议)愿否，…好吗
collins.def: You use will in questions in order to make polite invitations or offers.

example.ex: Will you stay for supper?...
example.tran: 你愿意留下吃晚饭吗？

example.ex: Will you join me for a drink?...
example.tran: 你愿意跟我一起喝一杯吗？

collins.tran: (用于问句中，表示请求或让某人做某事)…好吗，…行吗
collins.def: You use will in questions in order to ask or tell someone to do something.

example.ex: Will you drive me home?...
example.tran: 你开车送我回家好吗？

example.ex: Will you listen again, Andrew?...
example.tran: 安德鲁，再听一遍好吗？

collins.def: You can use will in statements to give an order to someone.

example.ex: You will do as I request, if you please...
example.tran: 请按我的要求做。

example.ex: You will now maintain radio silence...
example.tran: 现在请保持无线电静默。

collins.def: You use will to say that someone is willing to do something. You use will not or won't to indicate that someone refuses to do something.

example.ex: All right, I'll forgive you...
example.tran: 好吧，我愿意原谅你。

example.ex: I'll answer the phone...
example.tran: 我来接电话。

collins.def: You use will to say that a person or thing is able to do something in the future.

example.ex: How the country will defend itself in the future has become increasingly important...
example.tran: 国家将来如何能自卫已经变得越来越重要了。

example.ex: How will I recognize you?
example.tran: 我怎样才能认出你呢？

collins.tran: (表示行为发生的经常性、习惯性)经常，惯于，总是
collins.def: You use will to indicate that an action usually happens in the particular way mentioned.

example.ex: The thicker the material, the less susceptible the garment will be to wet conditions...
example.tran: 布料越厚实，衣服就越不容易浸湿。

example.ex: There's no snake known that will habitually attack human beings unless threatened with its life...
example.tran: 除非自己的生命受到了威胁，已知的蛇中还没有习惯性地攻击人类的。

collins.tran: (用于含有 if 和 unless 的句子的主句中，表示非常可能发生)会，就
collins.def: You use will in the main clause of some 'if' and 'unless' sentences to indicate something that you consider to be fairly likely to happen.

example.ex: If you overcook the pancakes they will be difficult to roll...
example.tran: 如果薄饼烙久了，就很难卷起来。

example.ex: If a nuclear war breaks out, every living thing will be wiped off the face of the Earth...
example.tran: 如果核战争爆发，地球上的所有生物都会被毁灭。

collins.def: You use will to say that someone insists on behaving or doing something in a particular way and you cannot change them. You emphasize will when you use it in this way.

example.ex: He will leave his socks lying all over the place and it drives me mad.
example.tran: 他非要把袜子扔得到处都是，这简直要让我疯掉了。

collins.tran: (与过去分词连用，表示非常肯定将来会发生某事)定会
collins.def: You use will have with a past participle when you are saying that you are fairly certain that something will be true by a particular time in the future.

example.ex: As many as ten-million children will have been infected with the virus by the end of the decade...
example.tran: 到这个十年结束时，多达千万的儿童将会感染上这种病毒。

example.ex: He will have left by January the fifteenth.
example.tran: 到1月15日他肯定已经离开了。

collins.tran: (与过去分词连用，表示相当肯定)会，将
collins.def: You use will have with a past participle to indicate that you are fairly sure that something is the case.

example.ex: If someone has been in captivity for a long time, he will have changed as a result of his experience...
example.tran: 如果某人遭到长时间囚禁，他会因为他的经历而有所改变。

example.ex: The holiday will have done him the world of good.
example.tran: 假期定会对他大有好处。

collins.def: No one means not a single person, or not a single member of a particular group or set.

example.ex: Everyone wants to be a hero, but no one wants to die...
example.tran: 每个人都想成为英雄，但没有人想死。

example.ex: No one can open mail except the person to whom it has been addressed.
example.tran: 除收信人本人外，没人能打开邮件。

collins.def: A hotel is a building where people stay, for example on holiday, paying for their rooms and meals.

means: 星期六和星期日（或略长一点的）休息时间

collins.def: A weekend is Saturday and Sunday.

example.ex: She had agreed to have dinner with him in town the following weekend...
example.tran: 她答应下一个周末和他在城里共进晚餐。

example.ex: He told me to give you a call over the weekend.
example.tran: 他让我周末给你打个电话。

collins.def: A  customer is someone who buys goods or services, especially from a shop.

example.ex: Our customers have very tight budgets.
example.tran: 我们的顾客很会精打细算。

example.ex: ...a satisfied customer.
example.tran: 心满意足的顾客

collins.def: You can use customer in expressions such as a cool customer or a tough customer to indicate what someone's behaviour or character is like.

example.ex: She's a real cool customer.
example.tran: 她是个很冷静的家伙。

example.ex: ...two pretty awkward customers.
example.tran: 两个相当难缠的家伙

collins.def: When a baby is born, it comes out of its mother's body at the beginning of its life. In formal English, if you say that someone is born of someone or to someone, you mean that person is their parent.

example.ex: My mother was 40 when I was born...
example.tran: 母亲生我时40岁。

example.ex: She was born in London on April 29, 1923...
example.tran: 她1923年4月29日在伦敦出生。

collins.tran: 生下来（有某种疾病或问题）；天生（具有某种性格）
collins.def: If someone is born with a particular disease, problem, or characteristic, they have it from the time they are born.

example.ex: He was born with only one lung.
example.tran: 他生下来就只有一叶肺。

example.ex: Some people are born brainy...
example.tran: 有些人天生聪明。

collins.def: You can use be born in front of a particular name to show that a person was given this name at birth, although they may be better known by another name.

example.ex: She was born Jenny Harvey on June 11, 1946.
example.tran: 她在1946年6月11号出生，取名叫珍妮·哈维。

collins.def: You use born to describe someone who has a natural ability to do a particular activity or job. For example, if you are a born cook, you have a natural ability to cook well.

example.ex: Jack was a born teacher.
example.tran: 杰克天生是个当老师的料。

collins.def: When an idea or organization is born, it comes into existence. If something is born of a particular emotion or activity, it exists as a result of that emotion or activity.

example.ex: The idea for the show was born in his hospital room...
example.tran: 这个节目的构思是他在医院病房里想出来的。

example.ex: Congress passed the National Security Act, and the CIA was born...
example.tran: 国会通过了《国家安全法》，中央情报局由此而诞生。

collins.def: You use double to indicate that something includes or is made of two things of the same kind.

example.ex: ...a pair of double doors into the room from the new entrance hall.
example.tran: 从新的门厅通向该房间的一对双开门

example.ex: ...a lone skier gliding along smooth double tracks.
example.tran: 独自沿平滑的双轨雪道滑行的滑雪者

collins.tran: (用于单数名词前)两个的，双重的
collins.def: You use double before a singular noun to refer to two things of the same type that occur together, or that are connected in some way.

example.ex: ...an extremely nasty double murder...
example.tran: 极端残忍的双重谋杀

example.ex: The government committed a double blunder...
example.tran: 政府重蹈覆辙。

collins.def: If something is double the amount or size of another thing, it is twice as large.

example.ex: The offer was to start a new research laboratory at double the salary he was then getting...
example.tran: 所提供的工作机会是创建一个新的研究实验室，待遇是他当时所得工资的两倍。

example.ex: Leeds Prison is reported to have almost double the number of prisoners it's designed to accommodate.
example.tran: 据报道利兹监狱里犯人的数量几乎已达该监狱设计可容纳人数的两倍了。

collins.tran: 加倍的;双料的;可容纳两个的
collins.def: You use double to describe something which is twice the normal size or can hold twice the normal quantity of something.

example.ex: ...a double helping of ice cream.
example.tran: 双份的冰激凌

example.ex: ...a large double garage...
example.tran: 能停放两辆车的大车库

collins.def: A double room is a room intended for two people, usually a couple, to stay or live in.

example.ex: ...bed and breakfast for £180 for two people in a double room.
example.tran: 费用为180英镑的双人间，含房费和早餐

collins.def: A double bed is a bed that is wide enough for two people to sleep in.
You use double to describe a drink that is twice the normal measure.

example.ex: He was drinking his double whiskey too fast and scowling.
example.tran: 他猛灌着双份威士忌，脸色阴沉。

collins.tran: (用于单词拼写或数字中)两个的
collins.def: Double is used when you are spelling a word or telling someone a number to show that a letter or digit is repeated.

example.ex: Ring four two double two double two if you'd like to speak to our financial adviser.
example.tran: 如果想和我们的财务顾问通话，拨打 422222。

collins.def: When something doubles or when you double it, it becomes twice as great in number, amount, or size.

example.ex: The number of managers must double to 100 within 3 years...
example.tran: 经理的人数在3年内必须翻倍达到 100人。

example.ex: The program will double the amount of money available to help pay for child care.
example.tran: 该方案将使可用于帮助支付儿童保育的钱款增加一倍。

collins.def: If you refer to someone as a person's double, you mean that they look exactly like them.

example.ex: Your mother sees you as her double.
example.tran: 你母亲将你看作是她的翻版。

collins.def: If a person or thing doubles as someone or something else, they have a second job or purpose as well as their main one.

example.ex: ...a farmer who doubles as a night nurse...
example.tran: 兼做夜班护士的农夫

example.ex: Lots of homes in town double as businesses.
example.tran: 镇里的很多民宅还兼做商用。

collins.def: In tennis or badminton, when people play doubles, two teams consisting of two players on each team play against each other on the same court.
If you do something at the double or on the double, you do it very quickly or immediately.

example.ex: Two soldiers entered at the double and saluted...
example.tran: 两名士兵立即进来敬礼。

example.ex: Come to my office, please, at the double.
example.tran: 请来我的办公室，马上。

collins.def: When you bend double, you bend the top half of your body downwards a long way.

example.ex: There wasn't room to stand up and he had to bend double.
example.tran: 空间太小无法站直，他不得不弓着身子。

collins.def: If you are bent double, the top half of your body is bent downwards so that your head is close to your knees.

example.ex: Pickers are bent double, plucking each flower with lightning speed.
example.tran: 采花人弓着身子飞快地摘着花。

collins.def: If you are seeing double, there is something wrong with your eyes, and you can see two images instead of one.

example.ex: I was dizzy, seeing double.
example.tran: 我一阵眩晕，看到的都是重影。

means: 把…搅成糊状（或奶油状）混合物

collins.tran: (用于烹饪或放于水果或甜点上的)奶油，乳脂
collins.def: Cream is a thick yellowish-white liquid taken from milk. You can use it in cooking or put it on fruit or desserts.

example.ex: ...strawberries and cream.
example.tran: 奶油草莓

collins.tran: (用于含奶油或牛奶的汤的名称中)
collins.def: Cream is used in the names of soups that contain cream or milk.

example.ex: ...cream of mushroom soup.
example.tran: 奶油蘑菇汤

collins.def: A cream is a substance that you rub into your skin, for example to keep it soft or to heal or protect it.

example.ex: Gently apply the cream to the affected areas.
example.tran: 把药膏轻轻涂抹在患处。

example.ex: ...sun protection creams.
example.tran: 防晒霜

collins.def: Something that is cream is yellowish-white in colour.

example.ex: ...cream silk stockings.
example.tran: 米色丝袜

example.ex: ...a cream-coloured Persian cat.
example.tran: 米色的波斯猫

collins.def: Cream is used in expressions such as the cream of society and the cream of British athletes to refer to the best people or things of a particular kind.

example.ex: The Ball was attended by the cream of Hollywood society.
example.tran: 好莱坞的大牌影星们出席了那个舞会。

example.ex: ...the cream of Chicago's 200 jazz and blues clubs.
example.tran: 芝加哥200家爵士乐和蓝调乐俱乐部中最优秀的成员

collins.def: When it is dark, there is not enough light to see properly, for example because it is night.

example.ex: When she awoke it was evening and already dark...
example.tran: 她醒来时已是晚上，天已经黑了。

example.ex: It was too dark inside to see much...
example.tran: 里面太暗，看不太清。

collins.def: The dark is the lack of light in a place.

example.ex: Her mother was sitting in the dark by the stove in her rocking chair...
example.tran: 她母亲坐在炉边暗处的摇椅里。

example.ex: I've always been afraid of the dark.
example.tran: 我一直很怕黑。

collins.def: If you describe something as dark, you mean that it is black in colour, or a shade that is close to black.

example.ex: He wore a dark suit and carried a black attaché case...
example.tran: 他身穿暗色西服，手提黑色公文包。

example.ex: The heavy dark table is inlaid with lighter wood.
example.tran: 笨重的深色桌子上嵌有颜色较浅的木头。

collins.def: When you use dark to describe a colour, you are referring to a shade of that colour which is close to black, or seems to have some black in it.

example.ex: She was wearing a dark blue dress.
example.tran: 她穿着一件深蓝色的礼服。

collins.tran: (头发、眼睛或肤色)棕色的，黑色的
collins.def: If someone has dark hair, eyes, or skin, they have brown or black hair, eyes, or skin.

example.ex: He had dark, curly hair...
example.tran: 他有一头卷曲的黑发。

example.ex: Leo went on, his dark eyes wide with pity and concern.
example.tran: 利奥接着说下去，他的黑眼睛瞪得大大的，充满怜悯和关切。

collins.tran: (白人）有着棕色（或黑色）头发（且皮肤略带棕色）的，肤色深的
collins.def: If you describe a white person as dark, you mean that they have brown or black hair, and often a brownish skin.

example.ex: Carol is a tall, dark, Latin type of woman...
example.tran: 卡萝尔身材高大，黑发棕肤，是个有着拉丁风情的女子。

example.ex: The driver was very dark. Maltese, maybe.
example.tran: 司机一头乌发、肤色黝黑，可能是个马耳他人。

collins.def: A dark period of time is unpleasant or frightening.

example.ex: Once again there's talk of very dark days ahead...
example.tran: 又有传言说以后的日子会非常艰难。

example.ex: This was the darkest period of the war.
example.tran: 这是那次战争中最黑暗的时期。

collins.def: A dark place or area is mysterious and not fully known about.

example.ex: The spacecraft is set to throw new light on to a dark corner of the solar system.
example.tran: 这艘宇宙飞船可能会让人们对太阳系中的一个神秘角落有更新的认识。

example.ex: ...the dark recesses of the mind.
example.tran: 隐秘的思想深处

collins.def: Dark thoughts are sad, and show that you are expecting something unpleasant to happen.

example.ex: Troy's chatter kept me from thinking dark thoughts.
example.tran: 特洛伊的喋喋不休让我暂时收起了阴郁思绪。

collins.tran: (眼神或话语）阴险的，邪恶的，不祥的
collins.def: Dark looks or remarks make you think that the person giving them wants to harm you or that something horrible is going to happen.

example.ex: Garin shot him a dark glance, as if in warning.
example.tran: 加林恶狠狠地瞪了他一眼，似乎是在警告。

example.ex: ...dark threats.
example.tran: 恶毒的威胁

collins.tran: （指与严肃或令人不快的事物相关的)黑色的
collins.def: If you describe something as dark, you mean that it is related to things that are serious or unpleasant, rather than light-hearted.

example.ex: Their dark humor never failed to astound him...
example.tran: 他们的黑色幽默总能让他咋舌。

example.ex: Nina took a kind of dark pleasure in being the focus of the tension between her father and her brother.
example.tran: 对成了父亲和哥哥紧张关系的焦点，尼娜有点幸灾乐祸。

collins.def: If you do something after dark, you do it when the sun has set and night has begun.

example.ex: They avoid going out alone after dark.
example.tran: 他们避免在天黑以后独自外出。

collins.def: If you do something before dark, you do it before the sun sets and night begins.

example.ex: They'll be back well before dark.
example.tran: 他们会在天黑前早早返回。

collins.def: If you are in the dark about something, you do not know anything about it.

example.ex: The investigators admit that they are completely in the dark about the killing...
example.tran: 调查人员承认他们对这起谋杀一无所知。

example.ex: I managed to keep my parents in the dark about this...
example.tran: 我设法对父母瞒下了此事。

collins.def: If you describe something someone says or does as a shot in the dark or a stab in the dark, you mean they are guessing that what they say is correct or that what they do will be successful.

example.ex: Every single one of those inspired guesses had been shots in the dark.
example.tran: 所有那些凭直觉的猜测都是无根据的瞎猜。

collins.tran: 简单的;简明的;易于理解的
collins.def: If you describe something as simple, you mean that it is not complicated, and is therefore easy to understand.

example.ex: ...simple pictures and diagrams.
example.tran: 简单的图画和图表

example.ex: ...pages of simple advice on filling in your tax form...
example.tran: 几页关于如何填写税务表格的简单建议

collins.tran: 简朴的;朴素的;不加装饰的
collins.def: If you describe people or things as simple, you mean that they have all the basic or necessary things they require, but nothing extra.

example.ex: The Holy Family Church was closed and the parish now celebrates mass in this simple side chapel...
example.tran: 圣家堂关闭了，现在该教区的居民在它旁边的简陋的小教堂里做弥撒。

example.ex: He ate a simple dinner of rice and beans.
example.tran: 他晚饭简单地吃了点米饭和豆子。

collins.tran: 好办的;容易的;易解决的;简单的
collins.def: If a problem is simple or if its solution is simple, the problem can be solved easily.

example.ex: Some puzzles look difficult but once the solution is known are actually quite simple...
example.tran: 有些谜语看似难解，可一旦知道了谜底其实十分简单。

example.ex: The answer is simple...
example.tran: 答案很简单。

collins.tran: 易做的;易完成的;易解决的
collins.def: A simple task is easy to do.

example.ex: The job itself had been simple enough...
example.tran: 工作本身十分容易。

example.ex: The simplest way to install a shower is to fit one over the bath.
example.tran: 安装花洒最简单的方法就是在浴缸上面装一个。

collins.tran: 头脑简单的;愚笨的;迟钝的
collins.def: If you say that someone is simple, you mean that they are not very intelligent and have difficulty learning things.

example.ex: He was simple as a child.
example.tran: 他头脑简单地像个孩子。

collins.def: You use simple to emphasize that the thing you are referring to is the only important or relevant reason for something.

example.ex: His refusal to talk was simple stubbornness.
example.tran: 他拒绝交谈完全是因为固执。

collins.def: In grammar, simple tenses are ones which are formed without an auxiliary verb 'be', for example 'I dressed and went for a walk' and 'This tastes nice'. Simple verb groups are used especially to refer to completed actions, regular actions, and situations.
In English grammar, a simple sentence consists of one main clause.
Commercial means involving or relating to the buying and selling of goods.

example.ex: Docklands in its heyday was a major centre of industrial and commercial activity...
example.tran: 港区在其最繁荣的时期曾是主要的工商业活动中心。

example.ex: Attacks were reported on police, vehicles and commercial premises.
example.tran: 据报道，警察、车辆和商业经营场所均遭到袭击。

collins.tran: (组织、活动)营利的，商业化的，偏重利润的
collins.def: Commercial organizations and activities are concerned with making money or profits, rather than, for example, with scientific research or providing a public service.

example.ex: British Rail has indeed become more commercial over the past decade...
example.tran: 过去10年来，英国铁路确实变得更加商业化了。

example.ex: Conservationists in Chile are concerned over the effect of commercial exploitation of forests...
example.tran: 对森林的商业开发所带来的影响让智利的自然资源保护者们感到忧心忡忡。

collins.tran: (产品)商品化的，供市场出售的
collins.def: A commercial product is made to be sold to the public.

example.ex: They are the leading manufacturer in both defence and commercial products.
example.tran: 在军工产品和民用产品的制造方面，他们都处于领先地位。

collins.def: A commercial vehicle is a vehicle used for carrying goods, or passengers who pay.

example.ex: Commercial vehicles, coaches and lorries are required by law to be fitted with tachographs.
example.tran: 法律规定商用车辆、长途汽车和卡车要安装转速计。

example.ex: ...the fastest crossing of the Atlantic by a commercial passenger vessel.
example.tran: 商用客船最快的一次横渡大西洋

collins.tran: (电视、广播)靠广告收入维持的，商业性的
collins.def: Commercial television and radio are paid for by the broadcasting of advertisements, rather than by the government.

example.ex: ...Classic FM, the first national commercial radio station.
example.tran: 国内首家商业广播电台——经典调频

collins.tran: (电影或音乐)商业化的，迎合大众口味的
collins.def: Commercial is used to describe something such as a film or a type of music that it is intended to be popular with the public, and is not very original or of high quality.

example.ex: There's a feeling among a lot of people that music has become too commercial.
example.tran: 很多人都觉得音乐变得过于商业化了。

collins.def: A commercial is an advertisement that is broadcast on television or radio.

example.ex: The government has launched a campaign of television commercials and leaflets.
example.tran: 政府通过电视广告和传单的形式发起了宣传活动。

collins.def: Your hands are the parts of your body at the end of your arms. Each hand has four fingers and a thumb.

example.ex: I put my hand into my pocket and pulled out the letter...
example.tran: 我把手伸进口袋，掏出了那封信。

example.ex: Sylvia, camera in hand, asked, 'Where do we go first?'
example.tran: 西尔维娅手里拿着相机问道：“我们先去哪里？”

collins.def: The hand of someone or something is their influence in an event or situation.

example.ex: The hand of the military authorities can be seen in the entire electoral process...
example.tran: 整个选举过程中都能看出军方的介入。

example.ex: The study will strengthen the hand of congressmen who want stricter enforcement of the 14-year-old Act.
example.tran: 该研究将使那些希望更加严格执行这项已存在14年的法案的议员影响力加强。

collins.def: If you say that something is in a particular person's hands, you mean that they are looking after it, own it, or are responsible for it.

example.ex: I feel that possibly the majority of these dogs are in the wrong hands...
example.tran: 在我看来很可能这些狗大多数都没有人妥善照看。

example.ex: He is leaving his north London business in the hands of a colleague...
example.tran: 他把自己伦敦北部的业务交给一位同事打理。

collins.def: If you ask someone for a hand with something, you are asking them to help you in what you are doing.

example.ex: I could see you'd want a hand with the children...
example.tran: 我能看出你需要有人帮着照看孩子。

example.ex: Come and give me a hand in the garden...
example.tran: 到花园里来帮我一把。

collins.tran: （工厂或农场的）工人，体力劳动者（通常指男性）
collins.def: A hand is someone, usually a man, who does hard physical work, for example in a factory or on a farm, as part of a group of people who all do similar work.

example.ex: He now works as a farm hand...
example.tran: 他现在是一名农场工人。

example.ex: He met mill hands, miners and farm labourers.
example.tran: 他见过工厂工人、矿工和农场工人。

collins.tran: （通常指演出前后的）鼓掌，掌声
collins.def: If someone asks an audience to give someone a hand, they are asking the audience to clap loudly, usually before or after that person performs.

example.ex: Let's give 'em a big hand.
example.tran: 让我们为他们热烈鼓掌。

collins.def: If a man asks for a woman's hand in marriage, he asks her or her parents for permission to marry her.

example.ex: He came to ask Usha's father for her hand in marriage.
example.tran: 他来请求乌莎的父亲把女儿嫁给他。

collins.tran: （纸牌游戏中的）手中的牌，一手牌
collins.def: In a game of cards, your hand is the set of cards that you are holding in your hand at a particular time or the cards that are dealt to you at the beginning of the game.

example.ex: He carefully inspected his hand.
example.tran: 他仔细地审视着自己手中的牌。

collins.tran: 一手之宽（测量马匹高度的单位，等于4英寸）
collins.def: A hand is a measurement of four inches, which is used for measuring the height of a horse from its front feet to its shoulders.

example.ex: I had a very good 14.2 hands pony, called Brandy.
example.tran: 我有一匹很棒的14.2手高的小马，名叫布朗迪。

collins.def: The hands of a clock or watch are the thin pieces of metal or plastic that indicate what time it is.
Your hand is the style in which you write with a pen or pencil.

example.ex: The manuscripts were written in the composer's own hand.
example.tran: 手稿是作曲家亲笔写的。

collins.tran: （空间或时间上）接近的，不远的
collins.def: If something is at hand ,near at hand, or close at hand, it is very near in place or time.

example.ex: Having the right equipment at hand will be enormously helpful...
example.tran: 手头上有合适的设备将会帮上大忙。

example.ex: Realizing that his retirement was near at hand, he looked for some additional income.
example.tran: 意识到自己快要退休了，他想要挣些外快。

collins.tran: 在…手中，从…那里（尤指受到不好的待遇）
collins.def: If someone experiences a particular kind of treatment, especially unpleasant treatment, at the hands of a person or organization, they receive it from them.

example.ex: The civilian population were suffering greatly at the hands of the security forces.
example.tran: 老百姓吃尽了安全部队的苦头。

collins.def: If you do something by hand, you do it using your hands rather than a machine.

example.ex: Each pleat was stitched in place by hand.
example.tran: 每条褶裥都是手工缝制到位的。

collins.def: When something changes hands, its ownership changes, usually because it is sold to someone else.

example.ex: The firm has changed hands many times over the years.
example.tran: 该公司多年来已几易其主。

collins.tran: 完全受（某人）支配;完全听命于（某人）
collins.def: If you have someone eating out of your hand, they are completely under your control.

example.ex: Parker could have customers eating out of his hand.
example.tran: 帕克能让顾客对自己言听计从。

collins.tran: 连手带脚地，手脚一起地（捆绑）
collins.def: If someone is bound hand and foot, both their hands and both their feet are tied together.

collins.tran: 迫使（某人）提前行动（或公开其所作所为）
collins.def: If you force someone's hand, you force them to act sooner than they want to, or to act in public when they would prefer to keep their actions secret.

example.ex: He blamed the press for forcing his hand.
example.tran: 他指责新闻界迫使自己采取行动。

collins.tran: （为…）忙得不可开交;（因…）应接不暇
collins.def: If you have your hands full with something, you are very busy because of it.

example.ex: She had her hands full with new arrivals.
example.tran: 她忙于应付新来的人。

collins.tran: 自行决定权;自由行动权
collins.def: If someone gives you a free hand, they give you the freedom to use your own judgment and to do exactly as you wish.

example.ex: He gave Stephanie a free hand in the decoration.
example.tran: 他放手让斯蒂芬妮全权负责装修一事。

collins.tran: 迅速而大量地（赚钱或花钱）
collins.def: If you say that someone is making or losing money hand over fist, you mean that they are getting or losing a lot of money very quickly.

collins.tran: （通常指经过努力后）获得，得到
collins.def: If you get your hands on something or lay your hands on something, you manage to find it or obtain it, usually after some difficulty.

example.ex: Patty began reading everything she could get her hands on.
example.tran: 帕蒂开始阅读她能找到的所有东西。

collins.def: If you work hand in glove with someone, you work very closely with them.

example.ex: The UN inspectors work hand in glove with the Western intelligence agencies.
example.tran: 联合国观察员和西方情报机构之间密切合作。

collins.tran: （常指为表示爱意而）手拉手的，携着手的
collins.def: If two people are hand in hand, they are holding each other's nearest hand, usually while they are walking or sitting together. People often do this to show their affection for each other.

example.ex: I saw them making their way, hand in hand, down the path.
example.tran: 我看到他们手拉手沿着小路往前走去。

collins.tran: （两件事）密切相关地，同时并进地
collins.def: If two things go hand in hand, they are closely connected and cannot be considered separately from each other.

example.ex: For us, research and teaching go hand in hand...
example.tran: 对我们而言，研究和教学是齐头并进的。

example.ex: Hand in hand with the police inquiries the government has also announced a full investigation.
example.tran: 在警方调查的同时，政府也宣布要展开彻查。

collins.def: If you have a hand in something such as an event or activity, you are involved in it.

example.ex: He thanked all who had a hand in his release.
example.tran: 他向所有帮助自己获得释放的人表示感谢。

collins.def: If you say that someone such as the ruler of a country treats people with a heavy hand, you are criticizing them because they are very strict and severe with them.

example.ex: Henry and Richard both ruled with a heavy hand.
example.tran: 亨利和理查都用高压手段实行统治。

collins.tran: （常指为表示爱意而）手拉手，牵手
collins.def: If two people are holding hands, they are holding each other's nearest hand, usually while they are walking or sitting together. People often do this to show their affection for each other.

example.ex: She approached a young couple holding hands on a bench.
example.tran: 她走近一对手拉手坐在长椅上的年轻情侣。

collins.def: If you ask someone to hold your hand at an event that you are worried about, you ask them to support you by being there with you.

example.ex: I don't need anyone to hold my hand.
example.tran: 我不需要任何人的精神安慰。

collins.def: In a competition, if someone has games or matches in hand, they have more games or matches left to play than their opponent and therefore have the possibility of scoring more points.

example.ex: Wales are three points behind Romania in the group but have a game in hand.
example.tran: 威尔士队在小组中以3分之差落后于罗马尼亚队，但他们还有一场比赛没踢。

collins.def: If you have time or money in hand, you have more time or money than you need.

example.ex: Hughes finished with 15 seconds in hand.
example.tran: 休斯提前了15秒完成。

collins.tran: （工作或问题）办理中的，处理中的
collins.def: The job or problem in hand is the job or problem that you are dealing with at the moment.

example.ex: The business in hand was approaching some kind of climax.
example.tran: 手头的生意似乎快到紧要关头了。

collins.def: If a situation is in hand, it is under control.

example.ex: The Olympic organisers say that matters are well in hand.
example.tran: 奥运会的组织方说各项事务都在掌控之中。

collins.def: If you do something to keep your hand in, you practise a skill or hobby occasionally in order to remain fairly good at it.

example.ex: He still plays keyboards for a local band to keep his hand in.
example.tran: 他仍在一个本地乐队里担任键盘手，以免技艺生疏。

collins.def: If you are on your hands and knees, your knees and feet and the palms of your hands are touching the ground.

example.ex: Chris crawled on his hands and knees out onto the highway.
example.tran: 克里斯手脚并用爬上了公路。

collins.def: If you lend someone a hand, you help them.

example.ex: I'd be glad to lend a hand.
example.tran: 我很乐意帮忙。

collins.tran: （不客气的警告语）别碰…，别干涉…
collins.def: If you tell someone to keep their hands off something or to take their hands off it, you are telling them in a rather aggressive way not to touch it or interfere with it.

example.ex: Keep your hands off my milk.
example.tran: 不准打我的牛奶的主意。

collins.tran: 马上;立即;无需询问（或查证）
collins.def: If you do not know something off hand, you do not know it without having to ask someone else or look it up in a book.

example.ex: I can't think of any off hand.
example.tran: 我现在一个也想不出来。

collins.def: If you have a problem or responsibility on your hands, you have to deal with it. If it is off your hands, you no longer have to deal with it.

example.ex: They now have yet another drug problem on their hands...
example.tran: 他们现在又有个吸毒问题需要解决。

example.ex: She would like the worry of dealing with her affairs taken off her hands.
example.tran: 她希望不再为处理自己的事务而烦恼。

collins.def: If someone or something is on hand, they are near and able to be used if they are needed.

example.ex: The Bridal Department will have experts on hand to give you all the help and advice you need...
example.tran: 婚礼用品部会有现成的专家为您提供所需的一切帮助和建议。

example.ex: There was simply no cash on hand to meet the cost of food.
example.tran: 手头实在没有现金可以购买食品。

collins.def: You use on the one hand to introduce the first of two contrasting points, facts, or ways of looking at something. It is always followed later by on the other hand or 'on the other'.

example.ex: On the one hand, if the body doesn't have enough cholesterol, we would not be able to survive. On the other hand, if the body has too much cholesterol, the excess begins to line the arteries.
example.tran: 一方面，如果体内没有足够的胆固醇，我们就无法存活下去。另一方面，如果体内胆固醇过高，多余的胆固醇就会附着在动脉内壁上。

collins.tran: （从）另一方面（来说）（用于引出相对照的另一点）
collins.def: You use on the other hand to introduce the second of two contrasting points, facts, or ways of looking at something.

example.ex: Well, all right, hospitals lose money. But, on the other hand, if people are healthy, don't think of it as losing money; think of it as saving lives.
example.tran: 嗯，好吧，医院是赔钱。但从另一个角度看，如果人们都健健康康的，就不能认为是在赔钱，而应该想成是在救死扶伤。

collins.def: If a person or a situation gets out of hand, you are no longer able to control them.

example.ex: His drinking had got out of hand.
example.tran: 他酗酒的恶习已无法控制。

collins.tran: 立即，不假思索地（屏弃、拒绝等）
collins.def: If you dismiss or reject something out of hand, you do so immediately and do not consider believing or accepting it.

example.ex: I initially dismissed the idea out of hand.
example.tran: 我起初不假思索地就否定了这个想法。

collins.tran: 因失算而让…占便宜;做对…有利的事
collins.def: If you play into someone's hands, you do something which they want you to do and which places you in their power.

example.ex: He is playing into the hands of racists.
example.tran: 他这样做正中种族主义分子的下怀。

collins.tran: 摊牌;亮出底牌;表明自己的真实意图
collins.def: If you show your hand, you show how much power you have and the way you intend to act.

example.ex: He has grown more serious about running for president, although he refuses to show his hand.
example.tran: 尽管他拒绝亮出自己的底牌，他对竞选总统一事却越来越认真了。

collins.tran: （尤指为有所改善）接手，照管，担任起对…的责任
collins.def: If you take something or someone in hand, you take control or responsibility over them, especially in order to improve them.

example.ex: I hope that Parliament will soon take the NHS in hand...
example.tran: 我希望议会能很快接管国民医疗保健系统。

example.ex: He had thought her worth taking in hand.
example.tran: 他曾经认为照管她是值得的。

collins.tran: （因愤怒、绝望或厌恶而）骤然举起双手
collins.def: If someone throws up their hands, they express their anger, frustration, or disgust when a situation becomes so bad that they can no longer accept it.

example.ex: She threw up her hands in despair...
example.tran: 她绝望地举起双手表示放弃。

example.ex: Or are they just going to throw up their hands and say you're asking too much?
example.tran: 或许他们只会愤怒地挥舞着双手说你的要求太过分了？

collins.def: If you say that your hands are tied, you mean that something is preventing you from acting in the way that you want to.

example.ex: Politicians are always saying that they want to help us but their hands are tied...
example.tran: 政客们总是说想帮助我们，但却身不由己。

example.ex: Her hands were tied by the way that the US constitution is structured.
example.tran: 她为美国宪法的表述缚住了手脚。

collins.def: If you have something to hand or near to hand, you have it with you or near you, ready to use when needed.

example.ex: You may want to keep this brochure safe, so you have it to hand whenever you may need it.
example.tran: 你应该保管好这份手册，这样随时想用都能马上在手边找到。

collins.def: If you try your hand at an activity, you attempt to do it, usually for the first time.

example.ex: After he left school, he tried his hand at a variety of jobs—bricklayer, cinema usher, coal man.
example.tran: 离开学校后，他尝试过各种工作，如泥瓦匠、电影院引座员、运煤工。

collins.def: If you turn your hand to something such as a practical activity, you learn about it and do it for the first time.

example.ex: ...a person who can turn his hand to anything.
example.tran: 什么事都能学着做的人

collins.tran: 洗手不干;不再管;和…断绝关系
collins.def: If you wash your hands of someone or something, you refuse to be involved with them any more or to take responsibility for them.

example.ex: He seems to have washed his hands of the job.
example.tran: 那份工作他好像已经洗手不干了。

collins.def: If you win hands down, you win very easily.
A dog is a very common four-legged animal that is often kept by people as a pet or to guard or hunt. There are many different breeds of dog.

example.ex: Outside, a dog was barking...
example.tran: 外面，一只狗在叫。

example.ex: The dog growled again...
example.tran: 狗又在狂吠。

collins.tran: 公狗;犬科雄兽(雄狐、雄狼等)
collins.def: You use dog to refer to a male dog, or to the male of some related species such as wolves or foxes.

example.ex: Is this a dog or a bitch?
example.tran: 这是公狗还是母狗?

example.ex: ...a dog fox.
example.tran: 公狐狸

collins.def: If someone calls a man a dog, they strongly disapprove of him.

collins.tran: 蹩脚货;粗制滥造的东西
collins.def: People use dog to refer to something that they consider unsatisfactory or of poor quality.

example.ex: It's a real dog.
example.tran: 这实在是蹩脚货。

collins.def: If someone, especially a man, calls a woman or girl a dog, they mean that she is very ugly, unattractive, or boring.

example.ex: How can you go out with her? She's a real dog.
example.tran: 你怎么能和她谈恋爱呢？她简直就是个恐龙。

collins.def: If problems or injuries dog you, they are with you all the time.

example.ex: The problems that have dogged him all year are just a temporary setback...
example.tran: 一时的挫折竟困扰了他一整年。

example.ex: His career has been dogged by bad luck.
example.tran: 他在事业上一直不走运。

collins.tran: （带有赌博性质的）赛狗会，跑狗
collins.def: The dogs is a sports meeting where dogs, especially greyhounds, race and people bet on which dog will win.
You describe something as a dog's breakfast or dog's dinner in order to express your disapproval of it, for example because it is very untidy, badly organized, or badly done.

example.ex: The whole place was a bit of a dog's dinner, really...
example.tran: 整个地方乌烟瘴气的，真的。

example.ex: Our own Board are going to make a dog's breakfast out of it if we aren't careful.
example.tran: 如果我们不小心行事，我们的董事会就会乱成一团。

collins.tran: 狗咬狗;残酷无情的竞争;自相残杀
collins.def: You use dog eat dog to express your disapproval of a situation where everyone wants to succeed and is willing to harm other people in order to do so.

example.ex: It is very much dog eat dog out there...
example.tran: 那儿的竞争异常残酷。

example.ex: The TV business today is a dog-eat-dog business.
example.tran: 当前电视业的竞争残酷无情。

collins.def: If you say that something is going to the dogs, you mean that it is becoming weaker and worse in quality.

example.ex: They sit in impotent opposition while the country goes to the dogs.
example.tran: 国家败落之际，他们加入了软弱无力的反对党。

collins.def: If someone tells you to let sleeping dogs lie, they are warning you not to disturb or interfere with a situation, because you are likely to cause trouble and problems.

example.ex: Why can't she let sleeping dogs lie?
example.tran: 为什么她就不能不多事？

collins.tran: 不接受新事物;不喜欢新玩意儿
collins.def: If you say 'You can't teach an old dog new tricks', you are suggesting that someone is unwilling to try new ways of doing things.

means: 对…的真实或有效进行争论，怀疑

collins.def: A dispute is an argument or disagreement between people or groups.

example.ex: They have won previous pay disputes with the government...
example.tran: 在先前和政府的工资纠纷中他们赢了。

example.ex: Negotiators failed to resolve the bitter dispute between the European Community and the United States over cutting subsides to farmers.
example.tran: 谈判者未能消弭欧共体和美国之间在削减农民补贴一事上的争端。

collins.tran: 质疑(事实、声明或理论)；对…表示异议
collins.def: If you dispute a fact, statement, or theory, you say that it is incorrect or untrue.

example.ex: He disputed the allegations...
example.tran: 他对指控表示怀疑。

example.ex: Nobody disputed that Davey was clever...
example.tran: 没有人怀疑戴维是聪明的。

collins.def: When people dispute something, they fight for control or ownership of it. You can also say that one group of people dispute something with another group.

example.ex: Russia and Ukraine have been disputing the ownership of the fleet...
example.tran: 俄罗斯和乌克兰一直在争夺舰队的所有权。

example.ex: Fishermen from Bristol disputed fishing rights with the Danes.
example.tran: 布里斯托尔的渔民与丹麦人争夺捕鱼权。

collins.def: If two or more people or groups are in dispute, they are arguing or disagreeing about something.

example.ex: The two countries are in dispute over the boundaries of their coastal waters...
example.tran: 两国在近海水域分界线上尚存分歧。

example.ex: It is currently in dispute with the government over price fixing.
example.tran: 目前在定价上和政府还有争议。

collins.def: If something is in dispute, people are questioning it or arguing about it.

example.ex: All those matters are in dispute and it is not for me to decide them.
example.tran: 所有这些事项都尚无定论，也不是我可以决定的。

collins.def: You use especially to emphasize that what you are saying applies more to one person, thing, or area than to any others.

example.ex: Millions of wild flowers colour the valleys, especially in April and May...
example.tran: 尤其是在四五月份，不计其数的野花盛开，山谷里一片绚烂色彩。

example.ex: Re-apply sunscreen every two hours, especially if you have been swimming.
example.tran: 每两个小时重新涂一次防晒油，尤其是在游泳的时候。

collins.def: You use especially to emphasize a characteristic or quality.

example.ex: Babies lose heat much faster than adults, and are especially vulnerable to the cold in their first month.
example.tran: 婴儿散热比成年人快得多，在出生后的头一个月特别容易感冒。

collins.tran: 突如其来的;急剧的;引人注目的
collins.def: A dramatic change or event happens suddenly and is very noticeable and surprising.

example.ex: A fifth year of drought is expected to have dramatic effects on the California economy...
example.tran: 第五年遭受旱灾预计会对加利福尼亚的经济产生巨大的影响。

example.ex: This policy has led to a dramatic increase in our prison populations.
example.tran: 这项政策已经让我们监狱的囚犯人数激增。

collins.tran: 激动人心的;引人注目的;令人印象深刻的
collins.def: A dramatic action, event, or situation is exciting and impressive.

example.ex: He witnessed many dramatic escapes as people jumped from as high as the fourth floor...
example.tran: 他目睹了许多人从五层高的楼上跳下来逃生的惊险场面。

example.ex: Their arrival was dramatic and exciting.
example.tran: 他们的到来令人激动不已，难以忘怀。

collins.tran: 戏剧的;有关戏剧的;戏剧学的
collins.def: You use dramatic to describe things connected with or relating to the theatre, drama, or plays.

example.ex: ...a dramatic arts major in college...
example.tran: 大学里戏剧艺术专业的学生

example.ex: I had no thoughts of making a dramatic film. I was working in documentary.
example.tran: 我没想过要拍一部剧情片，我正在拍一部纪录片。

collins.def: Duty is work that you have to do for your job.

example.ex: Staff must report for duty at their normal place of work...
example.tran: 职员必须在平时上班的地方签到。

example.ex: My duty is to look after the animals.
example.tran: 我的责任就是照看这些动物。

collins.def: Your duties are tasks which you have to do because they are part of your job.

example.ex: I carried out my duties conscientiously...
example.tran: 我一丝不苟地履行我的职责。

example.ex: He was relieved of his duties as presidential adviser.
example.tran: 他被撤销了总统顾问一职。

collins.def: If you say that something is your duty, you believe that you ought to do it because it is your responsibility.

example.ex: I consider it my duty to write to you and thank you.
example.tran: 我认为写信向你表达谢意是我的责任。

collins.def: Duties are taxes which you pay to the government on goods that you buy.

example.ex: Import duties still average 30%.
example.tran: 进口税的平均水平仍然在 30%。

example.ex: ...customs duties...
example.tran: 关税

collins.def: If someone such as a policeman or a nurse is off duty, they are not working. If someone is on duty, they are working.

example.ex: I'm off duty...
example.tran: 我下班了。

example.ex: Four officers were told to go off duty and rest at home...
example.tran: 四名官员已经被通知停职在家休整。

collins.def: A holiday is a period of time during which you relax and enjoy yourself away from home. People sometimes refer to their holiday as their holidays.

example.ex: I've just come back from a holiday in the United States...
example.tran: 我刚从美国度假回来。

example.ex: We rang Duncan to ask where he was going on holiday...
example.tran: 我们打电话给邓肯，问他要去哪里度假。

collins.def: A holiday is a day when people do not go to work or school because of a religious or national festival.

example.ex: New Year's Day is a public holiday throughout Britain...
example.tran: 元旦是全英国的公众假日。

example.ex: He invited her to spend the Fourth of July holiday at his summer home on Fire Island...
example.tran: 他邀请她去自己在法尔岛上的消夏寓所过美国独立纪念日。

collins.def: The holidays are the time when children do not have to go to school.

example.ex: ...the first day of the school holidays.
example.tran: 学校放假的第一天

collins.def: If you have a particular number of days' or weeks' holiday, you do not have to go to work for that number of days or weeks.

example.ex: Every worker will be entitled to four weeks' paid holiday a year.
example.tran: 每位工人每年都能享受4周的带薪休假。

collins.def: If you are holidaying in a place away from home, you are on holiday there.

example.ex: Sampling the local cuisine is one of the delights of holidaying abroad...
example.tran: 品尝当地菜肴是海外度假的乐趣之一。

example.ex: Vacant rooms on the campus were being used by holidaying families.
example.tran: 校园里的闲置宿舍住着一些度假的家庭。

collins.def: If something is secret, it is known about by only a small number of people, and is not told or shown to anyone else.

example.ex: Soldiers have been training at a secret location...
example.tran: 士兵们一直在一个秘密场所训练。

example.ex: The police have been trying to keep the documents secret.
example.tran: 警方一直设法将这些文件保密。

collins.def: A secret is a fact that is known by only a small number of people, and is not told to anyone else.

example.ex: I think he enjoyed keeping our love a secret...
example.tran: 我觉得他喜欢和我偷偷摸摸地谈恋爱。

example.ex: I didn't want anyone to know about it, it was my secret.
example.tran: 我不想任何人知道这件事，这是我的秘密。

collins.def: If you say that a particular way of doing things is the secret of achieving something, you mean that it is the best or only way to achieve it.

example.ex: The secret of success is honesty and fair dealing...
example.tran: 成功的秘诀在于诚实和公平交易。

example.ex: I learned something about writing. The secret is to say less than you need.
example.tran: 我学过一点写作方面的技巧，秘诀就是欲说还休。

collins.def: Something's secrets are the things about it which have never been fully explained.

example.ex: We have an opportunity now to really unlock the secrets of the universe...
example.tran: 我们现在有机会去真正解开宇宙的奥秘。

example.ex: The past is riddled with deep dark secrets.
example.tran: 过去承载了诸多不可告人的惊天秘密。

collins.def: If you do something in secret, you do it without anyone else knowing.

example.ex: Dan found out that I had been meeting my ex-boyfriend in secret.
example.tran: 丹发现我一直在跟前男友偷偷见面。

collins.def: If you say that someone can keep a secret, you mean that they can be trusted not to tell other people a secret that you have told them.

example.ex: Tom was utterly indiscreet, and could never keep a secret.
example.tran: 汤姆言语很不谨慎，什么时候也别想他守住秘密。

collins.def: If you make no secret of something, you tell others about it openly and clearly.

example.ex: His wife made no secret of her hatred for the formal occasions...
example.tran: 他的妻子公开表示厌恶那些礼节性的场合。

example.ex: Ministers are making no secret about their wish to buy American weapons.
example.tran: 部长们毫不隐瞒他们想要购买美国武器的愿望。

collins.tran: 伯父；叔叔；舅舅；姑父；姨父
collins.def: Someone's uncle is the brother of their mother or father, or the husband of their aunt.

example.ex: My uncle was the mayor of Memphis...
example.tran: 我伯父是孟菲斯市市长。

example.ex: A telegram from Uncle Fred arrived...
example.tran: 弗雷德舅舅发的一封电报来了。

means: （英国用以称呼法官、主教或某些男性贵族成员，表示尊敬）大人

collins.def: In Britain, a lord is a man who has a high rank in the nobility, for example an earl, a viscount, or a marquis.

example.ex: She married a lord and lives in this huge house in the Cotswolds...
example.tran: 她嫁给了一位勋爵，住在科茨沃尔德的这幢大房子里。

example.ex: A few days earlier he had received a telegram from Lord Lloyd.
example.tran: 几天前，他收到劳埃德勋爵发来的一封电报。

collins.tran: （在英国对法官、主教及某些男性贵族的尊称）阁下，大人
collins.def: In Britain, judges, bishops, and some male members of the nobility are addressed as 'my Lord'.

example.ex: My lord, I am instructed by my client to claim that the evidence has been tampered with.
example.tran: 法官大人，本人受当事人委托，主张此证据已被人篡改。

collins.tran: （用于英国某些高级官员的头衔）
collins.def: In Britain, Lord is used in the titles of some officials of very high rank.

example.ex: He was Lord Chancellor from 1970 until 1974.
example.tran: 他于1970年到1974年间出任大法官。

example.ex: ...Sir Brian Hutton, the Lord Chief Justice for Northern Ireland.
example.tran: 北爱尔兰首席法官布赖恩·赫顿爵士

collins.def: The Lords is the same as the House of Lords .

example.ex: It's very likely the bill will be defeated in the Lords.
example.tran: 该法案很可能会在上议院遭到否决。

collins.def: In former times, especially in medieval times, a lord was a man who owned land or property and who had power and authority over people.

example.ex: It was the home of the powerful lords of Baux.
example.tran: 这是权力显赫的波城领主的故居。

collins.def: In the Christian church, people refer to God and to Jesus Christ as the Lord .

example.ex: I know the Lord will look after him...
example.tran: 我知道上帝会眷顾他的。

example.ex: She prayed now. 'Lord, help me to find courage.'
example.tran: 她马上祈祷道：“上帝呀，请赐我勇气吧。”

collins.def: If you describe a man as the lord of a particular area, industry, or thing, you mean that he has total authority and power over it.

example.ex: A century ago the aristocracy were truly lords of the earth.
example.tran: 一个世纪之前，贵族阶层是绝对的统治者。

example.ex: ...the lords of the black market.
example.tran: 黑市大佬们

collins.tran: （表示吃惊、懊丧或不快）上帝呀！主呀！天哪！
collins.def: Lord is used in exclamations such as 'good Lord!' and 'oh Lord!' to express surprise, shock, frustration, or annoyance about something.

example.ex: 'Good lord, that's what he is: he's a policeman.'...
example.tran: “我的天哪，他原来是警察呀。”

example.ex: 'They didn't fire you for drinking, did they?' — 'Lord, no! I only drink beer, nowadays.'
example.tran: “他们不是因为你喝酒而开除你的吧？”——“天哪，当然不是！我现在只喝啤酒了。”

collins.tran: （强调强烈的情感或信念）众所周知
collins.def: You can say 'Lord knows' to emphasize something that you feel or believe very strongly.

example.ex: I've got to go home, but Lord knows I dread it.
example.tran: 我必须得回家了，不过是个人都知道我很怕回去。

collins.tran: （强调不知情）天晓得，鬼知道，谁知道
collins.def: You can say 'Lord knows' to emphasize that you do not know something.

example.ex: He would turn up at meetings, but Lord knows where he came from.
example.tran: 开会时他便会露面，但鬼知道他从哪里来。

collins.tran: 颐指气使；发号施令；指手画脚
collins.def: If someone lords it over you, they act in a way that shows that they think they are better than you, especially by giving lots of orders.

example.ex: Alex seemed to enjoy lording it over the three girls.
example.tran: 亚历克斯好像很喜欢对这3个丫头发号施令。

collins.def: A particular set-up is a particular system or way of organizing something.

example.ex: It appears to be an idyllic domestic set-up...
example.tran: 这似乎是一种田园诗般的家庭组成格局。

example.ex: I gradually got rather disillusioned with the whole setup of the university.
example.tran: 渐渐地，我对大学的整个体制感到相当失望。

collins.def: If you describe a situation as a set-up, you mean that people have planned it in order to deceive you or to make it look as if you have done something wrong.

example.ex: He was asked to pick somebody up and bring them to a party, not realizing it was a setup.
example.tran: 有人让他开车去接几个人来参加聚会，他并没有意识到这是个陷阱。

collins.def: The set-up of computer hardware or software is the process of installing it and making it ready to use.

example.ex: The worst part of the set-up is the poor instruction manual...
example.tran: 安装时最糟糕就是操作指南讲述不够清楚。

example.ex: ... the setup program.
example.tran: 安装程序

collins.def: If you realize that something is true, you become aware of that fact or understand it.

example.ex: As soon as we realised something was wrong, we moved the children away...
example.tran: 我们刚意识到有什么不对劲就把孩子转移了。

example.ex: People don't realize how serious this recession has actually been...
example.tran: 人们没有意识到这次经济衰退事实上有多严重。

collins.tran: （希望、心愿或恐惧）实现，成为现实，发生
collins.def: If your hopes, desires, or fears are realized, the things that you hope for, desire, or fear actually happen.

example.ex: Straightaway our worst fears were realised...
example.tran: 我们最恐惧的事情一下发生了。

example.ex: Those are our hopes; we are starting this clinical trial to investigate whether those hopes will be realised.
example.tran: 那些就是我们的希望；我们正在开展这些临床试验以调查那些希望是否可以实现。

collins.def: When someone realizes a design or an idea, they make or organize something based on that design or idea.

example.ex: Various textile techniques will be explored to realise design possibilities...
example.tran: 将尝试和探索纺织技巧来把这些设计变为现实。

example.ex: The kaleidoscopic quality of the book is brilliantly realised on stage.
example.tran: 该书包罗万象、精彩纷呈的特质在舞台上得到了精彩再现。

collins.def: If someone or something realizes their potential, they do everything they are capable of doing, because they have been given the opportunity to do so.

example.ex: The support systems to enable women to realize their potential at work are seriously inadequate...
example.tran: 使妇女在工作中发挥潜力的支持体系严重不足。

example.ex: I think probably that the laser has not realised the potential that was expected of it in that domain.
example.tran: 我想可能激光在那个领域并没有充分发挥其潜力。

collins.def: If something realizes a particular amount of money when it is sold, that amount of money is paid for it.

example.ex: A selection of correspondence from P G Wodehouse realised £ 1,232.
example.tran: P.G.沃德豪斯的书信选集卖了1,232英镑。

collins.def: If you tie two things together or tie them, you fasten them together with a knot.

example.ex: He tied the ends of the plastic bag together...
example.tran: 他把塑料袋的两头系在了一起。

example.ex: Mr Saunders tied her hands and feet.
example.tran: 桑德斯先生把她的手脚捆了起来。

collins.def: If you tie something or someone in a particular place or position, you put them there and fasten them using rope or string.

example.ex: He had tied the dog to one of the trees near the canal...
example.tran: 他把狗拴在了沟旁的一棵树上。

example.ex: He tied her hands behind her back.
example.tran: 他把她的双手绑在背后。

collins.def: If you tie a piece of string or cloth around something or tie something with a piece of string or cloth, you put the piece of string or cloth around it and fasten the ends together.

example.ex: She tied her scarf over her head...
example.tran: 她把头巾围在头上。

example.ex: Roll the meat and tie it with string...
example.tran: 把肉卷起来，用线捆扎牢。

collins.tran: 打(结或蝴蝶结)；将…打成(结或蝴蝶结)
collins.def: If you tie a knot or bow in something or tie something in a knot or bow, you fasten the ends together.

example.ex: He took a short length of rope and swiftly tied a slip knot...
example.tran: 他拿起一小截绳子，飞快地打了个活结。

example.ex: She tied a knot in her scarf...
example.tran: 她把围巾打了个结。

collins.def: When you tie something or when something ties, you close or fasten it using a bow or knot.

example.ex: He pulled on his heavy suede shoes and tied the laces.
example.tran: 他穿上厚厚的软皮鞋，系上鞋带。

example.ex: ...a long white thing around his neck that tied in front in a floppy bow.
example.tran: 他的脖子上围着个长长的白色的东西，在前面松松地打了个蝴蝶结

collins.def: A tie is a long narrow piece of cloth that is worn round the neck under a shirt collar and tied in a knot at the front. Ties are worn mainly by men.

example.ex: Jason had taken off his jacket and loosened his tie.
example.tran: 贾森已经脱下夹克，松开了领带。

collins.def: If one thing is tied to another or two things are tied, the two things have a close connection or link.

example.ex: Their cancers are not so clearly tied to radiation exposure...
example.tran: 他们的癌症是否和接触放射线有关还不太清楚。

example.ex: My social life and business life are closely tied.
example.tran: 我的社交生活和工作联系紧密。

collins.def: If you are tied to a particular place or situation, you are forced to accept it and cannot change it.

example.ex: They had children and were consequently tied to the school holidays...
example.tran: 他们有孩子，当然就受学校假期的束缚。

example.ex: I wouldn't like to be tied to catching the last train home.
example.tran: 我不想非得赶最后一趟列车回家。

collins.def: Ties are the connections you have with people or a place.

example.ex: Quebec has always had particularly close ties to France...
example.tran: 魁北克和法国一向关系特别紧密。

example.ex: I can't find any tie between her and the town...
example.tran: 我一点也看不出她和那个小镇有什么联系。

collins.def: Railroad ties are large heavy beams that support the rails of a railway track.
If two people tie in a competition or game or if they tie with each other, they have the same number of points or the same degree of success.

example.ex: Both teams had tied on points and goal difference...
example.tran: 两支队伍得分和净胜球都相当。

example.ex: Ronan Rafferty had tied with Frank Nobilo.
example.tran: 罗南·拉弗蒂和弗兰克·诺比洛打成了平局。

collins.def: In sport, a tie is a match that is part of a competition. The losers leave the competition and the winners go on to the next round.

example.ex: They'll meet the winners of the first round tie.
example.tran: 他们将迎战第一轮淘汰赛中的胜者。

collins.def: Nuclear means relating to the nuclei of atoms, or to the energy released when these nuclei are split or combined.

example.ex: ...a nuclear power station.
example.tran: 核电站

example.ex: ...nuclear energy.
example.tran: 核能

collins.def: Nuclear means relating to weapons that explode by using the energy released when the nuclei of atoms are split or combined.

example.ex: They rejected a demand for the removal of all nuclear weapons from UK soil.
example.tran: 他们拒绝了将所有核武器从英国国土上撤除的要求。

example.ex: ...nuclear testing.
example.tran: 核试验

collins.def: Your favourite thing or person of a particular type is the one you like most.

example.ex: ...a bottle of his favourite champagne...
example.tran: 一瓶他最喜爱的香槟

example.ex: Her favourite writer is Hans Christian Andersen.
example.tran: 她最喜爱的作家是安徒生。

collins.def: If you describe one person as the favourite of another, you mean that the second person likes the first person a lot and treats them with special kindness.

example.ex: ...Robert Carr, Earl of Somerset, a favourite of King James I...
example.tran: 罗伯特·卡尔——萨默塞特伯爵，国王詹姆斯一世的亲信

example.ex: The Prime Minister is no favourite of the tabloids.
example.tran: 首相可不受小报的待见。

collins.def: The favourite in a race or contest is the competitor that is expected to win. In a team game, the team that is expected to win is referred to as the favourites .

example.ex: The Belgian Cup has been won by the favourites F.C. Liege.
example.tran: 比利时杯被夺冠热门列日队夺得。

collins.def: Stone is a hard solid substance found in the ground and often used for building houses.

example.ex: He could not tell whether the floor was wood or stone...
example.tran: 他无法确定地板是木头的还是石头的。

example.ex: People often don't appreciate that marble is a natural stone.
example.tran: 人们经常不了解大理石是一种天然石料。

collins.def: A stone is a small piece of rock that is found on the ground.

example.ex: He removed a stone from his shoe...
example.tran: 他从鞋子里倒出一块石子。

example.ex: The crowd began throwing stones.
example.tran: 人群开始扔石块。

collins.tran: (作为宗教标志的)石碑;纪念碑
collins.def: A stone is a large piece of stone put somewhere in memory of a person or event, or as a religious symbol.

example.ex: The monument consists of a circle of gigantic stones.
example.tran: 该遗址由一圈巨大的石碑组成。

collins.tran: (表示观念或规则固定而不可改变)板上钉钉，铁板钉钉
collins.def: Stone is used in expressions such as set in stone and tablets of stone to suggest that an idea or rule is firm and fixed, and cannot be changed.

example.ex: He is merely throwing the idea forward for discussion, it is not cast in stone...
example.tran: 他只是提出这个观点供讨论，它还没板上钉钉。

example.ex: Scientific opinions are not carved on tablets of stone; they change over the years.
example.tran: 科学观点并非一成不变;它们随着时间而改变。

collins.def: You can refer to a jewel as a stone .

example.ex: ...a diamond ring with three stones.
example.tran: 镶有 3 颗钻石的戒指

collins.def: A stone is a small hard ball of minerals and other substances which sometimes forms in a person's kidneys or gall bladder.

example.ex: He had kidney stones.
example.tran: 他有肾结石。

collins.def: The stone in a plum, cherry, or other fruit is the large hard seed in the middle of it.
If you stone a fruit, you remove its stone.

example.ex: Then stone the fruit and process the plums to a puree.
example.tran: 然后去核再将李子加工成糊状。

collins.def: If people stone someone or something, they throw stones at them.

example.ex: Youths burned cars and stoned police...
example.tran: 年轻人烧汽车，并向警察扔石头。

example.ex: A post office was set on fire and vehicles were stoned by looters.
example.tran: 抢劫犯放火烧了一家邮局，并用石头砸车。

collins.tran: 英石(重量单位，相当于 14 磅或6.35公斤)
collins.def: A stone is a measurement of weight, especially the weight of a person, equal to 14 pounds or 6.35 kilograms.

example.ex: I weighed around 16 stone.
example.tran: 我体重约为16英石。

collins.def: If you say that one place is a stone's throw from another, you mean that the places are close to each other.

example.ex: ...a two-bedroom apartment just a stone's throw from the beach...
example.tran: 离海滩只有几步之遥的一套两居室公寓

example.ex: Just a stone's throw away is the City Art Gallery.
example.tran: 不远处就是市美术馆。

collins.tran: 挖空心思;千方百计;用尽一切手段
collins.def: If you say that you will leave no stone unturned, you are emphasizing that you will try every way you can think of in order to achieve what you want.

example.ex: He said he would leave no stone unturned in the search for peace.
example.tran: 他说他会尽一切努力去寻求和平。

collins.def: Smoke consists of gas and small bits of solid material that are sent into the air when something burns.

example.ex: A cloud of black smoke blew over the city...
example.tran: 一团黑烟吹过城市的上空。

example.ex: The air was thick with cigarette smoke.
example.tran: 空气里充斥着浓浓的烟味。

collins.def: If something is smoking, smoke is coming from it.

example.ex: The chimney was smoking fiercely.
example.tran: 烟囱里浓烟滚滚。

example.ex: ...a pile of smoking rubble.
example.tran: 一堆冒着烟的瓦砾

collins.def: When someone smokes a cigarette, cigar, or pipe, they suck the smoke from it into their mouth and blow it out again. If you smoke, you regularly smoke cigarettes, cigars, or a pipe.

example.ex: He was sitting alone, smoking a big cigar...
example.tran: 他独自坐在那儿，抽着一只大雪茄。

example.ex: It's not easy to quit smoking cigarettes...
example.tran: 戒烟并非易事。

collins.def: If fish or meat is smoked, it is hung over burning wood so that the smoke preserves it and gives it a special flavour.

example.ex: ...the grid where the fish were being smoked.
example.tran: 熏鱼用的格栅

example.ex: ...smoked bacon.
example.tran: 熏咸肉

collins.def: If someone says there's no smoke without fire or where there's smoke there's fire, they mean that there are rumours or signs that something is true so it must be at least partly true.

collins.tran: 被焚毁;被烧掉;被付之一炬
collins.def: If something goes up in smoke, it is destroyed by fire.

example.ex: More than 900 years of British history went up in smoke in the Great Fire of Windsor.
example.tran: 900 多年的英国历史在温莎城堡的一场大火中灰飞烟灭。

collins.def: If something that is very important to you goes up in smoke, it fails or ends without anything being achieved.

example.ex: Their dreams went up in smoke after the collapse of their travel agency.
example.tran: 他们的旅行社倒闭之后，他们的梦想也随之破灭了。

collins.def: A program is a set of instructions that a computer follows in order to perform a particular task.

example.ex: The chances of an error occurring in a computer program increase with the size of the program.
example.tran: 计算机程序越长，出错的概率也越大。

collins.def: When you program a computer, you give it a set of instructions to make it able to perform a particular task.

example.ex: He programmed his computer to compare all the possible combinations.
example.tran: 他给他的计算机编制了一套程序，以比较所有可能的组合。

example.ex: ...45 million people, about half of whom can program their own computers.
example.tran: 4,500万人中约有半数可以给他们自己的计算机编制程序

collins.def: Wound is the past tense and past participle of wind 2 .

means: （指成年女子，有些人尤其是长者认为这样说比较礼貌）女士
（在英国对女贵族或贵族成员的妻子女儿或爵士妻子的称呼）夫人
举止文雅且有教养的女子

collins.tran: （尤为表示礼貌或尊敬的指称）女士；女子
collins.def: You can use lady when you are referring to a woman, especially when you are showing politeness or respect.

example.ex: She's a very sweet old lady...
example.tran: 她是一位很和蔼的老太太。

example.ex: Shall we rejoin the ladies?
example.tran: 咱们和女士们会合吧？

collins.def: You can say 'ladies' when you are addressing a group of women in a formal and respectful way.

example.ex: Your table is ready, ladies, if you'd care to come through...
example.tran: 你们的桌位已经准备好了，女士们，请跟我来。

example.ex: Good afternoon, ladies and gentlemen.
example.tran: 下午好，女士们，先生们。

collins.tran: （尤指旧时上层阶级的）贵妇，夫人，小姐
collins.def: A lady is a woman from the upper classes, especially in former times.

example.ex: ...the Empress and ladies of the Imperial Palace...
example.tran: 皇后与皇宫里的贵妇们

example.ex: Our governess was told to make sure we knew how to talk like English ladies.
example.tran: 要求家庭女教师教会我们英国贵妇般的谈吐。

collins.tran: （在英国用作对女贵族或爵士妻子的称谓）夫人，小姐
collins.def: In Britain, Lady is a title used in front of the names of some female members of the nobility, or the wives of knights.

example.ex: Cockburn's arrival coincided with that of Sir Iain and Lady Noble...
example.tran: 科伯恩到时正好伊恩爵士和诺布尔夫人也来了。

example.ex: My dear Lady Mary, how very good to see you.
example.tran: 亲爱的玛丽夫人，见到您真是太高兴了。

collins.def: If you say that a woman is a lady, you mean that she behaves in a polite, dignified, and graceful way.

example.ex: His wife was great as well, beautiful-looking and a real lady...
example.tran: 他妻子也很招人喜欢，样子俏丽，是位真正的淑女。

example.ex: A lady always sits quietly with her hands in her lap.
example.tran: 淑女端坐时总是双手放在膝上，不发一言。

collins.def: People sometimes refer to a public toilet for women as the ladies .

example.ex: At Temple station, Charlotte rushed into the Ladies.
example.tran: 一到坦普尔站，夏洛特立即冲进了女厕所。

collins.tran: （尤用于商店里或街上男子对不相识女子的称谓）女士，小姐
collins.def: 'Lady' is sometimes used by men as a form of address when they are talking to a woman that they do not know, especially in shops and in the street.

example.ex: What seems to be the trouble, lady?...
example.tran: 您遇到什么麻烦了吗，小姐？

example.ex: As she left the litter-strewn lot, an angry voice called out to her. 'Hey, lady!'
example.tran: 她正要离开满地垃圾的停车场，一个愤怒的声音朝她大嚷：“喂，小姐！”

collins.def: A person's or organization's income is the money that they earn or receive, as opposed to the money that they have to spend or pay out.

example.ex: Many families on low incomes will be unable to afford to buy their own home...
example.tran: 许多低收入家庭将会买不起自己的房子。

example.ex: To cover its costs, the company will need an annual income of £5 million...
example.tran: 公司年收入需要达到500万英镑才能收支平衡。

collins.def: If you prefer someone or something, you like that person or thing better than another, and so you are more likely to choose them if there is a choice.

example.ex: Does he prefer a particular sort of music?...
example.tran: 他有特别喜欢的音乐吗？

example.ex: I became a teacher because I preferred books and people to politics...
example.tran: 我当了老师，因为我更喜欢书本和人而不是权术。

collins.def: Fully means to the greatest degree or extent possible.

example.ex: She was fully aware of my thoughts...
example.tran: 她完全清楚我的想法。

example.ex: I don't fully agree with that.
example.tran: 对此我并不完全同意。

collins.def: You use fully to say that a process is completely finished.

example.ex: He had still not fully recovered.
example.tran: 他还没有完全康复。

collins.def: If you describe, answer, or deal with something fully, you leave out nothing that should be mentioned or dealt with.

example.ex: Fiers promised to testify fully and truthfully...
example.tran: 菲耶尔承诺所作证词将毫无保留且句句属实。

example.ex: Major elements of these debates are discussed more fully later in this book.
example.tran: 这些争论的主要内容将在本书后面的章节中更为充分地加以讨论。

collins.tran: (用于强调数量)整整，足足，至少
collins.def: Fully is used to emphasize how great an amount is.

example.ex: Fully 30% of the poor could not even afford access to illegal shanties.
example.tran: 足足有 30%的贫困人口甚至连非法窝棚都住不起。

collins.def: A summit is a meeting at which the leaders of two or more countries discuss important matters.

example.ex: ...next week's Washington summit.
example.tran: 下周的华盛顿峰会

example.ex: ...the NATO summit meeting in Rome.
example.tran: 在罗马举行的北约峰会

collins.def: The summit of a mountain is the top of it.

example.ex: Snow gleamed on the summit of Mount Simon.
example.tran: 西蒙山山顶白雪皑皑。

means: 成为拍照对象，在照片上显得

collins.def: A photograph is a picture that is made using a camera.

example.ex: He wants to take some photographs of the house...
example.tran: 他想给这幢房子拍一些照片。

example.ex: Her photograph appeared on the front page of The New York Times.
example.tran: 她的照片登在了《纽约时报》的头版上。

collins.def: When you photograph someone or something, you use a camera to obtain a picture of them.

example.ex: She photographed the children...
example.tran: 她给孩子们拍了照。

example.ex: I hate being photographed...
example.tran: 我讨厌照相。

means: 克制的，稳重的，不张扬的

collins.tran: 轻声的;安静的；静悄悄的
collins.def: Someone or something that is quiet makes only a small amount of noise.

example.ex: Tania kept the children reasonably quiet and contented...
example.tran: 塔妮娅把孩子们哄得安安静静而又心满意足。

example.ex: A quiet murmur passed through the classroom...
example.tran: 一阵悄悄的低语声传遍了整个教室。

collins.def: If a place is quiet, there is very little noise there.

example.ex: She was received in a small, quiet office...
example.tran: 她在一个安静的小办公室里受到接待。

example.ex: The street was unnaturally quiet.
example.tran: 街上安静得有些异常。

collins.tran: (地方、环境、时光)安宁的，清静的，平静的，宁静的
collins.def: If a place, situation, or time is quiet, there is no excitement, activity, or trouble.

example.ex: ...a quiet rural backwater...
example.tran: 平静而与世隔绝的农村地区

example.ex: It is very quiet without him...
example.tran: 他不在的时候这里非常清静。

collins.def: Quiet is silence.

example.ex: He called for quiet and announced that the next song was in our honor...
example.tran: 他叫大家安静，然后宣布下一首歌要送给我们。

example.ex: Jeremy wants some peace and quiet before his big match.
example.tran: 杰里米希望在大赛来临之前能享受到些许平静和安宁。

collins.tran: 沉默的；不出声的;一言不发的
collins.def: If you are quiet, you are not saying anything.

example.ex: I told them to be quiet and go to sleep...
example.tran: 我叫他们不要说话，马上睡觉。

example.ex: I just went quiet, embarrassed, and couldn't answer...
example.tran: 我一下子收了声，红了脸，答不出话来。

collins.tran: (感情)不外露的，不张扬的，内敛的，含蓄的
collins.def: If you refer, for example, to someone's quiet confidence or quiet despair, you mean that they do not say much about the way they are feeling.

example.ex: He has a quiet confidence in his ability...
example.tran: 他对自己胸有成竹，但却并不张扬。

example.ex: All through his life he has shown a quiet determination to get things done.
example.tran: 他一生都在默默而坚定地做事。

collins.def: You describe activities as quiet when they happen in secret or in such a way that people do not notice them.

example.ex: The Swedes had sought his freedom through quiet diplomacy...
example.tran: 瑞典人通过秘密的外交手段来争取他的自由。

example.ex: Then it was back to the house for a quiet celebration...
example.tran: 然后就回到房子里悄悄地庆祝一番。

collins.tran: 温和的;文静的;不易激动(或动怒)的
collins.def: A quiet person behaves in a calm way and is not easily made angry or upset.

example.ex: He's a nice quiet man.
example.tran: 他是一个温和友善的人。

collins.tran: (颜色、服饰)素净的，朴素大方的
collins.def: You describe colours or clothes as quiet when they are not bright or not very noticeable.

example.ex: They dress in quiet colors so as not to call attention to themselves.
example.tran: 为了避免别人注目，他们穿得很朴素。

collins.def: If someone or something quiets or if you quiet them, they become less noisy, less active, or silent.

example.ex: The wind dropped and the sea quieted...
example.tran: 风势减弱了，海面平静下来。

example.ex: Estela started to say something but a gesture from her husband quieted her at once.
example.tran: 埃丝特拉正要说些什么，但是看到丈夫的一个手势，马上就不说话了。

collins.tran: 消除，减轻(恐惧);平息(抱怨)
collins.def: To quiet fears or complaints means to persuade people that there is no good reason for them.

example.ex: Music seemed to quiet her anxiety and loneliness.
example.tran: 音乐似乎能够减轻她的焦虑和孤独。

collins.def: If someone does not go quietly, they do not leave a particular job or a place without complaining or resisting.

example.ex: She's not going to go quietly.
example.tran: 她不会乖乖离开的。

collins.def: If you keep quiet about something or keep something quiet, you do not say anything about it.

example.ex: I told her to keep quiet about it...
example.tran: 我告诉她此事要保密。

example.ex: I think I found it easier than Nell to keep our engagement quiet.
example.tran: 我觉得，我比内尔更容易守得住我们订婚的秘密。

collins.def: If something is done on the quiet, it is done secretly or in such a way that people do not notice it.

example.ex: She'd promised to give him driving lessons, on the quiet, when no one could see.
example.tran: 她已经保证要在别人看不见的时候私下教他开车。

collins.tran: 迷(尤指对某位名人或某项体育运动极为喜爱和感兴趣的人)
collins.def: If you are a fan of someone or something, especially a famous person or a sport, you like them very much and are very interested in them.

example.ex: If you're a Billy Crystal fan, you'll love this movie...
example.tran: 如果你是比利·克里斯托的影迷，你会喜爱这部影片。

example.ex: As a boy he was a Manchester United fan...
example.tran: 小时候，他是曼联队的球迷。

collins.def: A fan is a flat object that you hold in your hand and wave in order to move the air and make yourself feel cooler.
If you fan yourself or your face when you are hot, you wave a fan or other flat object in order to make yourself feel cooler.

example.ex: She would have to wait in the truck, fanning herself with a piece of cardboard...
example.tran: 她只得在卡车里等着，用一块纸板给自己扇风。

example.ex: Mo kept bringing me out refreshments and fanning me as it was that hot.
example.tran: 天气太热了，莫不停地给我拿饮料出来，还拿扇子给我扇风。

collins.def: A fan is a piece of electrical or mechanical equipment with blades that go round and round. It keeps a room or machine cool or gets rid of unpleasant smells.

example.ex: He cools himself in front of an electric fan.
example.tran: 他在电扇前让自己凉快些。
