example.ex: ...an extractor fan.
example.tran: 排风扇

collins.def: You can describe anything that has the shape of a wide 'V' with a curved part above it as a fan .

example.ex: ...its fan of tail feathers.
example.tran: 它扇形的尾羽

example.ex: ...a conservatory with an ornate fan-shaped roof.
example.tran: 有华丽扇形屋顶的温室

collins.def: If you fan a fire, you wave something flat next to it in order to make it burn more strongly. If a wind fans a fire, it blows on it and makes it burn more strongly.

example.ex: Kneeling in front of the open hearth, old Maria was fanning the smoldering fire...
example.tran: 老玛丽亚跪在壁炉前的空地上，扇着闷燃的炉火。

example.ex: During the afternoon, hot winds fan the flames.
example.tran: 下午，热风使火苗越燃越旺。

collins.tran: (故意)煽动，激发(恐惧、仇恨、热情等)
collins.def: If someone fans an emotion such as fear, hatred, or passion, they deliberately do things to make people feel the emotion more strongly.

example.ex: He said students were fanning social unrest with their violent protests.
example.tran: 他说学生们的暴力抗议会煽动起社会动乱。

example.ex: ...economic problems which often fan hatred.
example.tran: 那些常常煽起仇恨的经济问题

collins.def: If a group of people or things fan out, they move forwards away from a particular point in different directions.

example.ex: The main body of British, American, and French troops had fanned out to the west...
example.tran: 英、美、法部队的主力已经向西面散开。

example.ex: We fanned out from the farmhouse in twos and threes.
example.tran: 我们三三两两从农舍散去。

collins.tran: (使)展开(或打开)成圆形(或半圆形)
collins.def: If something fans out, or if you fan it out, it spreads out or opens out into the shape of a circle or half circle.

example.ex: She suddenly raised her arms and spun, so the dress's full skirt fanned out in a bright circle...
example.tran: 她突然举起双臂旋转起来，连衣裙的裙身呈圆形完全展开，明艳照人。

example.ex: Korontzis picked up his hand slowly and fanned out the cards one by one...
example.tran: 科龙奇斯慢慢抬起手，一张一张地把牌展开。

collins.def: The border between two countries or regions is the dividing line between them. Sometimes the border also refers to the land close to this line.

example.ex: They fled across the border.
example.tran: 他们穿越边界逃走了。

example.ex: ...the isolated jungle area near the Panamanian border...
example.tran: 靠近巴拿马边境的偏僻丛林地区

collins.def: A country that borders another country, a sea, or a river is next to it.

example.ex: ...the European and Arab countries bordering the Mediterranean.
example.tran: 地中海沿岸的欧洲和阿拉伯国家

collins.def: A border is a strip or band around the edge of something.

example.ex: ...pillowcases trimmed with a hand-crocheted border.
example.tran: 饰有手工编织花边的枕套

collins.def: In a garden, a border is a long strip of ground along the edge planted with flowers.

example.ex: ...a lawn flanked by wide herbaceous borders.
example.tran: 两侧栽种大片草本花的草坪

example.ex: ...border plants.
example.tran: 花带里的植物

collins.def: If something is bordered by another thing, the other thing forms a line along the edge of it.

example.ex: ... the mile of white sand beach bordered by palm trees and tropical flowers
example.tran: 四周种有棕榈树和热带花卉的长达1英里的白色沙滩

example.ex: Caesar marched north into the forests that border the Danube River.
example.tran: 恺撒挥师北上，深入到多瑙河沿岸的森林地带。

collins.def: A career is the job or profession that someone does for a long period of their life.

example.ex: She is now concentrating on a career as a fashion designer...
example.tran: 她目前正专注于服装设计师的工作。

example.ex: Dennis had recently begun a successful career conducting opera.
example.tran: 丹尼斯最近开始从事歌剧指挥的工作,并且非常成功。

collins.def: Your career is the part of your life that you spend working.

example.ex: During his career, he wrote more than fifty plays...
example.tran: 在他的创作生涯中,他写下了50多部剧本。

example.ex: She began her career as a teacher.
example.tran: 她开始了自己的教师生涯。

collins.def: Careers advice or guidance in British English, or career advice or guidance in American English, consists of information about different jobs and help with deciding what kind of job you want to do.

example.ex: She received very little careers guidance when young...
example.tran: 她年轻时基本没有接受过就业指导。

example.ex: Get hold of the company list from your careers advisory service.
example.tran: 到就业指导处领取企业名录。

collins.def: If a person or vehicle careers somewhere, they move fast and in an uncontrolled way.

example.ex: His car careered into a river...
example.tran: 他的车一头冲入河里。

example.ex: He went careering off down the track.
example.tran: 他控制不住，冲出了赛道。

collins.def: The eighteenth item in a series is the one that you count as number eighteen.

example.ex: The siege is now in its eighteenth day.
example.tran: 围困今天已经进入第18天了。

collins.def: You use sometimes to say that something happens on some occasions rather than all the time.

example.ex: During the summer, my skin sometimes gets greasy...
example.tran: 夏天我的皮肤有时候会出油。

example.ex: Sometimes I think he dislikes me...
example.tran: 有时候，我觉得他不喜欢我。

collins.def: If you reduce something, you make it smaller in size or amount, or less in degree.

example.ex: It reduces the risks of heart disease...
example.tran: 这降低了患心脏病的风险。

example.ex: Consumption is being reduced by 25 per cent...
example.tran: 消费下降了25个百分点。

collins.tran: 使沦为，使陷入（不好的境地）
collins.def: If someone is reduced to a weaker or inferior state, they become weaker or inferior as a result of something that happens to them.

example.ex: They were reduced to extreme poverty...
example.tran: 他们陷入极端贫困的状态。

example.ex: They wanted the army reduced to a police force.
example.tran: 他们想把这支队伍降级为一支警察部队。

collins.tran: 迫使;使不得不（做）；使只得
collins.def: If you say that someone is reduced to doing something, you mean that they have to do it, although it is unpleasant or embarrassing.

example.ex: He was reduced to begging for a living.
example.tran: 他不得不以乞讨为生。

collins.def: If something is changed to a different or less complicated form, you can say that it is reduced to that form.

example.ex: All the buildings in the town have been reduced to rubble...
example.tran: 城里所有的建筑都成了废墟。

example.ex: Politics has been reduced to class struggle.
example.tran: 政治变成了阶级斗争。

collins.def: If you reduce liquid when you are cooking, or if it reduces, it is boiled in order to make it less in quantity and thicker.

example.ex: Boil the liquid in a small saucepan to reduce it by half...
example.tran: 用小炖锅炖，收一半汤汁。

example.ex: Simmer until mixture reduces.
example.tran: 用小火煮到汤汁收浓。

collins.def: If you say that someone is living in reduced circumstances, you mean that they do not have as much money as they used to have.

example.ex: They are the descendants of emperors and kings and are now living in reduced circumstances.
example.tran: 他们是帝王的后代，但是现在境况大不如前了。

collins.def: If someone or something reduces you to silence, they make you feel so upset or confused that you cannot speak.

example.ex: Her challenge reduced them to silence.
example.tran: 她的质问让他们哑口无言。

collins.def: If someone or something reduces you to tears, they make you feel so unhappy that you cry.

example.ex: The attentions of the media reduced her to tears.
example.tran: 媒体的关注把她弄哭了。

collins.def: Someone who is happy has feelings of pleasure, usually because something nice has happened or because they feel satisfied with their life.

example.ex: Marina was a confident, happy child...
example.tran: 玛丽娜是个自信、快乐的孩子。

example.ex: I'm just happy to be back running...
example.tran: 我很高兴能重新回到跑道上。

collins.tran: （时光、地点或关系）令人愉快的，幸福的
collins.def: A happy time, place, or relationship is full of happy feelings and pleasant experiences, or has an atmosphere in which people feel happy.

example.ex: Except for her illnesses, she had had a particularly happy childhood...
example.tran: 除了体弱多病外，她的童年特别幸福。

example.ex: It had always been a happy place...
example.tran: 这里从前一直是个令人愉快的地方。

collins.tran: （对情况或安排）满意的，放心的
collins.def: If you are happy about a situation or arrangement, you are satisfied with it, for example because you think that something is being done in the right way.

example.ex: If you are not happy about a repair, go back and complain...
example.tran: 如果你对修理效果不满意，可以再找他们投诉。

example.ex: He's happy that I deal with it myself...
example.tran: 我自己把事情解决了，对此他很满意。

collins.def: If you say you are happy to do something, you mean that you are very willing to do it.

example.ex: I'll be happy to answer any questions if there are any...
example.tran: 如果有问题，我很乐意回答。

example.ex: That's a risk I'm happy to take.
example.tran: 我愿意冒这个险。

collins.def: Happy is used in greetings and other conventional expressions to say that you hope someone will enjoy a special occasion.

example.ex: Happy Birthday!...
example.tran: 生日快乐！

example.ex: Happy Easter!
example.tran: 复活节快乐！

collins.def: A happy coincidence is one that results in something pleasant or helpful happening.

example.ex: By happy coincidence, Robert met Richard and Julia and discovered they were experiencing similar problems.
example.tran: 幸运的是，罗伯特碰巧遇到了理查德和朱莉娅，发现原来他们也碰到了类似的问题。

collins.def: If something has variety, it consists of things which are different from each other.

example.ex: Susan's idea of freedom was to have variety in her life style...
example.tran: 苏珊心目中的自由就是拥有丰富多彩的生活。

example.ex: I know no store anywhere in the world that has such variety and display...
example.tran: 我不知道世界上还有哪个商店的经营品种如此繁多，陈列如此美观。

collins.def: A variety of things is a number of different kinds or examples of the same thing.

example.ex: West Hampstead has a variety of good shops and supermarkets...
example.tran: 西汉普斯特德有各种各样不错的店铺和超级市场。

example.ex: The island offers such a wide variety of scenery and wildlife...
example.tran: 这个岛屿拥有丰富多样的景致及种类繁多的野生动植物。

collins.def: A variety of something is a type of it.

example.ex: I'm always pleased to try out a new variety...
example.tran: 我一直乐于尝试新产品。

example.ex: She has 12 varieties of old-fashioned roses.
example.tran: 她有12种双花玫瑰。

collins.def: Variety is a type of entertainment which includes many different kinds of acts in the same show.

example.ex: ...a variety show of music, comedy, and magic.
example.tran: 汇集了音乐、喜剧及魔术表演的一档综艺节目

collins.tran: 经销；代理；经销店；代理公司
collins.def: An agency is a business which provides a service on behalf of other businesses.

example.ex: We had to hire maids through an agency.
example.tran: 我们得通过中介雇用女佣。

example.ex: ...a successful advertising agency.
example.tran: 一家成功的广告代理公司

collins.tran: （政府的）局，处，署，专业行政部门
collins.def: An agency is a government organization responsible for a certain area of administration.

example.ex: ...the government agency which monitors health and safety at work in Britain...
example.tran: 英国负责劳工医疗和安全的部门

example.ex: Webster is retiring as head of the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA).
example.tran: 韦伯斯特即将从中央情报局局长的位子上退职。

collins.tran: 宏伟的；壮丽的；富丽堂皇的
collins.def: If you describe a building or a piece of scenery as grand, you mean that its size or appearance is very impressive.

example.ex: ...this grand building in the center of town...
example.tran: 这幢位于市中心的宏伟建筑

example.ex: The scenery of South Island is on a grand scale.
example.tran: 南岛风光壮观秀丽。

collins.def: Grand plans or actions are intended to achieve important results.

example.ex: Critics will point to other grand schemes that have gone less well, such as Sheffield's World Student Games disaster...
example.tran: 批评家将会指出其他一些并不成功的大项目，比如谢菲尔德世界大学生运动会这一败笔。

example.ex: The grand design of Europe's  monetary union is already agreed.
example.tran: 欧洲统一货币的宏伟构想已经获得认同。

collins.def: People who are grand think they are important or socially superior.

example.ex: He is grander and even richer than the Prince of Wales...
example.tran: 他比威尔士亲王还牛气，甚至更有钱。

example.ex: The Duke of Clarence will be there, and many of your grander friends.
example.tran: 克拉伦斯公爵将会到场，还有你许多牛不可及的朋友亦将出席。

collins.tran: 快乐的；令人非常愉快的
collins.def: If you describe an activity or experience as grand, you mean that it is very pleasant and enjoyable.

example.ex: Few museums could rival the Old Royal Observatory at Greenwich for a grand day out...
example.tran: 若想找个地儿开心地逛一天，没有哪家博物馆能比得上格林尼治皇家天文台。

example.ex: The dinner was a grand success...
example.tran: 晚宴办得十分成功。

collins.tran: 了不起的；出色的；极好的
collins.def: You can describe someone or something as grand when you admire or approve of them very much.

example.ex: He was a grand bloke.
example.tran: 他非常了不起。

collins.def: A grand total is one that is the final amount or the final result of a calculation.

example.ex: It came to a grand total of £20,329.

collins.tran: （常用于大型建筑物的名称前）大的
collins.def: Grand is often used in the names of buildings such as hotels, especially when they are very large.

example.ex: They stayed at The Grand Hotel, Budapest.
example.tran: 他们住在布达佩斯大饭店。

collins.def: A grand is a thousand dollars or a thousand pounds.

example.ex: They're paying you ten grand now for those adaptations of old plays.
example.tran: 他们打算付你一万美元作为改编老剧本的报酬。

collins.def: A grand is the same as a grand piano .
A prince is a male member of a royal family, especially the son of the king or queen of a country.

example.ex: ...Prince Edward and other royal guests...
example.tran: 爱德华王子和其他皇室宾客

example.ex: The Prince won warm applause for his ideas.
example.tran: 王子的想法赢得了热烈的掌声。

collins.def: A prince is the male royal ruler of a small country or state.

example.ex: He was speaking without the prince's authority.
example.tran: 他说话的时候没有君王的威严。

collins.def: If someone describes a man as the prince of a particular type of work, they mean that he is the best man doing that type of work.

example.ex: To his 19th-century peers, Robert Brown was the prince of botany.
example.tran: 对于19世纪的同行来说，罗伯特·布朗是植物学巨匠。

collins.def: You can refer to a child as a kid .

example.ex: They've got three kids...
example.tran: 他们有3个孩子。

example.ex: All the kids in my class could read.
example.tran: 我们班所有的孩子都能阅读。

collins.def: Young people who are no longer children are sometimes referred to as kids .

example.ex: There were gangs of kids on motorbikes roaming around...
example.tran: 过去有成群结队的年轻人骑着摩托车四处游荡。

example.ex: That's a lot for a kid of 22 to cope with.
example.tran: 那对一个22岁的年轻人来说是够难应付的。

collins.def: You can refer to your younger brother as your kid brother and your younger sister as your kid sister.

example.ex: My kid sister woke up and started crying.
example.tran: 我妹妹醒了，哭了起来。

collins.def: A kid is a young goat.
If you are kidding, you are saying something that is not really true, as a joke.

example.ex: I'm not kidding, Frank. There's a cow out there, just standing around...
example.tran: 我没有开玩笑，弗兰克。外面有一头母牛，就站在附近。

example.ex: I'm just kidding...
example.tran: 我只是开玩笑。

collins.def: If you kid someone, you tease them.

example.ex: He liked to kid Ingrid a lot...
example.tran: 他很喜欢捉弄英格丽德。

example.ex: He used to kid me about being chubby.
example.tran: 他过去常取笑我胖。

collins.def: If people kid themselves, they allow themselves to believe something that is not true because they wish that it was true.

example.ex: We're kidding ourselves, Bill. We're not winning, we're not even doing well...
example.tran: 我们在自己骗自己，比尔。我们没有赢，我们甚至都没有发挥好。

example.ex: I could kid myself that you did this for me, but it would be a lie.
example.tran: 我可以欺骗自己你这样做是为了我，但那终究是谎言。

collins.tran: （强调所说的是真实的或是认真的）真的，不是开玩笑
collins.def: You can say 'No kidding' to emphasize that what you are saying is true, or that you mean it.

example.ex: I'm scared. No kidding, really.
example.tran: 我很害怕。不是开玩笑，真的。

collins.def: You can say 'No kidding?' to show that you are interested or surprised when someone tells you something.

example.ex: 'We won.' — 'No kidding?'
example.tran: “我们赢了。”——“真的吗？”

collins.tran: （表示认为某人所言极为荒唐或完全是假的）你一定是在开玩笑
collins.def: You can say 'you've got to be kidding' or 'you must be kidding' to someone if they have said something that you think is ridiculous or completely untrue.

example.ex: You've got to be kidding! I can't live here!...
example.tran: 你在开玩笑吧！我不可能住这儿！

example.ex: 'He's a mild inoffensive man isn't he? — Oh you've gotta be kidding.'
example.tran: “他是个温和、没有恶意的人，不是吗？”——“啊，你不是开玩笑吧。”

collins.tran: （表示认为某人不够真诚或不相信某人所言）她骗谁啊？/他想骗谁啊?
collins.def: You can say 'who is she kidding?' or 'who is he trying to kid?' if you think it is obvious that someone is not being sincere and does not mean what they say.

example.ex: She played the role of a meek, innocent, shy girl. I don't know who she was trying to kid...
example.tran: 她装作一个温顺、天真、害羞的女孩。真不知道她想骗谁。

example.ex: 'Maybe tomorrow will be better,' I said, hanging up. 'Who am I kidding?' I told Wolfe. 'Tomorrow will be more of the same.'
example.tran: “也许明天会更好，”我说着挂断了电话。“我在骗谁啊？”我对沃尔夫说。“明天还是一个样。”

means: （在意义、价值、效果、程度等方面）等于

collins.def: The amount of something is how much there is, or how much you have, need, or get.

example.ex: He needs that amount of money to survive...
example.tran: 他需要那样一笔钱以生存下去。

example.ex: I still do a certain amount of work for them...
example.tran: 我仍然为他们做一些工作。

collins.def: If something amounts to a particular total, all the parts of it add up to that total.

example.ex: Consumer spending on sports-related items amounted to £9.75 billion.
example.tran: 消费者在体育相关产品上的花费共计97.5亿英镑。

collins.def: If you say that there is any amount of something, there is a lot of it. If you say that there are any amount of people or things, there are many people or things.

example.ex: I'm able to lay my hands on any amount of cash at a minute's notice...
example.tran: 多少钱我都可以马上弄到。

example.ex: There are any amount of clubs you could join.
example.tran: 有无数个俱乐部你可以加入。

collins.def: An aspect of something is one of the parts of its character or nature.

example.ex: Climate and weather affect every aspect of our lives...
example.tran: 气候和天气影响着我们生活的方方面面。

example.ex: He was interested in all aspects of the work here...
example.tran: 他对这里工作的所有方面都感兴趣。

collins.def: The aspect of a building or window is the direction in which it faces.

example.ex: The house had a south-west aspect.
example.tran: 这幢房子面向西南。

collins.def: If something begins to have a new aspect, it begins to have a new appearance or quality.

example.ex: Our journey had taken on a new aspect. The countryside was no longer familiar...
example.tran: 我们所到之地呈现出一派新景象。乡村变得不再熟悉。

example.ex: The snowy street, like the church, assumed a dumb, lifeless aspect.
example.tran: 积雪覆盖的街道就像教堂一样，显得沉闷、毫无生气。

collins.def: In grammar, aspect is the way that a verb group shows whether an activity is continuing, is repeated, or is completed. For example, in 'They were laughing', the verb is in the progressive aspect and shows that the action was continuing.

means: 被拒绝或被抛弃的人或事物

collins.tran: 拒绝考虑;不接受;不同意
collins.def: If you reject something such as a proposal, a request, or an offer, you do not accept it or you do not agree to it.

example.ex: The British government is expected to reject the idea of state subsidy for a new high speed railway...
example.tran: 预计英国政府不会考虑为修建一条新的高速铁路提供国家补贴的设想。

example.ex: Seventeen publishers rejected the manuscript before Jenks saw its potential.
example.tran: 17家出版社回绝了这部手稿，直到詹克斯看到了它的潜在价值。

collins.tran: 摈弃，抛弃，不接受(信仰或政治制度)
collins.def: If you reject a belief or a political system, you refuse to believe in it or to live by its rules.

example.ex: ...the children of Eastern European immigrants who had rejected their parents' political and religious beliefs.
example.tran: 抛弃了父母一代政治和宗教信仰的东欧移民子女

collins.def: If someone is rejected for a job or course of study, it is not offered to them.

example.ex: One of my most able students was rejected by another university.
example.tran: 我的一个最有能力的学生申请另一所大学落选了。

collins.def: If someone rejects another person who expects affection from them, they are cold and unfriendly towards them.

example.ex: You make friends with people and then make unreasonable demands so that they reject you.
example.tran: 你和别人交朋友，然后向人家提出无理要求，结果被人家拒绝。

example.ex: ...people who had been rejected by their lovers.
example.tran: 被爱人拒绝的人

collins.tran: 排斥(移植器官)；对…产生排斥反应
collins.def: If a person's body rejects something such as a new heart that has been transplanted into it, it tries to attack and destroy it.

example.ex: It was feared his body was rejecting a kidney he received in a transplant four years ago.
example.tran: 令人担心的是，他的身体可能对4年前移植的肾产生了排斥反应。

collins.def: If a machine rejects a coin that you put in it, the coin comes out and the machine does not work.
A reject is a product that has not been accepted for use or sale, because there is something wrong with it.

collins.tran: 达到目的的;有成效的;成功的
collins.def: Something that is successful achieves what it was intended to achieve. Someone who is successful achieves what they intended to achieve.

example.ex: How successful will this new treatment be?...
example.tran: 这一新的疗法会有多大成效？

example.ex: I am looking forward to a long and successful partnership with him...
example.tran: 我期盼着能与他建立长期而有成效的合作关系。

collins.tran: 获得成功的;受欢迎的;获利匪浅的
collins.def: Something that is successful is popular or makes a lot of money.

example.ex: ...the hugely successful movie that brought Robert Redford an Oscar for his directing...
example.tran: 让罗伯特·雷德福拿到了奥斯卡最佳导演奖的大受欢迎的影片

example.ex: One of the keys to successful business is careful planning.
example.tran: 打造成功企业的关键之一就是要精心策划。

collins.def: Someone who is successful achieves a high position in what they do, for example in business or politics.

example.ex: Women do not necessarily have to imitate men to be successful in business...
example.tran: 女性不见得非要模仿男性才能在商界叱咤风云。

example.ex: She is a successful lawyer.
example.tran: 她是个成功的律师。

collins.def: If you fill a container or area, or if it fills, an amount of something enters it that is enough to make it full.

example.ex: Fill a saucepan with water and bring to a slow boil...
example.tran: 往平底锅里加满水,小火煮沸。

example.ex: She made sandwiches, filled a flask and put sugar in...
example.tran: 她做了三明治，把保温瓶灌满，又放了糖进去。

collins.def: If something fills a space, it is so big, or there are such large quantities of it, that there is very little room left.

example.ex: He cast his eyes at the rows of cabinets that filled the enormous work area...
example.tran: 他把目光投向那一排排挤占了巨大工作空间的柜子。

example.ex: The text fills 231 pages.
example.tran: 正文占了 231 页。

collins.def: If you fill a crack or hole, you put a substance into it in order to make the surface smooth again.

example.ex: Fill small holes with wood filler in a matching colour...
example.tran: 用颜色相配的木质填料填平小孔。

example.ex: The gravedigger filled the grave.
example.tran: 掘墓人把墓穴填上。

collins.def: If a sound, smell, or light fills a space, or the air, it is very strong or noticeable.

example.ex: In the parking lot of the school, the siren filled the air...
example.tran: 警报声响彻学校停车场。

example.ex: All the light bars were turned on which filled the room with these rotating beams of light...
example.tran: 所有灯条都打开了，满屋都是旋转的光柱。

collins.tran: 使强烈地感到;(感情)充盈于
collins.def: If something fills you with an emotion, or if an emotion fills you, you experience this emotion strongly.

example.ex: I admired my father, and his work filled me with awe and curiosity...
example.tran: 我很钦佩父亲，并对他的工作充满了敬畏和好奇。

example.ex: He looked at me without speaking, and for the first time I could see the pride that filled him...
example.tran: 他看着我没有说话，我第一次看出他内心充满了自豪。

collins.def: If you fill a period of time with a particular activity, you spend the time in this way.

example.ex: If she wants a routine to fill her day, let her do community work.
example.tran: 如果她想做些日常的事务来打发白天的时间，就让她去做社区工作吧。

collins.def: If something fills a need or a gap, it puts an end to this need or gap by existing or being active.

example.ex: ...properly organized and staffed day-care programs fill a need which allows family structures to remain intact...
example.tran: 组织得当、人员配备齐整的日托中心满足了人们的需求，保持了家庭结构不受破坏。

example.ex: She brought him a sense of fun, of gaiety that filled a gap in his life.
example.tran: 她带给他开心快乐，弥补了他生命中的缺憾。

collins.def: If something fills a role, position, or function, they have that role or position, or perform that function, often successfully.

example.ex: Dena was filling the role of diplomat's wife with the skill she had learned over the years.
example.tran: 德娜利用她多年来学到的处事技巧扮演着外交家妻子的角色。

collins.def: If a company or organization fills a job vacancy, they choose someone to do the job. If someone fills a job vacancy, they accept a job that they have been offered.

example.ex: One problem not mentioned is the unemployed may not have the skills to fill the vacancies on offer...
example.tran: 一个没有提及的问题是，失业人员也许缺乏填补所提供的空职的技能。

example.ex: A vacancy has arisen which I intend to fill.
example.tran: 有一个职位空了出来，我想要补上。

collins.def: If you fill yourself with food, you eat so much that you do not feel hungry.

example.ex: They joked and drank coffee and filled themselves with chocolate cake.
example.tran: 他们开着玩笑，喝着咖啡，尽情地吃着巧克力蛋糕。

collins.tran: 使爆满;使满座;使座无虚席
collins.def: A play, film, or performer that fills a theatre, concert hall, or cinema attracts a very large audience.

example.ex: Children are enthralled by his stories; he has been known to fill theatre halls in Australia.
example.tran: 孩子们为他的故事所着迷;众所周知他在澳大利亚总是场场爆满。

collins.def: When a dentist fills someone's tooth, he or she puts a filling in it.

example.ex: It is almost impossible to find a dentist who will fill a tooth on the National Health.
example.tran: 几乎不可能找到一位愿意接受国民医疗保健来补牙的医师。

collins.def: If you fill an order or a prescription, you provide the things that are asked for.

example.ex: A pharmacist can fill any prescription if, in his or her judgment, the prescription is valid.
example.tran: 只要药剂师认定处方有效就可按方配药。

collins.def: If you have had your fill of something, you have had enough of it, and do not want to experience it any more or do it any more.

example.ex: We feel that we have had our fill of disappointments and emotional upsets.
example.tran: 我们觉得已经受够了失望和情绪困扰。

collins.def: If you fill in a form or other document requesting information, you write information in the spaces on it.

example.ex: If you want your free copy of the Patients' Charter fill this form in...
example.tran: 如果想要一份免费的《病人约章》，就把这张表填一下。

example.ex: Fill in the coupon and send it first class to the address shown.
example.tran: 填写订单，并按一类邮件寄至注明的地址。

collins.def: If you fill in a shape, you cover the area inside the lines with colour or shapes so that none of the background is showing.

example.ex: When you have both filled in your patterns, you may want to share these with each other...
example.tran: 两人都把图案填好色后，不妨互相交换着看一下。

example.ex: With a lip pencil, outline lips and fill them in.
example.tran: 用唇线笔勾出双唇的轮廓，然后涂上唇膏。

collins.def: If you fill someone in, you give them more details about something that you know about.

example.ex: I didn't give Reid all the details yet — I'll fill him in...
example.tran: 我还没有告诉里德所有详情——我会讲给他听的。

example.ex: He filled her in on Wilbur Kantor's visit.
example.tran: 他告诉她威尔伯·坎特此行的详细经过。

collins.def: If you fill in for someone, you do the work or task that they normally do because they are unable to do it.

example.ex: Vice-presidents' wives would fill in for first ladies.
example.tran: 副总统夫人们将临时代替各位第一夫人。

collins.def: If you are filling in time, you are using time that is available by doing something that is not very important.

example.ex: That's not a career. She's just filling in time until she gets married.
example.tran: 那算不上什么事业，她只不过是在嫁人之前打发一下时间而已。

collins.def: If you fill out a form or other document requesting information, you write information in the spaces on it.

example.ex: Fill out the application carefully, and keep copies of it.
example.tran: 仔细填写申请表，并且保存副本。

collins.def: If a fairly thin person fills out, they become fatter.

example.ex: A girl may fill out before she reaches her full height.
example.tran: 女孩子在长足个头之前可能会发胖。

collins.def: If you fill up or fill yourself up with food, you eat so much that you do not feel hungry.

example.ex: Fill up on potatoes, bread and pasta, which are high in carbohydrate and low in fat...
example.tran: 用碳水化合物含量高、脂肪含量低的土豆、面包和意大利面食填饱肚子。

example.ex: When you are happy about yourself you won't need to fill yourself up with food.
example.tran: 一个人如果感觉舒心，就不必去胡吃海塞。

collins.def: A type of food that fills you up makes you feel that you have eaten a lot, even though you have only eaten a small amount.

example.ex: Potatoes fill us up without overloading us with calories.
example.tran: 吃土豆容易让我们有一种饱胀感，又不会摄入过多的热量。

collins.def: When you approach something, you get closer to it.

example.ex: He didn't approach the front door at once...
example.tran: 他没有马上走向前门。

example.ex: When I approached, they grew silent...
example.tran: 当我走近时，他们就不说话了。

collins.def: An approach to a place is a road, path, or other route that leads to it.

example.ex: The path serves as an approach to the boat house.
example.tran: 这条小路通往船屋。

collins.def: If you approach someone about something, you speak to them about it for the first time, often making an offer or request.

example.ex: When Chappel approached me about the job, my first reaction was of disbelief...
example.tran: 当查普尔为这份工作找我商量时，我的第一反应是不相信。

example.ex: He approached me to create and design the restaurant...
example.tran: 他请我建造并设计该饭店。

collins.def: When you approach a task, problem, or situation in a particular way, you deal with it or think about it in that way.

example.ex: The Bank has approached the issue in a practical way...
example.tran: 银行已经实际解决了这个问题。

example.ex: Employers are interested in how you approach problems.
example.tran: 雇主们对你如何处理问题感兴趣。

collins.def: Your approach to a task, problem, or situation is the way you deal with it or think about it.

example.ex: We will be exploring different approaches to gathering information.
example.tran: 我们将探索收集信息的不同方法。

example.ex: ...the adversarial approach of the British legal system.
example.tran: 英国法律制度采用的辩论式审判模式

collins.def: As a future time or event approaches, it gradually gets nearer as time passes.

example.ex: As autumn approached, the plants and colours in the garden changed.
example.tran: 秋天临近，花园中的草木和颜色也发生了变化。

example.ex: ...the approaching crisis.
example.tran: 步步逼近的危机

collins.def: As you approach a future time or event, time passes so that you get gradually nearer to it.

example.ex: We approach the end of the year with the economy slowing and little sign of cheer.
example.tran: 接近年末时，我们面临经济迟滞、处处萧条的局面。

collins.def: If something approaches a particular level or state, it almost reaches that level or state.

example.ex: Oil prices have approached their highest level for almost ten years...
example.tran: 石油价格已接近近10年中的最高水平。

example.ex: Mansell will race at average speeds approaching 200mph.
example.tran: 曼塞尔将以接近每小时200英里的平均车速参赛。

collins.def: A king is a man who is the most important member of the royal family of his country, and who is considered to be the Head of State of that country.

example.ex: ...the king and queen of Spain...
example.tran: 西班牙国王和王后

example.ex: In 1154, Henry II became King of England.
example.tran: 1154年，亨利二世成为英格兰国王。

collins.tran: 最重要者；首屈一指者；…之王
collins.def: If you describe a man as the king of something, you mean that he is the most important person doing that thing or he is the best at doing it.

example.ex: He's the king of unlicensed boxing...
example.tran: 他是黑市拳王。

example.ex: He was the king of the big love song.
example.tran: 他是流行情歌之王。

collins.def: A king is a playing card with a picture of a king on it.

example.ex: ...the king of diamonds.
example.tran: 方片K

collins.def: In chess, the king is the most important piece. When you are in a position to capture your opponent's king, you win the game.

collins.tran: 过阔绰的生活；活得像个国王
collins.def: If you say that someone lives like a king, you mean that they are able to live in a very comfortable or luxurious way.

example.ex: Executives lived like kings. The top thirty-one executives were paid a total of $14.2 million.
example.tran: 经理们活得像国王一样。职位最高的31名经理的薪金总额达到了1,420万美元。

means: （对某人所说的话表示气愤或不大理解）那是什么意思
料想( suppose的过去式和过去分词)

collins.def: If you say that something is supposed to happen, you mean that it is planned or expected. Sometimes this use suggests that the thing does not really happen in this way.

example.ex: He produced a handwritten list of nine men he was supposed to kill...
example.tran: 他拿出了一份手写的名单，上面列有 9 个他应该要杀死的人。

example.ex: Public spending is supposed to fall, not rise, in the next few years.
example.tran: 在接下来的几年里，政府开支应该会下降，而不是上升。

collins.tran: 本应该(发生而没有发生)
collins.def: If something was supposed to happen, it was planned or intended to happen, but did not in fact happen.

example.ex: He was supposed to go back to Bergen on the last bus, but of course the accident prevented him...
example.tran: 他本来要乘最后一班汽车回卑尔根，但当然，这起事故使他没能回去。

example.ex: The first debate was supposed to have been held on Tuesday.
example.tran: 第一场辩论本该在星期二就举行了。

collins.def: If you say that something is supposed to be true, you mean that people say it is true but you do not know for certain that it is true.

example.ex: 'The Whipping Block' has never been published, but it's supposed to be a really good poem...
example.tran: 《鞭笞刑具》还从未发表过，但大家认为它是一首真正的好诗。

example.ex: 'The President cannot be disturbed,' his son is supposed to have told an early morning caller.
example.tran: “校长不能见客，”他的儿子应该已经这样告知了一位一大清早就来了的拜访者。

collins.def: You can use 'be supposed to' to express annoyance at someone's ideas, or because something is not happening in the proper way.

example.ex: You're supposed to be my friend!...
example.tran: 你还是我朋友呢！

example.ex: Don't try to tell me what I'm supposed to be feeling...
example.tran: 别跟我说我到底该作何感想。

collins.tran: 误以为的;误信的;所谓的
collins.def: You can use supposed to suggest that something that people talk about or believe in may not in fact exist, happen, or be as it is described.

example.ex: Not all indigenous regimes were willing to accept the supposed benefits of British trade.
example.tran: 并非所有当地的政权都愿意接受与英国贸易的所谓好处。

example.ex: ...when the rule of law is broken by its supposed guardians.
example.tran: 当法治被其所谓的捍卫者破坏时

means: 主持会议的主席（的席位或职位）

collins.def: A chair is a piece of furniture for one person to sit on. Chairs have a back and four legs.

example.ex: He rose from his chair and walked to the window.
example.tran: 他从椅子上站起来，朝窗口走去。

collins.def: At a university, a chair is the post of professor.

example.ex: He has been appointed to the chair of sociology at Southampton University...
example.tran: 他被任命担任南安普敦大学的社会学教授一职。

example.ex: He gave London University £100,000 to establish a chair in Islamic art.
example.tran: 他资助伦敦大学10万英镑，以设立伊斯兰艺术教授一职。

collins.def: The person who is the chair of a committee or meeting is the person in charge of it.

example.ex: She is the chair of the Defense Advisory Committee on Women in the Military.
example.tran: 她担任军队女性权益保护顾问委员会主席。

collins.tran: 主持(会议);担任(委员会的)主席
collins.def: If you chair a meeting or a committee, you are the person in charge of it.

example.ex: He was about to chair a meeting in Venice of EU foreign ministers...
example.tran: 他将主持在威尼斯召开的欧盟外长会议。

example.ex: The declaration was drafted by a committee chaired by Dr Robert Song.
example.tran: 宣言由罗伯特·桑博士领导的委员会起草。

collins.def: The chair is the same as the electric chair .
If you are in the chair or take the chair at a meeting, you are the person in charge of it.

example.ex: In the chair was Morien Morgan...
example.tran: 会议由莫里恩·摩根主持。

example.ex: Wheeler took the chair of this sub-committee...
example.tran: 惠勒担任该小组委员会会议主席。

collins.tran: （各自发表不同观点的）辩论，争论，讨论
collins.def: A debate is a discussion about a subject on which people have different views.

example.ex: An intense debate is going on within the Israeli government...
example.tran: 以色列政府内部正在进行激烈的辩论。

example.ex: There has been a lot of debate among scholars about this.
example.tran: 学者之间对此一直争论纷纷。

collins.tran: (议会或其他机构就某问题在投票前进行的)辩论
collins.def: A debate is a formal discussion, for example in a parliament or institution, in which people express different opinions about a particular subject and then vote on it.

example.ex: There are expected to be some heated debates in parliament over the next few days.
example.tran: 预计接下来的几天里议会将会进行一些激烈的辩论。

collins.def: If people debate a topic, they discuss it fairly formally, putting forward different views. You can also say that one person debates a topic with another person.

example.ex: The United Nations Security Council will debate the issue today...
example.tran: 联合国安理会今天将就这个问题展开讨论。

example.ex: The causes of anorexia are much debated...
example.tran: 关于厌食的起因存在颇多争论。

collins.def: If you debate whether to do something or what to do, you think or talk about possible courses of action before deciding exactly what you are going to do.

example.ex: Taggart debated whether to have yet another double vodka...
example.tran: 塔格特思忖着是否再要一杯双份伏特加。

example.ex: At the moment we are debating what furniture to buy for the house...
example.tran: 我们眼下正盘算着为房子购置什么样的家具。

collins.tran: 存在争论的;有待讨论的;未确定的
collins.def: If you say that a matter is open to debate, you mean that people have different opinions about it, or it has not yet been firmly decided.

example.ex: Which of them has more musical talent is open to debate.
example.tran: 他们之中谁更有音乐天赋还未有定论。

means: 流入，注入，进入（如油流入机器）
（尤指向地方性电视台）馈送电视节目

collins.def: If you feed a person or animal, you give them food to eat and sometimes actually put it in their mouths.

example.ex: We brought along pieces of old bread and fed the birds...
example.tran: 我们拿了几片陈面包来喂鸟。

example.ex: She fed him a cookie...
example.tran: 她给他吃了一块饼干。

collins.def: To feed a family or a community means to supply food for them.

example.ex: Feeding a hungry family can be expensive.
example.tran: 养活饥肠辘辘的一家人花费很大。

example.ex: ...a food reserve large enough to feed the Sudanese population for many months.
example.tran: 足够苏丹人吃好多个月的食物储备

collins.def: When an animal feeds, it eats or drinks something.

example.ex: After a few days the caterpillars stopped feeding...
example.tran: 几天后毛虫停止进食。

example.ex: Slugs feed on decaying plant and animal material.
example.tran: 蛞蝓以腐烂的动植物为食。

collins.def: When a baby feeds, or when you feed it, it drinks breast milk or milk from a bottle.

example.ex: When a baby is thirsty, it feeds more often...
example.tran: 婴儿渴的时候，吃奶就会更频繁。

example.ex: I knew absolutely nothing about handling or feeding a baby.
example.tran: 我对如何抱婴儿、如何给婴儿喂食一无所知。

collins.def: Animal feed is food given to animals, especially farm animals.

example.ex: The grain just rotted and all they could use it for was animal feed.
example.tran: 谷物完全烂掉了，他们能将其派上的唯一用场就是作动物饲料。

example.ex: ...poultry feed.
example.tran: 家禽饲料

collins.def: To feed something to a place, means to supply it to that place in a steady flow.

example.ex: ...blood vessels that feed blood to the brain.
example.tran: 将血液输送到大脑的血管

example.ex: ...gas fed through pipelines.
example.tran: 通过管道输送的燃气

collins.tran: 将…放到，将…投入(容器或装置中)
collins.def: If you feed something into a container or piece of equipment, you put it into it.

example.ex: He took the compact disc from her, then fed it into the player...
example.tran: 他从她手里接过光盘，放入播放机中。

example.ex: She was feeding documents into a paper shredder.
example.tran: 她将文件放入碎纸机。

collins.tran: 向…泄露(秘密);向…灌输,向…通报(虚假信息)
collins.def: If someone feeds you false or secret information, they deliberately tell it to you.

example.ex: He was surrounded by people who fed him ghastly lies...
example.tran: 他周围的人都在给他灌输可怕的谎言。

example.ex: At least one British officer was feeding him with classified information.
example.tran: 至少有一个英国官员在向他提供机密情报。

collins.def: If you feed someone's dislike or desire for something, you make it stronger.

example.ex: The divorce was painfully public, feeding her dislike of the press.
example.tran: 离婚的事张扬出去，她十分痛苦，更加厌恶媒体了。

collins.def: If you feed a plant, you add substances to it to make it grow well.

example.ex: Feed plants to encourage steady growth.
example.tran: 给植物施肥促使其不断生长。

collins.def: If one thing feeds on another, it becomes stronger as a result of the other thing's existence.

example.ex: The drinking and the guilt fed on each other.
example.tran: 酗酒和犯罪彼此助长。

collins.def: To feed information into a computer means to gradually put it into it.

example.ex: An automatic weather station feeds information on wind direction to the computer.
example.tran: 自动化气象站将风向信息输入计算机。

collins.def: An award is a prize or certificate that a person is given for doing something well.

example.ex: ...the Booker prize, Britain's top award for fiction...
example.tran: 布克奖，英国小说界的最高荣誉

example.ex: She presented a bravery award to schoolgirl Caroline Tucker.
example.tran: 她向女学生卡罗琳·塔克颁发了英勇奖状。

collins.def: In law, an award is a sum of money that a court decides should be given to someone.

example.ex: ...workmen's compensation awards.
example.tran: 判给工人的赔偿金

collins.def: A pay award is an increase in pay for a particular group of workers.

example.ex: ...this year's average pay award for teachers of just under 8%.
example.tran: 今年教师平均加薪幅度将近8%

collins.def: If someone is awarded something such as a prize or an examination mark, it is given to them.

example.ex: She was awarded the prize for both films...
example.tran: 她的两部电影双双获奖。

example.ex: For his dedication the Mayor awarded him a medal of merit.
example.tran: 为表彰他的奉献精神，市长授予他荣誉奖章。

collins.def: To award something to someone means to decide that it will be given to that person.

example.ex: We have awarded the contract to a British shipyard...
example.tran: 我们将合同给了一家英国造船厂。

example.ex: A High Court judge had awarded him £6 million damages.
example.tran: 高级法院法官裁定他获得600万英镑的损失赔偿金。

collins.def: A theory is a formal idea or set of ideas that is intended to explain something.

example.ex: Marx produced a new theory about historical change based upon conflict between competing groups...
example.tran: 马克思创立了一种新理论，认为历史的演变是基于对立集团之间的冲突之上的。

example.ex: Einstein formulated the Theory of Relativity in 1905.
example.tran: 爱因斯坦于 1905 年创立了相对论。

collins.def: If you have a theory about something, you have your own opinion about it which you cannot prove but which you think is true.

example.ex: There was a theory that he wanted to marry her...
example.tran: 有人认为他想娶她。

example.ex: My theory about divorce is that it's not the split-up that damages children, it's how it is handled.
example.tran: 我对离婚的看法是，伤害孩子的不是婚姻的破裂，而是处理离婚的方式。

collins.def: The theory of a practical subject or skill is the set of rules and principles that form the basis of it.

example.ex: He taught us music theory.
example.tran: 他教我们乐理。

example.ex: ...graduates who are well-trained in both the theory and practice of statistics.
example.tran: 在统计学理论和实践两方面都训练有素的毕业生

collins.def: You use in theory to say that although something is supposed to be true or to happen in the way stated, it may not in fact be true or happen in that way.

example.ex: A school dental service exists in theory, but in practice, there are few dentists to work in them.
example.tran: 照理说，学校也有牙医诊所，可实际上，里面的牙医寥寥无几。

collins.def: A seed is the small, hard part of a plant from which a new plant grows.

example.ex: ...a packet of cabbage seed...
example.tran: 一包卷心菜籽

example.ex: I sow the seed in pots of soil-based compost.
example.tran: 我把种子种在几盆掺有堆肥的土里。

collins.def: If you seed a piece of land, you plant seeds in it.

example.ex: Men mowed the wide lawns and seeded them...
example.tran: 人们割了大片草地的草，然后在上面播种。

example.ex: The primroses should begin to seed themselves down the steep hillside.
example.tran: 报春花应该开始沿着陡峭的山坡一路撒播种子了。

collins.def: You can refer to the seeds of something when you want to talk about the beginning of a feeling or process that gradually develops and becomes stronger or more important.

example.ex: He raised questions meant to plant seeds of doubts in the minds of jurors...
example.tran: 他提出几个问题意欲引起陪审员的疑心。

example.ex: He considered that there were, in these developments, the seeds of a new moral order.
example.tran: 他认为在这些事态发展中包蕴着一种新的道德秩序的萌芽。

collins.tran: (网球、羽毛球等体育项目中的)种子选手
collins.def: In sports such as tennis or badminton, a seed is a player who has been ranked according to his or her ability.

example.ex: ...Pete Sampras, Wimbledon's top seed and the world No.1...
example.tran: 皮特·桑普拉斯，温布尔登网球锦标赛的头号种子，世界排名第一

example.ex: In the final Capriati, the third seed, defeated Katerina Maleeva.
example.tran: 在决赛中，三号种子选手卡普里亚蒂击败了凯特林娜·马莉娃。

collins.tran: 将(选手或参赛队)排列名次
collins.def: When a player or a team is seeded in a sports competition, they are ranked according to their ability.

example.ex: In the UEFA Cup the top 16 sides are seeded for the first round...
example.tran: 在欧洲联盟杯比赛中，排名前 16 位的球队已按位次进入首轮。

example.ex: He is seeded second, behind Brad Beven...
example.tran: 他被列为二号种子选手，位居布拉德·贝文之后。

collins.def: If vegetable plants go to seed or run to seed, they produce flowers and seeds as well as leaves.

example.ex: If unused, winter radishes run to seed in spring.
example.tran: 如果不去动的话，冬萝卜会在春天开花结籽。

collins.tran: 衰老;风光不再;衰退;退化
collins.def: If you say that someone or something has gone to seed or has run to seed, you mean that they have become much less attractive, healthy, or efficient.

example.ex: He says the economy has gone to seed...
example.tran: 他说经济已经走向衰退。

example.ex: He was a big man in his forties; once he had a lot of muscle but now he was running to seed.
example.tran: 他 40 多岁时很魁梧，曾经肌肉发达，但如今身体逐渐衰弱了。

collins.def: The different elements of something are the different parts it contains.

example.ex: The exchange of prisoners of war was one of the key elements of the UN's peace plan.
example.tran: 交换战俘是联合国和平计划的一个重要部分。

collins.def: A particular element of a situation, activity, or process is an important quality or feature that it has or needs.

example.ex: Fitness has now become an important element in our lives.
example.tran: 现在健康已经成为我们生活中的一个要素。

collins.tran: （社会或组织内部具有相同目标、信仰或习惯的）一群人，一组人，分子
collins.def: When you talk about elements within a society or organization, you are referring to groups of people who have similar aims, beliefs, or habits.

example.ex: ...criminal elements within the security forces.
example.tran: 安保部队中的犯罪分子

example.ex: ...the hooligan element.
example.tran: 流氓团伙

collins.def: If something has an element of a particular quality or emotion, it has a certain amount of this quality or emotion.

example.ex: These reports clearly contain elements of propaganda.
example.tran: 这些报告明显带有一些宣传的意味。

collins.def: An element is a substance such as gold, oxygen, or carbon that consists of only one type of atom.

collins.tran: （电炉、热水器等的）电热元件，电热丝
collins.def: The element in an electric fire or water heater is the metal part which changes the electric current into heat.

example.ex: With its unique heating element it makes perfect coffee.
example.tran: 其独特的电热元件使它能够煮出非常美味的咖啡。

collins.def: You can refer to the weather, especially wind and rain, as the elements .

example.ex: The area where most refugees are waiting is exposed to the elements.
example.tran: 大多数难民等待救济的地方都不能挡风遮雨。

collins.tran: 自在;适得其所;如鱼得水
collins.def: If you say that someone is in their element, you mean that they are in a situation they enjoy.

example.ex: My stepmother was in her element, organizing everything...
example.tran: 我的继母得心应手地料理着一切。

example.ex: Maybe it's because they're so out of their element that they feel the need to talk.
example.tran: 可能是因为他们感到非常不自在，所以觉得有必要说说话。

collins.def: The general ideas or opinions of a person or group can be referred to as their thinking .

example.ex: There was undeniably a strong theoretical dimension to his thinking.
example.tran: 不可否认，他的思想很有理论深度。

example.ex: ...the direction of the ANC's thinking on the country's political future...
example.tran: 非国大对于本国政治前景的认识方向

collins.def: Thinking is the activity of using your brain by considering a problem or possibility or creating an idea.

example.ex: This is a time of decisive action and quick thinking...
example.tran: 这个时候应该果断行动、快速反应。

example.ex: After the pain of defeat passes, England have some thinking to do.
example.tran: 失败的痛苦过去以后，英国人应该认真反思一下。

collins.def: If you describe someone as a thinking man or woman, you mean that they are intelligent and take an interest in important events and issues, and you approve of this.

example.ex: Thinking people on both sides will applaud this book...
example.tran: 双方的有识之士都会称赞这本书。

example.ex: A newspaper called him 'the thinking man's Tory'.
example.tran: 一家报纸称他为“有见识的保守党人”。

collins.def: A trial is a formal meeting in a law court, at which a judge and jury listen to evidence and decide whether a person is guilty of a crime.

example.ex: New evidence showed the police lied at the trial...
example.tran: 新的证据表明警方在审讯时撒了谎。

example.ex: He's awaiting trial in a military court on charges of plotting against the state...
example.tran: 他因被控密谋颠覆国家正等待军事法庭的审判。

collins.def: A trial is an experiment in which you test something by using it or doing it for a period of time to see how well it works. If something is on trial, it is being tested in this way.

example.ex: They have been treated with this drug in clinical trials...
example.tran: 他们已在临床试验中接受过这种药物的治疗。

example.ex: I took the car out for a trial on the roads…
example.tran: 我开车上路试驾了一下。

collins.def: If someone gives you a trial for a job, or if you are on trial, you do the job for a short period of time to see if you are suitable for it.

example.ex: He had just given a trial to a young woman who said she had previous experience...
example.tran: 他刚给了一位声称自己有从业经验的年轻女子一次试用机会。

example.ex: The 26-year old fullback has been on trial at the club for ten days.
example.tran: 那位 26 岁的后卫已经在该俱乐部试用 10 天了。

collins.def: If you refer to the trials of a situation, you mean the unpleasant things that you experience in it.

example.ex: ...the trials of adolescence.
example.tran: 青春期的苦恼

collins.def: In some sports or outdoor activities, trials are a series of contests that test a competitor's skill and ability.

example.ex: He has been riding in horse trials for less than a year.
example.tran: 他参加赛马选拔赛还不到一年。

example.ex: ...Dovedale Sheepdog Trials.
example.tran: 达夫谷牧羊犬测试赛

collins.tran: 通过反复试验；经过不断摸索
collins.def: If you do something by trial and error, you try several different methods of doing it until you find the method that works properly.

example.ex: Many drugs were found by trial and error...
example.tran: 很多药物都是通过反复试验才发现的。

example.ex: She feels that raising her children has been a matter of trial and error.
example.tran: 她感到抚养孩子就像是摸着石头过河。

collins.def: If someone is on trial, they are being tried in a court of law.

example.ex: He is currently on trial accused of serious drugs charges...
example.tran: 他目前正因严重的毒品控罪而受审。

example.ex: He will go on trial later this month charged with murder…
example.tran: 他将因谋杀罪名在本月晚些时候出庭受审。

collins.tran: 在测试中;在考察中;在考验中
collins.def: If you say that someone or something is on trial, you mean that they are in a situation where people are observing them to see whether they succeed or fail.

example.ex: The President will be drawn into a damaging battle in which his credentials will be on trial.
example.tran: 总统将被卷入一场造成负面影响的争斗中，他的资格会因此受到考验。

collins.def: If someone stands trial, they are tried in court for a crime they are accused of.

example.ex: He was found to be mentally unfit to stand trial…
example.tran: 他被判定精神状况不宜接受审判。

example.ex: Five people are to stand trial for murder.
example.tran: 将有 5 个人因涉嫌谋杀受到审判。

collins.def: Corp. is a written abbreviation for(书面缩略 =) corporation.

example.ex: ...Sony Corp. of Japan.
example.tran: 日本索尼公司

collins.def: A collection of things is a group of similar things that you have deliberately acquired, usually over a period of time.

example.ex: Robert's collection of prints and paintings has been bought over the years...
example.tran: 这些年来，罗伯特逐渐收藏了一批版画和绘画作品。

example.ex: The Art Gallery of Ontario has the world's largest collection of sculptures by Henry Moore...
example.tran: 安大略美术馆是世界上收藏亨利·摩尔雕塑作品最多的美术馆。

collins.tran: (故事、诗歌或文章的)集子，作品集
collins.def: A collection of stories, poems, or articles is a number of them published in one book.

example.ex: Two years ago he published a collection of short stories called 'Facing The Music'...
example.tran: 两年前，他出版了短篇小说集《勇敢面对》。

example.ex: The Brookings Institution has assembled a collection of essays from foreign affairs experts.
example.tran: 布鲁金斯研究所将一批外交专家撰写的文章结集出版。

collins.def: A collection of things is a group of things.

example.ex: Wye Lea is a collection of farm buildings that have been converted into an attractive complex.
example.tran: “怀河草地”是一处由农舍改造而成的赏心悦目的建筑群。

collins.def: A fashion designer's new collection consists of the new clothes they have designed for the next season.
Collection is the act of collecting something from a place or from people.

example.ex: Money can be sent to any one of 22,000 agents worldwide for collection.
example.tran: 可以把钱汇给分布在世界各地的22,000名筹款代理人中的任何一位。

example.ex: ...computer systems to speed up collection of information.
example.tran: 加速信息收集的计算机系统

collins.def: If you organize a collection for charity, you collect money from people to give to charity.

example.ex: I asked my headmaster if he could arrange a collection for a refugee charity.
example.tran: 我问校长他是否能为救济难民的慈善机构组织一次募捐。

collins.def: A collection is money that is given by people in church during some Christian services.
The floor of a room is the part of it that you walk on.

example.ex: Jack's sitting on the floor watching TV...
example.tran: 杰克正坐在地板上看电视。

example.ex: We painted the wooden floor with a white stain.
example.tran: 我们把木地板刷成了白色。

collins.def: A floor of a building is all the rooms that are on a particular level.

example.ex: It is on the fifth floor of the hospital...
example.tran: 它位于医院的5层。

example.ex: They occupied the first two floors of the tower.
example.tran: 他们占用了塔楼的头两层。

collins.def: The ocean floor is the ground at the bottom of an ocean. The valley floor is the ground at the bottom of a valley.

example.ex: They spend hours feeding on the ocean floor.
example.tran: 它们花好几个小时在海底进食。

example.ex: ...a two-hour climb from the valley floor.
example.tran: 从谷底向上攀登两个小时

collins.def: The place where official debates and discussions are held, especially between members of parliament, is referred to as the floor .

example.ex: The issues were debated on the floor of the House.
example.tran: 这些问题在议院的议员席进行了讨论。

collins.def: In a debate or discussion, the floor is the people who are listening to the arguments being put forward but who are not among the main speakers.

example.ex: The president is taking questions from the floor.
example.tran: 总统正接受来自听众席的提问。

collins.def: The floor of a stock exchange is the large open area where trading is done.

example.ex: ...the dealing floor at Standard Chartered Bank.
example.tran: 渣打银行的交易大厅

collins.def: The floor in a place such as a club or disco is the area where people dance.
If you are floored by something, you are unable to respond to it because you are so surprised by it.

example.ex: He was floored by the announcement...
example.tran: 这个通告使他不知所措。

example.ex: He seemed floored by a string of scandals.
example.tran: 他似乎被一连串的丑闻搞得茫然失措。

collins.tran: (尤指在拳击比赛中)打倒，击倒
collins.def: If someone is floored, especially in boxing, they are hit so hard that they fall over.

example.ex: He was floored twice in the second round.
example.tran: 在第二轮中他两次被打倒在地。

collins.tran: (在辩论或讨论中)发言/给予…发言权
collins.def: If you take the floor, you start speaking in a debate or discussion. If you are given the floor, you are allowed to do this.

example.ex: Ministers took the floor to denounce the decision to suspend constitutional rule...
example.tran: 几位部长发言谴责暂停宪制的决定。

example.ex: Only members would be given the floor.
example.tran: 只有会员才拥有发言权。

collins.def: If you take to the floor, you start dancing at a dance or disco.

example.ex: The happy couple and their respective parents took to the floor.
example.tran: 这对幸福的新人和他们各自的父母在舞池中翩翩起舞。

collins.def: If you say that prices or sales have fallen through the floor, you mean that they have suddenly decreased.

example.ex: Property prices have dropped through the floor...
example.tran: 房地产价格骤降。

example.ex: Last year, sales went through the floor.
example.tran: 去年，销售突然下滑。

collins.def: If you wipe the floor with someone, you defeat them completely in a competition or discussion.

example.ex: He could wipe the floor with the Prime Minister.
example.tran: 他能彻底击败首相。

collins.def: A plane is a vehicle with wings and one or more engines, which can fly through the air.

example.ex: He had plenty of time to catch his plane...
example.tran: 他有足够的时间赶飞机。

example.ex: Her mother was killed in a plane crash.
example.tran: 她母亲在一次坠机中遇难。

collins.def: A plane is a flat, level surface which may be sloping at a particular angle.

example.ex: ...a building with angled planes.
example.tran: 带有坡面的建筑物

collins.def: If a number of points are in the same plane, one line or one flat surface could pass through them all.

example.ex: All the planets orbit the Sun in roughly the same plane, round its equator.
example.tran: 所有的行星大致在同一平面上绕太阳赤道运转。

collins.def: If you say that something is on a higher plane, you mean that it is more spiritual or less concerned with ordinary things.

example.ex: ...life on a higher plane of existence...
example.tran: 更高境界的生活

example.ex: We felt we were living life on several different planes.
example.tran: 我们感到大家生活的精神层次各不相同。

collins.def: A plane is a tool that has a flat bottom with a sharp blade in it. You move the plane over a piece of wood in order to remove thin pieces of its surface.
If you plane a piece of wood, you make it smaller or smoother by using a plane.

example.ex: She watches him plane the surface of a walnut board...
example.tran: 她看着他刨平一块胡桃木板。

example.ex: Again I planed the surface flush.
example.tran: 我又一次把表面刨平。

collins.def: If something such as a boat planes across water, it moves quickly across the water, just touching the surface.

example.ex: All four of the boats planed across the Solent with the greatest of ease.
example.tran: 4艘船都极其自如地掠过索伦特海峡。

collins.def: A plane or a plane tree is a large tree with broad leaves which often grows in towns.
In a sport or game, if a player scores a goal or a point, they gain a goal or point.

example.ex: Against which country did Ian Wright score his first international goal?...
example.tran: 在与哪个国家的比赛中伊恩·赖特打进了他在国际比赛中的首粒进球？

example.ex: England scored 282 in their first innings...
example.tran: 英格兰队第一局就获得了 282 分。

collins.def: If you score a particular number or amount, for example as a mark in a test, you achieve that number or amount.

example.ex: Kelly had scored an average of 147 on three separate IQ tests...
example.tran: 凯利在 3 项不同的智商测试中平均得分 147。

example.ex: Congress as an institution scores low in public opinion polls.
example.tran: 作为一个公共机构，国会在公众民意调查中得分很低。

collins.def: Someone's score in a game or test is a number, for example, a number of points or runs, which shows what they have achieved or what level they have reached.

example.ex: The U.S. Open golf tournament was won by Ben Hogan, with a score of 287...
example.tran: 本·霍根以 287 杆的成绩赢得了美国高尔夫公开赛。

example.ex: Robin Smith made 167, the highest score by an England batsman in this form of cricket...
example.tran: 罗宾·史密斯得到 167 分，创下了英格兰击球手在这类板球比赛中的最高得分纪录。

collins.def: The score in a game is the result of it or the current situation, as indicated by the number of goals, runs, or points obtained by the two teams or players.

example.ex: 4-1 was the final score...
example.tran: 最终比分是 4 比 1。

example.ex: They beat the Giants by a score of 7 to 3...
example.tran: 他们以 7 比 3 的比分击败了巨人队。

collins.def: If you score a success, a victory, or a hit, you are successful in what you are doing.

example.ex: His abiding passion was ocean racing, at which he scored many successes...
example.tran: 他一直酷爱海上赛艇，并多次在比赛中获胜。

example.ex: In recent months, the rebels have scored some significant victories...
example.tran: 最近几个月里，叛乱分子已经取得了一些不小的胜利。

collins.def: The score of a film, play, or similar production is the music which is written or used for it.

example.ex: The dance is accompanied by an original score by Henry Torgue.
example.tran: 这支舞蹈的配乐是由亨利·托尔格所作的一首原创曲目。

example.ex: ...the composer of classic film scores such as West Side Story.
example.tran: 为《西区故事》等经典影片配乐的作曲者

collins.def: The score of a piece of music is the written version of it.

example.ex: He recognizes enough notation to be able to follow a score.
example.tran: 他认得足够多的乐符，看懂乐谱不成问题。

collins.def: If you score a piece of music, you write it or arrange it for specific instruments or voices.

example.ex: Strauss spent much of 1941 scoring his last opera, Capriccio...
example.tran: 施特劳斯用了 1941 年的大部分时间为自己的最后一部歌剧《随想曲》编写总谱。

example.ex: He has mastered enough of the complexities of arrangement to write and score a piece for a chamber music ensemble.
example.tran: 他对改编的复杂之处已有了足够的掌握，能够谱写一部室内合奏曲了。

collins.def: If you refer to scores of things or people, you are emphasizing that there are very many of them.

example.ex: Campaigners lit scores of bonfires in ceremonies to mark the anniversary.
example.tran: 参加运动的人们在各种仪式上点起一垛垛篝火以纪念周年庆典。

collins.def: A score is twenty or approximately twenty.

example.ex: A score of countries may be producing or planning to obtain chemical weapons...
example.tran: 大概有20个国家可能正在制造或计划获取化学武器。

example.ex: The company already has around four score titles commissioned and planned for publication...
example.tran: 那家公司已有约80本书委托好了作者并计划出版。

collins.def: If you score a surface with something sharp, you cut a line or number of lines in it.

example.ex: Lightly score the surface of the steaks with a knife.
example.tran: 在牛排表面轻轻打花刀。

collins.def: If someone scores drugs, they buy them illegally.

example.ex: Me and my mate went to score a kilo of amphetamine down in London.
example.tran: 我和爱人去伦敦市区搞到了一公斤苯丙胺。

collins.def: If things happen or exist by the score, they happen or exist in large numbers.

example.ex: The companies brought out new products by the score.
example.tran: 那些公司生产了大量的新产品。

collins.def: If you keep score of the number of things that are happening in a certain situation, you count them and record them.

example.ex: You can keep score of your baby's movements before birth by recording them on a kick chart.
example.tran: 你可以通过胎动图表记录分娩前胎儿的活动情况。

collins.tran: 了解情况;了解真相;知道问题的症结
collins.def: If you know the score, you know what the real facts of a situation are and how they affect you, even though you may not like them.

example.ex: I don't feel sorry for Carl. He knew the score, he knew what he had to do and couldn't do it.
example.tran: 我不为卡尔感到难过。他了解情况。他知道自己必须做什么但却没能做成。

collins.tran: 在那一点上/在这一点上;(尤指)在那个难题上/在这个关注点上
collins.def: You can use on that score or on this score to refer to something that has just been mentioned, especially an area of difficulty or concern.

example.ex: I became pregnant easily. At least I've had no problems on that score...
example.tran: 我很容易就怀上了孩子。至少在那方面我没有问题。

example.ex: If someone you know has cancer, don't let worry on this score stop you from visiting them.
example.tran: 如果你认识的人得了癌症，不要因为这方面的担忧就不去探望他们。

collins.tran: (通常指通过巧妙或更有说服力的发言)驳倒，占上风
collins.def: If you score a point over someone, or score points off them, you gain an advantage over them, usually by saying something clever or making a better argument.

example.ex: The Prime Minister was trying to score a political point over his rivals...
example.tran: 首相正设法在政治上将对手一一驳倒。

example.ex: The politicians might be forced to touch on the real issues rather than scoring points off each other.
example.tran: 政客们可能会被迫讨论真正的问题而不只是互相抬杠。

collins.def: If you settle a score or settle an old score with someone, you take revenge on them for something they have done in the past.

example.ex: The groups had historic scores to settle with each other.
example.tran: 这两个集团之间有几笔旧账要了结。

collins.def: You use possibly to indicate that you are not sure whether something is true or might happen.

example.ex: Exercise will not only lower blood pressure but possibly protect against heart attacks...
example.tran: 锻炼不仅会降低血压，而且可能对心脏病有预防效果。

example.ex: They were smartly but casually dressed; possibly students...
example.tran: 他们衣着时尚，但很休闲，也许是学生。

collins.tran: （表示对所见或所闻感到惊讶、困惑或震惊）
collins.def: You use possibly to emphasize that you are surprised, puzzled, or shocked by something that you have seen or heard.

example.ex: It was the most unexpected piece of news one could possibly imagine...
example.tran: 这条新闻最出人意料了，真是让人想象不到。

example.ex: I mean, how could they possibly eat that stuff?...
example.tran: 我的意思是，他们怎么可能吃那东西呢？

collins.def: You use possibly to emphasize that someone has tried their hardest to do something, or has done it as well as they can.

example.ex: They've done everything they can possibly think of...
example.tran: 凡是能想到的，他们都去做了。

example.ex: It's one of the nicest feelings you can possibly have.
example.tran: 这是一种极其美妙的感觉。

collins.def: You use possibly to emphasize that something definitely cannot happen or definitely cannot be done.

example.ex: No I really can't possibly answer that!
example.tran: 不，我无论如何也回答不了那个问题。

example.ex: There's nothing more they can possibly do right...
example.tran: 他们除此之外啥也做不了。

collins.tran: 政治；政治事务；政治活动（其后的动词既可用单数，又可用复数）
collins.def: Politics are the actions or activities concerned with achieving and using power in a country or society. The verb that follows politics may be either singular or plural.

example.ex: The key question in British politics was how long the prime minister could survive...
example.tran: 英国政治的关键问题是首相能坚持多久。

example.ex: He quickly involved himself in local politics...
example.tran: 他很快涉足地方政治事务。

collins.tran: 政治信仰；政治主张；政治见解
collins.def: Your politics are your beliefs about how a country ought to be governed.

example.ex: My politics are well to the left of centre.
example.tran: 我的政治主张相当偏左。

collins.def: Politics is the study of the ways in which countries are governed.

example.ex: He began studying politics and medieval history.
example.tran: 他开始学习政治学和中世纪史。

example.ex: ...young politics graduates.
example.tran: 年轻的政治学毕业生

collins.tran: 手腕；权术；策略（其后的动词既可用单数，又可用复数）
collins.def: Politics can be used to talk about the ways that power is shared in an organization and the ways it is affected by personal relationships between people who work together. The verb that follows politics may be either singular or plural.

example.ex: You need to understand how office politics influence the working environment.
example.tran: 你需要了解办公室权术是如何影响工作氛围的。

collins.def: The afternoon is the part of each day which begins at lunchtime and ends at about six o'clock.

example.ex: He's arriving in the afternoon...
example.tran: 他下午会到。

example.ex: He had stayed in his room all afternoon.
example.tran: 他整个下午都呆在房间里。

means: （力量、健康、品格、权力、价值等的）衰退

collins.def: If something declines, it becomes less in quantity, importance, or strength.

example.ex: The number of staff has declined from 217,000 to 114,000...
example.tran: 员工人数从 21.7万减少到了11.4万。

example.ex: Hourly output by workers declined 1.3% in the first quarter...
example.tran: 第一季度工人每小时的产量下降了 1.3%。

collins.def: If you decline something or decline to do something, you politely refuse to accept it or do it.

example.ex: He declined their invitation...
example.tran: 他谢绝了他们的邀请。

example.ex: The band declined to comment on the story...
example.tran: 乐队拒绝对这一报道作任何评论。

collins.def: If there is a decline in something, it becomes less in quantity, importance, or quality.

example.ex: There wasn't such a big decline in enrollments after all...
example.tran: 注册人数终究还是没有出现如此大幅度的下降。

example.ex: ...Rome's decline in the fifth century...
example.tran: 公元5世纪时罗马的衰落

collins.def: If something is in decline or on the decline, it is gradually decreasing in importance, quality, or power.

example.ex: Thankfully the smoking of cigarettes is on the decline...
example.tran: 令人欣慰的是，吸烟量在逐渐下降。

example.ex: He is still one of the world's most popular golfers, but his game is in decline.
example.tran: 他仍是世界上最受欢迎的高尔夫球选手之一，但他的球技日不如前。

collins.def: If something goes or falls into decline, it begins to gradually decrease in importance, quality, or power.

example.ex: Libraries are an investment for the future and they should not be allowed to fall into decline.
example.tran: 图书馆是对未来的一项投资，不应任其日趋萎缩。

collins.def: Something that is soft is pleasant to touch, and not rough or hard.

example.ex: Regular use of a body lotion will keep the skin soft and supple...
example.tran: 经常使用润肤露可使皮肤柔软而富有弹性。

example.ex: When it's dry, brush the hair using a soft, nylon baby brush.
example.tran: 当头发干后，用柔软的婴儿用尼龙发刷梳理头发。

collins.def: Something that is soft changes shape or bends easily when you press it.

example.ex: She lay down on the soft, comfortable bed...
example.tran: 她在柔软而舒适的床上躺了下来。

example.ex: Add enough milk to form a soft dough.
example.tran: 加入足量的牛奶，使面团变得柔软。

collins.tran: 线条柔和的;没有棱角的;平缓的
collins.def: Something that has a soft appearance has smooth curves rather than sharp or distinct edges.

example.ex: This is a smart, yet soft and feminine look.
example.tran: 这是一张透着精明的面孔，但是线条柔和，女人味十足。

example.ex: ...the soft curves of her body.
example.tran: 她柔和的身体曲线

collins.def: Something that is soft is very gentle and has no force. For example, a soft sound or voice is quiet and not harsh. A soft light or colour is pleasant to look at because it is not bright.

example.ex: There was a soft tapping on my door...
example.tran: 有人在轻轻地敲我的门。

example.ex: When he woke again he could hear soft music.
example.tran: 他再次醒来时，听见了轻柔的音乐声。

collins.tran: 宽容的;不严厉的;心慈手软的
collins.def: If you are soft on someone, you do not treat them as strictly or severely as you should do.

example.ex: The president says the measure is soft and weak on criminals...
example.tran: 总统说这一举措对犯罪分子过于宽容，力度太小。

example.ex: He had initially thought Byrnes too soft with the Russians.
example.tran: 原先他还以为伯恩斯对俄国人过于手软呢。

collins.def: If you say that someone has a soft heart, you mean that they are sensitive and sympathetic towards other people.

example.ex: Her rather tough and worldly exterior hides a very soft and sensitive heart.
example.tran: 她那强硬而世故的外表下掩藏着一颗温柔而敏感的心。

collins.def: You use soft to describe a way of life that is easy and involves very little work.

example.ex: The regime at Latchmere could be seen as a soft option...
example.tran: 在拉奇米尔建立政权可以视为一个简便易行的选择。

example.ex: There is no way that 20 years of soft living could be lost in the first 30 minutes' exercise.
example.tran: 20 年轻松舒适的生活是绝对不可能经过首次 30 分钟的训练就能放弃的。

collins.def: Soft drugs are drugs, such as cannabis, which are illegal but which many people do not consider to be strong or harmful.
A soft target is a place or person that can easily be attacked.

example.ex: Women who carry cash about in the streets, as they very often have to, are a very soft target.
example.tran: 必须经常携带现金上街的女性特别容易受到攻击。

collins.def: Soft water does not contain much of the mineral calcium and so makes bubbles easily when you use soap.

collins.tran: 特别喜爱;特别疼爱;钟爱
collins.def: If you have a soft spot for someone or something, you feel a great deal of affection for them or like them a lot.

example.ex: Terry had a soft spot for me...
example.tran: 特里非常疼我。

example.ex: I have a soft spot for London Zoo.
example.tran: 我特别喜欢伦敦动物园。

collins.def: A pair of things are two things of the same size and shape that are used together or are both part of something, for example shoes, earrings, or parts of the body.

example.ex: ...a pair of socks.
example.tran: 一双袜子

example.ex: ...trainers that cost up to 90 pounds a pair...
example.tran: 售价高达90英镑一双的运动鞋

collins.tran: 套，条，把，副（由两个尺寸和形状相同的部分组成的物品，如裤子、剪刀）
collins.def: Some objects that have two main parts of the same size and shape are referred to as a pair, for example a pair of trousers or a pair of scissors .

example.ex: ...a pair of faded jeans.
example.tran: 一条褪色的牛仔裤

example.ex: ...a pair of binoculars.
example.tran: 一副双筒望远镜

collins.tran: 一对伴儿；一对夫妻；一对情侣
collins.def: You can refer to two people as a pair when they are standing or walking together or when they have some kind of relationship with each other.

example.ex: A pair of teenage boys were smoking cigarettes...
example.tran: 两个十来岁的男孩正在吸烟。

example.ex: The pair admitted that their three-year-old marriage was going through 'a difficult time'...
example.tran: 那对夫妻承认他们3年的婚姻正在经历一个“困难期”。

collins.def: If one thing is paired with another, it is put with it or considered with it.

example.ex: The trainees will then be paired with experienced managers.
example.tran: 实习生随后将会与经验丰富的经理结成对子。

collins.tran: 可靠的好帮手；可以委托的人
collins.def: If you say that someone is or has a safe pair of hands, you mean that they are reliable and will not make any serious mistakes.

example.ex: He has now held five cabinet posts and remains a safe pair of hands.
example.tran: 他现在担任5个内阁职位，仍是一个靠得住的人。

collins.tran: 十分严重的;极为恶劣的
collins.def: You use severe to indicate that something bad or undesirable is great or intense.

example.ex: ...a business with severe cash flow problems...
example.tran: 有严重资金周转问题的公司

example.ex: I suffered from severe bouts of depression...
example.tran: 我曾患有严重的抑郁症。

collins.tran: (惩罚、批评)严厉的，严重的，苛刻的
collins.def: Severe punishments or criticisms are very strong or harsh.

example.ex: This was a dreadful crime and a severe sentence is necessary...
example.tran: 这一罪行十分恶劣，必须要重判。

example.ex: Before she could reply, my mother launched into a severe reprimand.
example.tran: 她还没来得及回答，我妈妈就开始严厉地训斥起她来。

collins.tran: (外貌、外观)简朴的，朴素的,不加修饰的
collins.def: If you describe the appearance of someone or something as severe, you do not like its plain appearance and lack of decoration.

example.ex: ...wearing her felt hats and severe grey suits...
example.tran: 戴着她的毡帽，穿着朴素的灰色套装

example.ex: The cushions add a touch of colour in a room that might otherwise look severe.
example.tran: 靠垫给房间添了一抹亮色，不然房间看上去可能太素净了。

means: 拥护共和政体者，共和主义者

collins.def: Republican means relating to a republic. In republican systems of government, power is held by the people or the representatives that they elect.

example.ex: ...the nations that had adopted the republican form of government.
example.tran: 实行共和政体的国家

collins.tran: (美国)共和党的，支持共和党的
collins.def: In the United States, if someone is Republican, they belong to or support the Republican Party.

example.ex: ...Republican voters...
example.tran: 支持共和党的选民们

example.ex: Some families have been republican for generations.
example.tran: 有些家庭世代都支持共和党。

collins.tran: (支持北爱尔兰脱离英国加入爱尔兰共和国的)共和主义者，共和派
collins.def: In Northern Ireland, if someone is Republican, they believe that Northern Ireland should not be ruled by Britain but should become part of the Republic of Ireland.

example.ex: ...a Republican paramilitary group.
example.tran: 共和派的准军事组织

means: 在…中具有最重要的特色
在…中拥有最重要的位置

collins.tran: 在…中占首要地位，在…中最具影响力
collins.def: To dominate a situation means to be the most powerful or important person or thing in it.

example.ex: The book is expected to dominate the best-seller lists...
example.tran: 这本书预计会占据畅销书排行榜的榜首。

example.ex: ...countries where life is dominated by war...
example.tran: 战事频繁的国家

collins.def: If one country or person dominates another, they have power over them.

example.ex: He denied that his country wants to dominate Europe...
example.tran: 他否认他的国家想要控制欧洲。

example.ex: Women are no longer dominated by the men in their relationships...
example.tran: 在两性关系中女性不再受制于男性。

collins.def: If a building, mountain, or other object dominates an area, it is so large or impressive that you cannot avoid seeing it.

example.ex: It's one of the biggest buildings in this area, and it really dominates this whole place.
example.tran: 这是该地区最大的建筑物之一，雄踞在整个地区之上。

example.ex: ...its skyline dominated by the central mosque.
example.tran: 中央的清真寺高耸天际

collins.def: A scientist is someone who has studied science and whose job is to teach or do research in science.

example.ex: Scientists have collected more data than expected.
example.tran: 科学家们已经收集到了比预期更多的数据。

collins.def: To give or be protection against something unpleasant means to prevent people or things from being harmed or damaged by it.

example.ex: Such a diet is widely believed to offer protection against a number of cancers...
example.tran: 这种饮食结构被广泛认为可以预防多种癌症。

example.ex: It is clear that the primary duty of parents is to provide protection for our children...
example.tran: 很明显，父母的首要职责是为孩子们提供保护。

collins.def: If an insurance policy gives you protection against an event such as death, injury, fire, or theft, the insurance company will give you or your family money if that event happens.

example.ex: The new policy is believed to be the first scheme to offer protection against an illness.
example.tran: 这份新的保险单被认为是首个承保疾病风险的保险方案。

collins.tran: 保护法；保护条例；保护措施
collins.def: Protections are laws and other official measures intended  to protect people's rights and freedoms.

example.ex: ...civil rights bills providing a myriad of protections for gays, women and the disabled.
example.tran: 为同性恋者、妇女和残疾人提供了诸多保护的民权法案

collins.def: If a government has a policy of protection, it helps its own industries by putting a tax on imported goods or by restricting imports in some other way.

example.ex: Over the same period trade protection has increased in the rich countries.
example.tran: 在同一时期，富国的贸易保护有所抬头。

collins.tran: （歹徒索取保护费后提供的）保护
collins.def: If criminals offer people protection, they demand money from them and in return promise not to hurt them or damage their property.

example.ex: A businessman who refused to pay protection money was shot nine times.
example.tran: 一位拒交保护费的商人被打了9枪。

example.ex: ...protection rackets.
example.tran: 勒索保护费

collins.tran: （用于修正作出的陈述，表示不大可能）几乎不，几乎没有
collins.def: You use hardly to modify a statement when you want to emphasize that it is only a small amount or detail which makes it true, and that therefore it is best to consider the opposite statement as being true.

example.ex: I hardly know you...
example.tran: 我不太认识你。

example.ex: Nick, on the sofa, hardly slept...
example.tran: 尼克在沙发上几乎没睡。

collins.def: You use hardly in expressions such as hardly ever ,hardly any, and hardly anyone to mean almost never, almost none, or almost no-one.

example.ex: We ate chips every night, but hardly ever had fish...
example.tran: 我们每晚吃炸薯条，但几乎从不吃鱼。

example.ex: Most of the others were so young they had hardly any experience...
example.tran: 其他人大多都很年轻，几乎没什么经验。

collins.tran: （用在否定句中构成双重否定，用于强调某事属实或经常发生）几乎不
collins.def: You use hardly before a negative statement in order to emphasize that something is usually true or usually happens.

example.ex: Hardly a day goes by without a visit from someone.
example.tran: 几乎每天都有人来。

collins.def: When you say you can hardly do something, you are emphasizing that it is very difficult for you to do it.

example.ex: I can hardly believe it's been over eight years since you used to go camping at Cedar Creek...
example.tran: 我几乎无法相信现在距离你过去常常去松溪露营的日子已经有8年多了。

example.ex: My garden was covered with so many butterflies that I could hardly see the flowers.
example.tran: 我的花园里飞舞着很多蝴蝶，我几乎看不见花了。

collins.tran: （表示两件事情紧接着发生）刚刚，才
collins.def: If you say hardly had one thing happened when something else happened, you mean that the first event was followed immediately by the second.

example.ex: He had hardly collected the papers on his desk when the door burst open...
example.tran: 他刚收起桌上的文件，门就猛地开了。

example.ex: Hardly had he returned to London when an anonymous well-wisher called to say he was about to be raided by Customs & Excise.
example.tran: 他刚回到伦敦，就有一个不愿透露姓名的好心人打来电话说，他即将面临海关的突击检查。

collins.tran: （表示希望听者或读者赞同自己）并不，丝毫不
collins.def: You use hardly to mean 'not' when you want to suggest that you are expecting your listener or reader to agree with your comment.

example.ex: We have not seen the letter, so we can hardly comment on it...
example.tran: 我们还没有看到这封信，所以无从发表意见。

example.ex: It's hardly surprising his ideas didn't catch on...
example.tran: 他的想法没有被广泛接受，这并不足为奇。

collins.tran: （尤用于对不赞同的说法表示惊奇或不满）不可能，不会吧
collins.def: You use 'hardly' to mean 'no', especially when you want to express surprise or annoyance at a statement that you disagree with.

example.ex: 'They all thought you were marvellous!' —'Well, hardly.'...
example.tran: “他们都认为你很棒！”“哦，不可能吧！”

example.ex: 'We could almost have seen it,' — 'Hardly, darling — in the dark and from a distance of a good hundred feet?'
