example.tran: “我们几乎都看到它了。”“不会吧，亲爱的——天那么黑，离得又至少有100英尺呢！”

collins.def: If something improves or if you improve it, it gets better.

example.ex: Both the texture and condition of your hair should improve...
example.tran: 你头发的发质与健康状况都应改善。

example.ex: The weather is beginning to improve...
example.tran: 天气开始好转了。

collins.def: If a skill you have improves or you improve a skill, you get better at it.

example.ex: Their French has improved enormously...
example.tran: 他们的法语进步很大。

example.ex: He said he was going to improve his football.
example.tran: 他说他要提高足球技术。

collins.def: If you improve after an illness or an injury, your health gets better or you get stronger.

example.ex: He had improved so much the doctor had cut his dosage.
example.tran: 他康复很快,医生已减少了用药剂量。

collins.def: If you improve on a previous achievement of your own or of someone else, you achieve a better standard or result.

example.ex: We need to improve on our performance against France.
example.tran: 我们需要比对阵法国队时表现得更好。

means: （思想、观点、文章主题等的）表现
（英国）对儿童进行特殊教育评估认定
申请（小孩）有特殊教育需要

collins.tran: (正式或明确的口头或书面)陈述，声明
collins.def: A statement is something that you say or write which gives information in a formal or definite way.

example.ex: Andrew now disowns that statement, saying he was depressed when he made it...
example.tran: 安德鲁现在推翻了那个说法，说那是自己在情绪低落时说的话。

example.ex: 'Things are moving ahead.'— I found that statement vague and unclear.
example.tran: “事情正在取得进展。”——我认为这个说法含糊不清。

collins.tran: (为某一场合特别发表的)官方声明，正式声明
collins.def: A statement is an official or formal announcement that is issued on a particular occasion.

example.ex: The statement by the military denied any involvement in last night's attack.
example.tran: 军方发表声明称其和昨晚的袭击无任何关系。

collins.tran: (嫌疑人或证人向警方提供的)陈述，证词
collins.def: You can refer to the official account of events which a suspect or a witness gives to the police as a statement .

example.ex: The 350-page report was based on statements from witnesses to the events.
example.tran: 这份 350 页的报告是根据各位证人对这些事件的证词写成的。

collins.def: If you describe an action or thing as a statement, you mean that it clearly expresses a particular opinion or idea that you have.

example.ex: The following recipe is a statement of another kind—food is fun!
example.tran: 下面的食谱是另一种观点的表现——食物可以带来乐趣！

collins.def: A printed document showing how much money has been paid into and taken out of a bank or building society account is called a statement .

collins.tran: 证明(儿童)有特殊教育需求
collins.def: If a child is statemented, social services staff write a document stating that the child has special educational needs, and the local education authority has to make sure that everything that is necessary is provided for that child.

example.ex: Nearly a year later, it was agreed that Tom would be statemented...
example.tran: 近一年后，汤姆被批准将获得特殊教育。

example.ex: I had eight statemented children in my  class.
example.tran: 我的班里有 8 名需要接受特殊教育的孩子。

collins.def: Grey is the colour of ashes or of clouds on a rainy day.

example.ex: ...a grey suit.
example.tran: 灰色套装

collins.def: You use grey to describe the colour of people's hair when it changes from its original colour, usually as they get old.

example.ex: ...my grey hair...
example.tran: 我灰白的头发

example.ex: Eddie was going grey.
example.tran: 埃迪的头发开始变白了。

collins.def: If the weather is grey, there are many clouds in the sky and the light is dull.

example.ex: It was a grey, wet April Sunday.
example.tran: 这是4月一个阴雨绵绵的星期天。

collins.def: If you describe a situation as grey, you mean that it is dull, unpleasant, or difficult.

example.ex: Brazilians look gloomily forward to a New Year that even the president admits will be grey and cheerless.
example.tran: 展望新年，巴西人心情沮丧，甚至连总统都承认明年困难重重，不容乐观。

collins.tran: 单调乏味的；无特色的；不吸引人的
collins.def: If you describe someone or something as grey, you think that they are boring and unattractive, and very similar to other things or other people.

example.ex: ...little grey men in suits.
example.tran: 身着西服、缺乏个性的小个子男人们

collins.def: Journalists sometimes use grey to describe things concerning old people.

example.ex: There was further evidence of grey consumer power last week, when Ford revealed a car designed with elderly people in mind.
example.tran: 福特汽车公司为老年人设计的一款汽车于上周亮相，这进一步体现了老年消费者的购买力。

collins.def: Supreme is used in the title of a person or an official group to indicate that they are at the highest level in a particular organization or system.

example.ex: MacArthur was Supreme Commander for the allied powers in the Pacific.
example.tran: 麦克阿瑟将军曾是太平洋战区盟军的最高统帅。

example.ex: ...the Supreme Court.
example.tran: 最高法院

collins.def: You use supreme to emphasize that a quality or thing is very great.

example.ex: Her approval was of supreme importance...
example.tran: 她的认可是至关重要的。

example.ex: The lady conspired to seize supreme power.
example.tran: 该女士图谋攫取最高权力。

means: 你的正常或健康的情况

collins.tran: 你自己;您自己;你们自己
collins.def: A speaker or writer uses yourself to refer to the person that they are talking or writing to. Yourself is used when the object of a verb or preposition refers to the same person as the subject of the verb.

example.ex: Have the courage to be honest with yourself and about yourself...
example.tran: 要有勇气对自己坦诚，同时对别人也要开诚布公。

example.ex: Your baby depends on you to look after yourself properly while you are pregnant...
example.tran: 你怀孕的时候，你的孩子指望着你好好照顾自己。

collins.tran: （用于强调所指对象）你自己，你本人，你们自己，你们本人
collins.def: You use yourself to emphasize the person that you are referring to.

example.ex: They mean to share the business between them, after you yourself are gone, Sir...
example.tran: 先生，他们两个打算等您本人离开后瓜分这个企业。

example.ex: I've been wondering if you yourselves have any idea why she came.
example.tran: 我一直在想，你们自己是否知道她为什么来。

collins.tran: （代替作宾语的you，用于强调或表示礼貌）你（自己），你们（自己）
collins.def: You use yourself instead of 'you' for emphasis or in order to be more polite when 'you' is the object of a verb or preposition.

example.ex: A wealthy man like yourself is bound to make an enemy or two along the way...
example.tran: 像你这样的有钱人，一路走来注定会结下一两个仇人的。

example.ex: I wouldn't want to cause such important people as yourselves any bother.
example.tran: 我不想给你们这样的大人物添任何麻烦。

means: 竞选提神（或兴奋）剂（一种健怡可乐，饮用后能使人精力充沛地从事竞选活动）

collins.def: Fuel is a substance such as coal, oil, or petrol that is burned to provide heat or power.

example.ex: They ran out of fuel.
example.tran: 他们的燃料用完了。

example.ex: ...industrial research into cleaner fuels.
example.tran: 对更清洁燃料的工业研究

collins.tran: 刺激;使变得更糟;使加剧
collins.def: To fuel a situation means to make it become worse or more intense.

example.ex: The result will inevitably fuel speculation about the Prime Minister's future...
example.tran: 这一结果将不可避免地加剧人们对首相未来的揣测。

example.ex: The economic boom was fueled by easy credit.
example.tran: 宽松的信贷政策刺激了经济繁荣。

collins.def: If something adds fuel to a conflict or debate, or adds fuel to the fire, it makes the conflict or debate more intense.

example.ex: His comments are bound to add fuel to the debate...
example.tran: 他的话必将为争论推波助澜。

example.ex: The decision to raise tariffs on imports will only add fuel to the fire.
example.tran: 上调进口关税的决定只会火上浇油。

collins.def: If you are careful, you give serious attention to what you are doing, in order to avoid harm, damage, or mistakes. If you are careful to do something, you make sure that you do it.

example.ex: Be very careful with this stuff, it can be dangerous if it isn't handled properly...
example.tran: 这东西一定要小心,稍不注意的话就会有危险。

example.ex: Careful on those stairs!...
example.tran: 走那几段楼梯要当心!

collins.def: Careful work, thought, or examination is thorough and shows a concern for details.

example.ex: He has decided to prosecute her after careful consideration of all the relevant facts...
example.tran: 在认真考虑了所有相关事实后,他决定起诉她。

example.ex: What we now know about the disease was learned by careful study of diseased organs.
example.tran: 我们目前对该疾病的认识是通过对病变器官的仔细研究得来的。

collins.def: If you tell someone to be careful about doing something, you think that what they intend to do is probably wrong, and that they should think seriously before they do it.

example.ex: I think you should be careful about talking of the rebels as heroes...
example.tran: 我觉得你说话应该小心,不能把反叛分子当英雄。

example.ex: It is important, I think, for everyone to be careful about claiming victory.
example.tran: 我想,每个人宣布胜利时都应该慎重。

collins.def: If you are careful with something such as money or resources, you use or spend only what is necessary.

example.ex: You will have to make a special effort to train your child to be careful with her pocket-money...
example.tran: 你得格外注意培养孩子的节俭意识，零花钱要省着花。

example.ex: It would force industries to be more careful with natural resources.
example.tran: 这将迫使企业更加节约资源。

collins.tran: 越谨慎越好;再小心也不为过
collins.def: You can say 'You can't be too careful' as a way of advising someone to be careful, even when this seems unnecessary.

example.ex: You can't be too careful when a young child is near water.
example.tran: 孩子在水边时,还是越小心越好。

collins.tran: 定时的;定期的;有规律的
collins.def: Regular events have equal amounts of time between them, so that they happen, for example, at the same time each day or each week.

example.ex: Take regular exercise...
example.tran: 定期进行锻炼。

example.ex: Now it's time for our regular look at the world of international sport...
example.tran: 现在我们再来关注一下国际体坛的消息。

collins.def: Regular events happen often.

example.ex: ...after a morning punctuated by regular volleys of gunfire...
example.tran: 过了枪声阵阵的早上之后

example.ex: This condition usually clears up with regular shampooing.
example.tran: 这种情形通常多用香波洗洗头即可消除。

collins.def: If you are, for example, a regular customer at a shop or a regular visitor to a place, you go there often.

example.ex: 'Tell me, Mr Mentakis, was Mrs Savalas one of your regular customers?'...
example.tran: “告诉我，门塔基斯先生，萨瓦拉斯夫人是您的常客吗？”

example.ex: She has become a regular visitor to Houghton Hall.
example.tran: 她已经成了霍顿府的常客。

collins.tran: 常客;老顾客;固定成员;正式成员
collins.def: The regulars at a place or in a team are the people who often go to the place or are often in the team.

example.ex: Regulars at his local pub have set up a fund to help out...
example.tran: 经常光顾他的酒吧的人伸出援手成立了一个基金会。

example.ex: I wasn't one of their regulars.
example.tran: 我并不是他们的正式成员。

collins.def: You use regular when referring to the thing, person, time, or place that is usually used by someone. For example, someone's regular place is the place where they usually sit.

example.ex: The man sat at his regular table near the window.
example.tran: 这个人坐在他固定的靠窗的位置。

example.ex: ...samples from one of their regular suppliers.
example.tran: 他们的一个固定供货商提供的样品

collins.def: A regular rhythm consists of a series of sounds or movements with equal periods of time between them.

example.ex: ...a very regular beat...
example.tran: 非常规律的节拍

example.ex: He stood in the doorway, listening to her quiet, regular breathing.
example.tran: 他站在走道里，听着她那沉静而规律的呼吸声。

collins.def: Regular is used to mean 'normal'.

example.ex: The product looks and burns like a regular cigarette...
example.tran: 这种产品看起来和点燃后都与常见的香烟没什么两样。

example.ex: He describes himself as just a regular guy from suburban Chicago.
example.tran: 他说自己就是一个从芝加哥郊区来的普通人。

collins.tran: (饮品或食物)分量适中的，中份的
collins.def: In some restaurants, a regular drink or quantity of food is of medium size.

example.ex: ...a cheeseburger and regular fries.
example.tran: 一个奶酪汉堡和中份薯条

collins.tran: 整齐排列的;（空距）均匀的
collins.def: A regular pattern or arrangement consists of a series of things with equal spaces between them.

example.ex: ...strange small rounded sandy hillocks, that look as if they've been scattered in a regular pattern on the ground.
example.tran: 奇怪的圆形小沙丘，看上去好像是被整齐地散放在地上似的

example.ex: ...regular rows of wooden huts.
example.tran: 整齐的一排排小木屋

collins.def: If something has a regular shape, both halves are the same and it has straight edges or a smooth outline.

example.ex: ...some regular geometrical shape.
example.tran: 一些对称的几何图形

collins.def: Regular troops are professional soldiers who are a permanent part of an official national army.

example.ex: Most schemes attempt to reduce the cost of defence through a smaller regular army...
example.tran: 大多数方案都试图通过缩减常备军的规模来降低国防支出。

example.ex: Only about a third of the reinforcements will be regular troops.
example.tran: 增援部队中仅有约1/3是常备军。

collins.tran: (语法中)按规则变化的，规则的
collins.def: In grammar, a regular verb, noun, or adjective inflects in the same way as most verbs, nouns, or adjectives in the language.
The style of something is the general way in which it is done or presented, which often shows the attitudes of the people involved.

example.ex: Our children's different needs and learning styles created many problems...
example.tran: 孩子们不同的需求和学习方式给我们带来了许多问题。

example.ex: Belmont Park is a broad sweeping track which will suit the European style of running...
example.tran: 贝尔蒙特跑马场有宽阔的弧形跑道，很适合举行欧式赛马。

collins.def: If people or places have style, they are smart and elegant.

example.ex: Bournemouth, you have to admit, has style...
example.tran: 你不得不承认伯恩茅斯是个很有格调的地方。

example.ex: Both love doing things in style...
example.tran: 两人行事都讲究风度。

collins.def: The style of a product is its design.

example.ex: His 50 years of experience have given him strong convictions about style...
example.tran: 50 年的经验使得他在款式上有自己的独到见解。

example.ex: Several styles of hat were available.
example.tran: 帽子有几种款式。

collins.tran: (某群艺术家或某文艺时期的)风格
collins.def: In the arts, a particular style is characteristic of a particular period or group of people.

example.ex: ...six scenes in the style of a classical Greek tragedy.
example.tran: 6 个古典希腊悲剧式的场景

example.ex: ...a mixture of musical styles.
example.tran: 音乐风格的混搭

collins.def: If something such as a piece of clothing, a vehicle, or someone's hair is styled in a particular way, it is designed or shaped in that way.

example.ex: His thick blond hair had just been styled before his trip.
example.tran: 他在旅行前刚把浓密的金发修剪了一番。

example.ex: ...classically styled clothes.
example.tran: 式样传统的衣服

collins.tran: 不是…的风格;不符合…的喜好
collins.def: If you say that something is not someone's style, you mean that it is not the way in which they usually do things, or it is different from the sort of thing they usually like.

example.ex: Mr Blair was not off guard. That is not his style...
example.tran: 布莱尔先生没有放松警惕，这不是他的风格。

example.ex: To be honest, the house is not quite our style.
example.tran: 说实话，这房子我们不是非常喜欢。

collins.def: An item is one of a collection or list of objects.

example.ex: The most valuable item on show will be a Picasso drawing...
example.tran: 展览会上最贵重的展品是毕加索的一幅素描。

example.ex: The menu includes the occasional off-beat item.
example.tran: 菜单中包括了偶尔会有的非传统菜肴。

collins.def: An item is one of a list of things for someone to do, deal with, or talk about.

example.ex: The other item on the agenda is the tour.
example.tran: 日程中的另一项是旅游。

collins.tran: 一篇报道(或文章);(新闻等的)一条,一则
collins.def: An item is a report or article in a newspaper or magazine, or on television or radio.

example.ex: There was an item in the paper about him.
example.tran: 报纸上有一条关于他的报道。

collins.def: If you say that two people are an item, you mean that they are having a romantic or sexual relationship.

example.ex: She and Gino were an item.
example.tran: 她和吉诺曾是一对。

collins.def: A  mark is a small area of something such as dirt that has accidentally got onto a surface or piece of clothing.

example.ex: The dogs are always rubbing against the wall and making dirty marks...
example.tran: 那些狗老是往墙上蹭，留下了斑斑污迹。

example.ex: A properly fitting bra should never leave red marks.
example.tran: 合适的胸罩不会留下红色勒痕。

collins.def: If something marks a surface, or if the surface marks, the surface is damaged by marks or a mark.

example.ex: Leather overshoes were put on the horses' hooves to stop them marking the turf...
example.tran: 马蹄上套了皮套子，以免弄脏赛马场。

example.ex: I have to be more careful with the work tops, as wood marks easily.
example.tran: 我必须格外小心使用操作台，因为木头容易留下污迹。

collins.def: A mark is a written or printed symbol, for example a letter of the alphabet.

example.ex: He made marks with a pencil.
example.tran: 他用铅笔做了记号。

collins.tran: 标示;为…作记号;为…作标记
collins.def: If you mark something with a particular word or symbol, you write that word or symbol on it.

example.ex: The bank marks the check 'certified'...
example.tran: 银行在支票上标有“保付”的字样。

example.ex: Mark the frame with your postcode...
example.tran: 在这一格里写上你的邮政编码。

collins.def: A mark is a point that is given for a correct answer or for doing something well in an exam or competition. A mark can also be a written symbol such as a letter that indicates how good a student's or competitor's work or performance is.

example.ex: ...a simple scoring device of marks out of 10, where '1' equates to 'Very poor performance'...
example.tran: 简单的十分评分制，其中“1”即“极差”

example.ex: Candidates who answered 'b' could be awarded half marks for demonstrating some understanding of the process...
example.tran: 回答b的选手表明对这个过程有所了解，因此可以得到一半的分数。

collins.def: If someone gets good or high marks for doing something, they have done it well. If they get poor or low marks, they have done it badly.

example.ex: You have to give her top marks for moral guts...
example.tran: 你不得不对她维护正义的勇气竖起大拇指。

example.ex: His administration has earned low marks for its economic policies.
example.tran: 他的班子在经济政策上所获评价很低。

collins.def: When a teacher marks a student's work, the teacher decides how good it is and writes a number or letter on it to indicate this opinion.

example.ex: He was marking essays in his small study.
example.tran: 他正在他那间小书房里批阅文章。

collins.def: A particular mark is a particular number, point, or stage which has been reached or might be reached, especially a significant one.

example.ex: Unemployment is rapidly approaching the one million mark.
example.tran: 失业人数正迅速逼近百万大关。

collins.def: The mark of something is the characteristic feature that enables you to recognize it.

example.ex: The mark of a civilized society is that it looks after its weakest members.
example.tran: 文明社会的特征是照顾最弱势群体。

collins.tran: （品质、情感、情景的）标志，表现，迹象
collins.def: If you say that a type of behaviour or an event is a mark of a particular quality, feeling, or situation, you mean it shows that that quality, feeling, or situation exists.

example.ex: It was a mark of his unfamiliarity with Hollywood that he didn't understand that an agent was paid out of his client's share...
example.tran: 他居然不知道经纪人的报酬得从其客户的收入中出，这说明他对好莱坞太不了解了。

example.ex: Shopkeepers closed their shutters as a mark of respect.
example.tran: 店主们暂时停业以示敬意。

collins.def: If something marks a place or position, it shows where something else is or where it used to be.

example.ex: A huge crater marks the spot where the explosion happened.
example.tran: 巨大的弹坑标明了爆炸发生的地点。

example.ex: ...the river which marks the border with Thailand.
example.tran: 标明了与泰国分界线的河

collins.def: An event that marks a particular stage or point is a sign that something different is about to happen.

example.ex: The announcement marks the end of an extraordinary period in European history...
example.tran: 声明标志着欧洲历史上一个伟大时代的终结。

example.ex: That programme received critical acclaim and marked a turning point in Sonita's career.
example.tran: 那个项目赢得了评论界的好评，成为索尼塔事业的转折点。

collins.def: If you do something to mark an event or occasion, you do it to show that you are aware of the importance of the event or occasion.

example.ex: The four new stamps mark the 100th anniversary of the British Astronomical Association...
example.tran: 这四枚新邮票是为了纪念英国天文协会成立100周年而发行的。

example.ex: Hundreds of thousands of people took to the streets to mark the occasion.
example.tran: 数十万人走上街头庆祝这一时刻。

collins.tran: 是…的特色;是…的典型特征
collins.def: If a particular quality or feature marks something, it is a quality or feature which that thing typically has.

example.ex: Tragedy has marked Wilmette's life...
example.tran: 悲剧笼罩着薇尔梅特的一生。

example.ex: The style is marked by simplicity, clarity, and candor.
example.tran: 这种风格的特点是简洁、清楚、直截了当。

collins.tran: 将…归为;把…列为;给…确定性质
collins.def: Something that marks someone as a particular type of person indicates that they are that type of person.

example.ex: Her opposition to abortion and feminism mark her as a convinced traditionalist.
example.tran: 她对堕胎和女权主义的反对态度表明她是个不折不扣的传统主义者。

collins.def: In a team game, when a defender is marking an attacker, they are trying to stay close to the attacker and prevent them from getting the ball.

example.ex: ...Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand, who so effectively marked Michael Owen.
example.tran: 成功盯住了迈克尔·欧文的曼联后卫里奥·费迪南德

collins.tran: 马克(德国使用欧元之前的货币单位)
collins.def: The mark was the unit of money used in Germany before it was replaced by the euro.

example.ex: The government gave 30 million marks for new school books.
example.tran: 政府拨款3000万马克用于购置学校的新教材。

collins.tran: (煤气炉上表示温度的)刻度，挡
collins.def: Mark is used before a number to indicate a particular temperature level in a gas oven.

example.ex: Set the oven  at gas mark 4.
example.tran: 将煤气炉开至4挡。

collins.def: Mark is used before a number to indicate a particular version or model of a vehicle, machine, or device.

example.ex: ...his Mark II Ford Cortina.
example.tran: 他的福特葛天娜二代车

collins.tran: 留下深刻的印记;留下深远的影响
collins.def: If someone or something leaves their mark or leaves a mark, they have a lasting effect on another person or thing.

example.ex: Years of conditioning had left their mark on her, and she never felt inclined to talk to strange men.
example.tran: 多年的熏陶对她影响很深，她从不愿意跟陌生人说话。

collins.tran: 成就不凡;获得名望;成名
collins.def: If you make your mark or make a mark, you become noticed or famous by doing something impressive or unusual.

example.ex: She made her mark in the film industry in the 1960s.
example.tran: 她在20世纪60年代的电影界占有一席之地。

collins.tran: （理解力或反应）敏捷的/迟钝的，灵敏的/缓慢的
collins.def: If you are quick off the mark, you are quick to understand or respond to something. If you are slow off the mark, you are slow to understand or respond to something.
On your marks in British English, or on your mark in American English, is a command given to runners at the beginning of a race in order to get them into the correct position to start.

example.ex: On your marks—get set—go!
example.tran: 各就各位！预备！跑！

collins.tran: 不正确;不得要领;不够贴切/完全正确;切中要害;十分贴切
collins.def: If something is off the mark, it is inaccurate or incorrect. If it is on the mark, it is accurate or correct.

example.ex: Robinson didn't think the story was so far off the mark...
example.tran: 鲁宾逊认为这个报道根本算不上离谱。

example.ex: He's right on the mark about movies being out of step with American culture.
example.tran: 他认为电影正在偏离美国文化的看法完全正确。

collins.def: If something is up to the mark, it is good enough.

example.ex: The workers get rid of those whose work is not up to the mark.
example.tran: 工人们赶走了工作不符合要求的人。

collins.def: If something such as a claim or estimate is wide of the mark, it is incorrect or inaccurate.

example.ex: That comparison isn't as wide of the mark as it seems.
example.tran: 那种比较并非像看起来那么离谱。

collins.def: You can say mark you to emphasize and draw attention to something you have just said.

example.ex: We're not extremists, mark you.
example.tran: 你听好了，我们不是极端分子。

means: （纸牌中的）王后， （国际象棋中的）后

collins.def: A queen is a woman who rules a country as its monarch.

example.ex: ...Queen Victoria...
example.tran: 维多利亚女王

example.ex: She met the Queen last week.
example.tran: 上周她受到了女王的接见。

collins.def: A queen is a woman who is married to a king.

example.ex: The king and queen had fled.
example.tran: 国王和王后都逃之夭夭了。

collins.tran: (某一活动的)女王，出众的女子
collins.def: If you refer to a woman as the queen of a particular activity, you mean that she is well-known for being very good at it.

example.ex: ...the queen of crime writing.
example.tran: 犯罪小说女王

collins.def: A queen is a male homosexual who dresses and speaks rather like a woman.
In chess, the queen is the most powerful piece. It can be moved in any direction.
A queen is a playing card with a picture of a queen on it.

example.ex: ...the queen of spades.
example.tran: 黑桃王后

collins.def: A queen or a queen bee is a large female bee which can lay eggs.
You use mainly when mentioning the main reason or thing involved in something.

example.ex: The stock-market scandal is refusing to go away, mainly because there's still no consensus over how it should be dealt with...
example.tran: 股票市场的丑闻迟迟没有消散，这主要是因为人们仍未就如何应对它达成共识。

example.ex: The birds live mainly on nectar.
example.tran: 这些鸟主要以花蜜为食。

collins.def: You use mainly when you are referring to a group and stating something that is true of most of it.

example.ex: The African half of the audience was mainly from Senegal or Mali...
example.tran: 观众中有一半是非洲人，其中大多数来自塞内加尔或马里。

example.ex: The spacious main bedroom is mainly blue.
example.tran: 宽敞的主卧室以蓝色为主色调。

collins.def: A feeling is an emotion, such as anger or happiness.

example.ex: It gave me a feeling of satisfaction...
example.tran: 这给了我一种满足感。

example.ex: Strong feelings of pride welled up in me...
example.tran: 我心中涌起强烈的自豪感。

collins.def: Your feelings about something are the things that you think and feel about it, or your attitude towards it.

example.ex: She has strong feelings about the alleged growth in violence against female officers...
example.tran: 据称针对女警的暴力事件有所增加，她对此十分愤慨。

example.ex: I have also begun to reassess my own feelings about being a woman...
example.tran: 我也开始重新审视自己对身为女性的感受。

collins.tran: (可能造成困扰、伤害或难堪的)感情
collins.def: When you refer to someone's feelings, you are talking about the things that might embarrass, offend, or upset them. For example, if you hurt someone's feelings, you upset them by something that you say or do.

example.ex: He was afraid of hurting my feelings...
example.tran: 他怕伤了我的心。

example.ex: He has no respect, no regard for anyone's feelings...
example.tran: 他不尊重，也不顾及别人的感受。

collins.def: Feeling is a way of thinking and reacting to things which is emotional and not planned rather than logical and practical.

example.ex: He was prompted to a rare outburst of feeling.
example.tran: 他被惹得情绪非常激动，这很少见。

example.ex: ...a voice that trembles with feeling.
example.tran: 激动得发颤的声音

collins.def: Feeling for someone is love, affection, sympathy, or concern for them.

example.ex: Thomas never lost his feeling for Harriet...
example.tran: 托马斯对哈丽雅特的爱从未消逝。

example.ex: It's incredible that Peter can behave with such stupid lack of feeling.
example.tran: 彼得行事如此麻木不仁，真是难以置信。

collins.def: If you have a feeling of hunger, tiredness, or other physical sensation, you experience it.

example.ex: I also had a strange feeling in my neck...
example.tran: 我的脖子感觉也很奇怪。

example.ex: Focus on the feeling of relaxation...
example.tran: 全身心体会放松的感觉。

collins.def: Feeling in part of your body is the ability to experience the sense of touch in this part of the body.

example.ex: After the accident he had no feeling in his legs.
example.tran: 事故过后，他的腿丧失了知觉。

collins.def: If you have a feeling that something is the case or that something is going to happen, you think that is probably the case or that it is probably going to happen.

example.ex: I have a feeling that everything will come right for us one day...
example.tran: 我有种感觉，事情总有一天会变得对我们有利的。

example.ex: You have a feeling about people, and I just felt she was going to be good.
example.tran: 人总会对其他人有某种感觉，我就觉得她会是个好人。

collins.def: Feeling is used to refer to a general opinion that a group of people has about something.

example.ex: There is still some feeling in the art world that the market for such works may be declining...
example.tran: 艺术界一些人仍然认为，这类艺术品的市场可能趋于低迷。

example.ex: It seemed that anti-Fascist feeling was not being encouraged.
example.tran: 看来反法西斯情绪并未受到鼓励。

collins.def: If you have a feeling of being in a particular situation, you feel that you are in that situation.

example.ex: I had the terrible feeling of being left behind to bring up the baby while he had fun.
example.tran: 我感觉糟糕透顶，我被留下抚养孩子，而他却在寻欢作乐。

collins.def: If you have a feeling for something, you have an understanding of it or a natural ability to do it.

example.ex: Try to get a feeling for the people who live here...
example.tran: 试着去理解在这片土地上生息的人们。

example.ex: You seem to have a feeling for drawing.
example.tran: 看来你有绘画的天赋。

collins.tran: (地方或书本营造的)气氛，氛围
collins.def: If something such as a place or book creates a particular kind of feeling, it creates a particular kind of atmosphere.

example.ex: That's what we tried to portray in the book, this feeling of opulence and grandeur.
example.tran: 那就是我们在书中竭力描绘的——一种富丽堂皇的气派。

collins.def: Bad feeling or ill feeling is bitterness or anger which exists between people, for example after they have had an argument.

example.ex: There's been some bad feeling between the two families.
example.tran: 两家人之前有过节。

collins.def: Hard feelings are feelings of anger or bitterness towards someone who you have had an argument with or who has upset you. If you say 'no hard feelings', you are making an agreement with someone not to be angry or bitter about something.

example.ex: I don't want any hard feelings between our companies...
example.tran: 我不想我们两个公司间存有什么芥蒂。

example.ex: He held out his large hand. 'No hard feelings, right?'
example.tran: 他伸出大手：“不生气，对吧？”

collins.tran: 我知道那种滋味;我理解那种感受
collins.def: You say 'I know the feeling' to show that you understand or feel sorry about a problem or difficult experience that someone is telling you about.
If you have mixed feelings about something or someone, you feel uncertain about them because you can see both good and bad points about them.

means: 用血染（皮革等），用血弄湿
让新人初试做某事，使先取得经验

collins.def: Blood is the red liquid that flows inside your body, which you can see if you cut yourself.
You can use blood to refer to the race or social class of someone's parents or ancestors.

example.ex: There was Greek blood in his veins...
example.tran: 他有希腊血统。

example.ex: He was of noble blood, and an officer.
example.tran: 他出身贵族，是一名军官。

collins.def: If you say that there is bad blood between people, you mean that they have argued about something and dislike each other.

example.ex: There is, it seems, some bad blood between Mills and the Baldwins.
example.tran: 米尔斯和鲍德温一家人好像有些不和。

collins.def: If you say that people are baying for blood, you mean that they are demanding that someone should be hurt or punished.

example.ex: And so what will he say to those who have been baying for his blood?
example.tran: 那么，他又会对那些一直强烈要求制裁他的人说些什么呢？

collins.def: If you say that someone has blue blood, you mean that they are from a family that has a high social rank.

collins.tran: 使怒不可遏；使怒火中烧
collins.def: If you say that something makes your blood boil, you are emphasizing that it makes you very angry.

example.ex: It makes my blood boil to think two thugs decided to pick on an innocent young girl.
example.tran: 一想到两个暴徒要欺负一个天真的小姑娘，我就满腔怒火。

collins.tran: 冷酷无情地；冷血地；残忍地
collins.def: If something violent and cruel is done in cold blood, it is done deliberately and in an unemotional way.

example.ex: The crime had been committed in cold blood.
example.tran: 这一罪行极为残忍。

collins.tran: 使人不寒而栗；令人毛骨悚然
collins.def: If you say that something makes your blood run cold or makes your blood freeze, you mean that it makes you feel very frightened.

example.ex: The rage in his eyes made her blood run cold...
example.tran: 他眼中的怒火吓得她汗毛倒竖。

example.ex: He could hear a sudden roaring. His blood froze.
example.tran: 他听到突如其来的一声吼叫，吓得魂不附体。

collins.tran: 手上沾了…的血；对…的死难辞其咎
collins.def: If you say that someone has a person's  blood on their hands, you mean that they are responsible for that person's death.

example.ex: He has my son's  blood on his hands. I hope it haunts him for the rest of his days.
example.tran: 他手上沾了我儿子的血。我咒他余生不得安宁。

collins.tran: 天生的；遗传的；生来就有的
collins.def: If a quality or talent is in your blood, it is part of your nature, and other members of your family have it too.

example.ex: Diplomacy was in his blood: his ancestors had been feudal lords...
example.tran: 他天生擅长交际：他的祖先曾是封建领主。

example.ex: He has adventure in his blood.
example.tran: 他天生具备冒险基因。

collins.tran: 新鲜血液；新生力量；新成员
collins.def: You can use the expressions new blood ,fresh blood, or young blood to refer to people who are brought into an organization to improve it by thinking of new ideas or new ways of doing things.

example.ex: There's been a major reshuffle of the cabinet to bring in new blood...
example.tran: 内阁进行了重大改组，吸收了一些新鲜血液。

example.ex: The England selectors must start introducing young blood.
example.tran: 英格兰队的人才选拔委员会必须着手引入一些新生力量。

collins.tran: 向石取血，缘木求鱼（比喻很难办到或徒劳无功）
collins.def: If you say that doing something such as getting information or persuading someone to talk to you is like getting blood out of a stone or getting blood from a stone, you are emphasizing that it is very difficult and that people are not being very helpful. In American English, you can also say that it is like getting blood out of a turnip .
If you say that someone sweats blood trying to do something, you are emphasizing that they try very hard to do it.

example.ex: I had to sweat blood for an M.A.
example.tran: 我得拼命争取获得硕士学位。

collins.tran: 取得初步胜利；最先占上风
collins.def: If you say that someone draws first blood, you mean that they have had a success at the beginning of a competition or conflict.

example.ex: The home side drew first blood with a penalty from Murray Strang.
example.tran: 主场球队依靠默里·斯特朗的罚球而旗开得胜。

collins.def: If you refer to something as involving blood, sweat, and tears, you mean that it is a very hard thing to do and requires a lot of effort.

example.ex: Why do apparently sane people go through all the blood, sweat, tears and heartache involved in getting a PhD?
example.tran: 为什么那些看起来神志正常的人会拼了命地要拿到一个博士学位？

collins.tran: 血浓于水；家人总比外人亲
collins.def: People say 'blood is thicker than water' when they mean that their loyalty to their family is greater than their loyalty to anyone else.

example.ex: Families have their problems and jealousies, but blood is thicker than water.
example.tran: 家家有本难念的经，也都难免互生嫉妒，但总归血浓于水。

collins.def: If one thing is above another one, it is directly over it or higher than it.

example.ex: He lifted his hands above his head...
example.tran: 他将双手举过头顶。

example.ex: Apartment 46 was a quiet apartment, unlike the one above it...
example.tran: 和它楼上的那间不同，46号公寓很安静。

collins.def: In writing, you use above to refer to something that has already been mentioned or discussed.

example.ex: Several conclusions could be drawn from the results described above...
example.tran: 从上文描述的结果中可以得出几个结论。

example.ex: Full details are in the table above.
example.tran: 详细信息请见上文表格。

collins.def: If an amount or measurement is above a particular level, it is greater than that level.

example.ex: The temperature crept up to just above 40 degrees...
example.tran: 温度攀升至40度出头。

example.ex: Victoria Falls has had above average levels of rainfall this year...
example.tran: 维多利亚瀑布今年的降雨量超过了平均水平。

collins.def: If you hear one sound above another, it is louder or clearer than the second one.

example.ex: ...trying to talk above the noise...
example.tran: 努力使说话声高过噪音

example.ex: Then there was a woman's voice, rising shrilly above the barking.
example.tran: 接着，一个女人的尖厉声音盖过了犬吠声。

collins.def: If someone is above you, they are in a higher social position than you or in a position of authority over you.

example.ex: I know you're above me socially, but I must say I find your attitude offensive...
example.tran: 我明白你的社会地位比我高，但我得说我觉得你的态度很粗鲁。

example.ex: I married above myself — rich county people...
example.tran: 我高攀了一门亲事，是县里的富有人家。

collins.def: If you say that someone is getting above themself, you disapprove of them because they think they are better than everyone else.

example.ex: I just think you're getting a little bit above yourself.
example.tran: 我只是觉得你变得有点自视过高。

collins.def: If you say that someone thinks they are above something, you mean that they act as if they are too good or important for it.

example.ex: This was clearly a failure by someone who thought he was above failure...
example.tran: 这显然是认为自己根本不会失败的人所遭遇的一次失败。

example.ex: I'm not above doing my own cleaning.
example.tran: 我很乐意自己做扫除。

collins.tran: 不会受到（批评或怀疑）；超乎…之所及
collins.def: If someone is above criticism or suspicion, they cannot be criticized or suspected because of their good qualities or their position.

example.ex: The Queen remains above criticism, apart from the issue of her tax liability...
example.tran: 抛开她的纳税义务不谈，女王一直无可指摘。

example.ex: He was a respected academic and above suspicion.
example.tran: 他是位受人尊敬的学者，根本没有嫌疑。

collins.def: If you value one person or thing above any other, you value them more or consider that they are more important.

example.ex: ...his tendency to put the team above everything...
example.tran: 他把这个团队看得比什么都重要的倾向

example.ex: I want to be honest, honest above everything else.
example.tran: 我想要做到诚实，一切以诚实为上。

collins.tran: （表示有礼貌地请求或邀请）请，烦劳
collins.def: You say please when you are politely asking or inviting someone to do something.

example.ex: Can you help us please?...
example.tran: 能请你帮帮我们吗？

example.ex: Would you please open the door?...
example.tran: 请你开一下门好吗？

collins.def: You say please when you are accepting something politely.

example.ex: 'Tea?' — 'Yes, please.'...
example.tran: “要茶吗？”——“好的，谢谢。”

example.ex: 'You want an apple with your cheese?' — 'Please.'
example.tran: “要不要加个苹果和奶酪一起吃？”——“行啊。”

collins.tran: （表示要求对方停止做某事或别再开口）请别，请不必
collins.def: You can say please to indicate that you want someone to stop doing something or stop speaking. You would say this if, for example, what they are doing or saying makes you angry or upset.

example.ex: Please, Mary, this is all so unnecessary...
example.tran: 玛丽，请不要这样，这完全没必要。

example.ex: Isabella. Please. I don't have time for this.
example.tran: 伊莎贝拉，别再说了，我没有时间听这个。

collins.tran: （用于吸引对方注意、特别是儿童对老师或其他成人时）请问，对不起
collins.def: You can say please in order to attract someone's attention politely. Children in particular say 'please ' to attract the attention of a teacher or other adult.

example.ex: Please sir, can we have some more?...
example.tran: 请问，先生，我们能再要一些吗？

example.ex: Please, Miss Smith, a moment.
example.tran: 对不起，史密斯小姐，能耽误你一会儿吗？

collins.def: If someone or something pleases you, they make you feel happy and satisfied.

example.ex: More than anything, I want to please you...
example.tran: 最重要的是，我想让你高兴。

example.ex: Much of the food pleases rather than excites...
example.tran: 这些食物中许多只是让人满意，但并不让人兴奋。

collins.def: You use please in expressions such as as she pleases ,whatever you please, and anything he pleases to indicate that someone can do or have whatever they want.

example.ex: Women should be free to dress and act as they please...
example.tran: 女性应该有穿衣和行动的自由。

example.ex: He does whatever he pleases...
example.tran: 他想干什么就干什么。

collins.tran: （用于强调）极尽…，…的程度怎么说都不为过
collins.def: You can use as you please in expressions such as bold as you please or casually as you please or charming as you please in order to emphasize what you are saying.

example.ex: He walked by my table and, casually as you please, picked up my address book...
example.tran: 他走到我的桌旁，非常随意地拿起了我的通讯录。

example.ex: Bold as you please, she grabbed me by the sleeve.
example.tran: 她真够大胆的，竟抓住了我的衣袖。

collins.tran: （表示很有礼貌和正式地吸引对方注意或提出请求）对不起，烦请
collins.def: If you please is sometimes used as a very polite and formal way of attracting someone's attention or of asking them to do something.

example.ex: Ladies and gentlemen, if you please. Miss Taylor's going to play for us...
example.tran: 女士们，先生们，烦请泰勒小姐为我们表演。

example.ex: Sir Harry! Stop, if you please!
example.tran: 哈里爵士！对不起，请等一下！

collins.tran: （表示惊讶、恼怒或难以置信）竟然，你说怪不怪
collins.def: You can say if you please to indicate that a situation surprises or annoys you, or is difficult to believe.

example.ex: She was pretty unforthcoming. Made Sally wait till she'd cooked Selby's lunch, if you please.
example.tran: 她爱搭不理地把萨莉晾在一边，直到她为塞尔比做好午饭，你说怪不怪。

collins.tran: （无礼地表示不在意或不关心）请便，随你的便
collins.def: You say 'please yourself ' to indicate in a rather rude way that you do not mind or care whether the person you are talking to does a particular thing or not.

example.ex: 'Do you mind if I wait?' I asked. Melanie shrugged: 'Please yourself.'
example.tran: 我问道：“要不我等会儿吧？”梅拉妮耸耸肩说：“随你便。”

collins.def: A lawyer is a person who is qualified to advise people about the law and represent them in court.

example.ex: Prosecution and defense lawyers are expected to deliver closing arguments next week.
example.tran: 下周控辩双方律师将进行结案陈词。

collins.def: A bottle is a glass or plastic container in which drinks and other liquids are kept. Bottles are usually round with straight sides and a narrow top.

example.ex: There were two empty beer bottles on the table...
example.tran: 桌子上有两个空啤酒瓶。

example.ex: He was pulling the cork from a bottle of wine.
example.tran: 他正在启一瓶葡萄酒的瓶塞。

collins.def: To bottle a drink or other liquid means to put it into bottles after it has been made.

example.ex: This is a large truck which has equipment to automatically bottle the wine.
example.tran: 这是一辆大型卡车，拥有自动将葡萄酒装瓶的设备。

example.ex: ...bottled water.
example.tran: 瓶装水

collins.def: A bottle is a drinking container used by babies. It has a special rubber part at the top through which they can suck their drink.

example.ex: Gary was holding a bottle to the baby's lips.
example.tran: 加里正拿着一个奶瓶给婴儿喂奶。

collins.def: To bottle fruit means to put it into special jars, in order to preserve it.

example.ex: Did she do things like bottling fruit or making jam?
example.tran: 她干过将水果装瓶或做果酱之类的活计吗？

example.ex: ...bottled plums.
example.tran: 装罐贮藏的李子

collins.def: Bottle is used to refer to courage or boldness.

example.ex: But will anyone have the bottle to go through with it?
example.tran: 但是谁会有胆量经受这件事？

collins.def: If someone hits the bottle, they drink a lot of alcohol.

example.ex: After my mother died my father started hitting the bottle.
example.tran: 我母亲死后父亲开始酗酒。

collins.tran: （在最后时刻）因胆怯而放弃，打退堂鼓
collins.def: If you say that someone has bottled it, you mean that they have lost their courage at the last moment and have not done something they intended to do.

example.ex: He was scheduled to appear on the Russell Harty Show, but bottled it at the last minute.
example.tran: 他原定参加拉塞尔·哈蒂主持的节目，但在最后时刻打了退堂鼓。

means: 古希腊与古罗马的文化研究（尤指对其语言与文学的研究）

collins.def: A classic example of a thing or situation has all the features which you expect such a thing or situation to have.

example.ex: The debate in the mainstream press has been a classic example of British hypocrisy...
example.tran: 主流媒体上的辩论是英国式虚伪的典型例子。

example.ex: His first two goals were classic cases of being in the right place at the right time.
example.tran: 他的头两粒进球是站位和时机把握的典范。

collins.tran: (电影、著作、音乐)经典的，典范的，最优秀的
collins.def: A classic film, piece of writing, or piece of music is of very high quality and has become a standard against which similar things are judged.

example.ex: ...the classic children's film Huckleberry Finn.
example.tran: 经典儿童电影《哈克贝利·费恩历险记》

example.ex: ...a classic study of the American penal system.
example.tran: 对美国刑罚制度研究的典范

collins.def: A classic is a book which is well-known and considered to be of a high literary standard. You can refer to such books generally as the classics .

example.ex: As I grow older, I like to reread the classics regularly.
example.tran: 随着年龄渐长，我喜欢经常重读经典著作。

collins.def: Classic style is simple and traditional and is not affected by changes in fashion.

example.ex: Wear classic clothes which feel good and look good...
example.tran: 穿些舒适而又好看的传统服装。

example.ex: These are classic designs which will fit in well anywhere.
example.tran: 这是些百搭的古雅图案。

collins.def: A classic car is a model of car that is greatly admired because of its style, and is considered to be one of the best of its kind; used especially to talk about cars which are no longer being produced.

collins.tran: (尤指对古希腊、古罗马的语言、文学、哲学的)古典文化研究
collins.def: Classics is the study of the ancient Greek and Roman civilizations, especially their languages, literature, and philosophy.

example.ex: ...a Classics degree.
example.tran: 古典文化研究学位

collins.tran: 感兴趣的;有兴趣的;关心的
collins.def: If you are interested in something, you think it is important and want to learn more about it or spend time doing it.

example.ex: I thought she might be interested in Paula's proposal...
example.tran: 我觉得她对葆拉的提议可能会感兴趣。

example.ex: I think the young man is getting interested in gardening...
example.tran: 我认为这个年轻人开始对园艺产生兴趣了。

collins.tran: 有利害关系的;利益相关的;当事的
collins.def: An interested party or group of people is affected by or involved in a particular event or situation.

example.ex: All the interested parties eventually agreed to the idea.
example.tran: 所有利益相关方最终都同意了这一想法。

collins.def: An artist is someone who draws or paints pictures or creates sculptures as a job or a hobby.

example.ex: ...the studio of a great artist...
example.tran: 一个伟大的艺术家的工作室

example.ex: Each poster is signed by the artist...
example.tran: 每幅海报都有这个艺术家的签名。

collins.tran: 艺术家（如小说家、诗人、导演等）
collins.def: An artist is a person who creates novels, poems, films, or other things which can be considered as works of art.

example.ex: His books are enormously easy to read, yet he is a serious artist...
example.tran: 虽然他是一个不折不扣的艺术家，但是他的作品极其通俗易懂。

example.ex: Engel is quoted as saying that balanced people do not become artists.
example.tran: 引用恩格尔的话说就是理性的人是成不了艺术家的。

collins.def: An artist is a performer such as a musician, actor, or dancer.

example.ex: ...a popular artist who has sold millions of records.
example.tran: 唱片销量达到数百万张的当红音乐家

collins.def: If you say that someone is an artist at a particular activity, you mean they are very skilled at it.

example.ex: He is an exceptional footballer — an artist.
example.tran: 他是一名出色的足球运动员，一个足球高手。

collins.def: The hundredth item in a series is the one that you count as number one hundred.

example.ex: The bank celebrates its hundredth anniversary in December.
example.tran: 这家银行将于12月庆祝其成立100周年。

collins.def: A hundredth of something is one of a hundred equal parts of it.

example.ex: Mitchell beat Lewis by three-hundredths of a second.
example.tran: 米切尔以0.03秒的微弱优势赢了刘易斯。

means: （文章、照片等）跨两栏（或多栏）的

collins.def: If you spread something somewhere, you open it out or arrange it over a place or surface, so that all of it can be seen or used easily.

example.ex: She spread a towel on the sand and lay on it...
example.tran: 她在沙滩上铺了一条毛巾，躺在上面。

example.ex: His coat was spread over the bed.
example.tran: 他的外套摊在床上。

collins.tran: 伸出，张开,叉开(手臂、双手、手指、双腿等)
collins.def: If you spread your arms, hands, fingers, or legs, you stretch them out until they are far apart.

example.ex: Sitting on the floor, spread your legs as far as they will go without overstretching...
example.tran: 坐在地板上，在不要拉伤的前提下将双腿尽量分开。

example.ex: He stepped back and spread his hands wide. 'You are most welcome to our home.'
example.tran: 他往后退了一步，伸开双手。“非常欢迎你到我们家来。”

collins.def: If you spread a substance on a surface or spread the surface with the substance, you put a thin layer of the substance over the surface.

example.ex: Spread the mixture in the cake tin and bake for 30 minutes...
example.tran: 将混合物抹在蛋糕烤盘里，烘烤 30 分钟。

example.ex: A thick layer of wax was spread over the surface...
example.tran: 表面涂上了厚厚的一层蜡。

collins.def: Spread is a soft food which is put on bread.

example.ex: ...a wholemeal salad roll with low fat spread.
example.tran: 涂有低脂酱的全麦色拉面包卷

collins.def: If something spreads or is spread by people, it gradually reaches or affects a larger and larger area or more and more people.

example.ex: The industrial revolution which started a couple of hundred years ago in Europe is now spreading across the world.
example.tran: 两百多年前始于欧洲的工业革命目前正在向全世界传播。

example.ex: ...the sense of fear spreading in residential neighborhoods...
example.tran: 在住宅小区中蔓延的恐惧感

collins.def: If something such as a liquid, gas, or smoke spreads or is spread, it moves outwards in all directions so that it covers a larger area.

example.ex: Fire spread rapidly after a chemical truck exploded...
example.tran: 一辆装有化学品的卡车爆炸后，火势迅速蔓延。

example.ex: A dark red stain was spreading across his shirt...
example.tran: 一块深红色的污渍正在他的衬衫上渗开。

collins.tran: 将…分散(在一段时间内);分期做
collins.def: If you spread something over a period of time, it takes place regularly or continuously over that period, rather than happening at one time.

example.ex: There seems to be little difference whether you eat all your calorie allowance in one go, or spread it over the day...
example.tran: 不管你是一次性摄入全天的卡路里限量，还是在一天内分次摄入，结果好像没有多大差别。

example.ex: The course is spread over a five week period.
example.tran: 这门课将持续 5 周时间。

collins.def: If you spread something such as wealth or work, you distribute it evenly or equally.

example.ex: ...policies that spread the state's wealth more evenly...
example.tran: 更加平均地分配国家财富的政策

example.ex: The loss of jobs has been far more evenly spread across the regions than it was during the early 1980s.
example.tran: 失业数字在各地区之间的分布要比 20 世纪 80 年代初均衡多了。

collins.def: A spread of ideas, interests, or other things is a wide variety of them.

example.ex: A topic-based approach can be hard to assess in primary schools with a typical spread of ability...
example.tran: 因为学生的能力通常差异很大，基于话题的教学方法在小学里评估起来可能很难。

example.ex: We have an enormous spread of industries, mainly in the Home Counties and East Anglia.
example.tran: 我们拥有种类繁多的工业，主要位于伦敦周围各郡和东英吉利地区。

collins.tran: (尤指为某一特殊场合准备的)丰盛饭菜，盛宴
collins.def: A spread is a large meal, especially one that has been prepared for a special occasion.

collins.tran: (书籍、杂志、报纸中)横贯两版的篇幅
collins.def: A spread is two pages of a book, magazine, or newspaper that are opposite each other when you open it at a particular place.

example.ex: There was a double-page spread of a dinner for 46 people.
example.tran: 有一张横贯两版的、由 46 人参加的宴席的照片。

collins.def: Spread is used to refer to the difference between the price that a seller wants someone to pay for a particular stock or share and the price that the buyer is willing to pay.

example.ex: Market makers earn their livings from the spread between buying and selling prices.
example.tran: 做市商靠赚取买卖价差生存。

collins.def: A rich person has a lot of money or valuable possessions.

example.ex: You're going to be a very rich man...
example.tran: 你将会成为一个非常有钱的人。

example.ex: Their one aim in life is to get rich...
example.tran: 他们人生的一个目标就是要变成有钱人。

collins.def: Riches are valuable possessions or large amounts of money.

example.ex: An Olympic gold medal can lead to untold riches for an athlete...
example.tran: 一枚奥运金牌能给运动员带来无尽的财富。

example.ex: Some people want fame or riches — I just wanted a baby.
example.tran: 有人希望得到名望，有人希望获得财富——我只想要个孩子。

collins.def: A rich country has a strong economy and produces a lot of wealth, so many people who live there have a high standard of living.

example.ex: There is hunger in many parts of the world, even in rich countries.
example.tran: 世界上很多地方，甚至在富有的国家里，都有人忍饥挨饿。

collins.def: If you talk about the earth's riches, you are referring to things that exist naturally in large quantities and that are useful and valuable, for example minerals, wood, and oil.

example.ex: ...Russia's vast natural riches.
example.tran: 俄罗斯丰富的自然资源

example.ex: ...the oil riches of the Middle East.
example.tran: 中东的石油资源

collins.def: If something is rich in a useful or valuable substance or is a rich source of it, it contains a lot of it.

example.ex: Liver and kidney are particularly rich in vitamin A...
example.tran: 肝脏和肾脏的维生素A含量尤其丰富。

example.ex: Fish is a rich source of protein.
example.tran: 鱼肉富含蛋白质。

collins.def: Rich food contains a lot of fat or oil.

example.ex: ...the hearty, rich foods of Gascony...
example.tran: 加斯科涅丰盛而油腻的食物

example.ex: Additional cream would make it too rich.
example.tran: 再加奶油会让它过于油腻。

collins.def: Rich soil contains large amounts of substances that make it good for growing crops or flowers in.

example.ex: Farmers grow rice in the rich soil.
example.tran: 农民们在肥沃的土地上种植稻子。

collins.def: A rich deposit of a mineral or other substance is a large amount of it.

example.ex: ...the country's rich deposits of the metal, lithium.
example.tran: 这个国家丰富的锂金属矿藏

collins.tran: 充满（幽默感、创意等）的;（信息）丰富的
collins.def: If you say that something is a rich vein or source of something such as humour, ideas, or information, you mean that it can provide a lot of that thing.

example.ex: The director discovered a rich vein of sentimentality...
example.tran: 导演发现了一个丰富的情感源泉。

example.ex: My collection of Victorian literature turned out to be a rich and often hilarious source of information.
example.tran: 我收藏的维多利亚时代的文学作品竟成了一个资源丰富的信息宝库，而且内容常常令人捧腹。

collins.tran: (气味)浓郁的，香浓的;(颜色)浓艳的，强烈的，鲜艳的;（声音）低沉的，浑厚的
collins.def: Rich smells are strong and very pleasant. Rich colours and sounds are deep and very pleasant.

example.ex: ...a rich and luxuriously perfumed bath essence.
example.tran: 香味浓郁的沐浴香精

example.ex: ...an attractive, glossy rich red colour.
example.tran: 迷人而富有光泽的艳红色

collins.def: A rich life or history is one that is interesting because it is full of different events and activities.

example.ex: A rich and varied cultural life is essential for this couple.
example.tran: 丰富多样的文化生活对这对夫妇而言至关重要。

example.ex: ...the rich history of the island...
example.tran: 这个岛屿灿烂的历史

collins.tran: (收藏或混合物)丰富的，各种各样的
collins.def: A rich collection or mixture contains a wide and interesting variety of different things.

example.ex: Visitors can view a rich and colorful array of aquatic plants and animals...
example.tran: 游客们可以看到一系列各种各样、色彩斑斓的水生动植物。

example.ex: Australia has a rich cultural mix.
example.tran: 澳大利亚拥有丰富多样的文化。

collins.tran: 不合情理的;荒谬的;荒唐的
collins.def: If you say that something a person says or does is rich, you are making fun of it because you think it is a surprising and inappropriate thing for them to say or do.

example.ex: Gil says that women can't keep secrets. That's rich, coming from him, the professional sneak.
example.tran: 吉尔说女人不能保守秘密。这话从他这样一个整天打小报告的人嘴里说出来真是太荒谬了。

collins.def: If you say that someone is filthy rich or stinking rich, you disapprove of them because they have a lot of money.

example.ex: He's stinking rich, and with no more talent than he ever had before.
example.tran: 他现在已经有几个臭钱了，但仍然和以前一样没什么才能。

example.ex: ...a handful of filthy rich young men who work eight months a year.
example.tran: 少数几个每年只工作8个月的腰缠万贯的年轻人

collins.def: The thirtieth item in a series is the one that you count as number thirty.
A trip is a journey that you make to a particular place.

example.ex: On the Thursday we went out on a day trip...
example.tran: 星期四我们出去玩了一天。

example.ex: Mark was sent to the Far East on a business trip.
example.tran: 马克被派往远东出差。

collins.def: If you trip when you are walking, you knock your foot against something and fall or nearly fall.

example.ex: She tripped and fell last night and broke her hip...
example.tran: 她昨晚绊倒了，摔坏了髋骨。

example.ex: He tried to follow Jack's footsteps in the snow and tripped on a rock...
example.tran: 他想要跟着杰克在雪中留下的脚印走，却让一块石头绊倒了。

collins.tran: 使绊;将…绊倒; 使跌倒
collins.def: If you trip someone who is walking or running, you put your foot or something else in front of them, so that they knock their own foot against it and fall or nearly fall.

example.ex: One guy stuck his foot out and tried to trip me.
example.tran: 一个家伙把脚伸出来想要绊倒我。

collins.tran: (对权力等的)迷恋;(内疚、怀旧感等的)困扰
collins.def: If you say that someone is, for example, on a power trip, a guilt trip, or a nostalgia trip, you mean that their behaviour is motivated by power, guilt, or nostalgia.

example.ex: There's such pressure to be happy in Hawaii, if you're unhappy you're on a guilt trip...
example.tran: 就好像去夏威夷就一定要开心似的，如果你不开心，你会一个劲儿地感到愧疚。

example.ex: The biggest star perk, and the biggest power trip, must be the private plane.
example.tran: 顶级的明星待遇和无上的权力体验肯定要数私人飞机了。

collins.def: A trip is an experience that someone has when their mind is affected by a drug such as LSD.

example.ex: An anxious or depressed person can experience a really bad trip.
example.tran: 焦虑或抑郁的人吸毒后可能会有非常糟糕的幻觉。

collins.def: If someone is tripping, they are having an experience in which their mind is affected by a drug such as LSD.

example.ex: One night I was tripping on acid.
example.tran: 有一天晚上我服用了迷幻药后正在幻游。

collins.def: If someone trips somewhere, they walk there with light, quick steps.

example.ex: A girl in a red smock tripped down the hill...
example.tran: 一个身穿红色罩衫的女孩迈着轻快的步子下山。

example.ex: They tripped along with scarcely a care in the world.
example.tran: 他们轻快地走着，几乎没有世间的烦恼。

collins.def: If you propose something such as a plan or an idea, you suggest it for people to think about and decide upon.

example.ex: Britain is about to propose changes to some institutions...
example.tran: 英国将提议对一些机构进行改革。

example.ex: It was George who first proposed that we dry clothes in that locker.
example.tran: 是乔治首先提议我们把衣服挂在那个储物柜里晾干的。

collins.def: If you propose to do something, you intend to do it.

example.ex: It's still far from clear what action the government proposes to take over the affair...
example.tran: 政府打算采取何种行动处理该事件仍然十分不明朗。

example.ex: And where do you propose building such a huge thing?
example.tran: 那么你打算在哪里建这么一个庞然大物呢？

collins.def: If you propose a theory or an explanation, you state that it is possibly or probably true, because it fits in with the evidence that you have considered.

example.ex: This highlights a problem faced by people proposing theories of ball lightning...
example.tran: 这使得球状闪电理论的提出者所面临的一个问题凸显出来。

example.ex: Newton proposed that heavenly and terrestrial motion could be unified with the idea of gravity.
example.tran: 牛顿提出天体和地球的运动可以用万有引力来解释。

collins.def: If you propose a motion for debate, or a candidate for election, you begin the debate or the election procedure by formally stating your support for that motion or candidate.

example.ex: A delegate from Siberia proposed a resolution that he stand down as party chairman...
example.tran: 一名来自西伯利亚的代表提议他辞去党主席的职务。

example.ex: I asked Robin Balfour and Derek Haig to propose and second me.
example.tran: 我请罗宾·鲍尔弗和德里克·黑格提名并支持我。

collins.def: If you propose a toast to someone or something, you ask people to drink a toast to them.

example.ex: Usually the bride's father proposes a toast to the health of the bride and groom.
example.tran: 通常新娘的父亲会提议为新郎新娘的健康干杯。

collins.def: If you propose to someone, or propose marriage to them, you ask them to marry you.

example.ex: He had proposed to Isabel the day after taking his seat in Parliament.
example.tran: 当选议员的第二天，他向伊莎贝尔求婚了。

collins.def: The name God is given to the spirit or being who is worshipped as the creator and ruler of the world, especially by Jews, Christians, and Muslims.

example.ex: He believes in God...
example.tran: 他信奉上帝。

example.ex: God bless you.
example.tran: 上帝保佑你。

collins.tran: （表示强调所说的话，或表示惊讶、恐惧或激动）啊呀，天啊，天哪（可能具冒犯意味）
collins.def: People sometimes use God in exclamations to emphasize something that they are saying, or to express surprise, fear, or excitement. This use could cause offence.

example.ex: God, how I hated him!...
example.tran: 啊呀！我恨死他了！

example.ex: Oh my God he's shot somebody...
example.tran: 我的天哪！他开枪打人了。

collins.def: In many religions, a god is one of the spirits or beings that are believed to have power over a particular part of the world or nature.

example.ex: ...Pan, the God of nature.
example.tran: 自然之神，潘

example.ex: ...Zeus, king of the gods.
example.tran: 众神之王，宙斯

collins.tran: 极受尊崇的人；影响极大的人
collins.def: Someone who is admired very much by a person or group of people, and who influences them a lot, can be referred to as a god .

example.ex: To his followers he was a god.
example.tran: 在追随者眼中，他就是神。

collins.tran: 愿上帝阻止这样的事情；但愿这样的事不会发生
collins.def: If you say God forbid, you are expressing your hope that something will not happen.

example.ex: If, God forbid, something goes wrong, I don't know what I would do.
example.tran: 如果哪儿出点儿岔子，我会不知所措的，但愿这样的事情不会发生。

collins.tran: 上帝的恩赐；十全十美的人
collins.def: If a person thinks they are God's gift to someone or something, they think they are perfect or extremely good.

example.ex: Are men god's gift to women? Some of them think they are.
example.tran: 男人是上帝赐予女人的礼物吗？有些男人就是这样认为的。

collins.def: You use God help you to warn someone that something unpleasant will happen to them if they do a particular thing.

example.ex: God help him if he gets in my way...
example.tran: 他要是跟我作对，那就让上帝保佑他吧。

example.ex: The boss says you must wear a tie. And God help you if you don't.
example.tran: 老板说你得打领带，如果不听你会倒霉的。

collins.def: If you feel sorry for someone because they are in a difficult or unpleasant situation, especially if you think that nobody can help them, you can say God help them.

example.ex: 'God help them,' he said. 'They're  beyond help.'
example.tran: “愿上帝保佑他们吧，”他说，“谁也帮不了他们了。”

collins.def: If you say God help us, you mean that you have negative feelings about the person or situation you are talking about.

example.ex: The first song is 11 minutes long, the last nearly the same, and, God help us, there's a drum solo along the way.
example.tran: 第一首歌有11分钟长，最后一首也差不多长，唉，上帝啊，中间还有一个击鼓独奏。

collins.tran: （表示强调）只有上帝知道，天晓得
collins.def: You can say God knows ,God only knows, or God alone knows to emphasize that you do not know something.

example.ex: Gunga spoke God knows how many languages...
example.tran: 天晓得贡嘎会讲多少门语言。

example.ex: God alone knows what she thinks.
example.tran: 只有天晓得她在想什么。

collins.def: If someone says God knows in reply to a question, they mean that they do not know the answer.

example.ex: 'Where is he now?' 'God knows.'
example.tran: “他现在在哪里？”“天晓得。”

collins.def: The term a man of God is sometimes used to refer to Christian priests or ministers.

example.ex: I am a man of God.
example.tran: 我是个牧师。

collins.tran: （用来强调生气、懊恼或吃惊）究竟什么/ 究竟为什么/究竟如何
collins.def: If someone uses such expressions as what in God's name ,why in God's name, or how in God's name, they are emphasizing how angry, annoyed, or surprised they are.

example.ex: What in God's name do you expect me to do?...
example.tran: 你究竟要我做什么？

example.ex: Why in God's name did you have to tell her?
example.tran: 为什么你非得告诉她呢？

collins.tran: 俨然一副上帝的样子；表现得无所不能
collins.def: If someone plays God, they act as if they have unlimited power and can do anything they want.

example.ex: You have no right to play God in my life!
example.tran: 你无权对我的人生指手画脚！

collins.tran: （强调愿望之强烈）老天保佑，求求上天帮忙
collins.def: You say please God to emphasize a strong hope, wish, or desire that you have.

example.ex: Please God, let him telephone me now.
example.tran: 拜托老天了，让他现在就给我来个电话吧。

collins.tran: （表示强调）我向上帝祈祷/我真诚地希望/我向上帝发誓
collins.def: You can use God in expressions such as I hope to God, or I wish to God, or I swear to God, in order to emphasize what you are saying.

example.ex: I hope to God they are paying you well...
example.tran: 我真希望他们给你一份好的酬劳。

example.ex: I wish to God I hadn't met you.
example.tran: 我真希望我不曾认识你。

collins.def: If you say God willing, you are saying that something will happen if all goes well.

example.ex: God willing, there will be a breakthrough.
example.tran: 如果一切顺利，将会取得突破性的进展。

collins.tran: 最重要的；卓著的；显赫的
collins.def: The leading person or thing in a particular area is the one which is most important or successful.

example.ex: ...a leading member of Bristol's Sikh community...
example.tran: 布里斯托尔锡克教社群一位出类拔萃的成员

example.ex: Britain's future as a leading industrial nation depends on investment.
example.tran: 作为一个主要工业国英国的未来要倚赖投资。

collins.def: The leading role in a play or film is the main role. A leading lady or man is an actor who plays this role.

collins.tran: （在比赛或行列中）首位的，居前的
collins.def: The leading group, vehicle, or person in a race or procession is the one that is at the front.

means: 订约将…收为学徒（或徒弟）
进行控告，提出罪状（或指责）(against)

collins.def: An article is a piece of writing that is published in a newspaper or magazine.

example.ex: ...a newspaper article...
example.tran: 一篇报载文章

example.ex: ...a travel article...
example.tran: 一篇游记

collins.def: You can refer to objects as articles of some kind.

example.ex: ...articles of clothing...
example.tran: 衣物

example.ex: He had stripped the house of all articles of value.
example.tran: 他把房间里值钱的东西洗劫一空。

collins.def: If you describe something as the genuine article, you are emphasizing that it is genuine, and often that it is very good.

example.ex: The vodka was the genuine article.
example.tran: 这种伏特加酒是正品。

collins.def: An article of a formal agreement or document is a section of it which deals with a particular point.

example.ex: The country appears to be violating several articles of the convention.
example.tran: 这个国家看起来违反了公约中的好几项条款。

example.ex: ...Article 50 of the UN charter.
example.tran: 《联合国宪章》第50条

collins.def: Someone who is in articles is being trained as a lawyer or accountant by a firm with whom they have a written agreement.

example.ex: In 1986, 44 per cent of those admitted to articles were women.
example.tran: 1986年，44％的实习生为女性。

collins.tran: 冠词（a和an是不定冠词，the是定冠词）
collins.def: In grammar, an article is a kind of determiner. In English, 'a' and 'an' are called the indefinite article, and 'the' is called the definite article .
You use fellow to describe people who are in the same situation as you, or people you feel you have something in common with.

example.ex: She discovered to her pleasure, a talent for making her fellow guests laugh...
example.tran: 她高兴地发现自己具备一种能把其他客人逗笑的才能。

example.ex: Even in jail, my fellow inmates treated me with kindness.
example.tran: 就算在监狱里，狱友们对我也很友善。

collins.def: A fellow is a man or boy.

example.ex: By all accounts, Rodger would appear to be a fine fellow.
example.tran: 据说，罗杰是个好小伙。

collins.def: Your fellows are the people who you work with, do things with, or who are like you in some way.

example.ex: He stood out in terms of competence from all his fellows...
example.tran: 他在能力上远远胜过其他同事。

example.ex: People looked out for one another and were concerned about the welfare of their fellows.
example.tran: 人们守望相助，关心着彼此的幸福。

collins.def: A fellow of an academic or professional association is someone who is a specially elected member of it, usually because of their work or achievements or as a mark of honour.

example.ex: ...the fellows of the Zoological Society of London.
example.tran: 伦敦动物协会会员

collins.def: An injury is damage done to a person's or an animal's body.

example.ex: Four police officers sustained serious injuries in the explosion...
example.tran: 4名警官在爆炸中受重伤。

example.ex: The two other passengers escaped serious injury.
example.tran: 另外两名乘客逃过一劫，未受重伤。

collins.def: If someone suffers injury to their feelings, they are badly upset by something. If they suffer injury to their reputation, their reputation is seriously harmed.

example.ex: She was awarded £3,500 for injury to her feelings.
example.tran: 她判得 3,500 英镑精神损失赔偿。

collins.def: Education involves teaching people various subjects, usually at a school or college, or being taught.

example.ex: They're cutting funds for education...
example.tran: 他们正在削减教育经费。

example.ex: Paul prolonged his education with six years of advanced study in English.
example.tran: 保罗延长了他的受教育时间，打算花6年时间深造英语。

collins.def: Education of a particular kind involves teaching the public about a particular issue.

example.ex: ...better health education.
example.tran: 更好的健康教育

collins.tran: 社会地位;专业资格;职位
collins.def: Your status is your social or professional position.

example.ex: People of higher status tend more to use certain drugs.
example.tran: 社会地位较高的人往往更容易吸食某种毒品。

example.ex: ...women and men of wealth and status.
example.tran: 有钱有势的男男女女

collins.tran: (在公众或某一团体中的)威望，地位,身份
collins.def: Status is the importance and respect that someone has among the public or a particular group.

example.ex: Nurses are undervalued, and they never enjoy the same status as doctors...
example.tran: 护士的作用被人们低估了，她们从未享有和医生同样的地位。

example.ex: He has risen to gain the status of a national hero.
example.tran: 他已被推崇为民族英雄。

collins.def: The status of something is the importance that people give it.

example.ex: Those things that can be assessed by external tests are being given unduly high status...
example.tran: 那些可以通过外部测试来评估的东西被过于重视了。

example.ex: The fact that the most senior judge of the High Court's  Family Division had taken control of the case was proof of its urgency and status.
example.tran: 高等法院家事庭里资历最高的法官已接管这个案子，这就证明了此案的紧迫性和重要性。

collins.tran: (个人、组织或地方的)法律地位，法律身份，状况
collins.def: A particular status is an official description that says what category a person, organization, or place belongs to, and gives them particular rights or advantages.

example.ex: Bristol regained its status as a city in the local government reorganisation.
example.tran: 布里斯托尔在地方政府重组过程中重新获得了自己作为一个城市的法律地位。

example.ex: ...his status as a British citizen...
example.tran: 他的英国公民身份

collins.def: The status of something is its state of affairs at a particular time.

example.ex: The Council unanimously directed city staff to prepare a status report on the project...
example.tran: 委员会一致要求市政府工作人员就该项目准备一份进度报告。

example.ex: What is your current financial status?...
example.tran: 你目前的经济状况如何？

collins.tran: (尤指专门报道某一类新闻的)记者，通讯员
collins.def: A correspondent is a newspaper or television journalist, especially one who specializes in a particular type of news.

example.ex: ...our Diplomatic Correspondent Mark Brayne.
example.tran: 我们的外交通讯员马克·布雷恩

collins.def: Something that is slow moves, happens, or is done without much speed.

example.ex: The traffic is heavy and slow...
example.tran: 交通拥挤，车流缓慢。

example.ex: Electric whisks should be used on a slow speed.
example.tran: 使用自动搅拌器时应该选用慢挡。

collins.tran: (用于非正式英语中)缓慢地，慢吞吞地
collins.def: In informal English, slower is used to mean 'at a slower speed' and slowest is used to mean 'at the slowest speed'. In non-standard English, slow is used to mean 'with little speed'.

example.ex: I began to walk slower and slower...
example.tran: 我走得越来越慢。

example.ex: We got there by driving slow all the way.
example.tran: 我们开着车去了那里，一路上开得很慢。

collins.tran: 费时间的;时间长的;迟缓的
collins.def: Something that is slow takes a long time.

example.ex: The distribution of passports has been a slow process.
example.tran: 颁发护照的过程非常缓慢。

collins.def: If someone is slow to do something, they do it after a delay.

example.ex: The world community has been slow to respond to the crisis...
example.tran: 国际社会对这次危机反应迟缓。

example.ex: I've been a bit slow in making up my mind.
example.tran: 我下决心有些慢。

collins.def: If something slows or if you slow it, it starts to move or happen more slowly.

example.ex: The rate of bombing has slowed considerably...
example.tran: 轰炸的速度明显慢了下来。

example.ex: She slowed the car and began driving up a narrow road...
example.tran: 她放慢车速，开始驶上一条狭窄的道路。

collins.def: Someone who is slow is not very clever and takes a long time to understand things.

example.ex: He got hit on the head and he's been a bit slow since.
example.tran: 他的脑袋受过撞击，从那以后，他的反应变得有些迟钝。

collins.tran: 呆滞的;不景气的;沉闷的
collins.def: If you describe a situation, place, or activity as slow, you mean that it is not very exciting.

example.ex: Don't be faint-hearted when things seem a bit slow or boring...
example.tran: 事情变得有点沉闷无聊的时候，不要胆怯。

example.ex: The island is too slow for her liking.
example.tran: 这个岛太沉闷了，不合她的胃口。

collins.def: If a clock or watch is slow, it shows a time that is earlier than the correct time.
Something that is purple is of a reddish-blue colour.

example.ex: She wore purple and green silk.
example.tran: 她穿着紫绿相间的绸缎衣服。

example.ex: ...sinister dark greens and purples.
example.tran: 不祥的暗绿色和紫色

collins.tran: （文章）词藻华丽的，堆砌意象的
collins.def: Purple prose or a purple patch is a piece of writing that contains very elaborate language or images.

example.ex: ...passages of purple prose describing intense experiences.
example.tran: 一篇篇描述强烈感受的词藻华丽的散文

collins.tran: （尤指运动员或球队）接连成功，好运不断
collins.def: If someone, especially a sports player or team, goes through a purple patch, they are very successful or lucky for a period.

example.ex: In the last 10 minutes Tranmere struck a purple patch which culminated in their goal.
example.tran: 最后10分钟，特兰米尔队时来运转，终于收获了进球。

collins.def: If you remove something from a place, you take it away.

example.ex: As soon as the cake is done, remove it from the oven...
example.tran: 蛋糕一烤好，立即把它从烤箱中取出。

example.ex: At least three bullets were removed from his wounds...
example.tran: 从他的伤口至少取出了3颗子弹。

collins.def: If you remove clothing, you take it off.

example.ex: He removed his jacket.
example.tran: 他脱下了夹克。

collins.def: If you remove a stain from something, you make the stain disappear by treating it with a chemical or by washing it.

example.ex: This treatment removes the most stubborn stains...
example.tran: 这种处理方式会清除最顽固的污渍。

example.ex: Try using lemon juice to remove tobacco stains from your fingers.
example.tran: 试试用柠檬汁去除手指上的烟渍。

collins.def: If people remove someone from power or from something such as a committee, they stop them being in power or being a member of the committee.

example.ex: The student senate voted to remove Fuller from office...
example.tran: 学生评议会投票免除了富勒的职位。

example.ex: The president could only be removed from power once free elections were organised...
example.tran: 总统只有在开始自由选举时才能被免职。

collins.tran: 消除(障碍);取消(限制);解决(问题)
collins.def: If you remove an obstacle, a restriction, or a problem, you get rid of it.

example.ex: The agreement removes the last serious obstacle to the signing of the arms treaty...
example.tran: 这个协议排除了签订武器条约的最后一个严重障碍。

example.ex: Most of her fears had been removed.
example.tran: 她的恐惧基本上消除了。

collins.def: If you do or experience something at one remove, you do not do it or experience it yourself, but someone else does it or experiences it instead of you.

example.ex: She enjoyed his company and the excitement of feeling herself linked at one remove to London society...
example.tran: 她喜欢他的陪伴，也很享受离伦敦社交圈仅仅一步之遥的兴奋感觉。

example.ex: She can know the world only at several removes.
example.tran: 她只能间接地认知这个世界。

collins.def: Nobody means not a single person, or not a single member of a particular group or set.

example.ex: They were shut away in a little room where nobody could overhear...
example.tran: 他们被关在一个小屋里，没人能听到他们的动静。

example.ex: Nobody realizes how bad things are...
example.tran: 没人意识到事情是多么糟糕。

collins.def: If someone says that a person is a nobody, they are saying in an unkind way that the person is not at all important.

example.ex: A man in my position has nothing to fear from a nobody like you.
example.tran: 处在我这样位置的人，一点都不害怕像你这种小人物。

collins.tran: （有特殊用途的）木板，塑料板，板材
collins.def: A board is a flat, thin, rectangular piece of wood or plastic which is used for a particular purpose.

example.ex: ...a chopping board.
example.tran: 砧板

collins.tran: （下棋等用的）木板，硬纸板，棋盘
collins.def: A board is a square piece of wood or stiff cardboard that you use for playing games such as chess.

example.ex: ...a draughts board...
example.tran: 跳棋棋盘

example.ex: Dr Tinsley had five pieces on the board against Chinook's four.
example.tran: 廷斯利博士在棋盘上还有5枚棋子，对手钦诺克还有4枚。

collins.def: You can refer to a blackboard or a noticeboard as a board.

example.ex: He wrote a few more notes on the board.
example.tran: 他在黑板上又写了几条注释。

collins.tran: （用来铺地板、筑围墙等的）长条木板
collins.def: Boards are long flat pieces of wood which are used, for example, to make floors or walls.

example.ex: The floor was draughty bare boards.
example.tran: 地面铺的是透气性好的实木地板。

collins.def: The board of a company or organization is the group of people who control it and direct it.

example.ex: Arthur wants to put his recommendation before the board at a meeting tomorrow.
example.tran: 阿瑟希望在明天的会议上把自己的建议书提交董事会。

example.ex: ...the agenda for the September 12 board meeting.
example.tran: 9月12日董事会议的议程

collins.tran: （用于机构名称中）局，所，中心，委员会
collins.def: Board is used in the names of various organizations which are involved in dealing with a particular kind of activity.

example.ex: The Scottish Tourist Board said 33,000 Japanese visited Scotland last year.
example.tran: 苏格兰旅游局宣称去年有33,000名日本人到苏格兰旅游。

example.ex: ...the US National Transportation Safety Board.
example.tran: 美国国家交通运输安全委员会

collins.tran: 上，登上（火车、轮船或飞机）
collins.def: When you board a train, ship, or aircraft, you get on it in order to travel somewhere.

example.ex: I boarded the plane bound for England.
example.tran: 我登上了飞往英格兰的飞机。

collins.def: Board is the food which is provided when you stay somewhere, for example in a hotel.

example.ex: Free room and board are provided for all hotel staff.
example.tran: 宾馆的所有员工都可享受免费膳宿。

collins.tran: （协议或交易）合法诚信的，公开的，光明正大的
collins.def: An arrangement or deal that is above board is legal and is being carried out honestly and openly.

example.ex: All I knew about were Antony's own financial dealings, which were always above board.
example.tran: 据我所知，安东尼经手的金融交易一直是公开透明的。

collins.def: If a policy or a situation applies across the board, it affects everything or everyone in a particular group.

example.ex: There are hefty charges across the board for one-way rental...
example.tran: 各处对单程租赁的收费都很高。

example.ex: The President promised across-the-board tax cuts if re-elected.
example.tran: 总统许诺如果能再次当选将采取全面的减税措施。

collins.def: If something goes by the board, it is rejected or ignored, or is no longer possible.

example.ex: It's a case of not what you know but who you know in this world today and qualifications quite go by the board.
example.tran: 在当今这个世界，重要的不是你知道什么而是你认识谁，能力才干根本派不上用场。

collins.def: When you are on board a train, ship, or aircraft, you are on it or in it.

example.ex: They arrived at Gatwick airport on board a plane chartered by the Italian government...
example.tran: 他们乘坐意大利政府的包机到达盖特威克机场。

example.ex: ...a naval task force with two thousand marines on board.
example.tran: 由2,000名海军陆战队士兵组成的海军特遣队

collins.tran: （在竞赛或选举中）取得压倒性胜利，大获全胜
collins.def: If someone sweeps the board in a competition or election, they win nearly everything that it is possible to win.

example.ex: Spain swept the board in boys' team competitions.
example.tran: 西班牙队在男子团体比赛中大获全胜。

collins.def: If you take on board an idea or a problem, you begin to accept it or understand it.

example.ex: I hope that they will take on board some of what you have said.
example.tran: 我希望他们能采纳你们所提出的部分想法。

means: 统称某人拥有（或训练的）赛马
在同一地方工作或训练的)一批人
使关进畜舍（或马厩、牛棚等），使放入马厩般的室内
被关在畜舍内，（人）生活在厩一般的地方

collins.def: If something is stable, it is not likely to change or come to an end suddenly.

example.ex: The price of oil should remain stable for the rest of 1992.
example.tran: 油价会在 1992 年剩下的时间里保持稳定。

example.ex: ...a stable marriage.
example.tran: 稳定的婚姻

collins.def: If someone has a stable personality, they are calm and reasonable and their mood does not change suddenly.

example.ex: Their characters are fully formed and they are both very stable children.
example.tran: 他们的性格已经完全形成，两人都是非常持重的孩子。

collins.def: You can describe someone who is seriously ill as stable when their condition has stopped getting worse.

example.ex: The injured man was in a stable condition.
example.tran: 伤者情况稳定。

collins.def: Chemical substances are described as stable when they tend to remain in the same chemical or atomic state.

example.ex: The less stable compounds were converted into a compound called Delta-A THC.
example.tran: 不太稳定的化合物被转换成了一种叫做Delta-A THC的化合物。

collins.def: If an object is stable, it is firmly fixed in position and is not likely to move or fall.

example.ex: This structure must be stable.
example.tran: 这一结构必须得很稳固。

collins.def: A stable or stables is a building in which horses are kept.
A stable or stables is an organization that breeds and trains horses for racing.

example.ex: Miss Curling won on two horses from Mick Trickey's stable.
example.tran: 柯林小姐在来自米克·特里齐养马场的两匹马身上下了注，结果她赢了。

collins.def: When horses are stabled, they are put into a stable.

example.ex: The animals had been fed and stabled...
example.tran: 牲畜已经喂好并关进厩里了。

example.ex: You should allow your stabled horse a couple of hours' freedom per day.
example.tran: 你应该每天把关在马厩里的马放出来自由活动几个小时。

collins.tran: 接受同一经纪人服务的一群人
