collins.def: You can say that someone has a stable of people when they manage and promote the careers of that group of people.

example.ex: As chief executive, he assembled a polished stable of celebrities.
example.tran: 作为首席执行官，他手下云集了一批优雅的名人名士。

collins.def: If you say that someone has closed or shut the stable door after the horse has bolted, you mean that they have tried to prevent something happening but they have done so too late to prevent damage being done.
A county is a region of Britain, Ireland, or the USA which has its own local government.

example.ex: He is living now in his mother's home county of Oxfordshire...
example.tran: 他现在居住在他母亲的故乡牛津郡。

example.ex: Over 50 events are planned throughout the county.
example.tran: 全县共筹划了50多次活动。

collins.def: Considerable means great in amount or degree.

example.ex: To be without Pearce would be a considerable blow...
example.tran: 失去皮尔斯将是一个巨大的打击。

example.ex: Doing it properly makes considerable demands on our time...
example.tran: 把这事做好要耗费我们相当多的时间。

collins.def: Highly is used before some adjectives to mean 'very'.

example.ex: Mr Singh was a highly successful salesman...
example.tran: 辛格先生是个非常成功的推销员。

example.ex: It seems highly unlikely that she ever existed.
example.tran: 她好像压根就没存在过。

collins.def: You use highly to indicate that someone has an important position in an organization or set of people.

example.ex: ...a highly placed government advisor.
example.tran: 高级政府顾问

example.ex: ...highly ranked soccer teams.
example.tran: 名列前茅的足球队

collins.def: If someone is highly paid, they receive a large salary.

example.ex: He was the most highly paid member of staff.
example.tran: 他是员工中薪酬最高的。

collins.def: If you think highly of something or someone, you think they are very good indeed.

example.ex: Daphne and Michael thought highly of the school.
example.tran: 达夫妮和迈克尔对那所学校评价很高。

example.ex: ...one of the most highly regarded chefs in the French capital.
example.tran: 法国首都最受推崇的厨师之一

collins.def: Something or someone that is an asset is considered useful or helps a person or organization to be successful.

example.ex: Her leadership qualities were the greatest asset of the Conservative Party...
example.tran: 她的领导才能是保守党最宝贵的财富。

example.ex: His Republican credentials made him an asset.
example.tran: 他作为共和党人的资历成了他的一笔财富。

collins.def: The assets of a company or a person are all the things that they own.

example.ex: By the end of 1989 the group had assets of 3.5 billion francs.
example.tran: 到1989年底该集团拥有的资产达35亿法郎。

collins.def: A mortgage is a loan of money which you get from a bank or building society in order to buy a house.

example.ex: ...an increase in mortgage rates.
example.tran: 房屋抵押贷款利率的提高

collins.def: If you mortgage your house or land, you use it as a guarantee to a company in order to borrow money from them.

example.ex: They had to mortgage their home to pay the bills.
example.tran: 他们不得不抵押房屋借贷来支付这些款项。

example.ex: ...mortgaged homes.
example.tran: 按揭房

means: （中小学生对男教师的称呼）先生

collins.tran: (对不知其姓名的男士或上级的尊称)先生，长官
collins.def: People sometimes say sir as a very formal and polite way of addressing a man whose name they do not know or a man of superior rank. For example, a shop assistant might address a male customer as sir .

example.ex: Excuse me sir, but would you mind telling me what sort of car that is?...
example.tran: 先生，请您告诉我那是什么类型的车好吗？

example.ex: Good afternoon to you, sir.
example.tran: 下午好，先生。

collins.tran: (用于爵士或准男爵的姓名前)爵士
collins.def: Sir is the title used in front of the name of a knight or baronet.

example.ex: She introduced me to Sir Tobias and Lady Clarke.
example.tran: 她把我引见给了托拜厄斯爵士和克拉克夫人。

collins.tran: (正式信函或商务信函开头的称呼语)先生，阁下(写信给某组织时使用 Dear sirs)
collins.def: You use the expression Dear sir at the beginning of a formal letter or a business letter when you are writing to a man. You use Dear sirs when you are writing to an organization.

example.ex: Dear Sir, Your letter of the 9th October has been referred to us.
example.tran: 尊敬的先生，您 10 月 9 日的来信已转交我处。

collins.def: An association is an official group of people who have the same job, aim, or interest.

example.ex: ...the British Olympic Association...
example.tran: 英国奥林匹克协会

example.ex: Research associations are often linked to a particular industry.
example.tran: 研究协会常与某个特定的行业挂钩。

collins.def: Your association with a person or a thing such as an organization is the connection that you have with them.

example.ex: ...the company's six-year association with retailer J.C. Penney Co...
example.tran: 该公司与零售商 J. C. 彭尼公司6年的业务往来

example.ex: Blyth's association with the sea began in 1966...
example.tran: 布莱思的航海生涯始于1966年。

collins.def: If something has particular associations for you, it is connected in your mind with a particular memory, idea, or feeling.

example.ex: He has a shelf full of things, each of which has associations for him...
example.tran: 他的一个搁架上摆满了东西，每一样都能勾起他许多回忆。

example.ex: Black was considered inappropriate because of its associations with death.
example.tran: 不宜用黑色，因为它让人联想到死亡。

collins.def: If you do something in association with someone else, you do it together.

example.ex: Published in association with the Council for the Protection of Rural England, the book provides refreshing solutions to the long-term problem of water conservation.
example.tran: 这本书与英格兰乡村保护委员会合作出版，就节约水资源这个长期问题提供了全新的解决方法。

collins.def: If one thing is found in association with another, they are found together.
Your reaction to something that has happened or something that you have experienced is what you feel, say, or do because of it.

example.ex: Reaction to the visit is mixed...
example.tran: 对这次访问的反应不一。

example.ex: The initial reaction of most participants is fear...
example.tran: 多数参与者的最初反应是恐惧。

collins.def: A reaction against something is a way of behaving or doing something that is deliberately different from what has been done before.

example.ex: All new fashion starts out as a reaction against existing convention...
example.tran: 所有新时尚都是从打破现有常规开始的。

example.ex: Her three years of freedom seemed like a reaction against that childhood.
example.tran: 她那3年的自由仿佛是对孩童时代的反叛。

collins.def: If there is a reaction against something, it becomes unpopular.

example.ex: Premature moves in this respect might well provoke a reaction against the reform...
example.tran: 在这方面不成熟的举动很可能引发对改革的抵触情绪。

example.ex: The government response seems to be the result of strong public reaction against the police apathy.
example.tran: 政府的回应似乎是公众强烈抵制警察冷漠执法的结果。

collins.def: Your reactions are your ability to move quickly in response to something, for example when you are in danger.

example.ex: If his reactions are so slow, he shouldn't be in charge of a bus...
example.tran: 如果他的反应太慢，就不应该开公交汽车。

example.ex: The sport requires very fast reactions.
example.tran: 这项运动要求极快的反应力。

collins.def: Reaction is the belief that the political or social system of your country should not change.

example.ex: Thus, he aided reaction and thwarted progress.
example.tran: 因此，他帮助反动派阻挠进步。

example.ex: ...their victory against the forces of reaction and censorship.
example.tran: 他们取得的对保守势力和审查制度的胜利

collins.def: A chemical reaction is a process in which two substances combine together chemically to form another substance.

example.ex: Ozone is produced by the reaction between oxygen and ultraviolet light...
example.tran: 臭氧由氧气和紫外线发生反应而产生。

example.ex: Catalysts are materials which greatly speed up chemical reactions.
example.tran: 催化剂是可以大大加速化学反应的物质。

collins.def: If you have a reaction to a substance such as a drug, or to something you have touched, you are affected unpleasantly or made ill by it.

example.ex: Every year, 5000 people have life-threatening reactions to anaesthetics...
example.tran: 每年有5,000人对麻醉剂产生致命反应。

example.ex: Common foods which cause this kind of reaction are fish, eggs, and shellfish.
example.tran: 引发这种不良反应的常见食物包括鱼、蛋和贝类。

collins.def: You can use increasingly to indicate that a situation or quality is becoming greater in intensity or more common.

example.ex: He was finding it increasingly difficult to make decisions...
example.tran: 他发现越来越难以作出决定。

example.ex: There is an increasingly popular alternative...
example.tran: 有了越来越受欢迎的替代品。

collins.def: If something is deep, it extends a long way down from the ground or from the top surface of something.

example.ex: The water is very deep and mysterious-looking...
example.tran: 水看上去幽深叵测。

example.ex: Den had dug a deep hole in the centre of the garden...
example.tran: 德恩在花园的中央挖了一个深洞。

collins.def: A deep container, such as a cupboard, extends or measures a long distance from front to back.

example.ex: The wardrobe was very deep.
example.tran: 这个衣柜很深。

collins.def: You use deep to talk or ask about how much something measures from the surface to the bottom, or from front to back.

example.ex: I found myself in water only three feet deep...
example.tran: 我发现脚下的水只有 3 英尺深。

example.ex: The mud is ankle deep around Shush Square...
example.tran: 舒什广场周围的泥水深及脚踝。

collins.def: Deep in an area means a long way inside it

example.ex: They were now deep inside rebel territory.
example.tran: 他们现在已深入叛军占领区。

example.ex: ...deep inside the country...
example.tran: 深入该国的腹地

collins.tran: (足球、网球等运动中球)纵深的，靠近对方端线的
collins.def: In sports such as football and tennis, a deep shot or pass is one that sends the ball a long way towards the end of the pitch or court.

example.ex: ...Steve Staunton's deep cross.
example.tran: 史蒂夫·斯汤顿的纵深横传

example.ex: ...a deep volley.
example.tran: 凌空远射

collins.def: If you say that things or people are two ,three, or four deep, you mean that there are two, three, or four rows or layers of them there.

example.ex: A crowd three deep seemed paralysed by the images on these monitors...
example.tran: 里里外外三层的人群看到显示屏上的画面似乎全都惊呆了。

example.ex: The rest of the space was taken up by cardboard boxes piled right to the ceiling, ten deep.
example.tran: 其余的空间都被纸板盒子占据了，一直摞到天花板，足有 10 层高。

collins.tran: 严重的;深切的;深厚的;深深的
collins.def: You use deep to emphasize the seriousness, strength, importance, or degree of something.

example.ex: I had a deep admiration for Sartre...
example.tran: 我对萨特怀有深深的敬意。

example.ex: ...a period of deep personal crisis...
example.tran: 经历严重个人危机的一段时期

collins.def: If you experience or feel something deep inside you or deep down, you feel it very strongly even though you do not necessarily show it.

example.ex: I kept reassuring them but deep in my heart I knew we had no hope...
example.tran: 我一再安慰他们，但在内心深处我知道我们没有任何希望。

example.ex: Deep down, she supported her husband's involvement in the organization.
example.tran: 在心底里，她支持丈夫参加这个组织。

collins.def: If you are in a deep sleep, you are sleeping peacefully and it is difficult to wake you.

example.ex: Una soon fell into a deep sleep.
example.tran: 尤娜很快便沉沉睡去。

collins.tran: 沉浸在…中的;专注于…的;埋头于…的
collins.def: If you are deep in thought or deep in conversation, you are concentrating very hard on what you are thinking or saying and are not aware of the things that are happening around you.

example.ex: Abby had been so deep in thought that she had walked past her aunt's car without even seeing it...
example.tran: 阿比沉浸在自己的思绪中，以至于从她姨妈的车边经过时都没有注意到。

example.ex: Before long, we were deep in conversation.
example.tran: 没过多久，我们便聊得很起劲了。

collins.def: A deep look seems to see right into your mind.

example.ex: Peter gave him a long deep look.
example.tran: 彼得深邃的目光长久地注视着他。

collins.def: A deep breath or sigh uses or fills the whole of your lungs.

example.ex: Cal took a long, deep breath, struggling to control his own emotions...
example.tran: 卡尔深长地吸了一口气，努力控制自己的情绪。

example.ex: At last he gave a deep sigh.
example.tran: 最后他一声长叹。

collins.def: You use deep to describe colours that are strong and fairly dark.

example.ex: The sky was deep blue and starry...
example.tran: 天空一片深蓝色，其间星光闪烁。

example.ex: The tree has gnarled red branches and deep green leaves.
example.tran: 这棵树的树枝扭曲多瘤且呈红色，树叶则是深绿色。

collins.def: A deep sound is low in pitch.

example.ex: His voice was deep and mellow...
example.tran: 他的声音深沉而柔和。

example.ex: They heard a deep, distant roar.
example.tran: 他们听到远处传来一声低沉的怒吼。

collins.def: If you describe someone as deep, you mean that they are quiet and reserved in a way that makes you think that they have good qualities such as intelligence or determination.

example.ex: James is a very deep individual...
example.tran: 詹姆斯是一个非常内敛的人。

example.ex: That expressionless face had seemed deep and mysterious.
example.tran: 那张毫无表情的脸看上去深沉而又神秘。

collins.tran: (问题、文章等)重要的，严肃的，深刻的
collins.def: If you describe something such as a problem or a piece of writing as deep, you mean that it is important, serious, or complicated.

example.ex: This is a very deep question...
example.tran: 这是一个非常严肃的问题。

example.ex: They're written as adventure stories. They're not intended to be deep.
example.tran: 它们是作为历险故事来写的，并没打算追求深刻。

collins.def: If you are deep in debt, you have a lot of debts.

example.ex: He is so deep in debt and desperate for money that he's apparently willing to say anything...
example.tran: 他负债累累，急需要钱，很显然什么话都说得出来。

example.ex: The company is sliding even deeper into the red.
example.tran: 公司的亏损状况进一步恶化。

collins.def: The deep means the sea.

example.ex: ...a vast unfrequented pool, traversed by whales and creatures of the deep.
example.tran: 一个面积巨大、人迹罕至的水池，鲸和其他海洋动物穿游其间

collins.tran: 在内心深处，在心底（知道）
collins.def: If you know something deep down or deep down inside, you know that it is true, but you are not always conscious of it or willing to admit it to yourself.

example.ex: We knew deep down that we could do it...
example.tran: 在内心深处，我们知道自己能够做到。

example.ex: Deep down, we had always detested each other.
example.tran: 我们在心底里一直都讨厌彼此。

collins.tran: 深吸一口气(以使自己坚强自信)
collins.def: If you say that you took a deep breath before doing something dangerous or frightening, you mean that you tried to make yourself feel strong and confident.

example.ex: I took a deep breath and went in.
example.tran: 我深吸一口气，然后走了进去。

collins.tran: 非常严重;极为强烈;根深蒂固
collins.def: If you say that something goes deep or runs deep, you mean that it is very serious or strong and is hard to change.

example.ex: His anger and anguish clearly went deep...
example.tran: 他的愤怒和痛苦显然是深切而强烈的。

example.ex: The problems went deeper than mere teething difficulties.
example.tran: 问题不仅仅是起始阶段的小麻烦那么简单。

means: 保证（做某事、遵守协议或遵从安排等）

collins.def: If someone commits a crime or a sin, they do something illegal or bad.

example.ex: I have never committed any crime...
example.tran: 我从来没犯过罪。

example.ex: This is a man who has committed murder.
example.tran: 这是一个杀人犯。

collins.def: If someone commits suicide, they deliberately kill themselves.

example.ex: There are unconfirmed reports he tried to commit suicide.
example.tran: 有未经证实的报道说他曾企图自杀。

collins.def: If you commit money or resources to something, you decide to use them for a particular purpose.

example.ex: They called on Western nations to commit more money to the poorest nations...
example.tran: 他们呼吁西方国家向极端贫困国家投入更多的钱。

example.ex: The government had committed billions of pounds for a programme to reduce acid rain...
example.tran: 政府已经给一个旨在减少酸雨的方案拨了几十亿英镑。

collins.def: If you commit yourself to something, you say that you will definitely do it. If you commit yourself to someone, you decide that you want to have a long-term relationship with them.

example.ex: I would advise people to think very carefully about committing themselves to working Sundays...
example.tran: 我建议大家慎重考虑一下答应周日工作的问题。

example.ex: I'd like a friendship that might lead to something deeper, but I wouldn't want to commit myself too soon...
example.tran: 我希望拥有一份能进一步发展的友谊，但又不想太快作出承诺。

collins.def: If you do not want to commit yourself on something, you do not want to say what you really think about it or what you are going to do.

example.ex: It isn't their diplomatic style to commit themselves on such a delicate issue...
example.tran: 对这样一个微妙的问题明确表态并非他们的外交风格。

example.ex: She didn't want to commit herself one way or the other.
example.tran: 不管怎样，她都不想明确表态。

collins.tran: 把…正式送进(医院、监狱等)
collins.def: If someone is committed to a hospital, prison, or other institution, they are officially sent there for a period of time.

example.ex: Arthur's drinking caused him to be committed to a psychiatric hospital.
example.tran: 阿瑟由于酗酒被送进一家精神病医院。

collins.def: In the British legal system, if someone is committed for trial, they are sent by magistrates to stand trial in a crown court.

example.ex: He is expected to be committed for trial at Liverpool Crown Court.
example.tran: 预计他会被移交利物浦高等刑事法庭。

collins.def: If you commit something to paper or to writing, you record it by writing it down. If you commit something to memory, you learn it so that you will remember it.

example.ex: She had not committed anything to paper about it...
example.tran: 关于这件事她未曾写下只言片语。

example.ex: I'll repeat that so you can commit it to memory.
example.tran: 我会重复一下，好让你们记住。

collins.def: Your rival is a person, business, or organization who you are competing or fighting against in the same area or for the same things.

example.ex: The world champion finished more than two seconds ahead of his nearest rival...
example.tran: 世界冠军领先第二名2秒多钟到达终点。

example.ex: He eliminated his rivals in a brutal struggle for power...
example.tran: 他在一场残酷的权力争斗中将对手一一铲除。

collins.tran: 没有敌手;独一无二;无人能及
collins.def: If you say that someone or something has no rivals or is without rival, you mean that it is best of its type.

example.ex: ...a wonderfully fragrant wine which has no rivals in the Rhone...
example.tran: 在罗纳河地区独一无二的无比香醇的葡萄酒

example.ex: He is a pastry chef without rival.
example.tran: 他是最好的面点师。

collins.tran: 能与…媲美;与…匹敌;与…不分高低
collins.def: If you say that one thing rivals another, you mean that they are both of the same standard or quality.

example.ex: Cassette recorders cannot rival the sound quality of CDs...
example.tran: 卡式磁带录音机的音质无法和CD相媲美。

example.ex: An epidemic to rival that which killed 26,000 in 1989 may hit the UK.
example.tran: 一种流行病可能会袭击英国，其危害程度不亚于1989年导致26,000人丧生的疾病。

means: [音乐]使（音调）下降，尤指降半音

collins.def: A flat is a set of rooms for living in, usually on one floor and part of a larger building. A flat usually includes a kitchen and bathroom.

example.ex: Sara lives with her husband and children in a flat in central London...
example.tran: 萨拉和丈夫还有孩子们住在伦敦中心城区的一间公寓里。

example.ex: It started a fire in a block of flats...
example.tran: 大火是从一幢公寓大楼烧起的。

collins.def: Something that is flat is level, smooth, or even, rather than sloping, curved, or uneven.

example.ex: Tiles can be fixed to any surface as long as it's flat, firm and dry...
example.tran: 只要表面平整、坚固而且干燥，瓷砖就可以贴住。

example.ex: After a moment his right hand moved across the cloth, smoothing it flat...
example.tran: 过了一会儿，他用右手把布抹平。

collins.def: Flat means horizontal and not upright.

example.ex: Two men near him threw themselves flat...
example.tran: 他身旁的两个男人直挺挺趴倒在地上。

example.ex: As heartburn is usually worse when you're lying down in bed, you should avoid lying flat.
example.tran: 通常躺着的时候胃灼热会更加厉害，所以应当避免平卧。

collins.def: A flat object is not very tall or deep in relation to its length and width.

example.ex: Ellen is walking down the drive with a square flat box balanced on one hand.
example.tran: 埃伦正一手托着一个方形的扁盒子沿私人车道走着。

collins.def: Flat land is level, with no high hills or other raised parts.

example.ex: To the north lie the flat and fertile farmlands of the Solway plain...
example.tran: 北边是索尔韦平原平坦而肥沃的农田。

example.ex: The landscape became wider, flatter and very scenic...
example.tran: 地势变得更开阔、更平整，风景十分优美。

collins.def: A low flat area of uncultivated land, especially an area where the ground is soft and wet, can be referred to as flats or a flat .

example.ex: The salt marshes and mud flats attract large numbers of waterfowl.
example.tran: 盐碱地和泥滩吸引了大量水鸟。

collins.def: You can refer to one of the broad flat surfaces of an object as the flat of that object.

example.ex: He slammed the counter with the flat of his hand.
example.tran: 他用手掌使劲拍打着柜台。

example.ex: ...eight cloves of garlic crushed with the flat of a knife.
example.tran: 用刀面拍碎的 8 粒蒜瓣

collins.def: Flat shoes have no heels or very low heels.

example.ex: People wear slacks, sweaters, flat shoes, and all manner of casual attire for travel.
example.tran: 人们穿着宽松的长裤、运动衫、平底鞋和各式适合旅行的休闲服装。

collins.def: A flat tyre, ball, or balloon does not have enough air in it.
A flat is a tyre that does not have enough air in it.

example.ex: Then, after I finally got back on the highway, I developed a flat.
example.tran: 后来，我终于回到公路上后，车胎又瘪了。

collins.def: A drink that is flat is no longer fizzy.

example.ex: Could this really stop the champagne from going flat?
example.tran: 这真的能让香槟不走气吗？

collins.tran: (电池)没电的，电耗光的，电不足的
collins.def: A flat battery has lost some or all of its electrical charge.

example.ex: His car alarm had been going off for two days and, as a result, the battery was flat.
example.tran: 他的汽车报警器连着响了两天，结果电池耗没电了。

collins.def: If you have flat feet, the arches of your feet are too low.

example.ex: The condition of flat feet runs in families.
example.tran: 平足会在家族中遗传。

collins.def: A flat denial or refusal is definite and firm, and is unlikely to be changed.

example.ex: The Foreign Ministry has issued a flat denial of any involvement...
example.tran: 外交部已经坚决否认参与过此事。

example.ex: She is likely to give you a flat refusal.
example.tran: 她很可能会断然拒绝你。

collins.def: If you say that something happened, for example, in ten seconds flat or ten minutes flat, you are emphasizing that it happened surprisingly quickly and only took ten seconds or ten minutes.

example.ex: You're sitting behind an engine that'll move you from 0 to 60mph in six seconds flat...
example.tran: 您面前的引擎，可以在短短 6 秒钟内速度从 0 提升至每小时 60 英里。

example.ex: I had it all explained to me in two minutes flat.
example.tran: 短短两分钟内，我让人把一切都给我解释了一下。

collins.tran: (比率、价格或百分比)固定的，统一的
collins.def: A flat rate, price, or percentage is one that is fixed and which applies in every situation.

example.ex: Fees are charged at a flat rate, rather than on a percentage basis...
example.tran: 费用按固定价格收取，而不是基于百分比收取。

example.ex: Sometimes there's a flat fee for carrying out a particular task...
example.tran: 有时执行某项特定的任务有固定的价码。

collins.tran: (贸易或商业)停滞的，不景气的
collins.def: If trade or business is flat, it is slow and inactive, rather than busy and improving or increasing.

example.ex: During the first eight months of this year, sales of big pickups were up 14% while car sales stayed flat...
example.tran: 今年前 8 个月，大型货车的销售量增加了 14％，而小轿车的销售仍然不景气。

example.ex: For the country overall, house prices have remained flat.
example.tran: 从全国来说，房屋价格没有多大变化。

collins.def: If you describe something as flat, you mean that it is dull and not exciting or interesting.

example.ex: The past few days have seemed comparatively flat and empty...
example.tran: 过去这几天似乎比较平淡无聊。

example.ex: It is a long time since a party leader delivered such a dreadfully flat speech as he did yesterday.
example.tran: 很久没有政党领导人像他昨天那样作如此枯燥无聊的演讲了。

collins.def: You use flat to describe someone's voice when they are saying something without expressing any emotion.

example.ex: 'Whatever you say,' he said in a deadly flat voice. 'I'll sit here and wait.'...
example.tran: “不管你说什么，我都会坐在这里等。”他用一种极为平淡的声音说道。

example.ex: Her voice was flat, with no question or hope in it.
example.tran: 她的声音平淡，听不出疑虑也感觉不到希望。

collins.tran: (用于表示音符的字母后)降半音的，降音的
collins.def: Flat is used after a letter representing a musical note to show that the note should be played or sung half a tone lower than the note which otherwise matches that letter. Flat is often represented by the symbol  after the letter.

example.ex: ...Schubert's B flat Piano Trio (Opus 99).
example.tran: 舒伯特降 B 调钢琴三重奏(第 99 号作品)

collins.tran: (演唱或乐器)比标准音低的，音偏低的
collins.def: If someone sings flat or if a musical instrument is flat, their singing or the instrument is slightly lower in pitch than it should be.

example.ex: Her vocal range was, to say the least of it, limited, and she had a distressing tendency to sing flat.
example.tran: 至少可以说，她的音域不够宽，而且令人不舒服的是，她总是音高偏低。

collins.tran: 非常平坦的;完全平展的
collins.def: If you say that something is as flat as a pancake, you are emphasizing that it is completely flat.

example.ex: My home state of Illinois is flat as a pancake...
example.tran: 我的故乡伊利诺伊州一马平川。

collins.def: If you fall flat on your face, you fall over.

example.ex: A man walked in off the street and fell flat on his face, unconscious.
example.tran: 一个男人从街上走进来，趴倒在地，不省人事。

collins.def: If an event or attempt falls flat or falls flat on its face, it is unsuccessful.

example.ex: Liz meant it as a joke but it fell flat...
example.tran: 利兹本想开个玩笑，结果却没有达到效果。

example.ex: If it wasn't for the main actress, Ellen Barkin, the plot would have fallen flat on its face.
example.tran: 如果不是女主角埃伦·巴尔金的话，整个情节会非常失败。

collins.tran: 一文不名;身无分文;一贫如洗
collins.def: If you say that you are flat broke, you mean that you have no money at all.

example.ex: Two years later he is flat broke and on the dole.
example.tran: 两年后，他一贫如洗，靠失业救济金生活。

collins.tran: 全速;全力以赴;竭尽全力
collins.def: If you do something flat out, you do it as fast or as hard as you can.

example.ex: Everyone is working flat out to try to trap those responsible...
example.tran: 每个人都在全力以赴，设法捉住那些罪魁祸首。

example.ex: They hurtled across the line in a flat-out sprint.
example.tran: 他们拼命冲刺，越过终点线。

collins.tran: 完完全全的;确确实实的
collins.def: You use flat out to emphasize that something is completely the case.

example.ex: That allegation is a flat-out lie...
example.tran: 那项指控是彻头彻尾的谎言。

example.ex: They say the industry is flat out lying about the effects of deregulation.
example.tran: 他们说业界所谓的放宽管制已经取得了成效的说法纯属谎言。

collins.def: On the flat means on level ground.

example.ex: He had angina and was unable to walk for more than 200 yards on the flat.
example.tran: 他患有心绞痛，在平地上最多能走 200 码。

collins.tran: 发现(以前不知道的事实)
collins.def: If you discover something that you did not know about before, you become aware of it or learn of it.

example.ex: She discovered that they'd escaped...
example.tran: 她发现他们已经逃跑了。

example.ex: I discovered I was pregnant...
example.tran: 我发现自己怀孕了。

collins.tran: (偶然)发现;找到(一直在寻找的某人或某物)
collins.def: If a person or thing is discovered, someone finds them, either by accident or because they have been looking for them.

example.ex: A few days later his badly beaten body was discovered on a roadside outside the city.
example.tran: 几天后，他的尸体在城外的路边被发现，身上有被严重殴打过的痕迹。

collins.def: When someone discovers a new place, substance, scientific fact, or scientific technique, they are the first person to find it or become aware of it.

example.ex: ...the first European to discover America...
example.tran: 第一个发现美洲大陆的欧洲人

example.ex: In the 19th century, gold was discovered in California...
example.tran: 19 世纪时，在加利福尼亚发现了金子。

collins.tran: 初次接触(某活动并乐在其中)
collins.def: If you say that someone has discovered a particular activity or subject, you mean that they have tried doing it or studying it for the first time and that they enjoyed it.

example.ex: I wish I'd discovered photography when I was younger...
example.tran: 我要是早点接触到摄影技术就好了。

example.ex: Discover the delights and luxury of a private yacht.
example.tran: 体验私人游艇的乐趣和奢华。

collins.tran: 发现，发掘(不为人所知的演员、音乐人等艺人)
collins.def: When an actor, musician, or other performer who is not well-known is discovered, someone recognizes that they have talent and helps them in their career.

example.ex: The Beatles were discovered in the early 1960's.
example.tran: 甲壳虫乐队于20世纪60年代初为世人所知。

means: 接受(accept的过去式及过去分词)

collins.tran: 为公众所接受的；公认的
collins.def: Accepted ideas are agreed by most people to be correct or reasonable.

example.ex: There is no generally accepted definition of life...
example.tran: 关于生活的定义不一而足。

example.ex: It is accepted wisdom that science has been partly responsible for the decline of religion.
example.tran: 人们普遍认为，科学的兴起是宗教衰落的部分原因。

collins.def: Rebels are people who are fighting against their own country's army in order to change the political system there.

example.ex: ...fighting between rebels and government forces.
example.tran: 叛军和政府军之间的战争

example.ex: ...rebel forces in Liberia.
example.tran: 利比里亚的叛军

collins.tran: （政党内部的）持不同政见者，反对派
collins.def: Politicians who oppose some of their own party's policies can be referred to as rebels.

example.ex: The rebels want another 1% cut in interest rates.
example.tran: 反对派希望利率再降一个百分点。

example.ex: ...rebel MPs.
example.tran: 持不同政见的国会议员

collins.def: If politicians rebel against one of their own party's policies, they show that they oppose it.

example.ex: More than forty Conservative MPs rebelled against the government and voted against the bill.
example.tran: 40多个保守党议员反对政府的主张，对法案投了反对票。

example.ex: ...MPs planning to rebel over the proposed welfare cuts...
example.tran: 打算反对削减社会福利提议的国会议员

collins.tran: 叛逆者;不循规蹈矩的人
collins.def: You can say that someone is a rebel if you think that they behave differently from other people and have rejected the values of society or of their parents.

example.ex: She had been a rebel at school.
example.tran: 她在学校时就是个叛逆者。

collins.def: When someone rebels, they start to behave differently from other people and reject the values of society or of their parents.

example.ex: The child who rebels is unlikely to be overlooked...
example.tran: 叛逆的孩子不太容易被忽视。

example.ex: I was very young and rebelling against everything.
example.tran: 我当时非常年轻，对一切都表现出叛逆。

means: 授给物（如财产、授地、专有权、补助、拨款等）

collins.def: A grant is an amount of money that a government or other institution gives to an individual or to an organization for a particular purpose such as education or home improvements.

example.ex: They'd got a special grant to encourage research...
example.tran: 他们得到一笔用以鼓励科研的特别经费。

example.ex: Unfortunately, my application for a grant was rejected.
example.tran: 很遗憾，我的助学金申请被拒绝了。

collins.def: If someone in authority grants you something, or if something is granted to you, you are allowed to have it.

example.ex: France has agreed to grant him political asylum...
example.tran: 法国已经同意给予他政治避难。

example.ex: It was a Labour government which granted independence to India and Pakistan...
example.tran: 是工党政府同意了印度和巴基斯坦的独立。

collins.def: If you grant that something is true, you accept that it is true, even though your opinion about it does not change.

example.ex: The magistrates granted that the charity was justified in bringing the action.
example.tran: 地方法官承认该慈善机构有理由提起诉讼。

collins.tran: （因视作理所当然而）不把…当回事，对…不予重视（或不知感激）
collins.def: If you say that someone takes you for granted, you are complaining that they benefit from your help, efforts, or presence without showing that they are grateful.

example.ex: What right has the family to take me for granted, Martin?...
example.tran: 这家人有什么资格瞧不起我，马丁？

example.ex: The officials felt taken for granted and grumbled loudly.
example.tran: 这些官员感到受了怠慢，于是大声抱怨起来。

collins.def: If you take something for granted, you believe that it is true or accept it as normal without thinking about it.

example.ex: I was amazed that virtually all the things I took for granted up north just didn't happen in London.
example.tran: 几乎所有我认为在北方是理所当然的事情在伦敦都没有发生，这让我惊诧不已。

collins.def: If you take it for granted that something is the case, you believe that it is true or you accept it as normal without thinking about it.

example.ex: He seemed to take it for granted that he should speak as a representative.
example.tran: 他似乎想当然地认为他应该以代表的身份发言。

collins.def: The relationship between two people or groups is the way in which they feel and behave towards each other.

example.ex: ...the friendly relationship between France and Britain...
example.tran: 法国和英国之间的友好关系

example.ex: ...family relationships.
example.tran: 家庭关系

collins.tran: 恋爱关系；性关系；感情关系
collins.def: A relationship is a close friendship between two people, especially one involving romantic or sexual feelings.

example.ex: We had been together for two years, but both of us felt the relationship wasn't really going anywhere.
example.tran: 我们在一起已经两年了，但我们双方都觉得这段感情不会有什么结果。

collins.def: The relationship between two things is the way in which they are connected.

example.ex: There is a relationship between diet and cancer.
example.tran: 饮食结构和癌症之间有一定关联。

example.ex: ...an analysis of market mechanisms and their relationship to state capitalism and political freedom.
example.tran: 对于市场机制及其与国家资本主义和政治自由之间关系的分析

collins.def: When you enter a place such as a room or building, you go into it or come into it.

example.ex: He entered the room briskly and stood near the door...
example.tran: 他轻快地走进屋里，站在门边。

example.ex: Before entering the bathroom, he emptied his dirty laundry into the hamper...
example.tran: 进浴室前，他把脏衣服全都放进洗衣筐里。

collins.tran: 加入;成为…的一员；进入…（工作）
collins.def: If you enter an organization or institution, you start to work there or become a member of it.

example.ex: He entered the BBC as a general trainee...
example.tran: 他进入英国广播公司成为一名普通实习生。

example.ex: She entered a convent.
example.tran: 她成为了一名修女。

collins.tran: 突然出现（在头脑中）;掠过（脑海）
collins.def: If something new enters your mind, you suddenly think about it.

example.ex: Whenever thoughts of his baby daughter enter his mind a smile appears on Jeremy's face...
example.tran: 无论何时想起他的小女儿，杰里米的脸上都会出现笑容。

example.ex: Dreadful doubts began to enter my mind.
example.tran: 我开始产生了可怕的怀疑。

collins.def: If it does not enter your head to do, think or say something, you do not think of doing that thing although you should have done.

example.ex: It never enters his mind that anyone is better than him...
example.tran: 他从没想过会有谁比他更好。

example.ex: Though she enjoyed flirting with Matt, it had not entered her head to have an affair with him.
example.tran: 虽然她喜欢和马特打情骂俏，但是却未曾想过要和他相好。

collins.tran: 开始进入…（状况);迈入…(时期)
collins.def: If someone or something enters a particular situation or period of time, they start to be in it or part of it.

example.ex: China enters a new five-year plan period next year...
example.tran: 中国明年开始进入新一个五年计划期。

example.ex: The war has entered its second month...
example.tran: 战争已经进入了第二个月。

collins.tran: 参加，报名参加（比赛或考试）
collins.def: If you enter a competition, race, or examination, you officially state that you will compete or take part in it.

example.ex: I run so well I'm planning to enter some races...
example.tran: 我跑步很不错，正在考虑参加一些比赛。

example.ex: He entered for many competitions, winning several gold medals...
example.tran: 他参加过多次比赛，赢得了数枚金牌。

collins.def: If you enter someone for a race or competition, you officially state that they will compete or take part in it.

example.ex: His wife Marie secretly entered him for the Championship.
example.tran: 他妻子玛丽偷偷地为他报名参加锦标赛。

example.ex: ...some of the 150 projects entered for the awards.
example.tran: 150个参加奖项评比的项目中的一些

collins.def: If you enter something in a notebook, register, or financial account, you write it down.

example.ex: Each week she meticulously entered in her notebooks all sums received...
example.tran: 每个星期她都细心地在笔记本上记下所有收到的款项。

example.ex: Prue entered the passage in her notebook, then read it aloud again.
example.tran: 普吕把那一段写在她的笔记本上，然后又大声念了一遍。

collins.tran: （向计算机或数据库中）输入，写入
collins.def: To enter information into a computer or database means to record it there, for example by typing it on a keyboard.

example.ex: When a baby is born, they enter that baby's name into the computer...
example.tran: 每当有婴儿降生，他们就将婴儿的名字输入电脑。

example.ex: Postcodes will be entered into the statisticians' computers...
example.tran: 邮编将被输入统计员的电脑中。

collins.def: A direction is the general line that someone or something is moving or pointing in.

example.ex: St Andrews was ten miles in the opposite direction...
example.tran: 圣安德鲁斯在相反方向上 10 英里处。

example.ex: He drove off in the direction of Larry's shop...
example.tran: 他驾车朝着拉里商店的方向驶去。

collins.def: A direction is the general way in which something develops or progresses.

example.ex: They threatened to walk out if the party did not change direction...
example.tran: 他们威胁说，如果该党不改变方针，他们就将集体退席。

example.ex: I've never done any sustained writing, but that might be one of my next directions.
example.tran: 我以前从未尝试过持续写作，不过那可能是我下一步努力的方向之一。

collins.def: Directions are instructions that tell you what to do, how to do something, or how to get somewhere.

example.ex: I should know by now not to throw away the directions until we've finished cooking...
example.tran: 现在我知道了不该在饭没做完之前就扔掉烹饪说明。

example.ex: He proceeded to give Dan directions to the computer room.
example.tran: 他接着告诉丹去计算机房该怎么走。

collins.tran: (影片、戏剧或电视节目的)导演
collins.def: The direction of a film, play, or television programme is the work that the director does while it is being made.

example.ex: His failures underline the difference between theatre and film direction.
example.tran: 他的失败说明了导演戏剧和电影是不同的。

collins.def: If you urge someone to do something, you try hard to persuade them to do it.

example.ex: They urged parliament to approve plans for their reform programme...
example.tran: 他们敦促议会批准他们的改革方案。

example.ex: He urged employers and trade unions to adapt their pay settlements to the economic circumstances.
example.tran: 他敦促雇主和工会根据经济条件调整工资方案。

collins.def: If you urge someone somewhere, you make them go there by touching them or talking to them.

example.ex: He slipped his arm around her waist and urged her away from the window...
example.tran: 他揽住她的腰，拉着她离开了窗边。

example.ex: 'Come on, Grace,' he was urging her, 'don't wait, hurry up.'
example.tran: “快点啦，格雷丝，”他催促道，“别等了。快点。”

collins.def: If you urge a course of action, you strongly advise that it should be taken.

example.ex: He urged restraint on the security forces...
example.tran: 他力主对安全部队设限。

example.ex: We urge vigorous action to be taken immediately.
example.tran: 我们强烈要求立即采取有力措施。

collins.tran: 强烈的欲望；冲动；迫切的要求
collins.def: If you have an urge to do or have something, you have a strong wish to do or have it.

example.ex: He had an urge to open a shop of his own...
example.tran: 他很想自己开一家店。

example.ex: I have often talked about why we want to be mothers, but none of us can describe the urge exactly.
example.tran: 我经常谈到我们为什么想做母亲，但没有一个人能准确地描述这种冲动。

collins.def: The third item in a series is the one that you count as number three.

example.ex: I sleep on the third floor...
example.tran: 我睡在三楼。

example.ex: It was the third time one of his cars had gone up in flames...
example.tran: 这是他的车第三次起火。

collins.def: A third is one of three equal parts of something.

example.ex: A third of the cost went into technology and services...
example.tran: 有三分之一的支出投入了技术和服务。

example.ex: Only one third get financial help from their fathers...
example.tran: 只有三分之一的人得到父亲的经济援助。

collins.def: You say third when you want to make a third point or give a third reason for something.

example.ex: First, interest rates may take longer to fall than is hoped. Second, in real terms, lending may fall. Third, bad loans could wipe out much of any improvement.
example.tran: 首先，利率的下降可能没有希望的那样快;第二，实际贷款额可能会减少;第三，坏账很可能抵消大部分增长。

collins.tran: 三等学位(英国大学颁发的最低级荣誉学位)
collins.def: A third is the lowest honours degree that can be obtained from a British university.

collins.tran: （尤指从行为中表现出来的）态度，看法
collins.def: Your attitude to something is the way that you think and feel about it, especially when this shows in the way you behave.

example.ex: ...the general change in attitude towards handicapped people...
example.tran: 对残疾人态度的整体转变

example.ex: Being unemployed produces negative attitudes to work...
example.tran: 失业会产生对工作的消极态度。

collins.tran: 个人风格;（尤指）咄咄逼人的作派
collins.def: If you refer to someone as a person with attitude, you mean that they have a striking and individual style of behaviour, especially a forceful or aggressive one.

example.ex: Patti Smith and Janis Joplin did it all years ago and they were women with attitude and talent.
example.tran: 帕蒂·史密斯和詹妮斯·乔普林多年前就这样做过，她们当时是两位个性鲜明的才女。

collins.def: Your attitude of mind is your general way of thinking and feeling.

example.ex: Writing calls for a critical attitude of mind that he did not possess.
example.tran: 写作需要有批判性思维，而这正是他所不具备的。

means: 到这程度，到这地步，这么

collins.def: You use thus to show that what you are about to mention is the result or consequence of something else that you have just mentioned.

example.ex: Neither of them thought of turning on the lunch-time news. Thus Caroline didn't hear of John's death until Peter telephoned...
example.tran: 两个人谁也没有想到打开电视看午间新闻，所以直到彼得打来电话，卡罗琳才得知约翰的死讯。

example.ex: Even in a highly skilled workforce some people will be more capable and thus better paid than others.
example.tran: 就算是在技术高度熟练的劳动者中，也会有人能力更强，因此，薪水也就更高。

collins.def: If you say that something is thus or happens thus you mean that it is, or happens, as you have just described or as you are just about to describe.

example.ex: Joanna was pouring the drink. While she was thus engaged, Charles sat on one of the bar-stools...
example.tran: 乔安娜正在倒酒。就在她正忙的当儿，查尔斯坐在了一张酒吧凳子上。

example.ex: Martin helped his father dig the water gardens out by hand. Thus he discovered his interest in gardening.
example.tran: 马丁亲手帮他父亲修建起了水景园，就这样对园艺产生了兴趣。

collins.def: You use therefore to introduce a logical result or conclusion.

example.ex: Muscle cells need lots of fuel and therefore burn lots of calories...
example.tran: 肌肉细胞需要很多能量，所以会燃烧大量卡路里。

example.ex: Nothing was to prevent him now from becoming the richest, and therefore the happiest, man in the world.
example.tran: 现在什么也阻挡不了他成为世上最富有因而也是最幸福的人。

collins.def: You use for instance to introduce a particular event, situation, or person that is an example of what you are talking about.

example.ex: There are a number of improvements; for instance, both mouse buttons can now be used...
example.tran: 在许多地方有了改进,例如,鼠标的左右键都可以使用了。

example.ex: Let your child make some of the small decisions concerning his daily routine. For instance, allow him to choose what clothes he wears at the weekend.
example.tran: 让孩子在日常生活中作一些小决定。比如,让他自己决定周末穿什么衣服。

collins.def: An instance is a particular example or occurrence of something.

example.ex: She cited an instance where their training had been a marvelous help in dealing with problems.
example.tran: 她举了一个所受训练为解决问题帮了大忙的实例。

example.ex: ...an investigation into a serious instance of corruption.
example.tran: 对一起严重的腐败事件的调查

collins.def: You say in the first instance to mention something that is the first step in a series of actions.

example.ex: In the first instance your child will be seen by an ear, nose and throat specialist...
example.tran: 你的孩子将首先由耳鼻喉专科医生来诊察。

example.ex: The post was for one year in the first instance with possible renewal to a further year.
example.tran: 该岗位初始为一年期,有可能会再续聘一年。

collins.def: If you do something at someone's instance, you do it because they have ordered or requested you to do it.

example.ex: The rally was organised at the instance of two senior cabinet ministers.
example.tran: 集会是应两位资深内阁大臣的要求组织的。

collins.def: You refer to people who are in control of a group or organization as the leadership .

example.ex: He is expected to hold talks with both the Croatian and Slovenian leaderships.
example.tran: 预计他将与克罗地亚和斯洛文尼亚领导层举行会谈。

example.ex: ...the Labour leadership of Haringey council  in north London.
example.tran: 北伦敦哈林盖政务委员会的工党领导层

collins.def: Someone's leadership is their position or state of being in control of a group of people.

example.ex: He praised her leadership during the crisis...
example.tran: 他赞扬她在危机中领导有方。

example.ex: We find the leftists assuming leadership and becoming the spokesmen for an ideal of international revolution.
example.tran: 我们发现，左派逐渐掌权并成为国际革命理想的代言人。

collins.tran: 领导才能；领导方法；领导作风
collins.def: Leadership refers to the qualities that make someone a good leader, or the methods a leader uses to do his or her job.

example.ex: What most people want to see is determined, decisive action and firm leadership.
example.tran: 大多数人希望看到的是果决的行动和强有力的领导作风。

means: 平民的，无官职的，士兵的

collins.tran: （产业、服务）私立的，私有的，私营的，民营的
collins.def: Private industries and services are owned or controlled by an individual person or a commercial company, rather than by the state or an official organization.

example.ex: ...a joint venture with private industry...
example.tran: 与私营企业建立的合资企业

example.ex: Bupa runs private hospitals in Britain...
example.tran: 保柏在英国开办私立医院。

collins.def: Private individuals are acting only for themselves, and are not representing any group, company, or organization.

example.ex: ...the law's insistence that private citizens are not permitted to have weapons...
example.tran: 法律坚持要求公民个人不得持有武器

example.ex: The King was on a private visit to enable him to pray at the tombs of his ancestors...
example.tran: 国王以私人身份出访，以便能够祭拜先祖陵墓。

collins.tran: （财物等）个人所有的，私有的，私人的
collins.def: Your private things belong only to you, or may only be used by you.

example.ex: The landowners have had to sell their private aircraft...
example.tran: 这些土地所有者不得不卖掉自己的私人飞机。

example.ex: They want more State control over private property...
example.tran: 他们希望加强国家对私有财产的控制。

collins.tran: （地方、聚会等）非公开的，私人的
collins.def: Private places or gatherings may be attended only by a particular group of people, rather than by the general public.

example.ex: 673 private golf clubs took part in a recent study...
example.tran: 673家私人高尔夫俱乐部参与了最近的研究。

example.ex: The door is marked 'Private'...
example.tran: 这扇门上标着“私人房间”。

collins.tran: （会议、讨论、活动等）秘密的，私下的
collins.def: Private meetings, discussions, and other activities involve only a small number of people, and very little information about them is given to other people.

example.ex: Don't bug private conversations, and don't buy papers that reprint them.
example.tran: 不要窃听私人谈话，不要购买重印这些谈话的报纸。

collins.tran: （生活）私人的，个人的，与工作无关的
collins.def: Your private life is that part of your life that is concerned with your personal relationships and activities, rather than with your work or business.

example.ex: I've always kept my private and professional life separate...
example.tran: 我总是将私生活和工作分开。

example.ex: My private affairs are no one's business but my own.
example.tran: 我自己的事自己管，不用其他人操心。

collins.tran: （想法、感觉）私密的，隐私的，内心的
collins.def: Your private thoughts or feelings are ones that you do not talk about to other people.

example.ex: We all felt as if we were intruding on his private grief.
example.tran: 我们都觉得似乎触及到了他内心的伤痛。

example.ex: ...the enactment of her private sexual fantasies...
example.tran: 她内心产生了性幻想

collins.def: You can use private to describe situations or activities that are understood only by the people involved in them, and not by anyone else.

example.ex: Chinese waiters stood in a cluster, sharing a private joke...
example.tran: 华人服务生们站在一起，讲着只有他们自己才懂的笑话。

example.ex: As many as 40 per cent of twins have a private language that excludes the rest of the family.
example.tran: 多达40％的双胞胎都有自己的语言，其他家庭成员都听不懂。

collins.tran: （地方等）僻静的，幽静的，无人打扰的
collins.def: If you describe a place as private, or as somewhere where you can be private, you mean that it is a quiet place and you can be alone there without being disturbed.

example.ex: It was the only reasonably private place they could find.
example.tran: 这是他们能找到的唯一一个还算僻静之处。

example.ex: ...a very attractive country house set within a uniquely beautiful and private position...
example.tran: 坐落在风景独特的僻静之处的非常别致的乡间别墅

collins.tran: （人）内敛的，文静内向的，孤僻的
collins.def: If you describe someone as a private person, you mean that they are very quiet by nature and do not reveal their thoughts and feelings to other people.

example.ex: She has always been a rather private person...
example.tran: 她一直是一个相当内向的人。

example.ex: Gould was an intensely private individual.
example.tran: 古德以前是个极为孤僻的人。

collins.tran: 私人教授的；私下辅导的
collins.def: You can use private to describe lessons that are not part of ordinary school activity, and which are given by a teacher to an individual pupil or a small group, usually in return for payment.

example.ex: Martial arts: Private lessons: £8 per hour.
example.tran: 武术：私人教授：每小时8英镑

example.ex: ...Donald Tovey, who took her as his private pupil for the piano.
example.tran: 唐纳德·托维，她的私人钢琴老师

collins.tran: 列兵，二等兵（级别最低的士兵）
collins.def: A private is a soldier of the lowest rank in an army or the marines.

example.ex: One gunner in each battery was an NCO and the rest were privates.
example.tran: 每个炮兵连都有一个炮手是军士，其余都是二等兵。

example.ex: ...Private Martin Ferguson.
example.tran: 二等兵马丁·费格森

collins.def: Your privates are your genitals.

example.ex: You should wash your feet and your privates every day.
example.tran: 应该每天洗脚，并清洗阴部。

collins.def: If you do something in private, you do it without other people being present, often because it is something that you want to keep secret.

example.ex: Some of what we're talking about might better be discussed in private.
example.tran: 我们要谈论的一些事情最好是在私下里讨论。

means: 调整（镜头，眼睛）焦点[焦距]以便看清
调整（眼睛或者镜头的）焦距

collins.def: If you focus on a particular topic or if your attention is focused on it, you concentrate on it and think about it, discuss it, or deal with it, rather than dealing with other topics.

example.ex: The research effort has focused on tracing the effects of growing levels of five compounds...
example.tran: 研究重点追踪了5种化合物含量上升的影响。

example.ex: He is currently focusing on assessment and development...
example.tran: 他目前在关注评估和发展。

collins.def: The focus of something is the main topic or main thing that it is concerned with.

example.ex: The UN's role in promoting peace is increasingly the focus of international attention...
example.tran: 联合国在促进和平方面的作用越来越受到国际社会的关注。

example.ex: The new system is the focus of controversy...
example.tran: 这个新体制是争议的焦点。

collins.def: Your focus on something is the special attention that you pay it.

example.ex: He said his sudden focus on foreign policy was not motivated by presidential politics...
example.tran: 他说他突然关注外交政策并非受总统政治的驱使。

example.ex: The report's focus is on how technology affects human life rather than business...
example.tran: 这个报告关注的是技术如何影响人类生活而非商业活动。

collins.def: If you say that something has a focus, you mean that you can see a purpose in it.

example.ex: Somehow, though, their latest album has a focus that the others have lacked...
example.tran: 但是，他们的最新专辑设法找到了其他专辑所欠缺的一种目的性。

example.ex: Suddenly all of the bizarre and seemingly isolated examples took on a meaningful focus.
example.tran: 突然之间，所有那些怪异且看上去孤立的例子都具有了意义。

collins.tran: 注视;使(相机、望远镜等)聚焦;给…调焦
collins.def: If you focus your eyes or if your eyes focus, your eyes adjust so that you can clearly see the thing that you want to look at. If you focus a camera, telescope, or other instrument, you adjust it so that you can see clearly through it.

example.ex: Kelly couldn't focus his eyes well enough to tell if the figure was male or female...
example.tran: 凯利没有看清楚那个人影到底是男的还是女的。

example.ex: His eyes slowly began to focus on what looked like a small dark ball...
example.tran: 他的眼睛慢慢开始看清楚那个看上去像是个小黑球的东西。

collins.def: You use focus to refer to the fact of adjusting your eyes or a camera, telescope, or other instrument, and to the degree to which you can see clearly.

example.ex: His focus switched to the little white ball...
example.tran: 他把关注点转移到那个小白球上。

example.ex: Together these factors determine the depth of focus...
example.tran: 这些因素综合起来决定了景深。

collins.def: If you focus rays of light on a particular point, you pass them through a lens or reflect them from a mirror so that they meet at that point.

example.ex: Magnetic coils focus the electron beams into fine spots.
example.tran: 磁线圈把电子束聚焦成微小的点。

collins.def: The focus of a number of rays or lines is the point at which they meet.

collins.tran: (图像)清晰;(照相机、望远镜等)对准焦点
collins.def: If an image or a camera, telescope, or other instrument is in focus, the edges of what you see are clear and sharp.

example.ex: Pictures should be in focus, with realistic colours and well composed groups.
example.tran: 照片应该图像清晰，颜色逼真，构图合理。

collins.tran: 受关注;在讨论;(目的和性质)清楚的，明白的
collins.def: If something is in focus, it is being discussed or its purpose and nature are clear.

example.ex: This aggression is the real issue the world should be concerned about. We want to keep that in focus...
example.tran: 这次侵略才是世界应该关注的真正问题。我们想继续保持关注。

example.ex: These issues were brought into sharp focus by the Gulf crisis.
example.tran: 海湾危机让这些问题备受关注。

collins.def: If an image or a camera, telescope, or other instrument is out of focus, the edges of what you see are unclear.

example.ex: In some of the pictures the subjects are out of focus while the background is sharp.
example.tran: 一些照片背景很清晰，被摄主体却因失焦而显得模糊。

example.ex: ...a lot of out-of-focus photographs.
example.tran: 许多对焦不实的照片

collins.tran: 不受关注;(目的和性质)不清晰的
collins.def: If something is out of focus, it is not being discussed or its purpose or nature is not clear.

example.ex: The deficit in the US balance of payments put these considerations out of focus...
example.tran: 美国的国际收支逆差使这些因素没有得到关注。

example.ex: The movement towards democracy in Latin America and the foreign debt problems that have plagued it have gone out of focus.
example.tran: 拉丁美洲的民主运动和困扰该地区的外债问题已经淡出人们的视线。

collins.def: Something or someone that is huge is extremely large in size.

example.ex: ...a tiny little woman with huge black glasses...
example.tran: 戴着一副硕大黑框眼镜的娇小女子

example.ex: Several painters were working on a huge piece of canvas which would serve as the scenery...
example.tran: 几位画家正在一块用作舞台布景的巨大帆布上作画。

collins.def: Something that is huge is extremely large in amount or degree.

example.ex: I have a huge number of ties because I never throw them away...
example.tran: 我有超多条领带，因为我从来不肯扔掉它们。

example.ex: He is furious they are making huge profits out of the misery of young addicts.
example.tran: 看到他们从年轻吸毒者的痛苦中榨取暴利，他怒不可遏。

collins.def: Something that is huge exists or happens on a very large scale, and involves a lot of different people or things.

example.ex: Another team is looking at the huge problem of debts between companies...
example.tran: 另一组人正在研究公司间严重的债务问题。

example.ex: The result was human suffering on a huge scale.
example.tran: 结果是人类遭遇深重的灾难。

collins.def: The volume of something is the amount of it that there is.

example.ex: Senior officials will be discussing how the volume of sales might be reduced.
example.tran: 高层领导将要讨论销售量如何削减。

example.ex: ...the sheer volume of traffic and accidents.
example.tran: 交通流量之大、事故之多

collins.def: The volume of an object is the amount of space that it contains or occupies.

example.ex: It is 2,300 metres above sea level, so a given volume of air contains only about one-third as much oxygen as it would at sea level...
example.tran: 这是在海拔2,300米的高空，因此一定体积空气的含氧量只有海平面处的约1/3。

example.ex: When egg whites are beaten they can rise to seven or eight times their original volume.
example.tran: 蛋清打散后，体积可增至原来的七八倍。

collins.def: A volume is a book.

example.ex: ...a 125-page volume.
example.tran: 一本125页的书

collins.def: A volume is one book in a series of books.

example.ex: ...the first volume of his autobiography.
example.tran: 他自传的第一卷

collins.def: A volume is a collection of several issues of a magazine, for example all the issues for one year.

example.ex: ...bound volumes of the magazine.
example.tran: 杂志的合订本

collins.tran: （广播、电视或音响系统的）音量，声量,响度
collins.def: The volume of a radio, television, or sound system is the loudness of the sound it produces.

example.ex: He turned down the volume...
example.tran: 他调低了音量。

example.ex: He came to complain about the volume of the music.
example.tran: 他过来抱怨音乐的音量太高了。

collins.tran: 清楚表明;详尽说明;充分说明
collins.def: If something such as an action speaks volumes about a person or thing, it gives you a lot of information about them.

example.ex: What you wear speaks volumes about you...
example.tran: 你的衣着能传递很多关于你的信息。

example.ex: Their absence spoke volumes.
example.tran: 他们的缺席已经充分说明了问题。

collins.def: The speed of something is the rate at which it moves or travels.

example.ex: He drove off at high speed...
example.tran: 他驱车飞驰而去。

example.ex: With this type of camera, the shutter speed is fixed...
example.tran: 对这类相机而言，快门的速度是固定的。

collins.tran: (某事发生或进展的)速度，进度
collins.def: The speed of something is the rate at which it happens or is done.

example.ex: In the late 1850s the speed of technological change quickened...
example.tran: 19 世纪 50 年代末期，技术变革的速度加快了。

example.ex: Each learner can proceed at his own speed.
example.tran: 每一位学习者都可以按自己的进度学习。

collins.def: Speed is very fast movement or travel.

example.ex: Speed is the essential ingredient of all athletics...
example.tran: 速度是所有田径运动项目的关键要素。

example.ex: He put on a burst of speed...
example.tran: 他突然加速了。

collins.tran: (指某事发生或进展时的)高速，快速
collins.def: Speed is a very fast rate at which something happens or is done.

example.ex: I was amazed at his speed of working.
example.tran: 他办事之麻利让我深感叹服。

example.ex: ...the sheer speed of the unification process.
example.tran: 统一进程速度惊人

collins.def: If you speed somewhere, you move or travel there quickly, usually in a vehicle.

example.ex: Trains will speed through the Channel Tunnel at 186mph...
example.tran: 火车将以每小时 186 英里的速度快速穿过海峡隧道。

example.ex: The engine noise rises only slightly as I speed along.
example.tran: 我一路高速行驶时，发动机的噪音只提高了一点点。

collins.def: Someone who is speeding is driving a vehicle faster than the legal speed limit.

example.ex: This man was not qualified to drive and was speeding.
example.tran: 这名男子没有驾驶资格，并且违章超速行驶。

collins.def: Speed is an illegal drug such as amphetamine which some people take to increase their energy and excitement.
If you are up to speed, you have all the most recent information that you need about something.

example.ex: A day has been set aside to bring all councillors up to speed on the proposal...
example.tran: 已经确定了一个日子，届时将向所有的市政委员汇报有关该建议的最新进展情况。

example.ex: Those in charge deluded themselves they were up to speed.
example.tran: 那些负责人自以为掌握了最新情况。

collins.def: If you make a copy of something, you produce something that looks like the original thing.

example.ex: The reporter apparently obtained a copy of Steve's resignation letter...
example.tran: 那记者显然弄到了史蒂夫辞职信的复印件。

example.ex: Always keep a copy of everything in your own files.
example.tran: 要时刻牢记把所有文件都备份。

collins.def: If you copy something, you produce something that looks like the original thing.

example.ex: She never participated in obtaining or copying any classified documents for anyone.
example.tran: 她从未参与过为任何人获取或复制机密文件之事。

example.ex: ...lawsuits against companies who have unlawfully copied computer programs.
example.tran: 对非法复制计算机程序的公司提起的诉讼

collins.def: If you copy a piece of writing, you write it again exactly.

example.ex: He would allow John slyly to copy his answers to impossibly difficult algebra questions...
example.tran: 他会让约翰偷偷抄下自己对一些极难的代数题的解答。

example.ex: He copied the data into a notebook...
example.tran: 他将数据抄在一个笔记本上。

collins.def: If you copy a person or what they do, you try to do what they do or try to be like them, usually because you admire them or what they have done.

example.ex: Children can be seen to copy the behaviour of others whom they admire or identify with...
example.tran: 人们发现儿童会模仿他们所崇拜或有共鸣感的人。

example.ex: He can claim to have been defeated by opponents copying his own tactics.
example.tran: 他可以说是被仿效自己策略的对手们给打败了。

collins.def: A copy of a book, newspaper, or CD is one of many that are exactly the same.

example.ex: I bought a copy of 'USA Today' from a street-corner machine...
example.tran: 我从街角的自动售卖机买了一份《今日美国》。

example.ex: You can obtain a copy for $2 from New York Central Art Supply.
example.tran: 花两美元就能从纽约艺术用品中心买到一册。

collins.tran: (准备刊印或广播的)原稿，稿件
collins.def: In journalism, copy is written material that is ready to be printed or read in a broadcast.

example.ex: ...his ability to write the most lyrical copy in the history of sports television.
example.tran: 他能够撰写体育节目史上最富热情和激情的稿件

example.ex: ...advertising copy.
example.tran: 广告文案

collins.tran: 有报道价值的消息;新闻素材
collins.def: In journalism, copy is news or information that can be used in an article in a newspaper.

example.ex: ...journalists looking for good copy.
example.tran: 搜罗好题材的记者

collins.def: A journalist is a person whose job is to collect news and write about it for newspapers, magazines, television, or radio.
Someone's aunt is the sister of their mother or father, or the wife of their uncle.

example.ex: She wrote to her aunt in America...
example.tran: 她给远在美国的姨妈写了封信。

example.ex: It was a present from Aunt Vera.
example.tran: 这是薇拉姑妈送的礼物。

collins.def: If you comment on something, you give your opinion about it or you give an explanation for it.

example.ex: So far, Mr Cook has not commented on these reports...
example.tran: 到目前为止，库克先生仍未就这些报道发表评论。

example.ex: Stratford police refuse to comment on whether anyone has been arrested...
example.tran: 斯特拉福德警方拒绝对是否已有人被捕一事发表任何评论。

collins.def: A comment is something that you say which expresses your opinion of something or which gives an  explanation of it.

example.ex: He made his comments at a news conference in Amsterdam...
example.tran: 他在阿姆斯特丹的记者招待会上发表了意见。

example.ex: I was wondering whether you had any comments about that?...
example.tran: 请问您对此有何见解？

collins.tran: (通常是不好的事的)体现，写照
collins.def: If an event or situation is a comment on something, it reveals something about that thing, usually something bad.

example.ex: He argues that family problems are typically a comment on some unresolved issues in the family.
example.tran: 他认为各种家庭问题通常都反映出家庭内部存在一些有待解决的矛盾。

collins.tran: 无可奉告(通常用于回答记者的提问)
collins.def: People say 'no comment' as a way of refusing to answer a question, usually when it is asked by a journalist.

example.ex: No comment. I don't know anything.
example.tran: 无可奉告。我什么都不知道。

collins.def: Progress is the process of gradually improving or getting nearer to achieving or completing something.

example.ex: The medical community continues to make progress in the fight against cancer...
example.tran: 医学界在抗癌的斗争中不断取得进步。

example.ex: The two sides made little if any progress towards agreement.
example.tran: 双方在达成协议方面的进展甚微。

collins.def: The progress of a situation or action is the way in which it develops.

example.ex: The Chancellor is  reported to have been delighted with the progress of the first day's talks...
example.tran: 据报道，总理对第一天会谈的进展表示满意。

example.ex: Ellen would keep me abreast of the progress by phone.
example.tran: 埃伦会通过电话及时向我通报进展情况。

collins.def: To progress means to move over a period of time to a stronger, more advanced, or more desirable state.

example.ex: He will visit once a fortnight to see how his new staff are progressing...
example.tran: 他会每两个星期来访一次，看看他的新员工进展如何。

example.ex: Were you surprised that his disease progressed so quickly?...
example.tran: 他的病情发展得这么快，您是否感到意外？

collins.def: If events progress, they continue to happen gradually over a period of time.

example.ex: As the evening progressed, sadness turned to rage...
example.tran: 随着夜幕逐渐降临，悲伤变成了愤怒。

example.ex: Life was hard, and it became harder as the war progressed.
example.tran: 那时候生活很艰难，并且随着战争的持续愈发艰难了。

collins.def: If you progress something, you cause it to develop.

example.ex: Very little was done to progress the case in the first 10 or so months after K was charged.
example.tran: 在K被指控后最初的10个月左右，这个案子进展缓慢。

collins.def: If something is in progress, it has started and is still continuing.

example.ex: The game was already in progress when we took our seats...
example.tran: 我们坐下来的时候，比赛已经开始了。

example.ex: The diaries are a mixture of confession, work in progress and observation.
example.tran: 这些日记里既有自白，也有当下工作记录，还有见闻评论。

collins.def: A painting is a picture which someone has painted.

example.ex: ...a large oil-painting of Queen Victoria.
example.tran: 维多利亚女王的大幅油画

collins.def: Painting is the activity of painting pictures.

example.ex: ...two hobbies she really enjoyed, painting and gardening.
example.tran: 她的两大嗜好: 绘画和园艺

collins.def: Painting is the activity of painting doors, walls, and some other parts of buildings.

example.ex: ...painting and decorating.
example.tran: 粉刷和装潢

collins.def: An employee is a person who is paid to work for an organization or for another person.

example.ex: He is an employee of Fuji Bank...
example.tran: 他是富士银行的雇员。

example.ex: Many of its employees are women.
example.tran: 很多雇员是女性。

collins.def: A republic is a country where power is held by the people or the representatives that they elect. Republics have presidents who are elected, rather than kings or queens.

example.ex: In 1918, Austria became a republic.
example.tran: 1918年，奥地利成为共和国。

example.ex: ...the Baltic republics.
example.tran: 波罗的海沿岸诸共和国

collins.def: A crisis is a situation in which something or someone is affected by one or more very serious problems.

example.ex: Natural disasters have obviously contributed to the continent's economic crisis...
example.tran: 很显然，自然灾害也是造成该大陆经济危机的原因之一。

example.ex: The Italian political system has been judged to be in terminal crisis for decades.
example.tran: 人们认为意大利的政治体系几十年来一直存在着严重危机。

collins.def: If you ignore someone or something, you pay no attention to them.

example.ex: She said her husband ignored her...
example.tran: 她说丈夫不关心她。

example.ex: The government had ignored his views on the subject...
example.tran: 政府没有理睬他对这一问题的看法。

collins.def: If you say that an argument or theory ignores an important aspect of a situation, you are criticizing it because it fails to consider that aspect or to take it into account.

example.ex: Such arguments ignore the question of where ultimate responsibility lay.
example.tran: 这些争论忽略了最终责任由谁来负的问题。

collins.def: Individual means relating to one person or thing, rather than to a large group.

example.ex: They wait for the group to decide rather than making individual decisions...
example.tran: 他们等待团体作决定而不是各自作出决定。

example.ex: Aid to individual countries would be linked to progress towards democracy...
example.tran: 对个别国家的援助会与其民主进程相挂钩。

collins.def: An individual is a person.

example.ex: ...anonymous individuals who are doing good things within our community.
example.tran: 一些在我们社区内做好事却不留名的个人

example.ex: ...the rights and responsibilities of the individual...
example.tran: 个人的权利和责任

collins.def: If you describe someone or something as individual, you mean that you admire them because they are very unusual and do not try to imitate other people or things.

example.ex: It was really all part of her very individual personality...
example.tran: 那其实都是她独特个性的表现。

example.ex: The language is highly individual.
example.tran: 语言非常独特。

collins.tran: 坚持;坚决认为(或主张、要求)
collins.def: If you insist that something should be done, you say so very firmly and refuse to give in about it. If you insist on something, you say firmly that it must be done or provided.

example.ex: My family insisted that I should not give in, but stay and fight...
example.tran: 家里人坚持认为我不应让步,而应该留下来继续抗争。

example.ex: She insisted on being present at all the interviews...
example.tran: 她坚持所有采访自己都要在场。

collins.def: If you insist that something is the case, you say so very firmly and refuse to say otherwise, even though other people do not believe you.

example.ex: The president insisted that he was acting out of compassion, not opportunism...
example.tran: 总统坚持说他如此做是出于同情而不是为了投机。

example.ex: 'It's not that difficult,' she insists...
example.tran: “并没有那么困难,”她坚持说。

collins.def: An egg is an oval object that is produced by a female bird and which contains a baby bird. Other animals such as reptiles and fish also lay eggs.

example.ex: ...a baby bird hatching from its egg.
example.tran: 从蛋中孵出的小鸟

example.ex: ...ant eggs.
example.tran: 蚁卵

collins.tran: （西方国家常指供食用的）鸡蛋
collins.def: In Western countries, eggs often means hen's eggs, eaten as food.

example.ex: Break the eggs into a shallow bowl and beat them lightly.
example.tran: 把鸡蛋打到一个浅碗中，轻轻搅打。

example.ex: ...bacon and eggs.
example.tran: 咸肉煎蛋

collins.def: Egg is used to refer to an object in the shape of a hen's egg.

example.ex: ...a chocolate egg.
example.tran: 巧克力蛋

collins.def: An egg is a cell that is produced in the bodies of female animals and humans. If it is fertilized by a sperm, a baby develops from it.

example.ex: It only takes one sperm to fertilize an egg.
example.tran: 只需要一个精子就能让卵子受精。

collins.tran: 寄希望于一件事上;孤注一掷
collins.def: If someone puts all their eggs in one basket, they put all their effort or resources into doing one thing so that, if it fails, they have no alternatives left.

example.ex: The key word here is diversify; don't put all your eggs in one basket.
example.tran: 这里的关键词是多样性；不要在一棵树上吊死。

collins.def: If someone has egg on their face or has egg all over their face, they have been made to look foolish.

example.ex: If they take this game lightly they could end up with egg on their faces.
example.tran: 如果他们对这场比赛掉以轻心，结果很可能会出丑。

collins.tran: (部位、问题、题目等)特定的，特别的
collins.def: You use specific to refer to a particular fixed area, problem, or subject.

example.ex: Massage may help to increase blood flow to specific areas of the body...
example.tran: 按摩有助于增加身体特定部位的血液流量。

example.ex: There are several specific problems to be dealt with...
example.tran: 有几个特定问题需要解决。

collins.def: If someone is specific, they give a description that is precise and exact. You can also use specific to describe their description.

example.ex: I asked him to be more specific...
example.tran: 我要求他说得更具体些。

example.ex: These nerve centres generate rhythmic movements; or to be more specific, rhythmic stomach movements...
example.tran: 这些神经中心产生有节奏的运动，或者更确切地说，是有节奏的肠胃蠕动。

collins.tran: 特有的;独特的;只与…有关的
collins.def: Something that is specific to a particular thing is connected with that thing only.

example.ex: Send your resume with a cover letter that is specific to that particular job.
example.tran: 寄出你的简历并附上一份针对那个特定工作岗位的附函。

means: 共产主义者，共产主义的支持者

collins.def: A communist is someone who believes in communism.
Communist means relating to communism.

example.ex: ...the Communist Party.
example.tran: 共产党

collins.def: Stocks are shares in the ownership of a company, or investments on which a fixed amount of interest will be paid.

example.ex: ...the buying and selling of stocks and shares...
example.tran: 证券和股票买卖

example.ex: As stock prices have dropped, so too has bank capital.
example.tran: 随着股价下跌，银行资本也减少了。

collins.def: A company's stock is the amount of money which the company has through selling shares.

example.ex: Two years later, when Compaq went public, their stock was valued at $38 million...
example.tran: 康柏公司两年后上市时，他们的股本为 3,800 万美元。

example.ex: The Fisher family holds 40% of the stock.
example.tran: 费希尔家族持有 40%的股份。

collins.def: If a shop stocks particular goods, it keeps a supply of them to sell.

example.ex: The shop stocks everything from cigarettes to recycled loo paper.
example.tran: 商店货品齐全，从香烟到再生厕纸应有尽有。

collins.def: A shop's stock is the total amount of goods which it has available to sell.

example.ex: We took the decision to withdraw a quantity of stock from sale.
example.tran: 我们决定将一批存货下架。

collins.def: If you stock something such as a cupboard, shelf, or room, you fill it with food or other things.

example.ex: I worked stocking shelves in a grocery store...
example.tran: 我在一家杂货店工作，负责为货架上货。

example.ex: Some families stocked their cellars with food and water...
example.tran: 有些家庭在地窖里储备了食品和水。

collins.def: If you have a stock of things, you have a supply of them stored in a place ready to be used.

example.ex: I keep a stock of cassette tapes describing various relaxation techniques...
example.tran: 我收集了一些介绍各种放松技巧的卡带。

example.ex: Stocks of ammunition were running low.
example.tran: 弹药的库存正在减少。

collins.def: The stock of something is the total amount of it that is available in a particular area.

example.ex: ...the stock of accommodation available to be rented.
example.tran: 可供租赁的住房储备量

collins.def: If you are from a particular stock, you are descended from a particular group of people.

example.ex: We are both from working class stock.
example.tran: 我们俩都出身于工人家庭。

example.ex: ...blacks, Asians and people of Mediterranean stock.
example.tran: 黑人、亚洲人和地中海沿岸高加索人的后裔

collins.tran: (尤指经过特殊饲养的)家畜，牲畜
collins.def: Stock are cattle, sheep, pigs, or other animals which are kept by a farmer, usually ones which have been specially bred.

example.ex: I am carefully selecting the breeding stock...
example.tran: 我正在精心挑选种畜。

example.ex: His herd of 170 dairy cattle and 200 young stock are kept on the land.
example.tran: 他那170头奶牛和200头乳牛都在那块地上圈养。

collins.tran: (回答、说法或做事方式)老一套的，陈腐的
collins.def: A stock answer, expression, or way of doing something is one that is very commonly used, especially because people cannot be bothered to think of something new.

example.ex: My boss had a stock response — 'If it ain't broke, don't fix it!'...
example.tran: 我上司总是这一句——“别没事找事！”

example.ex: National security is the stock excuse for keeping things confidential.
example.tran: 国家安全常被用作对一些事情保密的挡箭牌。

collins.def: Stock is a liquid, usually made by boiling meat, bones, or vegetables in water, that is used to give flavour to soups and sauces.
In former times, the stocks were an instrument of punishment. A criminal's hands and legs were locked into holes in a wooden frame while people threw things at them.
If goods are in stock, a shop has them available to sell. If they are out of stock, it does not.

example.ex: Check that your size is in stock...
example.tran: 查查你的尺码是否有货。

example.ex: Lemon and lime juice were both temporarily out of stock.
example.tran: 柠檬汁和酸橙汁暂时都缺货。

collins.tran: 作出整体估量;全面分析
collins.def: If you take stock, you pause to think about all the aspects of a situation or event before deciding what to do next.

example.ex: It was time to take stock of the situation...
example.tran: 是时候统观一下形势了。

example.ex: I was forty, the age when people take stock and change their lives.
example.tran: 我已年届不惑，到了该全面审视自己并改变生活的年龄了。

collins.def: If you enjoy something, you find pleasure and satisfaction in doing it or experiencing it.

example.ex: Ross had always enjoyed the company of women...
example.tran: 罗斯向来喜欢有女人伴其左右。

example.ex: He was a guy who enjoyed life to the full...
example.tran: 他是个尽情享受生活的人。

collins.def: If you enjoy yourself, you do something that you like doing or you take pleasure in the situation that you are in.

example.ex: I must say I am really enjoying myself at the moment.
example.tran: 我得说此刻我感到非常愉快。

collins.def: If you enjoy something such as a right, benefit, or privilege, you have it.

example.ex: The average German will enjoy 40 days' paid holiday this year...
example.tran: 今年，德国人将平均享受40天的带薪假期。

example.ex: He enjoys a reputation for honesty.
example.tran: 他出了名地老实。

collins.def: If you welcome someone, you greet them in a friendly way when they arrive somewhere.

example.ex: Several people came by to welcome me...
example.tran: 有几个人过来迎接我。

example.ex: She was there to welcome him home from war...
example.tran: 她在那儿迎接他从战场归来。

collins.def: You use welcome in expressions such as welcome home ,welcome to London, and welcome back when you are greeting someone who has just arrived somewhere.

example.ex: Welcome to Washington...
example.tran: 欢迎来到华盛顿。

example.ex: Welcome back, Deborah—It's good to have you here.
example.tran: 欢迎回来，德博拉，有你在这儿真好。

collins.def: If you welcome an action, decision, or situation, you approve of it and are pleased that it has occurred.

example.ex: She welcomed this move but said that overall the changes didn't go far enough...
example.tran: 她欣然接受了这一举措，但是说总体上改变还不彻底。

example.ex: In Germany, the move was welcomed by the Bundesbank president.
example.tran: 在德国，联邦银行行长欣然接受了这项措施。

collins.def: If you describe something as welcome, you mean that people wanted it and are happy that it has occurred.

example.ex: This was certainly a welcome change of fortune...
example.tran: 这确实是命运中一个令人欣喜的转变。

example.ex: The new 25 metre pool for more serious swimmers is a welcome addition...
example.tran: 为更高水平的游泳爱好者新建的25米长的游泳池受到了大家的欢迎。

collins.def: If you say that you welcome certain people or actions, you are inviting and encouraging people to do something, for example to come to a particular place.

example.ex: We welcome you to join us on a special tour which explores this unique Australian attraction...
example.tran: 我们欢迎你加入探索这处独特的澳大利亚景观的特别之旅。

example.ex: We would welcome your views about the survey.
example.tran: 我们欢迎你就这项调查发表意见。

collins.def: If you say that someone is welcome in a particular place, you are encouraging them to go there by telling them that they will be liked and accepted.

example.ex: New members are always welcome...
example.tran: 随时欢迎新成员加入。

example.ex: I told him he wasn't welcome in my home.
example.tran: 我告诉他我家不欢迎他。

collins.def: If you tell someone that they are welcome to do something, you are encouraging them to do it by telling them that they are allowed to do it.

example.ex: You are welcome to visit the hospital at any time.
example.tran: 你可以随时来医院。

example.ex: ...a conservatory which guests are welcome to use.
example.tran: 客人们可随意使用的温室

collins.tran: (表示十分乐意让别人拥有自己不想要的东西)尽管…好了
collins.def: If you say that someone is welcome to something, you mean that you do not want it yourself because you do not like it and you are very willing for them to have it.

example.ex: If women want to take on the business world they are welcome to it as far as I'm concerned.
example.tran: 就我而言，如果女人们想进军商界的话，就让她们去好了。

collins.tran: 使受欢迎;使感觉受欢迎
collins.def: If you make someone welcome or make them feel welcome, you make them feel happy and accepted in a new place.
If you say that someone outstays their welcome or overstays their welcome, you mean that they stay somewhere longer than they are wanted or expected to.

example.ex: After the kindness that had been shown to him, he didn't want to outstay his welcome.
example.tran: 在受到热情款待后，他决定离开以免过多打搅主人。

collins.def: You say 'You're welcome' to someone who has thanked you for something in order to acknowledge their thanks in a polite way.

example.ex: 'Thank you for the information.' — 'You're welcome.'
example.tran: “谢谢你提供的信息。”——“ 不客气。”

collins.def: The fiftieth item in a series is the one that you count as number fifty.

example.ex: He retired in 1970, on his fiftieth birthday.
example.tran: 他在 1970 年自己 50 岁生日时退了休。

collins.def: Your hair is the fine threads that grow in a mass on your head.

example.ex: I wash my hair every night...
example.tran: 我每晚都洗头。

example.ex: He has black hair.
example.tran: 他一头乌发。

collins.def: Hair is the short, fine threads that grow on different parts of your body.

example.ex: The majority of men have hair on their chest...
example.tran: 大多数男子长有胸毛。

example.ex: It tickled the hairs on the back of my neck.
example.tran: 它挠得我后脖梗儿的绒毛直痒痒。

collins.def: Hair is the threads that cover the body of an animal such as a dog, or make up a horse's mane and tail.

example.ex: I am allergic to cat hair.
example.tran: 我对猫毛过敏。

example.ex: ...dog hairs on the carpet.
example.tran: 地毯上的狗毛

collins.def: Hairs are short, very fine threads that grow on some insects and plants.

example.ex: The stinging nettle has a square stem and little hairs.
example.tran: 荨麻长有四方茎和细小茸毛。

collins.tran: 彻底放松;玩个痛快;无拘无束
collins.def: If you let your hair down, you relax completely and enjoy yourself.

example.ex: ...the world-famous Oktoberfest, a time when everyone in Munich really lets their hair down.
example.tran: 全球闻名的啤酒节，一个让所有身在慕尼黑的人都尽情放松的节日

collins.def: Something that makes your hair stand on end shocks or frightens you very much.

example.ex: This was the kind of smile that made your hair stand on end.
example.tran: 这是那种让人不寒而栗的微笑。

collins.def: If you say that someone has not a hair out of place, you are emphasizing that they are extremely smart and neatly dressed.

example.ex: She had a lot of make-up on and not a hair out of place.
example.tran: 她化了浓妆，精致得让人挑不出一丝瑕疵。

collins.tran: 面不改色;毫不惊慌;泰然自若
collins.def: If you say that someone faced with a shock or a problem does not turn a hair, you mean that they do not show any surprise or fear, and remain completely calm.

example.ex: No one seems to turn a hair at the thought of the divorced Princess marrying.
example.tran: 似乎没有人对离异的公主再婚感到丝毫地吃惊。
