collins.def: If you say that someone is splitting hairs, you mean that they are making unnecessary distinctions between things when the differences between them are so small they are not important.

example.ex: Don't split hairs. You know what I'm getting at.
example.tran: 别钻牛角尖了。你知道我指什么。

means: 冠于人名前，起呼语作用

collins.def: You use oh to introduce a response or a comment on something that has just been said.

example.ex: 'Had you seen the car before?' — 'Oh yes, it was always in the drive.'...
example.tran: “之前你见过那辆车吗？”——“哦，见过，它总是停在车道上。”

example.ex: 'Would you like me to phone and explain the situation?' — 'Oh, would you?'...
example.tran: “你需要我打电话解释一下情况吗？”——“哦，可以吗？”

collins.tran: （表示惊讶、痛苦、恼怒或喜悦等）唉，啊，呀，哈
collins.def: You use oh to express a feeling such as surprise, pain, annoyance, or happiness.

example.ex: 'Oh!' Kenny blinked. 'Has everyone gone?'...
example.tran: “啊！”肯尼眨了眨眼睛，“人都走了吗？”

example.ex: 'Oh, my God,' Korontzis moaned...
example.tran: “哎呀，我的天啊，”科龙齐斯呻吟道。

collins.def: You use oh when you are hesitating while speaking, for example because you are trying to estimate something, or because you are searching for the right word.

example.ex: I've been here, oh, since the end of June...
example.tran: 我是，呃，6月底来到这里的。

example.ex: The invaders have destroyed the, oh, I don't know what the right word is—the atmosphere, the ambience.
example.tran: 入侵者破坏了，嗯，我不知道用什么字眼好——气氛，氛围。

collins.def: A version of something is a particular form of it in which some details are different from earlier or later forms.

example.ex: ...an updated version of his book...
example.tran: 他的书的最新版本

example.ex: Ludo is a version of an ancient Indian racing game...
example.tran: 鲁多是由一种古印度竞赛游戏演变而来。

collins.tran: （某人对某事件区别于他人的）描述，说法
collins.def: Someone's version of an event is their own description of it, especially when it is different to other people's.

example.ex: Yesterday afternoon the White House put out a new version of events...
example.tran: 昨天下午，白宫对事件给出了另一种说法。

example.ex: She and her friends wanted to go public with their version of the incident...
example.tran: 她和朋友们想把他们看到的事情经过公之于众。

collins.def: When two people get married or marry, they legally become husband and wife in a special ceremony. Get married is less formal and more commonly used than marry .

example.ex: I thought he would change after we got married...
example.tran: 我原以为我们结婚后他会改变的。

example.ex: They married a month after they met...
example.tran: 他们相识一个月后就结婚了。

collins.def: When a priest or official marries two people, he or she conducts the ceremony in which the two people legally become husband and wife.

example.ex: The local vicar has agreed to marry us in the chapel on the estate...
example.tran: 当地的牧师已经同意在庄园的小教堂里为我们主持婚礼。

example.ex: In July 1957, we were married in New York.
example.tran: 我们于1957年7月在纽约举行了婚礼。

collins.def: If a parent marries their child to someone, the parent chooses who their child will marry and arranges it.

example.ex: He married his three daughters to princes of the ruling house.
example.tran: 他把三个女儿都嫁给了王室的王子。

collins.def: When you express an idea or feeling, or express yourself, you show what you think or feel.

example.ex: He expressed grave concern at American attitudes...
example.tran: 他对美国的态度表示严重关切。

example.ex: Sumner would greet us with frowns and grimaces, doing his best to express wordless disapproval...
example.tran: 萨姆纳会冲我们皱眉，做苦脸，竭力表示他无言的反对。

collins.def: If an idea or feeling expresses itself in some way, it can be clearly seen in someone's actions or in its effects on a situation.

example.ex: The anxiety of the separation often expresses itself as anger towards the child for getting lost.
example.tran: 离散带来的焦虑常常体现为对走失的孩子发火。

collins.def: In mathematics, if you express a quantity or mathematical problem in a particular way, you write it using particular symbols, figures, or equations.

example.ex: We can express that equation like that...
example.tran: 我们可以这样表示那个等式。

example.ex: It is expressed as a percentage.
example.tran: 它是以百分比的形式表示的。

collins.def: An express command or order is one that is clearly and deliberately stated.

example.ex: The ship was sunk on express orders from the Prime Minister.
example.tran: 遵照首相的明确指令，那艘船被击沉了。

collins.def: If you refer to an express intention or purpose, you are emphasizing that it is a deliberate and specific one that you have before you do something.

example.ex: I had obtained my first camera for the express purpose of taking railway photographs.
example.tran: 我已经买了我的第一架照相机，专门用来拍摄铁路。

collins.def: Express is used to describe special services which are provided by companies or organizations such as the Post Office, in which things are sent or done faster than usual for a higher price.

example.ex: A special express service is available by fax...
example.tran: 提供传真特快专递服务。

example.ex: It was sent to us by express mail.
example.tran: 那是用快递寄给我们的。

collins.def: An express or an express train is a fast train which stops at very few stations.

example.ex: Punctually at 7.45, the express to Kuala Lumpur left Singapore station...
example.tran: 7点45分，开往吉隆坡的特快列车准时驶离新加坡火车站。

example.ex: He had boarded an express for Rome.
example.tran: 他已经登上了前往罗马的特快列车。

collins.tran: 特快公共汽车（或长途汽车）;直达公共汽车（或长途汽车）
collins.def: An express is a fast bus or coach which goes from one place to another directly or with very few stops.

collins.tran: 开明的；开通的；（个人）自由主义的
collins.def: Someone who has liberal views believes people should have a lot of freedom in deciding how to behave and think.

example.ex: She is known to have liberal views on divorce and contraception.
example.tran: 众所周知，她在离婚与避孕方面思想很开明。

collins.tran: （制度等）开放的；（政治或经济上）自由主义的
collins.def: A liberal system allows people or organizations a lot of political or economic freedom.

example.ex: ...a liberal democracy with a multiparty political system...
example.tran: 多党政制的自由民主国家

example.ex: They favour liberal free-market policies.
example.tran: 他们支持开放的自由市场政策。

collins.tran: 自由党的;支持自由党的
collins.def: A Liberal politician or voter is a member of a Liberal Party or votes for a Liberal Party.

example.ex: The Liberal leader has announced his party's withdrawal from the ruling coalition.
example.tran: 自由党领袖已宣布该党退出执政联盟。

collins.tran: 慷慨的；肆意的；大量的；丰富的
collins.def: Liberal means giving, using, or taking a lot of something, or existing in large quantities.

example.ex: As always he is liberal with his jokes...
example.tran: 像平时一样，他出口就是笑话。

example.ex: She made liberal use of her elder sister's make-up and clothes.
example.tran: 她随便把姐姐的化妆品和衣服拿来用。

collins.def: If you give someone advice, you tell them what you think they should do in a particular situation.

example.ex: Don't be afraid to ask for advice about ordering the meal...
example.tran: 点餐时可以大胆征求意见。

example.ex: Your community officer can give you advice on how to prevent crime in your area...
example.tran: 社区工作人员能就如何预防社区内犯罪提供一些忠告。

collins.tran: 听取律师的意见;咨询律师
collins.def: If you take advice or take legal advice, you ask a lawyer for his or her professional opinion on a situation.

example.ex: We are taking advice on legal steps to recover the money...
example.tran: 我们正在就追回该款项所需的法律程序咨询律师。

example.ex: If you are prosecuted by the police, then it is essential that you take specialist legal advice.
example.tran: 如果你受到警方起诉，至关重要的是你要听取专业律师的意见。

means: 提出（离婚诉讼或其他讼案）

collins.def: A file is a box or a folded piece of heavy paper or plastic in which letters or documents are kept.

example.ex: He sat behind a table on which were half a dozen files.
example.tran: 他坐在一张放有6个文件夹的桌子后面。

example.ex: ...a file of insurance papers.
example.tran: 一夹子保险文件

collins.def: A file is a collection of information about a particular person or thing.

example.ex: There was stuff in that file that was private between me and Dr Denny...
example.tran: 那份档案的有些内容是只应我和丹尼医生知道的。

example.ex: We already have files on people's tax details, mortgages and poll tax...
example.tran: 我们已经建立了人们纳税详情、抵押贷款以及人头税的档案。

collins.def: If you file a document, you put it in the correct file.

example.ex: A secretary can file papers as efficiently as a floppy disk can store them...
example.tran: 秘书归档文件时可以像软盘存储一样高效。

example.ex: They are all filed alphabetically under author.
example.tran: 这些都是按照作者姓名的字母顺序归档的。

collins.def: In computing, a file is a set of related data that has its own name.

collins.tran: 提起(诉讼);提出(投诉、请求等)
collins.def: If you file a formal or legal accusation, complaint, or request, you make it officially.

example.ex: A number of them have filed formal complaints against the police...
example.tran: 他们中的许多人都对警方提出了正式控告。

example.ex: I filed for divorce on the grounds of adultery a few months later.
example.tran: 几个月后我以通奸为由提起了离婚诉讼。

collins.def: When someone files a report or a news story, they send or give it to their employer.

example.ex: Catherine Bond filed that report for the BBC from Nairobi...
example.tran: 凯瑟琳·邦德从内罗毕向英国广播公司发送了那篇报道。

example.ex: He had to rush back to the office and file a housing story before the secretaries went home.
example.tran: 他不得不冲回办公室，赶在秘书们回家之前提交一篇有关住房的新闻报道。

collins.def: When a group of people files somewhere, they walk one behind the other in a line.

example.ex: She paused as the group of children filed out of the house...
example.tran: 那群孩子从房子里鱼贯而出时，她停了下来。

example.ex: Slowly, people filed into the room and sat down.
example.tran: 人们排成一列缓慢地依次走进房间，并坐了下来。

collins.def: A file is a hand tool which is used for rubbing hard objects to make them smooth, shape them, or cut through them.
If you file an object, you smooth it, shape it, or cut it with a file.

example.ex: Manicurists are skilled at shaping and filing nails.
example.tran: 美甲师修锉指甲的手艺娴熟。

collins.def: Something that is on file or on someone's files is recorded or kept in a file or in a collection of information.

example.ex: His fingerprints were on file in Washington...
example.tran: 他的指纹已在华盛顿记录在档。

example.ex: We'll keep your details on file...
example.tran: 我们会把有关你的详细信息记录在档。

collins.def: A group of people who are walking or standing in single file are in a line, one behind the other.

example.ex: We were walking in single file to the lake.
example.tran: 我们正排成一列朝湖边走去。

collins.def: If you file away a document, you put it in the correct file.

example.ex: When at home, most evenings would be spent reading, cutting up and filing away his photographs...
example.tran: 晚上在家时，经常都是在看书或剪切和归类他的照片。

example.ex: The details are filed away by his three secretaries for future reference.
example.tran: 他的3个秘书已经把详细情况归档备查。

collins.def: A seat is an object that you can sit on, for example a chair.

example.ex: Stephen returned to his seat...
example.tran: 斯蒂芬回到自己的座位上。

example.ex: Ann could remember sitting in the back seat of their car.
example.tran: 安记得坐在他们车里的后排座上了。

collins.def: The seat of a chair is the part that you sit on.

example.ex: The stool had a torn, red plastic seat.
example.tran: 那个凳子的红色塑料座面已经破旧不堪。

collins.def: If you seat yourself somewhere, you sit down.

example.ex: He waved towards a chair, and seated himself at the desk.
example.tran: 他挥手指了指一把椅子，自己在书桌旁坐了下来。

example.ex: ...a portrait of one of his favourite models seated on an elegant sofa.
example.tran: 一幅他最喜欢的模特之一的画像，画中人坐在雅致的沙发上

collins.def: A building or vehicle that seats a particular number of people has enough seats for that number.

example.ex: The Theatre seats 570.
example.tran: 那个剧院可容纳 570 人。

collins.def: The seat of a piece of clothing is the part that covers your bottom.

example.ex: Then he got up and brushed off the seat of his jeans.
example.tran: 然后他站起来，拍了拍牛仔裤的臀部。

collins.def: When someone is elected to a parliament, congress, or senate, you can say that they, or their party, have won a seat .

example.ex: Independent candidates won the majority of seats on the local council.
example.tran: 无党派候选人在地方议会选举中赢得了多数席位。

example.ex: ...a Maryland Republican who lost his seat.
example.tran: 一名失掉席位的马里兰州共和党党员

collins.tran: (公司董事会、委员会中的)席位，职位
collins.def: If someone has a seat on the board of a company or on a committee, they are a member of it.

example.ex: He has been unsuccessful in his attempt to win a seat on the board of the company.
example.tran: 他始终未能如愿以偿地在公司董事会中谋得一席之地。

collins.tran: (组织、活动的)中心地，所在地;(豪门的)宅邸
collins.def: The seat of an organization, a wealthy family, or an activity is its base.

example.ex: Gunfire broke out early this morning around the seat of government in Lagos.
example.tran: 今天凌晨在拉各斯的政府大楼周围发生了枪战。

example.ex: ...Weston Park, family seat of the Earl of Bradford.
example.tran: 韦斯顿公园，布拉德福德伯爵的祖宅

collins.tran: 让权于他人;退居次要位置
collins.def: If you take a back seat, you allow other people to have all the power and to make all the decisions.

example.ex: You need to take a back seat and think about both past and future...
example.tran: 你得退居二线，把过去和将来都捋清楚。

example.ex: This is a country where women usually take a back seat.
example.tran: 在这个国家通常是男尊女卑。

collins.def: If you take a seat, you sit down.

example.ex: 'Take a seat,' he said in a bored tone...
example.tran: “请坐，”他不耐烦地说道。

example.ex: Rachel smiled at him as they took their seats on opposite sides of the table.
example.tran: 他们分坐在桌子两边，雷切尔对他微微笑了一下。

collins.def: You use anyway or anyhow to indicate that a statement explains or supports a previous point.

example.ex: I'm certain David's told you his business troubles. Anyway, it's no secret that he owes money...
example.tran: 我敢肯定戴维已经告诉过你他生意上有麻烦了。反正他欠钱也不是什么秘密了。

example.ex: Mother certainly won't let him stay with her and anyhow he wouldn't.
example.tran: 母亲当然不会让他和她住在一起，再说他也不愿意。

collins.def: You use anyway or anyhow to suggest that a statement is true or relevant in spite of other things that have been said.

example.ex: I don't know why I settled on Aberdeen, but anyway I did...
example.tran: 我不知道为什么我定居在阿伯丁，尽管如此，我还是这么做了。

example.ex: I wasn't qualified to apply for the job really but I got it anyhow.
example.tran: 实际上我并不具备申请这份工作的资格，但不管怎样，我还是被录用了。

collins.def: You use anyway or anyhow to correct or modify a statement, for example to limit it to what you definitely know to be true.

example.ex: Mary Ann doesn't want to have children. Not right now, anyway.
example.tran: 玛丽·安不想要孩子，至少现在不想。

collins.def: You use anyway or anyhow to indicate that you are asking what the real situation is or what the real reason for something is.

example.ex: What do you want from me, anyway?...
example.tran: 你到底想从我这儿得到什么？

example.ex: Where the hell was Bud, anyhow?
example.tran: 巴德到底在哪儿？

collins.tran: （表示略去一些细节转到下一个主要话题）总之
collins.def: You use anyway or anyhow to indicate that you are missing out some details in a story and are passing on to the next main point or event.

example.ex: I was told to go to Reading for this interview. It was a very amusing affair. Anyhow, I got the job.
example.tran: 我被通知前往雷丁面试。整个过程很有意思。总之，我被录用了。

collins.tran: （用于转移话题或回到原话题）对了，好吧
collins.def: You use anyway or anyhow to change the topic or return to a previous topic.

example.ex: 'I've got a terrible cold.' — 'Have you? Oh dear. Anyway, so you're not going to go away this weekend?'
example.tran: “我得了重感冒。”——“是吗？哦，天啊。对了，那你这个周末就不走了吧？”

collins.def: You use anyway or anyhow to indicate that you want to end the conversation.

example.ex: 'Anyway, I'd better let you have your dinner. Give our love to Francis. Bye.'
example.tran: “那么，我不打扰你用餐了。代我们向弗朗西斯问好。再见。”

example.ex: 'Anyhow, thanks a lot. Bye bye.'
example.tran: “那么，多谢了。再见。”

collins.def: A soldier is a person who works in an army, especially a person who is not an officer.
The two sexes are the two groups, male and female, into which people and animals are divided according to the function they have in producing young.

example.ex: ...an entertainment star who appeals to all ages and both sexes.
example.tran: 男女老幼都喜欢的娱乐明星

example.ex: ...differences between the sexes.
example.tran: 两性之间的差异

collins.def: The sex of a person or animal is their characteristic of being either male or female.

example.ex: She continually failed to gain promotion because of her sex...
example.tran: 她因为是女性而迟迟得不到晋升。

example.ex: The new technique has been used to identify the sex of foetuses.
example.tran: 这一新技术已经被用来鉴别胎儿的性别。

collins.def: Sex is the physical activity by which people can produce young.

example.ex: He was very open in his attitudes about sex...
example.tran: 他对待性的态度非常开放。

example.ex: The entire film revolves around drugs, sex and violence...
example.tran: 整个影片围绕着毒品、性和暴力展开。

collins.tran: 辨别…的性别;辨识…的雌雄
collins.def: If an animal is sexed, someone finds out whether it is male or female.

example.ex: The birds must be weighed, sexed and tagged.
example.tran: 必须对这些鸟称重，辨识雌雄并挂上标牌。

collins.def: If two people have sex, they perform the act of sex.

example.ex: I had no intention of having sex with him on a first date.
example.tran: 我并没想第一次约会就和他上床。

collins.def: Safety is the state of being safe from harm or danger.

example.ex: The report goes on to make a number of recommendations to improve safety on aircraft.
example.tran: 该报告接着给出了一系列改善飞机安全性能的建议。

collins.def: If you reach safety, you reach a place where you are safe from danger.

example.ex: He stumbled through smoke and fumes given off from her burning sofa to pull her to safety...
example.tran: 她的沙发着火了，他冒着浓烟跌跌撞撞地把她拉到安全的地方。

example.ex: Guests ran for safety as the device went off in a ground-floor men's toilet...
example.tran: 一层男厕所里的炸弹爆炸后，客人们纷纷逃命而去。

collins.tran: 安全程度;安全性;无害;无危险
collins.def: If you are concerned about the safety of something, you are concerned that it might be harmful or dangerous.

example.ex: ...consumers are showing growing concern about the safety of the food they buy...
example.tran: 消费者越来越关注所购食品的安全性。

example.ex: The safety of tacrine has not yet been proven, and there is concern that it causes damage to the liver.
example.tran: 他克林的安全性尚未得到证实，有人担心它会对肝脏造成损害。

collins.def: If you are concerned for someone's safety, you are concerned that they might be in danger.

example.ex: There is grave concern for the safety of witnesses...
example.tran: 人们非常担心证人的安全。

example.ex: The two youths today declined to testify because they said they feared for their safety.
example.tran: 这两个年轻人今天拒绝作证，称他们是出于对自身安全的担心。

collins.def: Safety features or measures are intended to make something less dangerous.

example.ex: The built-in safety device compensates for a fall in water pressure.
example.tran: 该内置式安全装置在水压下降时能提供保护。

example.ex: ...safety glasses.
example.tran: 护目镜

collins.def: If you say that there is safety in numbers, you mean that you are safer doing something if there are a lot of people doing it rather than doing it alone.

example.ex: Many people still feel there is safety in numbers when belonging to a union.
example.tran: 许多人仍然感到加入工会后会有强大的后盾。

means: （美国、澳大利亚等国议会的）参议院
（某些大学的）大学理事会，大学评议会

collins.tran: (美国、澳大利亚等国议会的)参议院
collins.def: The Senate is the smaller and more important of the two parts of the parliament in some countries, for example the United States and Australia.

example.ex: The Senate is expected to pass the bill shortly.
example.tran: 预计参议院不久就会通过此议案。

example.ex: ...a Senate committee.
example.tran: 参议院委员会

collins.tran: （某些大学的）大学理事会，大学评议会
collins.def: Senate or the Senate is the governing council at some universities.

example.ex: By the time I was Vice Chancellor, Senate had become a much larger and a much more democratic body...
example.tran: 到了我当校长的时候，大学评议会的人员规模已显著扩大，也变得更加民主了。

example.ex: The new bill would remove student representation from the university Senate.
example.tran: 新议案将取消大学评议会中的学生代表。

collins.def: The fifth item in a series is the one that you count as number five.

example.ex: Joe has recently returned from his fifth trip to Australia.
example.tran: 乔最近结束了第五次澳大利亚之行归来。

collins.def: A fifth is one of five equal parts of something.

example.ex: India spends over a fifth of its budget on defence.
example.tran: 印度的国防开支占了其财政预算的 1/5 强。

collins.tran: 科学;自然科学;自然科学知识
collins.def: Science is the study of the nature and behaviour of natural things and the knowledge that we obtain about them.

example.ex: The best discoveries in science are very simple.
example.tran: 最伟大的科学发现都非常简单。

example.ex: ...science and technology.
example.tran: 科学技术

collins.def: A science is a particular branch of science such as physics, chemistry, or biology.

example.ex: Physics is the best example of a science which has developed strong, abstract theories.
example.tran: 物理学是自然科学中发展出了强有力的抽象理论的最好例子。

example.ex: ...the science of microbiology.
example.tran: 微生物学

collins.tran: (研究人类行为的)学科，社会科学
collins.def: A science is the study of some aspect of human behaviour, for example sociology or anthropology.

example.ex: ...the modern science of psychology.
example.tran: 现代心理学

collins.def: If you commission something or commission someone to do something, you formally arrange for someone to do a piece of work for you.

example.ex: The Ministry of Agriculture commissioned a study into low-input farming...
example.tran: 农业部委托对低投入耕作进行研究。

example.ex: You can commission them to paint something especially for you.
example.tran: 你可以委托他们专门为你画点什么。

collins.tran: 受托之事;(接受报酬的)任务
collins.def: A commission is a piece of work that someone is asked to do and is paid for.

example.ex: Just a few days ago, I finished a commission.
example.tran: 就在几天前，我完成了一项委托创作任务。

collins.def: Commission is a sum of money paid to a salesperson for every sale that he or she makes. If a salesperson is paid on commission, the amount they receive depends on the amount they sell.

example.ex: The salesmen work on commission only...
example.tran: 销售人员只根据销售量提取佣金。

example.ex: He also got a commission for bringing in new clients.
example.tran: 他还因为带来了很多新客户拿到一笔佣金。

collins.tran: (银行或公司收取的)服务费，手续费
collins.def: If a bank or other company charges commission, they charge a fee for providing a service, for example for exchanging money or issuing an insurance policy.

example.ex: Travel agents charge 1 per cent commission on sterling cheques...
example.tran: 旅行社对英镑支票收取1%的服务费。

example.ex: Sellers pay a fixed commission fee.
example.tran: 卖方支付固定的服务费。

collins.def: A commission is a group of people who have been appointed to find out about something or to control something.

example.ex: The authorities have been asked to set up a commission to investigate the murders.
example.tran: 当局被敦促成立一个委员会负责调查这些谋杀案。

example.ex: ...the Press Complaints Commission.
example.tran: 媒体投诉委员会

collins.def: The commission of a crime is the act of committing a crime.

example.ex: If a person uses a gun in the commission of a crime, then he should be given an additional penalty.
example.tran: 如果使用枪支进行犯罪，就应该受到额外的惩罚。

collins.def: If a member of the armed forces receives a commission, he or she becomes an officer.

example.ex: He accepted a commission as a naval officer.
example.tran: 他接受任命成为一名海军军官。

collins.def: If a member of the armed forces is commissioned, he or she is made an officer.

example.ex: He was commissioned as second lieutenant in the Air Force...
example.tran: 他被任命为空军少尉。

example.ex: Only commissioned officers qualify for the Military Cross.
example.tran: 只有持委任状的军官才有资格获得十字勋章。

collins.tran: (船、设备等)坏了的，不能使用的
collins.def: If something, for example a ship or a piece of equipment, is out of commission, it is broken and cannot be used until it is repaired.

example.ex: The operator expects the ship to be out of commission until the end of September.
example.tran: 技工预计这艘船到9月底才能修好。

collins.def: Something that is normal is usual and ordinary, and is what people expect.

example.ex: He has occasional injections to maintain his good health but otherwise he lives a normal life...
example.tran: 他偶尔要注射药物保持身体健康，但除此之外他生活一切正常。

example.ex: The two countries resumed normal diplomatic relations...
example.tran: 两国恢复了正常的外交关系。

collins.tran: 身体健康的;精神正常的
collins.def: A normal person has no serious physical or mental health problems.

example.ex: Statistics indicate that depressed patients are more likely to become ill than are normal people...
example.tran: 统计显示抑郁症患者比正常人更容易生病。

example.ex: Will the baby be normal?
example.tran: 婴儿会一切正常吗？

collins.def: A critic is a person who writes about and expresses opinions about things such as books, films, music, or art.

example.ex: Mather was film critic on the Daily Telegraph for many years...
example.tran: 马瑟多年来一直担任《每日电讯报》的影评人。

example.ex: The New York critics had praised her performance.
example.tran: 纽约的影评家们高度评价了她的表演。

collins.def: Someone who is a critic of a person or system disapproves of them and criticizes them publicly.

example.ex: The newspaper has been the most consistent critic of the government...
example.tran: 一直以来，该报批评政府的立场最为坚定。

example.ex: He became a fierce critic of the tobacco industry...
example.tran: 他成了烟草业的强烈反对者。

means: 高速交通工具，高速交通网

collins.def: A rapid change is one that happens very quickly.

example.ex: ...the country's rapid economic growth in the 1980's...
example.tran: 20世纪80年代该国经济的迅速增长

example.ex: This signals a rapid change of mind by the government.
example.tran: 这标志着政府思想的急剧转变。

collins.def: A rapid movement is one that is very fast.

example.ex: He walked at a rapid pace along Charles Street.
example.tran: 他快步走过查尔斯大街。

example.ex: ...whether the Tunnel will provide more rapid car transport than ferries...
example.tran: 隧道是否能够提供比渡船更加快捷的车辆运输

collins.def: If people settle an argument or problem, or if something settles it, they solve it, for example by making a decision about who is right or about what to do.

example.ex: They agreed to try to settle their dispute by negotiation...
example.tran: 他们同意通过谈判来努力解决纠纷。

example.ex: Both sides are looking for ways to settle their differences...
example.tran: 双方都在寻求消除分歧的方法。

collins.def: If people settle a legal dispute or if they settle, they agree to end the dispute without going to a court of law, for example by paying some money or by apologizing.

example.ex: In an attempt to settle the case, Molken has agreed to pay restitution...
example.tran: 为了争取庭外和解，莫尔肯同意赔款。

example.ex: She got much less than she would have done if she had settled out of court...
example.tran: 如果她同意庭外和解的话，得到的肯定会更多。

collins.tran: 付清(欠款);结算(账单);结(账)
collins.def: If you settle a bill or debt, you pay the amount that you owe.

example.ex: I settled the bill for my coffee and his two glasses of wine...
example.tran: 我为我的咖啡和他的两杯葡萄酒付了账。

example.ex: They settled with Colin at the end of the evening.
example.tran: 晚上聚会结束的时候他们和科林结清了账。

collins.def: If something is settled, it has all been decided and arranged.

example.ex: As far as we're concerned, the matter is settled...
example.tran: 我们这边已经安排妥当了。

example.ex: That's settled then. We'll exchange addresses tonight.
example.tran: 那就定下来了，我们今晚交换联系地址。

collins.tran: (以遗嘱等正式方式)赠予,授予
collins.def: To settle money on someone means to formally give it to them, for example in a will.

example.ex: She offered to settle a legacy on Katharine.
example.tran: 她提出要把一笔遗产留给凯瑟琳。

collins.tran: 在…定居;使定居;把…安置在
collins.def: When people settle a place or in a place, or when a government settles them there, they start living there permanently.

example.ex: Refugees settling in Britain suffer from a number of problems...
example.tran: 在英国定居的难民面临很多问题。

example.ex: He visited Paris and eventually settled there...
example.tran: 他造访了巴黎，并最终在那儿定居下来。

collins.def: If you settle yourself somewhere or settle somewhere, you sit down or make yourself comfortable.

example.ex: Albert settled himself on the sofa...
example.tran: 艾伯特舒舒服服地坐在沙发上。

example.ex: Jessica settled into her chair with a small sigh of relief.
example.tran: 杰茜卡微微松了口气，坐到了椅子上。

collins.def: If something settles or if you settle it, it sinks slowly down and becomes still.

example.ex: A black dust settled on the walls...
example.tran: 墙上落了一层黑色的粉尘。

example.ex: Once its impurities had settled, the oil could be graded...
example.tran: 一旦杂质沉淀下去，油就可以分级了。

collins.def: If your eyes settle on or upon something, you stop looking around and look at that thing for some time.

example.ex: The man let his eyes settle upon Cross's face.
example.tran: 那名男子的目光落在了克罗斯的脸上。

collins.def: When birds or insects settle on something, they land on it from above.

example.ex: Moths flew in front of it, eventually settling on the rough painted metal.
example.tran: 几只蛾子在它前面飞，最终落在了那块粗糙的喷漆金属上。

means: （指男性）和（女性）交媾（美式英语）
[美国俚语、口语]狂欢作乐，消遣

collins.def: A ball is a round object that is used in games such as tennis, baseball, football, basketball, and cricket.

example.ex: ...a golf ball.
example.tran: 高尔夫球

example.ex: ...a tennis ball.
example.tran: 网球

collins.def: A ball is something or an amount of something that has a round shape.

example.ex: Thomas screwed the letter up into a ball...
example.tran: 托马斯把信揉成一团。

example.ex: They heard a loud explosion and saw a ball of fire go up.
example.tran: 他们听见一声爆炸的巨响，看见一个火球腾空而起。

collins.def: When you ball something or when it balls, it becomes round.

example.ex: He picked up the sheets of paper, and balled them tightly in his fists...
example.tran: 他抓起那几张纸，在手里紧紧攥成团。

example.ex: His hands balled into fists...
example.tran: 他攥起了拳头。

collins.tran: （脚趾和脚相连或拇指和手相连的）球状部位；脚趾球；拇指球
collins.def: The ball of your foot or the ball of your thumb is the rounded part where your toes join your foot or where your thumb joins your hand.
A ball is a large formal social event at which people dance.
A man's balls are his testicles.

collins.tran: 轮到…采取行动（或作出决断）
collins.def: If you say that the ball is in someone's court, you mean that it is his or her responsibility to take the next action or decision in a situation.

example.ex: The ball's now in your court — you have to decide what you're going to do.
example.tran: 轮到你了——你必须决定自己要做什么。

collins.tran: 使某事发生；开始某种活动
collins.def: If you get the ball rolling ,set the ball rolling, or start the ball rolling, you start something happening.

example.ex: He will go to the Middle East next week to get the ball rolling again on peace talks...
example.tran: 他下周将前往中东，开始重启和谈。

example.ex: I just want enough cash to start the ball rolling.
example.tran: 我只是想有足够的启动资金。

collins.def: If you are having a ball, you are having a very enjoyable time.

example.ex: Outside the boys were sitting on the ground and, going by the gales of laughter, they were having a ball.
example.tran: 男孩们在户外席地而坐，从阵阵笑声来看，他们玩得很开心。

collins.def: If you keep several balls in the air, you try to do several different things at once.

example.ex: The detective has to discover the motive, the means and the opportunity and has to keep these three balls in the air.
example.tran: 那名侦探必须查明动机、手段和时机，而且对这三项的调查必须同步展开。

example.ex: ...unhappy mothers trying to juggle ten balls in the air.
example.tran: 同时要做无数件事情的可怜的母亲

collins.def: If someone is on the ball, they are very alert and aware of what is happening.

example.ex: She really is on the ball; she's bought houses at auctions so she knows what she's doing.
example.tran: 她很精明干练；她通过拍卖购过房，所以知道自己在做什么。

collins.def: If someone refuses to play ball, they are unwilling to do what someone wants them to do.

example.ex: The association has threatened to withdraw its support if the banks and building societies refuse to play ball.
example.tran: 该协会威胁说如果银行和建屋互助会不配合的话，它将不再提供支持。

collins.def: The truth about something is all the facts about it, rather than things that are imagined or invented.

example.ex: Is it possible to separate truth from fiction?…
example.tran: 有可能把事实与虚构分开吗？

example.ex: I must tell you the truth about this business...
example.tran: 我必须告诉你这件事的真相。

collins.def: If you say that there is some truth in a statement or story, you mean that it is true, or at least partly true.

example.ex: There is no truth in this story...
example.tran: 这个故事纯属虚构。

example.ex: Is there any truth to the rumors?...
example.tran: 那些谣言有什么事实依据吗？

collins.def: A truth is something that is believed to be true.

example.ex: It is an almost universal truth that the more we are promoted in a job, the less we actually exercise the skills we initially used to perform it.
example.tran: 这几乎是一条普遍的真理：我们在某一工作中越往上晋升，实际运用那些当初在工作中经常实践的技能的机会就越少。

collins.def: You say in truth in order to indicate that you are giving your honest opinion about something.

example.ex: In truth, we were both unhappy.
example.tran: 事实上，我们俩都不快乐。

collins.def: You say to tell you the truth or truth to tell in order to indicate that you are telling someone something in an open and honest way, without trying to hide anything.

example.ex: To tell you the truth, I was afraid to see him...
example.tran: 坦白说，我害怕见他。

example.ex: Truth to tell, John did not want Veronica at his wedding.
example.tran: 说实在的，约翰不想韦罗妮卡参加他的婚礼。

collins.def: If you can identify someone or something, you are able to recognize them or distinguish them from others.

example.ex: There are a number of distinguishing characteristics by which you can identify a Hollywood epic...
example.tran: 好莱坞的史诗大片有着一些与众不同的特点。

example.ex: I tried to identify her perfume...
example.tran: 我试图分辨出她用哪种香水。

collins.def: If you identify someone or something, you name them or say who or what they are.

example.ex: Police have already identified around 10 murder suspects...
example.tran: 警方已经确认了约10名谋杀案疑凶。

example.ex: The reporters identified one of the six Americans as an Army Specialist...
example.tran: 记者们认出6名美国人中有一位是陆军技术兵。

collins.def: If you identify something, you discover or notice its existence.

example.ex: Scientists claim to have identified natural substances with cancer-combating properties...
example.tran: 科学家们声称已经发现自然界的某些物质具有抗癌特性。

example.ex: Having identified the problem, the question arises of how to overcome it.
example.tran: 发现问题后，如何克服它的问题又出现了。

collins.def: If a particular thing identifies someone or something, it makes them easy to recognize, by making them different in some way.

example.ex: She wore a little nurse's hat on her head to identify her...
example.tran: 她头戴一顶小护士帽，很容易辨认。

example.ex: His boots and purple beret identify him as commanding the Scottish Paratroops.
example.tran: 他的长靴和紫色贝雷帽表明他统领着苏格兰伞兵部队。

collins.def: If you identify with someone or something, you feel that you understand them or their feelings and ideas.

example.ex: She would only play a role if she could identify with the character...
example.tran: 她只愿扮演她能认同的角色。

example.ex: I could speak their language and identify with their problems because I had been there myself.
example.tran: 我会讲他们的语言，能体会他们的难处，因为我自己曾在那里呆过。

collins.tran: 把…(与…密)切联系;认为…(与…)有关联
collins.def: If you identify one person or thing with another, you think that they are closely associated or involved in some way.

example.ex: She hates playing the sweet, passive women that audiences identify her with...
example.tran: 她讨厌扮演那些漂亮可爱、消极被动的女人，观众们已把她定型为这类角色。

example.ex: The candidates all want to identify themselves with reform.
example.tran: 候选人都想把自己与改革密切联系起来。

collins.def: A target is something at which someone is aiming a weapon or other object.

example.ex: The village lies beside a main road, making it an easy target for bandits...
example.tran: 村子坐落在大路边上，很容易成为土匪袭击的对象。

example.ex: The missiles missed their target...
example.tran: 导弹没有击中目标。

collins.def: A target is a result that you are trying to achieve.

example.ex: He's won back his place too late to achieve his target of 20 goals this season.
example.tran: 他赢回自己的位置时为时已晚，无法实现本赛季进 20 粒球的目标。

example.ex: ...school leavers who failed to reach their target grades.
example.tran: 未能达到规定分数的肄业生

collins.tran: 攻击;批评;以…为攻击目标
collins.def: To target a particular person or thing means to decide to attack or criticize them.

example.ex: Republicans targeted Unsoeld as vulnerable in her bid for reelection this year...
example.tran: 共和党人将安索尔德定为攻击目标，认为她在争取今年连任的竞选中不堪一击。

example.ex: He targets the economy as the root cause of the deteriorating law and order situation.
example.tran: 他抨击经济是治安状况不断恶化的根源。

collins.def: If you target a particular group of people, you try to appeal to those people or affect them.

example.ex: The campaign will target American insurance companies...
example.tran: 这场活动将以美国各保险公司为目标。

example.ex: The company has targeted adults as its primary customers.
example.tran: 这家公司将成年人作为其主要顾客。

collins.tran: 进展顺利;有可能实现目标
collins.def: If someone or something is on target, they are making good progress and are likely to achieve the result that is wanted.

example.ex: We were still right on target for our deadline.
example.tran: 我们仍然有可能赶在最后期限前达成目标。

collins.def: The source of something is the person, place, or thing which you get it from.

example.ex: ...over 40 per cent of British adults use television as their major source of information about the arts...
example.tran: 40 %以上的英国成年人把电视当作获取艺术文化信息的主要途径。

example.ex: Renewable sources of energy must be used where practical...
example.tran: 必须在可行的地方使用可再生能源。

collins.tran: 寻找(产品或原料的)货源
collins.def: In business, if a person or firm sources a product or a raw material, they find someone who will supply it.

example.ex: Together they travel the world, sourcing clothes for the small, privately owned company...
example.tran: 他们一道走遍世界各地，为那家私营小公司寻觅服装货源。

example.ex: About 60 per cent of an average car is sourced from outside of the manufacturer.
example.tran: 一辆普通汽车上大约有60%的部件是由制造商以外的其他供应商提供的。

collins.tran: 消息来源;消息人士;(论文中引文的)出处，原始资料
collins.def: A source is a person or book that provides information for a news story or for a piece of research.

example.ex: Military sources say the boat was heading south at high speed...
example.tran: 军方称这艘船当时正高速向南行进。

example.ex: She quotes secondary and primary sources without distinction.
example.tran: 她对二手资料和一手资料的引用毫无区别。

collins.def: The source of a difficulty is its cause.

example.ex: This gave me a clue as to the source of the problem.
example.tran: 这件事给我提供了找出问题根源的线索。

collins.def: The source of a river or stream is the place where it begins.

example.ex: ...the source of the Tiber.
example.tran: 台伯河的源头

means: 比…活得长，经历…之后还存在

collins.def: If a person or living thing survives in a dangerous situation such as an accident or an illness, they do not die.

example.ex: ...the sequence of events that left the eight pupils battling to survive in icy seas for over four hours...
example.tran: 致使这 8 个小学生在冰冷的海水里挣扎求生四个多小时的一连串事件

example.ex: Those organisms that are most suited to the environment will be those that will survive...
example.tran: 最适宜该环境的微生物将会存活下来。

collins.def: If you survive in difficult circumstances, you manage to live or continue in spite of them and do not let them affect you very much.

example.ex: On my first day here I thought, 'Ooh, how will I survive?'
example.tran: 我第一天到这儿时就想，“天哪，我怎么能挺过去呢?”

example.ex: ...people who are struggling to survive without jobs...
example.tran: 艰难度日的失业者

collins.def: If something survives, it continues to exist even after being in a dangerous situation or existing for a long time.

example.ex: When the market economy is introduced, many factories will not survive...
example.tran: 引入市场经济后，许多工厂将面临倒闭。

example.ex: The chances of a planet surviving a supernova always looked terribly slim.
example.tran: 行星躲过超新星爆发的几率总是十分渺茫。

collins.def: If you survive someone, you continue to live after they have died.

example.ex: Most women will survive their spouses...
example.tran: 大多数女性都比配偶长寿。

example.ex: She is survived by two daughters from her first marriage.
example.tran: 她身后留下了头婚时生的两个女儿。

collins.def: A servant's master is the man that he or she works for.

example.ex: My master ordered me not to deliver the message except in private...
example.tran: 我的主人命令我务必私下里传递消息。

example.ex: In 1777 several northern states encouraged white masters to free their slaves for military service.
example.tran: 1777年，北方的几个州鼓励白人奴隶主解放奴隶，让他们参军。

collins.def: A dog's master is the man or boy who owns it.

example.ex: The dog yelped excitedly when his master opened a desk drawer and produced his leash.
example.tran: 主人打开抽屉拿出牵狗用的皮带时，狗兴奋地叫了起来。

collins.def: If you say that someone is a master of a particular activity, you mean that they are extremely skilled at it.

example.ex: She was a master of the English language...
example.tran: 她是英文高手。

example.ex: He is a master at blocking progress...
example.tran: 他特别擅长充当拦路虎。

collins.def: If you are master of a situation, you have complete  control over it.

example.ex: Jackson remained calm and always master of his passions...
example.tran: 杰克逊镇定自若，始终克制着情绪。

example.ex: He was under no illusions as to who was master in his house.
example.tran: 对于谁当家作主，他不抱任何幻想。

collins.def: If you master something, you learn how to do it properly or you succeed in understanding it completely.

example.ex: Duff soon mastered the skills of radio production...
example.tran: 达夫很快掌握了广播节目制作的技能。

example.ex: Students are expected to master a second language.
example.tran: 学生应该掌握一门第二语言。

collins.def: If you master a difficult situation, you succeed in controlling it.

example.ex: When you have mastered one situation you have to go on to the next...
example.tran: 一旦控制住了一个局面，又得接着应付下一个。

example.ex: His genius alone has mastered every crisis.
example.tran: 仅凭天分，他就控制了所有的危机。

collins.def: A master is a male teacher.

example.ex: Mr Palmer was a retired maths master.
example.tran: 帕尔默先生是一名退休的数学教师。

collins.def: A famous male painter of the past is often called a master .

example.ex: ...a portrait by the Dutch master, Vincent Van Gogh.
example.tran: 一幅由荷兰著名画家文森特·凡·高所作的画像

collins.tran: （电影、录音等）原始拷贝的，母盘的，母带的
collins.def: A master copy of something such as a film or a tape recording is an original copy that can be used to produce other copies.

example.ex: Keep one as a master copy for your own reference and circulate the others.
example.tran: 一盘留作母带自用，其余的都分发出去。

collins.def: The master of a ship that carries passengers or goods is its captain.

example.ex: ...the Royal Pacific's master.
example.tran: “皇家太平洋”号的船长

collins.def: A master's degree can be referred to as a master's .

example.ex: I've a master's in economics.
example.tran: 我获得了经济学硕士学位。

collins.tran: 长老(信徒对宗教法师或领袖的称呼)
collins.def: Master is sometimes used by the followers of a male religious teacher or leader as a way of referring to him or addressing him.

example.ex: She believed that she had been selected by the Master to reveal forgotten wisdom.
example.tran: 她认为自己是被长老选中来揭示被人们遗忘的智慧的。

collins.tran: (旧时的)少爷，小主人;君(现在用于信件中对男孩的称谓)
collins.def: In the past, Master was used before a boy's name as a polite way of referring to him or addressing him. Nowadays, Master can be written before a boy's name when addressing a letter to him.

example.ex: Nice to see you, Master Simon.
example.tran: 很高兴见到您，西蒙少爷。

collins.def: If you say that you are your own master, you mean that your decisions are not controlled by other people and you are free to do what you want.

example.ex: It was no place for a man who liked to be his own master.
example.tran: 这绝非喜爱独立自主的人能呆下去的地方。

collins.def: To destroy something means to cause so much damage to it that it is completely ruined or does not exist any more.

example.ex: That's a sure recipe for destroying the economy and creating chaos...
example.tran: 那样做肯定会破坏经济、制造混乱。

example.ex: No one was injured in the explosion, but the building was completely destroyed...
example.tran: 没有人在爆炸中受伤，但大楼遭到了彻底毁坏。

collins.def: To destroy someone means to ruin their life or to make their situation impossible to bear.

example.ex: If I was younger or more naive, the criticism would have destroyed me.
example.tran: 如果我再年轻一些，或是再单纯一些，那些批评可能就会把我给毁了。

collins.tran: 杀死，消灭（生病或具危险性的动物）
collins.def: If an animal is destroyed, it is killed, either because it is ill or because it is dangerous.

example.ex: Lindsay was unhurt but the horse had to be destroyed.
example.tran: 林赛没有受伤，但那匹马却不得不被人道毁灭。

collins.def: A river is a large amount of fresh water flowing continuously in a long line across the land.

example.ex: ...a chemical works on the banks of the river.
example.tran: 跨河而建的一家化工厂

example.ex: ...boating on the River Danube.
example.tran: 在多瑙河上划船

collins.def: A mass of things is a large number of them grouped together.

example.ex: On his desk is a mass of books and papers.
example.tran: 他的书桌上有大堆的书籍和文件。

collins.def: A mass  of something is a large amount of it.

example.ex: She had a mass of auburn hair.
example.tran: 她有一头浓密的棕发。

collins.def: Masses of something means a great deal of it.

example.ex: There's masses of work for her to do...
example.tran: 她有一大堆的工作要做。

example.ex: It has masses of flowers each year.
example.tran: 它每年都开许多花。

collins.def: Mass is used to describe something which involves or affects a very large number of people.

example.ex: ...ideas on combating mass unemployment...
example.tran: 对付大量失业的点子

example.ex: All the lights went off, and mass hysteria broke out.
example.tran: 所有的灯都熄灭了，大家都变得歇斯底里起来。

collins.def: A mass of a solid substance, a liquid, or a gas is an amount of it, especially a large amount which has no definite shape.

example.ex: ...before it cools and sets into a solid mass...
example.tran: 在它冷却成为固态之前

example.ex: The fourteenth century cathedral was reduced to a mass of rubble.
example.tran: 这座14世纪的大教堂变成了一堆瓦砾。

collins.tran: （与领导或受过高等教育的人相对的）普通老百姓，民众，平民大众
collins.def: If you talk about the masses, you mean the ordinary people in society, in contrast to the leaders or the highly educated people.

example.ex: His music is commercial. It is aimed at the masses...
example.tran: 他的音乐走商业化路线，针对的是一般大众。

example.ex: This issue has aroused much resentment among the masses.
example.tran: 这个问题在民众中间引起了强烈的不满。

collins.def: The mass of people are most of the people in a country, society, or group.

example.ex: The 1939-45 world war involved the mass of the population...
example.tran: 1939至1945年间的世界大战使大多数民众卷入其中。

example.ex: Schools allowed the mass of children to leave school at 16 with poor qualifications.
example.tran: 学校允许大部分考试成绩差的学生16岁时毕业离校。

collins.def: A mass of people is a large crowd of them.

example.ex: ...masses of excited people clogged the streets.
example.tran: 情绪激动的人群挤满了街道。

example.ex: ...a mass of grinning teenage faces.
example.tran: 一张张少年的笑脸

collins.def: When people or things mass, or when you mass them, they gather together into a large crowd or group.

example.ex: Shortly after the workers went on strike, police began to mass at the shipyard...
example.tran: 工人们罢工后不久，警察就开始在船厂集结。

example.ex: The clouds massed, whipped up by the wind...
example.tran: 云卷云舒随风起。

collins.def: If you say that something is a mass of things, you mean that it is covered with them or full of them.

example.ex: His body was a mass of sores...
example.tran: 他遍体鳞伤。

example.ex: In the spring, the meadow is a mass of daffodils.
example.tran: 春天，草地上开满了黄水仙。

collins.def: In physics, the mass of an object is the amount of physical matter that it has.

example.ex: Astronomers know that Pluto and Triton have nearly the same size, mass, and density.
example.tran: 天文学家知道冥王星与海卫一拥有几乎相同的体积、质量与密度。

collins.tran: 弥撒(尤指天主教或东正教的圣餐仪式，以此纪念耶稣基督的最后的晚餐)
collins.def: Mass is a Christian church ceremony, especially in a Roman Catholic or Orthodox church, during which people eat bread and drink wine in order to remember the last meal of Jesus Christ.

example.ex: She attended a convent school and went to Mass each day.
example.tran: 她上的是教会学校，每天都去做弥撒。

collins.def: A Mass is a piece of music which uses the prayers from the Christian ceremony of Mass as the words that are sung.
A farmer is a person who owns or manages a farm.
You use someone or somebody to refer to a person without saying exactly who you mean.

example.ex: Her father was shot by someone trying to rob his small retail store...
example.tran: 她的父亲被企图抢劫他那间小零售店的人开枪打死了。

example.ex: I need someone to help me...
example.tran: 我需要有人帮忙。

collins.tran: (某行业或某地方的)重要人物，大人物
collins.def: If you say that a person is someone or somebody in a particular kind of work or in a particular place, you mean that they are considered to be important in that kind of work or in that place.

example.ex: He was somebody in the law division...
example.tran: 他在法律部门是个人物。

example.ex: 'Before she came around,' she says, 'I was somebody in this town'.
example.tran: “她来之前，”她说道，“我在这个镇上也算得上个人物了。”

collins.def: Nearly is used to indicate that something is not quite the case, or not completely the case.

example.ex: Goldsworth stared at me in silence for nearly twenty seconds...
example.tran: 将近20秒的时间，戈兹沃思就那么一声不响地盯着我看。

example.ex: Hunter knew nearly all of this already...
example.tran: 这事亨特几乎已全知道了。

collins.def: Nearly is used to indicate that something will soon be the case.

example.ex: It was already nearly eight o'clock...
example.tran: 已经快8点了。

example.ex: I was nearly asleep...
example.tran: 我差不多都睡着了。

collins.def: You use not nearly to emphasize that something is not the case.

example.ex: Father's flat in Paris wasn't nearly as grand as this...
example.tran: 爸爸在法国的公寓远不如这处宽敞。

example.ex: Minerals in general are not nearly so well absorbed as other nutrients...
example.tran: 总体来说，矿物质远远不如其他营养成分好吸收。

collins.def: Someone or something that is famous is very well known.

example.ex: New Orleans is famous for its cuisine.
example.tran: 新奥尔良以其美食而著称。

example.ex: ...England's most famous landscape artist, John Constable.
example.tran: 英格兰最著名的风景画家约翰·康斯太布尔

means: 包括( include的过去式和过去分词)

collins.def: You use included to emphasize that a person or thing is part of the group of people or things that you are talking about.

example.ex: All of us, myself included, had been totally committed to the Party...
example.tran: 我们大家,包括我本人在内,一直都对党绝对忠诚。

example.ex: No city, Tel Aviv or Jerusalem included, is home to more Jews than New York...
example.tran: 没有一个城市,包括特拉维夫与耶路撒冷在内,像纽约市一样拥有如此之多的犹太居民。

means: 积极的，活跃的，有生气的

collins.def: Someone who is active moves around a lot or does a lot of things.

example.ex: Having an active youngster about the house can be quite wearing.
example.tran: 家里有个好动的小孩会是相当累人的。

example.ex: ...a long and active life.
example.tran: 漫长而忙碌的一生

collins.def: If you have an active mind or imagination, you are always thinking of new things.

example.ex: ...the tragedy of an active mind trapped by failing physical health.
example.tran: 因为健康状况衰退而思维受阻的悲剧

collins.def: If someone is active in an organization, cause, or campaign, they do things for it rather than just giving it their support.

example.ex: ...a chance for fathers to play a more active role in childcare...
example.tran: 让父亲们更积极地参与育婴的机会

example.ex: I am an active member of the Conservative Party...
example.tran: 我是保守党的积极分子。

collins.def: Active is used to emphasize that someone is taking action in order to achieve something, rather than just hoping for it or achieving it in an indirect way.

example.ex: Companies need to take active steps to increase exports.
example.tran: 各公司需要采取积极措施增加出口。

example.ex: ...active discouragement from teachers.
example.tran: 教师们的竭力阻挠

collins.def: If you say that a person or animal is active in a particular place or at a particular time, you mean that they are performing their usual activities or performing a particular activity.

example.ex: Guerrilla groups are active in the province.
example.tran: 游击队在该省很活跃。

example.ex: ...animals which are active at night.
example.tran: 夜行动物

collins.def: An active volcano has erupted recently or is expected to erupt quite soon.

example.ex: ...molten lava from an active volcano.
example.tran: 活火山喷出的熔岩

collins.tran: 起化学(或生物)作用的;活性的;有效的
collins.def: An active substance has a chemical or biological effect on things.

example.ex: The active ingredient in some of the mouthwashes was simply detergent.
example.tran: 某些漱口剂中的有效成分只不过是洗涤剂而已。

collins.def: In grammar, the active or the active voice means the forms of a verb which are used when the subject refers to a person or thing that does something. For example, in 'I saw her yesterday', the verb is in the active.

You use maybe to express uncertainty, for example when you do not know that something is definitely true, or when you are mentioning something that may possibly happen in the future in the way you describe.

example.ex: Maybe she is in love...
example.tran: 她大概是恋爱了。

example.ex: Maybe he sincerely wanted to help his country...
example.tran: 或许他是诚心诚意地想帮助自己的祖国。

collins.tran: 也许，或许(用于提出建议、作出礼貌的请求等)
collins.def: You use maybe when you are making suggestions or giving advice. Maybe is also used to introduce polite requests.

example.ex: Maybe we can go to the movies or something...
example.tran: 也许我们可以去看场电影什么的。

example.ex: Maybe you'd better tell me what this is all about...
example.tran: 也许你应该告诉我这究竟是怎么回事。

collins.tran: 可能，也许(用于表示某一观点部分属实，但另一观点也应该加以考虑)
collins.def: You use maybe to indicate that, although a comment is partly true, there is also another point of view that should be considered.

example.ex: Maybe there is jealousy, but I think the envy is more powerful...
example.tran: 也许是羡慕，但我认为更多的是嫉妒。

example.ex: OK, maybe I am a failure, but, in my opinion, no more than the rest of this country.
example.tran: 好吧，也许我是个失败者，不过在我看来，这个国家里的其他人也不比我成功到哪里去。

collins.tran: 可能吧(用于表示未置可否)
collins.def: You can say maybe as a response to a question or remark, when you do not want to agree or disagree.

example.ex: 'Do you think that another country will step in to become the dominant military power in the region?' — 'Maybe.'...
example.tran: “您认为另一个国家会介入在该地区建立军事霸权吗？”——“可能吧。”

example.ex: 'Is she coming back?' — 'Maybe. No one hears from her.'
example.tran: “她快回来了吗？”——“也许吧。都还没信儿呢。”

collins.tran: 大概,大约(用于对数目、数量或价值等作出约略的估计)
collins.def: You use maybe when you are making a rough guess at a number, quantity, or value, rather than stating it exactly.

example.ex: The men were maybe a hundred feet away and coming closer.
example.tran: 那些人大约有100英尺远，正在向这里靠近。

collins.tran: 有时(尤用于笼统地描述某人的行为或经常发生的事情)
collins.def: People use maybe to mean 'sometimes', particularly in a series of general statements about what someone does, or about something that regularly happens.

example.ex: They'll come to the bar for a year, or maybe even two, then they'll find another favourite spot.
example.tran: 他们会在一年，有时甚至是两年里一直光顾这个酒吧，然后再另寻好去处。

collins.def: An argument is a statement or set of statements that you use in order to try to convince people that your opinion about something is correct.

example.ex: There's a strong argument for lowering the price...
example.tran: 有充分理由要求降低价格。

example.ex: The doctors have set out their arguments against the proposals...
example.tran: 医生们已经陈述了他们反对这些提案的理由。

collins.def: An argument is a discussion or debate in which a number of people put forward different or opposing opinions.

example.ex: The incident has triggered fresh arguments about the role of the extreme right in France...
example.tran: 该事件引发了关于极右翼势力在法国所起作用的新一轮讨论。

example.ex: The issue has caused heated political argument.
example.tran: 这个问题已经引发了激烈的政治争论。

collins.def: An argument is a conversation in which people disagree with each other angrily or noisily.

example.ex: Anny described how she got into an argument with one of the marchers.
example.tran: 安妮描述了她是如何与其中一位游行者发生争执的。

example.ex: ...a heated argument.
example.tran: 激烈的争吵

collins.def: If you accept something without argument, you do not question it or disagree with it.

example.ex: He complied without argument...
example.tran: 他二话不说就服从了。

example.ex: It should of course be given back. There is no argument about that.
example.tran: 它当然应该还回去，这是无可争议的。

collins.def: The weight of a person or thing is how heavy they are, measured in units such as kilograms, pounds, or tons.

example.ex: What is your height and weight?...
example.tran: 你的身高和体重是多少？

example.ex: This reduced the weight of the load...
example.tran: 这减轻了负荷的重量。

collins.def: A person's or thing's weight is the fact that they are very heavy.

example.ex: His weight was harming his health...
example.tran: 他体重过重，这有损他的健康。

example.ex: Despite the vehicle's size and weight it is not difficult to drive.
example.tran: 尽管车子很大很重，但它一点都不难开。

collins.def: If you move your weight, you change position so that most of the pressure of your body is on a particular part of your body.

example.ex: He shifted his weight from one foot to the other...
example.tran: 他把重心从一只脚转到另一只脚上。

example.ex: He kept the weight from his left leg.
example.tran: 他一直不让左腿受力。

collins.def: Weights are objects which weigh a known amount and which people lift as a form of exercise.

example.ex: I was in the gym lifting weights.
example.tran: 我在健身房举哑铃。

collins.def: Weights are metal objects which weigh a known amount and which are used on a set of scales to weigh other things.
You can refer to a heavy object as a weight, especially when you have to lift it.

example.ex: Straining to lift heavy weights can lead to a rise in blood pressure.
example.tran: 用力提重物会导致血压升高。

collins.def: If you weight something, you make it heavier by adding something to it, for example in order to stop it from moving easily.

example.ex: It can be sewn into curtain hems to weight the curtain and so allow it to hang better.
example.tran: 可以把它缝到窗帘的褶边里增加重量，使窗帘更有垂感。

collins.def: If you weight things, you give them different values according to how important or significant they are.

example.ex: ...a computer program which weights the different transitions according to their likelihood...
example.tran: 根据可能性的大小对不同转换进行加权处理的电脑程序

example.ex: This takes account of the number of countries in which a company wins approval for a new drug, weighted by the size of each country's market.
example.tran: 这考虑到了允许一家公司的新药在本国上市的国家的数量，并依照每个国家的市场规模权衡其重要性。

collins.def: If something is given a particular weight, it is given a particular value according to how important or significant it is.

example.ex: The scientists involved put different weight on the conclusions of different models...
example.tran: 相关科学家对不同模型的结论给予不同的权重。

example.ex: We had this understanding that courses were roughly the same weight.
example.tran: 我们已经了解到各门功课差不多一样重要。

collins.def: If you talk about the weight of something, you mean that it is large in amount or has great power, which means that it is difficult to oppose or fight against.

example.ex: The weight of expectation was getting to them...
example.tran: 他们逐渐感觉到了期望带来的压力。

example.ex: Companies found themselves collapsing under the weight of debts.
example.tran: 许多公司发现自己因债台高筑而濒临倒闭。

collins.def: If someone or something gives weight to what a person says, thinks, or does, they emphasize its significance.

example.ex: The fact that he is gone has given more weight to fears that he may try to launch a civil war...
example.tran: 他已经离开这一事实让人更担心他会发动一场内战。

example.ex: Do you think, perhaps, that what happened today might lend weight to that criticism?
example.tran: 你觉得今天发生的事情可能会使那种批评加剧吗？

collins.def: If you give something or someone weight, you consider them to be very important or influential in a particular situation.

example.ex: Consumers generally place more weight on negative information than on the positive when deciding what to buy.
example.tran: 消费者在决定要买什么东西的时候往往更重视负面消息，而不是正面消息。

example.ex: ...the overwhelming weight Freud assigned parents in our development.
example.tran: 弗洛伊德认为父母在我们的成长过程中所起到的举足轻重的作用

collins.def: If you feel a weight on you, you have a problem or a responsibility that is difficult for you to manage and that you are very worried about.

example.ex: The relief was indescribable. It was freedom after years of slavery. A great weight lifted from me.
example.tran: 如释重负的感觉是难以言喻的。这是受多年奴役之后的自由。我卸下了一个重担。

collins.def: If a person or their opinion carries weight, they are respected and are able to influence people.

example.ex: That argument no longer carries as much weight...
example.tran: 那个论点不再具有那么大的影响力了。

example.ex: Senator Kerry carries considerable weight in Washington.
example.tran: 参议员克里在华盛顿举足轻重。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is worth their weight in gold, you are emphasizing that they are so useful, helpful, or valuable that you feel you could not manage without them.

example.ex: Any successful manager is worth his weight in gold.
example.tran: 任何一个成功的管理者都是千金难求的。

collins.def: If you pull your weight, you work as hard as everyone else who is involved in the same task or activity.

example.ex: He accused the team of not pulling their weight.
example.tran: 他指责这个团队没有尽到本分。

collins.def: If someone throws their weight around or throws their weight about, they act aggressively and use their authority over other people more than they need to.

collins.tran: （利用自己的影响等）全力相助，鼎力支持
collins.def: If you throw your weight behind a person, plan, or campaign, you use all your influence and do everything you can to support them.

example.ex: The administration is throwing its full weight behind the UN plan.
example.tran: 该政府正鼎力支持这项联合国计划。

means: 明智地使用（金钱、时间、信息等）

collins.def: If you manage an organization, business, or system, or the people who work in it, you are responsible for controlling them.

example.ex: Within two years he was managing the store...
example.tran: 不出两年他就开始管理这家店了。

example.ex: Most factories in the area are obsolete and badly managed...
example.tran: 这个地区的绝大多数工厂都十分陈旧，经营状况也非常糟糕。

collins.tran: 谨慎地使用，好好地利用(时间、金钱等)
collins.def: If you manage time, money, or other resources, you deal with them carefully and do not waste them.

example.ex: In a busy world, managing your time is increasingly important...
example.tran: 在忙碌的世界里，善于利用时间变得越来越重要。

example.ex: Josh expects me to manage all the household expenses on very little.
example.tran: 乔希指望我对每笔家庭支出都精打细算。

collins.def: If you manage to do something, especially something difficult, you succeed in doing it.

example.ex: Somehow, he'd managed to persuade Kay to buy one for him...
example.tran: 不知用了什么方法，他成功说服凯给他买了一个。

example.ex: I managed to pull myself up onto a wet, sloping ledge...
example.tran: 我终于爬上了一块潮湿倾斜的暗礁。

collins.def: If you manage, you succeed in coping with a difficult situation.

example.ex: She had managed perfectly well without medication for three years...
example.tran: 3年来，她一直没有服药却挺了过来。

example.ex: I am managing, but I could not possibly give up work...
example.tran: 我正在努力应付，但我不可能放弃工作。

collins.tran: 抽出，腾出，安排出(时间、金钱等)
collins.def: If you say that you can manage an amount of time or money for something, you mean that you can afford to spend that time or money on it.

example.ex: This makes it ideal for those who can only manage a few hours in the morning or evening...
example.tran: 对于那些只能在早晚抽出几个小时的人来说，这是最理想不过的了。

example.ex: 'All right, I can manage a fiver,' McMinn said with reluctance.
example.tran: 麦克明不情愿地说：“好吧，我可以出5镑。”

collins.tran: 勉强做出（微笑、寒暄等);强作
collins.def: If you say that someone managed a particular response, such as a laugh or a greeting, you mean that it was difficult for them to do it because they were feeling sad or upset.

example.ex: He looked dazed as he spoke to reporters, managing only a weak smile...
example.tran: 跟记者谈话的时候，他只是勉强挤出一丝淡淡的微笑，显得非常恍惚。

example.ex: He managed a few sentences about his visit to the prison...
example.tran: 他勉强描述了一下探监情况。

collins.tran: （对他人给予帮助的婉拒）我能对付，我能行
collins.def: You say 'I can manage' or 'I'll manage' as a way of refusing someone's offer of help and insisting on doing something by yourself.

example.ex: I know you mean well, but I can manage by myself...
example.tran: 我知道您是一番好意，不过我一个人能行。

example.ex: 'I'll do it, Eleanor,' Angus said, quickly jumping up. But this time she only shook her head. 'I'll manage,' she said firmly.
example.tran: 安格斯一跃而起道：“让我来，埃莉诺。”可是，这一次她只是摇了摇头，坚定地说：“我能应付。”

collins.def: Something that is cold has a very low temperature or a lower temperature than is normal or acceptable.

example.ex: Rinse the vegetables under cold running water...
example.tran: 用凉的自来水清洗这些蔬菜。

example.ex: He likes his tea neither too hot nor too cold...
example.tran: 他想要杯不凉不热的茶。

collins.def: If it is cold, or if a place is cold, the temperature of the air is very low.

example.ex: It was bitterly cold...
example.tran: 天冷得刺骨。

example.ex: The house is cold because I can't afford to turn the heat on...
example.tran: 屋里很冷，因为我没钱付暖气费。

collins.def: Cold weather or low temperatures can be referred to as the cold .

example.ex: He must have come inside to get out of the cold...
example.tran: 他肯定是进来避寒的。

example.ex: His feet were blue with cold.
example.tran: 他的脚冻得发紫。

collins.def: If you are cold, your body is at an unpleasantly low temperature.

example.ex: I was freezing cold...
example.tran: 我快冻僵了。

example.ex: I'm hungry, I'm cold and I've nowhere to sleep.
example.tran: 我饥寒交迫，甚至连睡觉的地方都没有。

collins.def: Cold food, such as salad or meat that has been cooked and cooled, is not intended to be eaten hot.

example.ex: A wide variety of hot and cold snacks will be available.
example.tran: 会有各种冷热小吃。

example.ex: ...cold meats.
example.tran: 冷肉

collins.def: Cold colours or cold light give an impression of coldness.

example.ex: Generally, warm colours advance in painting and cold colours recede.
example.tran: 通常，绘画中暖色调为近感色，而冷色调为远感色。

example.ex: ...the cold blue light from a streetlamp.
example.tran: 街灯发出的幽幽蓝光

collins.tran: 冷淡的;冷酷的;不热情的
collins.def: A cold person does not show much emotion, especially affection, and therefore seems unfriendly and unsympathetic. If someone's voice is cold, they speak in an unfriendly unsympathetic way.

example.ex: What a cold, unfeeling woman she was...
example.tran: 她真是个冷酷无情的女人！

example.ex: 'Send her away,' Eve said in a cold, hard voice.
example.tran: “把她打发走。”伊芙冷酷无情地说道。

collins.def: A cold trail or scent is one which is old and therefore difficult to follow.

example.ex: He could follow a cold trail over hard ground and even over stones.
example.tran: 他能循着地面上甚至是石头上留下的淡淡的痕迹展开追踪。

collins.def: If you say that someone is cold when they are trying to guess the answer to a question or puzzle, you mean that they are thinking about it in the wrong way and are going to give a wrong answer.
If you have a cold, you have a mild, very common illness which makes you sneeze a lot and gives you a sore throat or a cough.
If you catch cold, or catch a cold, you become ill with a cold.

example.ex: Let's dry our hair so we don't catch cold.
example.tran: 我们把头发吹干，这样就不会感冒。

collins.tran: 未能打动;未能激起…的兴趣
collins.def: If something leaves you cold, it fails to excite or interest you.

example.ex: Lawrence is one of those writers who either excite you enormously or leave you cold.
example.tran: 劳伦斯是那种要么让人激动不已，要么让人觉得索然无味的作家。

collins.tran: 昏迷的;失去知觉的;睡得很沉的
collins.def: If someone is out cold, they are unconscious or sleeping very heavily.

example.ex: She was out cold but still breathing.
example.tran: 她处于昏迷状态，但还有呼吸。

collins.def: If you say that a person, group, or country has been left out in the cold, you mean that they have been ignored by others rather than being invited to take part in some activity with them.

example.ex: Developing countries might be left out in the cold in current world trade talks.
example.tran: 在目前的世界贸易洽谈中，发展中国家可能会受到冷落。

collins.def: A country's navy consists of the people it employs to fight at sea, and the ships they use.

example.ex: The government announced an order for three Type 23 frigates for the Royal Navy yesterday...
example.tran: 政府昨天宣布为皇家海军订购3艘23型护卫舰。

example.ex: Her own son was also in the Navy.
example.tran: 她自己的儿子那时也在海军。

collins.def: Something that is navy or navy-blue is very dark blue.

example.ex: I mostly wore black or navy trousers.
example.tran: 我大部分时间穿黑色或深蓝色裤子。

example.ex: ...a navy-blue blazer.
example.tran: 海军蓝的便上装

collins.def: If someone is weak, they are not healthy or do not have good muscles, so that they cannot move quickly or carry heavy things.

example.ex: I was too weak to move or think or speak...
example.tran: 我太虚弱了，无法动弹，无法思考，也无法说话。

example.ex: His arms and legs were weak.
example.tran: 他的四肢虚弱无力。

collins.tran: (器官或感官)功能差的，受损伤的
collins.def: If someone has an organ or sense that is weak, it is not very effective or powerful, or is likely to fail.

example.ex: Until the beating, Cantanco's eyesight had been weak, but adequate...
example.tran: 挨打前坎坦科的视力就一直很弱，不过也还勉强看得见。

example.ex: She tired easily and had a weak heart.
example.tran: 她很容易疲劳，心脏也不好。

collins.def: If you describe someone as weak, you mean that they are not very confident or determined, so that they are often frightened or worried, or easily influenced by other people.

example.ex: He was a nice doctor, but a weak man who wasn't going to stick his neck out...
example.tran: 他是位为人和蔼的医生，但胆小怕事，不敢冒什么风险。

example.ex: You have been conditioned to believe that it is weak to be scared.
example.tran: 你已经习惯性地认为害怕就是软弱。

collins.tran: (声音或笑容)微弱的，不热情的，无力的
collins.def: If you describe someone's voice or smile as weak, you mean that it is not very loud or big, suggesting that the person lacks confidence, enthusiasm, or physical strength.

example.ex: His weak voice was almost inaudible...
example.tran: 他的声音微弱，几乎听不见。

example.ex: He managed a weak smile.
example.tran: 他勉强挤出一丝笑容。

collins.tran: 不牢固的;易破的;易坏的
collins.def: If an object or surface is weak, it breaks easily and cannot support a lot of weight or resist a lot of strain.

example.ex: The owner said the bird may have escaped through a weak spot in the aviary...
example.tran: 鸟的主人说这只鸟可能是从鸟舍一处不结实的地方逃走的。

example.ex: Swimming is helpful for bones that are porous and weak.
example.tran: 游泳有助于改善骨质疏松和骨骼脆弱。

collins.def: A weak physical force does not have much power or intensity.

example.ex: The molecules in regular liquids are held together by relatively weak bonds...
example.tran: 常规液体里分子之间的键合力相对较弱。

example.ex: Strong winds can turn boats when the tide is weak.
example.tran: 潮水小的时候强风可以让船只改变航向。

collins.tran: 无权力的;无权威的;无影响力的
collins.def: If individuals or groups are weak, they do not have any power or influence.

example.ex: The council was too weak to do anything about it.
example.tran: 市政会手中无权，对此无能为力。

collins.tran: (政府或领导人) 软弱无力的
collins.def: A weak government or leader does not have much control, and is not prepared or able to act firmly or severely.

example.ex: The changes come after mounting criticism that the government is weak and indecisive...
example.tran: 随着对政府软弱和优柔寡断的批评愈演愈烈，情况终于有了变化。

example.ex: The chief editorial writer also blames weak leadership for the current crisis.
example.tran: 首席社论员也把当前的危机归咎于领导层软弱无力。

collins.tran: (货币、经济、产业、政府等)疲软的，有崩溃危险的
collins.def: If you describe something such a country's currency, economy, industry, or government as weak, you mean that it is not successful, and may be likely to fail or collapse.

example.ex: The weak dollar means American goods are relative bargains for foreigners...
example.tran: 美元疲软意味着美国的产品对外国人来说相对便宜。

example.ex: When the economy is weak, it's very hard for suppliers to raise their prices.
example.tran: 经济疲软时供货商很难提价。

collins.tran: (论据等)不充分的，没有说服力的;(逻辑)不周密的
collins.def: If something such as an argument or case is weak, it is not convincing or there is little evidence to support it.

example.ex: Do you think the prosecution made any particular errors, or did they just have a weak case?...
example.tran: 你认为公诉人犯了什么错误呢，还是根本就是证据不足？

example.ex: The claim exposed a weak point in the structure of facts upon which his argument rested...
example.tran: 这一主张暴露了支撑他论点的论据结构的一个弱点。

collins.def: A weak drink, chemical, or drug contains very little of a particular substance, for example because a lot of water has been added to it.

example.ex: ...a cup of weak tea...
example.tran: 一杯淡茶

example.ex: ...a very weak bleach solution.
example.tran: 高度稀释的漂白剂

collins.def: Your weak points are the qualities or talents you do not possess, or the things you are not very good at.

example.ex: You may very well be asked what your weak points are. Don't try to claim you don't have any...
example.tran: 你很可能会被问到有什么缺点。不要试图声称自己没有任何缺点。

example.ex: Geography was my weak subject...
example.tran: 地理是我的弱项。

collins.tran: （下巴）瘦小的;（尤暗指）性格懦弱的
collins.def: You can say that someone has a weak chin to indicate that their chin is not large, especially when you want to suggest that they do not have a strong character.

example.ex: She was a plain-looking woman with a weak chin.
example.tran: 她相貌平平，性格懦弱。

collins.def: Goods are things that are made to be sold.

example.ex: Money can be exchanged for goods or services.
example.tran: 钱可以用来换取商品或服务。

example.ex: ...a wide range of consumer goods.
example.tran: 种类繁多的消费品

collins.def: Your goods are the things that you own and that can be moved.

example.ex: All his worldly goods were packed into a neat checked carrier bag...
example.tran: 他的所有家当都装在一个干净的方格图案手提袋里。

example.ex: You can give your unwanted goods to charity.
example.tran: 你可以将不要的物品捐赠给慈善机构。

collins.def: If you deliver the goods or come up with the goods, you do what is expected or required of you.

example.ex: As long as I deliver the goods, my boss is very happy.
example.tran: 只要我做好本职工作，我的老板就很高兴。

collins.def: If you get the goods or have the goods on someone, you have evidence that they have done something wrong or criminal.

example.ex: He was the victim of those in his own party who had the goods on him.
example.tran: 党内一些人掌握了他的把柄，结果他成了牺牲品。

collins.def: The fortieth item in a series is the one that you count as number forty.

example.ex: It was the fortieth anniversary of the death of the composer.
example.tran: 这是该作曲家逝世 40 周年纪念日。

collins.def: Sports are games such as football and basketball and other competitive leisure activities which need physical effort and skill.

example.ex: I'd say football is my favourite sport...
example.tran: 我最喜欢的运动要数足球了。

example.ex: She excels at sport...
example.tran: 她在体育方面很优秀。

collins.def: If you say that someone is a sport or a good sport, you mean that they cope with a difficult situation or teasing in a cheerful way.

example.ex: He was accused of having no sense of humor, of not being a good sport.
example.tran: 他被指责缺乏幽默感，不够大度。

collins.def: If you say that someone sports something such as a distinctive item of clothing, you mean that they wear it without any shyness.

example.ex: He sported a collarless jacket with pleated black panels...
example.tran: 他穿着一件带有黑色褶子饰条的无领上衣。

example.ex: He was heavily-built and sported a red moustache...
example.tran: 他身材魁梧，留着红色的八字胡。

collins.def: If you quote someone as saying something, you repeat what they have written or said.

example.ex: He quoted Mr Polay as saying that peace negotiations were already underway...
example.tran: 他引用波利先生的话，说和谈已在进行之中。

example.ex: She was quoted in the Express by an unnamed source as saying: 'I won't bail out those two silly girls.'...
example.tran: 一位匿名的作者在《快报》中引用了她的话说：“我不会保释那两个傻丫头的”。

collins.def: A quote from a book, poem, play, or speech is a passage or phrase from it.

example.ex: The article starts with a quote from an unnamed member of the Cabinet.
example.tran: 文章的开头引用了一位未透露姓名的内阁成员说过的话。

collins.tran: 援引，引用(法律条款、事实等)
collins.def: If you quote something such as a law or a fact, you state it because it supports what you are saying.

example.ex: Mr Meacher quoted statistics saying that the standard of living of the poorest people had fallen.
example.tran: 米彻先生援引统计数据来说明最贫困人口的生活水平下降了。

collins.def: If someone quotes a price for doing something, they say how much money they would charge you for a service they are offering or for a job that you want them to do.

example.ex: A travel agent quoted her £160 for a flight from Bristol to Palma...
example.tran: 一位旅行社职员给她开出的从布里斯托尔至帕尔马的机票报价是160英镑。

example.ex: He quoted a price for the repairs.
example.tran: 他给出了维修费用的报价。

collins.def: A quote for a piece of work is the price that someone says they will charge you to do the work.

example.ex: Always get a written quote for any repairs needed.
example.tran: 每次进行修理都索要一份书面的报价单。

collins.def: If a company's shares, a substance, or a currency is quoted at a particular price, that is its current market price.

example.ex: In early trading in Hong Kong yesterday, gold was quoted at $368.20 an ounce...
example.tran: 在香港昨天早些时候的交易中，黄金的牌价为每盎司368.20美元。

example.ex: Heron is a private company and is not quoted on the Stock Market.
example.tran: 赫伦公司是一家私营公司，没有在股票交易市场挂牌。

collins.def: Quotes are the same as quotation marks .

example.ex: The word 'remembered' is in quotes.
example.tran: remembered 一词用引号括了起来。

collins.def: You can say 'quote' to show that you are about to quote someone's words.

example.ex: He predicts they will have, quote, 'an awful lot of explaining to do'.
example.tran: 他预计他们需要“大费周章地解释一番”，这是他的原话。

collins.def: A gun is a weapon from which bullets or other things are fired.

example.ex: He produced a gun and he came into the house...
example.tran: 他掏出枪来，走进房子。

example.ex: The inner-city has guns and crime and drugs and deprivation.
example.tran: 市中心的贫民区充斥着滥用枪支、犯罪、吸毒和贫困问题。

collins.def: A gun or a starting gun is an object like a gun that is used to make a noise to signal the start of a race.

example.ex: The starting gun blasted and they were off.
example.tran: 发令枪响了，他们冲了出去。

collins.tran: 把…发动起来；给…加大油门；使加速
collins.def: To gun an engine or a vehicle means to make it start or go faster by pressing on the accelerator pedal.

example.ex: He gunned his engine and drove off.
example.tran: 他发动引擎，驱车而去。

collins.def: If you come out with guns blazing or with all guns blazing, you put all your effort and energy into trying to achieve something.

example.ex: The company came out with guns blazing.
example.tran: 公司鼓足了劲要大干一番。

collins.def: If you jump the gun, you do something before everyone else or before the proper or right time.

example.ex: It wasn't due to be released until September 10, but some booksellers have jumped the gun and decided to sell it early.
example.tran: 这本书定于9月10号发行，但是一些书商已抢先一步，决定提前销售。

collins.tran: 坚持自己的立场；固执己见；一意孤行
collins.def: If you stick to your guns, you continue to have your own opinion about something even though other people are trying to tell you that you are wrong.

example.ex: He should have stuck to his guns and refused to meet her.
example.tran: 他本应坚持己见，拒绝与她会面。

collins.def: Your brain is the organ inside your head that controls your body's activities and enables you to think and to feel things such as heat and pain.

example.ex: Her father died of a brain tumour.
example.tran: 她父亲死于脑瘤。

collins.def: Your brain is your mind and the way that you think.

example.ex: Once you stop using your brain you soon go stale...
example.tran: 一旦停止用脑，人很快就会变得迟钝。

example.ex: Stretch your brain with this puzzle.
example.tran: 用这个智力游戏锻炼你的思维能力。

collins.def: If someone has brains or a good brain, they have the ability to learn and understand things quickly, to solve problems, and to make good decisions.

example.ex: They were not the only ones to have brains and ambition...
example.tran: 并不是只有他们聪明、有志向。

example.ex: I had a good brain and the teachers liked me.
example.tran: 我很聪明，老师们都喜欢我。

collins.def: If someone is the brains behind an idea or an organization, he or she had that idea or makes the important decisions about how that organization is managed.

example.ex: Mr White was the brains behind the scheme...
example.tran: 怀特先生是该项计划的幕后策划者。

example.ex: Some investigators regarded her as the brains of the gang.
example.tran: 一些调查员认为她是该团伙的决策者。

collins.def: To brain someone means to hit them forcefully on the head.

example.ex: He had threatened to brain him then and there.
example.tran: 他当时就威胁要打爆他的脑袋。

collins.tran: 把…的脑袋打伤；把…脑袋打开花
collins.def: To beat someone's  brains out or bash their brains in means to hit their head very hard, so that they are badly injured or killed.

example.ex: They stood over him with clubs raised as if to beat his brains out.
example.tran: 他们举着棍子监视着他，好像要揍扁他的脑袋。

collins.tran: （用枪）把…的脑袋打开花；射中…的头部
collins.def: To blow someone's brains out means to shoot them in the head, killing them.

example.ex: Give me all your money or I'll blow your brains out...
example.tran: 把你所有的钱都给我，否则我就一枪把你的脑袋打开花。

example.ex: He blew his brains out with a shotgun.
example.tran: 他用一支猎枪射中了他的脑袋。

collins.def: If someone has something on the brain, they keep thinking about it.

example.ex: You've had chess on the brain since you were little.
example.tran: 你从很小的时候就对下棋产生了浓厚兴趣。

collins.def: If you pick someone's brains, you ask them to help you with a problem because they know more about the subject than you.

example.ex: Why should a successful company allow another firm to pick its brains?
example.tran: 为什么一个成功的企业就得允许别的公司来讨教呢？

collins.def: If you delay doing something, you do not do it immediately or at the planned or expected time, but you leave it until later.
