example.ex: For sentimental reasons I wanted to delay my departure until June...
example.tran: 因为感情方面的原因，我想把离开的日期延迟至6月。

example.ex: They had delayed having children, for the usual reason, to establish their careers...
example.tran: 为了那个通常的原因——创立自己的事业，他们推迟了要孩子。

collins.def: To delay someone or something means to make them late or to slow them down.

example.ex: Can you delay him in some way?...
example.tran: 你能想办法拖住他一会儿吗？

example.ex: Various setbacks and problems delayed production...
example.tran: 各种各样的挫折和问题耽搁了生产进度。

collins.def: If you delay, you deliberately take longer than necessary to do something.

example.ex: If he delayed any longer, the sun would be up.
example.tran: 如果他再拖延，太阳就要出来了。

collins.def: If there is a delay, something does not happen until later than planned or expected.

example.ex: They claimed that such a delay wouldn't hurt anyone...
example.tran: 他们声称这样的延期对谁都不会造成损害。

example.ex: Although the tests have caused some delay, flights should be back to normal this morning.
example.tran: 虽然检测造成了一定的延迟，不过今天早上航班就应该能恢复正常了。

collins.def: Delay is a failure to do something immediately or in the required or usual time.

example.ex: There is no time left for delay...
example.tran: 已经没有时间再耽误了。

example.ex: We'll send you a quote without delay.
example.tran: 我们会立刻送一份报价给你。

means: 里格（长度单位，约等于 3 英里）

collins.def: A league is a group of people, clubs, or countries that have joined together for a particular purpose, or because they share a common interest.

example.ex: ...the League of Nations.
example.tran: 国际联盟

example.ex: ...the World Muslim League.
example.tran: 世界穆斯林联盟

collins.def: A league is a group of teams that play the same sport or activity against each other.

example.ex: ...the American League series between the Boston Red Sox and World Champion Oakland Athletics...
example.tran: 波士顿红袜队和世界大赛冠军奥克兰运动家队的美国联盟冠军赛对决

example.ex: The club are on the brink of promotion to the Premier League.
example.tran: 俱乐部即将晋级超级联赛。

collins.def: You use the word league to make comparisons between different people or things, especially in terms of their quality.

example.ex: Her success has taken her out of my league...
example.tran: 她的成绩令我望尘莫及。

example.ex: Their record sales would put them in the same league as The Rolling Stones.
example.tran: 他们的唱片销量可与“滚石”乐队比肩。

collins.def: If you say that someone is in league with another person to do something bad, you mean that they are working together to do that thing.

example.ex: There is no evidence that the broker was in league with the fraudulent vendor...
example.tran: 没有证据表明该经纪人与进行诈骗的卖主狼狈为奸。

example.ex: Williams operated the smuggling scheme in league with his brother.
example.tran: 威廉斯串通其弟进行走私活动。

collins.tran: 负有责任的;应承担责任的
collins.def: If someone or something is responsible for a particular event or situation, they are the cause of it or they can be blamed for it.

example.ex: He still felt responsible for her death...
example.tran: 他仍然觉得自己对她的死负有责任。

example.ex: I want you to do everything you can to find out who's responsible.
example.tran: 我希望你能尽一切可能找出责任人。

collins.def: If you are responsible for something, it is your job or duty to deal with it and make decisions relating to it.

example.ex: ...the minister responsible for the environment...
example.tran: 负责环境工作的部长

example.ex: The man responsible for finding the volunteers is Dr. Charles Weber.
example.tran: 负责寻找志愿者的人是查尔斯·韦伯博士。

collins.tran: 对(某人或某团体)负责的
collins.def: If you are responsible to a person or group, they have authority over you and you have to report to them about what you do.

example.ex: I'm responsible to my board of directors...
example.tran: 我对董事会负责。

example.ex: The government will be responsible to the President alone.
example.tran: 政府只对总统一人负责。

collins.tran: 负责的;有责任心的;可靠的
collins.def: Responsible people behave properly and sensibly, without needing to be supervised.

example.ex: He's a very responsible sort of person...
example.tran: 他是个非常有责任心的人。

example.ex: He feels that the media should be more responsible in what they report.
example.tran: 他觉得媒体应该对报道的内容更负责任些。

collins.def: Responsible jobs involve making important decisions or carrying out important tasks.

example.ex: I work in a government office. It's a responsible position, I suppose, but not very exciting...
example.tran: 我在政府机关工作。我想那是一个责任重大的职位，但并不是很有意思。

example.ex: They have been demoted to less responsible jobs.
example.tran: 他们被降职去做不太重要的工作。

collins.def: If two substances mix or if you mix one substance with another, you stir or shake them together, or combine them in some other way, so that they become a single substance.

example.ex: Oil and water don't mix...
example.tran: 油和水不相溶。

example.ex: It mixes easily with cold or hot water to make a tasty, filling drink...
example.tran: 它极易溶于冷水或热水，冲成既可口又充饥的饮料。

collins.def: If you mix something, you prepare it by mixing other things together.

example.ex: He had spent several hours mixing cement...
example.tran: 他花了几个小时搅拌水泥。

example.ex: Are you sure I can't mix you a drink?
example.tran: 你确定不用我为你调一杯饮料吗？

collins.tran: (制作糕点、调味汁等的)混合原料，混合配料
collins.def: A mix is a powder containing all the substances that you need in order to make something such as a cake or a sauce. When you want to use it, you add liquid.

example.ex: For speed we used packets of pizza dough mix...
example.tran: 为了节约时间，我们用了几包做比萨饼的混合面粉。

example.ex: It was a packet mix.
example.tran: 这是一小包混合配料。

collins.def: A mix of different things or people is two or more of them together.

example.ex: The story is a magical mix of fantasy and reality...
example.tran: 这个故事是幻想与现实的奇妙结合。

example.ex: We get a very representative mix of people.
example.tran: 我们现在有了非常具有代表性的一群人。

collins.def: If two things or activities do not mix or if one thing does not mix with another, it is not a good idea to have them or do them together, because the result would be unpleasant or dangerous.

example.ex: Politics and sport don't mix.
example.tran: 政治与体育不可混为一谈。

example.ex: ...some of these pills that don't mix with drink...
example.tran: 一些不能用饮料冲服的药片

collins.def: If you mix with other people, you meet them and talk to them. You can also say that people mix .

example.ex: I ventured the idea that the secret of staying young was to mix with older people...
example.tran: 我大胆地提出了这样的观点：保持年轻的秘诀就在于和年长的人交往。

example.ex: People are supposed to mix, do you understand?...
example.tran: 人们应该互相交际，你明白吗？

collins.def: When a record producer mixes a piece of music, he or she puts together the various sounds that have been recorded in order to make the finished record.

example.ex: They've been mixing tracks for a new album due out later this year.
example.tran: 他们一直在为定于今年稍后推出的新专辑录制歌曲。

collins.tran: 经常大吵大闹，动不动就大打出手(美国英语用 mix it up)
collins.def: If you say that someone mixes it, or in American English mixes it up, you mean that they often fight or argue strongly about things.

example.ex: Stewart has developed a tendency to mix it verbally with the opposition.
example.tran: 斯图尔特现在变得只要和别人意见不合，就准备大吵一架。

means: [数学]分解…的因子，将…分解成因子
以代理商（或管家等）的身份行事，做代理商（或管家）

collins.def: A factor is one of the things that affects an event, decision, or situation.

example.ex: Physical activity is an important factor in maintaining fitness.
example.tran: 进行体育活动是保持身体健康的一个重要因素。

collins.def: If an amount increases by a factor of two, for example, or by a factor of eight, then it becomes two times bigger or eight times bigger.

example.ex: The cost of butter quadrupled and bread prices increased by a factor of five.
example.tran: 黄油价格涨了 4 倍，面包价格涨了 5 倍。

collins.def: You can use factor to refer to a particular level on a scale of measurement.

example.ex: ...suncream with a protection factor of 8.
example.tran: 防晒系数为 8 的防晒霜

collins.def: A factor of a whole number is a smaller whole number which can be multiplied with another whole number to produce the first whole number.
If there is a lack of something, there is not enough of it or it does not exist at all.

example.ex: Despite his lack of experience, he got the job...
example.tran: 他虽然经验不足，但还是获得了这份工作。

example.ex: The charges were dropped for lack of  evidence...
example.tran: 指控因证据不足而被撤销。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something lacks a particular quality or that a particular quality is lacking in them, you mean that they do not have any or enough of it.

example.ex: It lacked the power of the Italian cars...
example.tran: 它没有意大利轿车动力强劲。

example.ex: He lacked the judgment and political acumen for the post of chairman...
example.tran: 他欠缺做主席应具备的判断力和政治敏锐度。

collins.def: If you say there is no lack of something, you are emphasizing that there is a great deal of it.

example.ex: He said there was no lack of things for them to talk about...
example.tran: 他说他们之间不缺谈资。

example.ex: President Clinton displayed no lack of vigor when he began to speak.
example.tran: 克林顿总统开腔时颇有气势。

collins.def: If you move or look forward, you move or look in a direction that is in front of you. In British English, you can also move or look forwards .

example.ex: He came forward with his hand out. 'Mr and Mrs Selby?' he enquired...
example.tran: 他走上前去伸出手来。“是塞尔比先生和夫人吗？”他问道。

example.ex: She fell forwards on to her face...
example.tran: 她一头栽倒在地。

collins.def: Forward means in a position near the front of something such as a building or a vehicle.

example.ex: The best seats are in the aisle and as far forward as possible...
example.tran: 最好的座位在过道处，越靠前越好。

example.ex: The other car had a 3-inch lower driving seat and had its engine mounted further forward.
example.tran: 另外一辆车的驾驶座椅低了3英寸，引擎更加靠前。

collins.tran: (尤指在轮船或飞机上)靠近…前面的，在…前面的
collins.def: If one thing is forward of another, especially on a ship or aircraft, the first thing is in front of the second thing or further ahead.

example.ex: Forward of the main cabin are the guest cabins...
example.tran: 主舱前面是客舱。

example.ex: Sixty-one small parachute symbols were painted on the left side just forward of the wing.
example.tran: 61 个小降落伞的标志被绘在左翼的正前面。

collins.def: If you say that someone looks forward, you approve of them because they think about what will happen in the future and plan for it. In British English, you can also say that someone looks forwards .

example.ex: Now the leadership wants to look forward, and to outline a strategy for the rest of the century...
example.tran: 现在领导层想要展望未来，为本世纪余下的时间勾画出战略纲要。

example.ex: People should forget and look forwards...
example.tran: 人们应该忘记过去向前看。

collins.def: If you put a clock or watch forward, you change the time shown on it so that it shows a later time, for example when the time changes to summer time or daylight saving time.

example.ex: When we put the clocks forward in March we go into British Summer Time.
example.tran: 我们3月份把表调快时，就进入了英国夏令时。

collins.def: When you are referring to a particular time, if you say that something was true from that time forward, you mean that it became true at that time, and continued to be true afterwards.

example.ex: Velazquez's work from that time forward was confined largely to portraits of the royal family.
example.tran: 委拉斯开兹的作品从那时起大多局限于皇室成员画像。

collins.tran: 向前地;前进地;有进展地
collins.def: You use forward to indicate that something progresses or improves. In British English, you can also use forwards .

example.ex: And by boosting economic prosperity in Mexico, Canada and the United States, it will help us move forward on issues that concern all of us...
example.tran: 促进墨西哥、加拿大和美国的经济繁荣将有助于解决与我们大家息息相关的诸多问题。

example.ex: They just couldn't see any way forward...
example.tran: 他们就是看不到前进的方向。

collins.def: If you forward something, you cause it to progress or improve.

example.ex: The music is used to forward the plot, not simply to keep the toes tapping.
example.tran: 音乐用来推进情节发展，而不仅仅是保持节奏感。

example.ex: ...the scientist who has done the most to forward the cause of public understanding over the year.
example.tran: 这位一年来为促进公众理解作出巨大贡献的科学家

collins.def: If something or someone is put forward, or comes forward, they are suggested or offered as suitable for a particular purpose.

example.ex: Over the years several similar theories have been put forward...
example.tran: 几年来已经有好几个类似理论相继提出。

example.ex: Next month the Commission is to bring forward its first proposals for action...
example.tran: 下月该委员会将提出它的首批行动建议。

collins.def: If a letter or message is forwarded to someone, it is sent to the place where they are, after having been sent to a different place earlier.

example.ex: When he's out on the road, office calls are forwarded to the cellular phone in his truck...
example.tran: 他在路上时，打到办公室的电话会转接到卡车里的移动电话上。

example.ex: We will forward your letters to him.
example.tran: 我们会把您的信转交给他。

collins.def: If you describe someone as forward, you mean that they speak very confidently and honestly but they do not always show enough respect for the person they are talking to.

example.ex: He's very forward and confident and chats happily to other people.
example.tran: 他很自以为是，喜欢和别人攀谈。

collins.tran: (足球、篮球或曲棍球等运动的)前锋
collins.def: In football, basketball, or hockey, a forward is a player whose usual position is in the opponents' half of the field, and whose usual job is to attack or score goals.
To import products or raw materials means to buy them from another country for use in your own country.

example.ex: Britain last year spent nearly £5000 million more on importing food than selling abroad...
example.tran: 去年英国的进口食品支出比其出口食品收入多出近50亿英镑。

example.ex: To import from Russia, a Ukrainian firm needs Russian roubles.
example.tran: 要从俄罗斯进口商品,乌克兰公司就需要俄罗斯卢布。

collins.def: Imports are products or raw materials bought from another country for use in your own country.

example.ex: ...farmers protesting about cheap imports.
example.tran: 抗议进口廉价商品的农民

collins.def: The import of something is its importance.

example.ex: Who leads Canada is also of some import to the rest of the world...
example.tran: 谁领导加拿大对世界来讲也具有一定的重要性。

example.ex: Such arguments are of little import.
example.tran: 这种争论没有什么意义。

collins.def: If you import files or information into one type of software from another type, you open them in a format that can be used in the new software.

example.ex: You can import files from Microsoft Word 5.1 or MacWrite II.
example.tran: 可以从 Microsoft Word 5.1 或 MacWrite II 程序导入文件。

collins.def: The import of something is its meaning, especially when the meaning is not clearly expressed.

example.ex: I have already spoken about the import of his speech.
example.tran: 有关他的讲话的含意我刚刚已经谈过了。

collins.tran: 绝对必要的;必不可少的;基本的
collins.def: Something that is essential is extremely important or absolutely necessary to a particular subject, situation, or activity.

example.ex: It was absolutely essential to separate crops from the areas that animals used as pasture...
example.tran: 将庄稼和放牧区分开绝对必要。

example.ex: As they must also sprint over short distances, speed is essential...
example.tran: 由于他们也必须进行短跑，因此速度至关重要。

collins.def: The essentials are the things that are absolutely necessary for the situation you are in or for the task you are doing.

example.ex: The flat contained the basic essentials for bachelor life.
example.tran: 那套公寓配有单身生活的基本必需品。

collins.def: The essential aspects of something are its most basic or important aspects.

example.ex: Most authorities agree that play is an essential part of a child's development...
example.tran: 大多数权威人士都同意，玩耍在孩子成长过程中起着非常重要的作用。

example.ex: In this trial two essential elements must be proven: motive and opportunity.
example.tran: 在这次审讯中，必须证明两个基本因素：动机和时机。

collins.def: The essentials are the most important principles, ideas, or facts of a particular subject.

example.ex: ...the essentials of everyday life, such as eating and exercise...
example.tran: 饮食、锻炼等日常生活的要素

example.ex: This has stripped the contest down to its essentials.
example.tran: 这就使比赛精简到最基本的环节。

collins.def: If one person argues with another, they speak angrily to each other about something that they disagree about. You can also say that two people argue .

example.ex: The committee is concerned about players' behaviour, especially arguing with referees...
example.tran: 委员会很关注运动员的行为，特别是与裁判争吵的行为。

example.ex: They were still arguing; I could hear them down the road.
example.tran: 他们还在争吵；我在马路的那头都能听见他们的声音。

collins.def: If you tell someone not to argue with you, you want them to do or believe what you say without protest or disagreement.

example.ex: Don't argue with me...
example.tran: 别和我争辩。

example.ex: The children go to bed at 10.30. No one dares argue.
example.tran: 孩子们10点半上床睡觉。没有人敢说不。

collins.def: If you argue with someone about something, you discuss it with them, with each of you giving your different opinions.

example.ex: He was arguing with the King about the need to maintain the cavalry at full strength...
example.tran: 他正和国王讨论保留骑兵全部力量的必要性。

example.ex: They are arguing over foreign policy...
example.tran: 他们正就外交政策进行讨论。

collins.def: If you argue that something is true, you state it and give the reasons why you think it is true.

example.ex: His lawyers are arguing that he is unfit to stand trial...
example.tran: 他的律师正在提出理由说明他不适合出庭受审。

example.ex: It could be argued that the British are not aggressive enough.
example.tran: 可以说英国人不够强势。

collins.def: If you argue for something, you say why you agree with it, in order to persuade people that it is right. If you argue against something, you say why you disagree with it, in order to persuade people that it is wrong.

example.ex: The report argues against tax increases...
example.tran: 报告提出理由反对提高税率。

example.ex: I argued the case for an independent central bank.
example.tran: 我支持设立独立的中央银行。

collins.def: If you argue, you support your opinions with evidence in an ordered or logical way.

example.ex: I've argued deductively from the text...
example.tran: 我已依文字作过推理论证。

example.ex: He argued persuasively, and was full of confidence.
example.tran: 他的论证很有说服力，且充满自信。

collins.def: If you say that no-one can argue with a particular fact or opinion, you are emphasizing that it is obviously true and so everyone must accept it.

example.ex: We produced the best soccer of the tournament. Nobody would argue with that.
example.tran: 本届比赛中我们踢出了最漂亮的足球，谁都不会否认这一点。

collins.def: If someone in authority sanctions an action or practice, they officially approve of it and allow it to be done.

example.ex: He may now be ready to sanction the use of force...
example.tran: 他现在可能打算批准使用武力。

example.ex: He seemed to be preparing to sanction an increase in public borrowing.
example.tran: 他似乎正准备批准增加公共贷款。

collins.def: Sanctions are measures taken by countries to restrict trade and official contact with a country that has broken international law.

example.ex: In 1935 the League of Nations imposed sanctions against Italy following its invasion of Ethiopia.
example.tran: 1935 年国际联盟在意大利入侵埃塞俄比亚之后对其实施了制裁。

example.ex: He expressed his opposition to the lifting of sanctions.
example.tran: 他对解除制裁表示反对。

collins.def: A sanction is a severe course of action which is intended to make people obey instructions, customs, or laws.

example.ex: As an ultimate sanction, they can sell their shares.
example.tran: 作为最高的处罚，他们可以出售他们的股份。

collins.def: If a country or an authority sanctions another country or a person for doing something, it declares that the country or person is guilty of doing it and imposes sanctions on them.

example.ex: ...their failure to sanction Japan for butchering whales in violation of international conservation treaties.
example.tran: 对日本违反国际保护条约残杀鲸鱼的行为他们未能进行制裁

means: 反对，表示异议（与 to 或 against连用）

collins.def: You use except to introduce the only thing or person that a statement does not apply to, or a fact that prevents a statement from being completely true.

example.ex: I wouldn't have accepted anything except a job in Europe...
example.tran: 除了到欧洲工作外，我本来什么都不会接受。

example.ex: I don't take any drugs whatsoever, except aspirin for colds...
example.tran: 我什么药都不吃，除了感冒时吃阿司匹林。

collins.def: You use except for to introduce the only thing or person that prevents a statement from being completely true.

example.ex: He hadn't eaten a thing except for one forkful of salad...
example.tran: 除了一餐叉色拉，他什么都没吃。

example.ex: Everyone was late, except for Richard.
example.tran: 除了理查德，其他所有人都迟到了。

collins.def: A studio is a room where a painter, photographer, or designer works.

example.ex: She was in her studio again, painting onto a large canvas.
example.tran: 她又回到了画室，在一张大帆布上作画。

collins.tran: (广播、电视的)录音室，录像室，演播室;(唱片、电影的)录音棚，制作室
collins.def: A studio is a room where radio or television programmes are recorded, CDs are produced, or films are made.

example.ex: She's much happier performing live than in a recording studio.
example.tran: 与在录音棚里录音相比，她更喜欢现场表演。

collins.tran: 电影公司;电影制片厂;唱片公司
collins.def: You can also refer to film-making or recording companies as studios .

example.ex: She wrote to Paramount Studios and asked if they would audition her.
example.tran: 她写信给派拉蒙电影公司，询问他们是否同意让她去试镜。

collins.tran: 单间公寓(一个房间兼作起居室和卧室，带厨房和卫生间)
collins.def: A studio is a small flat with one room for living and sleeping in, a kitchen, and a bathroom. You can also talk about a studio flat in British English or a studio apartment in American English.

example.ex: I live on my own in a studio flat.
example.tran: 我自己住在一个单间公寓里。

collins.def: Your response to an event or to something that is said is your reply or reaction to it.

example.ex: There has been no response to his remarks from the government...
example.tran: 政府尚未对他的言论作出回应。

example.ex: Your positive response will reinforce her actions...
example.tran: 你积极的回应会使她的行为更加坚定。

collins.def: You use generally to give a summary of a situation, activity, or idea without referring to the particular details of it.

example.ex: University teachers generally have admitted a lack of enthusiasm about their subjects...
example.tran: 高校教师大体上承认对其所教专业缺乏热情。

example.ex: Speaking generally, the space enterprise has served astronomy well.
example.tran: 总的说来，航空企业很好地促进了天文学的发展。

collins.def: You use generally to say that something happens or is used on most occasions but not on every occasion.

example.ex: As women we generally say and feel too much about these things...
example.tran: 作为女性，我们通常在这些事情上谈得过多，过于敏锐。

example.ex: It is generally true that the darker the fruit the higher its iron content...
example.tran: 一般来说，水果颜色越深，含铁量就越高。

collins.def: A flower is the part of a plant which is often brightly coloured, grows at the end of a stem, and only survives for a short time.

example.ex: Each individual flower is tiny.
example.tran: 每一朵花都很小。

example.ex: ...large, purplish-blue flowers.
example.tran: 紫蓝色的大花朵

collins.def: A flower is a stem of a plant that has one or more flowers on it and has been picked, usually with others, for example to give as a present or to put in a vase.

example.ex: ...a bunch of flowers sent by a new admirer.
example.tran: 又一个仰慕者送来的一束鲜花

collins.def: Flowers are small plants that are grown for their flowers as opposed to trees, shrubs, and vegetables.

example.ex: ...a lawned area surrounded by plants and flowers...
example.tran: 周围种着植物和花卉的草地

example.ex: The flower garden will be ablaze with colour every day.
example.tran: 花园每天都将开满各色鲜花。

collins.def: When a plant or tree flowers, its flowers appear and open.

example.ex: Several of these rhododendrons will flower this year for the first time.
example.tran: 这些杜鹃花有些将在今年首度开花。

collins.def: When something flowers, for example a political movement or a relationship, it gets stronger and more successful.

example.ex: Their relationship flowered.
example.tran: 他们的关系最终开花结果了。

collins.def: A person or thing that is described as the flower of something is the best part or example of it.

example.ex: Those killed have been described as the flower of Polish manhood.
example.tran: 那些牺牲者被称为波兰男子中的精英。

collins.def: When a plant is in flower or when it has come into flower, its flowers have appeared and opened.

example.ex: Some of the daffodils are still in flower...
example.tran: 有些水仙花仍在开放。

example.ex: As one plant fades, another comes into flower.
example.tran: 一株植物凋谢了，另一株又会盛开。

means: 极艰难[令人沮丧]的经历

collins.def: Murder is the deliberate and illegal killing of a person.

example.ex: The three accused, aged between 19 and 20, are charged with attempted murder...
example.tran: 3个年龄在19到20岁之间的被告被控谋杀未遂。

example.ex: She refused to testify, unless the murder charge against her was dropped.
example.tran: 除非撤销对她的谋杀指控，否则她拒绝作证。

collins.def: To murder someone means to commit the crime of killing them deliberately.

example.ex: ...a thriller about two men who murder a third to see if they can get away with it.
example.tran: 关于两个男人为了看看是否能成功逃脱惩罚而去谋杀另一名男子的惊悚片

example.ex: ...the body of a murdered religious and political leader.
example.tran: 被谋杀的宗教和政治领袖的尸体

collins.tran: (做坏事而)安然无恙，逍遥法外，为所欲为
collins.def: If you say that someone gets away with murder, you are complaining that they can do whatever they like without anyone trying to control them or punish them.

example.ex: His charm and the fact that he is so likeable often allows him to get away with murder.
example.tran: 他很有魅力而且讨人喜欢，这常让他能够为所欲为。

collins.tran: (对不喜欢的东西)大惊小怪地拼命叫嚷
collins.def: If you say that someone screams blue murder or screams bloody murder, you are emphasizing that they are making a lot of noise or fuss about something that they do not like.

example.ex: People are screaming blue murder about the amount of traffic going through their town.
example.tran: 人们对着那些穿越他们城市的川流不息的车辆大呼小叫。

collins.def: If you refer to a couple of people or things, you mean two or approximately two of them, although the exact number is not important or you are not sure of it.

example.ex: Across the street from me there are a couple of police officers standing guard...
example.tran: 我对面的街上有几名警官在站岗。

example.ex: I think the trouble will clear up in a couple of days.
example.tran: 我想问题几天内就会解决。

collins.def: A couple is two people who are married, living together, or having a sexual relationship.

example.ex: The couple have no children.
example.tran: 这对夫妻没有孩子。

example.ex: ...after burglars ransacked an elderly couple's home.
example.tran: 窃贼洗劫了一对老夫妇的家之后

collins.tran: (在某种场合在一起或有某种关系的)一对人，两个人
collins.def: A couple is two people that you see together on a particular occasion or that have some association.

example.ex: ...as the four couples began the opening dance...
example.tran: 4对舞伴开始跳开场舞的时候

example.ex: They were an odd couple.
example.tran: 他们是奇怪的一对。

collins.def: If you say that one thing produces a particular effect when it is coupled with another, you mean that the two things combine to produce that effect.

example.ex: ...a problem that is coupled with lower demand for the machines themselves...
example.tran: 这个问题外加上对机器本身需求量的下降

example.ex: Overuse of those drugs, coupled with poor diet, leads to physical degeneration...
example.tran: 过量使用那些药物再加上饮食缺乏营养，导致健康状况恶化。

collins.def: If one piece of equipment is coupled to another, it is joined to it so that the two pieces of equipment work together.

example.ex: Its engine is coupled to a semiautomatic gearbox...
example.tran: 它的发动机与一个半自动变速箱相连接。

example.ex: The various systems are coupled together in complex arrays.
example.tran: 多个系统在复杂的数组中连接起来。

collins.def: The maker of a product is the firm that manufactures it.

example.ex: ...Japan's two largest car makers.
example.tran: 日本最大的两家汽车制造商

example.ex: ...the makers of chocolates, sweets and biscuits.
example.tran: 巧克力、糖果和饼干生产商

collins.def: You can refer to the person who makes something as its maker .

example.ex: ...the makers of news and current affairs programmes.
example.tran: 新闻和时事节目制作人

collins.tran: 民主党党员;民主党支持者
collins.def: A Democrat is a member or supporter of a particular political party which has the word 'democrat' or 'democratic' in its title, for example the Democratic Party in the United States.

example.ex: ...a senior Christian Democrat...
example.tran: 资深的基督教民主党党员

example.ex: Congressman Tom Downey is a Democrat from New York.
example.tran: 国会议员汤姆·唐尼是来自纽约州的一名民主党人。

collins.def: A democrat is a person who believes in the ideals of democracy, personal freedom, and equality.

example.ex: This is the time for democrats and not dictators.
example.tran: 现在需要的是民主主义者，而不是独裁者。

collins.def: Someone's property is all the things that belong to them or something that belongs to them.

example.ex: Richard could easily destroy her personal property to punish her for walking out on him...
example.tran: 理查德能轻易毁掉她的私人财产来惩罚她对他的背叛。

example.ex: Security forces searched thousands of homes, confiscating weapons and stolen property.
example.tran: 安全部队搜查了数千所住宅，没收了武器和赃物。

collins.def: A property is a building and the land belonging to it.

example.ex: Cecil inherited a family property near Stamford...
example.tran: 塞西尔继承了斯坦福德附近的一处家族房产。

example.ex: This vehicle has been parked on private property.
example.tran: 这辆车停在了私人地产上。

collins.def: The properties of a substance or object are the ways in which it behaves in particular conditions.

example.ex: A radio signal has both electrical and magnetic properties.
example.tran: 无线电信号具有电、磁双重属性。

collins.def: You use certainly to emphasize what you are saying when you are making a statement.

example.ex: The public is certainly getting tired of hearing about it...
example.tran: 关于此事，公众当然已经听腻了。

example.ex: The bombs are almost certainly part of a much bigger conspiracy...
example.tran: 几乎可以肯定，这些炸弹是一个更大的阴谋的一部分。

collins.def: You use certainly when you are agreeing with what someone has said.

example.ex: 'In any case you remained friends.' — 'Certainly.'...
example.tran: “无论如何，你们都是好朋友吧。”——“那当然。”

example.ex: 'You keep out of their way don't you?' — 'I certainly do.'
example.tran: “你会离他们远远的，是吧？”——“一点儿不假。”

collins.def: You say certainly not when you want to say 'no' in a strong way.

example.ex: 'Perhaps it would be better if I withdrew altogether.' — 'Certainly not!'
example.tran: “也许，我完全退出更好吧。”——“当然不是！”

collins.def: Someone who is a citizen of a particular country is legally accepted as belonging to that country.

example.ex: ...American citizens...
example.tran: 美国公民

example.ex: The life of ordinary citizens began to change.
example.tran: 老百姓的生活开始发生变化。

collins.def: The citizens of a town or city are the people who live there.

example.ex: ...the citizens of Buenos Aires.
example.tran: 布宜诺斯艾利斯的市民

collins.tran: 民主的;民主制度的;民主政体的
collins.def: A democratic country, government, or political system is governed by representatives who are elected by the people.

example.ex: Bolivia returned to democratic rule in 1982, after a series of military governments.
example.tran: 在经历了数届军人政府后，玻利维亚于 1982 年恢复了民主政权。

example.ex: ...the country's first democratic elections.
example.tran: 该国的首次民主选举

collins.tran: 民主精神的;民主作风的
collins.def: Something that is democratic is based on the idea that everyone should have equal rights and should be involved in making important decisions.

example.ex: Education is the basis of a democratic society...
example.tran: 教育是民主社会的基础。

example.ex: He called for widespread changes to make the armed forces more democratic and less expensive.
example.tran: 他呼吁进行广泛的改革，使武装部队作风更加民主，开支更加俭省。

collins.def: Democratic is used in the titles of some political parties.

example.ex: ...the Social Democratic Party.
example.tran: 社会民主党

example.ex: ...the People's Democratic Party of Afghanistan...
example.tran: 阿富汗人民民主党

collins.def: If you check something such as a piece of information or a document, you make sure that it is correct or satisfactory.

example.ex: Check the accuracy of everything in your CV...
example.tran: 请核对简历中的每个细节，务必准确无误。

example.ex: It's worth checking each item for obvious flaws...
example.tran: 有必要逐件检查一下是否有明显的瑕疵。

collins.tran: 检查，查看(以确保一切正常)
collins.def: If you check on someone or something, you make sure they are in a safe or satisfactory condition.

example.ex: Stephen checked on her several times during the night...
example.tran: 斯蒂芬夜里起来看了她好几遍。

example.ex: He decided to check on things at the warehouse.
example.tran: 他决定去仓库查看一下。

collins.tran: 在…上打钩（以确定其正确、已选定或已处理）
collins.def: If you check something that is written on a piece of paper, you put a mark, like a V with the right side extended, next to it to show that something is correct or has been selected or dealt with.

example.ex: Frequently, men who check answer (b) have not actually had the experience of being repeatedly rejected by women.
example.tran: 多数情况下，选(b)的男人没有真的尝过三番五次被女人拒绝的滋味。

collins.def: To check something, usually something bad, means to stop it from spreading or continuing.

example.ex: Sex education is also expected to help check the spread of AIDS.
example.tran: 人们还希望性教育有助于控制艾滋病的蔓延。

example.ex: ...free press that will check corruption by ensuring total transparency in government.
example.tran: 通过确保政府行政完全透明来抑制腐败的新闻自由

collins.def: If you check yourself or if something checks you, you suddenly stop what you are doing or saying.

example.ex: He was about to lose his temper but checked himself in time...
example.tran: 他刚要发火，不过又及时克制住了。

example.ex: I held up one finger to check him.
example.tran: 我竖起一根手指头制止了他。

collins.def: When you check your luggage at an airport, you give it to an official so that it can be taken on to your plane.

example.ex: We arrived at the airport, checked our baggage and wandered around the gift shops...
example.tran: 我们到了机场，托运了行李，到礼品店里逛了逛。

example.ex: You can check your baggage right through to its final destination.
example.tran: 你可以把行李直接托运到终点。

collins.def: The check in a restaurant is a piece of paper on which the price of your meal is written and which you are given before you pay.
In a game of chess, you say check when you are attacking your opponent's king.

collins.tran: (通常为两种颜色的)方格图案，格子图案
collins.def: A pattern of squares, usually of two colours, can be referred to as checks or a check .

example.ex: Styles include stripes and checks.
example.tran: 款式包括条纹的和格子的。

example.ex: ...a red and white check dress.
example.tran: 红白相间的格子连衣裙

collins.tran: 受到控制的；被控制住的
collins.def: If something or someone is held in check or is kept in check, they are controlled and prevented from becoming too great or powerful.

example.ex: Life on Earth will become unsustainable unless population growth is held in check...
example.tran: 人口增长要是不加控制的话，地球上的生命将无法持续发展。

example.ex: He's found someone with a bit of fight to keep him in check.
example.tran: 他发现有个厉害的主儿能镇住他了。

collins.def: A check is the same as a cheque .

means: 用双手触摸、举起或握住

collins.def: A handle is a small round object or a lever that is attached to a door and is used for opening and closing it.

example.ex: I turned the handle and found the door was open.
example.tran: 我转了一下门把手，发现门开着。

collins.def: A handle is the part of an object such as a tool, bag, or cup that you hold in order to be able to pick up and use the object.

example.ex: The handle of a cricket bat protruded from under his arm.
example.tran: 一个板球拍柄从他的胳肢窝下面伸了出来。

example.ex: ...a broom handle.
example.tran: 扫帚柄

collins.tran: 有能力应付;（成功地）处理
collins.def: If you say that someone can handle a problem or situation, you mean that they have the ability to deal with it successfully.

example.ex: To tell the truth, I don't know if I can handle the job...
example.tran: 说实话，我不知道自己是否能做好这份工作。

example.ex: She cannot handle pressure...
example.tran: 她承受不了压力。

collins.def: If you talk about the way that someone handles a problem or situation, you mention whether or not they are successful in achieving the result they want.

example.ex: I think I would handle a meeting with Mr. Siegel very badly...
example.tran: 我觉得和西格尔先生会谈我可能会搞得一团糟。

example.ex: She admitted to herself she didn't know how to handle the problem.
example.tran: 她心里承认自己不知道该如何处理这个问题。

collins.def: If you handle a particular area of work, you have responsibility for it.

example.ex: She handled travel arrangements for the press corps during the presidential campaign...
example.tran: 她负责了总统竞选活动期间新闻报道团的行程安排。

example.ex: The investigation is being handled by Scotland Yard's anti-terrorist branch.
example.tran: 调查由伦敦警察厅反恐部门负责。

collins.tran: 使用，操纵（武器、车辆等）;训练，使唤（动物）
collins.def: When you handle something such as a weapon, vehicle, or animal, you use it or control it, especially by using your hands.

example.ex: I had never handled an automatic.
example.tran: 我从未用过自动手枪。

collins.def: If something such as a vehicle handles well, it is easy to use or control.

example.ex: His ship had handled like a dream!
example.tran: 他的船操纵起来非常灵便。

collins.def: When you handle something, you hold it or move it with your hands.

example.ex: Wear rubber gloves when handling cat litter.
example.tran: 清理猫粪时要带上橡胶手套。

collins.def: If you have a handle on a subject or problem, you have a way of approaching it that helps you to understand it or deal with it.

example.ex: When you have got a handle on your anxiety you can begin to control it.
example.tran: 一旦了解了自己焦虑的原因，你就开始能控制它了。

collins.def: If you fly off the handle, you suddenly and completely lose your temper.

example.ex: He flew off the handle at the slightest thing.
example.tran: 他为一点小事就大发脾气。

collins.def: Your boss is the person in charge of the organization or department where you work.

example.ex: He cannot stand his boss...
example.tran: 他无法忍受他的老板。

example.ex: Occasionally I have to go and ask the boss for a rise.
example.tran: 有时我不得不找老板要求加薪。

collins.def: If you are the boss in a group or relationship, you are the person who makes all the decisions.

example.ex: He thinks he's the boss.
example.tran: 他认为自己是头儿。

collins.tran: 对…颐指气使；对…指手画脚
collins.def: If you say that someone bosses you, you mean that they keep telling you what to do in a way that is irritating.

example.ex: We cannot boss them into doing more...
example.tran: 我们不能再差遣他们做更多的事了。

example.ex: 'You are not to boss me!' she shouted.
example.tran: “你不能指挥我！”她喊道。

collins.tran: 为自己打工；自己拿主意
collins.def: If you are your own boss, you work for yourself or make your own decisions and do not have anyone telling you what to do.

example.ex: I'm very much my own boss and no one interferes with what I do.
example.tran: 我自己很有主见，没有人干预我做的事。

collins.def: Glass is a hard transparent substance that is used to make things such as windows and bottles.

example.ex: ...a pane of glass.
example.tran: 一块玻璃

example.ex: ...a sliding glass door.
example.tran: 玻璃推拉门

collins.def: A glass is a container made from glass, which you can drink from and which does not have a handle.

example.ex: Grossman raised the glass to his lips.
example.tran: 格罗斯曼把杯子举到唇边。

collins.def: Glass is used to mean objects made of glass, for example drinking containers and bowls.

example.ex: There's a glittering array of glass to choose from at markets.
example.tran: 市场上有很多晶莹闪亮的玻璃制品可供挑选。

collins.def: Glasses are two lenses in a frame that some people wear in front of their eyes in order to help them see better.

example.ex: He took off his glasses.
example.tran: 他摘掉眼镜。

collins.def: Wood is the material which forms the trunks and branches of trees.

example.ex: Their dishes were made of wood...
example.tran: 他们的盘子是木制的。

example.ex: There was a smell of damp wood and machine oil.
example.tran: 有潮湿的木料和机油的气味。

collins.tran: 树林，林子（美国英语通常用woods）
collins.def: A wood is a fairly large area of trees growing near each other. You can refer to one or several of these areas as woods, and this is the usual form in American English.

example.ex: After dinner Alice slipped away for a walk in the woods with Artie...
example.tran: 晚餐后艾利斯溜出去跟阿蒂到林子里散步。

example.ex: About a mile to the west of town he came upon a large wood.
example.tran: 他在镇子以西约一英里处偶遇一大片林地。

collins.def: If something or someone is not out of the woods yet, they are still having difficulties or problems.

example.ex: The nation's economy is not out of the woods yet.
example.tran: 该国经济尚未摆脱困境。

collins.tran: 上天保佑(表示希望继续走好运)
collins.def: You can say 'touch wood' in British English, or 'knock on wood' in American English, to indicate that you hope to have good luck in something you are doing, usually after saying that you have been lucky with it so far.

example.ex: She's never even been to the doctor's, touch wood...
example.tran: 她从未看过病，希望她一直好运。

example.ex: Touch wood, I've been lucky enough to avoid any other serious injuries.
example.tran: 老天保佑，我一直很幸运，别的重伤都躲过了。

means: [组]联合国，成立于1945年，致力于推动国际社会的和平稳定

collins.def: The UN is the same as the United Nations .

example.ex: ...a UN peace-keeping mission.
example.tran: 联合国维和行动

collins.def: You use in addition when you want to mention another item connected with the subject you are discussing.

example.ex: Part-time English classes are offered. In addition, students can take classes in word-processing and computing...
example.tran: 开设了非全日制的英语班。另外，学生可以修读文字处理和计算机课程。

example.ex: There's a postage and packing fee in addition to the repair charge.
example.tran: 除修理费之外还有邮寄和包装费。

collins.def: An addition to something is a thing which is added to it.

example.ex: This is a fine book; a worthy addition to the Cambridge Encyclopedia series...
example.tran: 这是一本好书，对剑桥百科全书系列是一个很好的补充。

example.ex: This plywood addition helps to strengthen the structure.
example.tran: 多层胶合板有助于加固结构。

collins.def: The addition of something is the fact that it is added to something else.

example.ex: It was completely refurbished in 1987, with the addition of a picnic site.
example.tran: 它在1987年经过了彻底翻修，加盖了一个野餐点。

collins.def: Addition is the process of calculating the total of two or more numbers.

example.ex: ...simple addition and subtraction problems.
example.tran: 简单的加减题

collins.def: A sharp point or edge is very thin and can cut through things very easily. A sharp knife, tool, or other object has a point or edge of this kind.

example.ex: The other end of the twig is sharpened into a sharp point to use as a toothpick...
example.tran: 细枝的另一端被削尖用作牙签。

example.ex: Using a sharp knife, cut away the pith and peel from both fruits...
example.tran: 用一把锋利的刀削去两种水果的外皮和中果皮。

collins.def: You can describe a shape or an object as sharp if part of it or one end of it comes to a point or forms an angle.

example.ex: His nose was thin and sharp.
example.tran: 他的鼻子又细又尖。

example.ex: ...black sharp-toed cowboy boots.
example.tran: 黑色尖头牛仔靴

collins.def: A sharp bend or turn is one that changes direction suddenly.

example.ex: I was approaching a fairly sharp bend that swept downhill to the left.
example.tran: 我正驶向下坡路上一个突然向左的急转弯。

collins.tran: (人)敏锐的，灵敏的，敏捷的，机灵的
collins.def: If you describe someone as sharp, you are praising them because they are quick to notice, hear, understand, or react to things.

example.ex: He is very sharp, a quick thinker and swift with repartee...
example.tran: 他非常机敏，反应很快，并且能说会道。

example.ex: Gates is known to be a superb analyst with a sharp eye and an excellent memory.
example.tran: 盖茨是公认的杰出分析家，他目光敏锐且记忆力超群。

collins.tran: (言辞)激烈的，尖锐的，尖刻的，严厉的
collins.def: If someone says something in a sharp way, they say it suddenly and rather firmly or angrily, for example because they are warning or criticizing you.

example.ex: 'Don't contradict your mother,' was Charles's sharp reprimand...
example.tran: “不要和你妈妈顶嘴，”查尔斯严厉地斥责道。

example.ex: That ruling had drawn sharp criticism from civil rights groups.
example.tran: 那项判决已遭到了民权组织的严厉批评。

collins.tran: (变化、动作、感情等)急剧的，骤然的，大幅度的，强烈的
collins.def: A sharp change, movement, or feeling occurs suddenly, and is great in amount, force, or degree.

example.ex: There's been a sharp rise in the rate of inflation...
example.tran: 通货膨胀率已大幅上升。

example.ex: Tennis requires a lot of short sharp movements...
example.tran: 打网球需要做大量快速而剧烈的动作。

collins.tran: (差异)明显的，鲜明的;(图像、声音等)清晰的
collins.def: A sharp difference, image, or sound is very easy to see, hear, or distinguish.

example.ex: Many people make a sharp distinction between humans and other animals...
example.tran: 很多人认为人类和其他动物截然不同。

example.ex: Her reticence was in sharp contrast to the glamour and star status of her predecessors...
example.tran: 她的寡言少语和前任们的光鲜亮丽、明星范儿十足形成了鲜明的对比。

collins.tran: (味道或气味)强烈的，苦的，冲的
collins.def: A sharp taste or smell is rather strong or bitter, but is often also clear and fresh.

example.ex: ...a colourless, almost odourless liquid with a sharp, sweetish taste...
example.tran: 一种几乎无气味的无色液体,尝起来微甜，味道很冲

example.ex: In the hot sun the rain-washed herbs smelled sharp and spicy and sweet all at once.
example.tran: 烈日下，被雨水冲刷过的香草闻起来既冲又香气扑鼻。

collins.def: A sharp wind, or sharp cold, is so strong or intense that it almost hurts you when you are exposed to it.

example.ex: The wind was not as sharp and cruel as it had been.
example.tran: 风不像刚才那么凛冽和凶猛了。

collins.def: Sharp clothes are neat, elegant, and fashionable.

example.ex: Now politics is all about the right haircut and a sharp suit...
example.tran: 现在政界讲究的无非是合适的发型和时髦的衣着。

example.ex: A sharp dresser, Wyatt is never seen in casual clothes.
example.tran: 怀亚特衣着入时，从未有人见过他穿便装。

collins.def: Sharp is used after stating a particular time to show that something happens at exactly the time stated.

example.ex: She planned to unlock the store at 8.00 sharp this morning.
example.tran: 她打算今天早上 8 点整准时开门营业。

collins.tran: (用于音符后)升半音的(常用＃符号表示)
collins.def: Sharp is used after a letter representing a musical note to show that the note should be played or sung half a tone higher. Sharp is often represented by the symbol #.

example.ex: A solitary viola plucks a lonely, soft F sharp.
example.tran: 一把中提琴独自奏出了一个寂寞柔和的升F 调。

collins.tran: (活动或工作中)最困难的部分，最危险的部分
collins.def: If you say that someone is at the sharp end of a particular activity or type of work, you mean that they are involved in the most difficult or dangerous aspects of it.

example.ex: Vincent French is a real estate broker at the sharp end of a tough and exacting business...
example.tran: 文森特·弗伦奇在房地产这个艰难行业做了最吃苦受累的不动产经纪人。

example.ex: Working at the sharp end, many of us have noted an increase in the number of patients attending surgeries.
example.tran: 从事一线工作，我们很多人已经注意到来做手术的病人越来越多。

means: [高尔夫球]多于对方的一次击球

collins.tran: 奇怪的；古怪的；奇特的；异常的
collins.def: If you describe someone or something as odd, you think that they are strange or unusual.

example.ex: He'd always been odd, but not to this extent...
example.tran: 他一直比较怪异，不过并没有到这种程度。

example.ex: What an odd coincidence that he should have known your family...
example.tran: 他居然认识你的家人，真是太巧了。

collins.tran: （用于名词前）少量的，微小的，不重要的
collins.def: You use odd before a noun to indicate that you are not mentioning the type, size, or quality of something because it is not important.

example.ex: ...moving from place to place where she could find the odd bit of work...
example.tran: 她为了找到点儿零散活计不断地搬来搬去

example.ex: He had various odd cleaning jobs around the place...
example.tran: 他在这附近干过各种零碎的保洁工作。

collins.def: You use odd after a number to indicate that it is only approximate.

example.ex: How many pages was it, 500 odd?...
example.tran: 这有多少页，500来页？

example.ex: He has now appeared in sixty odd films...
example.tran: 他迄今演过60多部影片。

collins.def: Odd numbers, such as 3 and 17, are those which cannot be divided exactly by the number two.

example.ex: The odd numbers are on the left as you walk up the street...
example.tran: 沿这条街走，在左边的是单号。

example.ex: There's an odd number of candidates.
example.tran: 候选人总数为单数。

collins.tran: 不同类的；不成对的；单只的
collins.def: You say that two things are odd when they do not belong to the same set or pair.

example.ex: I'm wearing odd socks today by the way.
example.tran: 顺便提一下，我今天穿的袜子不成对。

collins.tran: 与集体不合的人；剩下孤零零的一人；异类
collins.def: The odd man out ,the odd woman out, or the odd one out in a particular situation is a person who is different from the other people in it.

example.ex: Azerbaijan has been the odd man out, the one republic not to hold democratic elections...
example.tran: 阿塞拜疆没有举行民主选举，是这些共和国中的异类。

example.ex: Mark and Rick were the odd ones out in claiming to like this cherry beer.
example.tran: 只剩下马克和里克声称喜欢喝这种樱桃啤酒。

collins.tran: 紧急事件;意外事件;（尤指）事故
collins.def: An emergency is an unexpected and difficult or dangerous situation, especially an accident, which happens suddenly and which requires quick action to deal with it.

example.ex: He deals with emergencies promptly...
example.tran: 他迅速处理突发事件。

example.ex: The hospital will cater only for emergencies.
example.tran: 那家医院只看急诊。

collins.def: An emergency action is one that is done or arranged quickly and not in the normal way, because an emergency has occurred.

example.ex: The Prime Minister has called an emergency meeting of parliament...
example.tran: 首相已召集议会召开紧急会议。

example.ex: She made an emergency appointment.
example.tran: 她挂了急诊。

collins.tran: （设备、供应品等）救急用的，应急的
collins.def: Emergency equipment or supplies are those intended for use in an emergency.

example.ex: The plane is carrying emergency supplies for refugees...
example.tran: 那架飞机正在为难民运送应急物资。

example.ex: They escaped through an emergency exit and called the police.
example.tran: 他们从紧急出口逃脱，并报了警。

collins.def: If you repeat something, you say or write it again. You can say I repeat to show that you feel strongly about what you are repeating.

example.ex: He repeated that he had been misquoted...
example.tran: 他反复说他的话被错误引用了。

example.ex: I repeat that medicine is on the brink of a revolution...
example.tran: 我要再次强调，医学面临着变革。

collins.def: If you repeat something that someone else has said or written, you say or write the same thing, or tell it to another person.

example.ex: She had an irritating habit of repeating everything I said to her...
example.tran: 她有个惹人讨厌的习惯，我跟她说的每一件事她都告诉别人。

example.ex: I trust you not to repeat that to anyone else...
example.tran: 我相信你不会把我的话告诉别人。

collins.def: If you repeat yourself, you say something which you have said before, usually by mistake.

example.ex: Then he started rambling and repeating himself.
example.tran: 他接下来就开始不着边际、说话来回重复了。

collins.def: People sometimes say repeat before saying again a word they have just said, in order to emphasize it or to make sure that people hear it.

example.ex: We are not, I repeat, not actually in the negotiating process...
example.tran: 我们不是，我重申一下，实际上不是在进行谈判。

example.ex: Find and destroy, repeat destroy, these units.
example.tran: 找到并且销毁，重复一下，销毁这些部件。

collins.def: If you repeat an action, you do it again.

example.ex: The next day I repeated the procedure...
example.tran: 第二天我重复了这个程序。

example.ex: He said Japan would never repeat its mistakes...
example.tran: 他说日本永远不会再犯同样的错误。

collins.def: If an event or series of events repeats itself, it happens again.

example.ex: The UN will have to work hard to stop history repeating itself...
example.tran: 联合国必须努力避免历史重演。

example.ex: The cycle then repeats itself.
example.tran: 这个循环周而复始。

collins.tran: (通常指令人不快的事件的)再次发生
collins.def: If there is a repeat of an event, usually an undesirable event, it happens again.

example.ex: There were fears that there might be a repeat of last year's campaign of strikes.
example.tran: 有人担心去年的罢工运动可能再次重演。

example.ex: ...in order to prevent a repeat tragedy.
example.tran: 为了防止悲剧的再次发生

collins.def: If a company gets repeat business or repeat customers, people who have bought their goods or services before buy them again.

example.ex: Nearly 60% of our bookings come from repeat business and personal recommendation.
example.tran: 我们近60%的订单来自于回头客和熟人介绍。

collins.def: A repeat is a television or radio programme that has been broadcast before.

example.ex: There's nothing except sport and repeats on TV.
example.tran: 除了体育节目和重播节目外，电视上没什么新鲜内容。

collins.tran: （通常指令人不快的事件的）再次出现，再次发生
collins.def: If there is a repeat performance of something, usually something undesirable, it happens again.

example.ex: This year can only see a repeat performance of the decline.
example.tran: 今年还会出现下降。

collins.def: When something rolls or when you roll it, it moves along a surface, turning over many times.

example.ex: The ball rolled into the net...
example.tran: 球滚进了网中。

example.ex: Their car went off the road and rolled over...
example.tran: 他们的车冲出公路，翻倒在一旁。

collins.def: If you roll somewhere, you move on a surface while lying down, turning your body over and over, so that you are sometimes on your back, sometimes on your side, and sometimes on your front.

example.ex: When I was a little kid I rolled down a hill and broke my leg...
example.tran: 我小时候从一座山坡上滚了下来，把腿摔断了。

example.ex: They just rolled about on the floor punching each other like schoolboys...
example.tran: 他们像小学生一样，在地板上滚来滚去，互相挥着拳头揍对方。

collins.def: When vehicles roll along, they move along slowly.

example.ex: The lorry quietly rolled forward.
example.tran: 卡车静静地缓慢前行。

collins.def: If a machine rolls, it is operating.

example.ex: He slipped and fell on an airplane gangway as the cameras rolled...
example.tran: 在摄像时他不慎滑倒在飞机座位间的通道上。

example.ex: The newspaper presses are rolling in Pittsburgh again today.
example.tran: 今天，匹兹堡的报纸又开始印刷了。

collins.def: If drops of liquid roll down a surface, they move quickly down it.

example.ex: She looked at Ginny and tears rolled down her cheeks.
example.tran: 她看着金尼，泪水滑落脸庞。

collins.def: If you roll something flexible into a cylinder or a ball, you form it into a cylinder or a ball by wrapping it several times around itself or by shaping it between your hands.

example.ex: He took off his sweater, rolled it into a pillow and lay down on the grass...
example.tran: 他脱下毛衣，将它卷成一个枕头，然后在草地上躺了下来。

example.ex: He rolled and lit another cigarette.
example.tran: 他又卷了一支烟并点着了。

collins.def: A roll of paper, plastic, cloth, or wire is a long piece of it that has been wrapped many times around itself or around a tube.

example.ex: The photographers had already shot a dozen rolls of film.
example.tran: 摄影师们已经照了一打胶卷了。

example.ex: ...a roll of blue insulated wire.
example.tran: 一卷蓝色的绝缘电线

collins.def: If you roll up something such as a car window or a blind, you cause it to move upwards by turning a handle. If you roll it down, you cause it to move downwards by turning a handle.

example.ex: In mid-afternoon, shopkeepers began to roll down their shutters...
example.tran: 下午三时左右，店主们开始放下百叶窗。

example.ex: She rolled up the window and drove on...
example.tran: 她把车窗摇上来，继续开车。

collins.tran: 转动(眼睛)；(眼珠)骨碌碌地转
collins.def: If you roll your eyes or if your eyes roll, they move round and upwards. People sometimes roll their eyes when they are frightened, bored, or annoyed.

example.ex: People may roll their eyes and talk about overprotective, interfering grandmothers...
example.tran: 人们可能会翻着白眼谈论那些溺爱儿孙、样样都要插手的祖母。

example.ex: His eyes rolled and he sobbed.
example.tran: 他转了转眼睛，呜咽起来。

collins.def: A roll is a small piece of bread that is round or long and is made to be eaten by one person. Rolls can be eaten plain, with butter, or with a filling.

example.ex: He spread butter on a roll.
example.tran: 他把黄油抹在小圆面包上。

collins.tran: （鼓的）咚咚声,隆隆声,持续的轰鸣声
collins.def: A roll of drums is a long, low, fairly loud sound made by drums.

example.ex: As the town clock struck two, they heard the roll of drums.
example.tran: 当小镇的时钟敲响两点钟时，他们听到了隆隆的鼓声。

collins.def: A roll is an official list of people's names.

example.ex: ...the electoral roll.
example.tran: 选民名单

collins.def: If someone is on a roll, they are having great success which seems likely to continue.

example.ex: I made a name for myself and I was on a roll, I couldn't see anything going wrong.
example.tran: 我靠自己的能力成名了，接二连三地获得成功，我觉得一切似乎一帆风顺。

collins.def: If you say roll on something, you mean that you would like it to come soon, because you are looking forward to it.

example.ex: Roll on the day someone develops an effective vaccine against malaria.
example.tran: 盼望有一天有人会研制出一种能有效预防疟疾的疫苗。

collins.def: If something is several things rolled into one, it combines the main features or qualities of those things.

example.ex: Experts claimed that teachers had to be Einstein, Marie Curie and Linford Christie rolled into one to help children grasp the new national curriculum...
example.tran: 专家们称老师必须集爱因斯坦、居里夫人和林弗德·克里斯蒂的本领于一身，才能帮助孩子们掌握新的国家课程大纲。

example.ex: This is our kitchen, sitting and dining room all rolled into one.
example.tran: 这既是我们的厨房，又是客厅和餐厅。

collins.def: The title of a book, play, film, or piece of music is its name.

example.ex: 'Patience and Sarah' was first published in 1969 under the title 'A Place for Us'.
example.tran: 《佩兴丝与萨拉》一书最初于1969年出版时以《属于我们的地方》为名。

collins.def: When a writer, composer, or artist titles a work, they give it a title.

example.ex: Pirandello titled his play 'Six Characters in Search of an Author'...
example.tran: 皮兰德娄把他的戏剧命名为《六个寻找作者的剧中人》。

example.ex: The single is titled 'White Love'...
example.tran: 单曲名为《白色爱情》。

collins.def: Publishers and booksellers often refer to books or magazines as titles .

example.ex: It has become the biggest publisher of new poetry in Britain, with 50 new titles a year.
example.tran: 它成为英国最大的新诗出版商，每年推出新书 50 种。

collins.def: A person's title is a word such as 'Sir', 'Lord', or 'Lady' that is used in front of their name, or a phrase that is used instead of their name, and indicates that they have a high rank in society.

example.ex: Her husband was also honoured with his title 'Sir Denis'...
example.tran: 她丈夫也被封为“丹尼斯爵士”。

example.ex: Princess Alexandra was to inherit the title of Duchess of Fife…
example.tran: 亚历山德拉公主将会继承法夫女公爵的爵位。

collins.def: Someone's title is a word such as 'Mr', 'Mrs', or 'Doctor', that is used before their own name in order to show their status or profession.

example.ex: She has been awarded the title Professor.
example.tran: 她已被授予教授职称。

collins.def: Someone's title is a name that describes their job or status in an organization.

example.ex: He was given the title of deputy prime minister…
example.tran: 他被授予副总理之职。

example.ex: 'Could you tell me your official job title?' — 'It's Data Processing Manager.'
example.tran: “能告诉我您的正式职务名称吗？”——“数据处理部经理。”

collins.def: If a person or team wins a particular title, they win a sports competition that is held regularly. Usually a person keeps a title until someone else defeats them.

example.ex: He became Jamaica's first Olympic gold medallist when he won the 400m title in 1948...
example.tran: 他 1948 年赢得 400 米冠军，成为牙买加第一位奥运会金牌得主。

example.ex: Gary Kasparov has retained his title as world chess champion.
example.tran: 加雷·卡斯帕罗夫卫冕了他国际象棋世界冠军的称号。

collins.def: Title is the legal ownership of something, especially land or property.

example.ex: He never had title to the property.
example.tran: 他从来就不具有这项财产的所有权。

collins.tran: 有利条件；有利因素；优势
collins.def: An advantage is something that puts you in a better position than other people.

example.ex: They are deliberately flouting the law in order to obtain an advantage over their competitors...
example.tran: 他们为了和竞争对手抢夺先机而公然无视法律。

example.ex: A good crowd will be a definite advantage to me and the rest of the team.
example.tran: 大批观众无疑将成为我和其他队员的一大优势。

collins.def: Advantage is the state of being in a better position than others who are competing against you.

example.ex: Men have created a social and economic position of advantage for themselves over women.
example.tran: 男性已经为自己创造了优于女性的社会和经济上的有利地位。

collins.def: An advantage is a way in which one thing is better than another.

example.ex: The great advantage of home-grown oranges is their magnificent flavour...
example.tran: 家产柑橘的一大好处是口感极佳。

example.ex: This custom-built kitchen has many advantages over a standard one.
example.tran: 这间定制的厨房与标准厨房相比存在诸多优点。

collins.def: If you take advantage of something, you make good use of it while you can.

example.ex: I intend to take full advantage of this trip to buy the things we need.
example.tran: 我打算充分利用这次旅行来购买我们所需的物品。

collins.def: If someone takes advantage of you, they treat you unfairly for their own benefit, especially when you are trying to be kind or to help them.

example.ex: She took advantage of him even after they were divorced.
example.tran: 甚至在他们离婚后，她还在占他的便宜。

collins.tran: （尤指转变不利情况使之）对…有利
collins.def: If you use or turn something to your advantage, you use it in order to benefit from it, especially when it might be expected to harm or damage you.

example.ex: The government have not been able to turn today's demonstration to their advantage.
example.tran: 政府未能把今天的游行示威转为己用。

collins.tran: 最有利地；最有效地；使优点突出
collins.def: If something is shown to good advantage or to best advantage, it is shown in a way that reveals its best features.

example.ex: The walls were painted in muted tones to show the pictures to good advantage.
example.tran: 墙面被漆成了淡色调，以突出照片。

collins.def: In Britain and some other countries, a ministry is a government department which deals with a particular thing or area of activity, for example trade, defence, or transport.

example.ex: ...the Ministry of Justice.
example.tran: 司法部

example.ex: ...a spokesman for the Agriculture Ministry.
example.tran: 农业部发言人

collins.def: The ministry of a religious person is the work that they do that is based on or inspired by their religious beliefs.

example.ex: His ministry is among the poor.
example.tran: 他是穷人的牧师。

collins.def: Members of the clergy belonging to some branches of the Christian church are referred to as the ministry.

example.ex: So what prompted him to enter the ministry?
example.tran: 那么，是什么促使他成为牧师的呢？

collins.def: If you pick a particular person or thing, you choose that one.

example.ex: Mr Nowell had picked ten people to interview for six sales jobs in London...
example.tran: 诺埃尔先生为伦敦的6个销售职位选出了10人进行面试。

example.ex: I had deliberately picked a city with a tropical climate.
example.tran: 我特意选了一个热带气候的城市。

collins.def: You can refer to the best things or people in a particular group as the pick of that group.

example.ex: The boys here are the pick of the under-15 cricketers in the country...
example.tran: 这儿的男孩是全国15岁以下板球手中的佼佼者。

example.ex: We had the pick of suits from the shop.
example.tran: 我们买了店里最好的套装。

collins.def: When you pick flowers, fruit, or leaves, you break them off the plant or tree and collect them.

example.ex: She used to pick flowers in the Cromwell Road...
example.tran: 她过去常到克伦威尔路采花。

example.ex: He helps his mother pick fruit.
example.tran: 他帮母亲摘果子。

collins.def: If you pick something from a place, you remove it from there with your fingers or your hand.

example.ex: He picked the napkin from his lap and placed it alongside his plate...
example.tran: 他拿起腿上的餐巾，放在盘子旁边。

example.ex: He picked the telephone off the wall bracket.
example.tran: 他从墙上的固定托架上摘下电话。

collins.def: If you pick your nose or teeth, you remove substances from inside your nose or between your teeth.

example.ex: Edgar, don't pick your nose, dear...
example.tran: 埃德加，不要抠鼻子，宝贝儿。

example.ex: He had just had a meal and was picking his teeth after it.
example.tran: 他刚吃完饭，正在剔牙。

collins.tran: 寻找…的口实；寻（衅）；找（碴儿）
collins.def: If you pick a fight or quarrel with someone, you deliberately cause one.

example.ex: He picked a fight with a waiter and landed in jail...
example.tran: 他找碴儿跟服务生打了一架，最后进了监狱。

example.ex: He was clearly in a mood to pick a quarrel with anybody.
example.tran: 他现在的心情明显是逮谁就想跟谁吵。

collins.def: If someone such as a thief picks a lock, they open it without a key, for example by using a piece of wire.

example.ex: He picked each lock deftly, and rifled the papers within each drawer.
example.tran: 他熟练地撬开每一把锁，把每个抽屉里的文件都偷走了。

collins.def: A pick is the same as a pickaxe .

collins.tran: 挑挑拣拣；挑三拣四；挑剔
collins.def: If you pick and choose, you carefully choose only things that you really want and reject the others.

example.ex: As a vocational teacher I could pretty much pick and choose my work...
example.tran: 作为一名职业教师，我几乎可以随意挑拣自己的工作。

example.ex: We, the patients, cannot pick and choose our doctors.
example.tran: 我们患者不能对医生挑挑拣拣。

collins.def: If you have your pick of a group of things, you are able to choose any of them that you want.

example.ex: Here is an actress who could have her pick of any part...
example.tran: 这是一个角色任她挑选的女演员。

example.ex: Klein could have had his pick of the world's top models.
example.tran: 克莱恩本可以从世界顶尖模特中想选谁就选谁。

collins.def: If you are told to take your pick, you can choose any one that you like from a group of things.

example.ex: Accountants can take their pick of company cars...
example.tran: 会计师可以任选配备的公车。

example.ex: Take your pick from ten luxury hotels...
example.tran: 10家豪华宾馆任你选择。

collins.def: If you pick your way across an area, you walk across it very carefully in order to avoid obstacles or dangerous things.

example.ex: The girls were afraid of snakes and picked their way along with extreme caution...
example.tran: 女孩们害怕蛇，于是谨小慎微地择路而行。

example.ex: I moved away from the shack and picked my way among the rubble.
example.tran: 我离开木屋，小心地走在瓦砾间。

collins.tran: 收拾残局；努力恢复正常
collins.def: When you pick up the pieces after a disaster, you do what you can to get the situation back to normal again.

example.ex: Do we try and prevent problems or do we try and pick up the pieces afterwards?...
example.tran: 我们是想要防患未然呢，还是想要事后收拾残局？

example.ex: She died, and somehow I never picked up the pieces and started again.
example.tran: 她死后我竟一蹶不振，无法重新来过。

collins.def: When a vehicle picks up speed, it begins to move more quickly.

example.ex: Brian pulled away slowly, but picked up speed.
example.tran: 布赖恩慢慢开动汽车，但很快就加速了。

collins.tran: 抱有希望的；有信心的；积极的
collins.def: If you are positive  about things, you are hopeful and confident, and think of the good aspects of a situation rather than the bad ones.

example.ex: Be positive about your future and get on with living a normal life...
example.tran: 要对自己的未来充满信心，继续过一种正常的生活。

example.ex: Her husband became much more positive and was soon back in full-time employment.
example.tran: 她丈夫自信大增，不久便重新开始全职工作。

collins.def: A positive fact, situation, or experience is pleasant and helpful to you in some way.

example.ex: The parting from his sister had a positive effect on John...
example.tran: 和姐姐分开对约翰来说有好处。

example.ex: Working abroad should be an exciting and positive experience for all concerned.
example.tran: 在海外工作对所有相关人员来说都应该是一段让人兴奋而愉快的经历。

collins.def: If you make a positive decision or take positive action, you do something definite in order to deal with a task or problem.

example.ex: There are positive changes that should be implemented in the rearing of animals...
example.tran: 应该对动物饲养进行明确的改革。

example.ex: He was expected to make a very positive contribution to the 1996 Games organisation...
example.tran: 人们期待他为1996年奥运会的组织做出积极的贡献。

collins.def: A positive response to something indicates agreement, approval, or encouragement.

example.ex: There's been a positive response to the UN Secretary-General's recent peace efforts.
example.tran: 联合国秘书长近期为和平所作出的努力得到了积极的回应。

collins.def: If you are positive about something, you are completely sure about it.

example.ex: I'm as positive as I can be about it...
example.tran: 我对它有绝对的把握。

example.ex: 'She's never late. You sure she said eight?' — 'Positive.'
example.tran: “她从不迟到，你肯定她说的是8点？”——“肯定。”

collins.def: Positive evidence gives definite proof of the truth or identity of something.

example.ex: There was no positive evidence that any birth defects had arisen as a result of Vitamin A intake.
example.tran: 没有确凿证据证明，摄取维生素A会导致出生缺陷。

collins.def: If a medical or scientific test is positive, it shows that something has happened or is present.

example.ex: If the test is positive, a course of antibiotics may be prescribed...
example.tran: 如果化验结果呈阳性，可能会开一个疗程的抗生素。

example.ex: He was stripped of his Olympic Hundred Metres gold medal after testing positive for steroids.
example.tran: 类固醇检测呈阳性后，他的奥运百米金牌被收回。

collins.tran: （强调名词）完完全全的，千真万确的，实实在在的
collins.def: You can use positive to emphasize a noun.

example.ex: Good day to you, Bernard! It's a positive delight to see you...
example.tran: 你好，伯纳德！见到你真高兴。

example.ex: He was in a positive fury...
example.tran: 他确实发怒了。

collins.def: A positive number is greater than zero.

example.ex: It's really a simple numbers game with negative and positive numbers.
example.tran: 它其实就是正负数的简单数字游戏。

collins.def: If something has a positive electrical charge, it has the same charge as a proton and the opposite charge to an electron.
The sixteenth item in a series is the one that you count as number sixteen.

example.ex: ...the sixteenth century AD.
example.tran: 公元 16 世纪

collins.def: A sixteenth is one of sixteen equal parts of something.

example.ex: ...a sixteenth of a second.
...fifteen sixteenths of an inch.

collins.def: You use apparently to indicate that the information you are giving is something that you have heard, but you are not certain that it is true.

example.ex: Apparently the girls are not at all amused by the whole business...
example.tran: 据说女孩们觉得整件事情一点也不好笑。

example.ex: Oil prices fell this week to their lowest level in fourteen months, apparently because of over-production.
example.tran: 据说因为产量过剩，这个星期石油价格跌至14个月以来的最低点。

collins.def: You use apparently to refer to something that seems to be true, although you are not sure whether it is or not.

example.ex: The recent deterioration has been caused by an apparently endless recession...
example.tran: 看似永无止境的经济衰退导致了最近的恶化。

example.ex: Rudolph said no more. Apparently he was a man of few words.
example.tran: 鲁道夫没再说话。看来他是个寡言少语的人。

collins.def: When you throw an object that you are holding, you move your hand or arm quickly and let go of the object, so that it moves through the air.

example.ex: He spent hours throwing a tennis ball against a wall...
example.tran: 他好几个小时都对着一堵墙掷网球。

example.ex: On one occasion, his father threw a radio at his mother...
example.tran: 他父亲曾有一次拎起收音机砸向他的母亲。

collins.tran: 急伸，猛动(身体或某部位)
collins.def: If you throw your body or part of your body into a particular position or place, you move it there suddenly and with a lot of force.

example.ex: She threw her arms around his shoulders...
example.tran: 她一把搂住他的肩膀。

example.ex: She threatened to throw herself in front of a train...
example.tran: 她威胁要卧轨。

collins.def: If you throw something into a particular place or position, you put it there in a quick and careless way.

example.ex: He struggled out of his bulky jacket and threw it on to the back seat...
example.tran: 他费劲脱下他那件笨重的夹克，随手把它扔在后座上。

example.ex: Why not throw it all in the pot and see what happens?
example.tran: 为什么不把它全扔进罐子，看看会发生什么变化？

collins.def: To throw someone into a particular place or position means to force them roughly into that place or position.

example.ex: He threw me to the ground and started to kick...
example.tran: 他把我摔倒在地，开始用脚踢。

example.ex: The device exploded, throwing Mr Taylor from his car.
example.tran: 那个装置爆炸了，把泰勒先生从车里抛了出去。

collins.def: If you say that someone is thrown into prison, you mean that they are put there by the authorities, especially if this seems unfair or cruel.

example.ex: Those two should have been thrown in jail...
example.tran: 那两个人早就应该抓去坐牢。

example.ex: Police should have the power to fine people who hamper rescue efforts. In fact I'd throw them into prison for a night.
example.tran: 警察应该有权对妨碍救援的人处以罚款。其实要是换了我，非关他们一宿不可。

collins.def: If a horse throws its rider, it makes him or her fall off, by suddenly jumping or moving violently.

example.ex: The horse reared, throwing its rider and knocking down a youth standing beside it.
example.tran: 那匹马尥了个蹶子，把骑手掀下马，还撞倒了旁边站着的一个小伙子。

collins.tran: 使处境不利;使进展不顺
collins.def: If a person or thing is thrown into an unpleasant situation or state, something causes them to be in that situation or state.

example.ex: Abidjan was thrown into turmoil because of a protest by taxi drivers...
example.tran: 出租车司机的抗议使得阿比让陷入了混乱。

example.ex: Economic recession had thrown millions out of work...
example.tran: 经济衰退导致数百万人失业。

collins.tran: 投下，洒下，抛下(光线或影子)
collins.def: If something throws light or a shadow on a surface, it causes that surface to have light or a shadow on it.

example.ex: The sunlight is white and blinding, throwing hard-edged shadows on the ground.
example.tran: 阳光明亮刺眼，在地上投下轮廓分明的影子。

collins.def: If something throws doubt on a person or thing, it causes people to doubt or suspect them.

example.ex: This new information does throw doubt on their choice...
example.tran: 这个新信息确实使人们对他们的选择产生了怀疑。

example.ex: She did not attempt to throw any suspicion upon you.
example.tran: 她无意让大家怀疑你。

collins.tran: 飞快(看)一眼;迅速(笑)一下
collins.def: If you throw a look or smile at someone or something, you look or smile at them quickly and suddenly.

example.ex: Emily turned and threw her a suggestive grin.
example.tran: 埃米莉转过头，冲她意味深长地一笑。

collins.def: If you throw yourself, your energy, or your money into a particular job or activity, you become involved in it very actively or enthusiastically.

example.ex: She threw herself into a modelling career...
example.tran: 她投身于模特事业。

example.ex: They threw all their military resources into the battle.
example.tran: 他们将全部军事资源都投入了那场战斗。

collins.def: If you throw a fit or a tantrum, you suddenly start to behave in an uncontrolled way.

example.ex: I used to get very upset and scream and swear, throwing tantrums all over the place.
example.tran: 以前，我动不动就发脾气，大喊大叫，还骂人。

collins.def: If something such as a remark or an experience throws you, it surprises you or confuses you because it is unexpected.

example.ex: The professor rather threw me by asking if I went in for martial arts...
example.tran: 教授问我是否爱好武术，这个问题让我吃了一惊。

example.ex: Obviously the puncture threw me a little, but I'm reasonably happy.
example.tran: 显然，轮胎扎破让我感到有些意外，不过我还是挺开心的。

collins.def: If you throw a punch, you punch someone.

example.ex: Everything was fine until someone threw a punch.
example.tran: 开头还好好的，后来不知是谁动了拳头。

collins.def: When someone throws a party, they organize one, usually in their own home.

example.ex: Why not throw a party for your friends?
example.tran: 干吗不在家里为你的朋友们搞个聚会？

collins.def: When someone throws a switch, they turn it on or off.

example.ex: Prince Edward threw the switch to light the illuminations.
example.tran: 爱德华王子按动开关亮起彩灯。

collins.def: In sports, if a player throws a game or contest, they lose it as a result of a deliberate action or intention.

example.ex: ...offering him a bribe to throw the game.
example.tran: 向他行贿，叫他故意输掉比赛

collins.def: A throw is a light rug, blanket, or cover for a sofa or bed.
If things cost a particular amount of money a throw, they cost that amount each.

example.ex: Most applications software for personal computers cost over $500 a throw.
example.tran: 个人电脑使用的多数应用软件的单价为 500 多美元。

collins.def: If someone throws themselves at you, they make it very obvious that they want to begin a relationship with you, by behaving as though they are sexually attracted to you.

example.ex: I'll say you started it, that you threw yourself at me.
example.tran: 我觉得是你主动向我投怀送抱。

collins.def: A shop is a building or part of a building where things are sold.

example.ex: ...health food shops.
example.tran: 健康食品商店

example.ex: ...a record shop...
example.tran: 音像店

collins.def: When you shop, you go to shops and buy things.

example.ex: He always shopped at the Co-op.
example.tran: 他一直在合作社买东西。

example.ex: ...some advice that's worth bearing in mind when shopping for a new carpet.
example.tran: 买新地毯时值得参考的一些建议

collins.def: You can refer to a place where a particular service is offered as a particular type of shop .

example.ex: ...the barber shop where Rodney sometimes had his hair cut.
example.tran: 罗德尼有时去理发的那家理发店

example.ex: ...betting shops.
example.tran: 彩票销售点

collins.def: You can refer to a place where things are made or done as a particular kind of shop .

example.ex: ...the blacksmith's shop.
example.tran: 铁匠作坊

example.ex: ...a repair shop.
example.tran: 修理厂

collins.def: If you shop someone, you report them to the police for doing something illegal.

example.ex: His father was so disgusted to discover his son was dealing drugs he shopped him to police...
example.tran: 他父亲发现儿子在贩毒时深感憎恶，就向警察告发了他。

example.ex: Fraudsters are often shopped by honest friends and neighbours.
example.tran: 诈骗犯经常会被正直守法的朋友和邻居告发。

collins.def: If something is happening all over the shop, it is happening in many different places or throughout a wide area.

example.ex: This gave them the freedom to make trouble all over the shop without fear of retribution.
example.tran: 这使他们可以肆意到处惹是生非，而不用担心受到惩罚。

collins.def: If you set up shop, you start a business.

example.ex: He set up shop as an independent PR consultant...
example.tran: 他自己开公司，做起了独立公共关系顾问。

example.ex: He has just set up shop in Cherbourg.
example.tran: 他刚刚在瑟堡开业不久。

collins.tran: (商店、办事处、公司)休息，下班，打烊，停业，歇业
collins.def: When a shop, office, or firm shuts up shop, it stops doing business and closes, either at the end of the day or permanently.

example.ex: If they had been faced with the bill they'd have shut up shop and fled the country.
example.tran: 他们要是看到这账单，早就关门歇业逃到国外去了。

collins.tran: 谈论本行工作;三句话不离本行
collins.def: If you say that people are talking shop, you mean that they are talking about their work, and this is boring for other people who do not do the same work.

example.ex: If you hang around with colleagues all the time you just end up talking shop.
example.tran: 如果整天和同事泡在一起的话，你最终就会变得开口闭口都是工作。

collins.def: If something exists, it is present in the world as a real thing.

example.ex: He thought that if he couldn't see something, it didn't exist...
example.tran: 他认为自己看不见的东西就不存在。

example.ex: Research opportunities exist in a wide range of pure and applied areas of entomology...
example.tran: 纯理论昆虫学和应用昆虫学的众多领域都存在着研究机会。

collins.def: To exist means to live, especially under difficult conditions or with very little food or money.

example.ex: I exist from one visit to the next...
example.tran: 我的生活就是一个接一个的访问。

example.ex: I was barely existing.
example.tran: 我勉强维持生计。

collins.def: A newspaper is a publication consisting of a number of large sheets of folded paper, on which news, advertisements, and other information is printed.

example.ex: He was carrying a newspaper...
example.tran: 他拿着一份报纸。

example.ex: They read their daughter's allegations in the newspaper.
example.tran: 他们从报纸上看到了女儿的说法。

collins.def: A newspaper is an organization that produces a newspaper.

example.ex: It is Britain's fastest growing national daily newspaper...
example.tran: 这是英国发展最快的全国性日报社。

example.ex: Alexander Lazarus is a food critic for the newspaper.
example.tran: 亚历山大·拉扎勒斯是为该报撰稿的饮食评论家。

collins.def: Newspaper consists of pieces of old newspapers, especially when they are being used for another purpose such as wrapping things up.

example.ex: He found two pots, each wrapped in newspaper.
example.tran: 他发现了两个分别用报纸包着的罐子。

collins.tran: (人、团体或国家之间的)联系，关系，往来
collins.def: Relations between people, groups, or countries are contacts between them and the way in which they behave towards each other.

example.ex: Greece has established full diplomatic relations with Israel...
example.tran: 希腊已经和以色列建立了全面的外交关系。

example.ex: Apparently relations between husband and wife had not improved...
example.tran: 很明显夫妇之间的关系没有改善。

collins.def: If you talk about the relation of one thing to another, you are talking about the ways in which they are connected.

example.ex: It is a question of the relation of ethics to economics.
example.tran: 这是一个伦理学和经济学的关系问题。

example.ex: ...a relation between youthful unemployment and drug-related offences...
example.tran: 年轻人失业与毒品相关犯罪之间的关联

collins.def: Your relations are the members of your family.

example.ex: ...visits to friends and relations...
example.tran: 拜访亲友

example.ex: In America they are touting Hugh Grant as the next Cary Grant (no relation).
example.tran: 在美国，他们把休·格兰特吹捧为第二个加里·格兰特(两人并无亲属关系)。

collins.def: You can talk about something in relation to something else when you want to compare the size, condition, or position of the two things.

example.ex: The money he'd been ordered to pay was minimal in relation to his salary.
example.tran: 他被要求支付的金额与他的薪水相比微不足道。

example.ex: ...women's position in relation to men in the context of the family...
example.tran: 在家庭范围内女人相对于男人的位置

collins.def: If something is said or done in relation to a subject, it is said or done in connection with that subject.

example.ex: ...a question which has been asked many times in relation to Irish affairs...
example.tran: 被问过多次的关于爱尔兰事务的问题

example.ex: He is the sixth person to be arrested in relation to the coup plot.
example.tran: 他是政变阴谋牵涉到的第6个被捕的人。
