collins.def: A criminal is a person who regularly commits crimes.

example.ex: A group of gunmen attacked a prison and set free nine criminals in Moroto.
example.tran: 一伙持枪歹徒袭击了莫罗托的一所监狱，放走了9名罪犯。

collins.def: Criminal means connected with crime.

example.ex: Her husband faces various criminal charges...
example.tran: 她丈夫面临多项犯罪指控。

example.ex: At 17, he had a criminal record for petty theft...
example.tran: 他17岁就有了小偷小摸的犯罪前科。

collins.def: If you describe an action as criminal, you think it is very wrong or a serious mistake.

example.ex: He said a full-scale dispute involving strikes would be criminal.
example.tran: 他说如果出现罢工等大规模纠纷那将是极不应该的。

means: 符合最高标准的，高质量的

collins.def: Sterling is the money system of Great Britain.

example.ex: The stamps had to be paid for in sterling.
example.tran: 这些邮票必须用英镑购买。

collins.tran: (人的品格或工作)优异的，出色的
collins.def: Sterling means very good in quality; used to describe someone's work or character.

example.ex: Those are sterling qualities to be admired in anyone.
example.tran: 那些是在任何人身上都值得敬佩的优秀品质。

example.ex: ...his years of sterling service.
example.tran: 他多年出色的工作表现

collins.def: If you forget something or forget how to do something, you cannot think of it or think how to do it, although you knew it or knew how to do it in the past.

example.ex: Sometimes I improvise and change the words because I forget them...
example.tran: 有时，我临场发挥改了词，因为我把原来的词给忘了。

example.ex: She forgot where she left the car and it took us two days to find it.
example.tran: 她忘记把车子停在什么地方了，我们花了两天时间才找到。

collins.def: If you forget something or forget to do it, you fail to think about it or fail to remember to do it, for example because you are thinking about other things.

example.ex: She never forgets her daddy's birthday...
example.tran: 她从来不会忘记老爸的生日。

example.ex: She forgot to lock her door one day and two men got in...
example.tran: 有一天她忘了锁门，两个男人溜了进来。

collins.def: If you forget something that you had intended to bring with you, you do not bring it because you did not think about it at the right time.

example.ex: Once when we were going to Paris, I forgot my passport.
example.tran: 有一次我们准备去巴黎时，我忘了带护照。

collins.def: If you forget something or someone, you deliberately put them out of your mind and do not think about them any more.

example.ex: I hope you will forget the bad experience you had today...
example.tran: 我希望你不要把今天遇到的倒霉事放在心上。

example.ex: I can't forget what happened...
example.tran: 我无法不去想发生的事。

collins.def: If you forget yourself, you behave in an uncontrolled or unacceptable way, which is not the way in which you usually behave.

example.ex: He was so fascinated by her beauty that he forgot himself and leaned across to touch her.
example.tran: 他为她的美貌所倾倒，以至于忘乎所以地靠上前去触摸她。

collins.tran: 没关系;不必在意;不要再提了
collins.def: You say 'Forget it' in reply to someone as a way of telling them not to worry or bother about something, or as an emphatic way of saying no to a suggestion.

example.ex: 'Sorry, Liz. I think I was a bit rude to you.' —
'Forget it, but don't do it again!'...
example.tran: “抱歉，莉兹。我想我刚才对你有点粗鲁。”——“没关系，但是别再那样做了!”

collins.def: You say not forgetting a particular thing or person when you want to include them in something that you have already talked about.

example.ex: The first thing is to support as many shows as one can, not forgetting the small local ones.
example.tran: 首先要尽可能多地支持演出，这其中也包括当地的小型演出。

collins.def: Chancellor is the title of the head of government in Germany and Austria.

example.ex: ...Chancellor Gerhard Schröder of Germany.
example.tran: 德国总理施罗德

example.ex: ...as the Chancellor arrived.
example.tran: 总理到达的时候

collins.def: In Britain, the Chancellor is the Chancellor of the Exchequer.
The Chancellor of a British university is the official head of the university. The Chancellor does not take part in running the university.
The head of some American universities is called the Chancellor .

collins.tran: （陆军或美国空军的）上尉;(海军或英国空军的)上校
collins.def: In the army, navy, and some other armed forces, a captain is an officer of middle rank.

example.ex: ...Captain Mark Phillips.
example.tran: 马克·菲利普斯上尉

example.ex: ...a captain in the British army...
example.tran: 英国陆军上尉

collins.def: The captain of a sports team is the player in charge of it.

example.ex: ...Mickey Thomas, the captain of Wrexham football club.
example.tran: 雷克瑟姆足球俱乐部的队长米基·托马斯

example.ex: ...Bob Willis, the former England cricket captain.
example.tran: 英格兰板球队前队长鲍勃·威利斯

collins.def: The captain of a ship is the sailor in charge of it.

example.ex: ...the captain of the aircraft carrier Saratoga.
example.tran: “萨拉托加号”航空母舰的舰长

example.ex: ...a beefy German sea captain.
example.tran: 健硕魁梧的德国船长

collins.def: The captain of an aeroplane is the pilot in charge of it.

collins.tran: (美国等国家的)警察局副巡官，消防队中队长
collins.def: In the United States and some other countries, a captain is a police officer or fireman of fairly senior rank.

collins.tran: 担任(运动队)的队长;当…的船长(或舰长)
collins.def: If you captain a team or a ship, you are the captain of it.

example.ex: ...Murdo McLeod, who captained Hibernian's League-Cup-winning team in 1991...
example.tran: 默多·麦克劳德，海伯尼安队1991年获得联盟杯冠军时的队长

example.ex: I did once dream of becoming the first woman to captain an ocean liner.
example.tran: 我确实曾经梦想过成为首位远洋客轮的女船长。

collins.tran: （某一国家或地区的）全体人民，人口
collins.def: The population of a country or area is all the people who live in it.

example.ex: Bangladesh now has a population of about 110 million.
example.tran: 孟加拉国现有大约1.1亿人口。

example.ex: ...the annual rate of population growth.
example.tran: 人口年增长率

collins.tran: （某一国家或地区某类人或动物的）总数
collins.def: If you refer to a particular type of population in a country or area, you are referring to all the people or animals of that type there.

example.ex: ...75.6 per cent of the male population over sixteen.
example.tran: 16岁以上男性中的75.6%

example.ex: ...areas with a large black population.
example.tran: 黑人人口众多的地区

collins.def: To export products or raw materials means to sell them to another country.

example.ex: The nation also exports beef...
example.tran: 该国也出口牛肉。

example.ex: They expect the antibiotic products to be exported to Southeast Asia and Africa...
example.tran: 他们希望向东南亚和非洲出口抗生素产品。

collins.def: Exports are goods which are sold to another country and sent there.

example.ex: He did this to promote American exports...
example.tran: 他这么做是为了推广美国出口产品。

example.ex: Ghana's main export is cocoa.
example.tran: 加纳的主要出口商品是可可豆。

collins.def: To export something means to introduce it into another country or make it happen there.

example.ex: It has exported inflation at times.
example.tran: 它有时会输出通货膨胀。

example.ex: ...hecklers who said the deal would export jobs to Mexico.
example.tran: 声称这项协议会把就业机会转往墨西哥的质疑者

collins.def: In computing, if you export files or information from one type of software into another type, you change their format so that they can be used in the new software.

example.ex: Files can be exported in ASCII or PCX formats.
example.tran: 文件可以以ASCII或者PCX格式导出。

collins.def: If you do one thing instead of another, you do the first thing and not the second thing, as the result of a choice or a change of behaviour.

example.ex: She had to spend nearly four months away from him that summer, instead of the usual two...
example.tran: 那个夏天她被迫离开他将近四个月而不是通常的两个月。

example.ex: Check-out workers in London will receive £7.17 an hour instead of £6.54...
example.tran: 伦敦的收银员每小时工资将从原先的 6.54 英镑涨为 7.17 英镑。

collins.def: If you do not do something, but do something else instead, you do the second thing and not the first thing, as the result of a choice or a change of behaviour.

example.ex: He reached for the wine but did not drink, pushed it, instead, across the table towards Joanna...
example.tran: 他伸手拿酒却没有喝,而是把它推给了坐在桌子对面的乔安娜。

example.ex: The kitchen might have been workable had Nicola kept it tidy; instead it was littered with pots and pans...
example.tran: 如果妮古拉会收拾,厨房本来是能用的;但现在,这里到处乱放着锅碗瓢盆。

collins.def: A key is a specially shaped piece of metal that you place in a lock and turn in order to open or lock a door, or to start or stop the engine of a vehicle.

example.ex: They put the key in the door and entered...
example.tran: 他们用钥匙打开门进去了。

example.ex: She reached for her coat and car keys.
example.tran: 她伸手拿外套和汽车钥匙。

collins.def: The keys on a computer keyboard or typewriter are the buttons that you press in order to operate it.
The keys of a piano or organ are the long narrow pieces of wood or plastic that you press in order to play it.
In music, a key is a scale of musical notes that starts on one specific note.

example.ex: ...the key of A minor.
example.tran: A小调

collins.tran: （地图、图解或科技书籍的）略语表，符号表，凡例
collins.def: The key on a map or diagram or in a technical book is a list of the symbols or abbreviations used and their meanings.

example.ex: You will find a key at the front of the book.
example.tran: 你会在书的前面找到略语表。

collins.def: The key person or thing in a group is the most important one.

example.ex: He is expected to be the key witness at the trial...
example.tran: 他将成为审判的关键证人。

example.ex: Education is likely to be a key issue in the next election.
example.tran: 在下届选举中教育可能成为最重要的一个议题。

collins.def: The key to a desirable situation or result is the way in which it can be achieved.

example.ex: The key to success is to be ready from the start...
example.tran: 成功的关键在于从一开始就要准备充分。

example.ex: Diet and relaxation are two important keys to good health.
example.tran: 限制饮食和放松身心是保持健康的两个要诀。

collins.def: An opportunity is a situation in which it is possible for you to do something that you want to do.

example.ex: I had an opportunity to go to New York and study...
example.tran: 我曾经有一个去纽约学习的机会。

example.ex: The best reason for a trip to London is the super opportunity for shopping...
example.tran: 绝佳的购物机会是前往伦敦的最好理由。

collins.def: You use despite to introduce a fact which makes the other part of the sentence surprising.

example.ex: Despite a thorough investigation, no trace of Dr Southwell has been found...
example.tran: 尽管进行了彻底的调查，还是没有发现索思韦尔博士的任何踪迹。

example.ex: The National Health Service has visibly deteriorated, despite increased spending...
example.tran: 尽管支出在增加，但国民医疗保健服务的质量却明显下降了。

collins.def: If you do something despite yourself you do it although you did not really intend or expect to.

example.ex: Despite myself, Harry's remarks had caused me to stop and reflect.
example.tran: 哈里的话让我不由自主地停下来细想。

collins.def: If you touch something, you put your hand onto it in order to feel it or to make contact with it.

example.ex: Her tiny hands gently touched my face...
example.tran: 她的小手轻轻触摸我的脸庞。

example.ex: Don't touch that dial…
example.tran: 不要碰那个刻度盘。

collins.def: If two things are touching, or if one thing touches another, or if you touch two things, their surfaces come into contact with each other.

example.ex: Their knees were touching ...
example.tran: 他们的膝盖挨着。

example.ex: A cyclist crashed when he touched wheels with another rider...
example.tran: 一个骑车人与另一辆自行车车轮相碰后摔倒在地。

collins.def: Your sense of touch is your ability to tell what something is like when you feel it with your hands.

example.ex: The evidence suggests that our sense of touch is programmed to diminish with age.
example.tran: 有证据表明，我们的触觉会随着年龄的增长而减损。

example.ex: …boys and girls who are blind and who want to be able to read and write by touch.
example.tran: 想通过触觉读写的失明的男孩和女孩

collins.def: To touch something means to strike it, usually quite gently.

example.ex: He scored the first time he touched the ball…
example.tran: 他第一次触球就得分了。

example.ex: As the aeroplane went down the runway the wing touched a pile of rubble.
example.tran: 飞机降落沿跑道滑行的时候机翼擦到了一堆碎石。

collins.tran: (与否定词连用)处理，照看，照管
collins.def: If something has not been touched, nobody has dealt with it or taken care of it.

example.ex: When John began to restore the house in the 1960s, nothing had been touched for 40 years.
example.tran: 约翰 20 世纪 60 年代开始整修那幢房子时，它已有 40 年都无人照管了。

collins.tran: (与否定词连用，尤用于受到指责时)伤害，攻击，破坏
collins.def: If you say that you did not touch someone or something, you are emphasizing that you did not attack, harm or destroy them, especially when you have been accused of doing so.

example.ex: Pearce remained adamant, saying 'I didn't touch him'...
example.tran: 皮尔斯仍旧坚定不移地说：“我没有碰过他。”

example.ex: I was in the garden. I never touched the sandwiches.
example.tran: 我那时在花园里。我根本没动三明治。

collins.def: You say that you never touch something or that you have not touched something for a long time to emphasize that you never use it, or you have not used it for a long time.

example.ex: He doesn't drink much and doesn't touch drugs...
example.tran: 他喝酒不多，也不沾毒品。

example.ex: His diet is vegetarian, and he hasn't touched meat for six years…
example.tran: 他吃素，已经 6 年不知肉味了。

collins.def: If you touch on a particular subject or problem, you mention it or write briefly about it.

example.ex: The film touches on these issues, but only superficially...
example.tran: 这部电影涉及了这些问题，但却流于表面。

example.ex: She writes about women's idealisation of men, touching briefly on the topic of women's fantasy life.
example.tran: 她写女人心目中理想化的男人，其中简单涉及了女人所幻想的生活的话题。

collins.def: If something touches you, it affects you in some way for a short time.

example.ex: ...a guilt that in some sense touches everyone...
example.tran: 在某种意义上影响到每个人的负罪感

example.ex: Nor had the benefits of the war years touched all sectors of the population.
example.tran: 战争年代的救济金也没有惠及所有的人。

collins.def: If something that someone says or does touches you, it affects you emotionally, often because you see that they are suffering a lot or that they are being very kind.

example.ex: It has touched me deeply to see how these people live...
example.tran: 看到这些人的生活境况，我深受触动。

example.ex: Her enthusiasm touched me.
example.tran: 她的热情打动了我。

collins.def: If something is touched with a particular quality, it has a certain amount of that quality.

example.ex: His crinkly hair was touched with grey...
example.tran: 他卷曲的头发有些花白。

example.ex: The boy was touched with genius.
example.tran: 那个男孩透着点天分。

collins.def: If you say about someone that nobody can touch him or her for a particular thing, you mean that he or she is much better at it than anyone else.

example.ex: No one can touch these girls for professionalism.
example.tran: 就职业素养来说，没人能比得上这些姑娘。

collins.def: To touch a particular level, amount, or score, especially a high one, means to reach it.

example.ex: By the third lap Kinkead had touched 289 m.p.h.
example.tran: 到第三圈时，金基德的车速达到了每小时 289 英里。

example.ex: The winds had touched storm-force the day before.
example.tran: 风力前一天就已达到了狂风级。

collins.def: If you touch someone for money, you ask them to give it to you.

example.ex: Now is the time to touch him for a loan.
example.tran: 现在是向他借笔钱的时候了。

collins.def: A touch is a detail which is added to something to improve it.

example.ex: They called the event 'a tribute to heroes', which was a nice touch...
example.tran: 他们把这一活动称为“向英雄致敬”，这可是加分之举。

example.ex: Small touches to a room such as flowers can be what gives a house its vitality.
example.tran: 房间里放些诸如鲜花之类的小点缀可以给家里带来生气。

collins.def: If someone has a particular kind of touch, they have a particular way of doing something.

example.ex: The dishes he produces all have a personal touch...
example.tran: 他做的菜全都带有其个人风格。

example.ex: The striker was unable to find his scoring touch.
example.tran: 那个前锋找不到进球的感觉。

collins.def: A touch of something is a very small amount of it.

example.ex: She thought she just had a touch of flu...
example.tran: 她认为自己仅仅有点感冒。

example.ex: At university he wrote a bit, did a touch of acting, and indulged in internal college politics.
example.tran: 在大学期间他写过一点东西，小试过表演，并迷恋于校内政治活动。

collins.def: You can use a touch to mean slightly or to a small extent, especially in order to make something you say seem less extreme. For example, if you say that something is a touch expensive, you might really think that it is very expensive.

example.ex: We were all a touch uneasy, I think...
example.tran: 我想我们都稍有点不自在。

example.ex: I found it a touch distasteful.
example.tran: 我觉得这略有点让人反感。

collins.def: You use at the touch of in expressions such as at the touch of a button and at the touch of a key to indicate that something is possible by simply touching a switch or one of the keys of a keyboard.

example.ex: Staff will be able to trace calls at the touch of a button.
example.tran: 工作人员一摁按钮便可以追踪电话。

example.ex: …seats that flip out at the touch of a lever.
example.tran: 一按控制杆就会翻开的座位

collins.def: If you say that someone has the common touch, you mean that they have the natural ability to have a good relationship with ordinary people and be popular with them.

example.ex: Unlike many senior judges, he has consistently shown that he has the common touch.
example.tran: 与很多高级法官不同，他一贯表现得平易近人。

collins.def: If you get in touch with someone, you contact them by writing to them or telephoning them. If you are, keep, or stay in touch with them, you write, phone, or visit each other regularly.

example.ex: I will get in touch with solicitors about this…
example.tran: 我会就此事与律师联系。

example.ex: The organisation would be in touch with him tomorrow...
example.tran: 该组织明天就会和他联络。

collins.tran: 了解最新情况(或信息)/不了解最新情况(或信息)
collins.def: If you are in touch with a subject or situation, or if someone keeps you in touch with it, you know the latest news or information about it. If you are out of touch with it, you do not know the latest news or information about it.

example.ex: You'll also be kept in touch with local Oxfam events.
example.tran: 您还将随时获得乐施会在当地的最新活动信息。

example.ex: ...keeping the unemployed in touch with the labour market...
example.tran: 使失业者即时了解劳动力市场的最新动态

collins.def: If you lose touch with someone, you gradually stop writing, telephoning, or visiting them.

example.ex: In my job one tends to lose touch with friends...
example.tran: 干我这行，往往会与朋友失去联系。

example.ex: We lost touch after that.
example.tran: 我们自那以后就失去了联络。

collins.tran: 不再了解最新情况(或信息)
collins.def: If you lose touch with something, you no longer have the latest news or information about it.

example.ex: Their leaders have lost touch with what is happening in the country.
example.tran: 他们的领导人不再了解该国正发生的一切。

collins.tran: 不确定的事态;无法预言的事
collins.def: If you say that something is touch and go, you mean that you are uncertain whether it will happen or succeed.

example.ex: It was touch and go whether we'd go bankrupt.
example.tran: 我们是否会破产还很难说。

collins.tran: 容易借钱给人的人;好说话的人
collins.def: If you say that someone is a soft touch or an easy touch, you mean that they can easily be persuaded to lend you money or to do things for you.

example.ex: Mr Wilson is no soft touch…
example.tran: 威尔逊先生绝不会轻易借钱给别人。

example.ex: Pamela was an easy touch when she needed some cash.
example.tran: 她缺钱花的时候，帕梅拉总是有求必应。

collins.def: A region is  a large area of land that is different from other areas of land, for example because it is one of the different parts of a country with its own customs and characteristics, or because it has a particular geographical feature.

example.ex: ...Barcelona, capital of the autonomous region of Catalonia.
example.tran: 加泰罗尼亚自治区首府巴塞罗那

example.ex: ...a remote mountain region.
example.tran: 边远山区

collins.def: The regions are the parts of a country that are not the capital city and its surrounding area.

example.ex: ...London and the regions...
example.tran: 伦敦和外省地区

example.ex: Tax incentives would be used to attract firms to the regions, away from the South-East.
example.tran: 将采取税收优惠政策把公司吸引到东南部以外的各地区。

collins.def: You can refer to a part of your body as a region.

example.ex: ...the pelvic region.
example.tran: 骨盆区

example.ex: ...the frontal region of the brain.
example.tran: 大脑的额区

collins.def: You say in the region of to indicate that an amount that you are stating is approximate.

example.ex: The scheme will cost in the region of six million pounds.
example.tran: 这个计划将耗资大约600万英镑。

collins.def: A park is a public area of land with grass and trees, usually in a town, where people go in order to relax and enjoy themselves.

example.ex: ...Regent's Park...
example.tran: 摄政公园

example.ex: ...a brisk walk with the dog around the park...
example.tran: 牵着狗在公园里轻快地散步

collins.def: When you park a vehicle or park somewhere, you drive the vehicle into a position where it can stay for a period of time, and leave it there.

example.ex: Greenfield turned into the next side street and parked...
example.tran: 格林菲尔德转进下一个小巷，停好车。

example.ex: He found a place to park the car...
example.tran: 他找到了一个停车位。

collins.def: You can refer to a place where a particular activity is carried out as a park .

example.ex: ...a science and technology park.
example.tran: 科技园区

example.ex: ...a business park.
example.tran: 商务区

collins.def: A private area of grass and trees around a large country house is referred to as a park .

example.ex: ...a 19th century manor house in six acres of park and woodland.
example.tran: 位于6英亩园林和树林中的19世纪庄园宅第

collins.def: Some people refer to a football or rugby field as the park .

example.ex: Chris was also the best player on the park.
example.tran: 克里斯同时也是场上的最佳球员。

collins.tran: 棒球场（亦用于某些棒球场名称中）
collins.def: A park is a park or stadium where baseball is played. Park is also used in the names of some parks.

example.ex: ...a spot where professional baseball has been played in one park or another since 1896...
example.tran: 自1896年以来其中多个棒球场举办过职业棒球赛的地方

example.ex: The network was broadcasting the World Series from Candlestick Park when the quake struck.
example.tran: 地震发生时，该电视网正在烛台棒球场直播世界系列赛。

collins.def: Someone's sight is their ability to see.

example.ex: My sight is failing, and I can't see to read any more...
example.tran: 我的视力在下降，看不了书了。

example.ex: I use the sense of sound much more than the sense of sight.
example.tran: 我用听觉比视觉要多得多。

collins.def: The sight of something is the act of seeing it or an occasion on which you see it.

example.ex: I faint at the sight of blood...
example.tran: 我一见到血就晕。

example.ex: The sight of him entering a room could flood her with desire.
example.tran: 见到他进入房间会让她心中欲望澎湃。

collins.def: A sight is something that you see.

example.ex: The practice of hanging clothes across the street is a common sight in many parts of the city...
example.tran: 街边晾晒衣服在这座城市的许多地区随处可见。

example.ex: We encountered the pathetic sight of a family packing up its home...
example.tran: 我们目睹了一家人正在收拾家当准备离开的凄惨景象。

collins.def: If you sight someone or something, you suddenly see them, often briefly.

example.ex: The security forces sighted a group of young men that had crossed the border...
example.tran: 安全部队突然看见一群越过边境的年轻人。

example.ex: A fleet of French ships was sighted in the North Sea.
example.tran: 在北海突然发现了一支法国船队。

collins.def: The sights of a weapon such as a rifle are the part which helps you aim it more accurately.
The sights are the places that are interesting to see and that are often visited by tourists.

example.ex: We'd toured the sights of Paris...
example.tran: 我们游览了巴黎的风景名胜。

example.ex: I am going to show you the sights of our wonderful city...
example.tran: 我会带你浏览我们这座美丽城市的风景名胜。

collins.def: You can use a sight to mean a lot. For example, if you say that something is a sight worse than it was before, you are emphasizing that it is much worse than it was.

example.ex: She's been no more difficult than most daughters and a sight better than some I could mention...
example.tran: 与大多数女儿相比，她并不算太难管，而且比我知道的一些要乖巧得多。

example.ex: We weren't doing anything different to what we've always done. We're just doing it a damn sight quicker.
example.tran: 我们正在做的事和我们一直在做的别无二致，只不过我们现在动作要快得多。

collins.def: If you catch sight of someone, you suddenly see them, often briefly.

example.ex: Then he caught sight of her small black velvet hat in the crowd...
example.tran: 然后他突然在人群中看见了她那顶小巧的黑色天鹅绒帽子。

example.ex: Every time I catch sight of myself in the mirror, I feel so disappointed.
example.tran: 每次我瞥见镜子里的自己就觉得沮丧。

collins.tran: 乍一看;一见之下;初看时
collins.def: If you say that something seems to have certain characteristics at first sight, you mean that it appears to have the features you describe when you first see it but later it is found to be different.

example.ex: It promised to be a more difficult undertaking than might appear at first sight...
example.tran: 那项任务可能比乍看之下还要困难。

example.ex: At first sight it resembles a traditional village of two-storeyed, balconied houses, set among well-tended gardens.
example.tran: 乍一看，它就像个传统的村庄：带阳台的两层楼房坐落于精心照料的花园中。

collins.def: If something is in sight or within sight, you can see it. If it is out of sight, you cannot see it.

example.ex: The sandy beach was in sight...
example.tran: 沙滩映入眼帘。

example.ex: The Atlantic coast is within sight of the hotel...
example.tran: 从宾馆可以看见大西洋海岸。

collins.tran: 在望;在即;临近;即将产生
collins.def: If a result or a decision is in sight or within sight, it is likely to happen within a short time.

example.ex: An agreement on many aspects of trade policy was in sight...
example.tran: 一项涉及到贸易政策诸多方面的协议即将达成。

example.ex: There is no end in sight to the struggle for power...
example.tran: 权力的争斗近期不会终止。

collins.def: If you lose sight of an important aspect of something, you no longer pay attention to it because you are worrying about less important things.

example.ex: In some cases, US industry has lost sight of customer needs in designing products...
example.tran: 某些情况下，美国工业在产品设计上忽略了客户的需求。

example.ex: We shouldn't lose sight of the fact that education is important for its own sake.
example.tran: 教育本身就很重要，我们不应忽视这一事实。

collins.def: If you know someone by sight, you can recognize them when you see them, although you have never met them and talked to them.

example.ex: I knew him by sight but had never spoken with him.
example.tran: 我和他有过几面之缘，但从未说过话。

collins.def: If you say 'out of sight, out of mind', you mean that people quickly forget someone if he or she goes away.

example.ex: The problems of the poor are largely invisible—out of sight, out of mind.
example.tran: 穷人的问题人们大多看不见——正所谓“眼不见，心不烦”。

collins.def: If someone is ordered to do something on sight, they have to do it without delay, as soon as a person or thing is seen.

example.ex: Troops shot anyone suspicious on sight...
example.tran: 部队士兵一见到任何可疑的人马上就开枪。

example.ex: Magee was set free but British authorities were asked to arrest him on sight.
example.tran: 马吉被释放了，但是英国当局却被要求一见到他就立即逮捕。

collins.tran: 不好看;不雅观;有碍观瞻
collins.def: If you say that someone or something is not a pretty sight, you mean that it is not pleasant to look at.

example.ex: The bathroom is not a pretty sight. The wallpaper's peeling, the tiles are crumbling.
example.tran: 浴室破旧不堪。墙纸剥落了，瓷砖也裂了。

collins.tran: 以…为奋斗目标;志在必得;决心做到
collins.def: If you set your sights on something, you decide that you want it and try hard to get it.

example.ex: They have set their sights on the world record...
example.tran: 他们的目标是冲击世界纪录。

example.ex: Although she came from a family of bankers, Franklin set her sights on a career in scientific research.
example.tran: 尽管出身于银行家家庭，富兰克林还是决心从事科研事业。

collins.tran: 在未见实物的情况下;事先未经检查
collins.def: If you agree to buy something sight unseen, you agree to buy it, even though you have not seen it and do not know what condition it is in.

example.ex: Although people sometimes buy property sight unseen, it's a remarkably bad idea.
example.tran: 尽管人们有时没看房就买了房，但这真是一个很糟糕的主意。

collins.def: Someone who is male is a man or a boy.

example.ex: Many women achievers appear to pose a threat to their male colleagues...
example.tran: 许多事业有成的女性似乎对她们的男同事构成了一种威胁。

example.ex: The London City Ballet has engaged two male dancers from the Bolshoi...
example.tran: 伦敦市芭蕾舞团从波修瓦芭蕾舞团聘来了两名男舞蹈演员。

collins.def: Men and boys are sometimes referred to as males when they are being considered as a type.

example.ex: ...the remains of a Caucasian male, aged 65-70...
example.tran: 65岁至70岁之间的白人男性的遗骸

example.ex: He was very anxious to prove he was a red-blooded male...
example.tran: 他急于证明自己是一名热血男儿。

collins.def: Male means relating, belonging, or affecting men rather than women.

example.ex: The rate of male unemployment in Britain is now the third worst in Europe.
example.tran: 英国男性的失业率目前高居欧洲第三位。

example.ex: ...male violence.
example.tran: 男性暴力

collins.def: You can refer to any creature that belongs to the sex that cannot lay eggs or have babies as a male .

example.ex: Males and females take turns brooding the eggs.
example.tran: 雄鸟和雌鸟轮流孵蛋。

collins.def: A male flower or plant fertilizes the part that will become the fruit.

means: （愉快而懒散地）度过（时间）（常与 away 连用）

collins.tran: (表示两件事同时发生)当…的时候，在…时
collins.def: If something happens while something else is happening, the two things are happening at the same time.

example.ex: They were grinning and watching while one man laughed and poured beer over the head of another...
example.tran: 当一个男人大笑着把啤酒倒在另一个人头上时，他们都在乐呵呵地看着。

example.ex: I sat on the settee to unwrap the package while he stood by...
example.tran: 我坐在长椅上打开包裹时他就站在旁边。

collins.tran: (表示某一件事是在另一件事发生过程中的某一时间点发生的)当…的时候，在…时
collins.def: If something happens while something else happens, the first thing happens at some point during the time that the second thing is happening.

example.ex: The two ministers have yet to meet, but may do so while in New York...
example.tran: 两位部长尚未会面，但可能会在纽约碰头。

example.ex: Never apply water to a burn from an electric shock while the casualty is still in contact with the electric current.
example.tran: 当被电击者还连着电时，千万不要把水弄到电击伤口上。

collins.def: You use while at the beginning of a clause to introduce information which contrasts with information in the main clause.

example.ex: Marianne was tempted to turn the large rooms into traditional French-style salons, while Howard was in favour of a typically English look...
example.tran: 玛丽安娜想把这些大房间弄成传统法式客厅的样子，但是霍华德喜欢典型的英式风格。

example.ex: The first two services are free, while the third costs £35.00.
example.tran: 前两项服务免费，但是第三项服务要花35英镑。

collins.def: You use while, before making a statement, in order to introduce information that partly conflicts with your statement.

example.ex: While the numbers of such developments are relatively small, the potential market is large...
example.tran: 尽管这种增长的数量相对较小，但是潜在的市场是巨大的。

example.ex: While the modelling business is by no means easy to get into, the good model, male or female, will always be in demand...
example.tran: 尽管模特行业绝不是那么容易进入的，但是好的模特，不论男女，总是需要的。

collins.def: A range of things is a number of different things of the same general kind.

example.ex: A wide range of colours and patterns are available...
example.tran: 各种颜色和样式都有。

example.ex: The two men discussed a range of issues...
example.tran: 那两个人讨论了一系列问题。

collins.def: A range is the complete group that is included between two points on a scale of measurement or quality.

example.ex: The average age range is between 35 and 55.
example.tran: 平均年龄在35岁到55岁之间。

example.ex: ...properties available in the price range they are looking for.
example.tran: 在他们寻求的价格范围内的房产

collins.def: The range of something is the maximum area in which it can reach things or detect things.

example.ex: The 120mm mortar has a range of 18,000 yards...
example.tran: 口径为120毫米的迫击炮的射程是1.8万码。

example.ex: The trees on the mountains within my range of vision had all been felled...
example.tran: 山上我视野范围内的树木都被砍倒了。

collins.def: If things range between two points or range from one point to another, they vary within these points on a scale of measurement or quality.

example.ex: They range in price from $3 to $15.
example.tran: 它们的价格从3美元到15美元不等。

example.ex: ...offering merchandise ranging from the everyday to the esoteric.
example.tran: 供应从日常用品到专业用具等各种商品

collins.def: If a piece of writing or speech ranges over a group of topics, it includes all those topics.

example.ex: The conversation ranged over the desirability of such restaurants, the shortcomings of men, and why it had only taken 15 minutes to cross a continent.
example.tran: 谈话涉及了这类餐馆的吸引人之处、男人的弱点，还有为什么只用15分钟就跨越了一个大洲。

collins.def: If people or things are ranged somewhere, they are arranged in a row or in lines.

example.ex: Some 300 trees have been ranged along the perimeter hedge...
example.tran: 沿着绿篱栽种着大约300棵树。

example.ex: More than 1,500 police and troops are ranged against them.
example.tran: 1,500多名警察和士兵列队与他们对峙。

collins.def: If animals or people range somewhere, they move around in a place without having a particular destination in mind.

example.ex: Feeding is not a problem because the birds range over such a large area...
example.tran: 这种鸟活动的范围很大，因此觅食不成问题。

example.ex: They range widely in search of carrion.
example.tran: 它们在广阔的区域内搜寻腐肉。

collins.def: A range of mountains or hills is a line of them.

example.ex: ...the massive mountain ranges to the north.
example.tran: 向北延伸的巨大山脉

example.ex: ...an impressive range of hills topped with trees.
example.tran: 山顶覆盖着树木的绵绵山峦

collins.def: A range is a large area of open land, especially land in the United States where cattle are kept.
A rifle range or a shooting range is a place where people can practise shooting at targets.

example.ex: It reminds me of my days on the rifle range preparing for duty in Vietnam.
example.tran: 它使我想起了在靶场练习射击准备去越南服役的日子。

example.ex: ...an Army firing range.
example.tran: 陆军射击场

collins.def: A range or kitchen range is an old-fashioned metal cooker.
A range or kitchen range is a large metal device for cooking food using gas or electricity. A range consists of a grill, an oven, and some gas or electric rings.

collins.tran: 在可及的范围内/在可及的范围外
collins.def: If something is in range or within range, it is near enough to be reached or detected. If it is out of range, it is too far away to be reached or detected.

example.ex: Cars are driven through the mess, splashing everyone in range.
example.tran: 车从脏水里驶过，溅了周围所有人一身水。

example.ex: ...a base within range of enemy missiles...
example.tran: 在敌人导弹射程内的基地

collins.tran: 接近地/靠近地/以…的距离
collins.def: If you see or hit something at close range or from close range, you are very close to it when you see it or hit it. If you do something at a range of half a mile, for example, you are half a mile away from it when you do it.

example.ex: He was shot in the head at close range...
example.tran: 他在近距离内被人用枪击中头部。

example.ex: McCoist knocked the ball in from close range.
example.tran: 麦克科伊斯特门前近距离将球攻入。

collins.tran: 势力;权势;影响力;支配力
collins.def: Influence is the power to make other people agree with your opinions or do what you want.

example.ex: As Hugh grew older, she had less influence and couldn't control him...
example.tran: 休慢慢长大,她的影响力变小了,无法再控制他了。

example.ex: I have rather a large influence over a good many people...
example.tran: 我对很多人都有相当大的影响力。

collins.def: If you influence someone, you use your power to make them agree with you or do what you want.

example.ex: He is trying to improperly influence a witness...
example.tran: 他在试图误导证人。

example.ex: The angry crowds could influence the government...
example.tran: 愤怒的群众可以影响政府。

collins.def: To have an influence on people or situations means to affect what they do or what happens.

example.ex: Van Gogh had a major influence on the development of modern painting...
example.tran: 凡·高对现代绘画的发展有着重大影响。

example.ex: The Shropshire landscape was an influence on Owen too...
example.tran: 什罗普郡的风景也对欧文产生了影响。

collins.def: If someone or something influences a person or situation, they have an effect on that person's behaviour or that situation.

example.ex: We became the best of friends and he influenced me deeply...
example.tran: 我们成了最好的朋友,他深深地影响了我。

example.ex: What you eat may influence your risk of getting cancer...
example.tran: 你吃的东西会影响你患癌症的风险。

collins.def: Someone or something that is a good or bad influence on people has a good or bad effect on them.

example.ex: I thought Sue would be a good influence on you...
example.tran: 我认为苏能对你产生良好影响。

example.ex: TV is a bad influence on people.
example.tran: 电视会对人们产生不良影响。

collins.tran: 在…影响之下;在…控制之下
collins.def: If you are under the influence of someone or something, you are being affected or controlled by them.

example.ex: I fell under the influence of a history master...
example.tran: 我当时深受一位历史老师的影响。

example.ex: The very earliest sculptures were made under the influence of Greek art...
example.tran: 最早的雕塑作品受到了希腊艺术的影响。

collins.tran: 喝醉;(吸食毒品后)处于迷幻状态
collins.def: If someone is under the influence, their mind is affected by alcohol or drugs.

example.ex: Police charged the man with driving under the influence...
example.tran: 警方指控那名男子酒后驾车。

example.ex: We find members of the opposite sex more attractive when under the influence.
example.tran: 我们喝醉时感到异性更具吸引力。
